description: This role is expected to work closely with the sales and delivery colleagues in the Asia region to increase awareness of alliance related opportunities, and engage with the appropriate company executives to build targeted strategic relationships to build long term business opportunities for the company.  Key Responsibilities: - Manage the alliances proactively and map out the alliances capabilities and understanding for our market in Asia region. Develop and nurture strategic and mutually beneficial relationship with vendors to drive revenue with joint sales efforts.  Create go to market opportunities with the alliances to drive sales Generate sales opportunities to achieve short and long term revenue and profit growth Educate the alliances on our value propositions and help them to drive joint engagement with customers while working closely with our sales and delivery teams. Support the execution of mutual business plans that define target partnership outcomes and key metrics, including sales, training & skills development, implementation projects and customer success stories. Create, and manage company’s pipeline for deals with partners and transform potential leads into joint sales activities. Conduct regular business reviews of alliances assessing performance and providing insights on the business. Job Requirements: - Thorough understanding of each of the regional partners. This includes the organization, relative business priorities, communication styles & preferences and key risks that need to be mitigated for successful long-term partnership success. Good understanding of Software Applications, ERP, RPA, BI and Data Analytics. Excellent communication skills, and a proven ability to communicate effectively in a multi-cultural matrix environment and at all levels from technical team to country sales managers At least 5 years’ experience with demonstrated success in one or more related areas such as professional services, alliances and software sales Ability to effectively communicate and influence solution direction to both technical and non-technical audiences alike across all organizational levels Bachelor’s Degree in business, technology or related discipline.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: BitTitan® empowers IT service professionals to successfully deploy and manage cloud technologies through automation. BitTitan is the developer of MigrationWiz®, the industry-leading SaaS solution for mailbox, document, public-folder and Microsoft Teams migrations between a wide range of Sources and Destinations. Additionally, Voleer is BitTitan’s solution that centralizes and automates IT tasks, helping empower IT service professionals to streamline daily operations and eliminate redundancies. Since 2009, BitTitan has moved over 19 million users to the cloud for 43,000 customers in 187 countries and supports leading cloud ecosystems including Microsoft, Amazon, Google and Dropbox. BitTitan is a global company with offices in Seattle and Singapore.  Quick Overview  The following infromation details the primary duties and responsibilities for BitTitan's Channel Sales Manager. There may be additional aspects to the job which management can provide. The company reserves the right to modify and revise job descriptions as business needs dictate.  In This Job, You Will Drive Achievement of Channel Sales Quota Create and execute a channel sales strategy for each channel partner assigned with primary focus on key distributors Achieve 100% of quarterly and full year channel sales quotas assigned Enable and manage long-term relationships with assigned channel partners to support business goals and to execute channel strategies Drive consistent and predictable channel bookings through joint business planning and ongoing channel enablement Grow and maintain effective internal BitTitan relationships to maximize speed-to-market and opportunity closings Prepare compelling visual presentations to communicate BitTitan’s value proposition Drive strategic/large deals to exceed revenue targets Working with marketing, identify and develop new contacts, leads, and opportunities resulting in net new customer growth through your channel partners Ensure effective training and use of SFDC for distributor planning, contact information, opportunity management, forecasting, and win/loss analysis Travel as appropriate to work with partners and customers to grow your business and provide product requirements back to BitTitan Demonstrate cultural awareness for local customs and business processes fortifying the company’s value proposition as a global supplier of cloud based, SaaS solutions QBR Execution Execute effective QBRs with key distributors involving account managers, marketing, product management, and sales management as appropriate to achieve assigned channel quotas Team Management Able to to lead and manage team members to drive the channels strategy for that particular region We would love to speak with you if you have: Sales experience requirements: 3-4 years of sales, quota-carrying experience 2-3 years in channel sales Demonstrated history developing partner relationships and successful global outcomes Demonstrated personal leadership in driving new sales and meeting/exceeding sales targets Excellent written and verbal communications skills including formal and informal presentations Experience in technology industry specifically in cloud-based SaaS environments Works effectively with internal teams, i.e. account managers, marketing, product, finance, customer support, and sales management. Adept at handling ambiguous issues/assignments Comfortable delivering client-facing presentations Desire to work in a mid-sized, entrepreneurial company with a can‐do attitude Extras That Will Give You An Edge Education A business or technical Bachelor's degree applicable to the technology industry. Language Skills Read and communicate fluently in the English , Mandarin Language Bring your experience, your talent, your creative energy, and meet a diverse group of people who work together and build software that aims for the cloud. We have a unique culture that is collaborative, customer centric, professional, and encourages hard work with a layer of fun that keeps us in balance. Join the team that makes a positive impact on the future of IT services automation… you’re going to love it!  At BitTitan, Inc. we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we embrace it for the benefit of our employees, our partners, and our community. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and diversity.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What we're looking for:  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  We are looking for Enterprise Account Executives to join our sales team and focus on enterprise customers in Singapore. We seek exceptional talent that is eager to do the best work of their life while supporting others in doing the same. You will be responsible for driving sales opportunities with prospective customers as well as expanding business within existing accounts. You will work closely with our customers to understand their business objectives and act as their trusted guide for using Slack most effectively. You'll also work with cross-functional teams to help align our product roadmap and marketing materials with customer feedback.  If you're an established sales professional with a proven track record in helping customers achieve lofty goals, we should talk!  Some of the things you’ll be doing include …  Own the full sales cycle from lead to close Establish lasting relationships with senior executives and decision-makers Help educate customers on the value of Slack throughout their adoption cycle Build Slack awareness at all levels of an organization Identify customer needs to ensure customer success with special emphasis on signup, upgrade, and renewal Collaborate with other members of the sales team (solutions engineers, customer success managers, leadership, etc.) to build strategic adoption plans for customers Prepare and educate customers on new features and releases Monitor and identify adoption and utilization trends Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product Handle all customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including: billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Drive revenue through proactive outreach to key accounts  Who You Are...  You have 5+ years of software sales experience, preferably in SaaS You are a self-motivated teammate that can act independently Experience presenting to senior managers and the C-Suite You take an active interest in opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen customer relationships You have a consistent track record of identifying customer needs and successfully implementing solutions Ability to orchestrate and collaborate with cross-functional teams You are flexible, adaptive, and resilient You have a post-secondary degree, or equivalent experience Some travel required  About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Area Vice President, Sales - Slack  Slack is on a mission to make your working life simpler, more pleasant and more productive. We are looking for an Area Vice President of Large Enterprise Sales to join our fast growing Sales organization.  You are driven, curious, intelligent and deeply passionate about your craft. You will build and run a diverse team of talented individuals looking for mentorship and help growing their careers. In addition, you will remove barriers to Customer adoption of Slack and collaborate with the broader Leadership Team. This is a demanding role that requires strong leadership, priority management and interpersonal skills.  Responsibilities:  Participate in customer and prospect meetings and help define a strong business case Partner with Solution Engineering, Customer Success and other cross-functional teams to drive success and prioritize where Slack invests its resources Identify product and technology gaps with Customers and present a point of view to Slack’s Product and Leadership Teams Support ongoing growth and development including recruiting, hiring, training and mentoring reps Conduct weekly forecast meetings and coach Account Executives on strategies to reach their goals Report on sales activity and manage a regular revenue forecast Achieve key performance metrics and goals Work with your team to discuss, plan and implement process improvements Requirements:  12+ years of Sales experience preferably within an Enterprise SaaS organization 8+ years of Sales Management experience preferably within an Enterprise SaaS organization Solid understanding of Enterprise SaaS applications and collaboration technology Consistent track record of selling software into large Enterprise accounts and achieving personal and team goals Ability to grow business in a strategic manner including demand generation Excellent coaching, writing, discovery and presentation skills History of thriving in a rapidly-changing environment Enthusiasm for increasing customer happiness and deepening customer relationships Comfortable and willing to be a hands-on contributor Bachelor's degree required  About Slack  Slack is a layer of the business technology stack that brings together people, data, and applications – a single place where people can effectively work together, find important information, and access hundreds of thousands of critical applications and services to do their best work. From global Fortune 100 companies to corner markets, businesses and teams of all kinds use Slack to bring the right people together with all the right information. Slack is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and has ten offices around the world. For more information on how Slack makes teams better connected, visit slack.com .  Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Slack’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work.  Come do the best work of your life here at Slack. description: Our Client is a European MNC that specializes in manufacturing thermal packaging solutions.  Due to continued growth in globally they are looking for a high caliber Regional Sales Manager to join the organisation in Singapore.  Position Requirements:  * University Degree Holder. * Minimum of 5 years sales / business development experience in Cold Chain Logistics, Pharmaceutical or Speciality Chemical Industries. * Proven track record of sales success. * A self starter, highly motivated to develop new ideas, strategy and markets. * Ability to cope with high pressure and strict deadlines. * Sound willingness and skills to solve problems. * Strong English communication skills (additional language is an added advantage). * Highly effective presentation skills. * Willingness to travel regionally (once Covid-19 pandemic and restrictions ease).

About The Role: Mixpanel is in a stage of high-growth and partnerships is a key piece of the puzzle to our growth across the Asia-Pacific (‘APAC’) region. We are looking for a highly motivated leader and team player to join our Partnerships team to support the growth of Reseller partnerships in APAC. In this role, you’ll identify, recruit and operationalize new reseller partnerships to help expand Mixpanel’s indirect sales reach across Asia-Pacific. You will build a regional partner business plan with quantified goals and milestones to achieve partner sourced revenue metrics to meet all quarterly sales requirements. This role manages existing reseller partners in Asia, as well as being responsible for acquiring and nurturing new reseller relationships across all of APAC. You will drive the strategy for your partners, be responsible for managing your partner relationships, executing GTM activities with your partners, accountable for exceeding quarterly quota, generating pipeline and forecasting revenue, and helping your partner reps resell Mixpanel to generate revenue. You have experience working with Channel Resellers, Distributors, System Integrators (SIs), and Digital Agencies to understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate your partnerships and grow the region.  Responsibilities: Own and drive relationships with Solution Provider Reseller partners in Asia to generate significant resell revenue in region through new customer acquisition and existing customers upsell. Identify, recruit, enable and manage long-term relationships with new reseller partners (Regional Service Integrators (SIs), Digital agencies, Product Development agencies, etc.) to support business goals and to execute channel strategies Develop a deep understanding of partner business models, needs, and challenges including an understanding of our mutual customers’ needs. Develop GTM plans with partners to achieve and exceed revenue targets. Execute GTM activities and lead cross functional teams on activities such as onsite trainings, email campaigns, remote training sessions, webinars, and events. Generate resold revenue and assist partner sales teams to close deals. Manage pipeline generation and revenue forecast reporting. Leverage existing relationships at partners to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Assist partners with product positioning, configuration, demonstrations, sales strategy, and closing deals. Forge strong Mixpanel-internal relationships with key managers and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. We're looking for someone who has: Aside from having channel / indirect sales experience, you exhibit the two core characteristics of the Mixpanel Partnerships Team: low-ego and self-motivation. This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Development professional to join a growing channel program or an Account Executive looking to shift to a channel sales role and make a significant impact in the region. Preferred Qualifications: 5+ years of channel or direct sales experience in a Channel Sales role or equivalent quota-carrying role Execution focused but able to see larger picture Self-starter with great time management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Hard working and willing to put in the extra effort to get it done Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments Travel as necessary (and when possible), typically 25% or more depending on territory/region coverage Multi-lingual preferred.
industries: Computer Software

description: At Dornier MedTech, we believe in fostering a culture of science, innovation and reliability in our people, products, and services. These values serve as a compass that guides us towards meeting our everyday commitment to leading technology and improving life. We’re passionate about our products and our work and are looking to add you to our team.  You will play a key role in managing and expanding the distribution channels in assigned countries to drive business growth and to develop business relationships with end customers directly.  To be successful in this role, you should be independent and highly driven, demonstrate extensive experience in business development strategies, and the ability to adapt quickly in a dynamic environment. It is also important to take on a hands-on approach when required and willing to travel extensively.  Primary Responsibilities  Take ownership for assigned markets in the following areas : Achieve individual performance targets and meet specific goals and strategies Manage channel partners and develop distribution network   Negotiate and close business deals with channel partners Perform market analysis and develop suitable pricing strategies Develop and implement plans to be the brand champion for Dornier MedTech Understand market drivers & dynamics to craft relevant strategies to drive business  Secondary Responsibilities  Work with service team to meet service targets Develop client relationships and strengthen industry partnerships  Education/Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent  Experience  Minimum 2-3 years of relevant regional work in sales and channel management Possess 3-4 years of medical device sales experience is a plus  Aptitude  Keen to take on interesting challenges with limited resources Resourceful in utilizing existing structure & set up Able to adapt to diverse work environment Independent and takes ownership Strong collaborative mindset  Operational Skills  Able to view isolated & separate processes from a strategic viewpoint Must be able to do case support in the operating theatre  We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

description: To perform well in this role, we are looking for an individual with a proven track record in identifying and generating new business leads through various social platforms. You must also be confident in articulating technical concepts and solutions to various leads, in particular, executive level decision makers.  This role covers both outbound and inbound responsibilities, with a larger emphasis on generating outbound leads.  Roles & Responsibilities: Outbound Creating highly qualified opportunities for Account Executives within their Targeted accounts Outbound calling to prospective customers Analysing customer needs in terms of current business obstacles, identifying projects and scoping potential TIBCO solutions. Effectively communicating TIBCO’s solutions Overcoming objections and scheduling meetings with field sales and prospects Responsible to achieve a high level of collaboration with Marketing and Sales teams by developing and delivering against the strategy agreed with the field representatives and regional VP. Actively problem solving during the duration of the campaign to ensure results are met by the end of the campaign Inbound Creating highly qualified opportunities for Account Executives within their Targeted accounts Outbound calling to prospective customers Analysing customer needs in terms of current business obstacles, identifying projects and scoping potential TIBCO solutions. Effectively communicating TIBCO’s solutions Overcoming objections and scheduling meetings with field sales and prospects Responsible to achieve a high level of collaboration with Marketing and Sales teams by developing and delivering against the strategy agreed with the field representatives and regional VP. Actively problem solving during the duration of the campaign to ensure results are met by the end of the campaign  Skills & Qualifications: Fluency in written and verbal English is prerequisite for you to perform well in this role. Any additional proficiency in SEA languages (Thai / Vietnamese / Bahasa / Korean) will give you an edge in your application. Proven track record in identifying business and generating new business leads via the Internet, Telephone or Social media (LinkedIn and other platforms) Strong business development experience, with the ability to present technical concepts and business solutions clearly through conversations and written communications Experience in calling into C-level Executives at Enterprise size organizations along with the ability to work to and overachieve on targets. A strong interest in technology, passion for sales and strong communication skills. Understanding of the use and application of IT systems in a Business environment Objection handling expertise Knowledge of TIBCO’s products or previous experience in the IT industry is a bonus  How you’ll be rewarded: Focus on YOU - Health and Wellbeing : Employee Assistance Programme and an employer-funded Private Medical Insurance plan. You can also benefit from dental insurance, health assessments, and a truly holistic approach to flexible working options. Focus on FINANCES - Financial Future : We understand your financial future is key. That’s why you’ll have access to an exceptionally competitive pension scheme, a bonus incentive plan, automatic enrolment in an income protection plan, as well as a death and disability insurances to provide you with that financial peace-of-mind. Focus on PROGRESSION – Learn and Advance : Develop your skills with best-in-class on-line and in-person learning and development tools. Take advantage of TIBCO’s Career Mapping to enhance and develop your skills to take your career in the direction you choose. Participate in our ‘Elevate Live’ weekly enablement sessions, and for our Sales professionals - attend our Elevate Academy. Focus on COMMUNITY – Collaboration and Inclusion : Team up with our Culture Captains and help us continue to build #TIBCOSpirit. Daily we all strive to create a truly diverse, inclusive and collaborative community where we seek out inspiration, innovation and genuine WOW moments. From inspiring key-note speakers, to mental health awareness, to culture recognition days, we offer you a truly diverse environment where your voice matters. Focus on CUSTOMERS - Make a difference : Take a look at our many customer success stories: https://www.tibco.com/customers  The Fine Print: Please note you must have full working rights for the country you are applying for. If on a work permit or visa please make sure the details along with expiry date are included on your application. Applications and CVs must be in English. TIBCO is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. Important: Please note that we have updated our Candidate Data Privacy policy and can be found here: https://www.tibco.com/careers/candidate-privacy

description: About Cashapon Aims to be Southeast Asia's premier ecommerce enabler, providing innovative solutions that boost productivity and maximise sales opportunities for top brands through online channels. Cashapon Team is made up of highly ambitious individuals driven to innovate, build and succeed and is always looking for like-minded self-starters to join. Key Responsibilities: The Key Account Manager will be a key contact point for End to End process and services including, internal & external function. Internal function includes e-commerce Marketing, day to day operation, Customer service, and technology functions to manage Cashapon service to brand and improve the customer experience. Developing relationship with marketplace and new channel is also key part to drive client’s sales coverage and growth. Managing brand and channel portfolio to deliver growth to clients. The ideal candidate would have key skills as fast learner, high interpersonal skill, logical thinking, problem solving, high responsibility, prioritizing and initiative thinking. The role will require a combination of financial, business development and account management skills. Job description: Performance Management • Manage overall account profitability via P&L management • Ensure all clients and channels are successfully on-boarded on time and deliver KPI on track • Manage to maximize GMV with day-to-day collaboration with client and channels • Customer budget management and P&L execution including reimbursement to deliver agreed GMV, Take Rate, and Profit • Ensuring optimal product presentation and visibility on online channels • Leading all initiatives Across different services • Coordinating with internal cross function and external parties • Establish and monitor progress against key performance indicators. Partner Service • Responsible for client relationship and retain client satisfaction • Serve as the “face of aCommerce” and primary point of contact for client executives and key stakeholders at each assigned account • Advising clients on how to increase online sales through merchandising, promotion planning and onsite marketing activities • Managing fast-growing e-commerce sales of large brand owners through their own webstore or other online channels and initiative channel • Ensuring that regular reviews are carried out with customers, to ensure that their needs are being met and that excellent customer service is achieved and, developing future improvements/services for the customers. • Ensure operational performance on all areas • Identifies and anticipates additional opportunities for enhancements, improvements or new services with existing clients • Inventory management including forecast, ordering and DOH controlling • Works with other departments to ensure that everything is ready for go-live; Ensures that no processes or set up have been overlooked • Present analysis and recommendations to key stakeholders both client-side and internally Leadership and team work • Individual contributor in key account • Able to lead project relating with responsible account and category • Able to be mentor for key specialist that leads from account activities • Able share knowledge and team player Business Development • Contract Management by helping translate the outlined solution into a high level initial statement of work (SOW) and helps secure the client's agreement in sales meetings with the prospect or client (system & integration options, cost model, forecast value, activity planning, requirements definition, etc.) • Working closely with Solution design and business development to manage key customers (existing and new), thereby improving turnover and profitability • SOW & Trade Agreement management for existing account and input industry insight to SD for new customer. Key Qualifications • 2 year++ working experience in an Ecommerce company, Internet start-up, International Brand, FMCG, retailer or consulting • Previous experience in trade marketing, brand management, merchandising would be a plus. • Able to develop account plan • Good knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint and ability to quickly adapt to new software and tools • Proactive and problem-solving attitude • Very strong commercial English as well as client-facing abilities • Analytical, data driven mindset • High interpersonal skill with problem solving

description: Reports to: Managing Director Commercial Business, Asia Pacific  Job Summary  This is an experienced sales support role assisting Bell’s Asia Pacific sales region by developing product literature, proposals, purchase agreements and customer quotes. Responsibilities Compare, differentiate and communicate product features based on customer needs and requirements. Advance into roles of increasing customer interface and responsibility Develop sales literature, sales proposals, and purchase agreements Coordinate delivery of marketing materials to Sales Managers Develop & implement plans for aircraft demonstrations, trade shows and sales meetings Forecast annual sales goals Ensure that Sales Force.com is current for assigned region Coordinate aircraft deliveries Support achievement of annual sales goals for assigned region Monitor budget for assigned region Work with Finance, Customer Support Services, Contracts and Legal to ensure compliance Potential growth into international role supporting region  Education Bachelors degree in business, engineering or related field. (Rotorcraft experience preferred) Position Requirements At least four years of experience in a Sales or Marketing capacity with two years being in the aerospace/aviation industry (Rotorcraft experience preferred) Fluent in English. Sales Representative handling Chinese speaking market, proficient in Chinese is required. Spoken and written fluency in an Asian language (Bahasa Indonesia, Thai) is beneficial. Previous Asia-based education or work experience is strongly preferred. Excellent relationship building skills Knowledge of aviation and in particular, Helicopter operations is preferred Demonstrated organizational skills, written/oral communication skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office software Position will require travel throughout the Asia Pacific Region Ability to grasp concepts and skills along with potential to assume more responsible role Job Field  Sales  Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore  Recruiting Company  Bell Textron Inc.  Schedule  Full-time  Job Level  Individual Contributor  Shift  First Shift  Travel  Yes, 20 % of the Time  Job Posting  03/07/2021, 5:46:24 PM

description: ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES  Sales Strategy Contribute to the sales strategy on assigned Corporate Accounts portfolio growth objectives Determine the strategies for the assigned Corporate Accounts portfolio; Ensure development of cross selling in Country; Build the wallet share of business for GEODIS with the assigned customer portfolio and their subsidiaries or affiliates.  Account Management Ensure the development and maintenance of customer relationships and enhance overall client portfolio, safeguard sales revenue and ensure customer satisfaction Ensure increased consistency of services and pricing linked to “integrated solutions”; Grow the share of business, as well as expand the relationships within the customer identifying influencers, gatekeepers, decision makers but also to direct and align with Regional and Global KAM’s to further penetrate the client organization; Deploy a strong consultative selling approach with assigned accounts to identify their supply chain challenges and develop value creating solutions that drive increased scope of engagement and share of wallet for Geodis; All account issues proactively managed and resolved using continuous improvement principles to enhance service levels; Improve client satisfaction based on formal feedback and surveys of your customers.  New Business Ensure the identification and targeting of opportunities with customized propositions Provide support & leadership to local sales to develop business within portfolio of assigned clients; Participate to the VM Activities by supporting presentations to prospects and other clients and showcasing best practices & innovative solutions from your accounts; Work with VM manager to develop standardized offering from the customized solutions deployed on your customer; Engage with VM manager, product stakeholders, IT & management teams to create value adding service offerings that can be taken back to your clients;  Management Information Gather, consolidate, analyze and report management information Use CRM for all RFQ’s and Meetings; Track key indicators such as volume, revenue, gross profit, manage yield; Gather and provide to the company feedback on competitor information through your ongoing contact with strategic customers assigned to your care; Provide timely and accurate reporting of relevant details as required and requested.  Business Planning Drive behavior towards strategic engagement and value creation for assigned portfolio of accounts and strategic targets; Manage pipeline size and quality.  Organizational Culture Embrace the 5 values of Geodis be an ambassador by demonstrating these values in everything you say and do.  Leadership Steer, develop and motivate the local account managers to sell, maintain and support the assigned clients Customer cards in place and used to drive opportunities, innovations & growth strategy; Hands on Management of the accounts across using all standardized tools: QBR deck, Issue Log, Communication and Escalation Matrix, Monthly report… and ensuring same are maintained by local Account Managers.  REQUIREMENTS  Degree holder in related disciplines Minimum 5 years relevant experience in sales field with at least 3-year senior sales position; In-depth knowledge and experience with Freight Forwarding and Supply Chain Management; Excellent command of spoken and written English Good negotiation & presentation techniques Well-versed sales techniques, consultative selling, customer psychology and purchasing patterns. Fluent in local language, comfortable in English and other languages that the job requires to manage customer and other contacts Basic sales techniques and negotiation skills Presentation techniques, comfortable with meeting and presenting to groups 2-3 people Knowledge of Geodis Singapore tools Knowledge of company goals and strategies Good interpersonal and communication skills Highly proficient in computer skills and common applications (Office, Excel, PowerPoint & Word)  Our Candidate promise  Recruiting passionate people  At GEODIS, we believe that each and every person matters when it comes to achieving long-lasting success and demonstrating our know-how. Our commitment to our customers leads us to recruit passionate and demanding men and women who are ready to fulfill the ambitions of our rapidly changing sector with all their energy.  Join a leader in constant evolution  With more than 100 years of experience in the field of transport and logistics, GEODIS knows how to respond to the major challenges. Throughout its history, GEODIS showed ability to adapt to the needs of its clients, industry-specific constraints and new national boundaries. With its talent pool, GEODIS opens you doors to the world full of dynamism where everyone finds their place in expertise, contributes to their development and succeeds. Being the key player of the supply chain, we are working on the logistics projects of our customers today and preparing those of tomorrow.  Creating daily opportunities  It is true that we are committed to offering autonomy and the opportunity to take initiative to each of our new hires. Therefore, it is necessary that they benefit from personalized and operational support that will allow them to understand the challenges of GEODIS and emphasize their strengths. We encourage openness. “Discuss. Decide. Align.”- this is a genuine moto to guarantee the success of our actions.  And if you were part of this adventure?  Being GEODIS employee means living every day professional and personal adventure. It is about incorporating your personality, your knowledge and your know-how in the culture and the team spirit of GEODIS. Involvement and collaboration make it easier for everyone to take responsibility. We encourage you to go and meet different expertise and our complementary ecosystems whose activities give meaning to the group.

description: Account Executive Singapore  Our job is to be bold at work. It starts with an insatiable curiosity about clients, colleagues, and the future. At Forrester, we believe curiosity powers progress. Forresterites bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on the ideas and initiatives that change the course of business. As a trusted advisor to the most influential companies in the world, we live at the nexus of what’s next.  About This Role: The Account Executive is a hybrid sales role that generates and closes new businesses, as well as renews and upsells from existing clients within an assigned territory. This role will work on developing and executing a territory plan and strategy that will result in high quota attainment. For qualified prospects, the Account Executive must conduct a needs analysis and demonstrate the value of Forrester to potential clients by addressing critical business issues. Upon new client acquisition, the Account Executive will continue to build strong relationships, enrich existing accounts, and drive retention of existing businesses by ensuring high-level client satisfaction. This position is based in Singapore and will cover global corporate enterprise accounts, government-link companies, and government agencies as a territory.  Job Description Achieve a new business sales quota in the assigned territory on corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. Prospect and close appropriate accounts from a target account list on corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. Keep the relationship on closed accounts and develop them further. Develop and close business by promoting interest from IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing organizations across clients and other prospects. Sell to VP level and above within the prospect’s IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing organizations. Maintain an appropriate sales pipeline to achieve quota, and keep the pipeline updated in Forrester’s CRM system (Salesforce.com). Produce accurate and timely forecasts. Build a strong understanding on assigned industries, as well as the changing business and technology issues and needs that Forrester’s potential clients face. Navigate across teams to better understand the Forrester value proposition for prospects. Develop a complete understanding of Forrester's full array of product offerings, with an emphasis on business outcomes.  Job Requirements A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. Five or more years of proven experience in successful sales to C-level executives. Proven experience in working in a complex global business environment and managing stakeholders internally and externally. Proven experience in working in lean organizations with complex internal ecosystems. Possesses a strong domain knowledge in the following areas: IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing, as well as experience in selling to corporate enterprises The ability to align client business objectives with Forrester solutions. A high level of business acumen of corporate enterprises A team player with effective organization and time management skills. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills. Must be willing to travel.  Explore #ForresterLife on: YouTube Twitter Facebook Instagram LinkedIn Glassdoor  Forrester Research is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of discrimination, including sexual harassment.  Data Protection The information provided by you in this application will be used for the purposes of recruitment and, for successful applicants only, for personnel administration and management purposes and to comply with the employer’s obligations regarding the retention of employee records. If your application is unsuccessful, Forrester Research, Inc., its subsidiaries, affiliates, and/or service providers (collectively “Forrester”) will retain your personal information on secure file solely to consider you for future recruitment opportunities. By submitting your resume/CV, you consent to Forrester’s retention of the information provided on a secure file for personnel administration and management purposes and/or in order to consider you for future employment opportunities and to the transfer of the information provided to: Forrester’s offices in the US and other countries outside the European Economic Area; and Service providers engaged by Forrester for the purposes of processing applications for employment who may be located outside the European Economic Area.
industries: Management Consulting and Research

jobTitle: Sales Leader - Global Accounts Team Southeast Asia
description: Description  At Amazon.com, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help companies transform and innovate with the AWS platform, this is your chance to make history. Cloud Computing is revolutionizing Information Technology. Since early 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS customers can requisition compute power, storage, and other services–gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as their business demands them. Customers pay only for what they use, with no up-front expenses or long-term commitments, making AWS the most cost-effective, flexible way to deliver their applications to their customers and clients. With AWS, customers take advantage of Amazon.com’s worldwide computing infrastructure, that is the backbone of Amazon.com’s multi-billion retail business and transactional enterprise whose scalable, reliable, and secure distributed computing infrastructure has been honed for over a decade.  Would you like to lead and manage a team of high performance Global Account Managers focused on increasing adoption of Amazon Web Services in global accounts based in Singapore/Southeast Asia? Do you have the business savvy, technical background, and leadership skills necessary to help establish AWS as the premier cloud provider and strategic technology partner for our enterprise customers? As the Head of Global Accounts, Southeast Asia, you will have the exciting opportunity to lead a highly talented sales team focused on helping global accounts with regional headquarters in Asia innovate and grow their businesses through increased adoption of AWS services. The ideal candidate will possess a sales, management, and technical background that enables them to lead a team with engagements at the CxO level as well as with software developers and IT architects.  Roles & Responsibilities Accelerate the growth of AWS business in the global accounts with regional headquarters in Southeast Asia Work with the Global Accounts team (based largely in EMEA and US) to develop and execute account strategies and identify opportunities to drive business expansion within these global accounts. Lead and strengthen a highly skilled global accounts sales team. Work with all appropriate AWS resources (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, Support, Service teams and Professional Services) to support customer interests. This includes dotted line responsibility. Develop and execute against enterprise account plans, meet and exceed your targets. Articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services. Work with partners to extend reach and drive adoption.  Basic Qualifications Experience leading high performance sales teams is mandatory. 15+ years of high technology related sales or business development experience, as well as B2B sales experience 10+ years of sales management experience. Track record of meeting and exceeding business established goals Professional, ambitious, determined and results oriented mind set BA/BS degree required A technical background in engineering or computer science is a plus. Strong leadership skills. Preferred Qualifications Selling to large global accounts is preferred. Other experiences to include: experience in large complex deal negotiations with a successful track record; ability to navigate across AWS and the customer in a trusted advisor/consultative approach; and, establishing credibility quickly with senior level executives across the organizations. Experience in driving the adoption of new technologies and solutions preferred. A strong understanding of AWS and/or technology as a service would be preferred but not required. Literacy in Salesforce desirable  Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore Job ID: A1658751
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

jobTitle: Sales Representative - Small and Medium Business (SMB)
description: Oracle (NASDAQ: ORCL) is the world's most complete, open, and integrated business software and hardware systems company. For more information about Oracle, visit oracle.com. Oracle SMB Sales Representative   This is your chance to further your career and join an outstanding team of results driven, entrepreneurial Sales Account Executives and build an amazing career, working for the world's No. 1 in software for information management. We are seeking experienced Account Executives with the ability to own and deliver against a Sales Target, hold a Winning attitude and have the Passion and Hunger to help Oracle in our Quest to be the No1 Vendor in Cloud Technology! Oracle Cloud Platform meets the unique needs of developers, IT professionals and business users with a comprehensive, integrated portfolio of platform services that enables them to innovate faster, increase productivity and reduce costs. Help your customers integrate existing IT with next-generation cloud services, accelerate application development and deployment, and lead business transformation. Oracle Database 12c introduces your customers to a new multi-tenant architecture that makes it easy to consolidate multiple databases quickly and manage them as a cloud service. Oracle Business Intelligence (BI) solutions gives your customers instant visibility into business performance and drives better outcomes using a broad set of capabilities for reporting, analysis, modelling, forecasting – on any device. Oracle Fusion Middleware is the digital business platform for the enterprise and the cloud. It enables your customers to create and run agile, intelligent business applications while maximizing IT efficiency.  Key Responsibilties: Own and deliver a monthly sales target Sell solutions and services to new & existing Oracle customers Be an active Social Media player in your Market, to engage with appropriate prospects and run efficient targeted campaigns Prepare & Deliver online demonstrations of your business solutions to prospective clients Liaise with business contacts to develop & manage relationships, identifying new opportunities to sell Oracle products and services  Requirements: Bachelors /Masters’ Degree in IT or Business Experience of selling to the region is essential. Relocation services on offer if applicable. Excellent Training + Development including 2-week Intensive Foundation Course.

Who we are: At Mitto, we’re on a mission to deliver reliable, high-quality communications between businesses and their customers, every time.   Our company was founded in 2013 with the specific aim of building a state-of-the-art Application-to-Person (A2P) SMS messaging platform, unrivalled in reliability, that could support the requirements of a new wave of A2P services. As the demand grew for enablement of omnichannel communications capabilities, we expanded our portfolio beyond SMS to now include voice, chat bots, all major chat apps (WhatsApp, Viber, Facebook Messenger, etc.), Google Business Messaging, RCS, myriad CRM and marketing platform integrations and, most recently, pre-built tools for bulk campaigns and conversational support chats.  Simply put, we make communication happen… and you can help.  We are looking for an ambitious and sales-driven Business Development Executive located in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore to work on identifying, opening, and growing new accounts in the telecoms, Internet, and mobile app markets across the region.  What you’ll do:  Be responsible for sales and closing of the new business opportunities in the region. Manage clients located in the APAC region and be responsible for their growth. Contribute by helping with a relationship with Mitto´s key accounts in the region Identify prospects, build pipelines, and close deals ensuring long-term revenue plans. Work together with the operations team to deploy the service offered to the client and manage the account according to the Mitto team strategy. Prioritise and deliver a superior customer experience to strategic customers in the region. Participate in answering global clients RFP for cloud telecommunications support. Continuously work with the client to identify needs and propose solutions making an impact on the Mitto product roadmap  You need to bring with you: University degree or equivalent practical experience. Fluent in English. Ability to work under pressure and quickly grasp a good understanding of trends driving innovation in technology, specifically in mobile, cloud and consumer areas. Willingness to work with an international team. Experience in building strong relationships with decision-makers. Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills. Excellent customer service skills with a customer-driven focus and the ability to adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment. Ability to work cross-functionally both internally and externally to execute deals. Self-motivated with a passion for sales and the ability to thrive in a results-driven environment 3+ years of B2B sales experience in the mobile solutions sector (SMS, Voice, and similar)  What we offer: A fast-paced, start-up like environment where every team member makes a direct impact on our collective success Resources and leadership to help grow your skills and advance your career Collaboration with talented individuals in various locations throughout the world Access to cutting-edge technology and its application across global markets with leading brands Competitive benefits to ensure your health, wellness, and happiness so you can enjoy the full experience of life at Mitto. Freedom to work remotely from anywhere in the APAC region
industries: Information Technology and Services and Telecommunications

description: At Aiven, we turn top Open-Source data technologies into frustration-free cloud services to serve the needs of customers of all sizes. Today, we offer eight fully-managed services - Apache Kafka, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Redis, InfluxDB and Grafana that work across major cloud providers such as Google, Amazon, Azure, Digital Ocean and more.  Aiven in a nutshell:   We are open-source and cloud experts Our platform delivers bulletproof data ops Global service footprint & support organization Security in our DNA 500+ customers in 50+ countries $150M in VC funding   We are now looking for a Sales Manager to join our newly-founded Aiven Sales team in Singapore.   Responsibilities:  Qualify new customers and prospects and sell the Aiven product suite to them Prospect and open new leads by identifying and qualifying opportunities for Aiven Become an expert on Aiven's services and conduct discovery calls, presentations, and demos with prospects and customers Articulate the business values your prospects can benefit from using Aiven services Support customers during the sales cycle and optimize the selection of Aiven's service offering in alignment with customer requirements Assist customers during the onboarding process and align closely with our Support Team to ensure a smooth transition to becoming an Aiven customer with a best-in-class customer experience Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product & engineering support Visit customers on site as appropriate in alignment with our Sales Enterprise Director Track all opportunity and customer details in Salesforce  Requirements:  3-5 years of software selling experience; SaaS experience preferred, familiarity with the Open-Source space is a major bonus Experience selling to Developers as well as Director/VP-level leaders Some basic IT education Outbound prospecting experience A consistent track record in meeting / exceeding quota Proficiency using Salesforce.com Skills in virtual presentations, online web demos, remote sales processes A Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience Extraordinary verbal and written communication skills The ambition to be an amazing salesperson (or maybe you are already - congrats!). As we are growing so fast - "the Sky's the Limit" for your own personal career here at Aiven.  Benefits:  We are proud of our supportive and pragmatic organizational culture. We are solution-oriented, and at the same time we cultivate an environment of trust and diversity where everyone can strive for excellence.    Besides our people and culture, at Aiven you'll have   A dynamic environment in a rapidly growing, international business Highly experienced colleagues from a variety of backgrounds Flexible working hours, including remote working when needed Ability to choose the devices and tools that make you work the best Mobile phone and subscription Participation in employee stock option plan  You will be part of a highly-skilled, tight-knit and growing team, making your contribution essential to what is becoming a truly unique success story. If you're interested, send us your application and we'll take it from there.   Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes.   Aiven complies with applicable local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Egencia is changing the way corporations manage their travel programs and is seeking a professional sales specialist to drive our leadership in corporate travel. The Global Sales Manager will be selling into global Singapore based companies with footprints across all regions; North America (NA) Asia Pacific (APAC), Latin America and European markets. The objective of this position is to develop multi-dimensional relationships with global customers and provide customized solutions for their worldwide travel needs.  This position requires a customer centric approach with tried skills in pipeline management, platform selling, negotiation; understand complex systems and processes. With effective communication and a strong knowledge of market trends, will assist to understand the impact on business needs and travel solutions. This position will be representing the Egencia brand through verbal, written and formal presentations to potential customers at all levels.  The individual must be a great teammate, biased to action, self-motivated, highly organized, high energy, integrity, humility and can function effectively in an un-structured environment.  Egencia makes business travel better. Combining technology and service, we build a seamless experience, where companies have access to a user-friendly interface, extensive travel options, and 24/7 global support. Join our mission and help us take the next steps in transforming the world of business travel.  What You’ll Do The ability to understand product capabilities and communicate the value and differentiation of a service offering in the market. Grow Egencia portfolio and revenue with new customers headquartered in Singapore by playing an active role in value proposition selling and contract negotiation Once requirements are clearly identified, promote competitive advantages and Egencia’s outstanding value proposition through proposal, RFI/RFPs and presentations Connect with prospects (from discovery meeting to closing) and build a high-level relationship with executives (CFOs, CEOs) Responsible for contract closing and implementation of customers with the implementation team Selling the right solution, to ensure that the customer transitions from implementation to trade Sign profitable business to meet quarterly goals, in line with Egencia’s pricing schedules Work collaboratively and establish relationships with internal teams Who You Are  You’ll be great for this role if you have the following: Excellent communication skills, including written and oral Strong listening skills with to interpret the customers’ needs Validated sales experience in pipeline management including negotiation skills Ability to effectively address key decisions makers in a very competitive and innovating environment Minimum 4 years Sales experience with a consistent track record in hitting quarterly sales targets Organized and structured High level of dynamism, drive, and energy - great teammate Strong commitment to both a high quality of work and service to customers in a fast-paced environment Proficient level of experience with MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word Graduate level education is desired Position requires some travel, sometimes to international locations A good knowledge of the corporate travel industry and/or platform selling (desired but not essential) Egencia started out by disrupting the business travel technology industry and we haven’t stopped since. We are purpose-built to provide the industry’s best travel management experience – and we’re continually investing to make it even better, faster, and easier for people to connect with confidence. Learn more at egencia.com and follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn.  Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Leisure, Travel & Tourism

description: At Quantum, we focus on creating innovative technology and solutions to help our customers get the most value from their data. With 40 years of storage know-how, Quantum’s technology, solutions, and services help customers capture, create, and share digital content – and preserve and protect it for decades. Whether it’s unlocking the potential of digital content, powering breakthrough innovations, creating entertainment that enriches lives, or keeping nations secure, Quantum works with customers and partners to make the world a happier, safer, and smarter place.  Quantum Corp. leads the world in helping users collaboratively solve some of the world's hardest computer challenges. Whether its wrangling petabytes of data for cutting edge movie production, managing global content production workflows, exploring new sources of energy, or managing oceans of content and blending collaborative high-speed workflows with cutting-edge object storage, Quantum has the tools and technology to help our customers engineer the solution that works now, preserving their work for decades to come.  You are applying to an exceptional team that contributes to enhancing our position as a proven global expert in data management.  Visit us at www.quantum.com    Our Sales and Channel teams share with companies around the world, helping them understand the power Quantum has to offer teams at scale. The Sales Strategy team develops insights to assess business performance, and leads initiatives to identify new sources of growth. We work closely with senior sales leaders to develop shared goals, and do the planning and execution necessary to make those goals a reality.  The Head of Sales - Asean will lead the Quantum Business sales organisation across the ASEAN region.  Quantum Southasia regional offices are located in 5 geographies across the Asea region and are selling into 7 geographies across the region.  This role will be responsible for setting and implementing the GTM strategy, developing and growing the sales organization capability, and will ultimately carry the total Business revenue and profitability targets for the region.   Quantum business in the region is predominantly a High Touch in Direct, so a strong background in developing high-growth and expansion opportunities through an high level of customer direct relationship and an indirect sales model are critical to the role.   Critical to the success of the role is to work with all cross-functional stakeholders, e.g. Marketing, HR, Solutions and Services to support their high-performing team and ensure efficient lead flow, short sales cycles and the right product/market fit across all of quantum portfolio required to drive the region’s growth.    Responsibilities  ·        Develop and execute a strategy and GTM plan for the region across diverse engagement models, working with global leaders and cross-functional partners to deliver on this plan  ·        Motivate, lead and inspire a team team that reflects the Quantum values of excellence, transformation and inclusivity. ·        Drive a high performing and professional sales culture, delivering on the revenue targets per quarter through operational excellence. ·        Ensure and nurture an environment of continuous learning & development  ·        Drive region-wide awareness in the space for Quantum , through speaking engagements, and working with marketing, channel and communications teams ·        Sit on regional leadership team for the broader Quantum APAC organisation  Requirements   ·        Track record of owning and driving a successful multi-market, multi-product & solution sales organisation to over-achievement across various routes to market (direct includes customer sales teams and channel) ·        Proven ability to drive business through recruiting, developing and scaling Channel partners and Distribution ·        Strong people leadership experience in a sales environment, with proven success in hiring, engaging, retaining and developing key talent ·        Proven experience in building a sales organisation with excellence in all areas of sales execution including lead generation, pipeline management, closing deals and managing existing installed base of customers ·        Proven excellence in leading an organisation working with small, medium and large enterprise accounts across multiple industries using value selling ·        Analytical, structured thinking, data driven approach and ability to synthesise the main considerations ·        Adaptable, capable of working within ambiguity ·        Capability of operating in a fast paced environment, and to lead a team to operate at pace and with exceptional results within the guidelines of the sales methodology ·        Experience in managing multi-country business in Asean ·        Located in Singapore with at least 8 to 10 years of Enterprise sales/big deal management experience with a minimum of 3 years direct sales exposure in public sector; a strong network within govt space will be highly desirable   Qualified candidates are requested to apply via email stating current and/or expected salary to: hr-sg@quantum-southasia.com
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Job Title: Regional Sales Manager   Who we are  We are Colombian Exotic Coffee; coffee growers growing high quality coffee beans. Grown under ideal conditions in the rich grounds of Colombian mountains. Traditionally harvested by hand. Processed using the modern day techniques. All resulting in the best of the best, since 1920.  Key Accountabilities As a Regional Sales Manager, you will be accountable for:  The acquisition of new customers as well as further business development in the field of Green Coffee Beans to the roasters in the Asia region. You will be responsible for presenting and selling our product to a variety of professionals in the coffee industry. Your goal will be to develop creative and alternative strategies to achieve and surpass sales targets.   Experience Skills And Qualifications  5+ years of relevant sales experience in speciality coffee sector  Understand the green coffee and speciality coffee trading business  Cupping, Roasting, and Tasting experience, understand how to describe a coffee, differentiate commercial and low quality to specialty grades Understanding the technical differences of commercial coffee to speciality coffee on a foundation level  Basic understanding of coffee processes (Natural, washed, honey, etc) Experience in brewing and other extraction methods  Basic knowledge of varieties and coffee origins Build and maintain client relationship Formulate and implement marketing and sales strategies across Asia Maintain a deep understanding of our products, practices, and brand values while engaging with the clients Traveling required   Benefits Of Working At Colombian Exotic Coffee  Attractive Fixed and Commission based salary  Competitive vacation policy Comprehensive health benefits

From Fivetran's founding until now, our mission has remained the same: to make access to data as simple and reliable as electricity. With Fivetran, customer data arrives in their warehouses, canonical and ready to query, with no engineering or maintenance required. We're proud that more organizations continue to leverage our technology every day to become truly data-driven.  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) position at Fivetran is a highly strategic role that sits squarely between our Marketing and Sales go-to-market motion. The goal for SDR Organization is to respond to all inbound marketing qualified leads as quickly as possible, connect and qualify prospects, and deliver high quality meetings for our Sales team that drives pipeline to fuel the company's growth.  As a Sales Development Representative at Fivetran, you will: Hit Monthly Quota for Stage 1 Opportunities Hit Daily/Weekly/Monthly Activity Goals Master the Fivetran consultative, Command of the Message, and Challenger sales process Understand our target audience and primary use cases Clearly communicate and collaborate with Marketing and Sales teams  What you bring to the table: A track record of high achievement Excellent written and verbal communication skills Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better The desire to meet and exceed measurable performance goals Naturally curious and passionate A "one-speed" energy with a highly self-driven sense of motivation Owns individual work output and makes contributions to achievement of team results in a well-defined area of limited scope Identifies issues preventing an assigned task from being accomplished. Thinks through problems and enlists support to solve The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis Mandarin speaking  Nice-to-haves: Previous SDR/BDR experience of 6-months or longer Salesloft/Outreach experience Social selling through personalization via LinkedIn & Video  We're honored to be valued at over $5.6 billion, but more importantly, we're proud of our core values of Integrity, Initiative, and One Team, One Dream. To learn more about Fivetran's culture and what it's like to be part of the team, click here and enjoy our video.  To learn more about our candidate privacy policy, you can read our statement here.

description: As part of the Business Development team, you will develop and implement effective solution-selling strategies at all levels within assigned industries and locations. Providing strategic direction in your specific industry, you will work collaboratively with the Regional Sales/Product Marketing teams to develop and foster long-term business partnerships that can be leveraged to enable the achievement of our key corporate goals.  Responsibilities: Meet/exceed sales growth objectives for the assigned industry (Machine Building) and locations as established by Sales leadership. Drive value-added/custom solutions within assigned industry (Machine Building) and locations. Work independently or in conjunction with regional Sales/Product Marketing teams to translate the specific sales strategy into location specific execution plans that will enable market penetration within the Southeast Asian Machine Building Industry. Work effectively as part of a team to achieve individual, team and departmental objectives, sharing knowledge and skills as appropriate. Plan and participate in marketing activities for the assigned industry (Machine Building) and locations. Contribute to the tender / product specification process and manage pre-sales strategy. Perform design-in/cross-over wins from competitors and create barriers to competitors in assigned industries and locations. Foster and build good customer relationships at a senior level that may be leveraged to maximise revenue growth and customer retention. Report regularly on project status/activity as required by the management team. Consistently provide feedback and insight to Product Marketing teams regarding competition, product and/or market needs to help develop a competitive edge. Provide pro-active leadership and maintain clear and concise communication channels with individual sales personnel within the locations responsible for Machine Building customers. Gain and maintain a sound technical/application knowledge base on all products. Deliver presentations and hands-on demonstrations of Phoenix Contact products, applications, and technology to assist in the sales process. Demonstrate a positive and flexible approach to changing business priorities.  Qualifications:  Diploma degree in Electronics/Electrical/Marketing/Business. Technical discipline preferred and/or equivalent business experience in the Machine Building industry. Minimum 3 years of sales experience with track record in the Machine Building marketplace. Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills Proficient with Windows based applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Customer-driven and results-oriented. Self-motivated and ability to take lead and show initiative. Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills. A good team player. Disciplined, hardworking and able to perform under pressure. Willing to travel regionally
industries: Industrial Automation, Machinery, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: As a Funds Services - Business Development Specialist this role will work in collaboration with on-field sales executives in each of the markets and will take  responsibility for selling into a designated territory  Candidate should expect the following- ·         Building pipeline and executing new business opportunities and meet/exceed targets established for the designated region ·         Big emphasis will be on building pipeline from new prospects within the region ·         A successful candidate must be capable of engaging at a CXO and Senior levels within Banks, fund administrators, asset managers, insurance companies and pension funds to understand their strategy and key business drivers; strive to develop a buying vision and roadmap with the customer; introduce Oracle solutions and to convince the customers of the value it delivers  ·         Strives to position Oracle as a market leader in the Fund Accounting and Servicing space ·         Collaborate closely with Sales, Pre-sales, Consulting, Marketing teams to drive sales in the assigned market ·         Will be the face of Oracle FSGBU Fund Services business within the region and actively contributes towards thought leadership vie- speaking engagements, writing blogs etc..  ·         Provide direction and input to the Product Management, Product Marketing and Product Development Groups on product plans and new product roll outs by analysing the changes and advances in technology to anticipate the market trends  Skills you need- ·       10-15 years of experience selling enterprise software to banks, preferably in the space of Wealth Management, Fund Accounting and Servicing space ·       A strong track record of pipeline and revenue growth ·       Has strong connects within the business and technology teams within Banks, fund administrators, asset managers, insurance companies and pension funds in the region ·       Should have a sound understanding of the Fund Accounting and Servicing domain ·       Should have good understanding of the technology trends and should be able to articulate the Functional and Technical value proposition to prospective customers  ·       Should have an excellent presentation and demonstration skills and should have the prior experience in public speaking at conferences and trade events

description: As part of the Customer Business Development team, you will help deliver retail sales target, optimize customer profits, manage inventory holdings to a mutually agreed target, and develop channel trade plans with customer to ensure timely execution of trade plans of the online boutique/s of the brand/s you manage. Equipped with enthusiasm and skill, you will be primarily responsible to:  1. Develop and build long term strategic relationship with assigned key customer(s) To be the channel experts for customers so as to advice and develop business to achieve goals Channels refer to offline channels and / or online channels such as Lazada, Shopee, Zalora, etc. Develop, align and implement channel portfolio strategies, go-to-channel routes and promotional plans to achieve mutually agreed business goals. Regular meetings and quarterly business review with customer(s) and channels to ensure business progress and alignment towards agreed goals Submission of trade investments and promotional claims to customer(s) per agreed amount  2. Manage channels' (online & offline) activities for assigned customer(s) To conduct advance planning and gain alignment on business activities with customers and channels To execute and review agreed plans on channels’ seller centers and exercise entrepreneurship to drive business targets To manage all channels' seller centers from trade activities to ensuring strong seller's store ratings To conduct post activity / promotion analysis so as to improve and enhance forward plans Pitch and negotiate with channels’ category manager to maximize brand’s exposure and visibility  3. Business Custodian for Synagie To understand assigned customer(s) P&L and identify areas for growth / improvements To negotiate trade terms and margins with customer to achieve win-win scenario To prepare analysis and presentations in preparation for any trade / channel negotiations   Qualifications Hold a bachelor’s degree in any discipline of study; Are keen to work in the eCommerce industry; Have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong commercial acumen; Are passionate about consumer experience, innovation, health, beauty and fashion; Possess good communication and interpersonal relation skills; Agile and able to work in a dynamic and fast paced environment; and Self driven and a strong team player.   About Synagie Synagie is an eCommerce company that provides end-to-end commerce enablement solutions to businesses selling online and offline. Our mission is to simplify commerce and make it easier for brands and businesses to sell online. Established in 2014, our clients include some of the world’s leading MNCs in the consumer goods sector and SMBs who are looking to simplify the complex commerce process.
