description: Company Description  We’re on a mission to help move the businesses that move the world. With over 130 years’ experience, Toll Group, proudly part of Japan Post, operates an extensive global logistics network, covering road, air, sea and rail across 1,200 locations in more than 50 countries.  Global Logistics provides sophisticated supply chain solutions, from end-to-end or part solutions, warehousing and distribution to dedicated transport solutions, across the globe and to some of the most remote corners of the world.  Job Description  VP, Sales & Marketing Based in Singapore Reports to the Executive VP, Asia Responsible to drive the P&L of the business in Singapore The primary responsibility of the role will be required to drive profitable growth across the existing Singapore business through development of new business and increased share of wallet from existing customers in the following sectors- Retail, Consumer, Industrial and Automotive. This role also plays a significant role in the strategic communication channel between the customer and Toll and to develop and drive a customer centric and service excellence culture.  As a Vice President, Sales & Marketing, You Will Setting a strategic vision for the sectors to grow sales and profitability and manage the strategic direction for Toll’s relationship of the assigned strategic account/s Developing and implementing top tier sales and marketing strategy as well as the developing a clear TGL end to end value proposition in accordance with industry application and strategies. Leading the sales team, co-ordinating account team members across multiple operations and services and ensuring a single Toll experience for the customer. Using market and segment intelligence on customers, competitors and significant factors affecting markets to influence short and long term business objectives and to support decision making. Engaging with solution development to drive efforts that best address customer needs, seeking and securing leading edge innovative solutions to meet customer needs Use industry networks and market intelligence, identify and drive the provision of innovative end-to-end customised solutions for new and existing customers through the effective identification of customer needs and keeping up to date with relevant industry solutions, in conjunction with the relevant Supply Chain Solutions support team. Qualifications  To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Need Tertiary qualifications in related field (Sales or Marketing) 10+ years’ experience in senior sales roles within matrix organizations Extensive experience in commercial negotiations in a B2B, 3 PL environment Experience in developing logistics solutions and demonstrated understanding of the operational impacts of customer proposals Proven track record in driving business performance through strategic account management and development and effective people leadership. Understanding and experience in segment marketing/brand development/value proposition generation Additional Information  Be Connected  With a bold vision and innovative drive, join our 44,000 colleagues as we lead industry change and transform how customers best meet their global supply chain needs in a meaningful and sustainable way. There are countless opportunities to learn and make a real impact in shaping our industry’s future. Grow with diverse challenges amongst a friendly and inclusive global culture. Take pride in building relationships that matter, because being connected is at the centre of what makes Toll great – it’s what makes our possibilities endless.  Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities.  If this sounds like the opportunity you are looking for, apply now or for more information contact yen.lim@tollgroup.com  To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com  You must be entitled to work in the country where the role is based and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Logistics and Supply Chain, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: 200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.  Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years.   About the role  As a regional key account manager, you will ensure the delivery of expected outcomes along with providing high quality services to our FMCG customers. Reporting to the Head of FMCG Vertical in ASPAC, the role is expected to manage, develop and facilitate growth of existing and targeted accounts within the FMCG Vertical.  It will be your responsibility to come up with strategies to develop and/or maintain Bollore’s position with existing and prospective FMCG accounts. You will also be required to work cross-functionally to participate in tender opportunities, draft legal contracts, as well as generate performance reports in order to position Bollore towards successful business acquisitions.   What you will be doing  Extend Bollore’s reach within Asia Pacific region  Identify Key Account targets in Asia Pacific region Study the FMCG market, inclusive but not limited to, competitors, carriers, manufacturers, market trends, fluctuations and changes. Work with Vertical Lead to develop, grow & capture market share among existing and targeted FMCG accounts with the ASPAC Region Effectively Interact with our network to support overall FMCG development, work with local sales teams in achieving targeted growth for each entity Act as internal consultant and share know-how about the vertical Send sales leads to network in order to increase Bollore Logistics’ presence in ASPAC Establish a referencing strategy for regional or international accounts Develop relationships with prospective key accounts to promote Bollore Logistics and obtain the opportunity to participate for future tenders Represent Bollore Logistics to lead and participate in tender process (RFP/RFI/RFQ) for FMCG accounts Promote Bollore Logistics services and key Asia stations and regions Implement new business strategies to gather sales leads and expand new FMCG customer base  Service support  Determine a tariff policy in conjunction with Middle Office and Regional Sales Management Participate in negotiations with suppliers Monitor customer account profitability and problems linked to receipts with site managers Transfer obtained contracts to Operations team in order to provide high quality service to customers Support services or operation sites through advising on relevant SOPs  Synthesis of information Consolidate statistical elements from various operations for reporting purposes Report sales actions undertaken to further develop key customer accounts Update CRM with weekly activities and monthly reports for key accounts   The successful applicant  Essential  Bachelor’s degree and above At least 10 years’ experience in a fast paced and dynamic MNC environment Prior experience in the logistics/warehousing industry Prior experience in key account management (preferably in ASPAC region) Exceptional business development, relationship management & communication skills  Desirable  Prior experience in FMCG vertical Strong network/contacts of FMCG decision makers in Asia Pacific Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office suite Good sales and analytical skills Customer-centric mindset Self-starter Highly adaptable    Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: We are looking for an ambitious and energetic Business Development professional to help us expand our vertical client based. You will be the front of the company and will have the dedication to create and apply an effective business development strategy.  Summary of job Working with large key accounts in Singapore in Public or Private Sector (please specify vertical specialization), this position requires a knowledgeable and experienced business professional with strong account management capabilities in engaging customers at the executive level to provide solutions, develop new business and ensure high levels of customer satisfaction while maintaining positive ongoing relationships. This professional must be able to demonstrate the ability to engage at all levels within project groups and to influenced the opportunity at the early stage. The actions of this position will result in Hikvision being seen as the “Trusted Advisor” to the End-user communities while creating pull-through sales value to the supply channel for Hikvision products and solutions. The business development professional shall feel at home being the “voice of Hikvision” in front of customers, the decision makers.  What we are looking for: Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Execute Hikvision Singapore strategic plan: Study the selected vertical’s value chain/players; Identify, prioritize, schedule, pursue, and deliver strategic Key End-user project opportunities for target fulfillment, Building long term relationships through direct and indirect touch, Use of innovative marketing tools to nurture this relationship, Work as a Team with Hikvsion project sales and System Integration partners to manage Key End User accounts in the Public or Private Sector (please specify vertical specialization) Make the knowledge available to Hikvision project sales and product marketing teams for planning and fulfillment purposes Deep dive into End-User organization structure and ability to understand the different Group down to the Department level of the End User to identify the opportunities area Conduct Key End-user events to better understand the required features & functions of future technologies in the video based IoT space. Provide Key End-user presentations during “face to face” and Virtual introductory meetings. Develop and schedule the deployment of required Key End-user programs to address individual End-user needs and pain-points Identify & understand the business models of the Key End-user accounts as it relates to security and not limited to security functions Cooperate with and coordinate company internal technical resources and project teams to effectively communicate the expansion / transition to future technology. Provide educational/awareness briefings for End-users to reinforce Hikvision role as “Trusted Advisor”. Interface, collaborate and communicate effectively with other departments and business units addressing the end-user in support of Hikvision goals. Expand and maintain a comprehensive database of key and named end-user accounts in the Public or Private Sector (please specify vertical specialization) Maintain a high degree of product knowledge, more on the spectrum/benefit/road map level. Attend applicable industry tradeshows, meetings and other Hikvision internal and external events, especially with focus on speaking and presentation opportunities. Participate in applicable End-user seminars and conferences and drive Hikvision engagement. Provide timely and accurate monthly status report of group activities and progress using CRM & during the weekly / monthly / quarterly briefing session.  Qualifications, Education and Experience  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Bachelor’s degree and/or minimum of 5-10 years of proven business development experience Minimum of 5 years of work experience in CCTV or a technology-related industry. Candidate with Project Sales experience with a System Integration Company in the Physical Security Industry is a plus. Excellent communication, analytical and financial skills Strong account management skills with experience in collaboration in a global team Ability to think critically and creatively and to contribute in a team environment Ability to use the internal and external tools to gather and interpret data  Language Skills      Ability to effectively communicate in English language, both verbally and in writing. Ability to communicate in Chinese language verbally Ability to read and interpret technical journals, technical specifications, international technical standards (such as ONVIF), etc.  Computer Skills Proficient in MS Office & CRM software. Familiar with operating systems, such as Windows, etc.   Work Requirements Compliance with all relevant Hikvision Global policies and procedures related to Quality, Security, Safety, Business Continuity, and Environmental systems. Travel and fieldwork, including international travel may be required. Therefore, the employee must possess, or be able to acquire a valid passport. Must be legally eligible to work in Singapore  In your application please specify the vertical specialization! E.g Transportation, Education, BFSI, Government, etc for consideration

Adecco is collaborating with a fast-growing Fintech startup in Singapore and they are looking to hire a Sales Support Specialist for their team expansion.  Job Description: Supervise and/or build pitch decks, presentation or video materials for the sales team Analyze sales-report based on the data from CRM and company database and brainstorm strategy with BD team to improve the results Improve team workflow and relationship in between departments Organize daily sales meeting and write meeting minutes Other tasks assigned by Sales Manager  Job Requirements: At least 3 years of working experiences in related fields Must be exceptional at presentations and communications with senior stakeholders and at organizing data Bilingual in English and Mandarin (work closely with Shanghai office) Project experience within financial services, fintech, or blockchain industry Project experience in affiliate marketing, or digital product regional expansion Prior industry experience in crypto and/or DeFi is a plus Experience or high interest in blockchain and cryptocurrency  Next Step: Interested applicants, please send your resume in Word format to gordon.quek@adecco.com with your current and expected salary. We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

description: Job Purpose With more than 15,000 clients worldwide and over 175 years in business, Accuity a LexisNexis Risk Solutions company, is looking for a junior ambitious Sales person for the role of  Business Development Executive, Financial Crime Compliance, South East Asia based in Singapore.  The successful candidate will have the ability to plan, prospect, cold call/cold connect and maintain high levels of activity that lead to create new opportunities with new and existing customers across a diverse region and vertical industries.  Reporting directly to the Sales Manager, South East Asia, through sales of Accuity & LexisNexis Risk Solutions Financial Crime Compliance (FCC) solutions – you, will be responsible for acquiring new logo business by actively promote our hosted solutions to grow our risk & compliance business from the ground up in the region. You will plan and execute the ‘Go To Market’ strategy for this growing space in Accuity and maximise lead generation and build our engagement and participation in the surrounding FCC community.  -------------------------------------       To achieve sales targets by acquiring new business from prospects through sales of Accuity FCC solutions within South East Asia region.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:  Sales Activity Identifies new business opportunities to increase penetration and growth of new logos for Accuity’s FCC solutions Plans, organises and executes sales campaigns in order to develop revenue opportunities and to maximise revenue growth Holds themselves accountable to deliver against high activity and sales KPIs and objectives as assigned by management Reports and Forecasts on performance against objectives on a regular basis through SalesForce Plans, builds and maintains accurate and informative prospect and customer records using Salesforce Creates account plans for significant prospects to ensure the successful management of opportunities in line with agreed expectations Be able to build relationships and collaborate with external/internal stakeholders      Relationship Management Regular contact with prospects and existing customers to develop relationships to better understand their business, their goals and their requirements Drives Referral based activities to expand account opportunities and influence Establishes strong working relationships with all other areas of Lexis Nexis Risk Solutions in order to create and execute effective GTM plans Delivers a high level of customer satisfaction through a consultative sales approach Shares best practice across the sales team  Market Knowledge Keeps abreast of any changes in the industry/market by talking to customers, industry experts, partners and own research; and interprets the changes and the effects this will have on the solutions Updates line managers and team on industry trends, developments and potential opportunities. Monitors competitor activity in the market place – records and shares information and responds accordingly  KEY SKILLS REQUIRED: Direct B2B sales, preferably international New business sales experience, hunter mentality Good in Network building Comfortable in fast paced, high activity role and environment Data / software solutions sales Excellent Communication skills Proactive and self-motivated Excellent Organisation skills Results driven Numeracy and analytical IT literacy Fluent in English, a local language in SEA region would be an advantage
industries: Financial Services

description: The ideal candidate will be accountable for sales and profitability for all channels of both Sulwhasoo & HERA. He/She will lead and manage retail team and operations issues for offline counters and will also be responsible for negotiations with retailers/KAM.  Job Responsibilities  Sales & Management Accountable for and oversee total brand (2) sales (inclusive of offline/online and sell-in) to ensure achievements of KPIs Responsible to consolidate sales numbers across channels for reporting Manage manpower budget and P&L ensuring the best possible profitability by optimizing and controlling the expenses Work closely and build relationship with various internal stakeholders such as Digital Team, New growth Team, support divisions and external partners such as retailer and mall management etc Responsible for allocation of stocks by channel and overall stock inventory level Operations Recruit, manage and motivate the Retail team consisting of Retail Executive, Digital Executive, Beauty Consultants, Therapist, Makeup artists. Evaluate Retail Team’s performance and to identify candidates for career advancement when necessary. Maximize the team’s efficiency in the planning and utilization of all resources including staffing resources; Adherence to legal regulations and company’s policies and SOPs via routine supervision and thorough follow through to ensure that company assets are safeguarded at all times; Responsible for the SOP and guidelines at retail level, ensure Retail Team is always up to grooming and customer service standards Ensure store/counter is always maintained up to the required standards (e.g. housekeeping, VMD etc.), setting up of new stores/outlets as and when required, packing of stores/outlets whenever necessary during closure/renovation works etc. Work with relevant teams on issues pertaining to VMD, M & E, IT, for upgrades or rectification when necessary Oversee payroll, ensuring accuracy and propose commission/incentive scheme for Retail Team Work closely with Education Team to ensure performance level of Retail Team Involved in distribution strategy and negotiating on leases, counter locations Monitoring of sales performance and preparation/submission of sales reports Handle and resolving feedback from customers regarding operations issues, if any. Keep abreast of retail landscape and work closely with retailers to maximize brand sales potential via each departmental store Share competitor’s analysis and feedback with team to brainstorm on ideas for improvement of business Work closely with Marketing Team for effectiveness of Marketing Campaigns for sales results Ad-Hoc Plan CNY & Xmas Events, Incentive trips and Team Bonding Activity for Retail Team to Work closely with Marketing Team to ensure alignment, execution of all campaigns such as trade mechanics, events, etc. to achieve operating effectiveness and KPIs as a brand; Involved in trade/ consumer events when required Any other projects related to sales Job Requirements  Education And Experience Diploma in Business/Retail Management; Minimum 6 years of relevant experience, of which 3 years are in a similar capacity with multinational companies; Prior experience in a FMCG, retail, cosmetics/beauty industry preferred. Skill Sets Business Acumen/Commercial Awareness and numerically inclined; Analytical and problem-solving skill; Superior listening, counseling and people management ability; Abreast of retail landscape changes; Stay current on statutory and labor market changes and trends; Strong written and oral communication; Effective presentation skills; Knowledge on SAP preferred; Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel. Personal Attributes A confident self-starter with a high level of drive, energy, integrity and professionalism; Self-motivated, committed, determined, diligent and trustworthy nature; Results oriented, resourceful, resilient, meticulous, has initiative, and willing to be “hands-on” when required; Possess a strong sense of urgency, able to prioritize and meet deadlines, and able to work beyond contractual work hours when required; Able to work autonomously and be a dedicated team player in a fast paced and dynamic environment. Able to work on weekends when required Possess strong leadership qualities and excellent interpersonal skills

description: Are you up for an entrepreneurial challenge? As our first Business Development Rep in our Asia-Pacific team, you make a very serious impact on the growth of ChannelEnginge. Next to chasing leads, you’re also expected to think strategically about creating effective sales funnels. You'll work for the South-East Asia, Australia and New Zealand market.  In this role, you work closely together with our Partner Manager and Account Executive to grow the APAC market for our fast-growing Software as a Software (SaaS) company. We have a proven go-to-market strategy in Europe and a team of 100 ChannelEngineers in Europe, America, Asia, and the Middle East and we have the ambition to grow even more! Therefore we are looking for innovative sales talent that can help us drive our growth even further. Your focus will be on brands and retailers, you will engage and educate cold and warm leads to schedule qualified demos for the Account Executive. Set yourself up for a successful career by learning the necessary fundamentals from an experienced closing team to be a great salesperson, leader, and executive!  Your Challenges You are responsible for top-of-the-funnel customer acquisition by building a robust pipeline of qualified client leads, uncovering new businesses to go after and building relationships with prospective customers You identify potential prospects generated through targeted lists created by self-directed online research, email campaigns, and events Proactively address incoming inquiries and leads generated through online advertising and marketing campaigns You effectively pitch ChannelEngine to key decision makers, leveraging a consultative selling approach, via phone, online meetings and events You will become an expert on industry trends that are relevant to targeted vertical markets, staying up-to-date with technology and news You maintain a steady sales pipeline and report periodically to management  What does ChannelEngine have to offer you? Training: Individual coaching from experienced tech sales professionals A steep learning curve with sales skills development you will profit from the rest of your life! We will help you in recognizing buying signals, applying proven sales techniques, and discovering your own potential pitfalls and opportunities. An interesting industry: We offer the opportunity to start your career in the exciting, fast-growing world of online marketplaces We are a company with ambitious plans and a fast international growth rate. Flexible and entrepreneurial culture: As this is a new role; you'll make a lot of impact from the moment you start You can work flexible hours, according to your own schedule Great colleagues in the US, Europe, Asia and Australia who are very knowledgeable in the e-commerce field Work from our flex office in CBD, and work from home whenever you want Monthly lunch, (online) social activities Growth possibilities into a more international (sales) role  Who are you? You have a commercial growth mindset and want to perform better every day. You show some experience with telephone or online sales; e.g. during an internship, (student) job or via a student committee / board membership You can handle a few no’s before receiving a convincing yes. You are eager to learn and love receiving and giving feedback. You want to become a great salesperson, leader, and executive! Must: you show a proficient level of both English, both in spoken and written form If you have some marketplace experience, you can start on Monday!  Do you like change and innovation? Are you looking for high-energy and driven people to work with and achieve ambitious goals together while having fun? Are you ready to grow with us? Don’t hesitate to send in your application!
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Senior Sales Development Representative – One of the hottest Cybersecurity start-ups on the globe - $110,000 OTE – Singapore  Henderson Scott are currently recruiting for one of the hottest cybersecurity start-ups on the planet. This organisation has had an incredible amount of funding already and are already classified as a ‘cybersecurity unicorn’. They are still pre-IPO (and you would get shares in the business) – and as part of their universal scale-up, they are really investing in APAC  We are growing their Singapore sales function and looking for their second SDR across this region. This organisation are in one of the fastest-growing verticals of cyber-security, and they are complete market-leaders in it. They have limited competition in the APAC region, so there’s a strong chance that you can come in and absolutely smash your targets!  Key Information We are looking for this person to have experience working in Sales Development, having previously worked in a SDR or BDR position Experience working for SaaS, security, or software vendors Strong cold-calling experience Tenacious and enthusiastic sales attitude Experienced booking in meetings, liaising with Account Executives and customers Ability to manage sales pipelines  As you can tell, this is a long way from your average SDR position, this is with an absolute market-leader in one of the quickest growing areas of security. The stock you would receive from joining this vendor could be life-changing  For the initial conversation, apply today!
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: THE COMPANY Singapore E-Business Pte Ltd ("SGeBiz") is a Fintech company incorporated in 2014. We believe in empowering businesses globally in the digital economy through innovative solutions, helping businesses accelerate growth through integrated payments, financing and our suite of value-added solutions.  EzyProcure is our proprietary one-stop procure-to-pay business solution for the F&B industry. This cloud-based platform has helped to improve the productivity of both buyers and suppliers through the automation of procurement, payments and reconciliation processes. EzyProcure also uses data analytics to highlight key patterns in the procure-to-pay journey, enabling more timely and informed business decisions. EzyProcure has recently been adapted and applied in the procure-to-pay journey for the hospitality, retail and education industries.   EzyPayment is a B2B payment solution which helps optimise cash flows for buyers and facilitating cash collection for suppliers. EzyPayment provides buyers up to 60 days’ of interest free credit for payments to suppliers, while suppliers can receive payments within 2 to 5 days. In the coming months, we will roll out more innovative solutions in integrated payments and financing.   THE Enterprise & Partnership Growth (EPG) TEAM The Enterprise & Partnership Growth team (EPG) is responsible for all partner-led projects and sales-led growth. As we are growing a new product segment in the electronic collection and payments space, we are expecting a strong sales pipeline of high-value deals with governments and enterprise clients.  The EPG team identifies key clients whom we can either find product and company synergies together, or high-value clients who needs a more curated product using our core offerings. This team encompasses high energy members with high expectations in quality output for their clients. The EPG team members focuses on cross industries clients, and have end-to-end skill sets to gap identification, creation of value to clients, negotiation, building relationship and managing key stakeholders.  THE ROLE As we are launching the new e-collection/ e-payment solution, we are looking for a team member to join our EPG team as a Senior Partnership Associate in a full-time role with responsibilities as follows:  RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for achieving sales & business development objectives / targets Plan and execute key account strategy, marketing activities and demand generation campaigns Identify client’s strategic priorities and interests Identify, negotiate and acquire new, high-value deals Identify, acquire & manage accounts (end-to-end CRM) for enterprise and/or government sales Ensure that the commercial terms for deals are in line with business objectives and strategy Manage existing key clients to sell, upsell, expand their sales volumes and maintain positive long-term relationships Develop innovative new methods of cooperation and sales acquisition Handle account management matters and be the point of contact for customers Work with cross functional teams to coordinate pre-sales, post-sales and support resources to drive successful closure and implementation for customers Coordinate and support communication plans for enhanced visibility and influence with targeted audiences. Attend industry functions, such as association events and conferences, and provide feedback and information on market and creative trends.  EXPECTED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: Degree in Business Administration/Financial Management/Economics or similar degree to understand complex and multi -level business lending dynamics 4-6 years of working experience in management consulting, management associate program, business development, enterprise sales, strategic partnership management or B2B sales, or Experience and proven track record successfully corporate business management with P&L responsibility/ entrepreneurial experiences Experience working with senior stakeholders to find win-win solutions. Proven track record of successful partnership management Demonstrate the ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization. Excellent interpersonal skills and entrepreneur mindset Strong business acumen and analytical skills – Complex problem solving skills Relevant industry experience in corporate banking, insurance, FinTech or Enterprise sales will complement the roles and responsibilities of the job Understanding of payments products and industry will be a plus

jobTitle: Account Executive, Mid Market Sales - Slack
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What We're Looking For...  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  We are looking for Account Executives to join our Sales team and focus on our Mid Market customers in Singapore. This segment represents a huge opportunity for Slack and we want someone who is eager to do the best work of their lives while supporting others in doing the same.  You will be responsible for driving the sales process with prospective customers as well as the expansion of existing accounts. You will work closely with our customers to understand their business objectives and act as their trusted guide for using Slack most effectively. You’ll also work with cross-functional teams to help align our product roadmap and marketing materials with customer feedback. If you enjoy working with customers from a variety of industries in a rapidly changing environment, then come and join us!  Some of the things you’ll be doing include …  Educate customers on the value of Slack in a thoughtful way Provide recommendations based on a customer’s business needs and usage patterns Manage multiple customers simultaneously at various stages of the Slack buying cycle Handle inbound customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Drive revenue through proactive outreach to existing customers Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product  Who You Are ...  You have 3+ years relevant work experience in an account management or sales role, preferably in SaaS You are a self-motivated teammate that can act independently You take an active interest in opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen customer relationships You have a consistent track record of identifying customer needs and successfully implementing solutions You have a proven track record of managing large scale accounts for the duration of the sales cycle and beyond You are flexible, adaptive, and resilient You have excellent written and verbal communication skills  About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Job Summary  This role exists to assist and support sales and trade marketing function and associated business matters in Thailand, Philippines and Vietnam. The key result indicators for this role are completion of tasks on time with high quality.  Job Responsibilities · Base in Singapore, develop Route-to-Market Strategy, appoint distributors and wholesalers in southeast Asia, focusing on Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Philippines. · Develop and execute business and marketing strategies, identify growth opportunities, and implement profitability objectives to ensure sustainable sales growth, accountable for P&L. · Build and lead a team in the responsible market to meet the objectives of growth development aligned with the organization's vision, missions, and values. · Seek out opportunities for expansion and growth by developing new business relationships with customers, government, trade associations etc. · Aware of significant market trends and perform complex analysis of possible business opportunities · Ensure sustainability, profitability to meet the business objectives · Responsible and accountable for the day-to-day operations and development of the business activities with internal stakeholders and external customers including forecast, marketing coordination, sales planning · Product quality issue handling and customer complaint management. · May require to work during weekends for event execution  Behavioural competences · You have the personality to succeed in this role - friendly, energetic, creative, flexible, humble, discipline, hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy. Attitude and work ethic will be really important in this role.  · You believe in the company mission and our role in advancing those goals - building a company committed to sustainability, superior nutritional health, and trust. This is important to you and you have been dreaming of finding a company that aligns this closely with your personal values! · You love building relationships and making connections around something you are passionate about. You are a make-it-happen person who is excited to roll up your sleeves and dive in. · You thrive in a job that doesn't include a traditional workplace structure. You are a self-starter who doesn't need direct supervision to motivate you for success. · You are ready to make your mark in a smaller, growing brand leveraging your experience to deliver amazing results and build an outstanding company. · You are comfortable with ambiguity and are energized by the process of building something lasting from the ground up.   Experience · Minimum 10 years of relevant senior management expertise in the F&B, sales & marketing role · Excel in distributor management & key account management · Knowledge in marketing will be a plus · Proficiency in using Microsoft Excel, Word and Powerpoint · Tertiary education, preferably Bachelor degree in any field · Self-motivated and good team player with excellent communication and presentation skill · Fluent in both spoken and written English, Chinese and Mandarin is a plus  What's on Offer · Excellent opportunity to work for one of the fastest growing and most promoting categories in food & beverage. · Attractive career progression and competitive salary. description: The database market is massive (the IDC estimates it to be $89B+ by 2024!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. The MongoDB community is transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.  MongoDB is the top tier modern, general-purpose database platform, crafted to ignite the power of software and data for developers and the applications they build. Developers around the world are using MongoDB to build software to create new businesses, modernize existing businesses, and transform the lives of millions of people around the world.  Headquartered in New York, with offices across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific, MongoDB has more than 17,000 customers, which include some of the largest and most sophisticated businesses in nearly every vertical industry, in over 100 countries.  We're looking for hardworking Corporate Account Executives who will be responsible for prospecting within an assigned territory to uncover new opportunities. The CAE will identify, nurture, and close opportunities with both new and existing customers, run forecasts, and supervise customer data.  The CAE will be responsible for quarterly and annual sales targets in the designated region. They will work in concert with the Enterprise Account Execs, designated partners/resellers within the region to improve the velocity of business and to build solutions that serve the best interests of our customers at MongoDB.  Responsibilities Develop new business by driving sales in their existing accounts as well as new Accounts Developing and executing account plans to achieve targets: Cold calling, prospecting, qualification, account mapping, and presentations Effectively utilize sales tools for pipeline development, tracking opportunity progress (Forecasting), developing monthly, quarterly level forecasts Responsible for all aspects of the selling process - Identity, Qualify, Sell, Close, and Coordinate for all volume business in a designated territory Generate leads by using networking and other sales tools Qualify, Sell and Close Identify key steps to close the sale, identify the decision-maker and influencers, etc Resolve Availability needs and Objectives Gain agreement of proposed solution / Services, tying back to customer business drivers Close significant sales across multiple Accounts across assigned territory Accurate Forecasting of business, previous experience with Salesforce.com ideal Requirements 6+ years of sales experience in selling software/technology solutions Native-level proficiency in Chinese, Thai, Bahasa, or Vietnamese Ability present & excellent listening skills Daring selling approach | consultative selling A strong network of relationships with key decision-makers in small/medium & large-sized companies in the respective territory Demonstrate current / running customer contacts and be able to generate revenue within the first 45 days Experience with Lead generation and sales closure Strong exposure to handling the assigned Market Track record of maintaining relationships with accounts Experience working with Channels & Ecosystem of ASEAN Perseverant with the ability to meet deadlines and targets Bachelors degree or equivalent from a reputed institute with a good academic record Do you know why MongoDB is a phenomenal place to work and build your career? Disrupting a $89B+ billion market Top NoSQL database in the world The largest Ecosystem and the fastest growing database in the world Close to 22,600+ customers in over 100 countries and over 130MM+ million downloads >120% net ARR expansion rate over each of the last twenty quarters Sequoia Capital and a number of other Top VC firms have invested in MongoDB. Sequoia Capital calls us out as one of their flagship portfolios; Sequoia has also invested in Apple, Google, YouTube, and WhatsApp 9-figure revenue company, with very high double-digit growth rates Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused Work with talented people around the globe Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing an encouraging and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!  MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.  This role is remotely optional until November 1, 2021, we are looking to speak to candidates who plan to be available in Singapore for when we introduce our hybrid model.  *MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer*

description: What You Do At AMD Changes Everything  At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.  Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.  Manager, Commercial Sales  The Role  The BDE Manager will own end-user relationships to drive sales of the entire AMD portfolio. The BDE will work in tight collaboration with the End Customers, VARs, SIs and distribution to help drive OEM sales in Singapore/ASEAN countries. The successful candidate will be responsible for executing the AMD sales strategy - including partnerships and market approach to drive large enterprise, corporate, and SMB sales of AMD platforms across PC client, server, cloud, workstation/graphics, and thin client.  AMD's environment is fast paced, results oriented and built upon a legion of forward-thinking people with a passion for winning technology!  The Person  The BDE should demonstrate the following characteristics: An intense drive to “win,” combined with sound business perspective High level of confidence, maturity, and integrity Open communication style and presence to work effectively at multiple levels, from salespeople to senior management Honest and trustworthy in dealings with internal/external customers, colleagues and stakeholders Ability to listen to the customer and articulate the customer’s needs internally Key Responsibilities Deliver on AMDs revenue, unit and market share goals Manage a detailed forecast & multiple quarter pipeline (SFDC) Implement go-to-market and sales-out strategies that grow revenue base and market share Be the face of AMD to all key customers in the assigned regions Build/Execute, in partnership with AMD Marketing, GTM strategy across multiple distributors and partners in Singapore/ASEAN markets Identify customer challenges and insert a compelling AMD value proposition to address challenges Ideally have existing relationships with key SIs, VAR & resellers. Previous experience selling into Enterprise and Government highly desirable. Strong historical interaction and relationship with Partner Sales team of key OEM’s (For example HPi, HPE, Dell, Lenovo, LG, Acer, Asus and others) Build confidence and awareness around AMD offerings within the sales teams at key OEMs and resellers Business relationship with ecosystem partners such as Microsoft and others. Preferred Experience  The BDE will ideally have the following attributes: Proven success in a comparable role, developing strong customer relationships which have led to sales success An established background in technology sales with at least 5 years’ progressive experience Ideally also have previous experience working with OEMs such as HPI, HPE, Lenovo, Dell and others Ability to learn, understand, and work with new and emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT technology space Experience in SaaS, IaaS and PaaS sales and/or consulting is a plus Demonstrated effectiveness working in a cross-matrix organization Thrives in an autonomous environment Academic Credentials Undergraduate degree as a minimum Location:  Singapore/ASEAN countries  AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and will consider all applicants without regard to race, marital status, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. description: Black Box® is a trusted IT solutions provider delivering cutting-edge technology products and world-class consulting services to businesses across the globe in every industry. The breadth of our global reach and depth of our expertise accelerate customer success by bringing people, ideas, and technology together to solve real-world business problems.  We deliver technology solutions for our customers by harnessing technology innovation to digitally transform and accelerate their business in the areas of connected buildings (incl. IoT), digital workplace & customer experience, data centers, networking (incl. Wi-Fi, SD-WAN), in-building 5G/ONGO and cyber security.  With more than 80 years of technology excellence and thousands of team members globally, managing over 175,000 customers across 150 countries, we are uniquely positioned to build a global IT services brand that can deliver maximum value, world-class integrated solutions, deliver results, cultivate strategic relationships, and enable lasting relevance for our customers across six continents.  Position Summary: The Regional Business Development Manager is focused on the development of customer relationships sales opportunities within new and dormant accounts to Black Box. Strategically-minded, the BDM will establish and build a trusting relationship with potential prospects, and develop and close sales opportunities within new accounts (high touch sales).  As this position is focused on the pursuit and acquisition of ‘new logos’, the BDM will cultivate the teams that will support the account beyond the initial opportunity wins, which will enable the BDM to pursue other new prospects for Black Box.  Job Responsibilities: Identify prospects, and establish relationships with new customers and dormant accounts. Specifically, the BDM will target larger organizations, with a primary focus on Fortune 1000 prospects. Seek opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell to the client by introducing additional solutions that will enable the customer’s success. Develop strategic pursuit plans. Engages with other internal sales professionals (direct and overlay), solutions experts, engineering when appropriate to actively drive pursuit opportunities. Main focus SG & ASEAN region.  Skills, Knowledge, Abilities: Able to cultivate relationships with large enterprises, including Fortune 1000 targets that do little or no business with Black Box at the present time. Able to understand the customer’s business, and provide strategic insights to help the customer’s business will positioning Black Box solutions as a way to enable the customer’s business success. Encompasses strategic pursuit management skills from opportunity start to finish. Able to use Black Box CRM to own benefits in the business prospecting and sales processes. Able to work independently, as well as part of a team environment. Must be a self-starter, entrepreneurial and able to work effectively with minimal direct supervision. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in standard business software programs, such as Microsoft Office.  Qualifications: Undergraduate Business degree is required. MBA preferred. Must have more 10+ years of sales experience in developing new accounts within the technology/business IT services sector, preferable with leading system integrator (SI). Extensive, existing and relevant network of customers, OEMs, Distributors, SIs, Vendors and Supplier relationships. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with one of the OEMs; Cisco, Aruba, Silver Peak. Minimum one or two valid Sales certifications in above OEMs is a pre. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with Professional and Managed Services solutions. Ability to travel 25% of the time.  Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

description: DataSpark is an innovative startup in the exciting space of Big Data and Analytics. As a newly formed organization, DataSpark has big ambitions to become a major regional player in the analytics software and consulting space. As part of our highly energetic, youthful and dynamic team, we are looking for a highly motivated, highly disciplined individual to drive and build the DataSpark business in the coming years as the enterprise & channels sales leader.  As a young organization, DataSpark is seeking to build an ecosystem of consulting and technology solution partners that will help promote and deliver cutting edge insights and solutions based on DataSpark offerings. Your primary objective is to engage C-suite buyers in new and innovative conversations around analytics and insights, create new initiatives, lead DataSpark presales & consulting team to progress opportunities till closure. In the process, you will also be required to identify, recruit and develop a set of partners by helping them driving new business based on DataSpark’s analytics offerings.  Resposibilities Engage C-suite and senior line of business buyers either directly or via business partners to evangelize the value of telco based insights & Dataspark’s offerings. Work with clients & partners to identify & create new funded projects. Lead the DataSpark pursuit team to articulate & demonstrate our value propositions through the engagement process. Understand & execute DataSpark’s channel strategy by identifying the recruiting suitable partners to support our growth strategy Develop business partners capabilities around DataSpark offerings and lead these partners in client engagements to build their selling competencies. Drive prospecting activity through channel routes to market so as to identify new clients & opportunities Providing sales leadership to support partners to qualify, create value for clients & progress sales opportunities to closure Work with other sellers, business partners, and units of within Singtel/NCS group to create an effective solution for the client Maintaining a thorough understanding of the client’s industry, including industry trends, industry business processes, industry financial measurements and performance indicators. Specific industries of focus will be Governments, Advertising, Retail/Property, Tourism & Events management, Responsible for monitoring & guiding the delivery of projects to ensure client satisfaction Meet & exceed quarterly and annual sales targets for contract signings & booked revenue. Requirements Bachelors/Masters or related degree business or engineering degree At least 3-4 years proven sales/channel sales record in software solutions market. At least 2 years of experience in building and managing a partner ecosystem Have extensive professional contacts with consulting firms, solution providers or Government agencies. Ability to excite identified partners and align their business to DataSpark’s strategy Proven channel business planning & management. As a Solution and Consultative seller you would have outstanding ability to understand business problems, create value propositions and articulate a corresponding solution. Ability to build and execute a GTM/ territory plan Has experience managing various levels of partners and external clients Strong EQ, collaborative and networking skills Self-motivated, resilient, ability to problem solve and work with ambiguity Strong reputation & trusted by clients and partners in the industryKnowledge of the analytics software industry & ecosystem

description: Job Description:  Babel Finance is expanding its international Business Development business to help achieve aggressive business growth goals in onboarding clients to our Enterprise-grade custody and execution services offerings. As a member of Singapore Business Development team, your primary objective will be increasing asset under management (AUM) and revenue. You will collaborate with product manager, sales support, and other Babel Finance teams to support our clients’ activities and the growth of our business.  The Purpose of Your Role  As part of our International Business Development team, you will interface with internal & external stakeholders to identify, develop, and execute strategies that create deep and lasting partnerships with high-net-worth (HNW) individuals and institutional clients. As we continue to explore opportunities in crypto assets, you must be able to represent the voice of the client while continuing to achieve our business goals.  The Expertise We’re Looking For    3-5 years’ experiences in forex trading or sales role in a bank, trading funds, broker-dealer, or other financial institutions. Good knowledge on fx trading or market making is a big plus. Understanding of one or more of the following marketplaces: cryptocurrencies, blockchain. Experienced in sales, business development and/or relationship management, with strong hunting drive Ability to conduct market research independently and present deal opportunities. Exceptionally strong interpersonal skills in managing internal and external relationships in a proactive, energetic, and customer-oriented way. Experience with the sales toolkit, including experience with CRM systems and development of pitchbooks and sales materials. Develop presentations and sales materials for audiences with varying levels of seniority and understanding of finance, cryptocurrencies. Represent the voice of the market and the client with internal stakeholders in product, marketing, legal, risk, compliance, relationship management, implementation, operations, and client service. Identify opportunities for internal process improvement within the Business Development team, present such opportunities and drive change Monitor, evaluate and improve your sales toolkit on market trends and signals, including competitor business models, industry news and regulatory developments. Contribute to a corporate climate that values and rewards contributions, drive, initiative, and achievement of results. By offering an easy, smooth, and secure experience, we're building a solid crypto financial infrastructure for the world. Learn more at https://www.babel.finance

Excellent selling skills with a “hunter” mentality. Have an entrepreneurial approach with a strong focus on innovation and is passionate towards customer advocacy. Possesses strong account management and relationship building skills. Excellent problem-solving and negotiation skills. Able to think strategically - seeing the bigger picture and setting aims and objectives in order to develop and improve the business. Has a proactive approach, take initiative and the confidence to start things from scratch. Is a team player and have outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

description: Egencia is changing the way corporations manage their travel programs and is seeking a professional sales specialist to drive our leadership in corporate travel. The Global Sales Manager will be selling into global Singapore based companies with footprints across all regions; North America (NA) Asia Pacific (APAC), Latin America and European markets. The objective of this position is to develop multi-dimensional relationships with global customers and provide customized solutions for their worldwide travel needs.  This position requires a customer centric approach with tried skills in pipeline management, platform selling, negotiation; understand complex systems and processes. With effective communication and a strong knowledge of market trends, will assist to understand the impact on business needs and travel solutions. This position will be representing the Egencia brand through verbal, written and formal presentations to potential customers at all levels. The individual must be a great teammate, biased to action, self-motivated, highly organized, high energy, integrity, humility and can function effectively in an un-structured environment.  Egencia makes business travel better. Combining technology and service, we build a seamless experience, where companies have access to a user-friendly interface, extensive travel options, and 24/7 global support. Join our mission and help us take the next steps in transforming the world of business travel.  What You’ll Do The ability to understand product capabilities and communicate the value and differentiation of a service offering in the market. Grow Egencia portfolio and revenue with new customers headquartered in Singapore by playing an active role in value proposition selling and contract negotiation Once requirements are clearly identified, promote competitive advantages and Egencia’s outstanding value proposition through proposal, RFI/RFPs and presentations Connect with prospects (from discovery meeting to closing) and build a high-level relationship with executives (CFOs, CEOs) Responsible for contract closing and implementation of customers with the implementation team Selling the right solution, to ensure that the customer transitions from implementation to trade Sign profitable business to meet quarterly goals, in line with Egencia’s pricing schedules Work collaboratively and establish relationships with internal teams Who You Are  You’ll be great for this role if you have the following: Excellent communication skills, including written and oral Strong listening skills with to interpret the customers’ needs Validated sales experience in pipeline management including negotiation skills Ability to effectively address key decisions makers in a very competitive and innovating environment Minimum 4 years Sales experience with a consistent track record in hitting quarterly sales targets Organized and structured High level of dynamism, drive, and energy - great teammate Strong commitment to both a high quality of work and service to customers in a fast-paced environment Proficient level of experience with MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word Graduate level education is desired Position requires some travel, sometimes to international locations A good knowledge of the corporate travel industry and/or platform selling (desired but not essential) About Expedia Group  Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, Egencia®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.

Job Description  The successful candidate will be part of the Sales & Marketing Division, Global & Corporate Sales Department. Maintaining effective working relationships with procurement personnel or decision makers at corporate accounts and their fulfilment agencies (ie TMCs). Liaising with stations on fare matters and finding resolution for any operational issues that arise for SIA corporate accounts. Conducting performance reviews with corporate accounts. Preparing and reviewing contract documentation to ensure that SIA's commercial interests are protected. Providing advice to corporate sales teams at stations on trends in travel procurement and how to address them in sales processes / fare structures etc. Sharing best practices / success stories across the network. Support sales recovery efforts. Required Skills Possess a good university degree in a related field and have good business acumen. Manage projects and communicate with various stakeholders. Respond quickly and effectively to the changing environment and difficult situations. Anticipate and respond to (internal/external) customers' needs and driven to deliver high-quality results.

description: The Qualtrics XM PlatformTM is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can't imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  Global Strategic Sales Mission Of The Team  Qualtrics Experience Management PlatformTM is used by the world's most iconic brands to optimise their employee (EX), customer (CX), brand (BX) and product experiences (PX).  Our mission is to drive the holistic adoption and standardisation of the Experience Management (XM) platform across the largest and most strategic brands in the world. We are laser focused on standardising the next set of major flagship brands on XM. We take a full portfolio view and work across the different product pillars CX, EX, BX and PX.  Job Description  You will be a key member of a focused global team which reports directly into the Chief Revenue Officer and represents the highest level of strategic sales. We operate against a list of our most strategic accounts that represent the future XM flagship customers and work tightly with regional Enterprise Sales Leaders and local AEs. You will drive the full portfolio of XM and standardisation for the firm, develop multi-year account plans and pursue the deployment of our entire product portfolio, not just single product sales. You will be deep in sales execution and sales strategy which includes: developing relationships, negotiating global framework agreements, connecting stakeholders to flagship XM firms, engaging with partners in the right place and right time, and championing C-Level events. You will orchestrate the full-suite of Qualtrics supporting resources for the right plays at the right time, across Marketing/ABM, Solution Strategy, XM Scientists, Program Architects, PSPs, Tech Sales, pricing strategy, SAP and direct line sales management.  Success is creating some of the largest customers of Qualtrics and driving mobilisation across the full XM portfolio -- all XM applications and use cases.  Expectations For Success Achieve and exceed ‘new bookings' revenue targets across a named account list of Qualtrics' most strategic customers and the full XM portfolio Lead, inspire and create vision for customers and those around you. In other words, be a beacon and shape and demonstrate the art of the possible Develop multi-year success plans and orchestrate ecosystem to win as many XM use cases as possible and develop a sustainable customer relationship Build champions and rally executives around XM and associated business value Create and leverage best practices for selling enterprise-wide executive adoption of XM Navigate and overcome obstacles and challenges in the way of winning. Effectively navigate Qualtrics as a nuanced, fast-growing organisation Build strong relationships with local sales reps, leaders, customers, and other internal orgs supporting your success In sum, this role is focused on creating Qualtrics's next set of flagship full XM portfolio customers and ELA's  Qualifications & Requirements 10-15 years of extensive and relevant market experience, selling into front-office as well as back-office functions Demonstrated track record of meeting and exceeding quotas and developing global accounts with decentralised, regional budgets, where aligning both the customer as well as internal teams is a key success criteria Motivator and leader with a passion for the Qualtrics mission and for developing new approaches to nuanced challenges - easily move others to action by planning, inspiring, and organising Proven ability to execute and implement change - a scrappy self-starter. Ideally, experience in the space of Customer Experience, Employee Experience and/or related product suites (e.g. Experience Cloud, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, HCM, VoC, BI) Experience interacting with clients in pre-sales capacity, industry capacity and/or consultant (internal or external consultant) Deep understanding of Qualtrics product portfolio and the competitive landscape Has a good balance of risk taking and judgment Is confident and able to operate independently of a large staff Commands the respect of teams that they work alongside Exceptional presentation skills Willingness and ability to travel between 25-60% Preview YouTube video What is Qualtrics? | The world's first Experience Management Platform  What is Qualtrics? | The world's first Experience Management Platform  Preview YouTube video Work at Qualtrics!  Work at Qualtrics!

description: About the Role  At ClassPass we believe partnering with companies who share our values can help thousands of more people live active lives. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly-motivated individual to help grow our burgeoning corporate sales channel.  The right candidate isn’t afraid of striking up a conversation with someone they just met. They think outside the box, by iterating on a pitch deck, crafting a convincing email proposal or influencing stakeholders to close a deal. This role is ideal for someone who’s a few years into their sales career and is looking to get more experience in relationship-based selling and prospecting.    Key Responsibilities  Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls, emails and SDR set up meetings Research, prospect and engage new medium to large corporate partners in ClassPass markets Manage your own opportunities by utilising CRM, email and outreach tools and resources to cultivate and maintain sales pipeline Drive through the full sales cycle by making/sending introductory calls and emails, assessing and building the relationship, performing sales presentations and closing the deal Develop creative, fun, and innovative ways in which you connect and build out your relationships with potential clients and share across the team Attend various industry events and conferences including organising and hosting stands Share good knowledge of the HR/Benefit world and how ClassPass fits in Manage sales pipeline and project management of signed accounts Collaborate with the Corporate Account Management team to ensure the smooth onboarding of a corporate partner  Achieve, and consistently exceed monthly sales goals Maintaining daily KPIs and metrics Contribute to company wide projects   Skills & Experience  Proven experience within sales, preferably selling to HR teams A strong problem solver with the hustle and drive to hit, or even better, exceed goals A strong negotiator with a passion for results Strong relationship builder; comfortable and confident with a wide range of decision makers (internal and external) and happy to collaborate with other teams Willingness to make multiple sales calls and email contacts per day Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to multitask, prioritise, and manage time effectively Right to work in Singapore  Who we are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world’s best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world’s leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we’re just getting started.  What we believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we’re all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass’ success is its people. ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.
