jobTitle: Senior Business Development Manager, ASEAN Market
description: Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree required 6+ years of sales and partner management experience at a high-growth technology company, with a track record of achieving and exceeding sales goals Experience in cross-selling a complex suite of products and services to different stakeholders at all levels of target organizations Excellent analytical skills including the ability to forecast deal value and model unit economics Ability to craft and deliver compelling and data driven presentations Capacity to meet multiple objectives in an entrepreneurial and fast paced environment with minimal guidance Comfortable working with a globally distributed team Preferred Qualifications Experience in airline sales & distribution (Travel tech, OTA, TMC, GDS, airline, etc) Experience in travel industries in ASEAN countries such as Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia and Philippines About The Job  We’re looking for an experienced business development manager to join our growth team to trailblaze the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) region in support of Hopper’s Asia-Pacific (APAC) market expansion.  Despite the challenges of the pandemic, Hopper managed to have triple digit year-over-year revenue growth in 2020. In fact, Hopper is recovering faster than the sector at large and that is driven in large part by the performance of our unique fintech products which offer travelers an unparalleled level of flexibility and control. In 2021, Hopper will enter APAC, the world’s largest regional travel market to extend the success achieved in the North American Market (NAM) and benefit a larger user group.  At Hopper you can have an immediate impact in a high-growth environment. On behalf of Hopper in the ASEAN market, you will be leading the business development with players in the air sector such as airlines, OTAs and consolidators to acquire the best local content. Air business is a niche field, so prior experience in travel (travel tech, OTA, TMC, GDS, airline, etc) is preferred. The strongest candidates will be able to intuitively communicate Hopper’s unique value proposition and frame our benefits to partners.  Responsibilities Identify opportunities with prospective air content partners (airlines, aggregators, travel agencies etc.) in ASEAN countries (SG prioritized) and own the partner acquisition cycle from first contact to close Manage the full scope of partnership for a group of currently contracted airlines, including contract negotiation and renewals, marketing funds, service funds, ticketing operations and agency support Cross-sell an expanding suite of products and services into different airline business teams (Distribution, Sales, Revenue Management and Marketing) Leverage data analysis to understand partner performance, forecast deal value and model unit economics Work closely with the product team to ensure airline display requirements are met in the app and negotiated API integrations are on track Work closely with the data science team to analyze and communicate partner performance Identify and represent Hopper in relevant trade shows and conferences Benefits Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options Unlimited PTO WeWork All Access Pass OR Work-from-home stipend Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business Open communication with management and company leadership Small, dynamic teams = massive impact Despite the pandemic’s impact on the travel industry, Hopper has emerged stronger than ever. As the travel industry continues to rebound, Hopper has seen its valuation more than double since early 2020, reflecting the strength of our mobile-only marketplace and the value customers are deriving from our proprietary suite of fintech offerings.  Here are just a few stats that demonstrate our recent growth: Hopper’s valuation is now over $3.5B, reflecting the strength of its mobile-only marketplace and value customers are deriving from the company’s proprietary suite of fintech offerings. Based on its current run rate, Hopper is pacing towards 330% revenue growth compared to last year, and it has already surpassed its pre-pandemic revenue peak from Q1 2020 by over 100%. Hopper has over 60 million downloads, consistently ranks as one of the most downloaded travel apps, and now has a larger air travel market share in North America than it did before the pandemic (source: MIDT). The company is on track to surpass $1.5 billion in travel sales this year, with 40% coming from the hotel and car rental categories. Hopper’s fintech offerings, such as Price Freeze and Rebooking Guarantee, now represent 50% of its revenue. Given the success of its travel fintech, Hopper recently launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud , where any travel provider can unlock a totally unique revenue stream by seamlessly integrating and offering Hopper’s travel fintech. The industry opportunity for Hopper Cloud is enormous as projections estimate that if all travel distribution channels offered travel fintech, it could increase the total consumer spend for the sector by $200 billion annually.  All this recent growth is just the beginning. There are still so many new opportunities we’re excited to tackle in the next year!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: 200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.  Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years.   About the role  As a Regional Account Manager, you will ensure the delivery of expected outcomes along with providing high quality services to our customers. It will be your responsibility to come up with strategies to develop and/or maintain Bollore’s position with existing and prospective accounts. You will also be required to work cross-functionally to participate in tender opportunities, draft legal contracts, as well as generate performance reports.  As our team is currently expanding in various verticals, prior experience in F&F, FMCG, Automotive, Chemical or Pharmaceutical/ Healthcare verticals would be advantageous.   What you will be doing  Extend Bollore’s reach within existing network Identify key account targets in ASPAC Send sales leads to network in order to increase Bollore Logistics’ presence in ASPAC Establish a referencing strategy for regional or international accounts Develop relationships with prospective key accounts to promote Bollore Logistics and obtain the opportunity to participate in future tenders Implement new business strategies to gather sales leads and expand customer base  Service support Determine a tariff policy in conjunction with Middle Office and Regional Sales Management Participate in negotiations with suppliers Monitor customer account profitability and problems linked to receipts with site managers Transfer obtained contracts to Operations team in order to provide high quality service to customers Support services or operation sites through advising on relevant SOPs  Synthesis of information Consolidate statistical elements from various operations for reporting purposes Report sales actions undertaken to further develop key customer accounts Update CRM with weekly activities and monthly reports for key accounts   The ideal candidate  Essential: Bachelor’s degree and above At least 10 years’ experience in a fast paced and dynamic MNC environment Prior experience in the logistics/warehousing industry Prior experience in key account management (preferably in ASPAC region)  Desirable: Prior experience in F&F, FMCG, Automotive, Chemical or Pharmaceutical/ Healthcare verticals Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office suite Good sales and analytical skills Customer-centric mindset Self-starter Strong interpersonal skills Highly adaptable  Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.

description: Areas Of Responsibilities  Develop and implement the 3-year (cross-functional) business plan which details the game plan of how to unlock the brand and business potential across the SEA West region. On a daily basis provide hands on guidance and support to the existing distributor(s)/retailer(s) to ensure that the brand standards as well as the local consumer and product needs are fully met. Continuously evaluate the marketplace and the existing distributor(s) against the criteria checklist. Proactively propose and execute changes where necessary. Develop and implement monthly sales forecast, monthly sell-out reports and annual budgets according to set timelines. Formulate sales tools and programs in line with CYBEX corporate strategy. Provide weekly business summary and monthly market and competitor intelligence reports to line manager. Work closely with the cross functional teams in Bayreuth to ensure necessary tools and support are granted to exceed set annual objectives.   Required Education / Qualification  University degree in Business Administration or similar (preferably MBA degree) coupled with profound work experience preferably in the Fashion & Lifestyle or Juvenile industries Proven track record of business operation in South West Asia, experience in product importation and certification Proven track record of successfully managing and developing 3-parties (i.e. distributors, retailers) Solid strategic mindset and analytical skills with excellent communication and negotiation skills In-depth cultural and business knowledge of the South West Asian markets, including but not limited to key distribution channels and retailers. Exposure to secondary channels (i.e. hypermarket and supermarket) can be a plus. Fluency in English (Asian language is a plus) Willingness to travel extensively (both domestically and internationally)

description: CELLINK is the world’s leading bioconvergence company. As a global supplier of innovative life-science solutions, we strive to find synergies between the most recent findings in biology and the latest breakthroughs in mechanical and digital technologies. The best-in-class products we develop are also backed by our renowned support team of highly skilled application and technical specialists. We are committed to the highest quality because we know that our 3D bioprinters, bioinks, single-cell dispensers, imaging systems and liquid handlers are being used to solve today’s most pressing challenges in tissue engineering, cell biology, microscopy, drug development and healthcare.  Our three core values are passion, inspiration and persistence. We are passionate about what we do. We are inspired by, and work to inspire, today’s greatest scientific minds. We are persistent about going the extra mile to deliver the very best.  We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. As an equal opportunity employer, we do more than accept difference. We celebrate diversity, we support employees from a wide range of backgrounds, and we benefit from the added creativity and richness that these differences bring to our offices and community. We pride ourselves on being a collaborative environment where everyone’s talents and opinions contribute to the greater good and are always recognized.  We are looking for a Sales Manager SEA & Oceania for the Singapore office:  Responsibilities  You will be the face and spirit of CELLINK in the field You will be responsible for selling the Bioprinting products within the region Build the CELLINK brand through customer communication, organize workshops, and do live demonstrations for potential and new users Specify targeted accounts, identify business opportunities, close new business deals Develop and foster new relationships with local and international businesses and institutions Work with marketing to drive initiatives, enhance campaigns and build material for the SEA and Oceania market Arrange client meetings, identify opportunities, and generate leads with accounts in your territory. You will have individual responsibility for new business, and are expected to be autonomous; however, you will be part of a growing team of people focused on the European market. You will work in close collaboration with the management and internal teams for larger opportunities Partner with the application’s team in response to tenders and requests for information in a timely manner Work with our inside sales team to create campaigns targeting lead generating functions Confident negotiator and ability to ‘close the deal’ at all levels with the customer Travel requirements: up to 60%  Qualifications  Minimal 4-5 years of sales experience in laboratory/capital equipment or laboratory supplies fields Business experience in SEA and Oceania regions would be a plus Effective leader with an entrepreneurial mindset Minimum of Bachelor of Science degree preferably a background in Biomedical Engineering or similar Outside the box thinking, creative Proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite

description: Your Team  You will be part of a commercial team managing client relationships and new business developments activities globally.  Your Mission  You will be responsible to manage and further develop the business in APAC of one of our largest and key strategic customers, a leading global financial institution having outsourced key business processes and IT operations to Avaloq.  Your role will be to manage and coordinate all commercial and contractual aspects between Avaloq and the customer. This includes mastering the upselling process for products and services, ensuring compliance with the various contracts, overseeing financials, acting as an escalation point for all matters relating to the delivered services and ensuring highest client satisfaction.  Other responsibilities include:  Build and maintain effective long-term relationships with key stakeholders of this highly complex account to ensure a high level of satisfaction, profitable account and increasing revenues by upselling activities Build up in-depth knowledge of the customer’s business, build up and maintain a network within the customer on various levels (IT, Business, team-leader, management leads, upper Management). Identify the major decision-makers and maintain relationship Coordinate inside Avaloq the different functions serving the customer like service management, banking operations, project delivery, product sales, application management services or IT infrastructure to ensure an aligned approach to customer topics/issues/requests and address inefficiencies or failures in service delivery in tight collaboration with service management Ensure consistent communication to each of the client stakeholders as first point of contact and serve as escalation point and primary interface for all products and services Manage commercial discussions, handle contract negotiations and billing/ invoicing control Ensure projects follow-up with the client Increase actively the share of wallet by promoting Avaloq products and services (offers preparation) and identifying opportunities, promoting and proposing new products or services to the existing clients Ensure opportunity management and customer account plans are updated regularly in Avaloq’s CRM  Qualifications  What you need  At least 5-6 years of relevant sales experience in financial institutions Have been a client partner or customer success role in a services or consulting business Prior experience in managing and selling banking software packages Bachelor's/Masters’ from a recognized institute, preferably specializing in Business / Banking / Computer Science related disciplines Strong in creating trustworthy long-term relationships with demanding stakeholders in situations of conflicting interests Savvy in networking Exceptional problem-solving skills Experience in several banking domains Ability to maximize customer value and embrace intrapreneurship Strong in communication, presentation and conflict management skills Capable in generating trust and manage resources effectively Process competence and adherence Prior work experience in South East Asia markets  You will get extra points for the following  Knowledge and experience in the wealth management industry Experience in selling large IT and business outsourcing / operations engagements  Additional Information  Now let's talk about perks and compensation  We offer high flexibility in regards to working models (e.g. part time and home office models are possible depending on business requirements). Our base salaries are competitive and if you prove to be a superstar, you might even be entitled to an extraordinary achievement reward. Avaloq aims to share its success with all its employees by paying out “Success Share Units” depending on its performance in a given year.  At Avaloq we embrace diversity, we embrace difference. We are whole-heartedly committed to equal employment opportunities and we foster an inclusive culture where everyone’s' contributions are valued and their voices are listened to. We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other fascinating characteristics that make us different. Please note that our job descriptions are intended to be written in an inclusive and gender neutral language.  Don’t be shy – apply! Please only apply online, preferably with pdf documents.  Note to Agencies: All unsolicited résumés will be considered direct applicants and no referral fee will be acknowledged.

description: This role is with SpeQtral, a startup supported by SGInnovate.  ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ SpeQtral is a Quantum Communication Systems company where we have a team of space quantum pioneers at our headquarters in Singapore. We are commercialising quantum communications to prepare the world for the quantum future such as quantum space lasers, entanglement and military level secure communications. As part of our mission to transform the world’s networks, we plan to enable constellations of satellites to provide world-wide entanglement distribution.  ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ Descriptions: SpeQtral is looking for a highly motivated Business Development Manager to join a team of space quantum pioneers at our headquarters in Singapore. We are commercialising quantum communications to prepare the world for the quantum future. Think quantum space lasers, entanglement and military level secure communications. As part of our mission to transform the world’s networks, we plan to enable constellations of satellites to provide world-wide entanglement distribution. The earliest application of this is highly secure delivery of encryption keys to facilitate secret communications.  ⠀ ⠀ As a Business Development Manager at SpeQtral, you will be working closely with the CEO and will be responsible for the strategic development of the fibre-based Quantum Key Distribution (QKD) business unit. Your role will involve securing new business opportunities and build client relationships across countries in South-east Asia, working with internal stakeholders to ensure overall success of the business unit.  ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ Responsibilities: Develop and execute strategic business plans based on geographical and industry requirements. Identify business opportunities and propose suitable solutions to meet customers’ business objectives. Build and manage strong business relationships with customers’ key decision makers. Work with internal stakeholders (technical, marketing and legal team members and external partners) to achieve sales objectives Establish strategies to build pipelines, preparing sales proposals and closing them to achieve sales goals and revenues Monitor market developments in the industry and acquire in-depth understanding of competitive landscape. Present sales forecasts and reports to management. Organize and/or participate in Trade Shows to reach out to potential customers.  ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in in a technical field (Physics or Engineering) coupled with at least five years of Business Development, Sales or Account Management working experience. An MBA qualification is a plus  ⠀ ⠀ Requirements: Proven track record in business development in the enterprise IT equipment or services related industry Understanding of IT, communications and cybersecurity infrastructure in the government and defense, finance, data centres or cloud sectors is preferred Fluent in sales account management, account planning, pipeline building and opportunity management Regional experience in Southeast Asia countries (Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, the Philippines) is preferred Confident in presenting to multiple levels of management Excellent listening skills and strong communication skills to engage clientele Strong business acumen, team player, results-oriented Sensitive to cultural & business environment across the region Curiosity about working on the forefront of deep tech development  ⠀⠀ ⠀ SpeQtral provides our employees with: Flexibility of working from home Attractive leave entitlement Comprehensive medical and dental insurance Employee stock options Career progression opportunities  ⠀⠀ ⠀ Interested applicants may apply directly on STARS https://stars.sginnovate.com/viewrole?type=tm&jobid=M-2021-SPEQTRAL-964

description: As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day,, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Enterprise Sales Manager with a wealth of experience selling SaaS solutions to enterprise companies? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? If yes then we want to hear from you!  The impact you will have:  You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new customer relationships across the APAC region. As an Enterprise Sales Manager you will become an expert in Elliptic’s value proposition, helping our prospective customers navigate and enter the cryptocurrency market with your knowledge and understanding of our product and compliance and regulatory environments.  You will manage the full sales cycle including prospecting, qualifying leads, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing business to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and exceed your targets.  This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!  What you’ll do: Develop net new business and cross sell opportunities Build out strategic market penetration plan, prospect, and manage full sales cycle Prospect and generate high quality leads Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements Conduct presentations and product demos Negotiate terms and close the business As applicable, work alongside our Customer Engagement team to develop deeper relationships and upsell to set and hit aggressive revenue goals Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota  Requirements  You will be a great fit here if you: Can understand the customer’s business model, and how digital assets fit into their strategy Have the ability to analyse data to identify market trends and opportunities for cryptocurrency and compliance Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals Have a collaborative mindset Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities  Our ideal candidate has: 5+ years full sales cycle experience selling Enterprise SaaS solutions Strong outbound prospecting skills, with track record of generating net new business Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur’s mindset. You’re comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy  Bonus Points for: Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Experience selling SaaS solutions to Financial Services Borderline obsession with emerging technology  Benefits Share Options Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays Health insurance Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Home office allowance Full access to Spill Mental Health Support  We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Unlock Better with TAIGER Everything we do at TAIGER is driven by a common belief that work as we know it can be done better. This is why at TAIGER, we develop hybrid artificial intelligence that understands language and logic, helping enterprises unlock better automation, better insights and ultimately better growth and human fulfilment.  Together with our clients and partners, we are solving challenging tasks in various industries. Tasks that involve billions of dollars of man-hours and infrastructure. Tasks that are thought to be impossible to apply cognitive automation and AI. Today, some of the world’s leading enterprises and government organisations use our technology for complex and high value work like digital non-client onboarding, fraud detection, customer service and engagement amongst others.   Our game-changing work on emerging technologies like Ontologies and Graphs, and Natural Language Technologies is featured on Gartner’s Hype Cycles in 2021. TAIGER is also named as an IDC innovator in AI in 2019, and we are proudly accredited by Singapore’s Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA).  TAIGER is looking for a Sales Manager to join our award winning team.  SALES MANAGER We are building a team passionate about cutting-edge AI technology and the potential of TAIGER. You should be motivated by growth opportunities with your responsibilities expanding in scope. You can also look forward to being part of a dynamic start-up environment where your contribution matters.  Responsibilities Close business with new and established accounts: building a strong and sustainable business pipeline. Identify key decision makers, approvers, and influencers and develop strategies to increase deal confidence. Drive incremental revenue inside named accounts by uncovering new use cases, growing adoption of current opportunities and upselling and cross-selling additional solutions. Solution-sell by mapping business challenges with technology solutions. Able to sell end to end solutions as part of digital transformation inside organisations. Lead generation, qualification and opportunity management to contract closure. Partnership with solution, marketing, business development, product, delivery. Past experience with working with IDP (Intelligent Document Processing) related solutions or AI sector. Forecast and pipeline management using CRM tools (Hubspot).  Requirements Demonstrated sales management with proven track-record of consistently exceeding quotas and performance targets. Strong account management successes in Singapore. Ability to sell new cutting edge technology solutions to clients: out of the box thinking, visioning, educating, consulting skills, customer success, etc. Effective account management skills in upselling solutions and making sure client implementations are successful. Experience developing new sales strategies. Ideal candidate will have strong experience of B2B direct and channel software sales, ideally in AI space. Consultative solution sales - hungry to drive and close business. Ability to articulate complex ideas and strategies. Strong collaboration and communication within departments with like-minded goal of achievement. Attention to detail. Execution excellence in using CRM and managing OKRs/KPIs.  You are right for the team if You have a good eye for business and excellent organisational, analytical, and influencing skills as well as strong business ties in our target region. Apart from being a savvy negotiator with competitive drive and determination, you should also be customer centric with good interpersonal and networking skills. You adapt to change well and are able to tackle complex problems using new and innovation solutions. You have a global mindset working in HQ in Singapore  You possess effective time management skills.  TAIGERs are different.  With a multinational and multicultural team headed by talents drawn from leading global companies, diversity is our strength. TAIGERs come from all walks of life, bringing to every piece of work varied experiences and expertise. Just as every TAIGER is unique, no two days at TAIGER are the same. Through working on diverse projects across geographies, every day is a new opportunity to master our craft and impact the future of work. Here at TAIGER, we share a common question—what else can we unlock better?  *TAIGER does not engage any recruitment agencies for recruitment of talents into our company. All job applications should be submitted directly to TAIGER.

description: About Us   Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise and a global network of innovation and delivery centers. A part of the Tata group, India’s largest industrial conglomerate, TCS has over 480,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 46 countries.  As an employer, TCS is dedicated to hire, develop, motivate and preserve the brightest talent. We offer a successful career that would be driven by boundless growth opportunities while working with cutting-edge technologies, learning platforms, exposure across domains and various roles that are equipped with a flexibility that allows you to discover and achieve your true potential. We encourage talent diversity and believe that this enrichens and deepens our organisation. Having one of the lowest market attrition rates, and being bestowed with several HR and employer of choice awards, is testament to our positive and collaborative HR and employee practices.   TCS Singapore is the headquarter of TCS Asia Pacific, and has been in operations since 30 years. We maintain our Global presence and ranking in Singapore as well, having a prestigious Global and Local clientele and significant employee base. We now look forward to taking the organisation to the next level, and are looking at onboarding the talent that will help us achieve our goals.   Who are we looking for, and Why?  With exciting times ahead, we are confident that our technology and domain offerings, will address the constant demand from our expanding clientele. In order to achieve our goals, we are looking at strengthening our Sales and Account Executive teams, and build the leadership that will take our organisation forward. We are specifically looking at Sales executives, who have experience in the BFSI sector, having demonstrated proven results in your prior experience. Any references provided in your application(from your contacts and network) will be an added bonus on your application. While we are looking for experienced individuals, there is no minimum experience requirement as long as your profile can be of value to our organisation!  What the role promises?  As part of being a Sales Executive for TCS, you will be...  the face of a global brand with an established presence around the world and the region.  interacting with top-tier companies in the industry and be responsible for pursuing partnerships and securing orders/contracts. educated in the full suite of our services and products, so you are adequately equipped to represent TCS. driving innovative client solutions and contributing towards organisational growth and a positive customer experience. defining the sales strategy for your respective portfolio, executing the strategy to expand TCS' presence, driving topline/bottomline growth.  Responsibilities and Expectations  Secure contracts/ engagement with target customers and achieve sales targets Collaborate with Country Management and Leadership on logo/deal pursuits, with periodic reporting. Work closely with internal solution and pre-sales teams to drive and devise solutions and proposals that are relevant to the target customer Engage proactively, intelligently and collaboratively with target customer stakeholders, build long-term relationships, secure a place in preferred vendor list, aim towards building a partner credibility and developing a mutually beneficial relationship Be result-oriented in securing and acquiring customers, goal oriented towards the assigned financial targets, highly driven and motivated to create an environment of energy and positivity, confident and creative in managing discussions and conversations with inter/external stakeholders Keep abreast with industry trends, customer trends, technology advancement; build a network of professionals inside/outside the organisation Manage high pressure work environment demands, commit to deadline/target driven business plans Be flexible towards working hours whenever the need arises, readiness to travel frequently within/outside Singapore   Expected Skills and Qualities  Strong visual and creative presentation skills. Good Business Acumen, and demonstrated leadership skills. Ability to communicate and network confidently and effectively with all levels of management and functional disciplines, both within and outside the organization Know-how of sales cycles, deal constructs with proven negotiation skills. Organized, independent, resourceful, self-motivated and highly driven to thrive in a fast pace and challenging environment Result-oriented and solution-focused, committed to sales target and timeline

description: Business Development Manager, GlobalData Disruptor Team Singapore  GlobalData is the gold standard business information provider to the world’s largest industries, we continuously collect and analyze terabytes of data to create the most comprehensive, authoritative, and granular market intelligence. We leverage the collective expertise of our in-house research analysts, consultants, and journalists, as well as thousands of external thought-leaders, to create differentiated and actionable insight. We have over 4,000 worldwide clients in 16 industry sectors including pharma, technology, finance, and retail. There are over 3,400 of us at GlobalData and we’re growing fast. Over the last five years, we’ve made over 20 acquisitions.  We’re gearing up for an exciting and fast-paced next phase in our expansion and we’re looking for the right people to join us and help make it happen. We’re investing significantly in new Products and Cutting-edge Business Solutions and are looking for a business development director who understand how technology is reshaping the future and its impact on business ecosystem.  GlobalData is currently looking for an enthusiastic Business Development Manager as an addition to our growing global sales team, representing the GlobalData Disruptive Team . Candidate needs to have a strong track record of nurturing clients and building bespoke, complex solutions for large enterprise clients, and an independent worker based out of our Singapore Office.   What we are looking for in the candidate:  5+ years B2B sales experience (with at least 2 years proven track record of consistently initiating & closing deals), of driving client outreach initiatives with tenacity and persuasiveness to make a direct revenue impact Experience in selling data-driven SaaS solutions to the Corporate Strategy, Innovation, M&A/VC, Digital Transformation teams across sectors Comfortable with aligning client’s ambiguous business challenges with the features of Disruptor IC– which helps clients identify critical information on emergence of digital natives, promising start-ups, technology led innovations, latest sector trends, consumer insights, and venture capital portfolio investments – and help them covert Disruptor into success Capable of managing long sales timelines (3-6 months) and consistently ‘nurturing’ leads. Must be able to present and lead discovery meetings by using consultative questioning, active listening and a ‘challenger’ mind set, in order to steer conversations Effective at working with other stakeholders to ensure that the right resources and expertise are in place when pitching and nurturing clients Hunter mindset with natural ease in initiating conversations with cold and warm prospects Showcase a passion for the technology sector with sector level understanding of startup ecosystem including technology investment, venture capital, technology adoption curve and related early-stage innovation Highly adaptable and able to work in a fast-paced environment where things change rapidly

description: The Senior Business Development Rep is responsible for strategic outbound sales activities to Fortune 500 companies. In this role the Sr BDR will work closely with their Account Executives to develop a strategic sales plan mapping out targeted accounts. The BDR will execute the sales plan alongside the Account Executive with the goal of engaging and scheduling a call with the target contact.  Responsibilities You own the full Business Development process including: Prospecting sales leads Account and contact research  Collaboration with Account Executives to sales plan outreach strategy Sending email sales campaigns to prospects Phone outreach to executive/senior level buyers Utilizing additional social channels as needed to prospect leads  Qualifying leads and scheduling calls with prospective accounts Working out of a CRM database Maintaining a full pipeline of sales leads Meet or exceed weekly metrics and quarterly KPI’s  Who we’re looking for: Smart and ambitious people Great verbal and written communicators Natural sales acumen  Ability to engage executive level prospects Outgoing with a “can do” attitude is critical Eager to learn new things daily You love being part of a team and want to make an impact Desire to work in a fast changing environment Critical thinkers ( This is mandatory ) You consider yourself a driven person Desire to progress within your sales career  Requirements Bachelor’s degree Excellent communication skills Proven strong work ethic Desire to excel and advance in a career Competitive attitude Enterprise SDR/sales experience targeting the fortune 500, minimum of 1-2 years + Preferred experience working with executive level buyers for SaaS solutions

description: Description  What makes us Qlik  Qlik helps enterprises around the world move faster, work smarter, and lead the way forward with an end-to-end solution for getting value out of data. A Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader for 11 years in a row! Our platform is the only one on the market that allows for open-ended, curiosity-driven exploration, giving everyone – at any skill level – the ability to make real discoveries that lead to real outcomes and transformative changes.  We are a Values-Driven organization, operating over 100 countries with 45,000 customers around the world. If you think we are interesting, please read on – we may be looking for you!  Business Development Representative – ASEAN  The Sales Organization in Qlik is the primary connection to our customers and prospects; focusing on driving revenue in new accounts and expanding our presence in the territory's existing customer. The teams work geographically or are industry focused.  The Business Development Representative addresses the accounts identified by Qlik as commercial accounts in a territory either current customers or as target customers, with the highest potential future value in the market. The role is part of an account team, with a primary responsibility of prospection within the accounts to generate and close new licenses sales  Key Responsibilities & Tasks Outbound identification and development of land and expand opportunities within assigned accounts using digital and social channels Follow up on inbound leads to qualify and manage them through the sales cycle Maintain a pipeline of opportunities and manage them through the sales cycle. Maintain customer and opportunity data in SFDC system Build/maintain strong customer and partner relationships within the territory base Competencies And Skills Ability to work on a prospecting and sales plan with partners within the territory. Strong marketing orientation. Customer Centric Selling experience. 2-4 years Business Development and/or 1-2 years Inside Sales experience (5 years preferred). description: The incumbent will be part of the APAC team based in Singapore selling into strategic enterprise accounts and to drive the growth of new logo acquisitions. The incumbent will work closely with prospective clients to position our digital solutions to best solve their digital customer engagement challenges. Ability to clearly and enthusiastically articulate our value proposition and demonstrate our solution at a high level will be the key to success. Key areas of focus in our digital solutions include our Social Messaging (Conversocial), Conversational AI (Next IT), Knowledge Management, and Orchestration Hub (Agent Desktop/Self Service) solutions.  Responsibilities Grow and manage a pipeline of new business opportunities through inbound and outbound efforts; originating and selling to our biggest clients and making believers out of fresh clients Partner daily with the broader commercial team (professional services, product management, product marketing, etc.) to close and support strategic opportunities. At Verint, we pride ourselves on our cross-functional sales culture. This is not a role for the lone wolf seller Think critically about sales insights and data and experiment with new growth tactics Define the client experience by building durable relationships, inspiring trust, and proposing innovative solutions to their problems Provide thought leadership to clients as well as internally mentor and offer professional insights to junior team members   Qualifications At least 5 years of enterprise software sales in the following areas; Digital, CX, Self Service & AI, Automation & Analytics, CRM/Desk Top technology, or Contact Centre solution sales experience including pipeline development and management, establishing and presenting compelling value propositions to potential customers Experience managing sales cycle from business champion to the CXO level, with expertise in call center, digital customer engagement and/or enterprise social ideal Ability to develop business relationships at a senior-level include key C-level Executives Demonstrable track record of sales success in selling enterprise software solutions to Corporate, SMB and Government sectors Demonstrated ability to prospect, develop & close sales deals through disciplined and systematic approach Strong ability to seek out and maintain a robust sales pipeline Proven experience in complex sales cycles Effective communication and presentation skills Expertly navigate the complex buying processes of large Enterprise Organizations Enjoy meeting & exceeding sales goals with a drive for sales success Highly regarded with an extensive network within the Industry

description: Who we are: At Mitto, we’re on a mission to deliver reliable, high-quality communications between businesses and their customers, every time.   Our company was founded in 2013 with the specific aim of building a state-of-the-art Application-to-Person (A2P) SMS messaging platform, unrivalled in reliability, that could support the requirements of a new wave of A2P services. As the demand grew for enablement of omnichannel communications capabilities, we expanded our portfolio beyond SMS to now include voice, chat bots, all major chat apps (WhatsApp, Viber, Facebook Messenger, etc.), Google Business Messaging, RCS, myriad CRM and marketing platform integrations and, most recently, pre-built tools for bulk campaigns and conversational support chats.  Simply put, we make communication happen… and you can help.  We are looking for an ambitious and sales-driven Business Development Executive located in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore to work on identifying, opening, and growing new accounts in the telecoms, Internet, and mobile app markets across the region.  What you’ll do:  Be responsible for sales and closing of the new business opportunities in the region. Manage clients located in the APAC region and be responsible for their growth. Contribute by helping with a relationship with Mitto´s key accounts in the region Identify prospects, build pipelines, and close deals ensuring long-term revenue plans. Work together with the operations team to deploy the service offered to the client and manage the account according to the Mitto team strategy. Prioritise and deliver a superior customer experience to strategic customers in the region. Participate in answering global clients RFP for cloud telecommunications support. Continuously work with the client to identify needs and propose solutions making an impact on the Mitto product roadmap  You need to bring with you: University degree or equivalent practical experience. Fluent in English. Ability to work under pressure and quickly grasp a good understanding of trends driving innovation in technology, specifically in mobile, cloud and consumer areas. Willingness to work with an international team. Experience in building strong relationships with decision-makers. Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills. Excellent customer service skills with a customer-driven focus and the ability to adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment. Ability to work cross-functionally both internally and externally to execute deals. Self-motivated with a passion for sales and the ability to thrive in a results-driven environment 3+ years of B2B sales experience in the mobile solutions sector (SMS, Voice, and similar)  What we offer: A fast-paced, start-up like environment where every team member makes a direct impact on our collective success Resources and leadership to help grow your skills and advance your career Collaboration with talented individuals in various locations throughout the world Access to cutting-edge technology and its application across global markets with leading brands Competitive benefits to ensure your health, wellness, and happiness so you can enjoy the full experience of life at Mitto. Freedom to work remotely from anywhere in the APAC region

With fifteen offices and three R&D labs worldwide, you will be part of a global team that transcends time zones and geographical boundaries. You get to enjoy working in an environment that values transparency and collaborative effort. Most importantly, both work and play are equally important to us. 10 years of experience in the acquirer or payment gateway company with exposure to regional merchants with multiple market in Southeast Asia Owned and maintain P/L responsibilities Demonstrate experience with a successful track record in managing accounts, building partnership relationships, and driving revenues In-depth knowledge of the payment industry and its competitive background Excellent understanding of payment development processes, pipelines, workflows, and tools Good analytical skills, capable of doing in-depth analysis, to provide business insights and develop strategic to counterchallenges and grow new business Own and maintain an extensive partnership, merchant & channel network in payment industry Experience in working with international partners and multi-countries partnerships Experience of managing a diverse set of stakeholders  Be part of a phenomenal team today!

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What we're looking for:  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  We are looking for Enterprise Account Executives to join our sales team and focus on Large Enterprise customers in Singapore. We seek exceptional talent that is eager to do the best work of their life while supporting others in doing the same. You will be responsible for driving sales opportunities with prospective customers as well as expanding business within existing accounts. You will work closely with our customers to understand their business objectives and act as their trusted guide for using Slack most effectively. You'll also work with cross-functional teams to help align our product roadmap and marketing materials with customer feedback.  If you're an established sales professional with a proven track record in helping customers achieve lofty goals, we should talk!  What you’ll be doing:  Own the full sales cycle from lead to close Establish lasting relationships with senior executives and decision-makers Help educate customers on the value of Slack throughout their adoption cycle Build Slack awareness at all levels of an organization Identify customer needs to ensure customer success with special emphasis on signup, upgrade, and renewal Collaborate with other members of the sales team (solutions engineers, customer success managers, leadership, etc.) to build strategic adoption plans for customers Prepare and educate customers on new features and releases Monitor and identify adoption and utilization trends Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product Handle all customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Drive revenue through proactive outreach to key accounts  What you should have:  5+ years of Enterprise Account Executive experience Relevant sales experience, preferably in a SaaS organization Experience managing a pipeline and closing large contracts Excellent communication skills both with customers and within an organization Proven negotiation and closing skills Strong track record of navigating within large and mid-market organizations Ability to develop senior level relationships quickly and effectively Experience presenting to senior managers and the C-suite Ability to manage multiple opportunities simultaneously at various stages of the buying process Takes an active interest in increasing customer satisfaction and deepening customer relationships Ability to orchestrate and collaborate with cross-functional teams Ability to be flexible and adaptive Experience with enterprise SaaS vendors preferred Bachelor's degree required Some travel required  About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: The Qualtrics XM PlatformTM is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can't imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  Primary Responsibilities Lead a team of 5-6 Enterprise Account Executives based throughout Southeast Asia. Strong communication skills, listen first and speak second, aware of the message being transmitted to the team, how it's delivered, and it's perception. Provide mentoring and guidance on key enterprise motions including collaboration with legal, product presentations, running multiple internal teams and quarterly sales forecasting. Serve as executive sponsor during enterprise level deals. Interface and develop professional relationships with existing clients and prospects throughout organisational levels. Display a systemic approach to leading challenging contract negotiations/deals with multiple reps at a time. Maintain an in-depth knowledge of Qualtrics XM solution offerings. Maintain a real-time understanding of the competitive landscape to assist in determining win-based proposals and pricing. Develop and maintain positive relationships with other functional areas internally at Qualtrics, e.g. Professional Services, Implementation, Subject Matter Experts, etc to ensure a collaborative approach to secure large enterprise engagements Demonstrate experience successfully leading through change in a fast-growing environment. Entrepreneurial approach to effectively leading a business. Qualifications Strong background! Validated winner that has led teams to breakthrough results. Bachelor's degree from a top-accredited university At least 6-8 years of individual enterprise level sales experience At least 2 years managing an enterprise level sales team Experience using Salesforce.com and measuring system compliance Experience over-exceeding quarterly team quotas through metric based skill development and internal team management Experience working on complex contract negotiations Singaporean and PR is preferred. About The Team  We've grown our Enterprise Sales team to respond to very strong client demand for the Qualtrics Insight Platform. This growth has resulted in the need to bring on an exceptional leader with a track record of attracting, developing and motivating an elite team of enterprise SaaS sales professionals.  Our team is a group of highly driven individuals that are intelligent, organized, and dedicated. We work together as a team to accomplish and exceed quarterly and annual objectives. We are a goal-oriented team that works hard and enjoys the incredible trajectory that Qualtrics provides. Our overarching objective is to drive company revenue growth through client success.  What Differentiates Us From Other Companies Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours. We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative workspace. Comprehensive perks and benefits package (private health, life insurance, etc) as well as snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office. We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees. Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer  Qualtrics provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or veteran status.

jobTitle: Regional Lead, Sales Strategy and Analytics, GrabGifts
description: Job Description:  About Us  Grab was founded on the belief that a technology company in Southeast Asia could both run profitably and create sustainable social impact. We hold ourselves responsible to the environment and socio-economic development of this region, not just for today, but also for the future.  At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles, which we call the 4Hs. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.  WORKING WITH GRAB POSITIVE & COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENT. Grabbers thrive in a corporate culture that values every team member's contribution towards our goal of improving lives. ROCKET FUEL FOR CAREERS. Grabbers experience hyper professional growth and all the challenges that entails. Grow your skills while working to solve real issues across the region. FUN & DEDICATED FAMILY. Grabbers work hard and play hard. Our teams grow as one as they overcome challenges and have fun along the way. Our Team:  As a member of Grab, not only will you bring your skill sets to drive your team forward, but you will also develop your untapped potential and be inspired by some of the most amazing minds in the industry. Our team consists of both young and experienced individuals who are tenacious, motivated and energized by the fact that we exist to make a change - have a societal impact in Southeast Asia.  Grab for Business is the B2B SaaS team within Grab that helps to simplify business transportation, corporate food & package deliveries as well as related services for companies across Southeast Asia. We actively engage with top companies and top brands across the region and it is imperative that we drive efficient commercial operations within our organisation. To this end, we are looking for a strong Regional Associate - Sales Ops & Strategy, GrabGifts in our Grab for Business team to contribute towards a robust commercial & account operations organisation that will cater at scale to an expanding portfolio of corporate clients.  To perform this role well, the candidate needs to have strong communication capabilities, attention to detail, ability to create and follow processes, data analysis capabilities and a track record of exceeding expectations.  The Role: You will report to the Regional Head - GrabGifts and be part of the regional Grab for Business team, assisting in building up the GrabGifts business. You will work with multiple cross functional teams including but not limited to Grab for Business business and operations teams, Data Analytics, Country Operations, Country Finance, Finance SSC, Grab Support etc. Be a GrabGifts subject matter expert, and align with Grab for Business country leads and Grab Central Operations teams to develop, implement and track standard GrabGifts Operations SOPs in line with overall objectives. Your tasks include, but are not limited to, the following:  Strategic analysis Extract, analyze and interpret data, generate insights on business performance and optimise for profitability; Substantiate hypotheses with sound insights and data, relate operational initiatives to the bigger picture. Lead monthly/weekly/ad hoc sales update meetings with leadership; ensure sales performance and strategy insights are supported with accurate data Own and steer business operations initiatives, supported with insights from qualitative and quantitative data for effective decision-making Operational execution Translate strategic directions into action plans, drive alignment between multiple teams to implement sales ops initiatives (sales ops automation enhancements) Support our Product team with insights and data for feature prioritization exercises. Lead the strategy, project management and implementation of GrabGifts’ automation projects with cross-functional Grab teams. Cross-functional relationships Build strong relationships in a complex, collaborative environment with key stakeholders and partners across the company for the scoping, planning and preparation for product launch The Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s Degree (optional) Work Experience: Minimum of 5 years as a commercial ops or account ops executive within a fast-paced and competitive B2B, SaaS, enterprise, corporate or startup environment. Proven track record in building and driving operational excellence and best practices . Ability to work independently, deal with data analysis and increase the operational efficiency of the business. Strong business acumen, preferably with prior experience in Business Strategy, Programme Management, Operations, Sales. Strong critical thinking and problem solving abilities, able to ideate out of the box to address complex business challenges Proficiency in data analytics tools (Tableau, Holistics), CRM (SalesForce), marketing analytics (Google Analytics) and SQL a must. Should be comfortable with advanced usage of Microsoft Office and G Suite (Docs / Sheets / Slides) and client experience tools (Salesforce CRM, Tableau reporting dashboards). Communication: Strong and effective communicator with good presentation and speaking skills who can verbally and visually articulate their point of view clearly and succinctly. Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can work well in a startup VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous) environment. Should have demonstrated integrity and respect in the performance of their duties.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: As the Business Development & Partnerships Manager, you will be crucial and central in building strong and long-lasting relationships to make significant inroads into new markets and business opportunities. You will work closely with Product, Sales & Marketplace, Marketing, and others in the team to achieve new partnerships, grow our footprint, and increase revenue.  Responsibilities Identify and develop Go-To-Market (GTM) partnerships within ComfortDelGro group and with external partners to grow new and adjacent businesses and revenues. Identify and engage partner decision-makers with support from fellow team members. Analyze opportunity requirements, and prepare content for proposals to be sent for RFPs, client proposals, and partnership opportunities. Work closely with fellow team members to collaborate on opportunities from early identification through to initial stages of client relationship management, and continued partner advancement. Create a systematic, data-driven approach to partner outreach and relationship management. Research, evaluate, and prioritize partners via balancing the management of strategic partnerships across our offerings. Be our eyes in the field and explore different ways to position and package our offerings, and share feedback and learnings with internal teams to strengthen our proposition. Produce and manage a robust pipeline of incoming partners and showcase the results via reports and updates. Gain deep understanding of partner needs, target audience, key players, and industry trends. Identify themes and trends to understand market needs.  Requirements At least 6 years of proven track record and relevant experience in business development and partnerships for mid-large matrixed organizations. Experience with bid writing and securing sponsors and partners. Strong ability to negotiate agreements. Experience in digital businesses is a must, and/or with mobility or sustainability would be preferred. Knowledgeable about e-commerce platforms relating to mobility, marketplace, lifestyle offerings. Ability to think through a long-term vision for a partnership, but realize and act on the small steps needed to get there. Highly motivated and adaptable to ever-changing client needs and expectations. Able to prioritise tasks and work to deadlines. Strong communication skills. Able to use own initiative and develop ideas with the team.

jobTitle: Sales Performance Consultant, LinkedIn Marketing Solutions
description: Company Description  LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.  Job Description  We are seeking a Sales Performance Consultant (SPC) to join the Sales Readiness team in LinkedIn Marketing Solutions (LMS), a business that is in hyper-growth and innovating quickly. This SPC will partner with regional sales leadership to align sales enablement strategies to key business priorities focused on driving learning effectiveness across the field and leadership teams in the APAC region. This is an exciting opportunity to create and drive enormous impact for LinkedIn Marketing Solutions and across our APAC business!  The SPC team owns the business relationships - they are aligned with specific regions and segments, and serve as an extension of the sales leadership team in their segment. Their remit is to enable and empower the field and sales managers in their region/segment to do the best work of their careers. To raise the bar in how we think about Sales Excellence, and to embrace learning and growth across Sales Competencies, Sales Methodology, Sales Process, and Sales Coaching. This team takes learning programs that are built centrally for scale, and brings them to market across regions and segments in a way that lands deeply, is customized for each business, and is fueled by real customer examples and regional nuances. They provide key input into the centralized program management team, to ensure programs are being built in a way that will best drive value in-market. SPCs bring learning insights to their business and their sales leaders to drive recommendations on where we should prioritize and focus learning programs to close gaps, or to achieve specific business goals. This team is essential to making learning land, stick, and drive meaningful value for our global business.  This person will partner with sales to drive learning effectiveness and business impact across the APAC region in LMS. Your role, as the SPC of this team, is to be an extension of the sales team and provide individualized learning and relevancy with our sales methodology as the foundation. What do great learning experiences look like in this new future of work? How do you partner with the sales leadership team to collaborate deeply, seek leverage programmatically, and measure success? This SPC is passionate about learning (and reinforcement/learning stickiness), they possess the ability to coach and teach, they have deep business acumen and build strong relationships with our sales leaders, they are energetic around owning end-to-end programs themselves and they are innovative, future-focused thinkers. This person needs to be comfortable operating in ambiguity with open-mindedness, agility, positivity, and a continuous commitment to iterating and improving.  Responsibilities Partner with Sales team to create recommendations for driving impact to the business, plan and execute the sales enablement strategies. Serve as a key partner to the Sales team and establish a trusted partnership in developing learning strategies Consult with leaders, including learning & development planning, team development, management and coaching Consults with leaders to assess and analyze the learning needs of employees based on current and future strategic plans Measure and evaluate the ROI of sales enablement programs, tied directly to core sales competencies and direct impact to key business metrics Manage stakeholders – build relationships, ongoing communication, bring others with you along the journey Identify gaps that centralized programs aren’t solving for – build learning programs to close these gaps Create an enablement strategy around using tech to surface wins and drive learning reinforcement (i.e. Gong, Teams, etc.) Collaborate closely with Sales Readiness colleagues in across APAC and in other regions (EMEAL & NAMER) to ensure we scale globally, think locally Collaborate cross-functionally to uncover business needs and skills gaps, and deliver best in class development for sales professionals Delivers high quality sales training and practice workshops Drive programmatic changes to sales development approach driven by measurement outcomes to continue to demand excellence Qualifications  Basic Qualifications 4+ years of professional experience working in a sales, sales readiness environment, or marketing Preferred Qualifications Adept at presenting and public speaking Modern learning obsessed – passionate about knowing the technology and trends that can make learning stick, today Experience collaborating with cross functional teams Project and program management experience Exceptional communication – know your audience, articulate the “so what?” Experience deploying change and a understanding of change management methodologies Strong ability to simplify complex problems An avid learner Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong consultative skills Highly proficient in MS Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Role Purpose  Manages customer relationships and uses insight and understanding of customer needs to support account growth.  Role Responsibilities  A result driven, derivatives professional required to drive the next phase of growth in the Asia pacific region. Finance or Management graduate/ post-grad 2-4 years’ experience in covering these products and bank, buy-side clients Willingness to travel in the region Proficiency in English and Mandarin Independent operator, outgoing and strong communication, presentation skills At LSEG, we believe that creating a diverse and inclusive organisation is fundamental to the way we deliver on our promise – and our purpose. description: About Oddle  Oddle is the leading cloud-based Software-as-a-Service platform that facilitates e-commerce and order management solutions for the F&B industry.  Our journey started in Singapore in 2014 and over the past 7 years, we are proud of what we can offer to help restaurants to manage and grow their sales – not only with technology but also with our data-guided marketing solutions. We connect to food lovers with Oddle Eats, a discovery platform with favourites curated by us because at Oddle, every meal matters. There is more to what we want to achieve.  About The Role  We are looking for a Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our Singapore team as we're bringing Oddle's position in Singapore to the next level. Join us in this high-growth journey and make a meaningful impact in the F&B scene.  As a BDR, you will be collaborating with our Sales Development Representative (SDR) team to bring potential F&B merchants onboard as Oddle's partners. You will adopt the local sales strategies and manage the sales cycle from pitching to closing the deals, to grow and expand our restaurant's clientele in Singapore.  Who might you be? You are a business-minded individual and will go out of your way to make things happen. You believe in our mission and the excitement that it brings. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth and ever-changing environment, you can easily adapt to any situation and are up to any challenge that arises.  You are authentic and genuine and have a knack of building great and meaningful business relationships. You want to learn the in & out of the F&B tech industry in Singapore, to leverage on or build your network with the humans of F&B. You care about the impact that you and the company can influence on restaurant partners that entrust their business to us.  What You Will Do Collaborate with the SDR team to generate new business opportunities to fuel your pipeline Discover F&B merchants' potential, identify their challenges and consult them on how Oddle can add value to their business Work closely with the Onboarding team in coordinating with merchants to get the merchants to go live within the expected timeline Meet and exceed given weekly and monthly KPIs and targets Establish and maintain strong relationships with clientele in the F&B industry Develop in-depth knowledge and gain updates of key trends of the local F&B e-commerce industry Gather merchant feedback, monitor competitor activities and provide recommendations for improvements to product development team  Who We're Looking For 3-4 years of field sales experience with a proven track record of consistent target achievement. Experience in F&B / F&B eCommerce industry will be advantageous. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbally, with the ability to negotiate and convince. Bilingual with proficiency in Mandarin to engage with Mandarin-speaking clients is an advantage. Solid persuasion and negotiation kill, with a sound business acumen Strongly disciplined and sound time management skill A self-driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced and highly agile environment An entrepreneurial spirit who is self-started, resourceful, able to drive actions and inspire people around you Possess a great sense of ownership and take pride in your work Good team player and willingness to share knowledge and experiences with team members Only Singaporean/SPR applicants should apply  If you are driven and looking for tremendous growth opportunities and want to grow with us, we would love to speak with you soon!  Powered by JazzHR  yNN5ODKyOL
