description: Job Description  Procore is expanding our international reach into the ASEAN market to help construction companies revolutionise and digitise their business. We’re breaching greenfield territories with tremendous market potential and are building out our team to lead this exciting endeavour. Are you up for the challenge?  We’re looking for an Account Executive, Majors to join Procore’s Sales Team. In this role, you’ll apply an understanding of Procore’s products, sales methodology, processes, prospecting techniques, and customer base while selling to strategic mid-market accounts. You’ll focus on companies that can benefit from Procore’s world-class project management tool for the construction industry. This position’s primary function is new account acquisition, where you’ll grow revenue with an emphasis on new product sales to our customer base. This includes following up on inbound leads, prospecting, qualifying, solution selling, negotiation, and closing.  This position is based in Singapore and will report to our Head of ASEAN, Sales. International travel may be required, specifically in the ASEAN territories, when borders reopen and travel safety improves. We’re looking for someone to join us immediately.  What you'll do: Timely follow up and qualification of new prospects from either inbound leads or customer requests generated by marketing Develop prospecting plans for territory development to build rapport and create opportunities Research accounts, identify key players, generate interest and obtain business requirements Maintain accurate and up-to-date forecasts Provide sales management with reports on sales activities and projects as requested forecasts Pursue an increase knowledge of key competitors to ensure that our value proposition communicated effectively to customers Manage and maintain accurate leads, opportunities, and account information within Salesforce.com Achieve or exceed monthly and quarterly targets Obtain repeat business, referrals, and references by applying an understanding of the unique requirements of your customers Networking, relationship building, cold calling, lead follow-up through emails, product demonstrations, and execution of service agreements  What we're looking for: BA/BS or equivalent experience preferred 3+ years of demonstrated successful software sales, preferably B2B Desire to sell into a new market for Procore Experience using a consultative, solution-based sales methodology desired Proven record of success in an inside sales and or outside sales based selling model Proven ability to communicate effectively via telephone and email with customers Ability and resilience to work in a fast-paced sales environment Ability to develop trusted relationships Proficiency in Microsoft Office products and online collaboration tools Experience with CRM and opportunity management systems, preferably Salesforce.com Proven ability to build and manage pipeline and forecasting Successful candidates will share our Procore Values of Openness, Optimism and Ownership  Additional Information  If you'd like to stay in touch and be the first to hear about new roles at Procore, join our Talent Community.  About Us  Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore.  We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic, and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.  We will provide further details during the interview process on the proposed contractual arrangement and relationship you will have with Procore if you are successful in applying for this role.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: PSG is a global pump and dispensing solution expert and leading manufacturer of pumps, systems and related flow-control technology for the safe and efficient transfer of critical and valuable fluids and materials. Headquartered in Oakbrook Terrace, IL, USA, PSG is comprised of several world-class brands, including Abaque™, All-Flo, Almatec®, Blackmer®, Ebsray®, EnviroGear®, Griswold®, Hydro Systems, Mouvex®, Neptune™, Quattroflow™ and Wilden®. PSG products are manufactured on three continents, North America, Europe and Asia, in state-of-the-art facilities that practice lean manufacturing and are ISO-certified. PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of Dover Corporation. For additional information on PSG, please visit psgdover.com. PSG: Where Innovation Flows.  PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of the Dover Corporation® (NYSE: DOV). Dover is a diversified global manufacturer and solutions provider with annual revenue of approximately $7 billion. We deliver innovative equipment and components, consumable supplies, aftermarket parts, software and digital solutions, and support services through five operating segments. Recognized for our entrepreneurial approach for over 60 years, our team of over 23,000 employees takes an ownership mindset, collaborating with customers to redefine what's possible.   To develop and expand market coverage in the Asian semiconductor market with our Almatec brand we are looking for a Business Development Manager (f/m/d) – Semicon, Asia starting in September 2021, located in the Philippines or Singapore.  Your tasks: ·        Develop and execute a strategy to leverage commercial, operational, and organizational opportunities to deliver revenue synergies. ·        Drive revenue in the targeted market by identifying, acquiring, and managing new customers with focus on end-users, OEMs and other relevant semicon market participants. ·        Collaborate with account managers on account specific challenges and sales strategies. ·        Proactively understand the customer strategy and needs. ·        Develop, establish, maintain, and manage relationships with key influential contacts of customers. ·        Identify acquisition and product development opportunities within core and adjacent technologies. ·        Interface with product managers, engineering, and sales to develop new products, create business cases, execute field trial plans, and product launches that are aligned with overall product life cycle strategies. ·        Drive development of value-added customer materials and training. ·        Train and accompany new partners in their way to market.  Your profile: ·        4 year degree bachelors degree from accredited university. ·        Prior customer interfacing responsibilities (ex. sales, business development, technical service etc.) with strong communication and presentation skills. ·        Experience in selling the values of a premium product offering. ·        History of achieving sales goals using a collaborative, cross-functional team. ·        Deep knowledge of production technologies in general and of fluid handling systems in the Semicon market. ·        Ideally personal professional experience in the regional Semicon market. ·        Expert in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and experience with SharePoint. ·        Willingness to travel 50%, mostly Asia, occasionally EMEA or USA. ·        Fluent in English (written and oral).

description: About Us  At WeWork, we provide inspiring and flexible workplace solutions to help businesses - small, medium or large - thrive in more than 150 cities globally. The future of work is happening right now, and we are leading this moment. United by a common purpose, here we will empower tomorrow’s world at work. Join us on our journey as we give our members the freedom and support to push boundaries in their industries, and work to redefine our own.  About The Opportunity  WeWork All Access allows you to hot desks, conference rooms and private offices worldwide. It is redefining how businesses manage their workspace, and the All Access team is at the forefront of this flexible working revolution.  This role will be pivotal in the success of WeWorks hybrid work solution in the Pacific area, contributing to its development, its growth and ultimately its success.  In This Role, You Will  We are looking for an Account Executive, All Access to be the main point of contact for All Access sales in Pacific.  Drive all 10+ All Access card deals Partner with the International Accounts and Leasing teams on their All Access requirements Shares best practices in selling strategies and operations with the other International All Access sales teams (MLB, Unnamed Accounts and Named Accounts) Execute net new and upsell bookings for the All Access product to companies with 500+ FTEs Position the value of All Access and the future of flexible work Serve as a bridge between sales and the All Access product team, constantly looking to improve the product and customer experience Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and effectively communicate our value proposition to members Provide unmatched customer service to members to ensure the best possible member experience  About You  Does the below sound like you? If so, we’d love to hear from you!  A relevant Bachelor’s Degree 5+ years of professional experience in sales, account management or related industry Comfortable using CRM platforms – Salesforce experience highly desirable Demonstrated experience in nurturing, negotiating and closing sales Experience in high growth SaaS is highly desirable Experience working on a team and leading a team player mentality Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills Exceptional organization skills and multi-tasking skills  Life At WeWork  Being a WeWorker is more than just a job. We believe the magic of work is sparked by the passion you bring, the places you go, the people you meet and the purpose you follow. And it starts here. Here you will brush shoulders with those who dare to dream and do. Here you will be welcomed by a diverse community that embraces and inspires you—because together we can achieve more. Here we challenge ideas, and explore new ways of getting things done. Whether you are part of our Employee Community Groups, or part of a global project, we ask you to bring your open-minded attitude and collaborative spirit. In return, you will be part of a team where your unique perspectives are celebrated.  WeWork is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil status, pregnancy (or pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression, transgender status or gender reassignment, race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including genetic testing and characteristics), military or veteran status, or any other grounds or characteristic that is protected under the law.

description: There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Snowflake, the company that delivers the Data Cloud to Mobilize the World’s Data, is actively seeking a Sales Enablement Business Partner based in Singapore to support the Asia Pacific Japan (APJ) segment.  In this role, which reports to the Director of Sales Best Practices and Enablement, you will be a key contributor to the vision and realization of our overall sales enablement strategy.  IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO: Serve as the voice of Global Sales Enablement in the APJ segment, leading communication and execution of the global enablement plan in the segment. Establish yourself with sales leadership and cross functional partners in marketing and sales operations as an extended member of their leadership teams. Connect with a broad range of stakeholders to identify enablement needs in the sales organization. Manage the intake process and prioritize segment specific enablement requests based on expected business impact. Lead and manage projects that produce segment specific selling and enablement assets. Where applicable, manage the process and resources (internal or external) to localize these assets to the needs of the sales team. Build strong partnerships and align with internal and cross functional SMEs on enablement content creation and delivery. Coordinate and schedule activities and people in support of new hire onboarding, Sales Kickoff and ongoing enablement. Keep the field informed on all things enablement - offerings, process, systems, due dates, progress reports, etc. - through active communication and awareness campaigns. Collaborate with your Global Sales Enablement peers to shape and continuously refine the onboarding program, quarterly enablement plan and on-demand enablement offerings based on the needs of the segment. Collaborate with your Sales Enablement Business Partner peers from around the world on common needs, and share content and other enablement assets to speed time to impact in your segment.  ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE: A minimum of 8 years of related experience with a focus in enterprise software, sales and enablement. Bachelor’s degree Strong project management skills. Highly organized with excellent communication skills. Ability to manage competing priorities across multiple projects, while meeting deadlines and producing quality deliverables. Business, technical and sales acumen. Understanding of complex sales cycles, processes and methodologies. Ability to lead through influence. Experience working in a fast-changing environment that requires strategic thinking, resourcefulness, agility, results-oriented decision making and commitment to excellence.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?

Qualifications: l  Passionate in promoting green lifestyle (knowledge in vegetarian/vegan product is a plus); l  Degree holder or above in Hospitality or Business Development; l  At least 5 years’ working experience in Business Development or F&B industry is preferable; l  Have project experience is definitely an advantage; l  Excellent command in spoken and written English; l  Proactive, responsible, organized and ability to work in a fast-paced environment; l  A good team player with good interpersonal and communication skills; l  Can travel overseas; l  Candidate with less experience will be considered as Assistant Manager.

description: The Qualtrics XM PlatformTM is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can't imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  Primary Responsibilities Lead a team of 5-6 Enterprise Account Executives based throughout Southeast Asia. Strong communication skills, listen first and speak second, aware of the message being transmitted to the team, how it's delivered, and it's perception. Provide mentoring and guidance on key enterprise motions including collaboration with legal, product presentations, running multiple internal teams and quarterly sales forecasting. Serve as executive sponsor during enterprise level deals. Interface and develop professional relationships with existing clients and prospects throughout organisational levels. Display a systemic approach to leading challenging contract negotiations/deals with multiple reps at a time. Maintain an in-depth knowledge of Qualtrics XM solution offerings. Maintain a real-time understanding of the competitive landscape to assist in determining win-based proposals and pricing. Develop and maintain positive relationships with other functional areas internally at Qualtrics, e.g. Professional Services, Implementation, Subject Matter Experts, etc to ensure a collaborative approach to secure large enterprise engagements Demonstrate experience successfully leading through change in a fast-growing environment. Entrepreneurial approach to effectively leading a business. Qualifications Strong background! Validated winner that has led teams to breakthrough results. Bachelor's degree from a top-accredited university At least 6-8 years of individual enterprise level sales experience At least 2 years managing an enterprise level sales team Experience using Salesforce.com and measuring system compliance Experience over-exceeding quarterly team quotas through metric based skill development and internal team management Experience working on complex contract negotiations Singaporean and PR is preferred. About The Team  We've grown our Enterprise Sales team to respond to very strong client demand for the Qualtrics Insight Platform. This growth has resulted in the need to bring on an exceptional leader with a track record of attracting, developing and motivating an elite team of enterprise SaaS sales professionals.  Our team is a group of highly driven individuals that are intelligent, organized, and dedicated. We work together as a team to accomplish and exceed quarterly and annual objectives. We are a goal-oriented team that works hard and enjoys the incredible trajectory that Qualtrics provides. Our overarching objective is to drive company revenue growth through client success.  What Differentiates Us From Other Companies Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours. We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative workspace. We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees. Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer  Qualtrics provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or veteran status.

description: Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.  Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?  We are looking for a Business Development Manager to join the team and help with our expansion. This role will be based in Singapore.  Responsibilities Build & Manage Portfolio of Products on Binance SG Platform.    Onboard retail/institutional trading clients/partners and maintain strong relationships as well as oversee regulatory and licensing issues. Oversee and set budgeting, P&L and KPIs. Drive client acquisition, new user growth and business development activities. Execute marketing initiatives with merchants and strategic partners to drive greater brand awareness. E.g. Socials, campaigns, communications. Work closely with the product and marketing functions to identify areas of growth and execute growth plans. Proactively monitor the competitor landscape and work with the product and marketing teams to iterate the overall strategy.  Qualifications 4 to 7 years of experience in business development, product or sales function at financial institutions, preferably at retail broker, crypto exchange, investment fund, institutional brokerage or electronic trading firm with a clear track record of meeting and exceeding sales and revenue targets.  A resourceful self-starter and tenacious problem-solver, willing to roll up one’s sleeves to meet client needs and improve client experience Passionate about the crypto industry.  Detail-oriented, results focused individual who can work with minimal supervision. Excellent verbal/ written communication and presentation skills. Ability to easily build rapport with clients. Fluent in English, Mandarin is advantageous due to the focus of the role.

description: The Senior Business Development Rep is responsible for strategic outbound sales activities to Fortune 500 companies. In this role the Sr BDR will work closely with their Account Executives to develop a strategic sales plan mapping out targeted accounts. The BDR will execute the sales plan alongside the Account Executive with the goal of engaging and scheduling a call with the target contact.  Responsibilities You own the full Business Development process including: Prospecting sales leads Account and contact research  Collaboration with Account Executives to sales plan outreach strategy Sending email sales campaigns to prospects Phone outreach to executive/senior level buyers Utilizing additional social channels as needed to prospect leads  Qualifying leads and scheduling calls with prospective accounts Working out of a CRM database Maintaining a full pipeline of sales leads Meet or exceed weekly metrics and quarterly KPI’s  Who we’re looking for: Smart and ambitious people Great verbal and written communicators Natural sales acumen  Ability to engage executive level prospects Outgoing with a “can do” attitude is critical Eager to learn new things daily You love being part of a team and want to make an impact Desire to work in a fast changing environment Critical thinkers ( This is mandatory ) You consider yourself a driven person Desire to progress within your sales career  Requirements Bachelor’s degree Excellent communication skills Proven strong work ethic Desire to excel and advance in a career Competitive attitude Enterprise SDR/sales experience targeting the fortune 500, minimum of 1-2 years + Preferred experience working with executive level buyers for SaaS solutions

description: About REinvent REinvent is Asia’s first innovation studio focused on technologies for the real estate industry (property technology or "PropTech"). REinvent’s mission is to reinvent real estate using its core competencies of technology product development, business model innovation and venture building. REinvent’s in-house invests time and money into a repeatable process that outputs valuable companies. The goal is for every studio-born startup to become a large and profitable standalone PropTech business.  REinvent is an in-house full-time, full-stack technology development organization: product managers, product designers, software engineers, AI engineers, and real estate operators based in offices in Shanghai, Singapore and Taipei. The REinvent team is comprised of experienced veterans from both technology and real estate industries including WeWork, naked Hub, Airbnb, Google, KE Holdings, Bytedance, Alibaba Cloud, Microsoft, Blackboard, Autodesk, and other leading firms.  For more information, please visit reinventventures.com  Location of this position  Open to Singapore and China (Shanghai)   What This Position Does to Help REinvent Succeed?  This is a unique opportunity for an experienced and highly motivated commercial real estate professional.  We expect you to have a successful track record of selling services to co-working operators / commercial real estate landlords and/or selling proptech B2B SaaS.   Our sales team is hardworking, coachable, curious, adaptable with a consultative, diagnostic approach to our sales process. If this describes you and being at the forefront of innovation in the world’s largest market, then we want you on our team!   What Makes This Job Awesome?  Help to reinvent real estate and be at the forefront of technology innovation in the real estate world Become an expert on the REinvent product portfolio  Build a sales pipeline by prospecting new business with executive-level decision makers at the top Commercial Real Estate companies Assuredly present REinvent’s value to C-level executives through product demonstrations and strategy sessions in person and via web tools Translate discovery insights and desired business outcomes into compelling sales strategies that win new business accounts and upsell into expansion accounts Creatively and strategically build consensus across multiple divisions, regions and levels of contacts in a competitive environment (actual competitor or status quo) Effectively utilize a complex network of partners, internal resources and industry experts to win an opportunity Confidently negotiate pricing and sales contracts running point on legal and contract reviews.  Work closely with deployment, professional services and customer support teams to address client requirements and ensure successful implementation and continued use Represent REinvent at in-market events, industry groups, and CRE specific initiatives networking and building relationships with target prospects  What Makes You A Great Fit?  Minimum 10 years of commercial real estate experience including selling services to co-working operators / commercial real estate landlords.  Experience in proptech B2B SaaS will be advantageous  Possesses strong co-working / commercial real estate domain knowledge and is very familiar with their operations   Strong network and having trusted relationships with co-working operators / commercial real estate landlords / brokers  Demonstrated strong sales record in large and complex Enterprise software sale or solution sale advantageous  Inquisitive by nature you are always probing underlying issues that suggest broader solutions and successfully aligning to business outcomes  A critical thinker you understand the customer’s objectives and translate that to sell to a broad set of customer stakeholders  A process-oriented approach you create winning account action plans that drive results  A strong communicator and negotiator with excellent interpersonal, written, and executive level presentation skills  Passionate with a desire to succeed you have demonstrated ability to positively collaborate and engage with a broader team to achieve successful results  Creative thinker, highly organized and efficient in managing multiple projects at once  Willingness and ability to travel (post Covid)
industries: Internet

description: About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. We are currently hiring for Business Development Manager, Mortgages role for Singapore location.(Only for Singapore citizens)  Responsibilities  Engaging affluent and mass market clients for their mortgage requests from internal stakeholders such as marketing campaigns, inbounds mortgage enquiries and also branch walk-in. End to end implementation of mortgage sales process from case processing right up to acceptance of loan offer. Able to perform Networking events, campaigns and show flats etc when required  Qualifications 2+Years of experience and in-depth knowledge in acquiring and Processing Mortgage loans  Knowledge in Singapore real estates market. Regulatory framework for mortgage assessment (eg. MSR, TDSR etc) Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and able to engage customer of all levels with assertiveness. What is there for you ! Immense opportunity to grow along with the organization. Its a great opportunity for someone who is is seeking career excellence, stability, brand name and career growth!  Priti Dubey  Talent Acquisition Partner with Standard Chartered Bank  ROC No.: 201135949D | EA Licence No.: 12C5536 EA Reg. No.: R2096051

description: 200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.  Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years.   About the role  As a Regional Account Manager, you will ensure the delivery of expected outcomes along with providing high quality services to our customers. It will be your responsibility to come up with strategies to develop and/or maintain Bollore’s position with existing and prospective accounts. You will also be required to work cross-functionally to participate in tender opportunities, draft legal contracts, as well as generate performance reports.  As our team is currently expanding in various verticals, prior experience in F&F, FMCG, Automotive, Chemical or Pharmaceutical/ Healthcare verticals would be advantageous.   What you will be doing  Extend Bollore’s reach within existing network Identify key account targets in ASPAC Send sales leads to network in order to increase Bollore Logistics’ presence in ASPAC Establish a referencing strategy for regional or international accounts Develop relationships with prospective key accounts to promote Bollore Logistics and obtain the opportunity to participate in future tenders Implement new business strategies to gather sales leads and expand customer base  Service support Determine a tariff policy in conjunction with Middle Office and Regional Sales Management Participate in negotiations with suppliers Monitor customer account profitability and problems linked to receipts with site managers Transfer obtained contracts to Operations team in order to provide high quality service to customers Support services or operation sites through advising on relevant SOPs  Synthesis of information Consolidate statistical elements from various operations for reporting purposes Report sales actions undertaken to further develop key customer accounts Update CRM with weekly activities and monthly reports for key accounts   The ideal candidate  Essential: Bachelor’s degree and above At least 10 years’ experience in a fast paced and dynamic MNC environment Prior experience in the logistics/warehousing industry Prior experience in key account management (preferably in ASPAC region)  Desirable: Prior experience in F&F, FMCG, Automotive, Chemical or Pharmaceutical/ Healthcare verticals Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office suite Good sales and analytical skills Customer-centric mindset Self-starter Strong interpersonal skills Highly adaptable  Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: About Cashapon Aims to be Southeast Asia's premier ecommerce enabler, providing innovative solutions that boost productivity and maximise sales opportunities for top brands through online channels. Cashapon Team is made up of highly ambitious individuals driven to innovate, build and succeed and is always looking for like-minded self-starters to join. Key Responsibilities: The Key Account Manager will be a key contact point for End to End process and services including, internal & external function. Internal function includes e-commerce Marketing, day to day operation, Customer service, and technology functions to manage Cashapon service to brand and improve the customer experience. Developing relationship with marketplace and new channel is also key part to drive client’s sales coverage and growth. Managing brand and channel portfolio to deliver growth to clients. The ideal candidate would have key skills as fast learner, high interpersonal skill, logical thinking, problem solving, high responsibility, prioritizing and initiative thinking. The role will require a combination of financial, business development and account management skills. Job description: Performance Management • Manage overall account profitability via P&L management • Ensure all clients and channels are successfully on-boarded on time and deliver KPI on track • Manage to maximize GMV with day-to-day collaboration with client and channels • Customer budget management and P&L execution including reimbursement to deliver agreed GMV, Take Rate, and Profit • Ensuring optimal product presentation and visibility on online channels • Leading all initiatives Across different services • Coordinating with internal cross function and external parties • Establish and monitor progress against key performance indicators. Partner Service • Responsible for client relationship and retain client satisfaction • Serve as the “face of aCommerce” and primary point of contact for client executives and key stakeholders at each assigned account • Advising clients on how to increase online sales through merchandising, promotion planning and onsite marketing activities • Managing fast-growing e-commerce sales of large brand owners through their own webstore or other online channels and initiative channel • Ensuring that regular reviews are carried out with customers, to ensure that their needs are being met and that excellent customer service is achieved and, developing future improvements/services for the customers. • Ensure operational performance on all areas • Identifies and anticipates additional opportunities for enhancements, improvements or new services with existing clients • Inventory management including forecast, ordering and DOH controlling • Works with other departments to ensure that everything is ready for go-live; Ensures that no processes or set up have been overlooked • Present analysis and recommendations to key stakeholders both client-side and internally Leadership and team work • Individual contributor in key account • Able to lead project relating with responsible account and category • Able to be mentor for key specialist that leads from account activities • Able share knowledge and team player Business Development • Contract Management by helping translate the outlined solution into a high level initial statement of work (SOW) and helps secure the client's agreement in sales meetings with the prospect or client (system & integration options, cost model, forecast value, activity planning, requirements definition, etc.) • Working closely with Solution design and business development to manage key customers (existing and new), thereby improving turnover and profitability • SOW & Trade Agreement management for existing account and input industry insight to SD for new customer. Key Qualifications • 2 year++ working experience in an Ecommerce company, Internet start-up, International Brand, FMCG, retailer or consulting • Previous experience in trade marketing, brand management, merchandising would be a plus. • Able to develop account plan • Good knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint and ability to quickly adapt to new software and tools • Proactive and problem-solving attitude • Very strong commercial English as well as client-facing abilities • Analytical, data driven mindset • High interpersonal skill with problem solving

We are looking for a Strategic Account Manager with a strong background in business development and sales. This role will be based in our Singapore office, and will be instrumental in taking a dynamic organisation to the next stage of its growth. You will have significant experience of closing SaaS or software business into financial institutions and be an instinctive and natural ‘hunter’.  You will be responsible for managing a portfolio of key client accounts and establishing yourself as a ‘trusted advisor’. To be successful in this role, you will have experience of engaging with senior level stakeholders, feel comfortable with sales at an enterprise level, and have the gravitas, personality, and ability to represent Xceptor at the highest level.  This is an individual contributor role, demanding a high level of strategic thinking, autonomy, and the ability to be a part of an entrepreneurial business in significant growth mode. The right candidate will be open to the challenges that this ‘start-up’ mentality may present.  RESPONSIBILITIES Manage and strategically develop a portfolio of key strategic accounts (existing and target). Deliver an annual net revenue target of license sales, through upselling and new business. Establish fundamental account plans and go to market campaigns built around our value propositions. Drive all aspects of the sales process, including: relationship management, product demonstrations, client workshops, contract negotiation and sales closing. Qualify leads through the evaluation of requirements and the development of a concise understanding of any decision-making processes and criteria. Work closely with the wider team to drive the delivery of new business wins. Develop relationships with decision-influencing senior executives within prospect organisations, both within IT and the Business. Build and leverage a network of existing and prospective clients.  EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS Significant experience of Financial Services SaaS and/or software license sales. Demonstrated sales experience and a proven track record of winning business within Financial Services institutions. Solution driven sales professional with a proven record of achieving /exceeding annual quota target. Able to demonstrate an understanding of the dynamics involved in selling SaaS & software licenses. Independent in identifying, managing, and developing strategic accounts. Experience of sales processes involving multiple tiers of complex organisations, and where the sales cycles are long and consultative. High level of gravitas, with experience of engaging with senior level stakeholders. Highly competent in delivering product presentations, managing client workshops, and proof of concepts. Strong commercial awareness with a high level of EQ. Excellent client facing, communication and interpersonal skills. A self-starter, who is naturally driven, ambitious and tenacious. Familiar with smaller company mentality.  In return we will offer exposure to global, blue-chip clients and an unparalleled experience of best practice. This is a fast-paced, dynamic, and highly collaborative environment where there are significant opportunities for growth and development.  Xceptor is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion, or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic, or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
industries: Financial Services

description: Job Purpose With more than 15,000 clients worldwide and over 175 years in business, Accuity a LexisNexis Risk Solutions company, is looking for a junior ambitious Sales person for the role of  Business Development Executive, Financial Crime Compliance, South East Asia based in Singapore.  The successful candidate will have the ability to plan, prospect, cold call/cold connect and maintain high levels of activity that lead to create new opportunities with new and existing customers across a diverse region and vertical industries.  Reporting directly to the Sales Manager, South East Asia, through sales of Accuity & LexisNexis Risk Solutions Financial Crime Compliance (FCC) solutions – you, will be responsible for acquiring new logo business by actively promote our hosted solutions to grow our risk & compliance business from the ground up in the region. You will plan and execute the ‘Go To Market’ strategy for this growing space in Accuity and maximise lead generation and build our engagement and participation in the surrounding FCC community.  -------------------------------------       To achieve sales targets by acquiring new business from prospects through sales of Accuity FCC solutions within South East Asia region.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:  Sales Activity Identifies new business opportunities to increase penetration and growth of new logos for Accuity’s FCC solutions Plans, organises and executes sales campaigns in order to develop revenue opportunities and to maximise revenue growth Holds themselves accountable to deliver against high activity and sales KPIs and objectives as assigned by management Reports and Forecasts on performance against objectives on a regular basis through SalesForce Plans, builds and maintains accurate and informative prospect and customer records using Salesforce Creates account plans for significant prospects to ensure the successful management of opportunities in line with agreed expectations Be able to build relationships and collaborate with external/internal stakeholders      Relationship Management Regular contact with prospects and existing customers to develop relationships to better understand their business, their goals and their requirements Drives Referral based activities to expand account opportunities and influence Establishes strong working relationships with all other areas of Lexis Nexis Risk Solutions in order to create and execute effective GTM plans Delivers a high level of customer satisfaction through a consultative sales approach Shares best practice across the sales team  Market Knowledge Keeps abreast of any changes in the industry/market by talking to customers, industry experts, partners and own research; and interprets the changes and the effects this will have on the solutions Updates line managers and team on industry trends, developments and potential opportunities. Monitors competitor activity in the market place – records and shares information and responds accordingly  KEY SKILLS REQUIRED: Direct B2B sales, preferably international New business sales experience, hunter mentality Good in Network building Comfortable in fast paced, high activity role and environment Data / software solutions sales Excellent Communication skills Proactive and self-motivated Excellent Organisation skills Results driven Numeracy and analytical IT literacy Fluent in English, a local language in SEA region would be an advantage
industries: Financial Services

description: Who we are: At Mitto, we’re on a mission to deliver reliable, high-quality communications between businesses and their customers, every time.   Our company was founded in 2013 with the specific aim of building a state-of-the-art Application-to-Person (A2P) SMS messaging platform, unrivalled in reliability, that could support the requirements of a new wave of A2P services. As the demand grew for enablement of omnichannel communications capabilities, we expanded our portfolio beyond SMS to now include voice, chat bots, all major chat apps (WhatsApp, Viber, Facebook Messenger, etc.), Google Business Messaging, RCS, myriad CRM and marketing platform integrations and, most recently, pre-built tools for bulk campaigns and conversational support chats.  Simply put, we make communication happen… and you can help.  We are looking for an ambitious and sales-driven Business Development Executive located in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore to work on identifying, opening, and growing new accounts in the telecoms, Internet, and mobile app markets across the region.  What you’ll do:  Be responsible for sales and closing of the new business opportunities in the region. Manage clients located in the APAC region and be responsible for their growth. Contribute by helping with a relationship with Mitto´s key accounts in the region Identify prospects, build pipelines, and close deals ensuring long-term revenue plans. Work together with the operations team to deploy the service offered to the client and manage the account according to the Mitto team strategy. Prioritise and deliver a superior customer experience to strategic customers in the region. Participate in answering global clients RFP for cloud telecommunications support. Continuously work with the client to identify needs and propose solutions making an impact on the Mitto product roadmap  You need to bring with you: University degree or equivalent practical experience. Fluent in English. Ability to work under pressure and quickly grasp a good understanding of trends driving innovation in technology, specifically in mobile, cloud and consumer areas. Willingness to work with an international team. Experience in building strong relationships with decision-makers. Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills. Excellent customer service skills with a customer-driven focus and the ability to adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment. Ability to work cross-functionally both internally and externally to execute deals. Self-motivated with a passion for sales and the ability to thrive in a results-driven environment 3+ years of B2B sales experience in the mobile solutions sector (SMS, Voice, and similar)  What we offer: A fast-paced, start-up like environment where every team member makes a direct impact on our collective success Resources and leadership to help grow your skills and advance your career Collaboration with talented individuals in various locations throughout the world Access to cutting-edge technology and its application across global markets with leading brands Competitive benefits to ensure your health, wellness, and happiness so you can enjoy the full experience of life at Mitto. Freedom to work remotely from anywhere in the APAC region
industries: Information Technology and Services and Telecommunications

description: Regional Sales Manager, Japan and Korea Our mission is “…to safely deliver life-saving products” the products we make are geared towards healthcare companies who require the highest level of quality and care. As a result, we are looking for people who understand the importance of a higher purpose. The inside sales manager serves that function by ensuring our customers are getting the right service and products, specific to their needs. This role requires a good understanding of consultative sales, solution and interdisciplinary collaboration experience are a must to be successful. The role is responsible for developing cross-functional relationships with new and existing customers in a culturally and geographically diverse market. The inside sales manager must have an ability to consistently follow-up and bring multi-year projects to a close, while meeting quarterly and annual performance objectives. The primary role objectives are: Responsibilities: Sales Growth - Develop and maintain good relationships for given territory - Support global key accounts in territory and share insights and intelligence within global sales organization - Consistently update and work from customer relationship management (CRM) tool - Develop new customers and new business to meet territory sales growth objectives - Follow up quickly on marketing leads generated, ensure consistent messages and needs are addressed when leads are routed - Promote company products and capabilities via customer meetings, industry exhibitions and technical seminars - Develop adjacent industry relationships with companies serving healthcare manufacturers - Attend regional association meetings, networking and become member as necessary to expand Oliver’s presence in the region - Interface regularly with commercial leaders regarding new product and new market opportunities - Identify target accounts and create a strategy for closing new business - Uncover price targets and competitive information - Tailor conference calls and pitch to meet the needs of different buyer personas and market applications  Account Maintenance - This role covers Japan & Korea market - Understand the customer’s market, financial results, and buying cycles - Manage account forecasts and assist with budget process at year end - Capture and communicate competitor activities - Maintain great customer relationships and maintain high level of customer satisfaction - Maintain marketing databases including lead follow up and maintenance from existing accounts - Communicate customer specifications and requirements to manufacturing, process engineering, production planning, graphic production areas, etc. - Work internally to negotiate accurate ship dates that are close to the customer’s request date - Expedite all customer requests for rushed deliveries, and communicates schedule request changes to production planning and manufacturing departments - Captures all customer complaints and tracks them in accordance with established practices and procedures  Requirements: - Bilingual in English, Japanese and/or Korean to liaise with customers from Japan and Korea - B.S. in Marketing, Sales, General Business, Engineering or closely related field. - 4+ years of successful business development experience required - A record of building great customer relationships - Strong presentation skills required - Strong negotiating and closing skills - Computer and business writing competency - Ability to travel 50% of the time internationally
industries: Packaging and Containers

description: About Us   Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise and a global network of innovation and delivery centers. A part of the Tata group, India’s largest industrial conglomerate, TCS has over 480,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 46 countries.  As an employer, TCS is dedicated to hire, develop, motivate and preserve the brightest talent. We offer a successful career that would be driven by boundless growth opportunities while working with cutting-edge technologies, learning platforms, exposure across domains and various roles that are equipped with a flexibility that allows you to discover and achieve your true potential. We encourage talent diversity and believe that this enrichens and deepens our organisation. Having one of the lowest market attrition rates, and being bestowed with several HR and employer of choice awards, is testament to our positive and collaborative HR and employee practices.   TCS Singapore is the headquarter of TCS Asia Pacific, and has been in operations since 30 years. We maintain our Global presence and ranking in Singapore as well, having a prestigious Global and Local clientele and significant employee base. We now look forward to taking the organisation to the next level, and are looking at onboarding the talent that will help us achieve our goals.   Who are we looking for, and Why?  With exciting times ahead, we are confident that our technology and domain offerings, will address the constant demand from our expanding clientele. In order to achieve our goals, we are looking at strengthening our Sales and Account Executive teams, and build the leadership that will take our organisation forward. We are specifically looking at Sales executives, who have experience in the BFSI sector, having demonstrated proven results in your prior experience. Any references provided in your application(from your contacts and network) will be an added bonus on your application. While we are looking for experienced individuals, there is no minimum experience requirement as long as your profile can be of value to our organisation!  What the role promises?  As part of being a Sales Executive for TCS, you will be...  the face of a global brand with an established presence around the world and the region.  interacting with top-tier companies in the industry and be responsible for pursuing partnerships and securing orders/contracts. educated in the full suite of our services and products, so you are adequately equipped to represent TCS. driving innovative client solutions and contributing towards organisational growth and a positive customer experience. defining the sales strategy for your respective portfolio, executing the strategy to expand TCS' presence, driving topline/bottomline growth.  Responsibilities and Expectations  Secure contracts/ engagement with target customers and achieve sales targets Collaborate with Country Management and Leadership on logo/deal pursuits, with periodic reporting. Work closely with internal solution and pre-sales teams to drive and devise solutions and proposals that are relevant to the target customer Engage proactively, intelligently and collaboratively with target customer stakeholders, build long-term relationships, secure a place in preferred vendor list, aim towards building a partner credibility and developing a mutually beneficial relationship Be result-oriented in securing and acquiring customers, goal oriented towards the assigned financial targets, highly driven and motivated to create an environment of energy and positivity, confident and creative in managing discussions and conversations with inter/external stakeholders Keep abreast with industry trends, customer trends, technology advancement; build a network of professionals inside/outside the organisation Manage high pressure work environment demands, commit to deadline/target driven business plans Be flexible towards working hours whenever the need arises, readiness to travel frequently within/outside Singapore   Expected Skills and Qualities  Strong visual and creative presentation skills. Good Business Acumen, and demonstrated leadership skills. Ability to communicate and network confidently and effectively with all levels of management and functional disciplines, both within and outside the organization Know-how of sales cycles, deal constructs with proven negotiation skills. Organized, independent, resourceful, self-motivated and highly driven to thrive in a fast pace and challenging environment Result-oriented and solution-focused, committed to sales target and timeline

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What we're looking for:  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  Are you looking to build something greater than yourself? Do you want to work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people in the industry? If so, this might be the place for you. We'll help you build your career in Sales while you collaborate with a diverse team of talented individuals. You are a self starter who is deeply passionate about customer happiness.  We are looking for a highly motivated Business Development Representative to join our fast growing Sales organisation.  What You’ll Be Doing …  Work directly with Account Executives (Mid Market, Enterprise & Large Enterprise) to drive pipeline through personalized outreach to multiple stakeholders within Slack’s key prospect & customer accounts Providing a world-class prospect and customer experience through every interaction Become a product expert and learn Slack's selling practices Keep meticulous records of interactions with leads in our CRM (Salesforce.com) Help to build scalable demand generation campaigns based on data Identify inefficiencies and implement improvements in our process  Who You Are …  2+ years of experience in sales, preferably in SaaS Fluency in English Commitment to pursuing a career in sales Consistent track record of overachieving Empathic listener and persuasive communicator Competitive, resilient, and highly motivated A great attitude and love for teamwork Bachelor’s degree required  About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: SalesTribe has exclusively partnered with one of the most exciting tech unicorns around - Deel. As part of a wider APAC build-out, they are looking to hire a talented Account Executive to help rapidly grow the South East Asian market.  Deel sees a world without borders, empowering businesses to hire the best person for the job, wherever they are. Currently, Deel enables companies to hire people in 25 countries and counting. It’s fast, delightful, and compliant. Deel is truly changing the game. Until now, hiring internationally has been expensive, difficult, and time-consuming. Now, in 15 minutes clients can have their hires signed up with a fully compliant contract and ready to go.  Deel is the market leader in international payroll and compliance. With over $200 million raised from Andreessen Horowitz, Spark Capital, Y Combinator, Elad Gil, Nat Friedman, Alexis Ohanian, and Daniel Gross, there's never been a more exciting time to join the team.  What will you do?  Represent Deel’s products to the ASEAN market. Sell into enterprise, mid-market, and SME customers. Manage assigned customer relationships, building a deep understanding of their business needs and how they can maximise their investment in Deel. Drive top-line profitability through the high-impact top-of-the-funnel sales activity. Bring energy, drive, and ambition to one of the world’s most exciting tech vendors!  What do you have?  Experience in an AE or similar sales role in a high-growth tech environment. A real love of building long-lasting customer relationships A can-do, high-energy attitude. An ability to communicate succinctly and translate complex business issues into simple terms. High adaptability to fit into an ever-changing start-up environment.  What's on offer in return?  Life-changing Pre-IPO equity. A truly flexible work environment – work wherever you want! Learning and development budget for self-improvement. All the latest tech you need to make you successful. The joy of selling technology that customers love.  If you would like to discuss this role further, please apply or contact Peter Dowling +65 97980122 or by sending CV to peter@salestribe.com

description: About Us  At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.  We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!  About The Department  Account Executives, Business Development Representatives, Solution Engineers, and Customer Success - all working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences. The sales team at Cloudflare helps customers solve real, technical problems while creating the revenue streams that help the company provide free service to millions in our community.  What You'll Do  The Expansion Account Manager role is the specialization area of our sales organization that focuses on growing customer wallet share within the Cloudflare customer base by identifying, qualifying, and closing expansion opportunities.Reporting to the Head of Sales, APAC & Japan, you will conduct regular business reviews with Cloudflare customers in your assigned territories on optimization recommendations and new product offerings.You will work closely with cross-functional teams such as Customer Success and Solutions Engineering to ensure customers are experiencing excellent product outcomes. The ideal candidate will possess both an account management and technical background, to drive engagement with decision-makers and influencers within network & security operations, development and technical infrastructure teams.  Other Responsibilities Include Expanding sales into existing accounts within assigned territories, with strong forecast and funnel management. Delivering regular outbound campaigns on new product updates, partnering with Customer Success and Solutions Engineering resources. Conduct data driven conversations to cultivate new product pipeline and upsell opportunities. Delivering commercial outcomes by running a consistent sales process and setting next step expectations and contract negotiations with customers. Understanding customer use-cases and how they pair with Cloudflare’s portfolio solutions in order to identify new cross-sale opportunities. Evaluating core usage trends and articulate value to show Cloudflare impact and provide strategic recommendations during business reviews. Networking across different business units with each of your accounts, and m ulti-thread to identify and engage new divisional buyers. Operate internally as a liaison with cross-functional teams to share key customer feedback and insights to improve customer experience and further investments with Cloudflare. Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience 3-4 years+ managing and growing a portfolio of relationships with enterprise buyers in SAARC. Basic understanding of computer networking and “how the internet works” Aptitude for learning technical concepts/terms (Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus) Prior pipeline generation and closing sales experience in strategic selling to the enterprise. Managing a full sales process from demand to close for install base of customers Building strong, trusting relationships with customers and internal stakeholders Proven track record of performance (top 10-20% of company) in past sales positions Self-motivated, Analytical, and Entrepreneurial spirit with hunter sales capabilities Comfortable working in a fast paced dynamic environment Travel < 30% within assigned territories What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Computer & Network Security

description: Globalization Partners’ automated, AI-driven global employment platform, designed by our technical teams and powered by our worldwide HR experts, enables our customers to hire, onboard, and manage the best talent they can find, anywhere in the world.    As the leader in the Employer of Record industry, we simplify global business by allowing companies to grow to new countries and test new markets compliantly, without the hassle of setting up branch offices or subsidiaries.   With diverse teams all around the world, our people are the heartbeat of the company and the reason why Globalization Partners is a fun and inclusive place to work. We encourage and support personal growth and career development, trust our team members with the autonomy to do their best work, and believe in recognition for a job well done.    Did we mention you can experience all of this while working remotely? As a remote-first employer, we value your experience and skills more than where you are located. Join our collaborative work environment where you can make a real impact and love the work you’re doing!   About the position: As a Sales Executive, you will be joining a team that is laser-focused on taking over the world, building a company we are proud of, and meeting the needs of 30,000 employers hiring internationally. With our record of phenomenal growth, we need to recruit the best of the best, with the potential to grow with us as we expand.   What you will do:  You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle, reaching out and follow-up on both incoming and self-generated leads, proposals through to deal close. Although we close sales on the phone, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy and exceptional attention to detail, who is focused on outstanding client experience from the very first contact with Globalization Partners. Your responsibilities include: Follow up on company-sourced and self-generated leads from multiple sources including website, partners, sales team, trade shows, marketing campaigns, etc.  Proactively call prospects, build relationships by understanding their business and challenges  Educate prospects on the opportunities and benefits of our solution  Draft and follow up on proposals, overcome objections and close sales, while working to a quarterly sales target  Maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics  Identify potential prospects through LinkedIn, news feeds, online research, etc.  Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive  Maintain high quality data in Salesforce   What we are looking for:  We are creating this company together as a team, so it is incredibly important that we have the best and brightest people all working together towards our common goals. In order to be successful in the role, we look for the following:  Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business or finance discipline  2-4 years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets and selling to C-Level  Experience in global operations, or a B2B product with a financial focus, is a plus  Structured Sales training in established sales methodologies is a plus  International work and/or travel experience a strong plus. Experience working in a startup environment, an advantage  Outstanding communication skills both written and verbal, with excellent English language skills Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred  Ability to build and develop excellent customer relationships   About Globalization Partners Hire anyone, anywhere, quickly and easily. Globalization Partners AI- driven, automated, fully compliant global Employer of Record platform technology is transforming how companies hire talent around the globe. Our industry-leading proprietary technology simplifies onboarding and managing employees anywhere in the world. With easy-to-use dashboards and a mobile-ready payroll authorization system, our customers can safely and securely access crucial HR documents and authorize and approve global payroll faster than ever. Globalization Partners: Breaking Down Barriers for Everyone, Everywhere

description: Summary  Atome believes that there is always a smarter way to achieve your aspirations. Through the power of AI, savvy consumers can now access a diverse range of lifestyle brands and services immediately by paying their purchases through 3 interest-free payments.  Atome is one of the biggest Buy Now Pay Later players in South East Asia and is rapidly expanding across the region. In Singapore, Atome is now offered by more than 1,000 fashion, beauty, electronics, furniture retailers across the country - including Novelship. Playdress, Jurlique, iStudio, Dr. Martens, IDS Clinic and many others. Customers can simply scan the QR code at our partnered retailers or choose Atome at checkout on our partnered retailer websites to enjoy the payment service.  Atome is on a mission to uplift everyone’s quality of life, no one should be without.  The Role Atome is looking for an energetic, dynamic sales and business development go-getter to build and expand relationships with top-tier retailers that will create tremendous value to the business. You will be the first point of contact of the retailers - whether they are the business owners of an up and coming brand or a C-level key decision-maker in a well-established company.   The ideal candidate thrives in a challenging fast-paced environment, is passionate about building strong relationships with retailers and possesses the hustle to create new opportunities and close them. You will lead a territory that you are passionate about and connected with, and own the performance of the territory like your business.   You will be joining a fast-growing team and have the unique opportunity to shape how our product is built and our business is run in Singapore!   Job Description Source, negotiate and sign partnership with the top-tier, mid to small-sized retailers in your categories Propose deal terms in accelerating close won rate while maintaining margin Manage the sales pipeline carefully to ensure accurate data and hygiene are updated in the system Constantly build relationships with important networks through leveraging existing networks, and attending industry events to secure the 1st meeting with the key decision-makers Continuously refreshing sales pipeline by sourcing up and coming players Use competitive insights to inform selling strategies and strategic directions  Collaborate with cross-functional teams including operations, marketing, customer success   Minimum Qualifications 5+ years experience in sales or business development role, B2B sales experience is a plus Demonstrated track record of developing new opportunities, closing top-tier accounts and exceeding sales target Success in selling to, working with and building relationship with c-level decision makers in top-tier retailers, fortune 500 companies and business owners Excel in managing multiple retailers concurrently and closing deals quickly Highly developed interpersonal skills with your own styles - ability to build relationships with literally anyone High energy, passionate and always be hustling mentality Strong desire in working in a start-up environment and comfortable with always be evolving sales processes Existing network in fashion, beauty, e-commerce top-tiers accounts is a plus Highly self-motivated with the ability to work fast and smart independently Excellent communication, organizational and time management skills
