description: Zebra Insights Group serves clients in financial services, law, insurance, diverse corporate sectors and strategy consulting. We design innovative and differentiated content ideas for our clients' worldwide conferences and events of all sizes.   On behalf of our clients, we build relationships with senior executives, industry experts and keynote speakers across diverse sectors. We invite them to share their strategic insights and knowledge at our clients' events globally. The speaking engagements comprise a variety of formats including video calls, virtual roundtable discussions, keynote presentations at conferences, etc.  Zebra Insights Group seeks a Sales and Business Development Manager for its Singapore office in a full-time job role. Working closely with the management team, you will be the face of the company and will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities to generate revenue, improve profitability and help the business grow.    If you have an innovative mindset that enables you to come up with unique ideas to elevate company sales, if you have a passion for sales and have the dedication to create and apply an effective sales strategy, to dive right in, take the lead and use initiative, then this role is for you.  Your responsibilities:  ·       Research and identify new sales opportunities as a hunter in client sectors such as banking, large corporates (industries such as pharma, tech, property/real estate, insurance, etc), management and strategy consulting firms and non-profits ·       Building relationships with partner companies who bring you deal flow ·       Develop and implement your own outbound sales and business development strategy, and sales pipeline in accordance with your targets that will deliver results ·       Be cognizant of market trends and customer needs, using them to uncover sales opportunities  ·       Screen and qualify potential opportunities, selecting those with high likelihood of winning the deal  ·       Meet with prospects and clients face to face, via video call or over the phone ·       Foster and develop relationships with prospects with the goal to turn them into long term clients ·       Create informative presentations and deliver information to potential clients at sales meetings ·       Create and maintain list/database of prospects and current clients in CRM tool ·       Cold calling: making multiple outbound calls to prospects to uncover new buyers ·       Warm calling: leverage existing relationships to approach new buyers in the same organization and through referrals ·       Managing the sales process from A to Z ·       Constantly check business news and be knowledgeable about market trends & changes ·       Communicate daily with colleagues in Asia and Europe                         What we are looking for:   ·       Proven working experience as a business development manager, sales executive or a relevant role involving proactively hunting for new sales opportunities  ·       Successful track record in B2B sales and negotiation ·       Complete fluency in both written and spoken English is mandatory ·       Excellent verbal and written communication skills needed for communicating with a range of people, both internally and externally, as well as presentation skills ·       Interpersonal skills for building and developing relationships with clients ·       Experience working with people across different markets and countries ·       Experience cold calling is a must ·       Experience in customer support or account management is a plus ·       Tenacity and drive to seek new business and exceed targets ·       Ability to pivot and flourish in an environment of fast and frequent change (adaptability) and minimal guidance ·       Ability to act in a tactful and diplomatic manner and work on sensitive issues with a diverse group of individuals ·       Initiative and the confidence to explore new avenues ·       Strong business acumen; ability to understand the interests of a market ·       A bachelor's degree preferred ·       Familiarity with using LinkedIn as a sales tool   What we offer:  ·       Competitive salary for full time role  ·       Career development opportunities within the company ·       Position related on-and-off-the-desk training  ·       A great team dynamic in a corporate environment   To apply, please provide:  ·       CV and cover letter explaining in detail your skills for this position ·       Desired salary ·       Employment availability date  Please send your CV to: careers@zebrainsights.com until October 21, 2021.  www.ZebraInsights.com/careers

About the job iText is looking for a Sales Executive in Singapore, to join its APAC team. In this role you will be responsible to help iText gain more international exposure in the APAC region by selling into existing and new customers.   What you will do You will manage incoming inquiries and undertake outbound activities to secure sales of iText software in existing customers and new markets You will sell iText licenses within your region You will proactively engage with prospects via telephone and email to understand their requirements and use cases to be able to position iText solutions. Identify and manage new sales opportunities withing existing and prospect accounts (upselling and cross selling). Generate new opportunities by identifying and contacting prospects withing targeted markets (outbound selling). For this you will work closely with our marketing team by lead generation. Maintain and oversee records within CRM.  You will report to the Head of APAC sales.  What you bring Bachelor degree or higher You have 3 to 5 years of sales experience in a B2B software industry/ technology environment.  You have a proven track record of over-achievement of sales quota. You have experience with different sales methods.  Because of you background in a technology environment, you feel comfortable talking to more technical profiles (software developers, - architects, IT Managers, …). You have great written and verbal communication skills in English. Knowledge of any other language is a plus. Customer centric and outgoing personality.  You will thrive in this role if You have a passion for Sales in a B2B software environment. You are comfortable working in a fast paced, constantly changing environment. You had international exposure, working with clients throughout the APAC region. You show a high level of commitment to exceptional customer service and relationships. You have experience in use of CRM Software, MS Dynamics preferred.

description: Egencia is changing the way corporations manage their travel programs and is seeking a professional sales specialist to drive our leadership in corporate travel. The Global Sales Manager will be selling into global Singapore based companies with footprints across all regions; North America (NA) Asia Pacific (APAC), Latin America and European markets. The objective of this position is to develop multi-dimensional relationships with global customers and provide customized solutions for their worldwide travel needs.  This position requires a customer centric approach with tried skills in pipeline management, platform selling, negotiation; understand complex systems and processes. With effective communication and a strong knowledge of market trends, will assist to understand the impact on business needs and travel solutions. This position will be representing the Egencia brand through verbal, written and formal presentations to potential customers at all levels.  The individual must be a great teammate, biased to action, self-motivated, highly organized, high energy, integrity, humility and can function effectively in an un-structured environment.  Egencia makes business travel better. Combining technology and service, we build a seamless experience, where companies have access to a user-friendly interface, extensive travel options, and 24/7 global support. Join our mission and help us take the next steps in transforming the world of business travel.  What You’ll Do The ability to understand product capabilities and communicate the value and differentiation of a service offering in the market. Grow Egencia portfolio and revenue with new customers headquartered in Singapore by playing an active role in value proposition selling and contract negotiation Once requirements are clearly identified, promote competitive advantages and Egencia’s outstanding value proposition through proposal, RFI/RFPs and presentations Connect with prospects (from discovery meeting to closing) and build a high-level relationship with executives (CFOs, CEOs) Responsible for contract closing and implementation of customers with the implementation team Selling the right solution, to ensure that the customer transitions from implementation to trade Sign profitable business to meet quarterly goals, in line with Egencia’s pricing schedules Work collaboratively and establish relationships with internal teams Who You Are  You’ll be great for this role if you have the following: Excellent communication skills, including written and oral Strong listening skills with to interpret the customers’ needs Validated sales experience in pipeline management including negotiation skills Ability to effectively address key decisions makers in a very competitive and innovating environment Minimum 4 years Sales experience with a consistent track record in hitting quarterly sales targets Organized and structured High level of dynamism, drive, and energy - great teammate Strong commitment to both a high quality of work and service to customers in a fast-paced environment Proficient level of experience with MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word Graduate level education is desired Position requires some travel, sometimes to international locations A good knowledge of the corporate travel industry and/or platform selling (desired but not essential) Egencia started out by disrupting the business travel technology industry and we haven’t stopped since. We are purpose-built to provide the industry’s best travel management experience – and we’re continually investing to make it even better, faster, and easier for people to connect with confidence. Learn more at egencia.com and follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn.  Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

jobTitle: Sales Performance Consultant, LinkedIn Talent Solutions
description: Company Description  LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.  Job Description  We are seeking a Sales Performance Consultant (SPC) to join the Sales Readiness team in LinkedIn Talent Solutions (LTS), a business that combines our expertise in hiring, learning and engagement. This SPC will partner with regional sales leadership to align sales enablement strategies to key business priorities focused on driving learning effectiveness across the field and leadership teams in the APAC region. This is an exciting opportunity to create and drive impact for LinkedIn Talent Solutions and across our APAC business!  The SPC team manages the business relationships - they are aligned with specific regions and segments and serve as an extension of those sales leadership teams. Their remit is to enable and empower the field and sales managers in their region/segment to do the best work of their careers. To raise the bar in how we think about Sales Excellence, and to embrace learning and growth across Sales Competencies, Sales Methodology, Sales Process, and Sales Coaching. This team takes learning programs that are built centrally for scale and customizes them to meet the unique needs and nuances of their region/segment. They provide key input into the centralized program management team, to ensure programs are being built in a way that will best drive value in-market. SPCs bring learning insights to their business and their sales leaders to drive recommendations on where we should prioritize and focus learning programs to close gaps, or to achieve specific business goals. This team is essential to making learning land, stick, and drive meaningful value for our global business.  This person will partner with sales to drive learning effectiveness and business impact across the Asia and APAC Learning & Engagement teams. Your role as the SPC is to be an extension of the sales team and provide individualized learning and relevancy with our sales methodology as the foundation. What do great learning experiences look like in this new future of work? How do you partner with the sales leadership team to collaborate deeply, seek leverage programmatically, and measure success? This SPC is passionate about learning (and reinforcement/learning stickiness), they possess the ability to coach and teach, they have deep business acumen and build strong relationships with our sales leaders, they are energetic around owning end-to-end programs themselves and they are innovative, future-focused thinkers. This person needs to be comfortable operating in ambiguity with open-mindedness, agility, positivity, and a continuous commitment to iterating and improving.  Responsibilities Partner with sales teams to create recommendations for driving impact to the business, plan and execute the sales enablement strategies. Serve as a key partner to the sales team and establish a trusted partnership in developing learning strategies Consult with leaders, including learning & development planning, team development, management and coaching Consults with leaders to assess and analyze the learning needs of employees based on current and future strategic plans Measure and evaluate the ROI of sales enablement programs, tied directly to core sales competencies and direct impact to key business metrics Manage stakeholders – build relationships, ongoing communication, bring others with you along the journey Identify gaps that centralized programs aren’t solving for – build learning programs to close these gaps Create an enablement strategy around using tech to surface wins and drive learning reinforcement (i.e. Gong, Teams, etc.) Collaborate closely with Sales Readiness colleagues across APAC and in other regions (EMEAL & NAMER) to ensure we scale globally, think locally Collaborate cross-functionally to uncover business needs and skills gaps, and deliver best in class development for sales professionals Delivers high quality sales training and practice workshops Drive programmatic changes to sales development approach driven by measurement outcomes to continue to demand excellence Qualifications  Basic Qualifications 4+ years of professional experience working in sales, sales readiness, sales enablement or marketing Preferred Qualifications Adept at presenting and public speaking Modern learning obsessed – passionate about knowing the technology and trends that can make learning stick Experience collaborating with cross functional teams Project and program management experience Exceptional communication – know your audience, articulate the “so what?” Experience deploying change and an understanding of change management methodologies Strong ability to simplify complex problems An avid learner Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong consultative skills Highly proficient in MS Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Apply to: Support@Cashapon.com Salary Range: $4000+ to $5000+  About Cashapon We aim to be Southeast Asia's premier ecommerce enabler, providing innovative solutions that boost productivity and maximise sales opportunities for top brands through online channels. Cashapon Team is made up of highly ambitious individuals driven to innovate, build and succeed and is always looking for like-minded self-starters to join.   Key Responsibilities: The Key Account Manager will be a key contact point for End to End process and services including, internal & external function. Internal function includes e-commerce Marketing, day to day operation, Customer service, and technology functions to manage Cashapon service to brand and improve the customer experience. Developing relationship with marketplace and new channel is also key part to drive client’s sales coverage and growth. Managing brand and channel portfolio to deliver growth to clients. The ideal candidate would have key skills as fast learner, high interpersonal skill, logical thinking, problem solving, high responsibility, prioritizing and initiative thinking. The role will require a combination of financial, business development and account management skills.   Job description: Performance Management • Manage overall account profitability via P&L management • Ensure all clients and channels are successfully on-boarded on time and deliver KPI on track • Manage to maximize GMV with day-to-day collaboration with client and channels • Customer budget management and P&L execution including reimbursement to deliver agreed GMV, Take Rate, and Profit • Ensuring optimal product presentation and visibility on online channels • Leading all initiatives Across different services • Coordinating with internal cross function and external parties • Establish and monitor progress against key performance indicators.   Partner Service • Responsible for client relationship and retain client satisfaction • Serve as the “face of aCommerce” and primary point of contact for client executives and key stakeholders at each assigned account • Advising clients on how to increase online sales through merchandising, promotion planning and onsite marketing activities • Managing fast-growing e-commerce sales of large brand owners through their own webstore or other online channels and initiative channel • Ensuring that regular reviews are carried out with customers, to ensure that their needs are being met and that excellent customer service is achieved and, developing future improvements/services for the customers. • Ensure operational performance on all areas • Identifies and anticipates additional opportunities for enhancements, improvements or new services with existing clients • Inventory management including forecast, ordering and DOH controlling • Works with other departments to ensure that everything is ready for go-live; Ensures that no processes or set up have been overlooked • Present analysis and recommendations to key stakeholders both client-side and internally   Leadership and team work • Individual contributor in key account • Able to lead project relating with responsible account and category • Able to be mentor for key specialist that leads from account activities • Able share knowledge and team player   Business Development • Contract Management by helping translate the outlined solution into a high level initial statement of work (SOW) and helps secure the client's agreement in sales meetings with the prospect or client (system & integration options, cost model, forecast value, activity planning, requirements definition, etc.) • Working closely with Solution design and business development to manage key customers (existing and new), thereby improving turnover and profitability • SOW & Trade Agreement management for existing account and input industry insight to SD for new customer.   Key Qualifications • 2 year++ working experience in an Ecommerce company, Internet start-up, International Brand, FMCG, retailer or consulting • Previous experience in trade marketing, brand management, merchandising would be a plus. • Able to develop account plan • Good knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint and ability to quickly adapt to new software and tools • Proactive and problem-solving attitude • Very strong commercial English as well as client-facing abilities • Analytical, data driven mindset • High interpersonal skill with problem solving

Black Box® is a trusted IT solutions provider delivering cutting-edge technology products and world-class consulting services to businesses across the globe in every industry. The breadth of our global reach and depth of our expertise accelerate customer success by bringing people, ideas, and technology together to solve real-world business problems.  We deliver technology solutions for our customers by harnessing technology innovation to digitally transform and accelerate their business in the areas of connected buildings (incl. IoT), digital workplace & customer experience, data centers, networking (incl. Wi-Fi, SD-WAN), in-building 5G/ONGO and cyber security.  With more than 80 years of technology excellence and thousands of team members globally, managing over 175,000 customers across 150 countries, we are uniquely positioned to build a global IT services brand that can deliver maximum value, world-class integrated solutions, deliver results, cultivate strategic relationships, and enable lasting relevance for our customers across six continents.  Position Summary: The Regional Business Development Manager is focused on the development of customer relationships sales opportunities within new and dormant accounts to Black Box. Strategically-minded, the BDM will establish and build a trusting relationship with potential prospects, and develop and close sales opportunities within new accounts (high touch sales).  As this position is focused on the pursuit and acquisition of ‘new logos’, the BDM will cultivate the teams that will support the account beyond the initial opportunity wins, which will enable the BDM to pursue other new prospects for Black Box.  Job Responsibilities: Identify prospects, and establish relationships with new customers and dormant accounts. Specifically, the BDM will target larger organizations, with a primary focus on Fortune 1000 prospects. Seek opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell to the client by introducing additional solutions that will enable the customer’s success. Develop strategic pursuit plans. Engages with other internal sales professionals (direct and overlay), solutions experts, engineering when appropriate to actively drive pursuit opportunities. Main focus SG & ASEAN region.  Skills, Knowledge, Abilities: Able to cultivate relationships with large enterprises, including Fortune 1000 targets that do little or no business with Black Box at the present time. Able to understand the customer’s business, and provide strategic insights to help the customer’s business will positioning Black Box solutions as a way to enable the customer’s business success. Encompasses strategic pursuit management skills from opportunity start to finish. Able to use Black Box CRM to own benefits in the business prospecting and sales processes. Able to work independently, as well as part of a team environment. Must be a self-starter, entrepreneurial and able to work effectively with minimal direct supervision. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in standard business software programs, such as Microsoft Office.  Qualifications: Undergraduate Business degree is required. MBA preferred. Must have more 10+ years of sales experience in developing new accounts within the technology/business IT services sector, preferable with leading system integrator (SI). Extensive, existing and relevant network of customers, OEMs, Distributors, SIs, Vendors and Supplier relationships. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with one of the OEMs; Cisco, Aruba, Silver Peak. Minimum one or two valid Sales certifications in above OEMs is a pre. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with Professional and Managed Services solutions. Ability to travel 25% of the time.  Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Our job is to be bold at work. It starts with an insatiable curiosity about clients, colleagues, and the future. At Forrester, we believe curiosity powers progress. Forresterites bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on the ideas and initiatives that change the course of business. As a trusted advisor to the most influential companies in the world, we live at the nexus of what’s next.  About This Role: The Account Executive is required to generate and close new business, as well as renew and upsell from existing clients within an assigned territory. The role also entails working to develop and execute a territory plan and strategy that will result in high quota attainment. For qualified prospects, the Account Executive must conduct a needs analysis and demonstrate the value of Forrester to potential clients by addressing critical business issues. Upon new client acquisition, this person will continue to build strong relationships, enrich existing accounts, and drive retention of existing business by ensuring a high level of client satisfaction. This position is based in Singapore and will cover financial services (FS) as a territory.  Responsibilities Achieve a new business sales quota in the assigned territory on FS enterprises. Prospect and close appropriate accounts from a target account list on FS enterprises. Once closed, keep the relationship with these accounts and develop them further. Develop and close business by developing interest across Technology, Marketing, Customer Experience, Sales & Product roles. Maintain an appropriate sales pipeline to achieve quota, and keep the pipeline updated in Forrester’s CRM system (salesforce.com). Produce accurate and timely forecasts. Build a strong understanding of the financial services industry, as well as the changing business and technology issues and needs that our potential clients face. Navigate across teams to better understand the Forrester value proposition for prospects. Develop a complete understanding of Forrester's full array of product offerings, with an emphasis on business outcomes.  Qualifications Eight or more years quota-carrying experience in successful sales to C-level executive.s Strong understanding and experience in a recurring revenue model business. A bachelor’s degree or higher equivalent experience. A proven track record of prospecting and selling strategic solutions to more than $1 billion FS enterprises. Proven experience in working in complex global business environment, managing stakeholders internally and externally. Proven experience in working in lean organizations with complex internal ecosystems. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills. The ability to align client business objectives with Forrester solutions. A team player, with effective organization and time management skills. A high level of business acumen, particularly within FS. The ability to work and reside in Singapore without restriction.  Explore #ForresterLife on: YouTube Twitter Facebook Instagram LinkedIn Glassdoor  Forrester Research is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of discrimination, including sexual harassment. Data Protection The information provided by you in this application will be used for the purposes of recruitment and, for successful applicants only, for personnel administration and management purposes and to comply with the employer’s obligations regarding the retention of employee records. If your application is unsuccessful, Forrester Research, Inc., its subsidiaries, affiliates, and/or service providers (collectively “Forrester”) will retain your personal information on secure file solely to consider you for future recruitment opportunities. By submitting your resume/CV, you consent to Forrester’s retention of the information provided on a secure file for personnel administration and management purposes and/or in order to consider you for future employment opportunities and to the transfer of the information provided to: Forrester’s offices in the US and other countries outside the European Economic Area; and Service providers engaged by Forrester for the purposes of processing applications for employment who may be located outside the European Economic Area.

description: Senior Sales Development Representative – One of the hottest Cybersecurity start-ups on the globe - $110,000 OTE – Singapore  Henderson Scott are currently recruiting for one of the hottest cybersecurity start-ups on the planet. This organisation has had an incredible amount of funding already and are already classified as a ‘cybersecurity unicorn’. They are still pre-IPO (and you would get shares in the business) – and as part of their universal scale-up, they are really investing in APAC  We are growing their Singapore sales function and looking for their second SDR across this region. This organisation are in one of the fastest-growing verticals of cyber-security, and they are complete market-leaders in it. They have limited competition in the APAC region, so there’s a strong chance that you can come in and absolutely smash your targets! The stock you would receive from joining this vendor could be life-changing  For the initial conversation, apply today!

description: Job Title: Senior Channel / Channel Sales Manager, ASEAN & India As Splashtop continues our rapid growth and expansion, we are recruiting a Partner Sales Manager position for Southeast Asia and India. As the Senior Channel / Channel Sales Manager, you will be a crucial part of a growing Partner Sales Team and play an important role in Splashtop’s growth initiatives in the region.  Overview The Senior Manager / Manager for Channel Sales in Southeast Asia and India is responsible for developing, managing and ensuring the overall success of a portfolio of channel partners (resellers, system integrators, managed service providers, distributors) by designing and executing a plan to accelerate and scale the growth of indirect and channel partner sales for Splashtop in the region. You will function as part of a regional business unit to ensure achievement of business objectives and revenue targets.  You will report to the Regional Director, Asia Pacific.  Responsibilities l  Develop long-term strategic relationships with channel partners across Southeast Asia and India. l  Accelerate partner solution adoption by identifying specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a value proposition for using Splashtop’s portfolio. l  Adopt and execute a strategic solution approach based on individual partner needs to drive partner sales success. l  Drive and manage partner sales cycles from start to finish. l  Develop and maintain strong contacts and relationships with cross-functional teams (Sales, Support, Engineering, Services, Product Management) both internally and within the partnerships to ensure technical health of partners. l  Possess technical expertise and savvy to explain and architect the use of Splashtop’s portfolio to improve solutions offered by partnerships. l  Coordinate and oversee technical resources internally and within the partnerships to successfully close and deliver partnership opportunities. l  Prepare and deliver business reviews to the senior management team.  Required Skills and Qualifications l  Minimum 3 years of experience in the following areas: Partner Alliances, Business Development, Channel and/or Direct Sales. l  Track record and demonstrated ability to recruit and develop capable, focused and scalable partners. l  Strategic thinker who is able to blend technology and business strategy to develop compelling plans for new partner initiatives. l  Demonstrated ability to engage and influence senior-level executives. l  Ability to create thoughtful and compelling business cases highlighting revenue growth opportunities. l  Capable of building and maintaining strong relationships with a diverse set of internal and partner constituencies including senior level executives, legal, finance, support, sales, and marketing experts. l  Demonstrated ability to build significant revenue stream through channel partners, with a track record of successful revenue goal attainment. l  Strong understanding of the IT Software Support / Collaboration industry. l  Ability to negotiate skillfully in tough situations. l  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as the ability to effectively present to all levels of management. l  Ability to influence functional groups to a shared vision. l  High energy, enthusiasm, and passion for the business. l  Excellent planning and time management skills. l  Bachelor's degree or other significant business experience.   Splashtop is an Equal Opportunity Employer

This is a remote position. We welcome candidates from any location. Resumes are to be submitted in English.  Responsibilities: Build a client acquisition pipeline, ranging from Fortune 500 companies to mature growth companies, as well as nurture and close client deals. Lead the day to day execution of consulting with clients and developing client engagement plans for key target accounts, advising them to utilize our talent network and build on demand teams. Develop a tailored plan to address current needs and create a roadmap for future growth opportunities. Analyze results, propose new strategies and implement them. Set up tools and applications required for the role and conduct new programs to optimize results. Train Business Development Representatives specialized in key channels to take on successful experiments and optimize them for performance. Strong understanding of the digital transformation needs and challenges faced by clients in industries such as financial services, high-tech, telecommunications, manufacturing, energy, retail, pharmaceuticals, or travel and logistics. description: About Temenos  We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.  We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.  Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!  THE ROLE  A key position in the Regional APAC sales team and has primary responsibility for achievement sales targets through the implementation of sales strategies driven from a local territory sales and go to market plan. This role is a Business Development Role, focused on New Business / Logo’s only.  Key Responsibilities  Achieve New Business sales wins to exceed target supported by local cross functional support teams and the Sales Director Provide insight and plan effective sales campaigns together with a skilled Pre-Sales team, Marketing and Inside Sales teams to operate successfully in competitive bid scenarios Proactively address the Indonesian market to expand the brand reach and achieve a high rate of meetings, demonstrations, workshops, quotes and proposals Maintain four times your Annual quota in Pipeline with New Business opportunities by working closely with Marketing, Inside Sales our In-country Partners by and Sales support teams by establishing relationships with primary alliance partners and identify new market and growth opportunities to build a strong sales pipeline Skillfully negotiate profitable contract agreements for license, consulting and support services Provide leadership in client relations to set the company head and shoulders above the competition Leverage existing business relationships with decision makers, executives and key players in the banking and financial services sectors Provide leadership in client relationship management, address clients’ business needs and constraints. Build long-term relationships and referrals with senior managers and key opinion leaders in the banking and financial services sectors.  Skills & Experience  Proficient in both spoken and written English and local language i.e. Malay, Indonesian, Thai A high-caliber individual with the right breadth and depth of experience, strong credential, influence within the financial arena in Indonesia with the focus and acumen to cultivate profitable and lasting customer relationships Proven track record of leading and achieving “big ticket” sales to exceed targets in the banking and financial services software industry with substantial relevant experience within the same domain Minimum 7-10 years Sales and New Business Development experience in a banking software company or related companies (e.g. local Software Industry) Confident in operating at “C level” and can demonstrate strong sales and negotiating skills with key decision makers Must have the presence together with strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills to establish interest, trust and credibility Has mastered technical and business skills required to accomplish the job Good general understanding of banking operations and relevant processes (front, middle, back office) with a reasonable understanding of IT infrastructures and implementation approaches from both functional and technical perspectives Self-motivated, ambitious, independent, organized, focused and able to multi-task Can work independently and in a collaborative nature Willing to travel on a frequent basis  WHY TEMENOS  You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day. You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best. You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises. You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity. You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients. You will experience what we call – Temenosity!  We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.  Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy

description: Our Client: Our client is an award winning data research company providing insight and intelligence to the financial industry, easing the process of business-critical decision making for investment professionals across the world. jobTitle: Regional Head - Sales & Key Accounts, Grab for Business, SG
description: Job Description:  About Us  Grab was founded on the belief that a technology company in Southeast Asia could both run profitably and create sustainable social impact. We hold ourselves responsible to the environment and socio-economic development of this region, not just for today, but also for the future.  At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles, which we call the 4Hs. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.  WORKING WITH GRAB POSITIVE & COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENT. Grabbers thrive in a corporate culture that values every team member's contribution towards our goal of improving lives. ROCKET FUEL FOR CAREERS. Grabbers experience hyper professional growth and all the challenges that entails. Grow your skills while working to solve real issues across the region. FUN & DEDICATED FAMILY. Grabbers work hard and play hard. Our teams grow as one as they overcome challenges and have fun along the way. Our Team:  As a member of Grab, not only will you bring your skill sets to drive your team forward, but you will also develop your untapped potential and be inspired by some of the most amazing minds in the industry. Our team consists of both young and experienced individuals who are tenacious, motivated and energized by the fact that we exist to make a change - have a societal impact in Southeast Asia.  Grab for Business is the B2B SaaS team within Grab that helps to simplify business transportation, corporate food & package deliveries as well as related services for companies across Southeast Asia. We actively engage with top companies and brands across the region and its imperative that we drive efficient revenue channels within our organisation. To this end, we are looking for an incredibly resilient and capable regional sales leader in our Grab for Business team.  To perform this role well, the candidate needs to have exceptional leadership skills, strong sales strategy and communication capabilities, attention to detail, ability to create and follow sales processes, and an exemplary track record of exceeding expectations.  This role is based in Singapore.  The Role: You will report to the Regional Director - Grab for Business Manage multiple revenue generating teams and own the gross bookings and sales quota for multiple channels and B2B products in three core markets (Singapore, Malaysia and Philippines). People Leadership: Work with the Regional Director to oversee all people management aspects for your teams, including building a highly motivated team, hiring / coaching / mentoring best-in-class performers, resource planning and career development. Provide a conducive and progressive team environment for growth and learning. Be a Role Model by ensuring a healthy working culture for your team leads and members based on mutual respect, and by personally embodying and demonstrating all the Grab Way principles. Sales Planning: Ensure critical monthly / quarterly / annual milestones are consistently met or exceeded. Provide regular sales reports, forecasts and set clear performance metrics and be accountable for all sales & key accounts strategy across all your teams. Identify growth areas for existing and new B2B solutions. Implement a customer-centric based mode of working. Key Accounts Team: Lead from the front for multiple high impact teams of Regional & Enterprise Key Account Managers across the English-speaking markets of Singapore, Malaysia and Philippines, focussed on a portfolio of top corporate and multinational clients. Ensure client success by nurturing and expand our working relationships with top corporate clients and decision makers. Enable the team to leverage customer, industry and data-backed insights to achieve excellence and close high value deals with speed. Ensure your teams understand customer pain points, provide the right solutions and ensure a continuous process of up-selling and cross-selling Grab’s B2B solutions. Be extremely organized, and bring a high level of attention to detail and efficiency while working under tight deadlines and on multiple initiatives simultaneously. Inside Sales Team Manage a remote Manila-based team of Team Leads, Inside sales & Sales Development representatives Lead Generation: Build, implement and continuously improve lead generation (online / offline) in your markets. Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to lock down lead generation and sales pipelines for the team. Ensure Sales Development and Inside sales teams work on an always-on acquisition framework in lead nurturing. Pipeline Management: Own and oversee the Salesforce CRM pipeline for all new prospects and existing clients at every stage of the sales funnel. Setup and implement clear pipeline management guidelines for teams to diligently track qualified prospects, and analyse data to understand and forecast gross bookings value and sales potential on a monthly / quarterly basis while taking remedial steps as necessary. Channel Partners Build and scale a channel partner network with carefully selected partners Provide direction to the the Channel Partner team on strategy and operations Build and implement strong SOPs and processes with the Channel Partner to lock down lead generation opportunities and marketing plans that ensure a healthy sales pipeline. Ensure adherence to contractual obligations and commercial terms for Channel Partners The Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s Degree (minimum) required. Work Experience: Candidates need to have at least 8-12 years of total experience in Sales / Key account management in a fast paced B2B startup or B2B corporate environments dealing with SaaS, Recruitment or Technology digital solutions for corporate clients. Candidates should have at least 2-3 years experience in people management and leading high performing sales teams, with an exemplary track record. Experience in successfully running business teams for high growth startups will also be considered. Demonstrable sales planning based thinking ability with excellent communication skills (verbal, written) and presentation skills is a must. Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to effectively network within the industry and the overall Grab organisation. Direct connections to Finance / HR decision makers , other senior management and C-level executives will be advantageous. People skills: Committed and highly collaborative leader who can coach / mentor their sales team while establishing a healthy working culture based on the Grab Way principles. Ability to effectively manage and motivate a team to focus on the overall sales planning roadmap, pipeline management and high velocity sales to close multiple customer deals while ensuring client success. Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can work well in a startup VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous) environment. Should have a deep desire to excel and develop a career in a fast growing tech company. Should have demonstrated integrity and respect in the performance of their duties. Proficiency in customer experience tools (Salesforce CRM tools, reporting dashboards) Excellent in data analysis (MS Office, Google Docs / Sheets / Slides), pipeline management and forecasting

After successfully launching in Europe and in the US, they are excited to expand their operations in Asia-Pacific. The region will keep leading global growth in the years to come and is uniquely positioned to support the new generation of customer-facing giants. Develop and manage an accurate, qualified pipeline aligned to business goals and objectives for effective forecast management Help build, lead and develop a sales team. Lead by example by driving and closing deals directly and overachieving your personal revenue target Develop and manage the evolving sales strategy with relevant and distinct collateral articulating the solution and product Partner closely with Key Accounts and Marketing teams in Asia-Pacific Be the voice of customers, feeding back to Product teams, to influence the global roadmap decisions  You must have: 10+ years of solid experience in sales, including at least 3-5 years in new business SaaS sales Proven ability to build & manage a small sales team Successful track record of hitting ambitious sales targets Entrepreneur mindset. Has enjoyed growing in both startup and larger SaaS venture environment and eager to accelerate our growth in the market Extensive network with large corporations (B2B/B2C) in South East Asia Exceptional communication and collaboration capabilities Proven ability to present to enterprise leadership and C-suite, display gravitas and successfully engage with C-suite executives Industry knowledge and expertise in Marketing tech, SEO, e-commerce or marketplaces a clear plus Legal right to work in Singapore  My client offers a competitive salary and incentives plan, based on experience and increase with performance.

description: Pico is currently seeking candidates for the role of Sales & Account Manager position. The role requires being a content expert in all services provided by Pico as well as having strong project management & time management skills, attention to detail, outstanding oral / written communication skills, and someone that thrives within a fast-paced environment. We are seeking a mix of an aggressive hunter with outstanding sales acumen, laser focused pipeline management and a keen awareness of industry trends as they relate to our clients as well as someone that can deliver top quality services and support for our existing clients in region to grow the business with them. This position will report to Pico’s Head of APAC Sales. The role offers direct interaction with various clients in the financial market space from Global Tier 1 investment banks to sophisticated latency sensitive trading clients, market makers and other technology vendors in addition to internal sales engineering and client delivery staff.  Responsibilities Develop strong client relationships with prospective clients and research assigned new leads and qualify opportunities via telephone and email. Act as the primary point of contact for all existing client requests, administrative and technical matters, and new business inquiries in a pre-defined set of accounts. Maintain accurate and up-to-date account plans and opportunity information leveraging Salesforce.com, Confluence, and SharePoint for direct accounts under management. Work closely with the product and business team to provide feedback on any client, prospect or partner requirements. Develop overall knowledge of assigned accounts including products sold, asset classes traded, clients, and business issues; proactively and regularly communicate account status to senior management. Collaborate with sales engineering team to help qualify and ultimately win business. Promote a positive, collaborative environment throughout the organization. Contribute to Pico’s understanding of the competitive landscape, differentiation, and industry trends. Gather high-level requirements from client/prospect and confidently tell the Pico ‘story’ with a high-level overview of our products, services, and value proposition. Build proposals and deliver a curated value proposition to client/prospect. Share client feedback on product, service, and pricing with respective internal team members including Product and Engineering. Interact with various stakeholders on the client side at all levels from junior resources up to C-level; identify decision makers; build and maintain client relationships. Win business with the overall goal of maintaining and growing monthly recurring revenue in your account base relative to established sales targets. Participate in regular team forums, meetings, and training sessions.  Qualifications Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) from a 4-year university. Minimum 7+ years work-related experience in financial technology service industry, with at least 5 years of account relationship experience supporting Tier 1 global or large regional banks.; equally comfortable and capable interacting with clients in person as via calls and emails. Practical experience with sales, account management, financial markets and/or the securities industry including client interactions via telephone and face-to-face meetings. Experience with Salesfore.com (or other CRM), MS Office, SharePoint, JIRA. Professional demeanor a must. Self-starter with the ability to prioritize, multitask, and take direction when required. Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Team player (as you will be working with others on larger accounts globally), energetic, enthusiastic and organized. Emphasizes on attention to detail & comfortable acting as a de facto project coordinator who will advocate for both the company and client. Driven and proactive, comfortable escalating issues in context of possible solutions.

jobTitle: Account Executive, Mid Market Sales - Slack
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What We're Looking For...  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  We are looking for Account Executives to join our Sales team and focus on our Mid Market customers in Singapore. This segment represents a huge opportunity for Slack and we want someone who is eager to do the best work of their lives while supporting others in doing the same.  You will be responsible for driving the sales process with prospective customers as well as the expansion of existing accounts. You will work closely with our customers to understand their business objectives and act as their trusted guide for using Slack most effectively. You’ll also work with cross-functional teams to help align our product roadmap and marketing materials with customer feedback. If you enjoy working with customers from a variety of industries in a rapidly changing environment, then come and join us!  Some of the things you’ll be doing include …  Educate customers on the value of Slack in a thoughtful way Provide recommendations based on a customer’s business needs and usage patterns Manage multiple customers simultaneously at various stages of the Slack buying cycle Handle inbound customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Drive revenue through proactive outreach to existing customers Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product  Who You Are ...  You have 3+ years relevant work experience in an account management or sales role, preferably in SaaS You are a self-motivated teammate that can act independently You take an active interest in opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen customer relationships You have a consistent track record of identifying customer needs and successfully implementing solutions You have a proven track record of managing large scale accounts for the duration of the sales cycle and beyond You are flexible, adaptive, and resilient You have excellent written and verbal communication skills  About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Egencia is changing the way corporations manage their travel programs and is seeking a professional sales specialist to drive our leadership in corporate travel. The Global Sales Manager will be selling into global Singapore based companies with footprints across all regions; North America (NA) Asia Pacific (APAC), Latin America and European markets. The objective of this position is to develop multi-dimensional relationships with global customers and provide customized solutions for their worldwide travel needs.  This position requires a customer centric approach with tried skills in pipeline management, platform selling, negotiation; understand complex systems and processes. With effective communication and a strong knowledge of market trends, will assist to understand the impact on business needs and travel solutions. This position will be representing the Egencia brand through verbal, written and formal presentations to potential customers at all levels. The individual must be a great teammate, biased to action, self-motivated, highly organized, high energy, integrity, humility and can function effectively in an un-structured environment.  Egencia makes business travel better. Combining technology and service, we build a seamless experience, where companies have access to a user-friendly interface, extensive travel options, and 24/7 global support. Join our mission and help us take the next steps in transforming the world of business travel.  What You’ll Do The ability to understand product capabilities and communicate the value and differentiation of a service offering in the market. Grow Egencia portfolio and revenue with new customers headquartered in Singapore by playing an active role in value proposition selling and contract negotiation Once requirements are clearly identified, promote competitive advantages and Egencia’s outstanding value proposition through proposal, RFI/RFPs and presentations Connect with prospects (from discovery meeting to closing) and build a high-level relationship with executives (CFOs, CEOs) Responsible for contract closing and implementation of customers with the implementation team Selling the right solution, to ensure that the customer transitions from implementation to trade Sign profitable business to meet quarterly goals, in line with Egencia’s pricing schedules Work collaboratively and establish relationships with internal teams Who You Are  You’ll be great for this role if you have the following: Excellent communication skills, including written and oral Strong listening skills with to interpret the customers’ needs Validated sales experience in pipeline management including negotiation skills Ability to effectively address key decisions makers in a very competitive and innovating environment Minimum 4 years Sales experience with a consistent track record in hitting quarterly sales targets Organized and structured High level of dynamism, drive, and energy - great teammate Strong commitment to both a high quality of work and service to customers in a fast-paced environment Proficient level of experience with MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word Graduate level education is desired Position requires some travel, sometimes to international locations A good knowledge of the corporate travel industry and/or platform selling (desired but not essential) About Expedia Group  Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, Egencia®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.

CELLINK is the world’s leading bioconvergence company. As a global supplier of innovative life-science solutions, we strive to find synergies between the most recent findings in biology and the latest breakthroughs in mechanical and digital technologies. The best-in-class products we develop are also backed by our renowned support team of highly skilled application and technical specialists. We are committed to the highest quality because we know that our 3D bioprinters, bioinks, single-cell dispensers, imaging systems and liquid handlers are being used to solve today’s most pressing challenges in tissue engineering, cell biology, microscopy, drug development and healthcare.  Our three core values are passion, inspiration and persistence. We are passionate about what we do. We are inspired by, and work to inspire, today’s greatest scientific minds. We are persistent about going the extra mile to deliver the very best.  We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. As an equal opportunity employer, we do more than accept difference. We celebrate diversity, we support employees from a wide range of backgrounds, and we benefit from the added creativity and richness that these differences bring to our offices and community. We pride ourselves on being a collaborative environment where everyone’s talents and opinions contribute to the greater good and are always recognized.  We are looking for a Sales Manager SEA & Oceania for the Singapore office:  Responsibilities  You will be the face and spirit of CELLINK in the field You will be responsible for selling the Bioprinting products within the region Build the CELLINK brand through customer communication, organize workshops, and do live demonstrations for potential and new users Specify targeted accounts, identify business opportunities, close new business deals Develop and foster new relationships with local and international businesses and institutions Work with marketing to drive initiatives, enhance campaigns and build material for the SEA and Oceania market Arrange client meetings, identify opportunities, and generate leads with accounts in your territory. You will have individual responsibility for new business, and are expected to be autonomous; however, you will be part of a growing team of people focused on the European market. You will work in close collaboration with the management and internal teams for larger opportunities Partner with the application’s team in response to tenders and requests for information in a timely manner Work with our inside sales team to create campaigns targeting lead generating functions Confident negotiator and ability to ‘close the deal’ at all levels with the customer Travel requirements: up to 60%  Qualifications  Minimal 4-5 years of sales experience in laboratory/capital equipment or laboratory supplies fields Business experience in SEA and Oceania regions would be a plus Effective leader with an entrepreneurial mindset Minimum of Bachelor of Science degree preferably a background in Biomedical Engineering or similar Outside the box thinking, creative Proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite
industries: Biotechnology

description: Company Description  The Company  YouGov is an international market research and data analytics group.  Our mission is to supply a continuous stream of accurate data and insight into what the world thinks, so that companies, governments and institutions can better serve the people and communities that sustain them.  We have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.  We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics and proven methodologies. We respect and trust each other, and bring these values into everything that we do.  Each day, our highly engaged proprietary global panel of over 15 million people provides us with thousands of data points on consumer opinions, attitudes and behaviours. We combine this continuous stream of data with our research expertise to provide insights that enable intelligent decision-making and informed conversations.  With operations in the UK, North America, Mainland Europe, the Nordics, the Middle East, India and Asia Pacific, YouGov has one of the world’s largest research networks.  YouGov opened our office in Hong Kong in January 2014 and the team has grown to over 11 people to develop and manage our client base, providing them the best insights to help them grow their business. We have experienced strong growth year on year and are now looking for more talented candidates to join our team.  The Culture  Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to YouGov. We are committed to giving the world a voice by capturing the opinions of all groups, including the ones that are often under-represented in research. We are also committed to making sure that our products and tools are free from any bias, as accuracy is key to what we do. None of the above can be done without having a truly diverse workforce, in an inclusive workplace. We are very keen on attracting and retaining the best talent. And best talent also means a diverse pool of talent, with various backgrounds and perspectives.  Supporting the wellbeing of our staff, including maintaining a good work and life balance, is important to us. We support flexible working arrangements where appropriate for a role, with many locations offering a hybrid office-and-remote working approach.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. All employment decisions are made on the basis of occupational qualifications, merit, and business need.  Job Description  The Opportunity  At YouGov our client relationships are our top priority. We are seeking a dedicated, pro-active and personable Account Manager to maintain and enhance these relationships, driving achievement of sales targets through renewals and cross-selling / upselling opportunities, ultimately increasing client account value year-on-year.  Reporting into Head of Commercial APAC, you’ll be the day-to-day commercial lead for a group of accounts spread across a range of industries within the Consumer Research sector. As part of growing our key client accounts, you will work with the Head of Commercial APAC, Head of Research APAC and Head of Client Services Singapore to develop business growth plans for all existing assigned clients, whilst also contributing to strategic targeting of brands / sectors, with the aim of developing new growth opportunities.  Your clients will be from a range of industries that include but are not limited to Retail (Fashion, e-commerce, retailers, FMCG), Leisure and Entertainment, Finance (Banking, Insurance and Investment), Travel (Hotels, Airlines, Destinations) Media and Agencies (Media, Creative, PR), giving you exposure to a wide customer base with diverse research needs.  The Role  Across The Assigned Client Accounts, The Account Manager Will Manage, develop and strengthen client relationships to achieve long-term successful partnerships Develop a thorough understanding of YouGov products and service offerings in order to confidently upsell and cross-sell to clients Generate sales among client accounts, identifying and following through on opportunities for growing business Forecast and track client account metrics, collaborating with sales and commercial teams to develop strategic marketing plans and ensure client and wider company goals are met Utilise contacts to explore prospective new business opportunities Key Responsibilities Engage pro-actively with clients, acting as key point of contact for their needs, responding promptly to requests and anticipating requirements Maintain accurate client records, generating progress reports and keeping track of contract updates and renewals Manage multiple clients concurrently, ensuring services are provided within budget and timeframe Meet regularly with team members to discuss progress and potential sales growth strategies Communicate client needs and demands to wider sales and commercial teams, ensuring day-to-day and long-term objectives are aligned Oversee and carry out project management duties as necessary for assigned clients Qualifications  Our ideal candidate will be an excellent communicator, confident and persuasive with strong presentation and negotiation skills. You will enjoy working in a dynamic, creative environment, demonstrating the ability to juggle multiple account management demands whilst maintaining sharp attention to detail and not losing sight of wider company goals. Tight organisational and time management skills are key.  The Following Qualifications Would Be Of Benefit Relevant studies in business, marketing, market research or related subjects Experience in a performance-driven role from a media or communications agency, or a brand marketing or insights team Knowledge and experience (ideally 4-5 years) of business development and key account management / subscription sales systems, ideally from the media, communications or research agency world Ability to uncover client research needs by asking the right questions Appropriate solution & proposal development and collaborative sales experience Excellent grasp of research methodologies and applications to suit client objectives Technical Skills Excellent PowerPoint and Excel skills Excellent written, oral and electronic communication skills Working knowledge of client management / procurement systems such as Ariba Behavioural Competencies Competent at building effective strategic relationships with clients Ability to collaborate effectively within a project and team setting Passionate about data, research, tech & innovation
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: Role Purpose  Manages customer relationships and uses insight and understanding of customer needs to support account growth. Finance or Management graduate/ post-grad 2-4 years’ experience in covering these products and bank, buy-side clients Willingness to travel in the region Proficiency in English and Mandarin Independent operator, outgoing and strong communication, presentation skills At LSEG, we believe that creating a diverse and inclusive organisation is fundamental to the way we deliver on our promise – and our purpose. You’ll be part of an organisation of over 25,000 people, spanning 70 countries. We recognise the individual perspectives each of our colleagues brings, and our diverse workforce is one of our greatest strengths. In supporting collaboration and creativity and encouraging new ideas across a diverse and inclusive workforce, we can improve how we are driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.  LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support from healthcare and retirement planning to paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.  We are an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. description: The database market is massive (the IDC estimates it to be $89B+ by 2024!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. The MongoDB community is transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.  We’re looking for a hardworking, driven individual with superb energy, passion and initiative for new business acquisition. The Enterprise Account Executive role focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a sales strategy within an assigned territory, resulting in revenue growth and new customer acquisition.  MongoDB is always changing and innovating — not only in our technology, but also in our sales go-to-market strategy. Our sales leadership is committed to building the best salesforce in technology. This means, inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team. We not only equip you to be successful and close deals, but we want your feedback and input on how we can continue to “Think Big and Go Far.” As a crucial part of the Sales team at MongoDB, you will have access to a lucrative market and learn how to sell from some of the most successful sales leaders in the software industry.  To learn more about what it's like to be an Enterprise Account Executive, watch this interview with Jennifer Clark.  Responsibilities Proactively prospect, identify, qualify and develop a sales pipeline Close business to meet and exceed monthly, quarterly and annual bookings objectives Build strong and effective relationships, resulting in growth opportunities Participate in our sales enablement trainings, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamp, sophisticated sales training, and leadership and development programs Work closely with the Professional Services team to achieve customer satisfaction Requirements BA/BS required 5+ years field experience of quota-carrying experience in a fast-paced and competitive market with a focus on new business Demonstrated ability to articulate the business value of complex enterprise technology A track record of overachievement and hitting sales targets Skilled in building business champions and running a complex sales process Previous Sales Methodology training (e.g. MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales) Familiarity with databases, develops and open source technology a plus Driven and competitive: Possess a strong desire to be successful Skilled in managing time and resources; sound approach to qualifying opportunities Possess aptitude to learn quickly and establish credibility. High EQ and self-aware Must live in territory Singapore Passionate about growing your career in the largest market in software (database) and developing and maintaining an in-depth understanding of MongoDB products To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!  MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.  This role is remotely optional until November 1, 2021, we are looking to speak to candidates who plan to be available in Singapore for when we introduce our hybrid model. MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.
