jobTitle: Regional Key Account Manager, APAC - High Tech
description: The Regional Key Account Manager, APAC – High-Tech is responsible for leading the development of the assigned strategic Global Accounts in the High-Tech Market. He/she is also responsible for leading the Country Key Account Managers (KAMs) to drive business opportunities and support the assigned clients. The incumbent is also expected to work closely with the Global Account Managers to develop and grow the wallet share of business for GEODIS.  Roles and Responsibilities  1. Account Management Ensure the development and maintenance of customer relationships and enhance overall client portfolio, safeguard sales revenue and ensure customer satisfaction Ensure increased consistency of services and pricing linked to “integrated solutions” Grow the share of business, as well as expand the relationships within the customer identifying influencers, gatekeepers, decision makers within the region of APAC but also to direct and align with Global and Regional KAM’s to further penetrate the client organization Deploy a strong consultative selling approach with assigned accounts to identify their supply chain challenges and develop value creating solutions that drive increased scope of engagement and share of wallet for Geodis Proactively managed and resolved account issues using continuous improvement principles to enhance service levels Improve client satisfaction based on formal feedback and surveys of your customers  2. Business Development (BD) Determine the strategies for the selected Global Accounts Ensure development of cross selling in Asia Build the wallet share of business for GEODIS with this customer AND its subsidiaries or affiliates Provide support & leadership to APAC BDs to develop business within portfolio of assigned clients Participate to the VM Activities by supporting presentations to prospects and other clients and showcasing best practices & innovative solutions from your accounts Work with Regional VM manager to develop standardized offering from the customized solutions deployed on your customer Engage with Regional VM manager, product stakeholders, IT & management teams to create value adding service offerings that can be taken back to your clients  3. Management Information Gather, consolidate, analyze and report management information Use CRM for all RFQ’s and Meetings Track key indicators such as volume, revenue, gross profit, manage yield Gather and provide to the company feedback on competitor information through your ongoing contact with strategic customers assigned to your care Provide timely and accurate reporting of relevant details as required and requested  4. Business Planning Drive behavior towards strategic engagement and value creation for assigned portfolio of accounts and strategic targets Manage pipeline size and quality  5. Leadership Steer, develop and motivate the country KAM’s to sell, maintain and support the assigned clients Regional and Country Customer cards in place and used to drive opportunities, innovations & growth strategy Hands on Management of the accounts across all APAC countries using all standardized tools: QBR deck, Issue Log, Communication and Escalation Matrix, Monthly report and ensuring same are maintained by country KAMs  *KPI for RKAM is accumulated result of the country KAMs  Education Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in related field  Work Experience Strong Sales or Business Development experience in Supply Chain Management and Freight Forwarding Minimum 10 years relevant experience in sales field with at least 3 years senior management position Experience in key account management role managing Retail or Retail sector customers Experience in working in regional role, with regional or sub-regional client scope is an advantage  Our Candidate promise  Recruiting passionate people  At GEODIS, we believe that each and every person matters when it comes to achieving long-lasting success and demonstrating our know-how. Our commitment to our customers leads us to recruit passionate and demanding men and women who are ready to fulfill the ambitions of our rapidly changing sector with all their energy.  Join a leader in constant evolution  With more than 100 years of experience in the field of transport and logistics, GEODIS knows how to respond to the major challenges. Throughout its history, GEODIS showed ability to adapt to the needs of its clients, industry-specific constraints and new national boundaries. With its talent pool, GEODIS opens you doors to the world full of dynamism where everyone finds their place in expertise, contributes to their development and succeeds. Being the key player of the supply chain, we are working on the logistics projects of our customers today and preparing those of tomorrow.  Creating daily opportunities  It is true that we are committed to offering autonomy and the opportunity to take initiative to each of our new hires. Therefore, it is necessary that they benefit from personalized and operational support that will allow them to understand the challenges of GEODIS and emphasize their strengths. We encourage openness. “Discuss. Decide. Align.”- this is a genuine moto to guarantee the success of our actions.  And if you were part of this adventure? Being GEODIS employee means living every day professional and personal adventure. It is about incorporating your personality, your knowledge and your know-how in the culture and the team spirit of GEODIS. description: Description  We are a growing group of 140+ talented people, spread over three continents and united by one common mission: To improve efficiency in shipping through transparency and data-driven decisions.  Being at the forefront of a movement that's leading to a new digital era for shipping, we continuously set ambitious goals that often produce complex challenges and drive us to constantly innovate.  Each day at MarineTraffic presents numerous opportunities to develop skills, share knowledge and have fun. We are an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, one that is fair and honest and gives our people the confidence to be bold, to try new things and to grow.  As a result of our significant growth we are looking to add a seasoned sales hunter to drive sales activity in APAC region as part of the Singapore sales team. It requires an entrepreneur and self-starter mentality, someone who can bring new logos across various key verticals.  We are looking for a competitive and trustworthy Territory Sales Manager to help us build up our business outbound activities. You will be responsible for managing new and existing customer sales requests and maintaining customer satisfaction. The goal is to meet and surpass the company’s expectations to drive rapid and sustainable growth.  Responsibilities Of Your Role Managed an assigned territory with the associated revenue targets and commission structure. Able to develop and present a thorough territory plan within the first 90 days. Execute business development activity to strategically grow the customer base through prospecting and cold calling. Leverage a repeatable sales process to drive to closure. Be expert at selling to both commercial organizations and government across a range of industry verticals. Exceed activity, pipeline and revenue targets and lead contract negotiations. Keep accurate and complete information on the Salesforce CRM system including prospecting activity, closing, sales pipeline and forecasting, close ratios and market intelligence. Obtain in-depth knowledge of MarineTraffic’s products and services. Follow a consultative approach in order to understand client’s needs and business challenges. Accurately calculate quotations, handle invoices and license agreements. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Pre-Sales, Product, Engineering) regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns. Establish and maintain current and potential client relationships. To research and utilize industry tools to identify opportunities for business growth. Sharing Customer feedback, communicating product and services opportunities, with internal teams at MarineTraffic. Participate in marketing events, trade shows and company events. Approximately 30% to 40% travel. Report to the Regional Sales Manager on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results. It’s Essential That You Have  Requirements 3-5 years of prior sales experience working for a technology vendor selling Enterprise solutions (Data, Cloud, Software, SaaS). Previous experience of working at established and early-stage companies. A track record of developing a greenfield territory, adding net new logos. A hunting mentality with a very strong Sales DNA and demonstrated success. The ability to identify use cases and value propositions across a broad range of verticals. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Fluent in English, knowledge of other languages is beneficial. Have strong numeracy and analytical skills. Have good IT skills: you are comfortable using Microsoft Office. The ability to work cross-culturally and cross-functionally. The right level of entrepreneurship, creativity, and commitment. Maritime domain experience is a plus. Have a prior experience in shipping or fleet operations will be an added advantage. A Bachelor’s degree or higher. Benefits Work in an international, dynamic and fun environment, at a growing company Attractive remuneration package Continuing education and training Pleasant and fun working environment Huge learning experience and room for experimentation. Remote work flexibility If you’ve read the description carefully and feel you are a genuine fit for this role, which is both challenging and fun, we would like to hear from you.  Get your career on course by joining a globally recognised industry leader. Apply now.

description: Job Description Summary  The Services Growth Manager, ASEAN is a key leadership role that will be responsible for driving growth and ensuring the financial performance of the Ultrasound Services segment, a high double-digit growth segment. In this role, you will lead product positioning, market segmentation, new offerings development and launch, as well as installed base marketing. To be successful in the role, you should demonstrate an ability to identify market trends and customer needs, as well as possess a track record in leading demand generation and funnel acceleration activities. The role reports to the ASEAN Services Growth Director. GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Key Responsibilities  Product & Market Expertise Formulate and implement solid strategies and differentiation to secure profitable services business growth for the Ultrasound portfolio Plan the launch of new service offerings and solution, manage the cross-functional and wing-to-wing roll-out of the plan Lead new business initiatives – provide ASEAN input, develop business case justification for new service offerings and/or upgrades from concept stage, to test/prototype, launch planning and roll-out. This will be done in conjunction with collaboration with Global teams, Modality, commercial excellence and commercial operation team Responsible for ensuring country commercial teams have the right tools and training to sell -- interface with Global and regional counterparts to share and gain best practices, adapting training material, brochures and other sales tools to local market needs as necessary Own the success of Ultrasound Services portfolio Monitor and drive improvements for key metrics such as capture rates, profitability, installed base growth and $ per installed base, influencing countries to strive for improvement Own the growth of the Ultrasound Services Contract business by developing market suitable offerings including market opportunity prioritization, opportunity mining, market/competitive analysis Collaborate with Inside Sales Leader to drive towards alternative, more efficient way of contract renewal, conversion and win back Conceptualize and launch demand generation programs for on demand services leveraging digital ecommerce platform Drive the options and upgrades portfolio to drive potential lifecycle solutions to add value to customers Work closely with the product/modality teams to drive improvement in Point of Sale attachment for service contracts as well as support their market share gain programs Build and sustain relationships with key channel partners in the region and ensure execution of strategy via the partners including training, launching incentives and various marketing programs in collaboration with them. Own the short- and longer-term business planning activities related to the portfolio. Build the growth strategy story and engage in dialogues with senior leaders to share the same and drive alignment. Ensure suitable stocking/inventory management for portfolio Collaborate closely to launch key new 3rd party adjacent solutions in the portfolio & ensure strategic alignment to core portfolio for the GTM.  Preferred Qualifications    MBA or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field 7-10 years’ experience in marketing, product marketing or related field Proven commercial experience driving sales for a portfolio Channel partner management experience Healthcare product/industry acumen, ideally in related product segments Innovation – develop new ideas through collaboration and execute on creative ideas being comfortable with ambiguity Influencing skills – ability to motivate individuals and demonstrate organizational influence Excellent oral and written communications skills Team oriented – ability to motivate and work well with diverse, cross-functional Teams Strong analytical and process skills Strong in MS Office Suite especially MS Excel and MS Powerpoint  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Ourtotal rewardsare designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Fireblocks is a fast-growing VC-backed startup focused on securing and transferring digital assets across public and private blockchains. Based on explosive growth in 2020 and 2021 we are looking to expand our sales team across the globe. If you are looking for a fast-paced environment with a team that is passionate about security and blockchain technology and you have a strong track record of success then this is the perfect role for you.  About The Role  As part of the Fireblocks sales team, you will play a meaningful role in scaling one of the fastest-growing companies in the Blockchain and Cybersecurity field.  Responsibilities Achieving monthly and quarterly revenue targets Working closely with Fireblocks BDRs and GTM Team Building and maintaining relationships with prospects and customers Prospecting, territory, and account planning Updating and maintaining Fireblocks CRM Requirements At least 5 years enterprise sales experiences in software or institutional sales experience financial services - a must Understanding of blockchain technology and cryptocurrency - a must Experiences in financial services, cybersecurity or cryptocurrency - preferred Track record of over achievement Entrepreneurial and relentless attitude A willingness to prospect Worked in a team selling environment About Us: Fireblocks is an easy to use, enterprise-grade platform for financial institutions that need to streamline digital asset operations - without sacrificing on security. When it comes to cryptocurrencies, both storing and transferring can be cumbersome due to the fact that one wrong move means money could be lost forever. Fireblocks uses state of the art technology in order for customers to have one platform for their team to securely store and transfer digital assets across all their exchanges, wallets, counterparties, etc. Some of the largest players in this industry have switched to Fireblocks because it's the only solution that CISOs, Traders, and Ops teams all love.

Responsibilities:  Prospecting, educating and qualifying contacts - build a solid understanding of the industry in order to spark meaningful conversations.  Research prospective company’s background and prepare Jumio business pitch Engage new prospective client account’s contacts to establish connection Research Industry news / development to identify new target accounts Build PPT / Messaging on Tailored Value Proposition Represent Jumio in Industry Associations to network for new business Maintain key accounts from list (In collaboration with Jumio Account Executive) Working alongside Marketing to support the Account Executives on outbound strategies. Helping to spread awareness of special events/ projects e.g. blog posts, webinars, press releases etc.   Experience and Qualifications:  Degree educated Experience selling into the APAC market - ideally including relevant verticals such as Financial Services, Gaming, Sharing Economy or Mobility  Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.  Hands on experience with multiple prospecting techniques e.g. videos, social outreach etc.  A solid grounding in technology or engineering - comfortable understanding and conveying technical concepts and information   Great to have Experience and Qualifications:   Experience using Outreach Existing industry knowledge would be a strong asset  Key Characteristics and Attitudes:  In a recent global survey these attributes were valued by Jumios in all locations and functions - we firmly believe in hiring for attitude as well as skill.   Friendly and supportive Adaptable and flexible Articulate and persuasive Industry Knowledge of Online Identity Verification Curious and coachable Commercially Aware Resilient and tenacious Big picture and the detail  Jumio Values:   IDEAL: Integrity, Diversity, Empowerment, Accountability, Leading Innovation  Progression:  This position offers lots of opportunities to learn and to gain experience in this field. description: KnowBe4, Inc. is the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day. Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4’s platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day.  We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years.  Please submit your resume in English.  To learn more about our team and office culture in Singapore, visit the following links.  Careers Page: https://www.knowbe4.com/careers/locations/singapore  Glassdoor: https://www.glassdoor.com/Location/KnowBe4-Singapore-Location-EI_IE969384.0,7_IL.8,17_IC3235921.htm  The Regional Account Manager position is responsible for managing the customer accounts in their assigned territory and maximizing all sales opportunities within those accounts. More specifically, this position will be charged with promoting and selling KnowBe4’s products and services to small and medium sized businesses (organizations with 101 - 999 employees), with the objective to achieve and exceed monthly sales quota. This can be achieved by targeting new business as well as reactivating dark (lapsed) customer accounts.  Responsibilities Promote and sell KnowBe4’s range of products and services Identify and close net new customers in the assigned territory Build and maintain pipeline of potential customers by developing and managing relationships with prospects Forecast new business prospects that result in successful client relationships and sales Identify key decision makers while developing and qualifying new business opportunities within the targeted markets through cold calling, networking and high-level prospecting Articulate the value proposition of KnowBe4’s products and help the customer understand how it will improve their business’s security awareness training (and security overall) Achieve or exceed monthly quotas and/or targets established by KnowBe4 Be well versed in KnowBe4’s product offerings and promote the products and services at trade shows as requested Follow up on marketing leads to generate new sales opportunities and pipeline Act strategically in offering free templates or negotiating discounted pricing, in line with established policies and procedures Maintain accurate and thorough records for customer calls, emails, notes, tasks, demos and other relevant information in compliance with the Administration Policy Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree a plus Proven track record in sales 3 years selling software to Small Medium Enterprise Familiarity with standard concepts, practices and procedures within the IT Security Field Experience with Salesforce and Gmail Network or Security Plus preferred Excellent verbal and written communications Stats driven business professional Motivated, energetic self-starter Strong collaborative and teamwork skills Must be able to work with minimum supervision Note: An applicant assessment and background check may be part of your hiring procedure.  Individuals seeking employment at KnowBe4 are considered without prejudice to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please visit www.knowbe4.com/careers/request-accommodation.  No recruitment agencies, please.

description: Job Summary  As a Country Manager you will manage all sales activities within the defined District for NetApp Products and Professional Services. This challenging and high-visibility position provides leadership and management oversight to Sales Managers and mentors Sales Representatives.  You develop long-term strategies and shorter term plans to meet aggressive revenue goals. You must be extremely results driven, customer focused, technologically savvy, and skilled at building internal relationships and external partnerships.  Our Diversity Commitment  We are an equal opportunity employer committed to create a diverse, inclusive and belonged workforce. We welcome all applications without regard to their age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.) . We pledge to take every reasonable step to ensure that our applicants and employees are respected, treated fairly and with dignity.    Job Requirements  Essential Functions  Provide management oversight to Sales Managers within the District to drive all pertinent issues related to sales strategy and goal attainment.  Participate in strategic planning sessions with the sales management team on a quarterly and annual basis.  Communicate Corporate strategy to employees within your District.  Plan and direct activities including planning and implementing forecasts, marketing program development, relationship development, customer satisfaction and collateral material development and distribution.  Establish short-term and long-term goals and quotas in line with corporate objectives.  Identify needed resources for supporting sales strategy and develop a proposed budget for Senior Management review.  Identify and qualify important Enterprise sales opportunities at the management level.  Review management plans with other District Managers on a regular basis.  Act as coach, mentor and educator to all Sales Representatives within your District.  Select, develop, and evaluate personnel to ensure departmental goals are met.  Keep senior management informed of key issues and changes which may impact expected business results.  Assume responsibility for result, including costs, methods and staffing.   Requirements  Strong verbal and written communications skills, including presentation skills.  Strong relationship building and negotiating skills.  Ability to work collaboratively with functional peers across functions including Marketing, Sales Operations, System Engineering, Customer Support, and Product Development.  Strong understanding of storage technologies and competitive offerings in the marketplace.  Experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques.  An aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems.  Experience as a Sales Representative with a track record of exceeding assigned sales quotas in contiguous, multiple years.  Demonstrated experience working with Sales organizations and technical teams.  Experience with developing budgets and predicting project costs.  A demonstrated ability to manage professional level employees.   Education  Management and Interaction:  Management:  This individual uses their management and technical skills to develop, modify and execute company policies that affect operations and may have a company wide effect.  The scope of responsibility for this person includes implementing strategic policies and establishing and adhering to budgets, schedules, work plans, and performance requirements.  This individual manages the coordination of activities of a District, with full responsibility for oversight in terms of costs, methods and staffing.  May act as an advisor or subject matter expert.  Sets revenue targets and ensures targets are met.  Interaction:  This level of manager successfully manages subordinate level managers. Management direction includes checking work against objectives set.  This individual must effectively work with, and influences senior managers through executive level employees, functional peers and/or major customers.  The interactions of this individual require strong people skills, such as negotiating with customers or management, or attempting to influence senior level leaders regarding matters on an organizational level.  Acts in a leadership role within the function and across functions.  Receives Senior Management review of objectives to determine success.   Education & Experience  Seasoned Sales Leader in the Singapore IT space  Proven ability to manage high performing sales team is highly desired  Previous experience in a government vertical focused role is a plus  A minimum of 10 years of experience as an individual contributor in a sales role and 5 years as a people manager is required in a sales-driven position  A Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering or Computer Science; or equivalent experience is required. A Master of Science Degree in Engineering; or an MBA is preferred.

A diploma candidate with good working experiences can be considered as well. - Strong commitment in work ethics and team-work - Proficient in common office tools

About Us  WeWork began in 2010 with a vision to build the first global physical platform designed to bring people together. Today, we offer access to a desk, an office, a headquarters, or an entire building in hundreds of cities around the world; with over a third of the Fortune 500 companies being part of the WeWork community.  About The Opportunity  This is a key position within our Sales Team where the candidate will be responsible for the commercial success of a portfolio of small offices. This will include renewing existing members as well as sourcing and closing new business.  As a successful Inside Sales, Account Executive you will have the opportunity to:  Nurture, develop, and close renewal opportunities in a fast-paced and evolving environment. Source, nurture and close new business opportunities by ensuring that prospects’ needs are met and exceeded. Act as the owner of the commercial success of your portfolio, working with your colleagues in the Community team and the wider sales team.  Day To Day Responsibilities Include (but Not Limited To)  Maintain high activity through regular touch points with clients. Partner with Community Teams to ensure the successful placement of new members. Maintain our CRM to ensure you are showing an accurate view of your pipeline. Execute strategy and process implemented by Sales leaders, Marketing and Sales Operations. Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and confidently communicate our value proposition to members. Provide unmatched customer service to members to ensure the best possible member experience.  About You  We’d love to hear from you if you have:  A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent qualifications. Advanced verbal and written communication skills in English. Experience of the SEA Market as well as fluency in any other Asian language. Demonstrable experience in succeeding in fast-paced, KPI driven sales environment Two years or more of professional experience in sales, account management or related deal closing fields. Demonstrated experience in nurturing, negotiating, renewing and closing sales (required). Excellent experience in customer service and relationship building. Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit. Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills.

description: Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.  Job Overview  The Enterprise Solutions team serves global organizations, including leading companies, governments, and nonprofits, who seek to upskill or retrain their workforce with the world’s best education. This team is made up of three sub-teams: Sales, Customer Success, and Revenue Strategy & Operations. The teams operate globally and have members based out of our offices in Mountain View, New York, London, Gurgaon, and Abu Dhabi. As a part of Coursera’s APAC team, you will play a key role in increasing global access to world-class education in the Singapore Market. You will lead a team of Enterprise Account Executives. The Enterprise AE team drives revenue across Coursera’s Enterprise customers (5,000+ employees) in Singapore. The role also requires working across the organization (with marketing, inside sales, product, university partnerships, skills transformation, customer success, technical implementation and legal) in service of Coursera’s growth and long-term success. This is a senior role that is expected to grow in remit with growth in the Singapore market. Reporting to the APAC Enterprise Director, the person fulfilling this role is expected to be a key senior leader in the region and play a significant contributing role in developing strategy and go to market execution in Singapore as well as input into APAC growth plans.  Responsibilities Driving your team’s success and delivering the team's opportunity creation and revenue goals in the Enterprise space Meet and exceed all team quarterly and annual sales quotas, drive pipeline growth across Singapore Enterprise accounts, ensure accurate reporting of leads, pipeline, activities and forecasts Partner with Customer Success to meet and exceed all quarterly and annual renewal quotas; partner with marketing & sales leadership on prospecting, campaigns, and other initiatives Improve time to productivity for new AEs while maintaining performance in existing team; develop experienced team members for promotion and internal mobility opportunities; coach team members on inbound/outbound techniques, sales process and Challenger sales Attend key prospect and client meetings to support sales opportunities; use knowledge of industry trends to consult and support the team with customers; provide analyses to inform the team on general trends, product, competitors and act as a senior leader for the business and play an active role in GTM strategy Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!  Basic Qualifications 15+ years of demonstrated success across sales and team leadership roles where enterprise selling is the core of revenue generation, delivering revenues of $10M+ Demonstrated history of driving revenue in an enterprise software environment, with ideally an experience of HR / LMS / Talent or education-based solutions Experience as a leader of customer functions, with a bias to sales, and ability to influence marketing and customer success Demonstrated history as a sales business manager capable of evaluating, building, and executing on a strategy to drive accelerated growth in Singapore & engage top C-level customers on their strategic talent transformation initiatives Entrepreneurial drive and comfort working as part of a team in ambiguous, quickly-changing environments Preferred Qualifications Understanding of digital transformation imperatives & initiatives from customers of key Industries in Singapore Past experience in setting up Singapore operations of a global company and scaling them Business written and verbal communication skills, strong analytical and creative problem solving abilities, excellent interpersonal skills, organizational, and operational skills If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:  Foundations of Business Strategy  Successful Negotiation: Essential Strategies and Skills  Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.  Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We are looking for a Business Development professional to join our organization, Right Management under ManpowerGroup® (NYSE: MAN), the leading global workforce solutions company, helps organizations transform in a fast-changing world of work by sourcing, assessing, developing and managing the talent that enables them to win. Labor markets are out of balance and companies are operating in a highly uncertain environment. description: Business Development Representative   Do you believe in the future of the creator economy? Do you love education and see its power to transform lives? We do, which is why we are building Nas Academy, an online education platform to empower creators to share their knowledge. https://nasacademy.com/  Nas Academy is looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic Business Development Representative to join our growing outbound sales team. You will be responsible for the development of the lead generation program and nurture outbound sales lead campaigns for Nas Academy products and services.   Key responsibilities include: Managing the top of the funnel and middle of the funnel leads generation  Collaboratively work with the Head of Outbound sales to develop lead generation strategies to generate lead opportunities with prospective customers Hands on experience with email marketing and running email sequence campaign  Providing consistent, concise, accurate and timely weekly/monthly sales lead gen activity reports to management Solving complex technical integration solutions and issues with the Lead generation tool  Achieving sales lead gen and appointment quotas  Qualifications Minimum of 3 - 5 years of sales email marketing experience in an education, internet, or solutions selling environment.  Experience with lead generation and marketing automation software Must be an experienced successful prospector, and be able to independently develop new prospects in a highly competitive environment. Show a proven track record achieving sales lead gen and appointment quotas Must have strong inner drive and self-discipline, proficiency in EXCEL, Word, PowerPoint and Lead Generation Tools   About Nas Academy Nas Academy is an Ed-tech platform for the creator economy founded by Nuseir Yassin (Creator of Nas Daily). Nas means people in Arabic, and as the peoples academy, we want to help every creator monetize their knowledge. We believe content creators on the Internet will be the future journalists, commerce sellers, and educators of the world. We are on a mission to turn creators into academy’s, empowering them to become the world's best educators. Think of it like Masterclass...but for everybody else.   With team members around the world, we are a global platform for creators founded by creators. We are passionate about being a force for good in the world, and providing a platform for voices that are not always heard. Our social media pages have more than 13 billion views and 38 million followers across the internet.  Content creators and storytelling are the future - and we want to help build that future. Our goal is to be the Global leader for online learning. So far, 10,000+ students from over 140 countries have already taken our courses and are part of our community for a lifetime! We aim to grow these numbers by 10x in 2021.  ** Remote position**
industries: E-Learning

description: About Brightcove  Brightcove is a team of smart, passionate people who are revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video. We're hyped up about storytelling, and about helping people connect, share experiences, and view the world. Bottom line: video is the world's most compelling, exciting medium, and Brightcove exists to demonstrate that video means business.  As the industry leader in this space, we empower our customers to deliver top-notch video experiences to audiences on every screen in bold and innovative ways. When video is executed correctly, it can have a powerful and lasting effect. Hearts open. Minds change. Creativity thrives. Since 2004, Brightcove has been supporting customers that are some of the largest media companies, enterprises, events, and non-profit organizations in the world. There are over 600 Brightcovers globally, each of us representing our unique talents and passions and we have built a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence and collaboration. This culture enables us to develop technologies once thought impossible, provide customer support without parallel or excuses, and leverage the expertise and resources of a global infrastructure. We take our video seriously, and we take great pride in doing it as one team.  Position Overview  This is a quota-carrying sales role responsible for delivering Brightcove customer licence signings and revenue targets for Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam preferably based in Singapore. The role develops, writes and owns the execution of the strategic territory plan. Provides direction and hands-on management of all the resources assigned to a sales pursuit in their region. The Territory Manager supports Brightcove's corporate goals of customer satisfaction and profitability within these three markets.  Job Responsibilities Directs selling activities within the region/territory, inclusive of resource deployment and customer interactions. Owns the financial sales performance for the territory - both bookings and revenue. Owns and manages all routes to market in the territory, direct & indirect in partners. Establishes an environment and business foundation for future sales growth. Coaches others on how to sell value to Brightcove customers. Prioritizes effectively and in accordance with given corporate objectives. Responsible for accurate region/territory forecasting and performance tracking. Works closely with other team leaders within Brightcove to build sales, resolve customer issues and enable high customer satisfaction. Continually identifies and communicates customer knowledge gaps and opportunities for Brightcove products and services. Evaluates market trends and gathers competitive information, identifying trends that impact current and future growth of regional sales and profitability. Disseminates information to regional sales teams, corporate marketing and sales operations. Helps to build the knowledge base in applicable Brightcove communities including lessons learned, best practices, tools, methods and product enhancements.  Qualifications/Experience 7+ years sales experience delivering or exceeding quota targets in related fields. Requires excellent understanding of Salesforce or a similar CRM system. Proven track record of success in selling and achieving targets; Proven ability to prioritise projects and deliverables driving accurate and timely decisions; Adaptable, highly driven, high energy. Ability to work in a sometimes stressful and constantly changing environment employing multi-tasking capabilities; Problem solver, demonstrate the ability to apply sound judgment and negotiate successful outcomes for customers and internal stakeholders; Attain and maintain a deep understanding of Brightcove products, training and adoption services needed to advise and enable customer success; Numerate, commercially astute, able to effectively manage budgets and forecast accurately; Detail oriented and analytical. Able to learn and effectively use analysis and reporting software to forecast future business; English and French at level of native fluency required Special Conditions Seasoned professional that can work without manager direction on day to day basis. Can make independent decisions mapped to territory account plans and channel programmes to achieve territory revenue and signings plans. Has ownership of the territory's strategic plan and coordinates all resources engaged in the territory to achieve the plan. Business travel of up to 50 percent of available time is expected for this position as and when the Pandemic allows. Job requires extensive customer/ team engagement and extensive periods of computer and telephone work.  Working at Brightcove  As the undisputed global leader in powering premium video for our customers, Brightcove recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, creating an environment where people can innovate and achieve their best, and we reward them for their performance by giving them the opportunity to share in the company's success. We offer competitive benefits and compensation packages.  Brightcove is headquartered in Boston with offices in New York, London, Guadalajara, Funchal, Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney, Mumbai and Chennai. This position is being offered as a fully remote role in France and, while you won't get to experience the in-office culture, you will feel it remotely and be able to participate actively. We have plenty of opportunities to meet your colleagues around the globe and we also celebrate a variety of personal interests with organized groups and clubs including an Employee Action Committee, Women of Brightcove, Pride of Brightcove, Parents of Brightcove … and more to come!  If you've gotten all the way to the bottom of this description, thank you for your interest in Brightcove! If this role sounds like something that is exciting to you please don't hesitate to apply, even if you don't meet all of our qualifications. We recognize that no candidate is perfect and Brightcove would love to have the chance to get to know you.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.  Send us your resume if you are interested and want to learn more!  **Please submit your resume in English to be considered for this role.**

jobTitle: SVP Sales & Marketing, South East Asia & Indian Subcontinent
description: Company Description  At Toll, we do more than just logistics - we move the businesses that move the world. Our 20,000 team members can help solve any logistics, transport or supply chain challenge – big or small. We have been supporting our customers for more than 130 years. Today, we support more than 20,000 customers worldwide with 500 sites in 25 countries, and a forwarding network spanning 150 countries. We are proudly part of Japan Post — www.tollgroup.com  Global Forwarding delivers cargo across our global network via road, rail, sea, and air. From loose cartons for consolidation and palletised cargo to moving dangerous goods and bulk commodities, we have the experience, the infrastructure, and the global network to get freight moving – across towns, across countries and across continents.  Job Description  This role oversees the entire Sales & Marketing strategies and business development on Freight within the SEA-ISC Region. This role will manage the sales teams (through matrix reporting lines) and develop key processes and procedures to deliver business intelligence, drive our CRM strategy, and develop sales content and related tools to ensure our Sales teams have the resources to meet their goals and enhance overall sales effectiveness. The role will maximize profitability by reviewing, developing and linking sales sources, market trends, cost allocation and the company’s capabilities.  Qualifications  Technical Strategic thinking and strong networking abilities Knowledge of global freight forwarding operations and markets Strong selling & presentation skills based on solid experience in working in a diverse cultural environment\ Demonstrated critical thinking, using logic and reasoning to identify strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and risks, and identifying alternative solutions or approaches Good negotiation skills to close contracts with customers Business Air freight industry experience Ocean freight industry experience Marketing & Sales Management Experience(s) Commercially focused & result orientated Strong analytical skills and sensible to market trends Innovative Human Relations Good communication skills Strong interpersonal skills and able to build respectful relationship with all levels of people Team building & encourage collaboration Good leader and influence behaviours Supportive and ability to provide mentoring / training. Additional Information  Be Connected  With a bold vision and innovative drive, join our 44,000 colleagues as we lead industry change and transform how customers best meet their global supply chain needs in a meaningful and sustainable way. There are countless opportunities to learn and make a real impact in shaping our industry’s future. Grow with diverse challenges amongst a friendly and inclusive global culture. Take pride in building relationships that matter, because being connected is at the centre of what makes Toll great – it’s what makes our possibilities endless.  Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities.  To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com/careers  To be considered, you must be entitled to work in the specified country and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment.

description: Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate!  Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we’re on a mission to deliver the world’s most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world.  What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you!  Who We Are  Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in education, using modern technology.  Today, we’ve digitized payments for more than 2,400 global clients across education, healthcare, travel & B2B, covering more than 240 countries and territories and supporting over 130 currencies. And, we’re just getting started!  With over 500 global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 12 offices world-wide, we’re looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow.  The Opportunity  We, at Flywire, are seeking a Senior Sales Manager who will spend most of their time with prospective clients! Flywire is seeking an experienced and motivated Senior Sales Manager to join our growing team in Singapore for the Asia market (Less Japan & ANZ). This position is accountable for the full sales cycle from start to getting them onboard, pursuing new business and opportunities in order to effectively acquire, lead, and profitably grow our client database. This person will convert client conversations into qualified, developed, proposed, and closed sales opportunities. Focus on developing strategic education accounts Work autonomously to meet and exceed sales targets Investigate and solve problems for clients by tailoring plans which addresses their needs Develop in-depth knowledge of the business product offering and value proposition Work with internal teams to engage audiences and develop business strategies Be involved in Presentations, Demos and events to build up a robust client base Here’s What We’re Looking For: At least 8 years of experience in selling across APAC Experience in sourcing prospects - including account development and cold calling Experience in the Education or payments industry will be advantageous Experience in planning and implementing sales strategies Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient in Microsoft Office/ Google Workspace What We Offer Competitive compensation, including stock options Flying Start - Our immersive Global Induction Program (Meet our Execs & Global Teams) Work with brilliant people that will keep you on your toes, learn more about their journeys by checking out #InsideFlywire on social media Dynamic & Global Team (we have been collaborating virtually for years!) Wellbeing Programs (Mental Health, Wellness, Yoga/Pilates/HIIT Classes) with Global FlyMates Be a meaningful part in our success - every FlyMate makes an impact Competitive time off including FlyBetter Days to volunteer in a cause you believe in Great Talent & Development Programs (Managers Taking Flight – for new or aspiring managers!) Submit today and get started!  We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect 4-5 rounds of interviews with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a homework assignment (don’t worry - this is the fun part!) your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions.  Additional Information  Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 40 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we’re excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire.
industries: Financial Services

description: About The Role: Mixpanel is in a stage of high-growth and partnerships is a key piece of the puzzle to our growth across the Asia-Pacific (‘APAC’) region. We are looking for a highly motivated leader and team player to join our Partnerships team to support the growth of Reseller partnerships in APAC. In this role, you’ll identify, recruit and operationalize new reseller partnerships to help expand Mixpanel’s indirect sales reach across Asia-Pacific. You will build a regional partner business plan with quantified goals and milestones to achieve partner sourced revenue metrics to meet all quarterly sales requirements. This role manages existing reseller partners in Asia, as well as being responsible for acquiring and nurturing new reseller relationships across all of APAC. You will drive the strategy for your partners, be responsible for managing your partner relationships, executing GTM activities with your partners, accountable for exceeding quarterly quota, generating pipeline and forecasting revenue, and helping your partner reps resell Mixpanel to generate revenue. You have experience working with Channel Resellers, Distributors, System Integrators (SIs), and Digital Agencies to understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate your partnerships and grow the region.  Responsibilities: Own and drive relationships with Solution Provider Reseller partners in Asia to generate significant resell revenue in region through new customer acquisition and existing customers upsell. Identify, recruit, enable and manage long-term relationships with new reseller partners (Regional Service Integrators (SIs), Digital agencies, Product Development agencies, etc.) to support business goals and to execute channel strategies Develop a deep understanding of partner business models, needs, and challenges including an understanding of our mutual customers’ needs. Develop GTM plans with partners to achieve and exceed revenue targets. Execute GTM activities and lead cross functional teams on activities such as onsite trainings, email campaigns, remote training sessions, webinars, and events. Generate resold revenue and assist partner sales teams to close deals. Manage pipeline generation and revenue forecast reporting. Leverage existing relationships at partners to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Assist partners with product positioning, configuration, demonstrations, sales strategy, and closing deals. Forge strong Mixpanel-internal relationships with key managers and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. We're looking for someone who has: Aside from having channel / indirect sales experience, you exhibit the two core characteristics of the Mixpanel Partnerships Team: low-ego and self-motivation. This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Development professional to join a growing channel program or an Account Executive looking to shift to a channel sales role and make a significant impact in the region. Preferred Qualifications: 5+ years of channel or direct sales experience in a Channel Sales role or equivalent quota-carrying role Execution focused but able to see larger picture Self-starter with great time management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Hard working and willing to put in the extra effort to get it done Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments Travel as necessary (and when possible), typically 25% or more depending on territory/region coverage Multi-lingual preferred.
industries: Computer Software

description: ZA Tech is on a mission to redefine insurance with advanced technology. We are backed by a leading venture investor and have partnered with a number of unicorns and financial services companies across Asia.   ZA Tech continues our rapid growth and we are looking for a driven, empathetic, and results-oriented individual to join our Sales team. This is an incredible opportunity to help the regional fintech leader to shape a technology platform that is redefining insurance. You will have an opportunity to learn from our team and interact closely with our client-partners.   As the Sales Development Manager, you will be joining a hyper scaling insurtech startup. This will be a tremendous growth opportunity for you and will combine a challenging and fun environment. You will instrumental to our continued Southeast Asia success story and will become a key member in our expanding regional sales team. You will work closely with the sales executives across Southeast Asia to support them to meet ambitious growth targets.   Your responsibilities will include the day-to-day management and execution of number important aspects across Sales and Sales Operations as well as acting as a key player and maintaining relationships with Finance, Accounting, Legal and various other organisations across APAC.    A career with ZA Tech provides invaluable experience in a rapid growing fintech firm, with leading ecosystems and financial institutions as partners, as well as a cool startup culture.   Responsibilities   Outbound sales activities including research, reach-out and qualifying calls Development of sales materials with inputs from sales execs Support sales activities events, including conferences, meetings, and roadshows  Work closely with the regional sales leaders to drive operational cadence and run strategic initiatives.  Get to know our products inside and out and help to shape prospect communication for the feature launches by the company, work closely with the various departments to ensure that latest information of sales pipeline, progress is accurately recorded  Generate deal registration checkpoint reports as required  Follow through process of invoice collection, attendance list collection Support on customer onboarding, registration, and documentation  Requirements:  Three years of work experience in Sales Development, Operations or Sales Support   Self-starter with a strong drive and work ethic.  Be willing to drive initiatives, working across the organization and creative problem solving in a real-time, fast-paced sales environment  Bachelor's Degree preferred  Proficient computer skills, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Word  Academic background at software or information system is a plus  Good communication skills Able to work independently and flexibly with minimal direct supervision   What we offer   Attractive compensation package   Opportunity to work on the most interesting and impactful problems in insurance  Incredible learning opportunities across international markets  Health insurance  The amazing personal growth experience   About ZA Tech   ZA Tech is a technology venture founded by ZhongAn Online, a global leader in online insurance, and backed by Softbank’s Vision Fund. ZA Tech’s solution originated from the use-cases of ZhongAn and is utilized by external partners, including leading insurers to enable them to unlock the value of digital partnerships and accelerate the go-to-market for the new generation of online insurance.  ZA Tech is redefining the insurance landscape by enabling digital ecosystems to easily embed relevant protection within their customer journeys.

description: ROLE & CONTEXT As TR APAC Business Market Analyst, this position is the key contact for TR APAC Director with key mission to follow-up, gather and analyse all Sell-out Data for Guerlain TR APAC along market, ranking, competition, POS/ distribution evolution to support on all strategic decisions of TR APAC Business Unit.  As an ambassador for our Maison, you represent and transmit Guerlain's values to your customers and employees. You will oversee the achievement of sales objectives, the excellence of our customer service and the implementation of the strategy set by the Management. You ensure the management, training and development of your employees and put the customer relationship and experience at the heart of all your actions. description: Company Overview Our client, an international company with a diverse range of areas covering Fibre-Optic, Power Cable, Construction and Maintenance, Financial Service, Capital Investment, Information Technology and Tourism. It has 80 wholly owned companies and holding companies (some are listed on various Stock Exchanges: Shanghai, Singapore, Hong Kong and Indonesia) with 10 manufacturing overseas facilities based in Africa, Europe, South America, South Africa, South Asia and Southeast Asia. As well as sales offices in over 30 countries and regions around the world supplying products to over 130 countries. It is the largest Optical Fibre and Power Cable manufacturer in China and the second largest in the world. It is also the largest Optical Fibre communication producer globally.   Job brief We are looking for an experienced Sales Manager to head up, grow and be responsible for selling Bandwidth products within Middle East and Asia Pacific areas.   Responsibilities Conduct market research and analysis to create detailed business plans on sales opportunities (obstacle, competition, expansion, business development etc.) Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs Seek cooperation directly or indirectly sales for Bandwidth Products across related regions. Whole process Management& Coordination during tender evaluation, participation, pre-bid and post bid Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to the management team  Requirements BS/MS degree in Communication, Electric information engineering, marketing, business administration or a related field Singaporeans ONLY Good understanding of the Middle East and Asia Pacific telecom market, be familiar with local telecom operators, OTT and ISP players. Successful previous experience as a sales representative or sales manager or market related within that sector Committed to continuous education through workshops, seminars and conferences Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization Experience with international bandwidth sales would be beneficial Hard working and able to work autonomously  Strong business sense and industry expertise Attention to detail with genuine care and pride for what they do

description: About the company Founded in 2016, Crypto.com today serves over 10 million customers with the world’s fastest growing crypto app, along with the Crypto.com Visa Card — the world’s largest crypto card program — the Crypto.com Exchange and Crypto.com DeFi Wallet. Recently launched, Crypto.com NFT is the premier platform for collecting and trading NFTs, carefully curated from the worlds of art, design, entertainment and sports. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO/IEC 27701:2019, CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and independently assessed at Tier 4, the highest level for both NIST Cybersecurity and Privacy Frameworks. Crypto.com is headquartered in Hong Kong with a 1,500+ strong team. Find out more by visiting https://crypto.com  About the role Are you enthusiastic about gaming/eSports/anime/manga? Do you love closing deals and crushing your targets? Come join one of the most dominant companies in the crypto/fintech industry and play an important part in accelerating the world’s transition to cryptocurrency.  We are looking for an ambitious and passionate BD manager based in Singapore, to join our team and help scale up our global pool of NFT contents. As a deal hunter, you will be responsible for bringing digital artists, cartoonists, mangakas, musicians, influencers, gamers, Tiktokers and every relevant content creator interested onboard the Crypto.com NFT marketplace. You will be leveraging your knowledge of sales and customer insights to curate the best content worldwide.  Responsibilities Reach out to relevant creators who have strong presence in multiple social media platforms such as Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc. Research, identify, and reach out to suitable talents using platforms like Behance, Dribbble, Deviantart and other portfolio sites. Understand trends, likes, preferences and needs of customers in different age groups and geographical locations. Establish strategic partnerships with potential gaming or entertainment partners to list their content on Crypto.com NFT marketplace. Ensure a successful and smooth execution of each partnership with the optimal pricing strategy  Requirements Has minimum 5 years working experience as a sales/business development role in an e-commerce marketplace, influencer marketing agency, or gaming/entertainment industry Proven ability in business development and strategic partnership to structure creative deals, and drive revenue in the digital world Familiar with platform such as Foundation, Superrare, OpenSea, NiftyGateway, Rarible, Artblocks, Aysnc.art, Maker's Place, Ephimera, Bitski and Zora. Hungry for results. Resourceful.  Benefits Attractive compensation package - base salary, commissions and bonuses Working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team

description: Job Description The selected candidate will be responsible for handling selected StarHub's Channel Partners, leading a team of more than 20 Channel Partner sales professionals combined to drive sales revenue strategy, manage leads, institute and manage program execution as well as pipeline for growth of the SMB Segment.  The ideal candidate must possess an exemplary record of sales and leadership in building and directing sales and/or sales/channel sales teams to drive sustainable, profitable growth, market share and revenues. Knowledge of telecommunication products such as business mobile, broadband and Voice, ICT solutions are highly preferred.  With a never-say-die attitude, the selected candidate will be instrumental in build strategic relationships with existing/new channel partners, positioning partners for clear sales opportunities and sales campaigns within different StarHub products lines and develop route to market, and develop strategies to grow in new market segments identified.  He/She will also be required, from time to time, perform joint sales engagement on sizable sales opportunities with the partner sales representatives. The ability to handle customer engagements, strategize and close large opportunities is a must.  As people is StarHub's greatest asset, the candidate will must also be people-oriented - someone who is able to motivate, provide guidance and encouragement to the channel sales team under his/her charge to achieve the desired results.  The ability to work in a highly stressful, dynamic and result oriented culture is a must.  This candidate reports to the Channel Sales Director of Enterprise Business - SME Team.  This role requires a strong leader who will play a critical position within the following key business activities:  Channel strategy, forecast, sales gap analysis and action planning Channel Partner & Customer engagement Lead and Pipeline Management GTM and Program Management Large Deal Engagement Operational Management NPS  Qualifications   Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Marketing, or related field. Candidate with Polytechnic Diploma / A Levels / other professional qualifications will also be considered. 4+ years of experience in direct sales, channel sales, product marketing, or product management Experience in the Telecommunication industry is highly preferred Demonstrated oral and written communications skills Strong financial and analytical acumen Leadership skills to lead teams and shape growth vision and sales strategy. Accomplished sales individual contributors with no prior leadership experience but possesses the ability and strong desire to take on a leadership role will also be considered Creative problem solver and solution developer when presented with competing business priorities Demonstrated ability to independently deliver results while working on multiple projects simultaneously, balancing resources, timing, and quality of outcomes Proven ability to influence and negotiate with customers, channel partners and internal stakeholders Achieves and exceeds assigned sales and contract value quota in designated partner accounts Meet assigned expectation for product New sales and Revenue targets Maintains high Partner satisfaction ratings Execution of Monthly, Quarterly and Annual review of partner planning and performance evaluations Work closely with Customer Service Representatives to ensure customer satisfaction and problem resolution   *We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Telecommunications

description: At a glance Our Sales Managers are the front-line leaders of Chope’s market growth through software sales and F&B merchant acquisition. They report directly to the Head of Sales, and have a pivotal role in leading, grooming, and shaping the Singapore Sales team. In addition to their leadership role, they might also need to generate leads, build partnerships with key actors in the F&B scene, follow up, and close sales opportunities for high-yield accounts.  As part of nurturing strong account relations, the sales team will be key contact for their clients, and also undertake contractual and marketing-related account management. Like the team they lead, they will be expected to meet ambitious quarterly sales targets, and work closely with our marketing, account management, and operations teams to help our clients get the most out of the Chope platform, both operationally and marketing-wise.  Ideal candidates should have at least a two year’s experience in managing and motivating a sales team, as well as at least 2 to 3 years’ in B2B sales. Previous exposure to e-commerce and/or SaaS will definitely be an advantage. Candidates should have a keen understanding of performance metrics for sales people, and preferably be able to ‘lead from the front’, juggling both their own performance as well as that of their team.   About the role Lead a team of sales individuals to acquire and develop sales opportunities through a combination of channels, including but not limited to, referrals, networking, cold calls, and face-to-face meetings Consistently find ways to increase inbound and outbound lead generation through a combination of internal and external resources, to ultimately increase the overall sales team’s output Diligently monitor sales team stakeholders’ performance and take part/follow up on key account and large-scale group acquisition Impart consultative skills and hard sales skills within the team to ensure their ability to make purposeful recommendations to restaurant decision makers on our products and services while communicating the value of joining the Chope network Build a lasting relationship with decision makers in the F&B industry (e.g. restaurants, associations, agencies, etc) to maintain the possibility of future sales or client referrals Work closely with the Operations team’s leaders to facilitate successful product adoption by new clients Enable team to upsell additional paid-services to existing clients Manage the expectations, morale, and performance of their sales executives Recruit, develop, and retain a high-performing sales team Generate partnership opportunities that enables impactful client engagement, monetisation of our paid marketing offerings, and large-scale restaurant acquisition  Requirements At least 5-6 years’ experience in B2B sales, with 2-3 years managing a team Possesses a natural ability to network and build lasting business relationships  Understands the techniques of a consultative sell Independent and result-driven mindset, with the ability to be productive and efficient with minimal or no supervision in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment Analytical, detail-oriented, and conscientious  Resilient and methodical Proven track record of exceeding set sales targets Basic computer literacy in the Microsoft Office suite of software  While not required, the following skills/experience will be favourably considered Experience in the sale of restaurant reservations/table management systems such as ResPak etc., or in other food and beverage related SaaS products  Why Chope? Meaningful work - you’ll have ownership over and the ability to make a direct impact on the experience we’re delivering to our customers (you’re not here “just to execute”) Autonomy - you’ll be in an environment that enables you to challenge yourself, challenge team members, learn new skills, shape discussions and new initiatives, and try out new things Collaborative and an open culture that values receiving and giving feedback   A competitive salary  Flexible work arrangements that provide you the balance you deserve  We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted
industries: Internet

description: At Branch, we’re transforming how brands and users interact across digital platforms. Our mobile marketing and deep linking solutions are trusted to deliver seamless experiences that increase ROI, decrease wasted spend, and eliminate siloed attribution. Our team consists of smart, humble, and collaborative people who value ownership overall we do to create a product, team, and company that lives and breathes our motto: Build Together, Grow Together, Win Together.  The Sales Development team is all about generating lead volume for our Account Executives while helping marketers and developers understand the many ways in which Branch can improve their company’s success.  As a Sales Development Representative at Branch, you’ll prospect and identify key decision-makers at target companies and lay the foundation for a strong relationship. You're an energetic and organized self-starter. You understand the sales process, can build relationships with the right decision-makers, and can succinctly define and communicate the specific benefits of Branch appropriate for each user. You will be a key driver of growth for the company, and on the front lines for evangelizing our product to prospective and existing users.  What You’ll Do Work closely with Account Executives to build a pipeline of Branch prospects in the South East Asia Region. Develop and qualify opportunities with large app developers and mobile-centric companies in the region. Establish relationships with app marketers and developers around the world, explaining how Branch brings value to the customer’s needs. Partner with Account Executives in developing relationships with new stakeholders within customer accounts. (Upsells) Research on market trends and insights that could unlock business conversations with our key potential accounts in the region. You’ll Be a Good Fit If You Have A strong desire to build a career in tech sales within mobile, emerging technologies, and startups. 1+ years of relevant experience in a client-facing role, consulting, or marketing. Experience working on the indonesian Region in either B2B or B2C sales, deeply understanding the consumer and digital landscape of the region. A track record of overachieving against defined metrics (top 10-20%). Experience in prospecting and evangelizing SaaS marketing/ad technology. Intellectual curiosity and an ability to ignite data-driven conversations with executives. The ability to maintain a high level of productivity, manage multiple competing priorities and work effectively under the pressure of time constraints in a fast-paced, complex, collaborative, and team-oriented environment. An understanding and ability to apply effective business development strategies and techniques. A Bachelor's degree from an accredited University is strongly preferred. A passion for building new business and willingness to work in a collaborative environment. Technical expertise and the ability to acquire knowledge of new technology. A Little Bit About Us Branch has raised more than $330M from investors such as NEA, Founders Fund, and Playground Ventures. We are headquartered in Silicon Valley and have presence all over the world. Branch Ranked No. 3 Fastest-Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2020 Technology Fast 500. Diversity at Branch ranks in the top 10% for similarly sized companies (by Comparably). In 2020, we are recognized as one of Forbes Best Startups, Great Places to Work, and Bay Area Best Places to Work. We have more than 3 billion monthly users and are partnered with over 75,000 apps. If you think you’d be a good fit for this role, we’d love for you to apply! At Branch, we strive to create an inclusive culture that encourages people from different backgrounds, age groups to bring their unique, diverse perspectives to work. We aim every day to build an environment that empowers us all to do the best work of our lives, and we can’t wait to show you what we have to offer!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet
