description: Description  At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you would like to help us build our Public Sector team in Singapore, then this is your chance to make history.  The Public Sector Global Lead Development Team is expanding in Singapore! As a Lead Development Representative (LDR) covering the Singapore market, you will be an important member of the account management organization, playing a critical role in qualifying leads, profiling customers and providing input on which lead development campaigns generate the best leads. Working in collaboration with your global peers, marketing, account managers and the partner channel, your primary objective is to identify and create qualified opportunities for the team you support. Quite often you will be the customer’s very first introduction to the AWS experience!  The Successful Candidate Will Manage inbound and outbound leads to meet SLAs Conduct discussions with prospects and existing customers over the phone to identify and qualify opportunities Understand customer pain points, gather technical requirements and correlate business value to customer needs Generate interest and provide vision of the portfolio of AWS solutions to potential customers Understand existing and developing technologies as it relates to cloud computing Achieve monthly qualification goals Update and maintain customer information within SalesForce.com Provide account management team with detailed call notes to ensure the opportunity is understood and next steps are clearly defined Present a high level, technical solution to diverse audiences relevant to target industry or market  Basic Qualifications  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS University Degree or equivalent experience Fluent in English and other languages native to the geography you support Excellent time management. Ability to multi-task and manage high volume of leads Experience using a CRM/Customer Relationship Management tools (preferably Salesforce & Tableau) 2+ years prospecting & cold calling for new sales business  Preferred Qualifications  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Target orientated, ambitious, creative, customer focused Working knowledge of emerging technologies, especially as it relates to Iaas, PaaS, and SaaS. Technical interest with 1-2 years or more of experience in IT prospecting or business development in technology business Track record of meeting and exceeding established business goals Excellent written and verbal communication skills Self-starter with highly developed interpersonal skills and organizational skills, decisive and result oriented who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore  Job ID: A1753670

description: About Us Go1 is on a mission to unlock positive potential through a love of learning. The Go1 platform makes learning easy with thousands of courses in one simple solution. Since our founding in 2015, we have grown to an organization of 200+ in 9 global offices. At Go1, we go to infinity and beyond through excellent work, prioritising actions over words and encouraging creativity and candour. It is with this spirit that we are driving hypergrowth and international expansion. The role: We are in search of a motivated and determined sales Account Executive to join our Sales Team reporting to the Sales Team Manager. As an Account Executive you will encompass the sales lifecycle elements of discovery, solution design, negotiation, collaboration, and sale close. You will lead by example in performing and achieving your own personal sales targets. You have a complete understanding of the breadth and depth of opportunities held, be able to provide insight into how to best capitalize and convert opportunities at each sales stage, and to articulate process weekly via 1:1 pipeline review to optimize opportunities and troubleshoot where necessary.  Responsibilities: Full sales lifecycle: discovery, solution design, negotiation, collaboration, and sale close Generate new recurring revenue for Go1 Manage complex sales and present our value to C-level executives Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement in CRM, while creating satisfied and referenceable customers Maintain accurate data around opportunities and communications Achieve, and exceed, a monthly (and ultimately annual) sales quota Assist in preparation of pertinent sales and marketing material Attend and participate in events on behalf of Go1 Nurture highly positive relationships inside and outside of Go1 Assist in constantly improving sales and marketing processes Occasional travel up to 30%  About you: You are persuasive and organized. Communication is a top priority to you in interpersonal, verbal, and written formats. You are resilient and consistently meet your goals. You will have; High level of strategic sales capability and approach with a proven track record in customer acquisition, retention, and growth Consistent contribution to a high-performance sales team and culture Customer-centric with strong abilities in persuasion, organization, perseverance, negotiation, and appropriate communication Highly developed and effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, able to engage, influence, and negotiate at a senior and executive level if required Able to collaborate, problem solve and innovate internally with key stakeholders to develop compelling solutions for prospects and customers High alignment to Go1 Values; strong internal drive, bias for action, creativity and candor, collaboration and teamwork Strong understanding and capability for selling technical services to HR & other business stakeholders Excellent understanding of Go1 products and services (acquired during probation period  Pay Benefits Competitive market-based salaries, bonus, and commission plans Salary paid monthly, within 7 days of the end of the salary period Leave Benefits 20 Days Paid Annual Leave 11 Paid Public Holidays Sick Days Maternity Leave Childcare Leave Work-Related Injury Leave Other Benefits Access to Go1’s exclusive learning platform Wellness benefits EAP

description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting a Senior Manager to join our team in Singapore.  About Aon  Headquartered in London, Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.  Responsibilities: Develop and grow 'New" sales in the Large Commercial/ Corporate segments Actively search for new clients by developing leads through social platforms, cold calling, following up on direct marketing, attending networking events and converting leads to sales opportunities Execute Local Market Plans and develop a pipeline of opportunities in the Large Commercial I Corporate segment, with full responsibility for converting those prospects to clients Develop opportunities by demonstrating risk, insurance, consulting expertise and ability to help solve clients' problems in benefits administration Ensure smooth transition of 'New' accounts and strong collaboration to Broking and Account Servicing team in delivering distinctive client values Manage responses to tenders and develop quality presentations as needed, work with the relevant bid management in country and regional expertise Facilitate cross-selling activities as directed by Supervisor Follow the Aon sales process, including regular sales activity, accurate pipeline updates and branding standards Contribute, as required, to ARS Singapore initiatives in general by providing constructive challenge and implement agreed initiatives Achieve sales revenue target Provide mentoring and coaching to junior staff of the team Requirements University degree and/ or a professional qualification Minimum of 6 years’ experience in the general insurance industry Highly motivated and sales driven Highly articulate, an effective communicator who uses consultative selling skills Exceptionally organised with strong time management skills Excellent team player Ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines while maintaining prospect relationships Creative and lateral thinker Confidence to present to audiences / decision makers Strong computer/systems literacy including first class Word and PowerPoint skills How To Apply  Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience  Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. description: Why join us?    The global geospatial solutions market size is expected to swell to $549.1 billion by 2025, rising at 15.6% CAGR during the forecast period with Asia Pacific leading the charge.   Development of smart cities and urbanisation, integration of geospatial and mainstream technologies for business intelligence, and growing adoption of GIS solutions in transportation are the market’s key driving factors.   As a Pioneer and the Leader in location strategy and analytics solutions that enhance the core business of any organisation, Esri Singapore has been engaged by more than 500 organisations. They span across industry domains, from commercial and retail to national planning and public safety, adopting Esri’s world-leading ArcGIS technology as an integral part of their business for decision-making and better business outcomes.   We are looking for sales professionals who are client-oriented and collaborative team players who enjoy implementing strategies that will radically improve the challenges that organizations face, and deliver real‑world value and impact.   How will you benefit from this role?   You will:   Build a reputation as a trusted partner with our clients in the adoption of the fast-growing domain of geospatial technology in Singapore. Learn how geospatial technology can make a difference to our clients, our community and our environment. Have continuous opportunities to enrich your experience and grow as a sales leader.  What experience is required?   Enterprise solutions and services related to geospatial technologies, ERP, workforce management, business analytics and other information management solutions. Successful track record of selling holistic and effective solutions and services to large enterprises and/or government agencies and consistently meet or exceed assigned targets. Engaging senior executives and decision makers in strategic planning, negotiating and winning of large deals. Well-developed organizational and time management abilities, with an eye for detail.·     Methodical approach to developing a healthy sales pipeline. Professional, ambitious, determined, and a result-oriented mind‑set with a positive attitude who can work independently as well as collaboratively to achieve team goals. Effective communication skills including written and presentations.

Company Description  We’re on a mission to help move the businesses that move the world. With over 130 years’ experience, Toll Group, proudly part of Japan Post, operates an extensive global logistics network, covering road, air, sea and rail across 1,200 locations in more than 50 countries.  Global Forwarding delivers cargo across our global network via road, rail, sea, and air. From loose cartons for consolidation and palletised cargo to moving dangerous goods and bulk commodities, we have the experience, the infrastructure, and the global network to get freight moving – across towns, across countries and across continents.  Job Description  Regional Client Relationship Manager Based in Clementi, Singapore Reports in to SVP, Sale, ASEAN & ISC Key enabler of GF’s account management and customer care process The Role  The Regional CRM will serve as the internal sales point of contact for designated key and/or strategic accounts within the region. As a key enabler of GF’s account management and customer care process, the Regional CRM is responsible for ensuring the overall positive customer experience and managing the delta between customer expectations and GF performance, working closely with the designated stakeholders (e.g vertical heads) across all regions and divisions of Toll Group.  The position exists to support and develop the business relationships with our key clients in the Region. The position takes an active lead in all commercial areas by using the resources available to own & drive client relationships & satisfaction to grow share of wallet and profitability.  The position is required to comply with all necessary controls and procedures, whilst maintaining a high standard of customer care at all times.  As a Regional Client Relationship Manager, You Will Pro-actively manage and develop relationships with your allocated portfolio of customers Actively identify and pursue new sales opportunities within allocated portfolio, including cross selling Develop & implement strategies & tactics to increase revenue flows from the allocated portfolio or to grow newly identified strategic clients for the country/region Identify and be alert to new business opportunities within customer organization to generate new revenue opportunities; coordinate with the (Global/Regional) Account Owner to gather information to further qualify the opportunity for pursuit and development Maintain data compliance in the CRM to showcase new opportunities (e.g. pipelines, account plans,…) Attracting new opportunities and develop existing clients to generate additional volume & profit and to oversee contract preparation & deal negotiations, ensure compliance to company standards Qualifications  To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Need Degree/Diploma in transportation/logistics/marketing or above 5+ years’ of relevant working experience in development and client relationship building within the Freight Forwarding industry Experience in Key Account Management across multiple countries preferred High degree of communication skills Good problem-solving skills; ability to find core issues and creatively address Must be results-orientated with a strong customer orientation and ability to operate effectively at many levels within the organization in a virtual environment Additional Information  Be Connected  With a bold vision and innovative drive, join our 44,000 colleagues as we lead industry change and transform how customers best meet their global supply chain needs in a meaningful and sustainable way. There are countless opportunities to learn and make a real impact in shaping our industry’s future. Grow with diverse challenges amongst a friendly and inclusive global culture. Take pride in building relationships that matter, because being connected is at the centre of what makes Toll great – it’s what makes our possibilities endless.  Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities.  If this sounds like the opportunity you are looking for, apply now or for more information contact yen.lim@tollgroup.com  To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com  You must be entitled to work in the country where the role is based and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical.

description: Position Summary  As a subject matter expert, Proposition Sales focuses on new sales for the Investment Solutions Proposition in ASEAN to both existing and new clients. You will develop and lead deals aligned to the IS Proposition and focus on customers & prospects across the ASEAN region. The role works in close partnership with internal stakeholders from account management team, solutions consultants and customer success team to proactively drive recurring and once-off sales resulting in revenue growth for the company.  Role Responsibilities Develop a sales strategy for the IS proposition within the ASEAN market Proactively identify pipeline opportunities within a given territory with the support of the Account Managers and other internal resources Structure, negotiate and close deals against a pre-agreed target Provide insights and share Refinitiv thought leadership on the IS Proposition with customers & prospects Deliver customer demonstrations on the IS Proposition Qualifications And Experience Required Deep market understanding including a) specialist understanding of financial markets b) knowledge of relevant markets c) strong understanding of customers' business model workflow World class selling skills (identify, develop, & articulate proposition / consultative selling) as a “hunter” Strong sales “closer” Become a Product and Workflow Specialist in I&A Proposition Products, including but not limited to: Quantitative Analytics and related data StarMine Data Standardization & Collection Methodology Refinitiv Indices Data feed delivery channels and APIs Creative thinker and good sales ideation skills Presentation skills (verbal & written) Strong interpersonal skills Ability to organize and execute a sales plan Over 5 years of industry, sales or market experience Proven track record in a quota bearing sales environment Experience selling to C- level executives People are at the heart of what we do and drive the success of our business. Our culture of connecting, creating opportunity and delivering excellence shape how we think, how we do things and how we help our people fulfil their potential.  At LSEG we embrace diversity and actively seek to attract individuals with unique backgrounds and perspectives. We break down barriers and encourage collaboration, enabling innovation and rapid development of solutions that make a difference. Our workplace generates an enriching and rewarding experience for our people and customers alike. Our vision is to build an inclusive culture in which everyone feels driven to reach their potential.  We know that real personal growth cannot be achieved by simply climbing a career ladder – which is why we encourage and enable a wealth of avenues and interesting opportunities for everyone to broaden and deepen their skills and expertise.  LSEG are committed to supporting emotional, physical, financial and societal wellbeing. Our tailored benefits are a key part of this commitment and we offer colleagues a range of support from healthcare and retirement planning to paid volunteering days and consumer discounts.  We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If an accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please make your recruiter aware, we want to ensure you perform at your best.  As a global organisation spanning 70 countries and one rooted in a culture of growth, opportunity, diversity and innovation, LSEG is a place where everyone can grow, develop and fulfil your potential with purposeful careers. description: Concentrix Tigerspike Singapore is looking for a Business Development Manager to join the team. You'll work with a group of problem solvers who work collaboratively across Concentrix Tigerspike projects and client accounts.  Concentrix Tigerspike in Singapore is located just a 5-minute walk from the Tanjong Pagar MRT station, right in the heart of the CBD area. With projects ranging from aviation, telecommunications, finance, and the government sector, our energetic team is always ready to take up any challenge with enthusiasm, enjoyment and healthy competitiveness to deliver the best products for our customers. We are a vibrant young office that boasts approximately 14 different nationalities. We enjoy weekly activities ranging from Badminton, Basketball to Futsal but what the team thrives and enjoys most is our Friday Quiz which usually ends up in friendly banter on the amount of Googling the team has done to win!  You will Bring onboard new clients, projects and reach targets that hit defined revenue goals Expand contracts with current essential client executives and maintain post-engagement relationships whilst introducing new opportunities Gather client and internal team requirements to help create Statements of Work and Change Requests Present pre-sales material Identify needs that clients may not initially recognise, and ensure that approaches and solutions are linked to goals and return on investment Finally, you will manage channel partner education programs and work with partners to uncover and win new business You have Perseverance for results and have a strong interest in solving technical problems At least 5 years of experience in Enterprise Mobility Sales and experience closing significant complex enterprise technology deals Experience selling bespoke IT software solutions in the web and mobile space An understanding of software delivery and the SDLC A network of local connections and industry contacts in Tier 1 and 2 businesses or government Your colleagues trust you and your integrity is untouchable An understanding of AGILE ways of working through sales and technology An understanding of digital transformation Our Benefits Flexible work hours and work from home policy 20 days’ holiday (in addition to all public holidays) increasing to 25 days’ holiday each year after your 2nd work anniversary and 30 days after 5 years! 2 Duvet Days per year - that’s for when the day would be better spent at the beach or in bed A monthly phone bill allowance A generous annual allowance for training and development An annual allowance to spend on your personal growth such as learning a new language, cooking classes, yoga, pottery or even attending a beer tasting course End of year performance bonus Free Bootcamp classes weekly/lunch sport activities Parental benefits that exceed statutory requirements The chance to work on different projects in our other offices (London, Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Tokyo, Dubai, Singapore, New York, Bengaluru, Wroclaw, and San Jose) Free lunch and drinks on Fridays  About Concentrix Tigerspike  We’re a global digital services company, offering end-to-end expertise in strategic consulting, service and experience design, multi-platform engineering, and systems integration.  We’re excited to announce that we’re now operating under the new name of Concentrix Tigerspike.  We’ve been a part of Concentrix since 2017, helping our clients around the world create great customer and employee experiences. We’ve made this change to our name to more clearly show the evolution of our services and how they complement and strengthen the overall strategic offering of Concentrix.  Our ownership and structure haven’t changed: we’re still the same, great team spanning 10 global offices - and our design-led approach and deep engineering capability continue to remain core to how we work.  Our people are our culture and a huge part of what makes us unique. We recruit the best people and create small project teams, resulting in great chemistry between our teams and our customers that can solve even the toughest business problems. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.*  So what happens next?  Once we've received your application, we'll give it as much attention as it deserves and you'll hear from us either way. If we think you could be a good addition to our team, we will give you a call and from there you'll cruise through our recruitment process.  www.tigerspike.com  To all recruitment agencies  Concenrtix Tigerspike does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Concentrix Tigerspike employees, or any other organisation location. Concentrix Tigerspike is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.  Powered by JazzHR  dh82aHSXnt

TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Qualifications - University Degree or equivalent experience - 3+ years of contracts management in reviewing and negotiating commercial terms for large and complex cross-border ad tech-focused contracts. - Experience of developing and implementing contract management processes and systems - English Fluency - Self-starter, fast learner with a start-up spirit - Experience in Contract Lifecycle Management tools. - Professional-level fluency in Mandarin and/or an additional Southeast Asian language - Prior experience in a similar role across Southeast Asian jurisdictions  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. description: Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a talented individual to join the Global Marketing Response Center (MRC) team. Our team is a critical function within the lead and demand generation process, with its mission to profile, nurture and qualify leads generated from various events, campaigns and marketing activities.  We are looking for someone with experience in inbound demand generation and lead management campaigns, to join a new team tasked with increasing the quality of Marketing Inbound Leads through targeted profiling and nurturing activities. In this role, you work with a highly talented, dynamic and fun team, targeting existing leads with campaigns and information designed to improve the lead quality and sales conversion rates.  (ps: this is not a field sales customer facing role)  Roles & Responsibilities Work as part of the Inbound/Lead Nurturing team to build a stronger AWS Lead Database by profiling/researching existing AWS leads to create a detailed view of the customer’s need for cloud technology and the sales opportunity. Perform calls to nurture leads with information/campaigns to increase their understanding of the AWS portfolio, the value proposition and relevant use cases for AWS services. Qualify leads and move them from little interest to warm and active interest; help our customers evolve from a stage of Education to a state of Consideration. Through tele-profiling, researching and nurturing efforts you will create higher value leads resulting in higher sales conversion rates. Work closely with multiple stakeholders (Sales team, Partner team, Marketing team etc) to achieve campaign goals while ensuring exceptional internal & external customer satisfaction.Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of enterprise, government and start-up business and organizations globally. Check out this video to learn more about our team culture: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tjJcOv_uslA.   Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree 3+ years of work experience in a fast-paced and highly cross-functional organization - high-tech products/services preferred. Proven success in doing business development and marketing calls and juggling multiple projects in a high growth environment where priorities shift fast. Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and Bahasa Indonesia to cover the Indonesia market Have the ability to listen to customers, understand needs, and ask clarifying/probing questions. Preferred Qualifications AWS Cloud Practitioner Certification / AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate. A technical background in Engineering, Computer Science or MIS. In-depth knowledge and understanding of existing and developing technologies related to cloud computing: understand and identify opportunities for customers. Advanced Salesforce.com experience including the development of dashboards and reports. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore  Job ID: A1694019

description: The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  Primary Responsibilities Lead a team of 5-6 Enterprise Account Executives based throughout Southeast Asia. Strong communication skills, listen first and speak second, aware of the message being transmitted to the team, how it’s delivered, and it’s perception. Provide mentoring and guidance on key enterprise motions including collaboration with legal, product presentations, running multiple internal teams and quarterly sales forecasting. Serve as executive sponsor during enterprise level deals. Interface and develop professional relationships with existing clients and prospects throughout organisational levels. Display a systemic approach to leading challenging contract negotiations/deals with multiple reps at a time. Maintain an in-depth knowledge of Qualtrics XM solution offerings. Maintain a real-time understanding of the competitive landscape to assist in determining win-based proposals and pricing. Develop and maintain positive relationships with other functional areas internally at Qualtrics, e.g. Professional Services, Implementation, Subject Matter Experts, etc to ensure a collaborative approach to secure large enterprise engagements Demonstrate experience successfully leading through change in a fast-growing environment. Entrepreneurial approach to effectively leading a business. Qualifications Strong background! Validated winner that has led teams to breakthrough results. Bachelor’s degree from a top-accredited university At least 6-8 years of individual enterprise level sales experience At least 2 years managing an enterprise level sales team Experience using Salesforce.com and measuring system compliance Experience over-exceeding quarterly team quotas through metric based skill development and internal team management Experience working on complex contract negotiations Singaporean and PR is preferred. About The Team  We've grown our Enterprise Sales team to respond to very strong client demand for the Qualtrics Insight Platform. This growth has resulted in the need to bring on an exceptional leader with a track record of attracting, developing and motivating an elite team of enterprise SaaS sales professionals.  Our team is a group of highly driven individuals that are intelligent, organized, and dedicated. We work together as a team to accomplish and exceed quarterly and annual objectives. We are a goal-oriented team that works hard and enjoys the incredible trajectory that Qualtrics provides. Our overarching objective is to drive company revenue growth through client success.  What Differentiates Us From Other Companies Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours. We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative workspace. Comprehensive perks and benefits package (private health, life insurance, etc) as well as snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office. We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees. Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer  Qualtrics provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or veteran status.

description: Hire Digital is looking for an analytical and effective Manager- Enterprise Partnerships and Growth who is adept at driving key account revenue and growing our consultative sales. The Manager- Enterprise Partnerships and Growth will be responsible for owning the target accounts pipeline and driving our client acquisition programs, analyzing client acquisition metrics, and working with adjacent teams to develop strategies and campaigns to enhance client acquisition.  This is a remote position. We welcome candidates from any location. Resumes are to be submitted in English.  Responsibilities: Own the end-to-end sales process, from lead generation and prospecting to product demonstrations, negotiation and execution of closing strategies, to the final stage of bringing new clients onboard. You will be responsible for the entire sales process within a region and pitch Hire Digital's solutions to potential clients. Drive revenue growth through consultative sales and development of strategic proposals. Craft strategic proposals, marketing collaterals, project plans, SOW, and digital audits to generate sales pipeline. Create and manage a sales funnel of opportunities from start-to-finish and track in CRM. Collaborate with Marketing, account managers, and Talent Team on operational strategy, and execution of strategic targets. Educate customers on our offerings and evangelize key wins. Create a high-level network for events and follow-up, working closely with Marketing resources. Break into new lines of business groups within the defined Accounts.  Requirements: Over 5 years of enterprise consultative sales experience. Strong preference for candidates from backgrounds in the digital consulting fields, including software product development, digital marketing, e-commerce, analytics, and content production. Ability to create and refine sales programs for rapid scaling. Very strong communication and collaborative skills. Fast learner, comfortable with explaining new product ideas and processes to business decision makers. Strong phone presence, excellent written skills and high attention to detail. Fluent and articulate in English language.  About Hire Digital  Hire Digital is a freelance network of top talents in digital marketing, web development, and design. Our clients work with high-performing teams as well as individual talents who have gone through a rigorous screening process. Clients such as Shopify, Expedia, and Stripe have access to high-performing talents on-demand, with guaranteed performance.  Powered by JazzHR  tHFwqypQcd

description: About Brightcove  Brightcove is a team of smart, passionate people who are revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video. We’re hyped up about storytelling, and about helping people connect, share experiences, and view the world. Bottom line: video is the world’s most compelling, exciting medium, and Brightcove exists to demonstrate that video means business.  As the industry leader in this space, we empower our customers to deliver top-notch video experiences to audiences on every screen in bold and innovative ways. When the video is executed correctly, it can have a powerful and lasting effect. Hearts open. Minds change. Creativity thrives. Since 2004, Brightcove has been supporting customers that are some of the largest media companies, enterprises, events, and non-profit organizations in the world. There are over 600 Brightcovers globally, each of us representing our unique talents and passions and we have built a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence, and collaboration. This culture enables us to develop technologies once thought impossible, provide customer support without parallel or excuses, and leverage the expertise and resources of global infrastructure. We take our video seriously, and we take great pride in doing it as one team.  Position Overview  This is a quota-carrying sales role responsible for delivering Brightcove customer license signings and revenue targets for Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam preferably based in Singapore. The role develops, writes, and owns the execution of the strategic territory plan. Provides direction and hands-on management of all the resources assigned to a sales pursuit in their region. The Territory Manager supports Brightcove’s corporate goals of customer satisfaction and profitability within these three markets.  Job Responsibilities Directs selling activities within the region/territory, inclusive of resource deployment and customer interactions. Owns the financial sales performance for the territory - both bookings and revenue. Owns and manages all routes to market in the territory, direct & indirect in partners. Establishes an environment and business foundation for future sales growth. Coaches others on how to sell value to Brightcove customers. Prioritizes effectively and in accordance with given corporate objectives. Responsible for accurate region/territory forecasting and performance tracking. Works closely with other team leaders within Brightcove to build sales, resolve customer issues and enable high customer satisfaction. Continually identifies and communicates customer knowledge gaps and opportunities for Brightcove products and services. Evaluates market trends and gathers competitive information, identifying trends that impact current and future growth of regional sales and profitability. Disseminates information to regional sales teams, corporate marketing, and sales operations. Helps to build the knowledge base in applicable Brightcove communities including lessons learned, best practices, tools, methods, and product enhancements. Qualifications/Experience 7+ years of sales experience delivering or exceeding quota targets in related fields. Requires excellent understanding of Salesforce or a similar CRM system. Proven track record of success in selling and achieving targets; Proven ability to prioritize projects and deliverables driving accurate and timely decisions; Adaptable, highly driven, high energy. Ability to work in a sometimes stressful and constantly changing environment employing multi-tasking capabilities; Problem solver, demonstrate the ability to apply sound judgment and negotiate successful outcomes for customers and internal stakeholders; Attain and maintain a deep understanding of Brightcove products, training, and adoption services needed to advise and enable customer success; Numerate, commercially astute, able to effectively manage budgets and forecast accurately; Detail-oriented and analytical. Able to learn and effectively use analysis and reporting software to forecast future business; Special Conditions Seasoned professional that can work without manager direction on day to day basis. Can make independent decisions mapped to territory account plans and channel programs to achieve territory revenue and signings plans. Has ownership of the territory's strategic plan and coordinates all resources engaged in the territory to achieve the plan. Business travel of up to 50 percent of available time is expected for this position as and when the Pandemic allows. The job requires extensive customer/ team engagement and extensive periods of computer and telephone work. Working at Brightcove  As the undisputed global leader in powering premium video for our customers, Brightcove recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, creating an environment where people can innovate and achieve their best, and we reward them for their performance by giving them the opportunity to share in the company’s success. We offer competitive benefits and compensation packages.  Brightcove is headquartered in Boston with offices in New York, London, Guadalajara, Funchal, Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney, Mumbai, and Chennai. This position is being offered as a fully remote role in France and, while you won’t get to experience the in-office culture, you will feel it remotely and be able to participate actively. We have plenty of opportunities to meet your colleagues around the globe and we also celebrate a variety of personal interests with organized groups and clubs including an Employee Action Committee, Women of Brightcove, Pride of Brightcove, Parents of Brightcove … and more to come!  If you've gotten all the way to the bottom of this description, thank you for your interest in Brightcove! If this role sounds like something that is exciting to you please don't hesitate to apply, even if you don't meet all of our qualifications. We recognize that no candidate is perfect and Brightcove would love to have the chance to get to know you.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.  Send us your resume if you are interested and want to learn more!  **Please submit your resume in English to be considered for this role.**

Regional Sales Manager- Singapore (Work Remotely)  Job Overview: • Identify and qualify business opportunities within Enterprise, Public Sector, and Service Provider markets with or without partners. •  Negotiation, coordination, and business decisions to close deals. •  Develop and hold professional sales presentations, control project progress at each stage, make constant sales calls and follow up with any potential leads, work with partners aggressively to close deals and finalize contracts, meet/exceed sales quotas and revenue goals. Provide effective communication of A10's technology value propositions and solutions. •  Interface with resellers/distributors/channels to become an extended A10 sales force. •  Determine market strategies and business goals for A10 product lines and services. • Manage forecast reports as well as short-term/long-term business plans in an effective manner. • Maintain constant internal communications with the Sales Engineering team and outside staff of resellers and customers. • Turn in business forecast pipeline regularly and review with Regional Director on a regular basis. •  Grow the business and deliver results to meet/exceed the assigned targets.  Experience & Qualifications: •  Seeking candidates with a mix of extensive business and technology experience •  7+ years of networking industry experience within Sales, Business Development and Strategic Alliances • Extensive relationships and experience working with leading telco/wireless equipment/solution vendors •  Prior working experience in (or with) Nokia/Ericsson/Huawei (or similar MNSc) with broad understanding of their business units, products, and customers is highly desired •  Strong understanding of security infrastructure, DDoS mitigation and detection, application networking (L4 & L7), SDN/NFV transformation, cloud infrastructure and services, and mobile networks evolution, including IoT •  Great track record of strategic partnerships and alliance development with System Integrators and cloud providers resulting in exceeding annual targets and MBO’s  •  Vast hands-on experience developing, structuring, and closing large international business contracts •  Superior presentation skills and written communication as well as problem-solving skills at both a strategic and functional level •  Good knowledge and experiences to manage the Deal pipeline with a strong commitment •  Excellent technical, industry, business, and cross-functional knowledge •  Solid work ethic, customer-focused, team player, with passion for success  A10 Networks is an equal opportunity employer and a VEVRAA federal subcontractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. A10 also complies with all applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment.

description: As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Sales Manager with a wealth of experience selling SaaS solutions to government entities? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? If yes then we want to hear from you!  The impact you will have:  You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new customer relationships across the APAC region. As a Government Sales Manager you will become an expert in Elliptic’s value proposition, helping build our revenues with government bodies (central banks, law enforcement and regulators) to develop their understanding and help them to navigate the impacts of increased adoption of digital assets.  You will manage the full sales cycle including prospecting, qualifying leads, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing business to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and exceed your targets.  This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!  What you’ll do: Develop net new business and cross sell opportunities Build out strategic market penetration plan, prospect, and manage full sales cycle Prospect and generate high quality leads Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements Conduct presentations and product demos Negotiate terms and close the business As applicable, work alongside our Customer Engagement team to develop deeper relationships and upsell to set and hit aggressive revenue goals Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota  Requirements  You will be a great fit here if you: You have experience of selling into central banks, law enforcement and regulators. Have the ability to analyse data to identify market trends and opportunities for cryptocurrency and compliance. Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals Have a collaborative mindset Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities  Our ideal candidate has: 5+ years full sales cycle experience selling SaaS solutions to public sector entities Strong outbound prospecting skills, with track record of generating net new business Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur’s mindset. You’re comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy  Bonus Points for: Can understand how compliance of digital assets fit into public sector plans Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Experience selling SaaS solutions to government/public sector. Borderline obsession with emerging technology  Benefits Share Options Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays + additional day for your birthday Health insurance Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Home office allowance Full access to Spill Mental Health Support  We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Senior Manager, Global Sales Strategy and Planning
description: ONE Championship and ONE Esports is looking for a strategic, results oriented Senior Manager to join the Global Sales Strategy and Planning team. This person will partner with senior leaders across the Sales organizations to drive strategic initiatives that shape the growth trajectory of ONE’s business.  The ideal candidate will bring strong strategic and analytical thinking combined with leadership skills to drive action. This candidate will demonstrate intellectual curiosity, creative problem solving, and an impressive history of delivering results. Most importantly, the candidate will excel at building strong relationships and will possess the outstanding communication skills needed to convey complex information, reach alignment across executive teams, and keep projects on track.  Responsibilities  Partner with sales leadership to deliver strategic projects that enable the business to execute its highest priority initiatives Leverage data to conduct in-depth analyses across areas of the business to develop an understanding of key value drivers, identifying improvement areas and opportunities, and shape action plans Act as the strategic thought partner to various members of the Sales Leadership team, helping define and deliver on the sales strategy across the business Serve as a hub for cross-functional teams (including Sales, Finance, Marketing and other internal groups, etc.), and facilitate collaboration towards achieving common goals and outcomes  Requirements  Bachelor’s degree 5+ years of work experience in management consulting, investment banking / private equity, and/or or Strategy & Operations role within a technology company Excellent communication and analytical skills with the ability to distill complex thoughts and strategies into simple, actionable recommendations Strong executive presence and ability to articulately present and debate recommendations at the executive level  Expertise with Excel and Powerpoint,   Strong experience with Salesforce and HubSpot High-energy, team-first attitude: Motivated to work hard in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment to help our growing business
industries: Venture Capital & Private Equity, Investment Banking, and Management Consulting

description: About Sun Wealth Group  Sun Wealth Group is a global enterprise with Singapore as its headquarter. Our business covers SEA – Malaysia, India, Thailand, Vietnam and other countries. Our business focuses on asset and investment advisory, fintech, new energy, health and wellness business. Asset and investment advisory includes fund management, family offices, company listings, corporate mergers and acquisitions. The health and wellness business includes health care products, bioengineering and medical equipment.  Our vision is to discover values for investment and to empower dreams for people and support communities.  Responsibilities Responsible for the business development and sales of Funds and Wealth Management solutions to institutions and family offices. Managing and developing relationships with existing and potential clients. Manage the sales pipeline effectively including qualifying in, progressing, and closing opportunities. Play an active role in product and capability development by articulating long term trends and product gaps to the investment teams. Traveling when necessary to meet clients and/or prospect new relationships. Competitive compensation shall apply. All other assigned duties. Requirements At least 5 years of relevant experience in the financial industry in a similar position. Recognized degree holder. Additional certifications (CFA, MBA, etc) are preferred. Proven ability to build relationships with institutional clients, existing networks are strongly preferred. Proven sales ability, working to KPIs, and hitting sales targets. Good understanding of financial markets and knowledge of different wealth management products. Pioneering, innovative, and self-driven executives. Good communication, writing, and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in both English and Mandarin. Remuneration can be negotiated.

Who are we?  Crayon Data is a fast-growing big data and AI company, founded in 2012 with a vision to simplify the world’s choices. Crayons maya.ai is the world’s first AI engine that engages customers through taste-led customization and increases conversion rates for enterprises. As a Sales specialist, you will work to build a solid pipeline by converting cold leads & actively drive growth of new users, clients & revenues through deal closures for Middle East.  Job Overview  Can you say “Yes, I have!” to the following? Primarily a hunter with 6-8 years of experience primarily in financial services, or travel & hospitality industry Strong enterprise sales background in solutions /SaaS space ideally with knowledge of BI / analytics / Big data / AI Track record of successful sales in SEA & ANZ region with deep understanding of one of more of the following markets – Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam Curious, details-oriented mindset with excellent written and spoken English proficiency Familiarity with standard sales processes (we use MEDDIC) Experience: 3-5 years of relevant experience in Enterprise Sales, having sold to clients in financial services, airlines and travel.  Characteristics: Adapt to dynamic market forces and environmental developments Able to thrive in ambiguity Can you say “Yes, I will!” to the following? Rapidly create a funnel of qualified prospects using MEDDICC Generate new ARR and long term TCVs by closing new clients Create territory specific sales strategy aligned to Crayon GTM plans and execute on it Grow business by signing new partnerships and leveraging existing ones Brownie Points For Worked at either a product / platform company – SAAS (likes of Salesforce, Adobe) or cloud marketing platform (Oracle Marketing Cloud, SAP Hybris, IBM Watson), or consulting companies Knowledge of SEA language e.g. Bahasa Indonesia, Thai, Vietnamese Existing client network and connections Ties to partners and tech ecosystem More About Crayon Data  A young, fast-growing AI and big data company, with an ambitious vision to simplify the world’s choices. Our clients are top-tier enterprises in the banking, e-commerce, and travel spaces. They use our core AI-powered personalization platform maya.ai, to deliver personally relevant, omni-channel customer experiences centered around taste. The maya.ai platform now touches over 127Mn customers globally. You will find Crayon Boxes in Chennai and Singapore. But you will find Crayons in every corner of the world. Especially where our client projects are – UAE, India, SE Asia, and South America.  Life in the Crayon Box is a little chaotic, largely dynamic and keeps us on our toes! Crayons are a diverse and passionate bunch. Challenges excite us. Our mission drives us. And good food, caffeine (for the most part) and youthful energy fuel us. We want to build an agile high-performance learning organization with minimum hierarchy and a challenging environment that enables growth.  We are looking for young and young-at-heart professionals with a relentless drive to help Crayon double its growth. Leaders, doers, innovators, dreamers, implementers, and eccentric visionaries, we have a place for you all.  Crayon is an equal opportunity employer. Employment is based on a persons merit and qualifications and professional competences. Crayon does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy or related.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: About Currencycloud Currencycloud is somewhere where innovative thinking and the power of technology know no limits. We know that the success of the business depends on the people who keep it moving, which is why we are looking for exceptional talent to join our international payments revolution.   We are an open & collaborative Fintech unicorn that lives and breathes our company values: Be Human, Better Together and Own it.  About the role... You will be working closely with the Marketing, Demand Generation and the Strategy Team to lead and drive the development of Currencycloud market segments. Through using various tools and resources, the Sales Consultant will collaborate with other teams to validate the Product Market Fit (PMF) and help determine the Total Addressable Market of their specialist segment.  The Details... Research and identify potential clients, identify decision makers & qualify leads to build a strong pipeline of relevant opportunities and deliver against sales targets Call and meet with prospective clients to understand their challenges and the positive impact Currencycloud can have on their business so that you can outline the benefits and demonstrate the value of our platform (we advocate “Gap Selling”) Negotiate and close contracts with clients to meet revenue targets, setting clients off on a path to success, resulting in sustainable revenue streams Manage and report against activity, pipeline, and sales metrics Work with Compliance, Solutions, Customer Success and Account Management team members to provide a smooth onboarding and handover of accounts post sale Use insight from the Fintech and Payments market to help drive Currencycloud business strategy towards successfully expanding into your focus segment(s) Be seen as the Thought Leader and go-to expert for your segment(s) both internally and externally to industry participants.  Skills Knowledge & Expertise Highly motivated individual looking for first-class career building opportunity Someone with a track-record of achievement who thrives on being accountable for their own success 2+ years experience related to Fintech preferably within any of the following segments: Embedded finance, Payment Service Providers, Digital banking/ Digital e-Wallets or PayTech Experience selling SaaS based solutions with knowledge of FX and cross border payments Ability to contribute to new business sales strategy and revenue targets Enhanced communication skills with the ability to negotiate with C-suite executives Embrace the Consultative, Challenger, or Value selling sales approach Proven track record of exceeding sales targets in a business development/new business environment Strong and repeatable sales methodology to build a pipeline, forecast accurately and close deals Outstanding relationship building skills, both internally and with prospects.  Why Currencycloud? We are a remote-first company; whichever location you’re contracted to, we leave it up to you and your manager to agree on how often you come into the office. To make things easier we offer an allowance so you can create your own working space at home because we REALLY mean it when we say remote first.  Your health and well-being are of paramount importance to us, and so our jampacked employee benefits reflect this!  We offer a competitive salary, an individual learning and development budget, a pension or 401K contribution, mental health days and comprehensive health care that includes annual optical and dental allowances, access to mental health support and a monthly allowance that you can spend on anything health or wellness related!  At the moment we are unable to consider applicants living outside of our entities and we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.  We aren’t currently looking for additional Recruiter support on this role and won’t be accepting any unsolicited CVs

description: About Railsbank  Railsbank is the world’s leading global open banking platform that gives customers access to prototype, build, and scale financial products on 4 continents with one contract and one set of APIs. The company was founded by serial FinTech entrepreneurs who previously founded successful and award winning companies like Currency Cloud (recently sold to Visa for $1B) and Evolution.  Railsbank is in growth mode with hundreds of clients globally, over 5.5 million end user accounts, VC funding from top firms like Clocktower Ventures and Visa and the most globally-enabled, digitally-native product in the FinTech platform space. We recently announced our US launch with our new Credit Card as a Service offering, aimed at allowing any company to build futuristic credit cards and lending products that live inside their user experiences.  Since starting in 2016 in London, Railsbank is now the only platform capable of issuing multiple financial products on 4 continents including USA, Europe, SE Asia, and Australia. Fresh off the back of a new $70M VC raise, we are looking for exceptional people who share the same core values to join team Railsbank in APAC.  The Role  As an experienced Sales Executive, you will be responsible for working with Railsbank’s prospective customers as a trusted advisor to deeply understand their unique company challenges and goals. You will demonstrate the value of Railsbank and the impact the product will have on the prospect’s business. You will demonstrate the value of Railsbank and the impact Railsbank capabilities will have on leads and prospects’ businesses and the ability to drive results. You will have the opportunity to help influence the go to market strategy and further expansion of Railsbank in multiple countries working alongside Railsbank colleagues.  Key Measurements and Objectives include; Meeting ARR targets by closing deals Maintain the required value of deals pipeline to be able to meet ARR targets Bring in Net New Customer Revenue and establishing Railsbank brands in APAC Maintain the Average Sales Cycle as per company standards We are looking for you to; Work with startups, brands and established financial services providers to demonstrate Railsbank’s unique value This is first and foremost a closer role. You’ll be receiving qualified prospects and you will be responsible for the overall business development, client engagement, and sales lifecycle of Railsbank prospects across Europe Deeply understand the prospect's business, regulatory construct, flow of funds and challenges to ensure that Railsbank is the correct solution for the prospect Manage time effectively by qualifying and re-qualifying prospects throughout the sales cycle Build trust with the prospect by demonstrating that you understand the prospects’ business objectives and that our success can only result from their success Maintain and update an accurate log of activity in the CRM system Use phone and email to correspond with prospects Provide feedback across Railsbank related to information prospects share that could be helpful in advertising, marketing and product roadmap What We Look For In Your Professional Skills 5-10+ years of experience selling SaaS, fintech/tech, financial services or B2B solutions Superb listening skills. You must understand objections and defeat them by turning sceptics into excited new customers High level of empathy. It’s important for our Business Development Managers to be a good person to peers and prospects Demonstrable history of carrying and exceeding quota Proven ability to make strong connections and overcome rejection to achieve results Demonstrated ability to conduct compelling on-site presentations up to senior executives. Tenacity and discipline to follow up with passion and respect A self-starter that thrives when given a clean sheet of paper and a target to hit A genuine interest in startups, fintech and/or financial services Excellent Communicator at all levels, internally and with customers A ‘get things done’ mentality Analytical, able to visualise key metrics for informed decision making Market aware: Knowledge of today’s major financial services, open banking and payments technologies, players and major up-and-coming trends Role location and hours  Unless agreed otherwise the role will be a full time role and you will be based in our Singapore offices, with flexible working, we would expect you to be available 2-3 days a week as a minimum in the office  What we look for in our team members and our values  Being an integral part of the Railsbank team and sharing our values is important to us. The environment at Railsbank is fast-paced, exciting, and dynamic. It suits people that love to collaborate and support one-another.  We are all driven by the same values and are looking to welcome new people to the team that share these values.  Our values are: excellence, accountability, diversity, work/life balance, trust, fun, inclusivity, friendship, noble causes, and respect.  If you are eager to join a thriving, fast-paced, Scale-up company and contribute to shaping its future, this is the role for you to make a difference.  Equal Opportunities Employer  Railsbank is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion or belief, colour, sex or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, marital status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

description: The eCommerce Assistant Key Account Manager position is a key position within the eCommerce team. You will be managing a portfolio of eCommerce accounts and working on expanding the network. You will help build one of Carlsberg Singapore’s growth engine.   Responsibilities:  Support in formulating and implanting sales / key account strategies and action plans to achieve growth with our eCommerce partners Responsible in ensuring execution excellence end-to-end. Develop and maintain strategic collaboration with eCommerce key accounts, and ensure that we seamlessly work together to achieve growth Help maintain effective communication with customers to ensure all campaigns are planned and executed perfectly.  Identify new eCommerce customers and opportunities and develop plans initiating and executing new partnerships  Able to analyze different sets of data – be it is sales data, digital shelf data, operational data, etc. – and generate actions based on data-supported insights The main person to keep track of the ever-changing eCommerce landscape and understand how it may impact our business and dynamics with our key accounts  Requirements: Experience in eCommerce key account management: Ideally at least 3 years experience in driving online growth for a CPG company who partners with large pureplay platforms in Singapore. Coming from an eCommerce mature category e.g. beauty, toys, apparel will be a plus point. Additional FMCG experience is a plus as well. More importantly is to have an understanding of how to “trade” in an online environment. Familiar with eCommerce promo calendar in Singapore and have worked on big eCommerce campaigns in the past. Know how to plan and execute a perfect eCommerce campaign. Expert in aligning internal and external resources in order to drive the best campaign results Familiar with eCommerce platforms’ operations and merchant rules, and able to execute in a speedy manner Comfortable building relationships and discussing commercial terms with buyers. Empathetic with our customers’ concerns – and understand the ‘give-and-take’ dynamics Data literate– whether it is sales data or P&L. Natural ability to align the drivers of ecommerce – availability, promo, and content – to clear actions that align with an overall retailer action plan. Know who to tell a story back to the business on how things performed and good in implementing strategic action plan and process. Good collaborator – able to help sales deliver a plan in creative ways; and a partner to our global ecommerce colleagues who prize your market insights.  Job Details:  Workplace Hiap Hoe Building At Zhongshan Park, SG  Job type Permanent  Part time / Full time Full Time  Working Time Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5:00pm  We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: *This is a 1 year contract position that will renew each year based on performance.  Title: Sales Manager  Summary: Supermicro Computer, Inc. is currently seeking a Sales Manager to successfully expand Supermicro's customer portfolio. As a Sales Manager, you will be responsible for hunting new business opportunities, and engage with clients to drive for business success. In this position, you will be building and maintaining relationships with major enterprise clients for developing opportunity pipelines. In addition, you will lead and influence customers to build and grow their data center by using Supermicro's products and services.  Location: This position will be working remotely in Singapore.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Search for and develop new accounts; some travel required (up to 25%) Initiate outbound cold calls or emails to potential customers, specifically direct enterprise clients Engage with clients and qualify opportunities, create target lists for vertical markets Establish a high level of personal credibility as a trusted advisor to key client decision makers  Monitor inventory, negotiate price, enter and monitor orders, facilitate credit issues and negotiate returns Successfully manage all client requirements and requests –visit clients’ site on a regular basis Represent and sell the entire Super Micro portfolio of products and services to enterprise customers  Meet or exceed quarterly and annual revenue and margin quotas. Uses margin management techniques   Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in business administration is preferred  Minimum 5 years of business development experience in the IT industry, proven record of penetrating enterprise accounts in Fortune 1000  Strong technical knowledge and understanding of servers, storage, applications, and network products and solutions – highly familiar with IT industry Solid interpersonal skills, able to communicate effectively verbally and in written form with superior presentation skills  Experience in leading business meeting and communication, ability to persuade decision-maker and further lead to business opportunities and results Demonstrated ability in the following areas: pre-call planning, opportunity qualification and objection handling, call structure and control, time and territory management

description: Key Responsibilities  The Key Account Manager will be a key contact point for End to End process and services including, internal & External function. Internal function includes channel operation, Marketing, operation, Customer service, and Technology functions to manage aCommerce service to brand and improve the customer experience. Developing relationship with marketplace and new channel is also key part to drive client’s sales coverage and growth. Managing brand and channel portfolio to deliver growth to clients.  The ideal candidate would have key skills as fast learner, high interpersonal skill, logical thinking, problem solving, high responsibility, prioritizing and initiative thinking. The role will require a combination of financial, business development and account management skills.
