description: About the team  We're Australia's leading telecommunications and technology company. And, with a presence in more than 20 countries, we're creating a global footprint - which for you, that means incredible work opportunities and experiences to develop and grow your career.  We fully embrace flexibility and choice at Telstra and it's as unique as you. We believe every role can flex in some way and encourage you to work where, when, and how you are most engaged, safe, and productive. Talk to us about how a role could be flexible for you!  The role with us  As a presales Solutions Architect, you are a trusted technology advisor and customer advocate who thrives on developing comprehensive, tailored technology solutions for our customers. You understand Telstra's customer needs intimately, applying your deep knowledge of our products and services (especially the connectivity products and managed services within the Adaptive Networks portfolio) and key relationships (e.g. Account Team) to influence their technology strategy.  Your ability to articulate how technology can transform businesses, your entrepreneurial spirit is what makes you exceptional at your job and you're focused on developing end-to-end technology solutions, centred on the network. You communicate with influence, thrive off collaborating with a diverse range of stakeholders, and apply your commercial acumen to be successful in this role. This role will be primarily aligned to the Telstra Enterprise Adaptive Networks strategy and customer feedback/ratings in-line with Telstra's Customer Advocacy targets. Your success will also be measured on your ability to convert prospects into billing customers.  Key responsibilities As a presales Solutions Architect, you combine your deep knowledge of Telstra's solutions and products with business insight to deliver the following responsibilities:  Your key accountabilities and responsibilities include but are not limited to:   Make a strong contribution to sales and revenue growth through developing and maintaining a strong qualified pipeline of incremental opportunities in relation to Data and Strategic solutions sets, including developing customer technology strategies, roadmaps and business plans to support sales opportunity identification. Leverage substantial expertise in technology solutions and sales to manage sales opportunities from identification and qualification to closing, supporting sales teams to develop and implement effective sales plans and strategies. This includes providing input and support when sought out to orchestrate domain/multi-domain solution concepts and resources. Recognised as a technical sales expert and trusted technology advisor to key senior stakeholders (external and internal), producing deep technical and business insights that articulate how Telstra's solutions (that consider partner's, vendors and alliances) can be used to transform our customer's business, and influence technology strategy. Authentically engage with and effectively influence a diverse, multi-stakeholder client and internal landscape (Account Executives, Other Deep Domain Solution Architects, Pricing Specialists) to establish and negotiate a balanced technology solution that meets commercial and customer requirements. Apply your deep technical and professional expertise in technology solutions (e.g. Transmission and IP Connectivity, Video Conferencing, IP Telephony, Collaboration, Cloud, Security) with your knowledge of emerging product/technology trends to produce robust, implementable sales solutions that exceed customer's expectations. Significantly contribute to and role model continuous learning by maintaining a very high level of currency in technology solutions, emerging technologies and industry trends. Leverage your knowledge to coach and develop cross-functional team members (e.g. Solution Sales peers, Account Managers) on the latest products, pricing and solutions. About you To be eligible for this role, we are looking for candidates with the following experience:  Mandatory: CCNA  Desirable: CCNP, CCIE, other certifications from vendors (Aruba ACMP/ACCX, Juniper JNCIS/JNCIA-xxx), Cisco ACI or other network programmability  Deep domain expertise in core networking technologies, including WAN technologies and services such as Ethernet Private Lines, MPLS, Internet, connectivity to the cloud, SD-WAN, managed network services and LAN SDN, switching and Wifi.  Experience in other areas such as Security, UC platforms and Cloud will be an advantage.  Extensive experience in customer engagement and presentations, with high level of proficiency in spoken & written English.   Excellent communication skills, including active listening to deeply understand customers' questions and perspective, and articulate responses suited to the audience.  Engagement in thought leadership discussion with the ability to lead customer white-boarding and workshop sessions.  Demonstrated presales experience with at least 3 to 5 years of experience, with ability to articulate key messages and value propositions, linking business outcomes with the technical solution proposed.   If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!  ___________________________  We're committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce in all its forms. We encourage applicants from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds and applicants who may be living with a disability. We also offer flexibility in all our roles, to ensure everyone can participate.  To learn more about how we support our people, including accessibility adjustments we can provide you through the recruitment process, visit tel.st/thrive.

Job Title - Commercial Account Executive (CAE, Singapore)  Job Location - Singapore  Experience - 4-8 years  The world loves Postgres. If you work with developers or data scientists or anyone wrangling data, you’ll probably see a sticker with the tusks and trunk of the Postgres elephant on the lid of a nearby laptop. EDB has a lot to do with that. We’ve been major contributors to Postgres since the beginning, and we are proud to call thousands of boundary pushing customers our partners. Proud though we are, we are not resting on our laurels. There’s plenty of work to do. The good news is that everything we do will impact Postgres, which is to say that it will impact the world. No pressure..  EDB seeks an Commercial Account Executive (CAE) who will develop pipeline and close new business in the sales territory of ASEAN, Singapore for EDB’s commercial segment. The commercial segment is defined as accounts that have less than $1 billion in annual revenue - but this adjusts for different regions and territories. The CAE will be accountable for closing business that originates from the inbound marketing funnel, outbound prospecting, and assigned accounts. This is a high-energy role that requires exceptional organization, determination, and focus. It is not easy to identify new opportunities across multiple channels, progress qualified pipeline, close new business, and develop strong customer relationships simultaneously. If you’re up to the challenge in the hot PostgreSQL market - we want to talk to you! This resource will report to the Director of Inside Sales.  Responsibilities An Inside Account Executive at EDB gains a trusted rapport with our prospects and target accounts, helps them identify their challenges, and demonstrates how PostgreSQL and EDB can be a solution for their needs.  ●     Meet and exceed quotas for new annual recurring revenue (assuming you’d like to tap into excellent accelerators!) ●     Dig deep to understand customer needs, pain points, and requirements ●     Qualify and execute against an inbound lead funnel ●     Prospect and build demand at target accounts ●     Collaborate with SDRs to build pipeline ●     Collaborate with channel partners to build pipeline and close deals ●     Target carrying 3x pipeline coverage of your target ●     Exhibit pipeline management and forecasting accuracy ●     Learn and grow your knowledge and expertise of PostgreSQL There are three primary routes to market for the CAE. These include: ●     [1] Inbound demand (i.e. marketing and partner generated) from a defined geographic territory ●     [2] Proactive engagement at assigned [non-customer] target accounts ●     [3] Expansion business from an assigned set of EDB customers from the commercial segment.  Requirements   ●     Sales and lead development experience ●     Successful B2B sales experience (anything over 2-3 years is a plus) ●     Experience with or selling in the open source database space a definite plus ●     Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience ●     Exceptional interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills (verbal and written) ●     Excellent time management and organizational skills ●     Experience with Salesforce.com, SalesLoft / Outreach, ZoomInfo, and other marketing tools preferred ●     Highly motivated and goal oriented ●     Exhibit maturity and a healthy emotional intelligence  ●     Exhibit pride in your work   ﻿We know it takes a unique mix of people and skills to help us in our mission to supercharge Postgres, and we understand that not everyone will check every box. We’d love to hear from you and we want you to apply!  EDB is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. EDB was built on a commitment to trust and respect each other and to embrace an array of people and ideas. These values remain at the center of our culture and are key to our company’s integrity.

Ideally, to be this Sales Manager you will have: BSc or equivalent in Business/Medical Science 5+ years experience within medical consumable sales Ideally some experience in pharmaceutical sales or a background in pharmacy Ability to work independently and self-driven Ideally some people management experience or mentoring  If this Sales Manager role sounds like you please click apply now, or share with your network too if this is not quite right for you, but could be good for someone you know!  *Due to COVID-19 we can only consider applicants currently residing in Singapore*  Melissa Selvakumar EA Reg No: R2090154 l EA License No: 11C5813

description: About Workato  Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.  Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.  We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.  Why join us?  Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.  But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.  If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!  Also, feel free to check out why: Business Insider named us an "enterprise startup to bet your career on" Forbes' Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America Quartz ranked us the #1 large company for remote workers  All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups Flexible and personalized medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalization and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...) Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave  Responsibilities  We are looking for an exceptional Manager, Sales (Commercial) to join our growing team. In this role, you will be involved in building and managing a high-performing team to drive new logo acquisition and be responsible for creating and implementing Go-To-Market strategies and initiatives for our Commercial Team. You will also be responsible to: Develop and execute a strategic sales and Go-To-Market plan which delivers revenue and margin growth through the acquisition of new logo clients Reporting on sales activity and revenue forecast. Coach and empower your team to proactively prospect, qualify, and build sales pipeline Enable the team to win business and to navigate complex organizations and negotiations. Provide senior deal support when needed to win as a team Proactively recruit talented sellers for your team based on Workato's hiring criteria Onboard and ramp new Account Executives and accelerate their ability to be productive Accurately forecast and represent your business to the executive team Develop and execute initiatives with cross-functional stakeholders in the wider Workato org, including Sales, Marketing, Solutions Consulting, Product, and Business Development Have a strong understanding of the Workato platform to provide guidance to your Commercial Sales team Evangelize Workato's sales playbook and drive adoption and domain expertise within your team Develop and enable the next generation of sales leaders Share learnings and best practices across the entire company Be a company builder  Requirements  Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills 5+ years experience of quota-carrying experience technology sales in a competitive market and 3+ years experience building and managing highly successful/talented software sales teams Demonstrate experience with a successful track record in managing accounts, building partnership relationships, driving revenue, hitting and overachievement of sales targets. Understanding of the business issues impacting commercial organizations with ability to educate/evangelize and generate opportunities out of this knowledge Experienced at managing an outbound sales team in all areas of the sales cycle  Soft Skills / Personal Characteristics Passionate about coaching, mentorship and team management Demonstrates understanding of the Workato iPaaS & Automation Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time in high-pressure situations, and work in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Capability to build great relationships with highly technical customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Possess strong critical thinking and analytical skills with an entrepreneurial mindset Motivated by helping people grow with a desire to continue learning A self-starter with the ability to work in a high-growth, rapidly changing marketplace Have the ability to learn quickly and establish credibility. Great candidates are self-aware and have high emotional intelligence Passionate about growing your career in one of the largest markets in software (automation) and developing and maintaining an in-depth understanding of Workato's products

description: THE CHALLENGE  Janio is looking for a Business Development Manager to join our rapidly expanding Singapore team. We invite candidates with an entrepreneurial and motivated mindset, as well as a keen interest in combining logistics with new technologies, to apply. Fluency in both oral and written English and a 2nd language (Fluency in dialects is an added advantage) Computer literacy and good digital skills (i.e. Microsoft Office, in particular PowerPoint, Excel) Ability to convince and negotiate stakeholders Strong interpersonal skills and networking capabilities Strong organisation skills and high attention to details Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, startup environment Self-Motivated Individual who is able to work independently  Interested candidate can use the link below to apply : https://www.janio.careers/jobs/a6152720f90030_1632808798

description: This Talent will partner the external sales representatives to serve our customers and deliver a high-level of service to them and would be an important customer connector and relationship builder.  He/She will attend swiftly to customers' enquiries and provide the needed support via phone, email and various communication platforms as required and also proactively contact new and existing customers to canvass for new product sales leads or give advice on general product queries.  General daily work will include generation of product offers including SAP quotations, giving basic product recommendations and CRM sales lead creation. Close teamwork with external sales on large project tenders and bids to produce tender proposals and ensure smooth project execution.     Responsibilities  Lead Generation and building customer relationship Acquisition of new customers: finding and following up projects and leads (potential future customers) by searching in public databases, tender platforms, newspapers, customer internet sites, etc. and following up with customer contact actions. Relationship management: Proactively foster strong contact with existing customers (customer proximity) develop long-term customer relations through regular service calls. Selling products/services primarily through phone and emails to achieve predetermined sales quotas   Customer enquiries clarifications: Attends to customers’ inbound enquiries and presents the features and benefits of product/service offerings to existing/new customers. Verification and proper understanding of customer requests & technical requirements or issues, providing necessary support or assign the right resources to provide resolution. Creating leads for external sales to follow through on CRM system for large project opportunities.  Commercial proposals preparation and follow ups: Creation of commercial proposals per customer's requirements on SAP system, including basic price discount discussions with customer. Conduct a systematic and active follow-up of offers & quotations, including analyses and actions Supports external sales in preparation for project tender submissions and documentations.  Basic 1st level product/tech enquiry support: Advice customers on basic technical enquiries (e.g. technical documentations, dimensions, pressure ratings and materials compatibility queries etc.), forwarding complex questions when necessary to internal technical specialists.  Project coordination: Support external sales in overseeing project tracking and execution as necessary. Work with back-office department to ensure timely material availability and smooth site deliveries.  Requirements Strong customer-orientation with strong communication skills to connect with people and to clarify customers' enquiries. Sales focused and able to build relationships well over telephone or various non face-to-face communication media. Ability to learn and understand technical products and principles quickly. Fluent in English and Chinese in writing and speaking  Education: Diploma in mechanical engineering or related technical education.  Experience - 2 to 3 years of customer service and/or technical sales sales experience - Good knowledge of MS Excel and Word - Knowledge of ERP Systems such as SAP or equivalent. - CRM usage experience will be a plus.

Company Description  X0PA AI is an Artificial Intelligence Software as a Service (SaaS) start-up that aims to digitally transform the hiring process. We aim to save companies significant time and cost in hiring while achieving the highest level of objectivity, ultimately enhancing retention, loyalty and person to job and organization fit. Through our AI and Machine Learning capabilities, we can source, score and rank talent to identify the best talent for each organization. X0PA AI has recently launched X0PA ROOM, an AI enabled hybrid video interviewing and assessment platform.  Job Summary  As a Leader of Channel and Partner Management, you are responsible for impacting sales and growth through profitable partner recruitment & enablement initiatives.  You will win, maintain and expand relationships with existing channel partners and establish new alliances with prospective partners/resellers. You recruit, engage and enhance the relationships with our GTM resellers and partners.  In addition to hiring partners and channels for X0PA you will also be responsible to identify product or corporate partnerships for X0PA to be a partner of that can further help product integrations or GTM channels.  Leader of Channel & Partner Management will report to the CEO. This is a global role.  This is a fantastic opportunity to work hands on with a high performing team in an AI based, innovative, fast-moving, funded start-up.  Job Responsibility Recruit new partners as GTM channel for X0PA to increase sales - identify, recruit and on-board new channel partners Enable new and existing partners to improve their productivity Manage existing channel partners Establish good rapport with partners to strengthen partner alliances and keep them motivated to high performance and engagement Work closely with partners to identify and develop opportunities for revenue generation Ongoing training with partners on X0PA AI’s solutions and services Conduct regular reviews with partners and provide recommendations for improvements Create channel plans to grow market share Develop systems and process to manage partner activities Drive adoption of company programs among assigned partners Stay abreast of market trends and competitors’ offerings Engage in industry related trade shows, seminars and product launches Meet sales targets and strategic objectives in partner accounts Assesses, clarifies and fine-tunes partner specifications on an ongoing basis Job Requirement Experience within a SAAS or tech/software organization Previous experience in channel and partner sales is necessary. Strong interpersonal skills to liaise with internal and external stakeholders Self-driven and proactive in nature Initiative and driven Self-reliant Passionate to work for a fast-paced start-up Flexible What We Offer  We are a bunch of fun loving, self-motivated professionals. We offer an inclusive, diverse and motivated work environment with huge learning opportunities.  In Singapore, we are located at JTC LaunchPad at One North which is a leading start-up hub in Asia and the world, a vibrant start-up ecosystem with opportunities to meet lot of like-minded individuals.

description: Our Channel & Alliances team is an important part of Chainalysis go-to-market. The team supports technology and consulting alliances. This team collaborates closely with our direct sales force, product and service teams to recruit and develop strategic alliances that accelerate Chainalysis sales and customer success objectives.  A Channel Manager at Chainalysis has built a strategic channel community with emerging technology at a high-growth SaaS company. An ideal candidate has experience collaborating with regional sales and alliance leadership to develop and execute a strategic channel territory plan, including recruiting and enabling key partners as well as enabling and integrating with the direct sales force. We measure the success of our Channels and Alliances team by the impact on our partners, joint customers and Chainalysis.  In one year you’ll know you were successful if… You have contributed a measurable impact to Chainalysis sales and customer success objectives. You have built a strategic, productive and vocal community, based on mutual value and trust by leveraging sales frameworks, relationships, and persistence. You have established yourself and our regional channel community as trusted extensions of our direct sales and service teams. You have created and shared best practices for developing partnerships across vertical and geographic markets. A Background Like This Helps Experience being part of a global alliance team and collaborating with local business leadership to build impactful channel communities and partnerships to drive our customer success objectives. Building thriving partnerships with regional leads of global technology and consulting firms, as well as identifying and recruiting boutique and regional technology and consulting firms to grow sales and customer success. You’re an articulate, enthusiastic, and effective communicator who can convey complex concepts in an approachable and concise way You don’t have to be a blockchain expert, but you’re insatiably curious and willing to learn You’re willing to travel as needed (when it’s safe again!) At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.  You belong here.  At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women’s Day, Juneteenth, Harvey Milk Day, and International Migrant’s Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.  We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can’t wait to meet you.  Applying from the EU? Please review our Candidate GDPR Notice.  By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.  Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - USA Employees are not required to attend in-person meetings at this time. All in-person, Chainalysis attendees must be vaccinated* prior to the in-person event/meeting You must follow cleaning protocols. This includes washing your hands before and after meetings or using a disinfectant or alcohol solution with at least 70% alcohol If a worker or visitor was in close or proximate contact with others at the office location and tests positive for COVID-19, they must immediately notify the People team *A USA employee is considered fully vaccinated if they meet any of the following criteria: It has been 2 weeks since their second dose in a 2-dose series, such as the Pfizer or Moderna vaccines, or It has been 2 weeks after a single-dose vaccine, such as Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen vaccine, or A person has recovered from a COVID-19 infection and was treated with monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma and are within 90 days of the treatment. Please note that once 90 days has passed after the monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma treatment, an employee will not be permitted to meet in-person or go to a customer meeting until they meet the above criteria of being fully vaccinated Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - EMEA  As an employer, Chainalysis is obliged to ensure a healthy and safe working environment. This means that we must try to prevent the coronavirus from spreading inside the workplace and all employees are obliged to follow the local regulations issued by the relevant health authorities. To help support a safe work environment, we encourage all employees in EMEA to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees will not be required to attend an event or in-person customer meeting. Employees in the EU and the UK are allowed to travel internationally for internal meetings to any country deemed “green or amber” by the EU and the UK authorities. All attendees for Chainalysis in-person events or meetings will be required to adhere to the following guidelines: International travel will only be permitted if you receive approval from both your manager and Executive Leader You must familiarize yourself and comply with any screening/safety protocols imposed by the entity/individual hosting the in-person meeting or event You must comply with any and all safety guidelines and travel restrictions established by applicable law If you are in close or proximate contact with others at the event/customer site and test positive for COVID-19, you must immediately notify the People Team and avoid contact with others for 10 days Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - APAC  With circumstances changing on a regular basis and parts of our APAC team going in and out of mandatory lockdown, APAC will continue to follow country legislation and guidelines.

description: The Regional Business Development Manager is focused on the development of customer relationships sales opportunities within new and dormant accounts. Strategically-minded, the Business Development Manager will establish and build a trusting relationship with potential prospects, and develop and close sales opportunities within new accounts (high touch sales).  As this position is focused on the pursuit and acquisition of 'new logos', the Business Development Manager will cultivate the teams that will support the account beyond the initial opportunity wins, which will enable the Business Development Manager to pursue other new prospects.  Our partnering client is a trusted IT solutions provider delivering cutting-edge technology products and world-class consulting services to businesses across the globe in every industry. The breadth of our global reach and depth of our expertise accelerate customer success by bringing people, ideas, and technology together to solve real-world business problems.  We deliver technology solutions for our customers by harnessing technology innovation to digitally transform and accelerate their business in the areas of connected buildings (incl. IoT), digital workplace & customer experience, data centers, networking (incl. Wi-Fi, SD-WAN), in-building 5G/ONGO and cyber security.  With more than 80 years of technology excellence and thousands of team members globally, managing over 175,000 customers across 150 countries we are uniquely positioned to build a global IT services brand that can deliver maximum value, world-class integrated solutions, deliver results, cultivate strategic relationships, and enable lasting relevance for our customers across six continents.  Job Responsibilities Identify prospects, and establish relationships with new customers and dormant accounts. Specifically, the BDM will target larger organizations, with a primary focus on Fortune 1000 prospects. Seek opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell to the client by introducing additional solutions that will enable the customer's success. Develop strategic pursuit plans. Engages with other internal sales professionals (direct and overlay), solutions experts, engineering when appropriate to actively drive pursuit opportunities. Main focus SG & ASEAN region. Skills, Knowledge, Abilities Able to cultivate relationships with large enterprises, including Fortune 1000 targets that do little or no business with at the present time. Able to understand the customer's business, and provide strategic insights to help the customer's business and provide solutions as a way to enable the customer's business success. Encompasses strategic pursuit management skills from opportunity start to finish. Able to use company's CRM to own benefits in the business prospecting and sales processes. Able to work independently, as well as part of a team environment. Must be a self-starter, entrepreneurial and able to work effectively with minimal direct supervision. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in standard business software programs, such as Microsoft Office. Qualifications Undergraduate Business degree is required. MBA preferred. Must have min 10 years of sales experience in developing new accounts within the technology/business IT services sector, preferable with leading system integrator (SI). Extensive, existing and relevant network of customers, OEMs, Distributors, SIs, Vendors and Supplier relationships. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with one of the OEMs; Cisco, Aruba, Silver Peak. Minimum one or two valid Sales certifications in above OEMs is a pre. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with Professional and Managed Services solutions. Ability to travel 25% of the time. Supervisory Responsibility This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities. Next Step Prepare an updated CV (including your current salary package with full breakdown such as base, incentives, AWS, etc.) and expected package. Apply through this application or drop an email at Zac.lim@adecco.com in MS Word Copy stating the job you are applying for. Zac Lim Boon Pin  Direct Line: 9222 2418  EA License No: 91C2918  Personnel Registration Number: R1871136

Pure Commerce is currently in search for a highly customer-centric Senior Business Development Manager. Pure Commerce and Euronet Worldwide group is strategically expanding its merchant services portfolio globally through partnerships with APAC being a key focus.  Strategic and independent approach on sales plan and new market entry Develop and maintain a pipeline of new businesses across the full sales lifecycle Meet quantitative and qualitative targets set by management Build and maintain professional relationships and coordinate with key stakeholders to grow partnership and revenue Keep abreast of market developments and monitor the competitive landscape  We welcome you to apply for the role if you meet these requirements.  More than 8 years of client-facing and corporate relationship Related experience in Fintech or Financial Services, Payments preferred Wide network of bank and Fintech partners in APAC region and beyond Experience with use of CRM (Hubspot preferred) and tracking of sales activity Good leadership qualities, highly professional, great team worker Impressive track record of revenue generation Excellent track record of developing key accounts especially in bank and Fintech Stakeholder management skills

description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  About AdobeSign  Adobe's solutions meet the needs of a diverse customer base that spans from consumer to enterprise. The Document Cloud is a complete portfolio of secure digital document solutions that speeds business transactions through 100% digital workflows. It includes Acrobat DC and Sign services, plus web and mobile apps that integrate into your existing document processes, productivity apps, and systems. With Adobe Sign, users can edit, sign, send and track documents wherever they are — across desktops, mobile and web. Businesses embarking on digital transformation strategies can leverage Adobe Sign to drive better customer experiences, and organisational agility. The adoption of eSignatures as a solution is growing exponentially, and Adobe Sign offers the best in class offering, from the market leader in secure document communications and founder of the PDF standard.  The challenge  As an Inside Sales Representative, this person will be responsible for driving sales of Adobe Sign in your designated territory. This includes developing pipeline by proactive phone-based prospecting and demand generation, lead management, opportunity development and follow-up from events and marketing activities!  What The Successful Candidate Will Do Drive and close a pre-defined revenue targets per quarter Meet or exceed all other pre-defined and mutually agreed ‘S.M.A.R.T’ objectives per quarter Develop territory plan to deliver revenue targets for the year Develop sales opportunities from both inbound leads and outbound sales play execution Assist customers in understanding Adobe Sign, configuration, environment and how it fits within their current infrastructure and business processes Work with Adobe Solution Consultants to deliver the appropriate technical solution to meet the customers’ needs Utilise Salesforce.com for end to end Lead Management by building strong working relationships with the sales force and field marketing organisation Submit accurate and detailed pipeline/Salesforce.com reports weekly and within the specified time frames You will have key relationships with your peers, Adobe Digital Media Sales Account Executives, Adobe Solution Consulting, Adobe Customer Success Managers and Adobe Solution Partners. Build team brand and personal brand by achieving top internal and external customer service!  What Is Needed To Succeed Similar sales experience in software and/or SaaS solutions. Ability to understand complex business environments and uncover customer issues, process problems, and translate need into business opportunities. Comfortable talking with prospects and internal/external customers and building relationships, and monetising them Ability to work in a fast paced, changing environment while still providing quality opportunities and driving revenue Exceptional capacity to develop relationships quickly over the phone with customers and technical audience. Exceptional ability to talk at a detailed level about Adobe Sign Strong team orientation and ability to build cross-functional relationships. Strong understanding of sales cycles and required qualification criteria. Innate sense of what is important and what is not in the context of prospecting/sales cycle (ability to prioritise) Proficient in Cantonese and Mandarin highly regarded

description: Main Duties and Responsibilities:  1. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES 1.1 Responsible for implementing and executing all corporate sales activities. 1.2 Ensure set sales target is being achieved every month. 1.3 Widen the corporate clientele base from the given portfolio. 1.4 Provide prompt and systematic servicing to all business accounts. 1.5 Develop and execute on a strategic plan in assigned market and achieve maximum profitability and revenue growth in line with the hotel’s business objectives; 1.6 Assure new businesses for room sales while develop existing accounts to meet hotel’s revenue goals and objectives; 1.7 Maintain contact with all clients in the market area to ensure high levels of client satisfaction with accountability and follow up.  2. JOB FUNCTION 2.1 Promote and produce sales leads for other Millennium & Copthorne hotels. 2.2 Maintain a high level of exposure for the hotel in major market areas through direct sales solicitation, telephone, fax, contacts written communications. 2.3 Establish and maintain files on major active accounts within his/her market areas. 2.4 Arrange familiarization/ sites inspections trips to hotel for major clients. 2.5 Attend major functions (i.e., trade shows and promotional events) that deal specifically with his/her market areas. 2.6 Monitor assigned competitor/s and provide regular feedback. 2.7 Provide feedback to the Senior Sales Managers / Director of Sales on changing marketing conditions, including trends in the competition, as a result of direct sales solicitation, telephone and direct mail, in his/her market areas. 2.8 Ensure department’s operational budget is strictly adhered to and that all costs are strictly controlled. 2.9 Disseminate sales related information to other departments as appropriate. 2.10 Attend all pre/post-conference meetings, as required, arranged by the Meeting Services department. 2.11 Maintain efficient sales office procedures and ensure the maintenance of accurate and updated profiles in both Fidelio and Delphi. 2.12 Maintain the highest standards of professionalism, ethics and attitude towards all hotel guests, clients, staff and employees. 2.13 Maintain professional business confidentiality. 2.14 Support the Senior Sales Managers and provide supervision to Assistant Sales Managers and Sales Associates. 2.15 Undertake any other duties, relevant to your role, as assigned by the Manager.

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Customer Success Manager  Who is Mastercard?  Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.  Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.  Overview  The Data & Services team is looking for a Customer Success Manager to work closely with clients on customer loyalty strategy on SessionM platform. The ideal candidate is passionate about loyalty programs, personalized customer journey, highly motivated, intellectually curious and analytical.  Role  In This Client-facing Position, You Will Take responsibility for client contract renewals and drive upsell revenue. Identify opportunities to grow your client portfolio, solve problems, and deliver solutions. Strategically align SessionM products and services to client needs on an on-going basis. Partner with Project Manager and Integration Engineers to ensure client’s project requirements are clearly understood, and deliverables are met. Partner with Campaign Manager to manage client’s day-to-day campaign operations and performance monitoring and make campaign recommendations to achieve client goals  All About You  The ideal candidate for this position should: Understand marketing technology ecosystem specifically CRM, Loyalty, and messaging Go out of the way to find out client’s needs are and how a product or service can help Thrive in a fast-paced environment, handle diverse workload, and meet aggressive deadlines Level of expertise: Intermediate  List Of Additional Capabilities. Comfortable working with data analysts and recommend actionable insights Be skilled at explaining technical problems succinctly and clearly Cross-team effort between Sales, Support, Project Managers, Products and Engineering Always look for potential solutions to solve problems  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

description: At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. Because of that we’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and talent. Our culture was purpose-built to be remote first, and we offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. If you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology with a team that makes a difference every day, let’s talk.  About The Role  As a Regional Sales Manager (RSM), you will be responsible for driving new business opportunities within enterprise clients, whilst growing existing client relationships. You will position CrowdStrike as the supplier of choice within your accounts.  To meet and exceed your individual sales quota, you will drive the sales cycle to success. You will meet the client’s requirements and be responsible for collaborating with the relevant internal teams to deliver successful sales proposals.  The right candidate will possess excellent energy and drive and a real desire to build business across a portfolio of accounts. They will have the ability to build effective relationships quickly and to find valuable business within each account immediately that can then be enhanced by leveraging internal resources. Candidates with current strong security contacts are encouraged to apply.  As a Regional Sales Manager, you will be accountable for: Work closely with internal resources and individually to build a successful pipeline to meet and exceed your individual sales quota Identify new business opportunities whilst establishing, developing and maintaining relationships up to executive-levels within your assigned portfolio Network within the client’s business and influence key decision makers, typically at C-level Act as CrowdStrike ambassador within specific client accounts Articulate and promote the company’s value proposition and services to become a trusted advisor within your customer base Identify new business opportunities and prepare detailed account development plans, engagement strategies and targets for each account within your assigned portfolio Working in collaboration with internal teams and to lead a virtual team to drive and close opportunities Take control of opportunities and accurately forecast their business objectives and outcomes. What You’ll Need Proven successful track record in a similar role selling high technology products to Enterprise customers in Singapore across Government, FSI and large enterprise accounts. Ability to network multiple levels within an account up to C-Level Experience within Cyber Security is preferred Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills Ability to create and deliver value propositions Ability to identify and influence key decision makers Ability to succeed in a quota driven sales environment at an Enterprise level Proven sales track record Capable of closing solutions and services opportunities Strong business acumen and professionalism. Leadership, accountability qualities required Salesforce.com experience preferable Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-friendly culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Paid Parental Leave, including adoption Wellness programs A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Open offices have stocked kitchens, coffee, soda and treats We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives that encourage new ways of solving problems, so we strive to attract and develop talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels seen, heard and empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.  CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

description: Are you a motivated sales hunter who enjoys winning the sale through relationships and building innovative solutions in the Cloud Infrastructure Services space?  Capgemini – Cloud Infrastructure Services (CIS) business unit is a leading service provider in the South East Asia region across the industries we serve. We achieve success as a team collaboratively and share a common mission statement to offer solutions in a smarter, faster, safer, integrated approach.  What Do We Sell  Capgemini’s portfolio of Infrastructure services includes a full spectrum of Cloud/Data Services, End User Services/ End User Computing, Service Integration offerings, and Cybersecurity Services—and all services are designed to work in combination with each other, not just separately. Our unique approach to Infrastructure Services connects solutions, services, and suppliers to implement integrated solutions across the IT supply chain. Capgemini is the one partner that puts it all together so our clients can boldly accelerate their transformation journey—confidently.  What will a Hunter Sales Manager in Capgemini, CIS business unit do:  Successful Hunter Sales Managers own their geographic territory. They acquire new corporate accounts and nurture existing accounts to generate net new business by collaboratively working and leveraging presales and technical support and overachieve sales objectives. They uncover new business Opportunities, sell our solutions portfolio to various industries including Financial Services & Insurance, Utilities, Telco Service Providers, Retail, Govt & Public Sector (in a few geographies).The candidate needs to be outgoing, proactive and have attention to detail with outstanding selling and networking skills in the operating geographies.  You will thrive in this role if You are a seasoned sales professional with a hunter mentality skilled at generating your own leads through cold calling, networking, and driving your territory. You are tenacious. Our sales cycle can be on the longer side, so you must be willing to work accounts until the client has a need. You enjoy building relationships and creating a bond and rapport with clients. You are meticulous in time management skills. The candidate will enjoy a great sense of autonomy. In order to be successful, you must organize and balance your activities appropriately (prospecting, selling, and account management) to deliver results. You have a “yes” approach to work independently and equally have a line of sight in the spirit of being collaborative with the rest of the team members in the organization. You have high level of solution sales expertise in the areas of Cloud Infrastructure Services, Data Center Transformation, IT Managed Services and Service Management. Experience Summary Deep knowledge of the cloud services market, public and hybrid cloud solutions, including migration to cloud services. Understanding of Cloud – Technologies, Managed Services and Automation. Experience in articulating the challenges of transitioning to or co-existing with public cloud. Experience and understanding of common on-premise architecture patterns in the data centers related to IT Infrastructure – Servers, Storage, Network. Develop and maintain go to market strategies around Cloud adoption and sell solutions in the areas of cloud migration, optimization and migration services. Comfortable selling large scale, complex and innovative Infrastructure led solutions. The chosen candidate will need to work across 3 fronts: Internally – with cross business units and rest of the sales teams. Externally – with customers, establishing and developing relationships with key customer contacts. Externally – with partners & alliances. Primary Qualifications Minimum of 10 years sales experience in selling IT Infrastructure solutions of which at least 3-5 years in selling Cloud Services. Experience with the consultative sales approach. Ability to work in a global organizational and service delivery environment. Sales experience of Managed Services is an added advantage.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: The candidate will be part of the Operations Onboarding team and give our onboarding customers a stellar experience. Own lead conversion Report on onboarding metrics Explain & pitch to leads how Aspire works and how it fit their needs Help customers who face any problems during registration Turn the onboarding process into an amazing customer experience, and brainstorm and implement new ideas on improvement Be responsible for customer experience metrics along the early stage of the customer journey  YOUR PROFILE Passionate about customers & sales 2-8 years work experience in customer success, inside sales, account management, or similar role; preferably in a startup, financial or tech company A Bachelor / Master degree from a top university Knowledgeable of best practices in onboarding & sales Strong communication, writing, and presentation skills Positive & get-it-done attitude 100% hands-on  ABOUT ASPIRE We are the #1 B2B all-in-one banking platform in South-East Asia. We are proud to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners. Founded in 2018 by Lazada founders, Aspire has raised USD 200+M equity + debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions, we partner with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise. We were awarded 2020 Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and 2020 Startup Award by TechNode. We currently have ~150 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, and Thailand. We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.

What do we do ? This is a transformational role within NetApp that will drive our Cloud GTM with Google's key Sellers, Customers, Partners. This position will be responsible for all aspect of joint selling - partnering, GTM activities, sales enablement, pipeline management, sales opportunity reporting and management of NetApp and Google sellers. Not only will this position be responsible for the day-to-day sales leadership, but it will also provide feedback into our product orgs to shape our product vision. The Google Cloud Sales leaders will cover a territory and set of accounts and will be a part of our Google GTM Cloud Data Services Team that reports to the VP of Google Cloud Sales. The role of the Google Cloud Sales Executive is to work with Google to drive Google Cloud Volumes Service (CVS) and Google Cloud Volumes ONTAP (CVO) consumption through Google priority Sellers, Customers, Partners, and the Google Marketplace. This role is primarily responsible for building relationships with Google Sales Teams and Google Customer Engineers Business to grow Google Consumption of Data Migrating to Cloud and Customer Success in the Cloud Journey. This role will also help Customers and Partners evaluate CVS and CVO for their workloads, applications and data to the cloud, recommend solutions that meet their requirements, remove roadblocks to deployment and drive customer satisfaction.  What is a day like as Google Sales Rep ? Develop and maintain a MRR, ARR Sales Plan in SFDC that includes mapping to the appropriate Google resources; prospect into the Partner Services Team, Account Team, Specialist Team and Customer Success units to build relationships, manage sales opportunities, create a sales pipeline and deliver a GCP revenue forecast to Google Business Unit Management Disciplined business-management; adaptable to a culture of accountability; build a strong and active business network; meets sales targets and operational standards. Build and transform new markets and lead transformational shifts for our customers. Develop, communicate and provide high business impact solutions that enable digital transformation Maintain and develop a positive Customer and Partner Experience (PSM), per the foundational goals and aspirations of Google Clear communication, status, and leadership will be essential to succeed. As this is an emerging space, the ability to pivot quickly and try new ideas will also be required.  What do you bring to the table ? Effective territory/account management: planning, opportunity qualification and creation, stakeholder and executive communication needs analysis, value engineering, services/partner engagement, opportunity management, pipeline management, and large dollar deal negotiation Experience and expertise selling large cloud deals to senior business decision makers by aligning and reinforcing the value of the solution to the customer's overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria Ability to solve customer problems with the Google cloud platform, specifically solutions related to new internal LOB apps and external facing apps, migration to cloud, Hybrid cloud, datacenter infrastructure modernization, DevOps/DevTest along with knowledge of enterprise and competitive cloud solutions Success in previous roles selling through or with customers. partners and joint GTM efforts  Clear and demonstrated understanding of the various capabilities of Google SI and GTM Channels Ability to work in a fluid environment and possess a creative mindset for new forms of storage consumption/pricing models Proven ability to work collaboratively and be open to direct feedback Develop and grow a sales opportunity pipeline and manage a collaborative sales campaign Ability to define an operationalize a plan within an established company Be able to articulate a business case for the established direction/investment in this space Familiar and Leverage Marketing Automation Tool like Marketo, Hubspot, etc to drive new digital pipeline.  What is your background ? 10+ years demonstrated sales leadership success, leading high-growth, emerging businesses a plus. Demonstrated success in building and developing high performance teams. -Broad company & business experience, especially in go-to-market roles Proven success managing a diversified business, global responsibility a plus. A Bachelor of Arts or Sciences Degree in Electrical Engineer or Computer Science; or related field is required. A Graduate Degree is desired.
industries: Information Technology and Services

Enhance profitability by introducing products to multiple channels and developing/ growing those channels Ability to develop, build and maintain key retail and partner relationships to help drive significant company growth. Able to develop and lead the execution of sales programs with these key partners. Competent in business realignment for market changes and in driving change management initiatives Manage the eCommerce platform and CRM tool Work closely with the marketing team to develop strategic ideas for growth, plan and execute eCommerce promotional campaigns with the lowest cost to achieve the highest profit goal Monitor online retail and competitive activities for insights on new opportunities, trends, and best-in-class approaches Develop high-level eCommerce solution strategy to identify key performance indicators, understand online traffic patterns, segment customer behaviors, and provide prompt solutions to solve site issues Maintain accurate records and present reports to team management and stakeholders Support venture leader to define key finical targets depending on market demand and trend Your profile Bachelor's Degree in business development, sales, or related fields 3+ years of experience in B2C eCommerce sales and management Substantial background and network in the retail/ health/ fashion industry 1+ years of experience with sales forecasting in a direct B2C eCommerce online shop Strong verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Self-motivated and able to work in a professional environment with limited direct supervision Open-minded, positive, and bold in trying new ideas that can bring in more profitable sales Direct knowledge of Shopify platform is a plus Experience with ecommerce CRM tools Agile mindset, customer driven and results oriented, experience in Agile methods e.g. Scrum is a plus Ability to work in an autonomous team

description: Do you want to contribute to the future of healthcare? As Siemens Healthineers values those who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause, our company’s name is dedicated to our employees. It’s their pioneering spirit, blended with our long history of engineering in the ever evolving healthcare industry that truly makes us unique as an employer.  We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to stretch beyond your comfort zone in order to grow both personally and professionally. Sound interesting?  Then come in and join our global team as a Account Manager, you will plan and executes sales targets and activities in Singapore for the portfolio of DI & AT products with potential customers and to achieve defined commercial targets.  Your mission and responsibilities:  You will be responsible for management of assigned accounts You will be responsible for the delivery of revenue targets of assign accounts You will be responsible to handle Tender/ Procurement and to Work with commercial/ legal teams on T&C You will work along with project managers to manage customer’s expectation You will coordinate with Customer Service support and keep abreast with service support issues, status along with maintaining customer satisfaction You will ensure there is no overdue account receivable You will ensure effective, quality and accurate opportunity pipeline You will coordinate, report and feedback the market situation to sales managers You will maintain up-to-date customer/ market intelligence and capture win/ loss data You will be responsible for accurate forecast in monthly, quarterly and annual basis You will provide in-house residence expert for assigned products and business unit You will develop and execute strategy for assigned product lines and account  To find out more about the specific business, have a look at https://www.healthcare.siemens.com/  Your qualifications and experiences:  You have at least 3-5 years of sales experience preferably in Healthcare products and solutions in Singapore You have experience in managing customer accounts preferably in Healthcare industry. Understanding of diagnostic imaging market with sales knowledge of Singapore Healthcare market  Your personality and skills:  You are an expert in exposure to customers and account management best practices You are good in creating strategic business plan, communication and presentation skills You can build sound working relationships internally and with Customers to ensure success in this role You possess excellent communication, influencing and relationship building skills  Being part of our team:  Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. More than 53,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services.  Your cultural fit:  Our unique team spirit arises from embracing different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge conventions. Change is a constant aspect of our work. We aspire to lead the change in our industry rather than just react to it. That’s why we want you to seek, implement and celebrate your best ideas.  To all recruitment agencies: Siemens Healthineers does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, employees or any other company location. Siemens Healthineers is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes  Siemens Healthineers Singapore was awarded Gold in "Excellence in Total Rewards Strategy" & "Excellence in Retention Strategy" at the HR Excellence Awards 2020. Sliver for "Employer of the Year" at the HR Excellence Awards 2019.  Organization: Siemens Healthineers  Company: Siemens Healthcare Pte Ltd  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: Full-time
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Biotechnology

jobTitle: Senior Territory Manager, SE Asia Partnerships
description: Join us to solve real world problems while shaping the future of global trade.  The Opportunity  As a result of our global expansion, we're looking to hire a Senior Territory Manager, SE Asia to join our growing Asia Partners Team. This role will work in a cross-functional environment, partnering closely not only with our forwarding and customs partners, but also different teams across the company to achieve our shared goals. You’ll get substantial leadership exposure, focus on the highest priority business issues, and be plugged into every facet of the business.  What You’ll Do Ensure end-to-end business success of Flexport in SE Asia (both commercial and operational outcomes) Work cross-functionally with local, regional, and global teams (incl. Sales, CST, Tradelane Mgmt, and others) to drive growth, ensure high operational service performance, and improve Flexport productivity Represent Flexport in a number of countries in SE Asia being the face towards global clients, support sales efforts, RFPs, bids, and implementations where required Promote Flexport SE Asia capabilities internally, lead sales & internal enablement on SE Asia market; identify leads to grow Flexport SE Asia Identify opportunities to build / improve new capabilities and unlock new growth Represent Flexport brand in SE Asia market Own relationships with Flexport freight forwarding and customs partners Sourcing, vetting, and onboarding of new freight forwarding and customs partners Work with partners to plan sufficient resources necessary to support Flexport’s rapid growth Be a trusted advisor and coach to partners; continuously identify gaps and develop solutions focused on process standardization for both operations team and partners Ensure partners operate with a high level of integrity and compliance to global regulatory requirements Drive partner technology adoption & operational performance Enable partners to use Flexport’s proprietary technology and drive digital adoption Contribute to the development and implementation of next gen partner software, including localization requirements for assigned markets Manage Partner performance, leveraging global performance metrics, targets, dashboards, and reporting to drive quality and consistency of operations; drive continuous performance improvement Own exceptions and escalations on shipments operated by assigned Flexport Partners (supported by Partner Performance Associates) Build and lead a high performing team to manage and grow our partner landscape in SE Asia What You’ll Need BA/BS degree with 10+ years of professional experience in logistics, supply chain, and/or operations Deep understanding of needs & expectations of Flexport’s global logistics clients (in particular US importers); ideally gained through combination of working in global logistics provider and client side Knowledge of both ocean & air freight solutions/requirements on TPEB trade (FEWB desired) Hands-on experience in using / implementing technology to improve logistics outcomes A strong performance record of living our values; prior Flexport experience strongly preferred, to hire & onboard new Flexport employees in the region. Able to represent Flexport brand, values, and culture; towards local partners and global (US based) clients; Excellent cross-functional collaboration skills to deliver client outcomes within a matrix organization, across (US) destination operations, tradelane management; Solid negotiation skills and ability to influence without authority Strategic vision and ground floor execution; Strong ability to build relationships with local partners; excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills, able to connect within partner organizations at multiple levels; Business level Mandarin language proficiency required; Execute end to end with world class follow through; a system and process oriented mindset; Ability to lead and direct the work of others, hire & onboard local talent; Next-level attention to detail and the drive to deliver ahead of schedule with a servant leadership approach; Courage to challenge the status quo when logic and reason require it. See something broken? Fix it.

description: The Company Our client, is a leading Independent Marketing Intelligence Company. Their ambition has been to produce the best programmatic media results, underpinned by the sharpest data insights and delivered by the smartest people. You will join a global company with a global culture to match.  People, trust, commitment are some of their values as a company, they welcome & embrace new ideas. This is a company who believes in supporting and developing their employees in order to build a successful business.  The Role We are looking to hire an Account Manager to join its award-winning trading team. The successful candidate will be in the unique position to work closely with individuals from other departments including Sales, Trading, Analysis, Product, L&D and Marketing; not only within SEA but across their Global footprint. You will be responsible for the account management and growth of their existing business, keeping their clients happy, and ensuring that revenue streams remain strong with diversifying. The individual will directly report to the Head of Client Development SEA, benefitting from being part of an experienced and well-established Account Management team located in Singapore.   The Candidate He/she must have minimum 2-years account management experience in digital media, preferably with agency experience under their belt (or similar). He/she must also have a start-up mind-set, possess a can do' attitude to provide energy, drive and enthusiasm. If you have a dream to accelerate your career with a fast growing company, submit your application now!  Responsibilities Proactively connect multiple data points to drive solutions for clients Work with Trading & Analysis to identify insight-driven takeaways to drive incrementality through unlocking opportunities rooted in learnings / recommendations Produce and maintain Account Plans designed to monitor account growth and identify & plan for growth opportunities within key SEA accounts Collaborate with Sales team to lead QBR planning & production for key accounts in SEA Support Operations lead with weekly insight on evolving growth expectations for top accounts Leverages data to identify strategy for clients to share and build our client's brand Able to adjust team or patch focus and priorities based on new information while holding the bigger picture Create new ideas or solutions for clients ensuring we retain and improve client  Requirements A minimum of 2 years experience in a Media Planning/Strategy/Client Services/Sales Support/Ad-Ops background role Client facing experience in Digital Media Experience working with media agencies and brands. Knowledge of programmatic trading concepts and technology Ability to communicate technical concepts. Stakeholder management.

description: What You Do At AMD Changes Everything  At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.  Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.  Sales Manager 2  The Role  We are looking for our next team member to drive our region strategy and demand for AMD-based Lenovo products. The primary focus is to win market share and grow sales for AMD EPYC and Radeon Instinct product lines across all market segments.  The Person  Does this sound like you? We'd love to talk! A strong drive to “win,” combined with sound business perspective High level of confidence, business maturity and integrity A true hunter mentality identifying new business and partnerships beneficial to AMD sales goals Open communication style and presence to work optimally at all levels Honest and trustworthy in dealings with internal/external customers, colleagues and partners Ability to listen to the customer and articulate their needs internally Proven track record of strategy & planning, building on a strategic vision Proven ability to deliver high level communications, marketing and presentations at all levels. Key Responsibilities Define and execute the sales-out strategy with Lenovo Grow enterprise CPU & Datacenter graphics sales & market share Be part of a global AMD enterprise sales-out team and work with a network of sales-out specialists, FAEs and generalists to drive the customer’s direct sales bid participation and distribution/partner sales opportunities Formulate strategy to improve relationships with Lenovo executives, pre-sales and product marketing organizations on business growth opportunities Expand business relationships with key partners Build relationships with key decision makers, able to influence decision making to support our strategies and business goals, and to achieve outcomes where everybody wins Drive channel programs and train/motivate Lenovo Channel partners to achieve defined growth targets and goals Coordinate and support events and training and collaborate with AMD marketing & event teams to improve AMD presence & brand awareness and amplify the partnership Funnel new market opportunities to the AMD design-in and business unit teams Coordinate and close sales pipeline opportunities between Lenovo’s Corporate, CSP & Global Account teams and AMD BDEs Achieve agreed sales quota and critical metrics Establish a quarterly business review cadence Provide detailed weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual base and executive level reporting on overall program and market impact. Preferred Experience Proven server or system sales, preferably with a background in semiconductors, in the enterprise, CSP, or commercial segment Crafting contracts, establishing relationships and building partner networks in the industry A proven track record of success in server sales in the region Academic Credentials Degree in Business or Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience LOCATION:  Singapore  AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and will consider all applicants without regard to race, marital status, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. EOE/MFDV  Requisition Number: 95568  Country/Region/Location: Singapore State/Province: Singapore City: Singapore  Job Function: Sales
