description: AccelerAsia is a growth engine for technology scale-ups. We provide our clients with a suite of sales services to help them expand their businesses into APAC and become successful in this region. Over the past 11 years we have created a unique culture and a very successful business that has helped dozens of companies build their business in these parts of the world.   You will be part of a team responsible for executing the sales strategy, building market position for multiple AA clients. You will do this by working across the entire sales cycle from prospecting, lead qualification, nurturing opportunities to closing deals, under the supervision of your team lead (Business Development Director).  Key Requirements: You have 5 years of business development and enterprise sales experience (preferably SaaS sales). Demonstrated track record of success in launching solutions into new markets: building new pipeline, maintaining pipeline and closing deals Experience in selling into multiple different markets across the APAC region Familiar with sales processes and CRM reporting.  You have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. You enjoy pitching, eloquent and articulate, able to think (and speak) on your feet. Have led a team / mentored junior sales team members  This job might be for you if: You have a genuine interest in technology. You are always keeping up to date on the latest technology trends in your markets and industries. You’re curious and you learn fast. You have the ability to acquire understanding & absorb information rapidly.  You like a challenge. You’re willing to challenge the status quo and be challenged in return.  You are resilient. When things go wrong, you never give up, you proactively come up with new ideas and think outside the box.  You are a hunter. You know that hunting for leads and generating opportunities with large enterprises is not easy and it takes persistence - but you have that in spades. You have an international outlook. You like to travel and work with people from all over the world. You know the regional markets well (solid experience selling across different APAC markets) and all their different quirks.  You are supportive. You want to help your teammates as much as you want to help yourself!  Perks and Benefits: We can offer a competitive salary package with endless opportunities to work with exciting new technologies along with a clearly structured career path. You will get the opportunity to work with a highly supportive, fun and tenacious team, as well as access to professional coaches to guide you in your professional and leadership development. Not to mention you also get: Health Insurance plans Flexible working house and unlimited annual leave

description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  As the Regional Sales Manager, you will work with senior management to steer the design and implementation of commercial strategy and initiatives. You will also work with the sales and commercial teams across the region to drive growth and business development through deep understanding of the target market, key customer segments and the ideal customer journey.  Responsibilities Work with senior management to design, develop and execute a broad range of strategic initiatives with the goal of helping Ninja Direct grow Take direct responsibility for the business’ sales strategy Lead the charge in securing our value proposition with our target customer segments while helping to define and improve on our core customer journey Formulate and implement sales best practices across our local sales teams Ensure that the performance of sales teams is tracked and managed accurately Play an active role in developing our local sales teams through hiring and training Manage stakeholders across multiple layers, functions and geographies to ensure alignment across the business Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in relevant business discipline 3 - 5 years of relevant experience in sales management, business development, management consulting or similar roles. Prior P&L ownership will be highly favored. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Gsheets Proven track record of success in high-pressure environments, comfortable dealing with ambiguity and change Strong stakeholder management and communication skills - Proven track record of driving complex regional projects and working with senior stakeholders across the business Exposure to working across geographies, teams and individuals of different cultures, particularly across Southeast Asia Strong analytical abilities and a structured, data-driven approach to problem solving while possessing commercial acumen Organised, highly motivated and able to handle multiple projects / timelines concurrently Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: New Business Sales Manager, Digital Natives
description: As a New Business Sales Manager (DNB) at Stripe, you will play an instrumental role in fueling Stripe’s growth through new customer acquisition.  In this role you will lead a team of high-performing DNB Account Executives, helping them to develop their skills and deliver on their ambitious targets, as well as roll your sleeves up to work directly with customers.  We are looking for a proactive leader who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a high-growth environment, managing high-performing teams and solving problems with limited oversight. Ideal candidates will have experience scaling and managing a technology sales team, and possess first-class analytical, communication and relationship-building skills.  You Will Recruit, develop and lead a team of sales professionals, with a particular focus on the digital native customer segments. Develop the long-term vision and strategy for the team and manage day-to-day operations, with a focus on performance against key sales metrics. Be accountable for increasing revenue and new client acquisition at high rates of growth. Coach and guide the team in developing consultative and solution-based sales skills through all facets of the sales cycle. Play a personal and direct role in building and maintaining enduring customer relationships, up to C-level. Inspire, motivate and enable personal and career development of team members, both to promote career growth and to increase impact for Stripe. Work collaboratively and cross-functionally across the organisation to help shape Stripe’s products and solutions to meet customer needs. In particular, this will involve working with the extended Southeast Asia sales team, as well as global inter-working with US, European and APAC sales. Participate in industry events to help support positive market awareness. We Are Looking For Someone With 7+ years of sales experience and 5+ years of people management experience. = Experience leading sales and operations in a high-growth technology environment covering the enterprise customer segment. Ability to hire, train and coach a high-performance sales team. Ability to build strategic executive relationships with customers and industry thought leaders. Demonstrated passion for startups and new technology businesses. Ability to understand and articulate technical concepts, and translate them into industry- or business-relevant terms. You Should Include These In Your Application A current resume and LinkedIn profile.
industries: Computer Software, Financial Services, and Internet

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager, South East Asia (SEA)
description: We are looking for a high caliber individual with previous experience in industrial products in plumbing or HVAC industry with prior experience in Sales in Southeast Asia (SEA) countries. This position in SEA is to capitalize on the market growth potential for Armstrong Design Envelope pumps in HVAC applications, booster pumps and UL/FM fire pumps in commercial and industrial sector.  The individual will be responsible for growing Armstrong’s business in SEA with sales in selected market segments and the appointment of right channel partners in SEA. Target market coverage in Southeast Asia are: Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Vietnam, Indonesia.  The individual will undergo intensive and hands-on training in China and other appropriate facilities of Armstrong. For the right individual, this assignment will provide the candidate with the right opportunity for personal growth and career development along with increased coverage and exposure to other aspects of commercial business in Armstrong.  This position will be based in home country of applicant, South East Asia.  In addition to annual initiatives, the key accountabilities of this position are:  1.   Sales & Channel Management l Execute the sales strategy for key SEA markets and segments to achieve the annual budget for bookings, sales, margins and specific Armstrong metrics l Identify and develop the relevant channel partners/reps or agents to partner with Armstrong and adoption of the Armstrong Sales Process l Support the existing channel partner in the development of Armstrong Design Envelope pumps with consultants in plan and specification work alongside the Armstrong Technical Support team l Oversees and administers all aspects of channel partners including the pertinent distributorship Agreements; adherence to Agreement through monthly monitoring of Territory performance.  2.   Marketing and Business Intelligence l Monitors sales channels performance on a monthly basis; develops and recommends corrective or supportive actions l Provide the market intelligence on Armstrong competitors’ capabilities, report and recommend action plans l Ensure that CRM is updated with information on the current prospects l Participate in the definition of new product development and in ideas for Asia that would allow Armstrong Global to stay ahead of the competition and offer differentiable solutions l Work together as a team with Regional Sales for SEA and North Asia to support development of the overall market strategy for Armstrong in Asia  Role Requirements l Bachelor’s in Mechanical Engineering, preferably with fluid dynamics or HVAC subjects from a recognized university l 5-8 years in sales including exposure to SEA markets a must. North Asia experience will be added advantage l Experience working with US/European MNCs supplier l Industry network and access in SEA in building industry will be advantageous l Strong interpersonal and persuasive skills l Strong in communication in both languages in English and Chinese l Ability to work independently and where necessary work in a project team l Pleasant personality and a team player l Able to travel extensively (estimated 70-80% of time)

description: 200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.  Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years.  Responsibilities Play an integral role in managing and growing the key accounts Maintain and develop market shares by engaging the client commercially Responsible for the development and achievement of sales through direct sales channel Focus on growing and developing large MNC clients Write business plans for all current business and mapping opportunities Primary interface between the customer and all relevant divisions Propose innovative solutions for future development Conduct Quarterly Business Review, maintain SOPs and host regular meetings with customers to establish a healthy working relationship Identify new business opportunities and follow up on new customers’ developments Act as single point of contact for the clients (SPOC) Manage the shipments and daily operation for the clients Monitor the quality of daily operation and ensure the service is delivered as per committed on the SOP Tackle issues and provide immediate solutions  Qualifications Degree graduate in the relevant field Minimum 5 years of sales / account management experience in Logistics / Freight Forwarding Prior experience servicing customers in the Hi-Tech, electronics, manufacturing industries will be an advantage Strong account management and relationship building skills Excellent presentation and analytical skills Proficient in MS Office  We invite interested and qualified candidates to submit resume for consideration. We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.  Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: In this role, you will function as the lead to develop and establish sales channels to increase business growth for a pipeline of new products. This role offers an excellent opportunity for someone to be part of a dynamic, fast-paced team to gear up for global growth. You will interact across product development, marketing, engineering and operations, hence, excellent communication and collaboration skills are a pre-requisite due to the cross-functional nature of the role.  Job Description: Sourcing and establishing new sales channels to increase business growth. Establishing and maintaining trusted relationships with external retailers and distributors to increase sales and partnerships in both offline and online platforms. Negotiating and presenting to existing retailers and distributors to increase product visibility and sales performances Implementing promotion strategies for retail channels to increase sales for products Responsible for monthly reporting, profit & loss reporting, setting of performance measurement/matrix to measure the well-being of the sales channels. Analysing product performances and proposing implementation plans to improve KPIs Collaborate with the team to create, plan and put together strategies for successful execution and to maximize revenue and profit. Improve e-commerce channel performance via heavy A/B testing on all key levers to keep improving channel CTR and Conversions. Work cross functionally with marketing team to uplift channel performance via incremental analysis. Work closely with Ops Team to ensure Inventory are Inbounded and Orders are Shipped-On-Time. Product on-boarding on Marketplaces, Product Listing and Campaign Registration. Drive delivery & pick up sales through non-conventional sales channels and partnerships, including partnership, corporate sales, and bulk orders.  Job Requirements: Degree in Business / Marketing / Digital or equivalent At least 5-7 years of international channel sales experience Relevant work experience in aggregator and/or e-commerce sales such as Lazada, Shopee, Amazon, is an added bonus Advantage to have experience with country specific local marketplace platforms (Tiki in Vietnam, Bukalapak in Indonesia, JD Central in Thailand etc.) Proven track record in using Marketplace Seller Centre Tools Highly analytical and proficient in business presentation. Excellent project management, communication and interpersonal skills Demonstrated proven capability to work with multiple stakeholders in a fast moving environment Ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment and to work under pressure Able to multi task and meet tight deadlines

Rich Identifies, prioritizes, and executes against accounts/prospects articulated in the sales plans Understand customers’ needs and create value-add product solutions Sales management including distributors, wholesalers, brokers, and end-users management Tailors product mix and solutions to grow account volumes and profitability Responsible for Foodservice development and ensure the volume growth Uses solution selling to expand product mix and volumes Develop and expand new customers base Leverages the relationships and knowledge of peers to identify and secure new accounts to achieve overall “new business” targets and objectives Assist with product launches Products demonstrations Execute promotional activities to increase sales volume Address customer concerns with empathy trends to drive sales Continuously learn new sales skills & technology to drive sales performance Adhere to local government requirements/restrictions   JOB REQUIREMENTS : Culinary chef with 3 years description: We are currently looking for high energy, driven Enterprise Account Executive with a solid solution selling background. The Senior Enterprise Account Executive role is responsible for selling our sales enablement, learning, and marketing portfolio of products within the largest of our enterprise accounts. The Enterprise Account Executive’s primary responsibilities focus on executing successful sales strategies that will drive customer value for subscription licenses, and professional services. The Senior Enterprise Account Executive will also act as a mentor to other Enterprise Account Executives on the Enterprise Sales team, and help them develop skills to sell into larger enterprise accounts.  MindTickle offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be empowered to sell sales enablement, learning, and marketing solutions and be set up for success. Our goal is to build an organization of smart, ambitious Enterprise Account Executives, committed to our mission and focus on winning, but able to balance this with a respectful, healthy environment and lifestyle.  Responsibilities: Penetrate targeted accounts within your named account territory; contact and qualify new buyers, uncover and analyze needs, develop solution/value proposition, negotiate terms, and close business Managing complex sales-cycles which include our portfolio of products and presenting C-level executives the value of our enterprise suite of Sales Enablement cloud products Manage and forecast sales activity in salesforce.com, while creating satisfied customers Generate new business in existing accounts, across corporate families Facilitate communications with other team members and partners such as Salesforce to solve unique customer business challenges Conduct online demos of our products via web technologies and web-based presentations Maintain professional and ethical conduct with clients and staff Compliance with company standards, policies, and mission statement Maintain confidentiality where appropriate as well a high degree of ethics  Qualifications: 7+ years of quota carrying software or technology sales and account management experience. Proficiency in pipeline management and accurate forecasting Track record of over-achieving quota in past positions. Achievement of President's club is certainly a plus. Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment Excellent business and relationship development skills Exceptional ability to overcome objections and close business Dynamic, positive, and enthusiastic personality Excellent verbal/phone and written/electronic communication skills Exceptional time management and organization skills Previous sales methodology training in consultative / solution selling Sandler/Challenger or similar structured sales process Strong technology / social networking skills – prior knowledge/use of Cloud-based solutions and Salesforce Solution-oriented, proactive and ethical Bachelors degree required

description: Role description The Senior Business Development Executive plays a key role in supporting business development of the company. Part of the Senior Business Development Executive’s main task is to support Chief Commercial Officer with business development activities in the healthcare domain, including being the bid manager, as well as supporting various marketing activities. The Senior Business Development Executive will work under the supervision of the Business Development Team Leader.  Responsibilities: Oversee tender platforms and identify potential opportunities for participation. Actively prospect into new accounts by identifying key stakeholders for Business Development Managers to engage and follow-up. Assist business development effort in a variety of client-facing events, including meetings, trade shows, industry conferences, etc. To manage the bid process from end to end, handling commercial proposal development, ensuring the timeline and documentation and seeing through the project completion. Develop knowledge of the customer’s buying pattern and cycle, support in the preparation of the required documentation for the tender in collaboration with management and colleagues, including supporting in the evaluation and pricing process to win new business opportunities. Engage with other internal sales professionals (direct and overlay), solutions experts, engineering to develop suitable solution based on customer requirement and operational pain points. Help to prepare the presentation of tailored solutions with technical team to improve operational efficiency in healthcare institutions, showcasing technical and financial advantages. Works with our company marketing resources to act upon qualified leads, and to produce relevant, targeted materials to facilitate the sales processes. Main focus on Local & ASEAN markets' development.   Requirements:  Bachelor's in Business or Engineering Training in Process Improvement Discipline would be advantageous. Must have at least 3 years of experience in supporting new account development. Preferably have experience working for robotics and automation system integrator (SI) in the healthcare sector. Able to manage relationships and follow up with key stakeholders in healthcare institutions, and relevant government agencies. Entrepreneurial mindset to be able to empathize with the customer’s business, recognize sales opportunities via possessing the understanding of the healthcare institutions’ process/workflow, and propose ways to enhance operational and staff efficiency. Must use the various tools and resources available to assist in the business prospecting and sales processes.  Project management experience and capabilities to organize the necessary and collaborative efforts, support the Business Development Team Leader and CCO, to pursue projects and advance the sales activities including technical presentations and relevant customer/site visit. Proficient in standard business software programs, such as Microsoft Office. Understanding the landscape of healthcare institutions, SIs, Vendors and Supplier relationships in robotics and automation.

description: This is Adyen  Adyen is the payments platform of choice for the world's top companies, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile, and in-store channels. Our team members are motivated individuals that help each other do remarkable things every day. We face challenging situations and solve them as a team. And together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that transform the way the world pays.  Sales Manager, Enterprise  Adyen is looking for a highly motivated colleague to build our business in APAC. The focus of this role will be to facilitate our expansion in the market. The ideal candidate is a born networker who thrives in a fast-paced, diverse and entrepreneurial environment.  What You'll Do Generate new business, negotiate deals and close contracts for Adyen, specifically in the Retail sector Identify and approach prospective Enterprise customers Sell Adyen Payment Solutions to large global corporations Build long-term relationships with your merchants Collaborate across different functions to seal the deal Who You Are You're a proven deal closer and strong communicator You've prior experience in a Sales hunter role selling complex Enterprise software, technical infrastructure or financial service within the Retail industry You've a relevant business network in South-East Asia, ideally in Retail, Gaming, Streaming or Insurance You're informal yet professional You possess the ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively in a fast-paced work environment Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion commitments  Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to solve them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.  Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Even if you don't meet 100% of the criteria, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application.

description: Xen Capital is a next generation distributor for alternative investments and private market opportunities. Not expected to source or develop new relationships, but expected to support the business development team with new cross-selling opportunities. • Proactively updating existing client accounts on their current investments, including attending to all client inquiries, transactional and operational requests regarding their existing investments. • Assist with the onboarding of new clients and coordinating with internal departments. • Co-coverage of client accounts with business development director • Ensure good housekeeping in terms of documentation, exceptions and compliance requirements, including updating and periodic review of client AML/KYC. • Back-up and assist other team members while on leave  Qualifications & requirements: Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Banking/Finance To succeed in this role, you will require the following demonstrable skills and attributes: • Possess general investment knowledge. Pass CMFAS modules 1, 3, 5, 6, 8 & 8A. • People oriented with good verbal and written communication skills • Strong working knowledge of a second language a plus • Disciplined, fast learner and worker with an ability to multi-task • Strong attention to detail • Willing to learn and build on current analytical and problem solving skills • Highly motivated, team player and ability to interact effectively with different business units

Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world’s leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing startups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation.  At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in Singapore. Learn more about a career opportunity as an Enterprise Account Manager in the Singapore Team at AWS.  As an Enterprise Account Manager, you will be responsible for driving customer digital transformation through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, and developers. You will be a brand custodian working to support our customers, partners and end-users as they work with AWS, and utilise our cloud technology to innovate and improve their business outcomes.  About This Role  In this role, you will ‘Learn and Be Curious’ (see Amazon Leadership Principles) about the entire portfolio of AWS products and services across strategic accounts in the Singapore Market. As a trusted advisor, you will listen to our customers and help solve complex business transformation and growth challenges so they can focus on delivering optimal business results. Your role will include customer engagement and creating a pipeline of strategic accounts while managing existing customers. As builders, we are here to build long-term relationships with our customers. With a strong ‘Bias for Action’, you will improve user experiences while engaging with external and internal stakeholders demonstrating ‘’Customer Obsession’. Want to know more about what it’s like to be part of our ASEAN Team at AWS? Hear from our builders: ASEAN Builders  #AWSSINGAPORE   Basic Qualifications 10+ Years of experience in technology field sales, or business development 10+ years of experience with identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing projects with Enterprise accounts Demonstrated experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners. Preferred Qualifications Experience in selling cloud solutions Cross functional engagement experience (Architect, Sales Engineer, Professional Services, Partner or ISV) Strong presentation and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences in business proficient English Extensive experience with Singapore Enterprise accounts Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore Job ID: A1595139

description: Business Development Manager – TravelAds  Expedia Media Solutions is dedicated to building creative media partnerships for travel advertisers enabling them to use Expedia Group network of leading travel brands and global sites. We have revolutionized the way brands reach and connect with online travel consumers, emerging as a leader in online advertising sales among travel and e-commerce brands. With a growing product portfolio offering a multitude of advertising and sponsorship opportunities, our Media Solutions team at Expedia Group has built a viable marketing platform for advertising partners to reach the 78 million worldwide monthly unique visitors that visit Expedia Group sites.  Currently, we are looking for an experienced Business Development Manager to join our team in Singapore.  Are you someone who is passionate about driving a fast-growing, travel media business? Do you love to harness the power of e-commerce to help partners efficiently meet their goals and optimize their results?  We are looking for a Business Development Manager in the TravelAds business. You will have revenue and management responsibility for a portfolio of existing online advertiser accounts as well as prospecting new accounts. You will develop market specific strategies to reach a quarterly revenue target while producing industry leading results for your partners. You will uncover and implement revenue growth initiatives that are consistent with Media Solutions strategy and deliver measurable value to the accounts you lead.  What You’ll Do Utilize analytics skills to understand performance data and trends to then make forward thinking suggestions and uncover high return on investment opportunities and present them to clients Use good presentation skills and practices to deliver an effective message adapted to the audience Work coherently and collaboratively with different internal and external stakeholders Lead the launch of campaigns, monitor on-going day-to-day performance of advertising partnerships, anticipate hurdles and work creatively to resolve them Work directly with hotel level decision makers Educate our partners to use our platforms independently and smartly by utilizing the power of Expedia and Media Solutions unique data insights Execute effectively based on KPI metrics Who You Are Bachelor's in any related field with 3-5 years of sales experience, preferably in Media Sales or the travel industry or Equivalent related professional experience Demonstrate ability to meet revenue targets and effectively present proposals & provide influence at management level Clear understanding of the hotel industry Experience in providing consultative sales support and building long lasting client relationships Travel when required About Expedia Group  Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, Egencia®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.  © 2021 Expedia, Inc. All rights reserved. Trademarks and logos are the property of their respective owners. CST: 2029030-50  Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

description: We’re iSabel, a tech-led health care startup that helps organizations build holistic and sustainable cultures of workplace wellbeing. iSabel is actually an acronym for it’s Such a beautiful life... we really believe that and we want every human to truly feel that way.   About the role As the Enterprise Sales Manager / Senior Manager at iSabel, you will put your consultative hunter instincts to use, and unleash your drive to build out our business in key markets, including Singapore and India. This is an exciting opportunity to join us at the start of our journey, make an impact and go to market with a fresh, innovative solution.   In this full cycle sales role, you’re equal parts thinker and doer. You’ll work with the CEO to codify the sales process for large and SMB accounts - including lead generation and qualification, pitching and negotiating, and work collaboratively with the Head of Customer Success to onboard your new clients.  This role would be great opportunity for a high performing executive who consistently meets their sales KPIs and is looking to help shape the sales function of a startup. This is currently a hands-on individual contributor role with the potential to lead a sales team as we grow and expand.  Responsibilities Manage the sales cycle - from lead generation, following up on leads and closing new accounts. Especially during the startup phase, you will be in the trenches with the leadership team to build relationships with prospects and work closely with the Customer Success team to ensure ongoing client satisfaction on key accounts Build and maintain strong relationships with key customer decision makers and stakeholders Cultivate a successful demonstration of our solution, trial and conversion of customers  Manage a portfolio of large enterprise accounts where the primary focus is on adoption, customer delight, and ultimately renewal/expansion Develop the sales CRM and systems required to increase the output of our sales efforts quarter over quarter   Required skills & experiences At least 4 years of B2B sales experience (at least 5 years for the senior manager role) Deep understanding of the entire funnel of the sales cycle and practical experience in each of the stages Experience in building sales and account management processes from scratch Know how to sell on business value rather than a feature list Ability to create connections and engage confidently with a variety of audiences, including decision makers, in large enterprise and SMB companies Strong oral and written communication skills, and a polished presenter Super motivated, gritty, tenacious, confident, a team player and is results-driven  Has a “roll up your sleeves” action-oriented approach An entrepreneurial spirit, with the ability to thrive and develop relationships in fast-paced, collaborative, and ambiguous environments Past experience in a tech-led startup, HealthTech, InsurTech company or is familiar with the HR or People function is a plus Experience in working with CRM tools  How to apply If you’re looking for an opportunity to be a part of an exciting and high impact company, we'd like to hear from you! Please apply with a detailed CV, including achievements.

Internet of Things (IoT) will drive a fundamental shift for our customers from the Information Age to the new Digital Age. As a company HCL is looking to play a major role in supporting our customers in creating business values by providing prominent custom IoT solutions.  The IoT WoRKS team leads the IoT Business end to end for HCL Technologies including overall product direction, new business models, ecosystem and pioneer customer engagements in partnership with Engineering and Application Services. We have a unique opportunity in the area of IoT platform and services where HCL Technologies can lead business model transformations for customers.   As a Sales Director IoT Works, you will play an instrumental role in shaping and delivering our vision.    Core Job Responsibilities:  In-depth understanding of smart cities, and experience selling to government entities An understanding of IoT concepts, technology providers, IoT Platforms and data science as it relates to smart cities in governments.  Set strategic direction for IoT solution offerings to these industries Work with sales teams to create demand generation strategies related to solution offerings Provide thought leadership related to Smart Cities, Government selling Be responsible for the revenue plan for this industry derived from relevant solution offerings  Qualifications and Skills:  Leadership skills in cross-functional teams Bachelor’s degree with preference to master’s degree Proven track record in successfully working within or consulting Executive presence and polished communication skills Strategic mindset with an ability to create solutions that have a unique and quantifiable value proposition Ability to work across sales teams, and motivate a sales force to focus on IoT solutions Management consulting experience a plus General knowledge of IoT across devices, sensors, data science and different platform offerings Exposure to Smart Cities, and in particular video and sound surveillance   At HCL, we don’t just accept the differences—we support it and celebrate it. We are committed to cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and connectedness. We are able to grow and learn better together with a diverse team of employees. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone’s place

jobTitle: Country Sales Manager - Anywhere In APAC
description: Country Sales Manager - anywhere in APAC  X0PA AI is an Artificial Intelligence Software as a Service (SaaS) start-up that aims to digitally transform the hiring and selection process and make it a science. We aim to save companies significant time and cost in hiring while achieving the highest level of objectivity, ultimately enhancing retention, loyalty and person to job and organization fit. Through our AI and Machine Learning capabilities, we are able to source, score and rank talent to identify the best talent for each organisation. X0PA AI has recently launched X0PA ROOM, an AI enabled video interview platform.  Brief Overview Of The Role  As a Country Sales Manager, you will be responsible for contributing to the company’s global sales objectives. You will take charge of the sales of X0PA’s solutions in the region, managing all aspects of the customer lifecycle. You will be responsible for targeting new organisations to increase the awareness and usage adoption of X0PA’s solutions in the region. As a Country Sales Manager, you should be able to leverage on your thorough knowledge of sales processes to provide innovative ideas for business growth.  You will be reporting directly to the Global Head of Strategic Sales of the business and be responsible for the P&L of the business in the region.  This is a fantastic opportunity to work hands on with a high performing team in an AI based, innovative, fast-moving, funded start-up.  We are looking for an independent self-starter with the right attitude, drive & curiosity. The position starts as an individual contributor but eventually grows into a team lead role as the business grows. If you are highly driven, looking to grow with a high performing start-up environment, WE WANT YOU!  Key Responsibilities Generate sales leads with new clients Drive product subscriptions and sales Manage digital marketing and business development of X0PA’s solutions Conduct product demonstrations Manage end to end sales processes, including negotiating and closing clients Take ownership of creating your sales plan and achieving your sales targets Explore ways to increase customer engagement of X0PA’s solutions Develop and implement effective sales strategies Monitor and analyse performance metrics and suggest improvements Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual sales forecasts 10-15 years of sales experience, with a proven sales track record in driving subscriptions Bachelors in Engineering or Business Management Experience in B2B sales within a SaaS organization Experience in developing and driving achievement of sales performance metrics Experience in digital sales and marketing Knowledge of HR Tech Solutions will be an added advantage but not necessary Great interpersonal skills to liaise with key stakeholders including VP/C level executives Excellent negotiation and communication skills Analytical and data-driven problem solver Highly self-motivated with a strong ambition to excel and achieve results Strong business acumen of the software industry What we offer?  We are a bunch of fun loving, self-motivated professionals. We offer an inclusive, diverse and motivated work environment with huge learning opportunities.

description: WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?  As our Strategic Account Manager, you will lead a cross-functional team tasked with growing the Nike brand with one of our top global accounts within Nike’s Southeast Asia and India (SEA&I) territory  WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON? Own the end-to-end connection to the strategic partner, establishing and maintaining timely, consistent and positive relationships with key account personnel at all levels of the business Achieve sales goals on a seasonal and annual basis for a business spanning multiple countries Lead the development and implementation of seasonal, annual, and long-term plans by closely collaborating with partners and by applying an enterprising mindset Drive internal alignment and gather company support by engaging with cross-functional teams within the SEA&I territory, the Asia Pacific and Latin America (APLA) geography and Nike's World headquarters. Ensure the Nike brand is well presented in partner environments, leveraging consumer insights to create elevated consumer experiences that bring together the right product and the right stories at the right time. Ensure appropriate seasonal product flow to optimize account opportunities Work with account buyers and planners to ensure market and customer capacity is met and that account inventory positions are properly managed based on seasonal targets and sell-through objectives Be part of the SEA&I Marketplace Leadership team and contribute to the creation and execution of territory-wide strategies WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH?  As you will be driving the current and future business with one of our strategic partners, you will work with a variety of internal and external partners. Internally, the cross-functional team you will bring together will involve planning, merchandising, marketing, finance, operations and several other functions. You will directly report to the territory marketplace leader and will frequently interact with regional partner leadership. WHAT YOU BRING TO NIKE Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing or a related field 5 to 7 years of overall industry business experience in sales, retail management, marketing, merchandising, sales operations and/or product Experience in sales with large regional or global accounts strongly preferred Knowledge of the athletic footwear and apparel market and trends in the overall sportswear / fashion industries desired Strong understanding of retail business operations and high degree of retail math fluency, including sales programs, policies, and procedures Exceptional communication skills in English, including ability to elicit information, actively listen, dialogue freely, verbalize ideas effectively, negotiate tense situations successfully and manage and resolve conflict Ability to prepare, plan and deliver clear and persuasive presentations Proven success working in a dynamic fast changing environment with elements of ambiguity High proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel and PowerPoint) tools and Sales/Account Management systems Ability to travel post-pandemic Passion for sport and a desire to help fulfill Nike’s vision of bringing inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world (* if you have a body, you are an athlete) Note to Candidates: Local/Domestic Hire Only.

description: About the job  Circulor is a rapidly growing, technology business that empowers its customers to see into their supply chains to prevent exploitation of people and minimise environmental damage. You can learn more about the business at www.circulor.com  Circulor is looking for bi-lingual (Mandarin and English) Client Partners based in Singapore.  This is a fantastic opportunity to join a growing team that is one of the leaders in an exciting sector.  We are seeking dynamic, commercially focussed individuals who enjoy working in a fast-paced and collaborative environment with a multi-national and international client base.  The Client Partner role sits within our Sales team is responsible for leading our sales activities with prospects, clients, and their supply chain. They are a dynamic, commercially focussed individual and enjoy working in a fast-paced and collaborative environment with a multi-national and international client base.  The role requires a track record in selling software or consulting services to C-level clients in procurement, supply chain, and sustainability functions of large organisations. They should be able to generate and close opportunities independently and where required, work effectively with other colleagues in the team with responsibility for project delivery on more complex customer opportunities.  Additionally, this role helps Circulor to lead the market through the innovation and development of our products and services by providing industry and customer insights and by contributing to compelling thought leadership.   Responsibilities  Build an effective pipeline of sales opportunities and convert them into new business Identify opportunities to deliver increased revenue growth from both existing and new customers and prospects Manage and lead sales activities and negotiations using a range of selling and influencing skills to win new business that will make a positive financial impact on the business Prepare and deliver proposals, bids, and presentations to prospects and customers Build effective and trusting relationships across client organisations that promotes and enhances Circulor’s capabilities, track record, and brand recognition Provide support to colleagues in the account development team including management of proposals for complex customer expansion Apply best practice and sales methodologies and demonstrate core skills in objection handling with customers, overcoming difficult challenges to enable a positive outcome   Requirements  Languages: Fluent spoken and written Mandarin and English (mandatory)  5+ years of sales and/or consulting experience Prior experience selling SaaS IT solutions/consultancy services to supply chain, procurement, and sustainability C-level prospects and clients Strong understanding of industrial supply chains and/or sustainability Experience of working with internal and customer implementations and project delivery teams and building effective and trusting relationships across client organisations Strong interpersonal skills Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to create & deliver clear, engaging, accurate & concise presentations, proposals, and value propositions Willingness to travel internationally Adept in the use of social media tools such as LinkedIn, office productivity tools including PowerPoint, Word, etc., and in an accurate and timely manner, ensure that sales forecasting and management tools are kept up to date Graduates from any degree discipline. Numerical or analytical degree subject preferable. Location: Singapore   Life at Circulor  We are looking for driven and kind people to join our talented team to help deliver something genuinely transformative.  We pride ourselves on: A friendly, non-hierarchical, and supportive working environment No barriers to career progression Good salary A diverse, international, and gender-balanced team  Doing business responsibly is now a mainstream issue. The team at Circulor believes that systemic change is possible in how we all use and re-use natural resources efficiently and that good business should not exploit people or planet.  Within mapped supply chains we prove responsible sourcing, demonstrate sustainable production, and underpin effective recycling and reverse logistics.  Our mission is to make the world’s most complex supply chains more transparent and help prevent the exploitation of people and our planet
jobFunction: Supply Chain, Information Technology, and Sales

jobTitle: Asia Business Development Director – Digital Platform

This agile and rapidly growing firm, which is part of a large well-funded global group, with a solid digital platform offering to blue-chip organisations. description: ConnectedHealth’s flagship product SugoSure delivers remote monitoring and assists care for patients with Type 2 Diabetes. Patients receive guidance and feedback through the app and are linked to their doctor and health coach through the system. Health coaching is provided by ConnectedHealth.  SugoSure has a unique business model where digital health services are delivered in collaboration with go-to-market partners: individual doctors, private healthcare groups, insurance companies and pharmaceutical companies.  Developing and building on these relationships will be key to the successful commercialisation of SugoSure, together with effective direct-to-patient social media-driven marketing to generate patient pull.  As we prepare for the commercial launch of SugoSure, ConnectedHealth seeks to recruit a motivated, well organised and experienced Marketing and Business Development Manager with an interest in technology-based chronic disease management, to drive the commercialisation of this exciting new approach to the delivery of care.  The successful candidate will have relevant sales and marketing experience in the healthcare industry. An interest in and ability to communicate SugoSure’s transformational approach to care delivery is a prerequisite, as is the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and innovative start-up business environment.  Responsibilities  Manage all aspects of SugoSure’s Marketing & Business Development leading to a successful commercial launch in Singapore with steady growth thereafter.  Business Development  Understand physician needs, liaise with and persuade targeted physicians to trial then affiliate with ConnectedHealth to deliver SugoSure to eligible patients Utilise effective selling skills and cost-benefit analysis to target physicians. Clearly communicate relevant product information and present product demos Nurture and deepen relationships with physician leads and their related organisations Monitor and analyse market, sales and usage data to target sales activity and track performance Keep accurate records and documentation for reporting and feedback Pursue continuous learning and professional development and stay up-to-date with the latest advances in diabetes care Lead sales meetings, conference calls, training sessions and symposia to build the SugoSure brand and recruit users Attend to enquiries from physicians and business partners received through the multiple channels which support SugoSure’s digital marketing strategy.  Marketing  Develop and implement brand strategies to ensure a consistent marketing message Design and write marketing materials/collaterals that project a consistent brand image while addressing different audiences and needs Develop an appropriate digital marketing strategy centred around a strong social media presence with follow-through CRM-driven conversion into product subscriptions. Organise periodic marketing events (e.g. booths at CME talks, patient evenings etc) Work with the clinical team and product management to ensure that at all times the clinical positioning and benefits of SugoSure are accurately described. Interact with agencies and external content writers to build a strong presence for SugoSure in social media and communications in general. Oversee the development and use of ConnectedHealth’s CRM system.  Requirements  Bachelors degree in a relevant field preferred Good understanding of both healthcare services and technology Relevant work experience in pharmaceutical or medical devices sales and marketing An understanding of chronic diseases is preferred especially diabetes Excellent communication, negotiation and sales skills Strong organisational and time management skills Highly motivated and driven by buy-in to ConnectedHealth’s vision of becoming the dominant platform for chronic disease management in Asia and beyond. Experience in planning & executing successful product launches, including digital marketing Familiar with Microsoft 365 applications such as Teams, Sharepoint, Outlook. Knowledge and use of social media platforms such as Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter Ideally, prior experience with Hubspot - SugoSure’s CRM system A good team player with the ability to work with the clinical, technology and commercial teams.  This is a full-time position. Work will be based at ConnectedHealth’s office at One North with increasing physician and partner visits (or calls) as the business builds. The role may be partially work-from-home as agreed.  You will only be notified if shortlisted.

description: Purpose Of Job  In close collaboration with the Channel Manager, manage and oversee the business performance of assigned segment, with responsibility for multiple functions, including budget preparation and control, contract accounting and negotiation, and business resource allocation with key aims to increase sales volume, profits, market share and contract fulfillment to achieve or exceed budget. Develop and implement sales strategies to achieve sales objectives by identifying vertical growth opportunities to increase the throughput of each (key) account; provide direction and targets to the team to grow sales. Perform a pivotal role in successful management of the customer relationship.  Major Roles & Responsibilities Develop strategic sales and marketing initiatives to meet allocated targets across the segment, and to hold internal meetings at sufficient frequency to allow analysis of the sales activities. Maintain a number of key sounding boards to give confidence to sales plans and strategies. Collect market intelligence on the needs of customers, and the strategy and tactics of its competitors; provide analysis and interpretation of this intelligence and formulate retaliatory strategy and tactics; target key opportunities and tailor value propositions to establish differentiating plus sustainable advantage. Oversee the supervision of personnel, including work allocation, training, and problem resolution; evaluate performance and make recommendations for personnel action; motivate team members to achieve peak productivity and performance. Consult with/advise Operation team on the business performance of their key accounts. Identify changes necessary to correct deficiencies in performance and/or opportunities for improvement of sales performance. Prepare forecasts against sales within the channel on a periodic basis and to monitor and manage changes to the forecast to ensure that the pipeline of activity is always sufficient to meet the allocated target(s). Keep management informed of sales activities and segment performance by submitting timely and accurate activity, forecasting and results reports on a regular basis. Develop solid and long-term influential relationships with dealers and key decision makers at all levels in the assigned customer base. Develop or assist with the development and implementation of policies and procedures consistent with that of the department and/or organization to ensure efficient and effective operation of the team. Develop strategic business plan with assigned accounts to deliver profitability, volume and desire Market share Manage and control given LME effectively to deliver\exceed results\performance Other Information Required to spend a significant amount of time in the field both with individual key accounts and co-traveling with sales personnel. Education/Qualifications Degree in Business Administration/Studies, Commerce or Management Experience At least 5 - 8 years of diverse experience in all aspects of sales and sales management, including distribution channel management, key account development, business planning and analysis, and brand building. Demonstrated success in managing high-level commercial relationships. Job Related Knowledge/ Specific Skills Clear understanding of the business to be able to focus on core issues and develop sales strategies. Knowledge and understanding of the industry, competitor movements, customers’ value chain and business practices to exploit all available business opportunities. Skill in examining and reengineering operations and procedures, formulating policy, and impacts, and/or projections. Excellent communicator who can handle difficult business situations well, and represent the sales organization both inside and outside the organization in a professional and ethical manner. Ability to demonstrate energy, sense of urgency, focus and follow through that deliver high quality results.

description: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.  This role is part of TikTok’s Small and Medium Team (SMB) for APAC. The SMB team works with advertisers across the region, helping them onboard and find success on TikTok. Being part of the team would mean being directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients drive business results through consultation. The team is made of dynamic, savvy, engaged individuals who are passionate about the region and thrive in a fast-paced environment.  Responsibilities - Lead the SMB Training & Development team across the region to design and expand enablement programmes based on the needs of the team, including onboarding and upskilling the Sales team - Partner closely with global SMB Training team to build and drive global strategy into the region - Collaborate with SMB Sales, Support and Vendor teams to adapt training programs to the needs of the business, including onboarding and upskilling on product & processes. - Partner with the SMB regional head and country manager to define training strategy for the region with clearly defined plans - Build a strong team of training specialists to drive impact into the SMB team through coaching and development - Define processes to ensure training evaluations are conducted and actions are made to ensure all training provided is impactful - React immediately to address any enablement gaps identified in training programs to ensure learners take away key learning objectives - Build strong alliances with key stakeholders of the Sales team including Product and Marketing teams to ensure any training required aligns with the enablement strategy and methodology, whilst owning the entire training calendar for the SMB team - Stay connected on current learning/teaching trends and adopt innovative approaches to drive impactful learning for the sales team to result in high performance.  Qualifications - Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Training and Development, or a related field required; 8 years of experience with at least 2 years in HR, Training or Related Field - Experience working in multiple territories in APAC/Global to drive enablement - Experience managing projects and programs (sales development/strategy, training, communications, marketing, account management) at the market level and in partnership with cross-functional teams - Strong interpersonal and presentation skills; experience working with a multi-cultural organisation - Experience in working in large MNCs supporting sales business - Experience and knowledge of the digital marketing landscape - Ability to link training to performance and quality using measurable - Experience designing and implementing effective training and development though adopting of multiple learning approaches, eg. eLearning, F2F/Virtual classroom and webinars, video presentations, and workbook based practice - Excellent communication skills and fluency in English  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience.

GEP is a diverse, creative team of people passionate about procurement. We invest ourselves entirely in our client’s success, creating strong collaborative relationships that deliver extraordinary value year after year. Our clients include market global leaders with far-flung international operations, Fortune 500 and Global 2000 enterprises, leading government and public institutions.   We deliver practical, effective services and software that enable procurement leaders to maximise their impact on business operations, strategy and financial performance. That’s just some of the things that we do in our quest to build a beautiful company, enjoy the journey and make a difference. GEP is a place where individuality is prized, and talent respected. We’re focused on what is real and effective. GEP is where good ideas and great people are recognized, results matter, and ability and hard work drive achievements. We’re a learning organization, actively looking for people to help shape, grow and continually improve us.  Are you one of us?  GEP is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, national origin, religion, sex, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We are committed to hiring and valuing a global diverse work team.   For more information please visit us on GEP.com or check us out on LinkedIn.com.  The Services- Business Development team is responsible for revenue growth primarily through driving new sales (i.e. new logos). This is a quota carrying, solution selling position. Identify & create strong revenue generating opportunities and lead service line sales through strategy & execution. Lead the development of sales leads to a win through the development of sales strategies, solution proposal and deal closing for large, complex opportunities. Utilize GEP’s unique value proposition & industry experience to shape opportunities by leveraging perspectives and competitive intelligence on prospect end to win new logos. Regularly monitor sales trends, market dynamics and then incorporate into existing sales strategy and plan. Exemplify GEP’s global leadership within the Procurement space i conferences/events & meetings, by presenting thought leadership and networking with key individuals. Meet revenue targets as an individual contributor through all the required support from Sales Enablement teams (i.e. Marketing, Operations, Inside Sales & Solution Design/Presales).  Main Skill Sets:  Min 7+ years of demonstrated successful career record in selling Consulting Services in Supply Chain, Procurement, Sourcing, and Business Process Outsourcing (BPO). Proven track record in influencing Fortune 500 Executives by creating compelling business cases. Consultative, solutions focused mindset. Experience working within a large, heavily matrixed company environment. Strong leadership skills in a client-facing environment Excellent communication and client management skills Local language proficiency will be a plus for the candidate Strong teamwork, problem solving, organization and process improvement skills Bachelor’s Degree required, Masters in business or operations preferred Able to travel ~30-40% of the time if required

description: KnowBe4, Inc. is the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day. Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4’s platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day.  We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years. description: Pexip is looking for a Channel Sales Manager based in Singapore, to help us build on our success in the Asia region.  The ideal candidate will report to the Regional Director Asia. He/ She should be a highly energetic, customer-focused self-starter who is interested in developing and growing the Asia market (ASEAN, Korea, Taiwan and India) through partners. As a Channel Sales Manager, you are confident and thoughtful. This is a full sales cycle position, that starts at pipeline development, and continues through closing the deal. The right candidate has a proven track record of consultative selling of collaboration services or software technology to senior executives through existing partners.  Some of the responsibilities for the position include:  Lead generation and pipeline creation in the form of web lead follow up, forging channel relationships, trade shows, and cold calling. Develop existing channel partners through training session. Identify, recruit, and onboard new channel partners to support your sales effort in Asia. Promote Pexip within our strategic alliance partners such as Microsoft and Google. Deliver customer presentations and orientation sessions. Build strategic commercial and development plans with partners focused on commercial and collaborative outcomes. Forge and grow close relationships between partner sales/technical/marketing staff with Pexip counterparts.  Required qualifications:  Have a minimum of 5 years’ experience selling software technology solutions to senior leaders in small to medium businesses. You should be experienced in full cycle subscription selling. 3+ years’ experience managing channel partners and partner programs in Asia. Proven ability to work across functions including sales, marketing, engineering, support, and operations. Demonstrate a career pattern of being able to quickly understand different technologies and an ability to advise complex organizations on effective implementation and utilization. Be experienced and knowledgeable in selling, managing and driving business through partner networks. Display strong verbal and written communication skills. You should be very comfortable presenting to groups of cross-functional executives. This position will regularly interact with CxOs and other senior leadership. Be experienced in social selling including leveraging LinkedIn and other networks to reach critical contacts in the accounts you are focused on. Experience working collaboratively with multiple cross-functional teams. Demonstrate confidence and an ability to overcome obstacles in closing new business. Technology consulting experience with a global business strategy or technology consulting firm is a plus. Must be fluent in English and Chinese or Korean languages.  Due to Covid19 restrictions, we will only consider applicants who are currently based in Singapore.  Pexip enables enterprises and organizations of any size to deploy and use video-based communication and collaboration. The Company’s portfolio of products ranges from self-hosted software to cloud service video solutions. Pexip provides seamless collaboration between previously incompatible video and audio technologies such as professional video conferencing systems, Skype for Business, Microsoft Teams, Google Hangouts Meet, and WebRTC. Pexip’s software-based meeting platform can also be used as a foundation for service provider offerings. Pexip has HQ in Oslo, Norway, main offices in London, UK, New York and Herndon, US, Sydney, Australia, Tokyo, Japan and Singapore, as well as sales offices across the globe.
industries: Information Technology and Services

You will have an in-depth appreciation of the L&D & HR space and an ability connect at this level and understand their challenges in order to deliver a solution that meets their needs. You will leverage off your own network to create new leads and prospecting is something you excel at. You will have; 7+ years in solution selling subscription software or SaaS products to enterprise customers. Compelling consultative communicator (in person, on phone, in writing) Ability to tell the story of brand, product & content in an irresistible manner Proven ability to navigate complex customer organizations, and align strategic solutions to multiple stakeholders within a target customer Empathy with potential customers Planning, organisation, time management Negotiation skills Understanding Learning & Development market and practices Tenacity and persistence  Pay Benefits Competitive market-based salaries, bonus, and commission plans Salary paid monthly, within 7 days of the end of the salary period Leave Benefits 20 Days Paid Annual Leave 11 Paid Public Holidays Sick Days Maternity Leave Childcare Leave Work-Related Injury Leave  Other Benefits Access to Go1’s exclusive learning platform Wellness benefits EAP

description: We are seeking a Pre-Sales Specialist to work in our Singapore office. The Pre-Sales Specialist works closely with the Business Development team members on new sales opportunities for our Order and Portfolio Management Software, AlphaDesk. You will provide in-person and/or remote software demonstrations to prospective clients, typically Hedge Funds and other Asset Managers. Additionally, you will be responsible for the pre-sales discovery process which involves capturing technical requirements, documenting existing workflows, solving complex workflow issues, and providing guidance on new/improved workflows that can be achieved by using our technology.  Role Responsibilities Provide software demonstrations of our Order and Portfolio Management System, AlphaDesk, to various stakeholders (Portfolio Managers, Traders, Operations staff, CFO, etc.). Provide recommendations on how to improve the sales and demonstration process Complete pre-sales discovery process capturing detailed technical and workflow requirements, ensuring that the work required falls within the budget and scope of the implementation Act as a technical resource to the sales team, and in some cases to the implementation teams Identify any client requirements not met by the software, and recommend to management what steps are necessary to address any gaps and whether to proceed with the sale Develop knowledge of various Refinitiv products to improve sales success. Interface with the Product Management team providing feedback for any complex workflow issues discovered in the sales process that may require development Interface with the Implementation team providing guidance on software implementations ensuring smooth delivery Build strong relationships and become a trusted point of contact for our clients Qualifications And Experience Required Strong understanding of buy side workflows for portfolio management, trading/settlement, reconciliation, accounting, and reporting. Previous experience providing software demonstrations 1-3 years experience in the financial services industry, preferably at a Software Vendor or Hedge Fund Excellent presentation skills (verbal & written) Detail oriented and creative problem solver Working knowledge of Order and Portfolio Management Systems SQL knowledge Ability to handle and priorities multiple tasks and work independently Undergraduate degree in related field People are at the heart of what we do and drive the success of our business. Our culture of connecting, creating opportunity and delivering excellence shape how we think, how we do things and how we help our people fulfil their potential.  At LSEG we embrace diversity and actively seek to attract individuals with unique backgrounds and perspectives. We break down barriers and encourage collaboration, enabling innovation and rapid development of solutions that make a difference. Our workplace generates an enriching and rewarding experience for our people and customers alike. Our vision is to build an inclusive culture in which everyone feels driven to reach their potential.  We know that real personal growth cannot be achieved by simply climbing a career ladder – which is why we encourage and enable a wealth of avenues and interesting opportunities for everyone to broaden and deepen their skills and expertise.  LSEG are committed to supporting emotional, physical, financial and societal wellbeing. Our tailored benefits are a key part of this commitment and we offer colleagues a range of support from healthcare and retirement planning to paid volunteering days and consumer discounts.  We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If an accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please make your recruiter aware, we want to ensure you perform at your best.  As a global organisation spanning 70 countries and one rooted in a culture of growth, opportunity, diversity and innovation, LSEG is a place where everyone can grow, develop and fulfil your potential with purposeful careers.  Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information the London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (“We”) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject .
