description: READY TO BRING PASSION INTO YOUR CAREER?  Clarins Group is not only a fast-growing, leading Beauty Company, we’re also a committed, family-owned enterprise with a fiercely independent and pioneering spirit. As one of the top skin care companies worldwide, with a strong position in Europe and the Americas and growth accelerating in Asia, we’re looking for a Brand Manager based in Singapore.   THE ROLE:  The Brand Manager leads the products & services strategy within the SG Market towards the best relevancy and answer to the consumer needs. With a deep knowledge of SG consumers and profound understanding of the market, trends & competition, he/she is responsible to create the best product offering and marketing plan for the SG market. A balanced strategy between the Global/Regional Marketing plan and the Local Marketing needs, to guarantee both the coherence of the Brand and the relevancy of the marketing strategy in the SG market. Today is not about product anymore, but about customer intimacy, experience and storytelling. This position will have to work very closely with the SG Marketing Team to build a full 360° story around each product, range.  The Brand manager is the one to lead the 360°. He/She has the vision of the Brand Strategy for the market and will work closely with the rest of the team to brief, construct, and follow the execution and implementation of the 360°.  Some of the key mission & challenges are:  To grow own channels / standalone boutiques in Singapore Prioritize retail-tainment as branding staging and recruitment Drive 2nd purchase from new customers Recruitment of new prospects WHAT YOU'LL DO:  Identifies Customers’ Opportunities & Insights Constant contact with Consumers and Frontliners Manage consumers insights studies Performs digital listening analysis with Communications Manager to increase relevancy of the marketing strategy Performs competitor landscape analysis, builds market share, monitors market dynamism monitoring: identification of the opportunities, risks and gaps for Clarins Sharing of best practices across the subsidiary and Regional / Global Teams  Pricing & Distribution Strategies Defines the priorities for a healthy catalogue management Develop pricing strategy with Regional Team and Marketing Director Develop promotion strategy (tester, sampling, GWP)  Orchestrate 360° Marketing Product Launches Lead a 360° marketing approach aligned with business objectives Brief and tie in all the expert functions (Trade, CRM, E-commerce, Communication, Training) to drive the 360° Co-lead with the Communication Manager for the content development around the product strategy  Forecast Product Operations & Planning Forecasts management in close collaboration with Demand Planner to maximise sell-through/minimise excess Stock management and monitoring for the best optimization of resources Order forms management  Drive Top Lines Sales & Undertake Business Management Data capture and consumer recruitment objective definition Market share objective definition and validation with Marketing Director Net Invoicing by lines, driving monthly the Net Invoicing YTD/YTG by lines, readjusting depending of market trends to be able to deliver when there are opportunities, and to secure targets when slow down A&P Management: Optimized resources allocation, monthly risk management with Budget Holders  Others responsibilities may be given to the position of Brand Manager.   YOU HAVE:  Degree in Marketing or related field At least 8-10 years with solid product marketing experience in Cosmetic or FMCG companies, preferably with Skincare & Make-Up experience Strong business acumen and analytical skills Results and customers-oriented Passionate in digital marketing and possess knowledge of new media Proven track record in successfully driving sales and revenue growth Driven and ambitious individual with strong sense of ownership and accountability Good understanding of Omni-Channel business Strong communication/influencer, proactive initiative/follow-through, thoughtful leadership, and self-motivating with excellent stakeholder management achievements Driving high growth by in touch with very different parts of the company (Brand, Regional Team, Subsidiary departments), the person needs to be able to adapt messages & actions to influence for local market execution Highly operational and entrepreneurial, candidate should be tenacious and have a hands-on approach to business  WE HAVE:  Standout brands: Clarins, My Blend, Mugler and Azzaro Fragrances Distinctive, high-quality products and services A longstanding commitment to social, economic and ecological initiatives   Growth opportunities Learning & Development An attractive compensation and benefits package  If you have a curious mind and are always questioning how things can be done better, the ability to take risks and accept new challenges, join us!
industries: Cosmetics and Retail

description: About us:  Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.   In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn’s Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don’t take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  Objective of the role:  As Head of BD (Startup) you are responsible for the growth by boosting the lead generation of startups across APAC. You will have full ownership of the outreach strategy in your vertical to become the number one financial operating system for startups in the region. The core responsibilities will be to hire/train/manage a Business Development team, develop a robust lead strategy and build awareness of Aspire within the startup ecosystem (Vc’s/Accelerator/Angels/PE). As the Head of BD for the Startup vertical, you will be reporting and working closely with the Head of Sales. Your mission will be to make Aspire the #1 Financial OS for startups in APAC.  Your responsibilities: Develop Aspire Go-To-Market strategy for Startup across APAC and execute on these ambitious goals Grow and maintain relationships with the startup ecosystem, including VCs, accelerators, angels Hedge funds, etc.  Build, manage and train a business development team of overachievers focused on startups Ensure the team is building and maintaining qualified pipeline of opportunities to hit targeted growth Establish, build and nurture relationships with Startup founders and decision makers in key South East Asia markets Work closely with the Marketing team to develop relevant and distinct collateral articulating the solution and product to generate qualified marketing leads Track, measure, and report progress and performance to the head of sales  We would love to get to know you if you have the following:  7-10 years of experience spanning business development, sales, VC investor experience, or startup founder Successful track record of hitting ambitious targets and posses wide network of Startups across APAC Entrepreneur mindset who enjoys growing in both Startup and larger SaaS venture environments and eager to accelerate our growth in the region Experience in hunting B2B companies in South East Asia and startups in particular would be an advantage  Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can coach / mentor their sales team while establishing a healthy working culture based on the Aspire principle Exceptional communication and collaboration capabilities Ability to coach and guide teams on successful strategies to employ for success. High-energy, results-oriented, creative leadership approach.
industries: Financial Services

description: Job Responsibilities:  Digital Information Integration: Leads, participates and drives implementation of Digital Information Integration (DII) projects using Power BI tools for Asia Pacific Measurement Solutions Customer Care to improve processes & productivity. Works with business users to finalize the requirements and testing for DII projects. Works with developers to design & create the user interface form for DII projects. Provides on-going support and work on issues and future enhancements. Develops training materials and conduct training to AP business users. Provides timely updates to the management on the project schedule, progress and status. Supports Organization Goals through Continuous Improvement and Innovation.  Oracle Order to Cash: Performs testing for Oracle Sales Order Form enhancements with the business users, raise concerns if any and release to production. Executes list of Oracle Sales Order Form enhancements to improve productivity in Measurement Solution Fulfilment Process especially for Customer Care Teams. Reviews any new Oracle enhancement requests from business and log that as a requirement with strong business justification. Connects with all Asia Pacific Country Oracle Superusers regularly to discuss on the Oracle issues/enhancements and training needs. Provides support to Measurement Solution specific Oracle Sales Order Form issues across Asia Pacific and work closely with Asia Pacific IT team on the resolution, testing and releasing to production. Supports Oracle testing request from other global sites and perform collateral testing if needed. Works with Asia Pacific IT and ASG Team for resolution on recurring critical issues with high business impact. Works with Order Management and Shipping leaders to optimize processes to achieve business goals. Develops training materials and conduct training to AP business users.  Job Requirements: Degree in Engineering preferably in IT. Strong knowledge on Microsoft Power BI & Oracle R12. Hands-on experience in using Power BI for at least 2 or 3 years. Basic SQL knowledge. Communicates effectively, manages ambiguity, collaborates, and cultivates innovation. Excellent planning abilities and project management. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Very strong presentation and training skills. Fast Learner and able to work with minimal supervision.

description: Sales Executive Reports to: Sales Director                 Location: Singapore Salary: Competitive basic salary plus attractive commission structure.  Arkphire: Arkphire are a successful and fast-growing IT hardware and services company providing solutions to corporate and multinational companies across the globe. We have a very open culture where collaboration, inclusion and close working with the leadership team is encouraged. Our team are nurtured to take ownership and to constantly develop and progress their skills and careers.  Focus of the role: The role of Sales Executive is a key role in the APAC business. We are looking to continue to expand our customer base in the region through a focused sales strategy engaging our existing global customer base and onboarding new customers in APAC. The role will involve managing existing customer accounts as well as working to onboard new business in the region. In addition to day-to-day sales activity, you will be involved in the procurement process, negotiating with vendors, providing clear and accurate proposals to the customer in line with their requirements to ultimately secure the deal and follow through to completion ensuring smooth fulfilment and customer satisfaction. You will have access to superb sales and marketing collateral and be supported by sales-centric leadership.  Person Specification: Exposure to IT or related sector, working within a fast-moving entrepreneurial environment IT related sales experience ideally in the supply of hardware and fast moving products. Experience in positioning and selling to multinational and corporate businesses Experience selling to IT Managers, Directors and technology leaders. Robust market knowledge in relation to IT services and products with a focus around end user computing and Apple products. Takes ownership and responsibility of their work Track record of driving & securing new business Excellent account development skills Ability to deliver consistently against targets  Successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive basic salary and achievable OTE. Health cover, generous holiday entitlement Come and join a winning team.

description: The Director of Sales directs all markets including contracted, directed or online in both corporate and leisure segments. All sales activities should be managed to maximise revenue for the property. He/She is required to research and deliver strategic sales/business plans, monthly reports, annual targets, budgets, forecasts or other projects.  He/She has to analyse the competition, market trends, guest needs and performance in order to be pro-active and adapt to a changing market landscape. With the information, he/she is able to create new sales plans to improve efficiency of the current ones.  Responsibilities include discovering and pursuing new sales prospects, negotiating deals and maintaining customer satisfaction.  If you have excellent communication skills and feel comfortable reaching out to potential customers to demonstrate our services and products through email, phone & face to face meeting, we’d like to meet you.  Ultimately, you’ll help us meet and surpass business expectations and contribute to our company’s rapid and sustainable growth. Sells products by establishing contact and developing relationships with prospects; recommending solutions. Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance; researching and recommending new opportunities; recommending profit and service improvements. Identifies product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitors. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Skills And Qualifications  Presentation Skills, Client Relationships, Emphasizing Excellence, Energy Level, Negotiation, Prospecting Skills, Meeting Sales Goals, Creativity, Sales Planning, Independence, Motivation for Sales  He/She also needs to Use principles of revenue managementand work together with the revenue department. Internally, he/she handles the staffing, training and performance reviews for the Sales Department. Measures are also carried out to enhance the property’s image and high standards are set.

description: THE ROLE Seedly is looking for an experienced sales professional to manage and grow the provider relationships with some of the largest financial institutions in Singapore. As the Head of Commercial, you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of Digital Advisory and Insights within the financial services sector. Working directly with the Co-Founder, CEO of Seedly (Country Manager), you will lead the business development team in the country. Our ideal candidate is a great cultural fit: leader, team player, creative and resilient under pressure with drive and energy to move fast.  YOUR TASK Pitch, sell, negotiate and renegotiate commercial deals with FIs in Singapore by understanding their business needs and objectives Develop and execute against providers account plans, meet and exceed your targets Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationship with the decision makers in marketing and sales Recruit, manage and lead Account Managers in Singapore. Conduct training in sales, negotiation and account management Measure and manage business development progress and build a performance-driven sales culture Monitor the activity of competitors and utilize learnings Ensure the regulatory environment is understood and complied with Articulate compelling value propositions around Seedly and Hyphen Group services  SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS 5-8 years work experience in a B2B sales / sales management role / Advisory consulting role Deep knowledge of the Singapore market – banking/finance, insurance, fintech, telco & digital Proven record of negotiating and securing deals Experience in selling complex, tailored solutions at or to financial institutions Target orientated individual with demonstrable sales experience dealing with B2B providers having demonstrated decision making, problem solving, and negotiating skills. Excellent communication/interpersonal skills and the ability to professionally interact with providers, with verbal and written communication, analytical written and presentation skills. Ability to characterize value of products/some technical knowledge Positive and energetic leader with expertise in managing a sales team  Preferred Qualifications BA or BSc degree in finance, computer science, engineering, business, marketing, or related field Experience in driving the adoption of new technologies and solutions preferred. Last role: Head of Sales/Business Development in Financial Services or Media Sales  What can you expect from us?  Impact: We are actively empowering and connecting people to a better financial future. Join us if you want to help us achieve our mission.   Work: We have a team of over 400 talented individuals in 6 markets who are hyper passionate about building innovative financial solutions and making an impact on people’s lives.   Culture: We take our work seriously but don’t hesitate to keep things light. We can only create magic when we have a little bit of fun.   Thrive: We launched in 2014 and fast-forward 7 years we now help over 10 million monthly users make the best financial decisions. Accelerate your career and become a pioneer in your field with a leading fintech company that seeks to push the boundaries of your imagination and is committed to growing your career.   Reputation: We are backed by world-class organizations and companies and have raised over US$110 million from investors including Experian, Pacific Century Group, IFC - a member of the World Bank Group

description: Role summary Working closely with the Head of MBD Asia and Singapore partners, the MBD Manager will assist in the delivery and execution of a variety of marketing and business development activities for the Singapore office and Southeast Asia (SEA) region.  The MBD Manager will support a broad range of marketing and business development activities including pitches and capability statements, client events, thought leadership, priority client development, client targeting and implementation of regional business plans. This will involve working with the MBD team, partners and lawyers in Asia and across the network.  Manages One Business Executive  Key Responsibilities and Deliverables Singapore and SEA region support Existing client care programme and new client targeting Opportunity spotting – SEA M&A alert and scanning press Pitches and capability statements Profile raising – sponsorships, speaking opportunities, PR Events – lunch clubs, GC dinners, Women’s events, F1, wine tasting Directory and award submissions Client updates on legal development Drafting of / updating of brochures Managing and planning of budget Implementation of regional business plans Serve as the MBD lead for Indonesia, Cambodia, Malaysia, Thailand, Myanmar and India (cross over with global markets) Plan and support client targeting, country visits and newsletters  Pitch delivery and strategy Write and project manage the delivery of English language proposals, pitches, capability statements and presentations, including ensuring quality control of content and format and coordination of input from global document services and design team members. Work closely with Singapore and regional team members and fee earners to support the qualification of potential pitches, provide coaching on best practice pursuit approaches, conduct research, and develop key messages/value propositions. Log all pitches in the pitch database and solicit and record outcome together with any feedback. Where relevant, conduct proposal debrief meetings with the lawyers or the client to understand the outcome and improve pitching success rate in the future. Monitor key client satisfaction metrics to ensure the highest-quality pitch production within short timeframes. Maintain and improve the quality of experience lists and other business development content and help build and maintain a library of best practice documents and materials that will help to improve the quality of pitches overall.  Target and client development Help implement and support a focused approach to the creation, development or extension of core client and target relationships, including by: contributing to the identification and prioritisation of existing and new clients as targets for new business; producing and monitoring client action plans and detailed research for these (either directly or via external specialist resources); conducting client feedback interviews and contributing to those held by partners, providing relevant analysis and information; acting as a central contact point to ensure that client development activity is co-ordinated across the group (and beyond); and ensuring that information is captured and co-ordinated across the region and building up a thorough knowledge of key players on the target lists, both new and existing clients. Identify among PG key relationships and cross-selling opportunities for other offices or groups; facilitate communication and support of those opportunities. Follow up on cross-selling opportunities transferred into the practice areas from other PGs or offices firm-wide. Work with the partners to identify opportunities for the firm to grow its business with existing and new clients and help pursue those opportunities.  Global markets (GM) support Work with relationship partners of our StrongerTogether (ST) firms (local law firms) to build awareness of our ability to deliver mandates in our key GM regions in Asia Pacific. Provide Asia support and input to the GM MBD team on initiatives such as those to broaden our internal stakeholder network and increase awareness of the GM priorities and offering. Lead the development of regional ST events and support the wider GM team in the organisation of the annual International Bar Association event (or equivalent flagship event).  Marketing and Communications Promoting market awareness Develop a solid understanding of the Asia market in relevant practice and sector areas Oversee the production of client news monitoring on a daily basis via the daily BD Update. Work with the fee earners to ensure that opportunities are pursued and followed up. Build a thorough knowledge of Freshfields clients, practice areas and experience.   Client education/ thought leadership Taking client priorities and strategic objectives into consideration, take a proactive approach to identifying, developing and packaging product-related business development hooks, matching them to client needs (involving partners, Knowledge Management lawyers (KMLs) and BD Managers (BDMs) from other areas, as appropriate). For example: plan and initiate emails/briefings/articles on hot topics for promotional purposes; ensure that summaries of relevant legal developments (and input on their relevance to key client audiences) are fed into client newsletters and briefings; work with the Media Relations Manager, Events Coordinator and knowledge management team in the design of client seminars/other initiatives, client entertainment, interviews, publications and other marketing communications activities; and Co-ordinate editorial contributions to firm wide/ international publications as required. Liaise with the Media Relations Manager to manage the active promotion of the practice areas via press, web and print channels.  Rankings and directories Oversee the production of submissions for rankings and practice group contributions to the Chambers legal directory submission process. Track and analyse market trends and conduct a regular review of relevant ranking results and any other competitive data available and of the firm’s positioning/achievements versus its competitors.  Internal communications and training Ensure that active channels of internal communication relating to the activities of the PGs are maintained. Explore additional mechanisms for communication to improve internal communication. Ensure “best practice” methods are identified and transferred to others in the practice group, and shared with other BDMs. Train fee earners about business development. Integrate client focused business development into training and knowledge management to foster development of all categories of fee earner as well- rounded business lawyers, enhancing recruitment and retention. Understand the firm-wide business development systems (e.g. Salesforce, Matter Insights, pitch tool kit, etc) and ensure that the appropriate staff collect, enter and maintain the relevant information in these systems on a regular basis. Monitor the PGL’s and other partners’ perceptions of the quality and usefulness of the MBD activities and products/services provided regularly.  Budgeting Provide input to the production of the annual marketing budget for Singapore, liaising with BDMs in other relevant offices if required. Monitor costs against budget regularly.   Team relationships Build strong relationships with the other BDMs across Asia, the Asia Pitch Centre, office marketing personnel, and BDMs in relevant network offices and central MBD teams (e.g. International, Communications, Sector Groups). Build strong relationships with the knowledge management team across Asia. Work closely with the client relationship manager, Events coordinator, and Media Relations manager, and the wider Asia MBD team and their counterparts in relevant network offices. Maintain strong relationships with relevant members of the Asia Business Services teams (HR, Finance, Risk and Conflicts, Office Services and IT).   Key requirements  Essential Degree educated, preferably in marketing/business, economics or law. At least 4-6 years of experience in marketing and business development in a professional services firm.  Experience of legal services preferred. Experience of working in an international context in roles that require buy-in and engagement of senior management or partners. Experience of relationship management and winning new business (either active involvement or supporting others to do it, i.e. in a way which is a relevant to selling services and building propositions around products/services). Proven track record of project management and delivering against objectives.  Competencies Confident and intelligent with a robust personality. Ability to act as a positive role model and inspire others. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written). Very strong influencing skills combined with diplomacy and discretion. Structured and organised approach, as well as delivery orientated. Good planning and project management capability. Analytical and numerate. Strong ability to see the big picture. Resilient, able to work under pressure and deliver on tight deadlines. Creative thinker. Strong manager/coach. A team player capable of building excellent working relationships. Advanced Word user, proficient in Excel and PowerPoint.
industries: Law Practice

jobTitle: Manager, Business Development/ Strategy – New Digital Flows
description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Manager, Business Development/ Strategy – New Digital Flows  Overview  Grow Mastercard’s share of payments in emerging B2B and B2C flows in industries like gaming, cloud, digital ads, health insurance, ecommerce marketplace etc.  Responsibilities Assist in Strategy Development for new digital flows Landscape analysis for emerging payment opportunities by Industry and Market Deep analysis of emerging verticals and identify pain points Stitch together a Product suite that can solve some key pain points Articulate long-term strategy for product and services to form strong partnership and win disproportionate share of payments in emerging verticals Identify key partnership prospects Articulate ideal end state of the partnership, the areas of engagement and the 5 year revenue potential Develop the sales pipeline. Prospect, contact and contract new digital partners to drive penetration of Mastercard Digital products and solutions Financial modeling / business case development for new business opportunities Work with Product, Market, Franchise and Finance to develop a value proposition for the digital partner based on Mastercard assets and services Support Executing of commercial deals from initial engagements, client negotiations, contract agreement process to implementation Early account management for digital partners in coordination with product development, internal support teams such as customer delivery, operations and technology, legal, finance and market/geography teams  Experiences 6-10 year working experience. Experience executing and managing business development strategies Business Strategy and product management experience preferred but not mandatory. Track record in achieving business development targets and building customer relationships Output-driven and aspiring to good quality output. Ability to present output in formal and informal settings Can live with uncertainty, blue sky thinking and constant change  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

description: Responsibilities - Develop and implement B2B marketing strategy to articulate TikTok's value proposition to our partners -- including media agencies, resellers, creative agencies and industry associations - Lead the team to drive agency activations and generate leads through ongoing partner marketing activity - Oversee TikTok's agency CxO engagement and activities - Develop and own our industry relation strategy in Southeast Asia to position TikTok as a thought leader among relevant partners in the space of measurement, brand safety and creative - Develop messaging, narratives and collaterals to engage media & creative agencies in Southeast Asia - Develop advocacy plan to engage industry partners (e.g., IAB, MMA and local trade partners) - Work closely with global marketing teams to localise strategies and campaigns targeted at media agency partners - Work closely with sales, PR, product and other cross-functional teams to drive partner marketing programs - Activate integrated marketing campaigns including partner training, events, PR, advertising, social media and industry partnerships to engage media agencies - Manage partner marketing budget  Qualifications - A minimum of 8-10 years years of experience in marketing, communications, consulting or business strategy - Existing relationship and/or experience with industry associations like IAB and MMA - Team management experience - Experience in media, advertising or technology industries - Excellent written and verbal communications in English; candidates who can speak an additional Southeast Asian language preferred (Bahasa Indonesia, Thai or Vietnamese) - Strong understanding of the advertising industry and agency landscape in Southeast Asia - Track record of working with and influencing sales & other cross-functional teams - Experience developing integrated marketing strategies and executing go-to-market plans

description: Customer Business Development – Heart of Synagie  As part of Customer Business Development team for Omni Channel, you are expected to strategize, plan, and operate synergizing both online and offline channels in order to deliver sales target, optimize profitability, and continuously develop our omni-channel capabilities. Equipped with openness to learn, enthusiasm and tenacity, you will be primarily responsible to:  1. Develop and build Omni Channel Experience for the region a. Understand and leverage touchpoints for business development across Omni channel which consists of Online/e-Comm: Lazada, Shopee, Zalora, Amazon. Physical : Not limited to Personal care stores eg.Watsons, Guardian, Supermarkets eg. Landers, Jaya, baby fairs, pop up stores etc b. Develop & align with principal, work with partners (internal & external) to implement channel, portfolio strategies, go-to-channel routes. c. Constant learning about omni channel, innovate and leverage technologies to enhance experience for customers to their consumers  2. Regional Support & Capabilities development a. Create synergy with local markets to drive excellence in areas like i. Key Account Management capabilities: Strategizing, Planning & execution ii. Online E-Commerce Planning iii. Trade investment capabilities : Campaign Post Mortem, investment strategy b. S&OP process support (forecasting, ordering) for regional brands  3. Business Custodian for Synagie a. Conduct regular reviews for regional brands b. Understand assigned customer(s) P&L and identify areas for growth / improvements c. Prepare analysis and presentations in preparation for any trade / channel negotiations  4. Business Expansion Support a. Identify potential customers’ leads based on the unique enabler provided by Synagie Omni Channel team b. To prepare for pitches and develop new businesses c. To constantly innovate for solutions to enhance our Omni Channel offerings and attract new customers   Synagie believes you will be an awesome fit for this role if you: Hold a bachelor’s degree in any discipline of study. Experienced in online E-commerce or/& offline Key Account / Distributor Management (>5 years) Enthusiastic to learn and drive Omni-channel revolution will be advantage Possesses entrepreneurial spirit, strong commercial acumen & resilience to challenges Possess good communication skills and able to work in a fast paced but nurturing environment. A team player   About us: Synagie is an eCommerce company that provides end-to-end commerce enablement solutions to businesses selling online and offline. Our mission is to simplify commerce and make it easier for brands and businesses to sell online. Established in end 2014, our clients include some of the world’s leading MNCs in the consumer goods sector and SMBs who are looking to simplify the complex commerce process.  Why choose to join Synagie? The vision. Synagie wants to be the best. We thrive on innovation. We are competitive, but we compete only with ourselves. The feeling of working on something that will only get bigger and better is unparalleled. The culture. In Synagie, everyone has a voice. We promote an environment of open discussions and challenging notions. Yet, we treat each other as brothers and sisters that forms part a happy family. The people. We have such an incredible and diverse mix of people from all walks of life. You will work with the smartest, warmest, and most talented people in this industry. Working with such remarkable professionals makes one beam with pride. The expertise. The main thrust of Synagie is continuous improvement of talent through research, testing & learning, and training. We make sure you grow where you want to The E-Commerce. Be in the thick of the E-Commerce action where we work with FMCG and Prestige Beauty brands as well as Channel partners to drive business growth, consumers' penetration and enhance shopping journey.
industries: Internet

description: Job Description  OVERVIEW  The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for developing new accounts within assigned territories, with a clear set of growth targets to achieve. You will also maintain and grow revenue from existing accounts.  You will be a champion of our CDN and cloud security solutions, providing strong service and support to our existing customers’ needs at every interaction and to lead the resolution of their issues within the company. You will also be orchestrating direct sales engagements, win competitive opportunities, as well as establish and collaborate with channel partners in a fast pace for sell-to and sell-through strategies to reach a high and continuous growth.  You will enjoy a competitive base salary with a generous commission while representing a industry-leading customer focused CDN and cloud security that is helping companies expand their global businesses.  The ideal candidate should be a tenacious, results-oriented sales professional, with a passion for nurturing strong relationships with customers, passionate about the industry and possess excellent communication skills. Success in this position will require a positive attitude, great time management, strong work ethic, and a passion to build solid and sustainable relationships with customers.  Responsibilities  This position will prioritize more on hunting responsibilities. Drive new business directly from customers, identify and develop effective and scalable channel partners based in respective territories for building robust sales pipelines. Oversee and manage a portfolio of assigned accounts, seek additional revenue opportunities through up-selling and renewals. Accountable for owning all aspects of the sales cycle, whilst consistently generating pipeline to meet and/or exceed quota. Create and maintain all major customer deliverable (proposals, statements of work, etc.) to provide over-the-top customer service and support. Understand the value proposition of our CDN and cloud security solutions and more productively, communicating all offerings to C-level executives and decision makers. Continuously keep abreast of industry and market trends, whilst building strong knowledge in our products and services. Drive business cadence for weekly team meetings on pipeline update, opportunities review, customer account reviews, etc. As CDNetworks' country representative, to present on external symposium, conferences, media and industry events. Expected to travel across assigned territory/region at least 30%. Job Requirements  Requirements Bachelor’s degree required. Proven track record of exceeding sales goals/quotas. Good key account management skill and business acumen. Ability to gain access and interact with C-level executives with effective interpersonal and presentation skills. Minimum 3 years of relevant sales management experience, preferably in IT solutions/Cloud or similar Hi-tech environment. Knowledge of Content Delivery Networks (CDNs), internet and Cloud Infrastructure, Media and Cyber Security Services is highly desired. Energetic, self-motivated, result-oriented and thrive in a fast-paced dynamic growth environment. Familiarity with CRM platform especially Salesforce is highly desired. Possessing of experienced and resourceful channel partner such as Systems Integrator，Value Added Resellers in network and security field will be a plus. Proficiency in SEAN countries' languages like Vietnamese/Bahasa Indonesia....etc, is a plus as you will need to work closely and communicate with customers based in the country from ASEAN.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Computer & Network Security

jobTitle: Key Accounts & Project Manager | Global Market
description: The Global Key Account and Projects Manager will be instrumental in shaping and delivering on the future strategy & structure of the global Hach Projects business. For the purposes of describing this role, the word ‘Projects’ is used to define opportunities influenced by Engineering & Consulting firms (E&C’s), Engineering/Procurement/Construction firms (EPC’s), Original Equipment manufacturer (OEM’s) and/or System Integrators (SI’s) that involve the design, specification, procurement and integration of equipment & systems on behalf of a Hach customer/end-user to achieve desired/improved business performance of water treatment assets.  This Global Key Account and Projects Manager is a senior account management role focused on building strategic relationships with international engineering companies involved in projects in the municipal and industrial water and wastewater markets globally, building internal relationships with sales, marketing and technical resources. This position will be well-networked and highly-polished, engaging and managing a defined, carefully selected set of Global Key Accounts and major project opportunities.  This role is a strategic sales and business development role focusing on three main Clusters of Activities and Targets:  Global Business Development/Account management with targeted Global Strategic Accounts (System integrators and EPC firms) Building strategic relationships with Engineering companies across the regions to develop a strong network and medium to long term strategy. Targeted global accounts will include global System integrators involved in industrial water treatment projects.   Project management/coordination of larger and international opportunities involving targeted accounts Using a proactive approach to manage opportunities in the pipeline by aligning with all relevant stakeholders, both internal and external, and bring them into success. External stakeholder includes E&Cs, EPCs, Integrators, Operators/Owners of water assets and any other party that has an influence on the selection of water quality measuring equipment and software.  Internal stakeholders include Regional Sales Directors, Country Managers and Sales and Service organisations. Critical responsibilities will include accuracy of project business opportunities in Sales Force CRM software, support at mapping and engaging with involved bidders in to projects, early engagement related to service and start-up where equipment is purchased via third party, leading bid strategy and facilitation of standard work.  People and Capability Development for the APAC Region Identify and develop the overall capabilities and understanding of Project Business specifics within the region. The GKA Project Manager will act as subject matter expert on project delivery models for both Municipal and Industrial markets. Deploying formal training to ensure sustainment of standard work and building local capabilities around complex project delivery. Actively participating joint visits to deliver workshops, accelerate needs development and share/coach Best Practise.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop strategic relationships and eventually partnerships with targeted water treatment engineering companies (E&C/EPC/SI/OEM). Good understanding and close monitoring of water markets and its trends with particular focus on APAC regions, Tracking of all major investment projects in responsible regions Prospecting for new partnerships Support regional sales leaders to develop project business with targeted accounts and improve capabilities of the regional sales organizations in selling projects. Become highly proficient with the DBS tools to drive change and sustain process improvements. Interface with cross-functional leaders and teams to develop and improve sales tools and Hach offerings needed to facilitate success with targeted accounts. Lead the sales process for cross border projects as required to ensure transparency and alignment of execution i.e. bid strategy, service and start-up Driving key initiatives to get Hach key technologies (Claros, Service, Biotector and Applitek) recognized by the targeted accounts   Project Management of opportunities with targeted accounts  Manage the triangle between E&C, EPS, SI and end - user or any other project key stakeholders after identifying the opportunity in the early stage Provide the required level of support on projects from inception to closure ensuring smooth transition into the 90-day funnel (post Bid stage).  People and Capability Development for the Region  Coordinate and lead sales part of projects pursuits for complex and international projects Share best practice on a regular basis with sales leaders and key persons to accelerate the overall traction with external stakeholders Using joint activities and joint visits to increase personal capabilities of key members of the sales organization. Running training on regular basis in the field of solution selling capabilities, understanding the projects business and how to manage long term and complex opportunities Mentoring, coaching and management of key opportunities (must wins) to ensure we will drive them into success.    QUALIFICATIONS: Water treatment, Environmental, chemistry, process technology, electrical engineering or related technology bachelor’s degree required, Minimum 10 years of strategic selling experience in a B2B sales environment with high technology solutions, ideally in water/wastewater treatment to municipal and industrial markets, Experience in selling software solutions in water treatment industries, International experience in a key account management role Experience working within a large global organization in a matrix environment Must have the ability to manage consistently to a common plan, providing sales leadership in the implementation of corporate sales strategies. Position requires intensive travel throughout countries of APAC region and occasionally in other regions with a minimum of 40% being required Fluency in English required Fluency in Arabic, Mandarin or Hindi would be an additional asset Regional network with water industry would be desirable
jobFunction: Sales, Project Management, and Business Development

description: Appier is a technology company which provides artificial intelligence platforms to help enterprises solve their most challenging business problems. Appier was established in 2012 by a passionate team of computer scientists and engineers with expertise in AI, data analysis, distributed systems, and marketing.  About the role The Regional Presales Leader is responsible for selling and up-selling Appier’s AI-as-a-service products to new and existing clients and providing service in support of team revenue goals.  Task of the role Responsibilities for Sales/Pre-sales Enablement:   Become an expert with our product suite, able to deliver standard and customized presentations of Appier enterprise AI solutions and Demos to business management.   Maintain a healthy sales pipeline, and closure forecast.   Assist to field sales on prepares business proposals and quotations as required.   Work with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set integration schedules for products and services   Coordinate with sales leadership and executive management to define sales support initiatives.   Act as a liaison between Sales, Marketing(Growth team) , and Product teams.   Create written content to educate sales team and advance deals such as case studies, application scenario , competitive information fact sheets, product collateral, and custom work.   Train sales team on best use of marketing and sales enablement materials.   Field ad hoc content and support requests from sales team.   Assist on sales calls and demos as needed.   Manage the sales enablement content repository and ensure that all information is easily and readily accessible at point of need.   Determine content adoption metrics and define sales enablement best practices.   Conduct and report on market research.   Gather feedback from sales team on a regular basis to constantly improve support programs.   About you [Essential] Min. 2-5 years of enterprise software sales or Ad’s software relative sales experience; ideally SaaS based offerings in Digital, Analytics, Marketing systems Ability to communicate technical and business concepts effectively to customer’s mid/senior management as well as C-level executives Self-motivated, able to adapt to an ambiguous, fast paced sales environment A proven track record of driving and closing enterprise deals. Strong commitment to sales and service with good interpersonal skills, initiative and follow through Ability to “translate” complex technology processes into meaningful solutions that address business needs Crisp oral and written communications in English and Chinese A bachelor’s Degree preferred. Good connection and relationships with advertisers and media agencies Ability to “translate” complex technology processes into meaningful solutions that address business needs Able to handle multiple priorities

description: FactSet provides integrated workflow solutions and market data to Financial Professionals. Headquartered in the US, FactSet’s global revenues exceed $1.45 BB per annum. Please visit our website http://www.factset.com/ for further details.  We are seeking an ambitious, motivated and deal driven Senior Sales Executive to work in our Singapore office. The Singapore office is responsible for FactSet’s business in S.E. Asia. The Sales Executive will be responsible for managing and accelerating sales in Asset Owner and Asset Manager client segment in S.E. Asia.  The role offers a great opportunity to independently manage several clients.  The Sales Executive will be required to work independently, build relationships, and have high levels of commitment, while displaying strong organizational skills. The ideal candidate would be ambitious and portray a tireless work ethic. Motivation, high level of energy and drive are key to succeed in this role.  Main Goals and responsibilities include but not limited to: Maintain a prospect list and follow up on leads Build strong relationships with key senior managers and decision makers at each client Identify growth opportunities, lead the sales pursuit, and close deals Conduct sales demos, presentations, and contract negotiations Implement and close trials in decent time frame Draft response to RFI’s and RFP’s Attend industry conferences and seminars to promote FactSet Offer Project Management oversight to consulting team during implementation process Work closely with client solutions team to pursue common goals Visit clients/prospects on a regular basis Gain knowledge of competition in the accounts Contribute in setting long term strategy to increase market share  Skills Requirements: Hands-on sales experience of over 4 years in the Fin Tech industry Experience in selling complex solutions to asset managers / buy side industry Strong leadership skills Strong and proven communication and interpersonal skills Drive, enthusiasm, and a desire to exceed targets Strong sense of initiative and creativity Strong understanding of the investment process and the tools used MBA/CFA would be an advantage

description: A full-fledged FMCG Marketing role, where the selected candidate will be responsible for the assigned portfolio’s Brand & Trade Marketing. Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the incumbent is required to:  Recommend and implement strategic and tactical brand marketing initiatives in alignment with brand strategies to achieve business plans and objectives. Develop and deliver effective marketing campaigns to increase brand awareness through various touchpoints both ATL (traditional & new media) and BTL: - Assist with forming the overall digital marketing strategy & campaign - Promote the brand on various social media channels. - Increase the marketing funnel efficiencies. Contribute ideas and input into the 360 marketing plans for both ATL and BTL during annual business plan. Lead in implementation and execution of: - Approved brand activities in line with brand strategy and work closely with all relevant parties (internal and external) to ensure Business Plans and Brand Objectives are achieved. - Media and creative agencies for activation of the approved plans. - Agency on sampling activities at relevant touch points such as in-store, etc. and develop sampling tools and materials to support sampling activities. - Work with agency to develop POSM / Communication materials and Brand Imagery which includes obtaining best quotation for the printing of POSM and other communication materials and delivery arrangement. Support MM in development of 360 integrated marketing plans for new launches, re-launches and other marketing project. Actively contribute and participate in meetings with internal team (Sales, Operations, Supply Chain , Marketing Innovation, Finance and product supply) and external parties (media agencies, social media agencies, research agencies and creative agencies) and follow up WIP meetings. Monitor, report and analyze - Post evaluation and learnings of brand activities and campaigns. Include measurement and reporting of performance for all digital marketing activities and assesses against goals (ROI and KPIs). - Sales deck & ensure proper communication and execution of brand initiatives. - Competitive analysis which includes monitor, review, analyze competitors activities such as pricing, communications, launches / relaunches, marketing activities and market share. - A&P - track and monitor actual spend against budget for each of the marketing activities to ensure spend within A&P budget allocated (correct use of IO and GL code) - Monthly report, marketing activities monitoring and update - Product Bundle Sheet of competitors new launches or relaunches. - Internal sales trend Understanding of the shopper insights of the key customers (FairPrice, Sheng Siong, Local Chain, Lazada, Shopee, etc) and respective channels (Retail & E-commerce) of the categories to support MM in the development of channels and customers strategies and promotional planning to achieve business plans . In doing so : - Understand channel dynamics (Retail & E-commerce) and opportunities whilst helping to support strategic business partnerships with key retailers in the different channels we compete in. - Devising strategies that harness sales-related insights to encourage sales in our online store. - Developing, monitoring, writing and updating product content contained on eCommerce portals. - Drive traffic to E-commerce platforms - Deliver promotional plans with close follow through with the Sales on the executions . - Post promotional evaluation with key learnings for improve on effectiveness and ROI . - Support ad hoc /tactical promotions working with Sales to close sales gaps. Deliver the merchandising guidelines for new launches or re launches aided by the team. Supporting key accounts managers (Retail & E-commerce) in the development of the annual key accounts plan by providing input in the category and shoppers insights in the respective accounts. Engage cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain and other internal teams to ensure smooth execution of BTL plans. Other essential skill sets for this role include: - Must be well versed in both traditional & digital media - Possess good analytical skills - Knowledge of the Retail & E-Commerce channels  The person: Bachelor Degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Business Administration, Commerce, or related discipline Minimum 3 -5 years of FMCG/ E-Commerce Platform Marketing &/or Trade Marketing experience Well versed in Digital Marketing Essential to possess experience & knowledge in E-commerce platforms i.e. Shopee, Lazada. Strong project management skills. Able to juggle multiple projects within tight deadlines, work well under pressure, & excel in a fast pace working environment. Positive working attitude. Self-motivated & proactive with a high level of commitment. Able to work independently as well as interact with people from all levels Possess good business acumen, logical thinking, & is hands on Excellent command of written & spoken English Good command of written & spoken Mandarin will be advantageous (due to job requirement)

Job Description:  Get to know our Team:  GrabAds enables Advertisers, Agencies, and Merchants to engage the Grab Audience via innovative online and offline advertising experiences. Through our unique ecosystem and transacting user base, our clients are able to reach their desired audiences at scale, while driving measurable business outcomes.  We would like You to join our journey to create value for our users, drivers, merchants, and advertising partners, while continuing to make everyday lives better across Southeast Asia.  Get to know the Role:  As Head of Sales Operations of GrabAds, you will define, implement, and administer processes via your team and cross functional collaboration that enable scale for our organization. You will manage all aspects of sales operations, including pricing, yield management, forecasting, quotas, incentives, analytics, lead flows, and CRM. As part of a fast growing organization, you will provide key inputs into sales strategy, customer segmentation, org structure, process improvement, and business analytics.  The day-to-day activities: Actively Manage the Pricing and Yield Management of Grab’s Advertising assets including including rate cards, sales tools, discounting policies, and inventory utilization Own and enhance the usage of and processes around CRM (Salesforce), including integrations to Marketing Automation (Pardot) and other workflow tools. Develop scalable and measurable processes throughout our Lead to Order flow. Aggregate and Provide robust sales and business analytics via BI (Tableau, PowerBI, Spreadsheet) to stakeholders from various backend data sources. Collaborate with Sales and Operations to develop robust and increasingly accurate Revenue Forecasting for budgeting and in period performance Administer and enhance Sales Incentive Plans Collaborate with Product, Finance, and Legal to implement and strengthen our processes to meet SOX compliance Contribute to the creation of a unified reporting system as the source of truth with the help of multiple cross-functional stakeholders Source external partners and integrations to manage the end-to-end order to cash process Partner with Sales to define and build different sales cycles for various business channels and improve the process of lead to order flow and pipeline management through various stages. Define and build health metrics for various business channels and provide recommendations to improve operations Lead change management within GrabAds and other Grab verticals to successfully roll out new initiatives. Partner with internal stakeholders and external consultants to build enhancements on SFDC Partner with Marketing to build and implement an effective B2B framework for inbound lead qualification, lead routing, and lead allocation for pre-sales processes. The must haves: 10 - 15 years of sales operations or related experience; preferably in Southeast Asia Experience working in B2B organizations, preferably in media or marketing service Experience leveraging sales enablement tools (CRM, Content, Marketing Automation, etc…) Experience leveraging BI tools (Tableau, PowerBI, et…) Excellent communication & presentation skills with the ability to transmit across different level stakeholders in different countries Team Player with the ability to work across a matrix environment in a fast paced environment Experience in designing, implementing, and enforcing cross functional processes Strong organisational skills with ability to manage multiple tasks Advanced Spreadsheet Skills (Sheets or Excel); database / querying skills a plus Written and Verbal English; another South East Asian language a plus
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Service Sales Manager (SSM), Singapore & Indirect Countries
description: Job Description Summary  The Service Sales Manager (SSM) is responsible to lead, drive and execute the overall services growth strategy in the country as well as creating and converting sales opportunities for their respective accounts and portfolios. The SSM will lead the service sales team in the country / region, and work collaboratively and partner with the country and regional sales and functional teams, where applicable as a One GE Healthcare team. The SSM is responsible to maintain the relationship with departmental and technical decision makers and where applicable, work in conjunction with Account Executives and Managers to gain access to C-Suite decision makers. The SSM is the clinical/technical and sales expert for the assigned products, solutions/services, and is expected to be able to differentiate GE’s product/solution/service offerings, convey compelling value propositions, lead the opportunity, qualify the customer needs, develop and present solutions proposals and quotations, and respond to customers’ clinical/technical/process questions in order to successfully close clinical/technical/solution sales. GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Key responsibilities  Financial Performance & Strategy  Lead country/region service commercial team  Accountable to achieve Product/Solutions/Service sales OP target for country and / or assigned accounts.  This includes all revenue segments of contract and non-contract elements (part sales, options & upgrades, digital solutions) Manage and motivate service sales team to optimize financial performance Design/Execute on country-wide sustainable growth strategies in order to boost and grow revenue/margins for the country  Territory & Account Management  Create territory/account plans including opportunity development, competitive strategies and targets for service sales team. Build strong business relationships and formulate account relationship plans within the assigned accounts/ territory. Identify & respond to key account technical and departmental decision makers’ needs and maintain customer contact records in the relevant CRM tools. Maintain a network of key opinion leaders within the assigned territory. Track and communicate market trends to/from the field including competitor data and develop effective counter-strategies. Coach and support sales team to achieve sales target and build strong relationship in assigned accounts  Product & Market Expertise  Work collaboratively with marketing function to plan and execute on growth programs Maintain up to date detailed knowledge of their product/solution/services. Be able to present and discuss the value proposition and benefits which are relevant to customers. Maintain up to date market and competitor knowledge related to their product/solutions/services. Differentiate assigned product/service offerings during the various stages of the sales process, effectively using GE resources and approved marketing and promotion materials to actively support the customer through their decision-making process towards a successful outcome for GE. Represent the company at relevant medical conferences and technical exhibitions to promote product/solution/services and company. Opportunity management and commercial rigor Identify and create new opportunities and work with sales / service leaders and account teams (where applicable) to continuously increase prospect and opportunity funnel.  Support and manage tender/bid processes including the needs qualification, vendor selection, quotation and closure of their product/solution/service opportunities to meet sales and margin targets as well as to maximize customer satisfaction in the assigned territory. Manage opportunities and funnel using applicable CRM sales funnel tools and reports for their products/solutions/services in their assigned territory/accounts.  Estimate date of delivery to customer based on knowledge of the company's production and delivery schedules ensuring fulfillment of the order is according to customer expectations and enhances customer satisfaction. Coaching and maintaining commercial rigor for self and team through the adoption and use of CRM tool and aligning to the associated commercial metrics.  Qualifications    Bachelor’s degree and minimum 8 years of working experience in a medical, healthcare or technical field Minimum 5-year experience in managing sales team. Demonstrated leadership in identifying growth strategy, analyzing opportunities and gaps, motivating team to achieve sales targets.  Ability to interface with both internal team members and external customers as part of solutions based sales approach Ability to energize, develop and build rapport at all levels within an organization Excellent organizational skills Excellent negotiation & closing skills  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

Sales soft skill & product trainings, core selling and value selling etc Support Customer experience survey and other relevant surveys Conduct commercial check backs Campaign Management Premium product roll-outs External and internal Communication (Hapag-Lloyd Internal Portal and team sites updates) Representation in exhibitions and fairs Ensure regional adherence to regulatory affairs and tariff filings Driving and monitoring developments and success on Key account program Requirements University degree and 5 years of experience in the maritime industry or equivalent combination of education and experience Experienced in Sales functions Advanced negotiation, decision-making and presentation skills, self-confident and friendly when dealing with others Demonstrated strong listening, verbal and written communication skills Self-starter, self-motivated, resourceful and responsive Demonstrated ability to be multi-task, set priorities, organize work and implement action items Strong analytical skills Ability to take initiative and work under pressure Attention to detail, analytical, systematic and efficient way of working Ability to work in a team and motivate others

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager Ingredients, APAC region
description: Singapore, Tuas Singapore  Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.  This is a Leadership role reporting to Head of Sales, APAC & can be based at Singapore / Japan / Thailand ( Depending on the applicant's present position ) & will handle Lonza’s nutrition portfolio products and ingredients and will contribute towards global strategy with close alignment with US & EMEA markets & to deliver on budgeted sales number for ingredients for the region along with Receivables.  Responsibilities Responsible for Sales and Receivables for APAC region for Nutrition Ingredients segment (markets include, China, South East Asia, Japan and India) Must understand / analyze changing trends in nutrition industry and adapt to an evolving business environment for APAC markets; responsible to develop a strategy, long term plan and action for driving the growth for ingredients Responsible for sales both for local and regulated market customers based in region Handle Key and Potential accounts and devise and implement effective strategies both for sales & promotion Ability to handle new product introductions, technical discussion on nutrition portfolio. Should be capable of trouble-shooting and providing solutions to complex problems Responsible for identifying local market trends, assessing market potential and developing strategies to grow Lonza’s market share for APAC region Build a bridge with US & EMEA region and integrate strategy for the region Proven track record of managing relationships with both business partners and customers. Responsible for identifying and developing business opportunities and markets in the defined geographies. Provide a long term perspective to the Sales Operations strategies to improve customer service and provide an unmatched brand image translating to business development and market share Business planning, forecasting & analysis for assessing market potential of business opportunities for the business. Negotiating prices and quantities and assuring that agreements are respected Participating in product development cycles and the enlargement of marketing related product information by giving the customer concrete and specific information Following the evolution of markets; implementing, in close collaboration with the Key Accounts Sales Manager, commercial strategies and appropriate actions towards the customers Key Requirements Substantial years of experience in Sales & marketing with B2B experience within the nutrition portfolio Education : Bachelors / Masters Key Stakeholders : 1) Internal sales team within the region, BD, marketing, customer service team 2) Internal cross functional teams across the US & EMEA market, BD, Marketing, customer service, Operations 3) Customers, international stakeholders (internal and external) Every day, Lonza's products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieve ethically.  People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.  Reference: R28096  Apply

description: About the role Working closely with lead partners to develop and execute business development and marketing initiatives for the practice groups in Singapore and the Southeast Asia region. The individual will also be part of a regional team to work collaboratively with BDMC colleagues in other offices - particularly those in Malaysia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Hong Kong and China.  Help develop and oversee delivery of BDMC plans across the Practice Groups, to be aligned with the regional and global strategy but fine-tuned for AP market needs and dynamics; set and execute the strategic market-focused direction for the Groups with fee earners Develop, define and disseminate clear positioning and messaging for the Groups in line with the global groups and aligned with the Firm branding and communications plans with the goal of achieving high rankings in each AP market and strong brand recognition  Ensure Singapore and cross-border pitches and proposals for the Groups are delivered at a high level of quality and strategic input Team with lawyers and BDMC staff around the world to market the services and expertise of the Groups in AP, through the development and deployment of thought leadership content, market leading events, sponsorships and other profile-raising activities Monitor and spot forward-looking Group issues and trends and translate their legal impact to clients and lawyers in a commercial way for impacting strategy, business plans and their execution Manage and co-ordinate initiatives with BDMC teams, setting high standards and values, and embedding shared values of collaboration, market-leading intelligence and client service across the team Work and co-ordinate with Industry Key Client (IKC) and Regional Client Managers in the Expert BDMC function to drive key account management and client relationships with strategic accounts Partner closely with other Expert functions (Key Client management, Marketing & Campaigns and Communications, Pitch Excellence & Pursuits, Pricing Excellence etc.) to ensure the Group's media engagement, proposal preparation and pitch training for attorneys, pricing options and alternative fee arrangements strategies align with the requirements of the business as well as global best practice Work with our BDMC End-to-End Services teams and Expert functions (Marketing Services; Directories, Awards and League Tables; Event Management; others) around production needs including proposal and communications templates; marketing material, campaigns and channels; roll-out of branding communications and advertising; managing submissions for awards, league tables and directories; and event requirements Lead on the development and execution of 1-2 key cross-border and cross-practice regional initiatives, in line with the JAO and AP Business Plan or strategic priorities  About the candidate Educated to degree level or equivalent qualification / experience focusing on Marketing, Communications, Sales or related commercial subjects Experience of team leadership in a marketing and/or business development role, preferably in a professional services environment Experience working with and influencing senior stakeholders for strategic business outcomes Excellent English verbal and written communication skills Ability to effectively manage competing priorities Strong judgment and ability to make well-reasoned independent decisions Advanced understanding of business development, marketing and communications Self-motivated and independent, able to work with a minimum of supervision Comfortable working across multiple cultures and time zones in a matrix organization Strong interpersonal skills, positive attitude and team spirit High degree of attention to detail and excellent project management skills  About the team The BDMC function works closely with our Partners and leadership teams to: Increase our revenue, profitability and share across markets, industries and clients Enable us to win, retain and grow business through powerful pitches, engaging thought leadership and strong relationship management Lead market & client intelligence efforts to create new service line opportunities in industry and practice groups Channel the Baker McKenzie brand, identity and culture through a single communications voice  About the firm Baker McKenzie helps clients overcome the challenges of competing in the global economy. We solve complex legal problems across borders and practice areas. Our unique culture, developed over 65 years, enables our people to understand local markets and navigate multiple jurisdictions, working together as trusted colleagues and friends to instill confidence in our clients. This is an exciting time to join us as we invest in and further develop our Professional & Business Services organisation, providing rewarding and challenging career opportunities in all of our world-class business functions.  We are committed to promoting diversity and inclusion for all. Our unique international culture is reflected in the drawing together of a worldwide family of individuals from diverse cultures and backgrounds in all of our offices. We encourage the best people -- regardless of race, religion or belief if any, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation or age -- to fulfil their professional aspirations with us.
