description: An exciting opportunity has arisen to join Tradeweb's busy Client Service team based in Singapore covering the whole APAC region. Working in a fast paced, challenging and dynamic environment, the team enjoys the responsibility of delivering the Tradeweb suite of products to our clients on the buy side. As a Client Services Representative, you will be expected to deliver an excellent level of service to all clients, dealing with requests for information, queries and problems in an efficient and friendly manner and developing and maintaining a thorough understanding of our products and services in order to meet with our clients’ demands.  Main Responsibilities include: Support buy side clients with general platform / product queries Monitor trades and actively follow up to identify and resolve any issues Support internal teams in getting clients connected, delivering initial user training Work directly with the Sales Teams to onboard new clients, including training and the timely completion of relevant legal processes and documentation Ownership of some buy side procedures and documentation Fostering productive relationships with both Clients and other Sales & Client Services Representatives; and supporting team efforts to deliver great service, particularly around product launches Ensuring the system is prepared for daily trading and monitoring for potential problems throughout the day  Essential Skills / Experience: 2/3 years’ experience working in an investment bank or trading platform with knowledge of fixed income products Finance or tech degree educated Fluency in Mandarin essential Able to prioritise tasks and maintain a professional approach under pressure Results oriented and motivated to deliver excellent client service Strong MS Office skills and must be comfortable using financial applications   About Tradeweb: Tradeweb Markets Inc. (NASDAQ: TW) is a leading, global operator of electronic marketplaces for rates, credit, equities and money markets. Founded in 1996, Tradeweb provides access to markets, data and analytics, electronic trading, straight-through-processing and reporting for clients in the institutional, wholesale and retail markets. Advanced technologies developed by Tradeweb enhance price discovery, order execution and trade workflows while allowing for greater scale and helping to reduce risks in client trading operations. For more information, please go to www.tradeweb.com .

description: The Company Our client is a popular football media platform for the new generation of football fans. It is the only app with a fully personalised home stream for non-stop news of your favourite club and the only company to offer single live football matches in-app on a free and pay-per-view basis. They operate a 24-hour newsroom to provide fans across the world with the comprehensive football content they crave - from statistics and live scores of 200+ leagues and competitions worldwide to breaking news, highlight clips, live streaming, transfer rumours and features. The app is available in 12 languages and is the best rated sports app in the world, based on millions of App Store and Google Play reviews.  Founded in 2008, the company has its headquarters in Berlin and regional offices in London, New York, Mexico City, Singapore, Cairo, Istanbul and Rio de Janeiro.  The Role We are looking to hire a Client Solutions Sales Manager to join its growing APAC team. Reporting directly into the APAC. General Manager, you will be expected to utilize existing business relationships, as well as develop new ones across the media and sports industry and to provide appropriate solutions to clients’ challenges. Your day-to-day responsibilities will have you working closely with direct clients and our founding club partners across the APAC region.  The Candidate He/she must have an established network of industry contacts with local and regional clients, sports sponsorship and creative agencies.. A strong understanding of the digital content and media industry within the football, sports and entertainment industry will be necessary. He/she must also have an ambitious, entrepreneurial and proactive mindset. If you have a dream to grow your career with a fast growing company, submit your application now!  Responsibilities Develop appropriate solutions for brands and advertisers to help them achieve their goals. Utilize existing relationships and develop new ones with relevant clients and club commercial partners to unlock revenue opportunities. Establish client’s objectives, create appropriate sales responses, pitch, effectively manage your day-to-day business relationships and ensure salesforce is kept up to date. Meet and exceed quarterly/annual regional revenue targets. Work with the GM, APAC to structure and execute Go-To-Market client direct and club partners strategy. Forge strong internal relationships with clubs, publishers, editorial, social, legal and marketing teams to maximize sales opportunities.  Requirements Successful and proven track record in media & sponsorship sales. A proven ability of successfully interpreting a client’s objectives, creating an aligned response and presenting. Experience of selling to local and regional clients across the APAC region. A proven ability to source and manage third party resellers and representatives in overseas markets. Experience in selling end-end branded content solutions for clients. Competent PowerPoint/KeyNote skills. Experience of selling sport/football is preferable. Experience of using Salesforce is preferable. Love of football or sport in general is a bonus.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: About Vectra.ai  Vectra.ai delivers a new class of advanced threat defense that delivers real-time detection and analysis of active network intrusions. Vectra technology picks up where perimeter security leaves off by providing deep, continuous analysis of both internal and Internet-facing network traffic to automatically detect all phases of a breach as attackers attempt to spy, spread, and steal within your network.  Vectra directly analyzes network traffic in real time using a patent-pending combination of data science, machine learning, and behavioral analysis to detect attacker behaviors and user anomalies in the network. All detections are correlated and prioritized to show an attack in context, and Vectra Networks' machine learning adapts as attacks evolve.  Position Overview  Vectra is seeking self-starting, highly motivated sales professionals to join our Field Sales organization as a Regional Sales Manager (RSM). This sales professional will be responsible for all revenue within their territory location and have a proven track record of exceeding sales goals by selling into the larger enterprise. We are looking for a "Hunter"; someone who isn't afraid to knock down doors at the largest enterprises and has a structured/disciplined approach to pipeline development. This RSM will partner with our world class Sales Engineering team to own the sales process from start to finish, but will also leverage any/all corporate resources to ensure we win at all levels.  This Regional Sales Manager will need to be passionate about the extraordinary value Vectra is providing to our customers while also conducting themselves with professionalism, honesty and integrity.  Responsibilities Identify, cultivate and close new business sales relationships with enterprise accounts at an executive level within designated territory, this with CISO/CIO/CTO level contacts. Have a disciplined approach to pipeline development through leveraging Marketing, Channel partners, Customers, Sales Development team and their own ability to organically prospect. Develop an overall account strategy that will lead to a well-executed, team based selling effort. Team up with your Sales Engineer partner to deliver outstanding product demonstrations and well executed proof of concepts programs. Build a strong partnership with existing customers that focuses on customer retention, high renewal rates and expansion within the customer. Effectively forecast monthly/ quarterly revenue and communicate the status of strategic transactions to ensure you never win or lose alone. Strategic management of existing channel partners and development of new channel partners; 3-4 days a week domestic travel (and sometimes international); Development of strategic business plans for territory on quarterly base.  Qualifications Minimum 3+ years of Enterprise Sales experience exceeding quotas selling security, networking and/or software solutions. Hunter: you aren't afraid of cold-calling, breaking doors down to talk to the right people and own early stage pipeline development. A winner, someone who holds themselves accountable to consistent over-achievement. Successful experience closing complex Enterprise sales with multiple buying influences Experience managing and closing deals of $200K+ as well high value transactions above $1m+. Experience establishing and fostering strong relationships with potential partners and customers Ability to demo products, working independently from Sales Engineers in first customer-meetings Strong presentation and communications skills, translating technical features into business-values Experience with Salesforce.com is a plus. Outstanding verbal, written and presentation skills Comfortable working in a highly fast paced environment. Experience in consultative security fields; incident response, forensic investigations, threat intelligence, penetration testing, etc. Public speaking experience; Bachelor's degree preferred
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Computer & Network Security

description: Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?  We are looking for Regional Service Business Manager to make an impact!  At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability.  Schneider Electric has an opportunity for a Regional Services Manager for the East Asia Japan region focusing on the Services Business Development in the Semiconductor and eMobility segments.  “More Digital. More Services!” – Jean Pascal Tricoire! In a dynamic and rapidly evolving part of the business, you will have great autonomy to DISRUPT the status quo, be ENTREPRENEURIAL, and make a huge difference to CUSTOMER relationships.  This HIGH PROFILE position will develop your LEADERSHIP skills and gain you exposure to many senior leaders giving you fantastic EXPOSURE and EXPERIENCE to develop your career. This Job is really made for you.  What you will do:  The Regional Service Business Manager (RSBM) is accountable for developing the Services business for eMobility and Semiconductor customers in the EAJ/Greater India/Pacific zones. The RSBM will work with Country Services team to grow the Services business at Strategic Accounts, Multi-Country Target Accounts and selected CTAs. Growth will be measured by order growth of Services, but also includes key business metrics such as Digital Services ratio, overall Service Ratio, Share of wallet, CAGR, key Service Offer growth, pipeline of major opportunities/iniatives.  She/he will be as the SPOC for the Segment in the region.  Key Responsibilities: For assigned Region, develop Field Service business 3-year plan and current year action plan with eMobility & Semicon Regional leadership and specific Accounts Managers, and Country FS V2 management. Monitors execution of annual plan and reports to eMobility & Semicon stakeholders success and challenges. Makes annual evaluation of customer profile to ensure focus is on highest value customers for Services. Ensures the quality and accuracy of BFO and IB Intel Engages directly with customers to understand asset life cycle needs and creates service plan OPEX strategy for maintenance and modernization of critical electrical infrastructures Engages directly with customers to understand CAPEX investments and opportunities for Installation, Commissioning and Testing (IC&T) services. description: Aon is currently recruiting a Regional Assessment Sales Lead to join our team in Singapore.  About Aon Headquartered in London, Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement andealth solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.   The Opportunity  Aon’s Assessment Solutions is a leader in online assessment for employee selection and development. Our innovative and technologically advanced solutions are used globally in over 70 countries and 40 languages, supporting organisations in every aspect of their employee assessment needs - recruitment, selection, leadership development and succession planning. We provide tools, knowledge and expertise for the scientific measurement of talent and potential, thus, enabling companies to create and sustain competitive advantage through high quality workforce.  Responsibilities  Business Development Lead on sales activities: lead generation, networking, campaigns, pipeline management, contracting across the region. Work to understand complex local account needs, gain trust, manage the price and scope negotiation process to profitably benefit the business. Develop an effective method for targeting and conducting outbound sales calls. Refresh product value propositions and sales materials. Drive marketing and sales handshake/strategy for the Assessment Solutions business. Embed sales process around inbound product related opportunities to ensure quicker allocation and Client responsiveness. Take responsibility for sales discipline: increase response time to Clients, ensure use of an appropriate sales management framework including go/no-go decisions. Leverage understanding of other Assessment Solutions services to facilitate broader Client conversations and maximise company profit while servicing Client’s needs. Collaborate with colleagues across the APAC & MEA markets to support their efforts in selling products and consulting services in their respective markets. Generate appropriate responses to RFPs, sales presentations and proposals.  Sales Leadership Role model a sales & growth culture and how to successfully leverage Aon’s full range of capabilities when selling (e.g., selling across practice areas, lines of business) Help define the sales strategy to deliver new product sales. Sales strategy to include roles and responsibilities of products sales team, individual targets, reporting, sales process and sales management activities. Develop an action plan for each direct report by reviewing current processes, training needs etc and provide training, coaching, mentoring as required. Participate in setting strategy, annual budgets and staffing plans with the regional leadership team. Share business development techniques and/or Client management skills with colleagues across the APAC & MEA region.  Requirements  10 years’ experience in B2B sales, business development and client management. Experienced in selling talent assessment related products and solutions. Demonstrated track record of setting up, developing and growing a high achieving product sales team. Demonstrated ability to identify, negotiate and close complex, strategically valuable sales to new and existing Clients. Advanced business development and negotiation skills with the ability to influence multiple stakeholders including C-suites. Ability to self-start and independently initiate new opportunities. Be a confident communicator with the ability to work with and effectively manage a diverse range of stakeholders. Strong presentation, written and verbal communication, engagement and interpersonal skills. Client and customer centric mindset. Be able to work under pressure and have the skills to manage multiple projects/pitches within business deadlines.  How to Apply Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.

description: Are You The One  MatchMove is looking for an Operations and Sales Analyst who is excited to contribute in building a highly motivated and performance team within the Commercial Department.  Come join our dynamic team !  Job Responsibilities  Conduct market research and pull internal data from multiple sources to identify new business opportunities and build business cases on new products and sales opportunities. Support our Commercial Team in building common library resources on sales processes, business case studies, and use of standardized sales tools such as Sales Tools such as Monday.com and HubSpot for all countries, in order to improve operational efficiency. Collaborate with various teams across the Asia region to improve or define internal processes to promote operational efficiency and sales effectiveness. Proactively interact with the Commercial Team to continuously find ways to identify and create synergies between existing systems, processes for improvements to increase customer satisfaction and maximize sales potential growth. Align, consolidate and prepare business presentations. Assimilate all new Commercial hires across global locations to the Company by conducting orientation on the Company’s sales and operations processes, product training and sharing the current/past business cases. Identify training needs, develop and roll out individual coaching plans for the team to build a highly motivated and a high performance team. Support CCO in administering meetings, preparation and any administrative activities.  Requirements  Bachelor degree in business administration, economics, statistics or related field. Relevant inhouse training and market research experience in the finance, ePayment, Fintech and/or eCommerce sector. Knowledge of sales processes and business tools such as Monday.com and HubSpot CRM. Have prior experience in planning and delivering inhouse training and orientation materials to internal staff. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. High attention to detail with good problem-solving skills. Good analytical and logical thinking skills. Strong proficiency in MS Powerpoint and Excel skills. Able to multitask and work independently in a fast-paced environment. A good team-player, proactive and self-motivated.  MatchMove Culture  To work in a fast-moving growing start-up, fun and yet professional environment that recognizes and rewards individual contributions and team success. To work with highly motivated and diverse people who are totally focused on winning by combining great teamwork, rapid execution and an uncompromising approach to quality and customer satisfaction. We strongly encourage Innovation, Collaboration, Creativity, and Initiative.  Personal Data Protection Act  By submitting your application for this job, you are authorizing MatchMove to:  collect and use your personal data, and to disclose such data to any third party with whom MatchMove or any of its related corporation has service arrangements, in each case for all purposes in connection with your job application, and employment with MatchMove; and retain your personal data for one year for consideration of future job opportunities (where applicable).

description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  Job Purpose  The Sales Program Manager (SPM) will be part of the Field Sales channel, a member of the regional team responsible for the commercial success of the region. The SPM is responsible for pre-sales and post-sales activities for the region, such as sales lead funnel management, sales and shipper programs, and sales promotions to accelerate the sales effectiveness of the countries  Intro of Field Sales  The Field Sales channel will focus on offering final mile delivery solutions in the express domestic parcel segment to SMEs. The department is responsible for the revenue development and profitability of this segment within Ninja Van in the local market. The regional channel is seen as a major source for diversification of revenue for the Ninja Van organization and is heavily involved in supporting the local countries with sales processes, measurements, and governance.  Responsibilities Define and own the lead generation framework regionally. Responsible for top, mid, and bottom of the funnel performance as it feeds into the country sales process. Unify the various stakeholders in the process from Digital Marketing, Trade Marketing, Lead Qualification, and the sales team into achieving a robust yet scalable process in the supply through conversion of leads. Create and spearhead outbound lead generation programs to identify strong potential prospects. Lead in-country Lead Management team to achieve their intended performance and KPIs. Collaborate closely with Sales Enablement colleagues to ensure alignment of channel priorities and deliverables. Work in collaboration with Content, Marketing Program Managers, and Product Marketing to develop effective messaging for outbound communications to support the Customer Journey. Supporting country teams in building and aligning their sales promotions and conformity to regional commercial guidelines. Develop and prepare performance scorecards, dashboards, and data analysis by country, channel to reflect own performance and achievement. Align with regional sales planning teams on theirs observations of the country sales process gaps and support with the required sales campaigns to boost performance. Define, deploy and administer sales campaigns launched from the region. Requirements Minimally a Bachelor Degree with at least 5 years of demonstrable experience in a similar capacity Direct experience in sales, customer success, presales, or sales support roles. Advantageous to possess regional experience and familiarity in Salesforce CRM system Advantageous to possess experience in digital marketing and/or the logistics industry Excellent analytical skills and stakeholder management Good organizational and time management skills with the flexibility to reprioritize as necessary Strong communication skills as the role require lines of communication with multiple audiences across the region Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

description: Company Introduction: Matrixport is Asia’ fastest growing one-stop digital asset financial services platform. With $10 billion in assets under management and custody, it provides one-stop crypto financial services with over $5 billion in average monthly trading volumes. The offerings include Cactus Custody™, spot OTC, fixed income, structured products, lending as well as asset management. Headquartered in Singapore, Matrixport’s mission is to make crypto easy for everyone and its motto is “Get More From Your Crypto”. The company has over 220 employees serving both institutions and retail customers in Asia and Europe.  Why Join us: At Matrixport, we believe that teamwork allows us to tackle complex challenges together. Every team player is valued, has a voice that can be heard and a contribution that can be made. You can expect to make a difference and have direct impact towards the success of the company. We seek the passionate and the courageous who can imbue their expertise into the crypto community and build a better product for the next one billion users. We are looking for an energetic and ambitious Business Development Manager to help us expand our DeFi use-cases. You will be the front of the company and will have the dedication to create and apply an effective expansion strategy. You will also work closely with our marketing and community team. The goal is to drive sustainable growth through boosting users and forging strong relationships with DeFi projects.   Job Introduction: What are CC-Tokens? CC-Tokens are the ERC20 tokens backed 1:1 with blockchain assets bring you cross-chain transaction convenience and extra value. All M-Tokens are fully backed and safeguarded by qualified third-party custodians.  Website https://www.crosschain.network/ Twitter https://twitter.com/CrosschainToken Medium https://crosschaintoken.medium.com/introducing-cross-chain-tokens-the-rebranded-version-of-m-tokens-1b646868c072  Job Responsibilities Develop a growth strategy focused both on users gain and customer(DeFi protocols) satisfaction Handle DeFi clients in the blockchain space Promote the company’s products/services (such as increasing use cases) addressing or predicting clients’ objectives Provide trustworthy feedback and after-sales support Keep records of user base, DeFi use cases etc. Build long-term relationships with new and existing customers (DeFi protocols)  Qualifications Proven working experience as a business development manager, sales executive or a relevant role Experience of sales within the blockchain (crypto) industry Experience handling and managing clients Communication and negotiation skills Excellent service-mind and strong understanding of blockchain minder mind The ability to communicate both verbally and in writing in English & Chinese due to the need to interact with stakeholders Experience in customer support Understanding of financial infrastructure and DeFi protocols

description: Position Summary  The Dir – Business Development will find new and manage existing partnerships as well as coordinate our approach and sales strategy on large business opportunities. This role identifies, pursues, and secures business with new clients to meet or exceed individual and vertical sales goals within a geographical region, country, and/or territory. The Dir – Business Development also establishes and maintains relationships with key customer executives within the industry.    Job Responsibilities  •   Grows the company’s revenue and profitability by expanding client base. •   Identifies prospective clients through analysis of current marketplace data and a strong understanding of the industry, its challenges and opportunities. •   Establishes and owns relationships with key contacts at prospective clients, and develops prospects into becoming new clients. Owns client relationship from prospect stage to client stage. •   Works to maximize net sales, volume, share position and promotes the company to meet strategic business objectives.  •   Builds and uses simple business models to analyze profitability of various business cases and make recommendations to next level management for approval to improve company profitability. •   Directs a specific annual revenue target based on estimated forecasts for new clients. •   Develops and maintains prospective clients’ pipeline, forecasts and revenues, and provides regular activity reports to Senior Management and Leadership. •   Develops effective forecasting models considering the company’s product/service umbrella, existing clients’ experience, current market and business conditions, and gathered prospective client’s intelligence on business challenges and needs to help establish strategies and priorities, and drive decisions. •   Develops effective responses to Requests for Proposals (RFP) as needed. •   Organizes and facilitates meetings with targeted prospective clients and internal teams to identify adequate services/offerings to meet prospective clients’ needs.  •   Creates strong and effective internal partnerships with client and product teams to ensure services are properly scoped and priced to meet prospective client needs, and initial projects stay within scope, budget, timeline, quality and other Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).  •   Participates in the Strategic Account Planning (SAPs) process; drives the growth required to meet financial goals by developing and executing the annual strategic Account Plans as it pertains to new clients. •   Participates in, and often leads, the development and delivery of innovative proposals to capture both account growth and new business opportunities. •   Develops and implements the strategic and tactical plans (e.g., pricing, products, programs) for each major account and drives results directly through the District Sales Managers and Regional Managers.  •   Takes best practices of Major Accounts and works to execute them within the Division’s smaller accounts. •   Collaborates with management of major accounts to develop sales programs/presentations, and marketing initiatives to be used by the major accounts. •   Develops sales tools and collateral materials for both internal & external customers. •   Plans, directs, and coordinates activities of employee(s) to ensure goals or objectives are accomplished. Mentors, coaches, trains and develops team. •   Additional duties as assigned.   Qualifications/Requirements  •   Bachelor’s Degree in Business Development or related field •   Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s) preferred •   10+ years progressive sales and business development experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience •   Understand margin calculations, profit and loss.  •   8+ years in a leadership role (direct or indirect) •   Periodic travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required. •   High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications •   Strong analytical, prioritising, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills  •   Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning) •   Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts •   Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients •   Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. •   Ability to work with and influence peers and senior management •   Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting   SGK is a global packaging and brand experience company. From idea to implementation, we deliver packaging solutions and brand experiences that give brands the freedom to speak louder, scale faster and grow stronger. We simplify marketing and amplify brands to deliver value. SGK is a Matthews International company.  Matthews International endeavors to make our employment website and application process accessible to all users and applicants. In doing so, Matthews International provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation or assistance completing the application process, please contact a member of our Human Resource Team.

description: Vesta is seeking a professional in Singapore area focused on relationship building and a consultative approach to account management to take on the role of Strategic Account Director reporting into the General Manager, APAC. We are looking for someone uniquely motivated with the right background in enterprise accounts to be devoted to the growth and retention of a new and strategic enterprise partner. This partner is a leader in the financial services industry, including innovative payment schemes, processing services, risk and compliance, and business insights and optimization, so your experience in this sector is key to being a successful candidate for this role.  The right candidate will be an exceptional relationship-builder with a gift for creating trusting, consultative relationships. You will also have a proven track-record of generating revenue growth over time based on your ability to deepen existing relationships and by providing great service and successful engagement to find win-win solutions. With this in mind, you will come to the table with a seasoned professional background, very strong basic business acumen, and a skill for strategic and creative thinking.  More tactically speaking, as a Strategic Account Director, you will be responsible for developing and managing the end-to-end relationship including retention and growth strategies for key enterprise accounts. Through exceptional account management disciplines you will ensure your customers are highly engaged and understand how Vesta continuously delivers significant value to them within the context of their broader business strategy. You will ensure effective launch and product/solution adoption as well as build strategic account plans that drive ongoing account expansion and growth. You will also partner with our Customer Success team to deliver on day-to-day customer commitments and provide prioritization direction to that team.   Core Responsibilities: Develop trusted relationships with executive team. Spend significant time at customer sites (physically and virtually) building and maintaining the customer relationship. Prepare and deliver regular business reviews based on an in-depth understanding of the business and pain points. Communicate technical and commercial information, leading efforts to resolve customer issues.  Grow the business by leading this key customer’s strategic activities, including the development of detailed account growth strategies and plans that meet revenue, penetration, share and adoption goals. Lead efforts to build market share with this partner and grow opportunities with them. Partner with Customer Success to ensure successful onboarding, handoffs, and renewals.  Partner effectively across the organization with Customer Success, Approval Operations, Product and marketing to execute on account growth plans.  Lead multi-disciplinary cross divisional teams toward the achievement of technical and commercial objectives. Regularly assess the processes and players and be the go-to resource and pro-active thinker with regards to how to navigate changes in the ecosystem, organization, etc.  Education & Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree required and Master’s Degree in Business or related field or equivalent professional experience required 5-10 years of experience in payments/merchant acquirer and fraud solutions. 3-5 years of industry experience: ecommerce, payments, prepaid, gift card, and/or fintech industry. 8 -10 years of experience managing enterprise or regional accounts with proven track record of delivering revenue growth through relationship management Fluent in English, Mandarin a plus  Competencies Required: An understanding of and experience working with the financial services industry, specifically in payments, processing services, risk and compliance, and channel management. Proven ability to hit the ground running and make sense and plans out of ambiguity. People management and/or cross-functional project team leadership experience required Expert level customer relationship management skills. Professional executive presence. Strong leadership skills characterized by the ability to inspire, galvanize and drive cross-functional teams towards common goals. Superior communication and presentation skills – able to develop and tell a compelling, data-based story that influences others. Proficient in developing professional and aesthetic presentations. Proven ability to maintain, develop, and implement best practices for strategic account management processes. Expert in the sales process, including understanding of key steps with demonstrated closing skills and demonstrated knowledge Strong curiosity and research and analysis skills that support you in learning about your customer, their challenges and the industry context at a rapid pace. Strategic, critical and creative thinker able to develop compelling win-win solutions and ideas. Effective negotiation and influencing skills; comfortable modeling and leveraging data and financial analysis to influence. Familiarity and comfort with legal contract, language and priorities in contracting. Demonstrated ability to interface with different personalities; bring emotional maturity to challenging situations and be humble when the situation calls for it. Willingness to travel up to 30% - 40%; likely include international travel English / Mandarin Bilingual required  About Vesta Vesta is a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company that specializes in managing payments in the “card-not-present” (CNP) arena. We use next-level technologies and cutting-edge data science methodologies to bring unparalleled accuracy to fraud detection. Our zero liability solutions let merchants step fearlessly into the world of online commerce, so they can stop chargebacks—without stopping business.    Vesta is reinventing ourselves for the future in an industry that is growing and changing at the same time. We are looking for talented people to join us who resonate with our Vesta Values: trust, partner, empower, passion and courage -- and who love to tackle new challenges every day.     We are also a casual, fun and flexible workplace that also offers highly competitive benefits including a selection of medical, dental and vision care options, paid parental leave, generous paid-time-off and a paid sabbatical program. Vesta is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national

description: The Manager, Marketplaces manages and executes marketing solutions and campaigns while monitoring online marketplaces trends and developments to strategize action plans to drive an increase in business for 10 marketplaces in 5 markets (SG, MY, TH and INDO) within South APAC. He/she will also be responsible in overseeing the operational workflows and processes that attribute to the launching of online products and content campaigns. The key role of this position is to establish a strong web presence on marketplaces to gain new customers and the growth in retention rate.  Job Responsibilities Develop marketing and acquisition strategies for online Marketplaces like Shopee and Lazada that leads to customer conversions Develop and establish a strong web presence to gain new online customers and grow retention rate Managing digital campaigns across all marketplace sites Manage the end to end merchandising of the ecommerce platform which includes inbound and outbound requirements of the agreed product roll outs Drive on-site merchandising to reflect the category and collection targets for the season Establish best practices in digital marketing across functions like SEO, Performance Marketing, Digital Content and UX/UI Ensure brand consistency through all marketing channels and efforts Oversee implementations, operations and analysis of customers and partners marketing campaigns Analyze web traffic metrics, customer and product trends to identify new opportunities for sales and profitability Collate, analyze and provide demand planning-related trends (i.e. sell through and OTB assumptions) for better and more effective planning outputs Identify gaps in digital channels and marketing strategies, and offer strategies to resolve the issues Works closely with Marketing team on the alignment of brand building activities on marketplaces platforms  Job Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in IT or related field preferred Minimum 5 years of experience in ecommerce-related environment with at least 2 year of supervisory or management experience included Demonstrated creative thinking Logically thinking, good at analytics Strong presentation skills Excellent communication and negotiation skills Focus on financial success with ability to formulate strategies based on market needs and the Company goals Presentable, diligent and positive working attitude, multi-task and detail-oriented Demonstrated delivery of sales targets, budget development and tracking, and demand forecasting

description: MicroCare, LLC is looking for a Regional Sales Manager- Asia 92921.  MicroCare, LLC is an ISO 9001:2015 registered company specializing in cleaning coating and lubricating fluids used in the installation and manufacture of a broad range of products in the electronics, medical, fiber optic and metal fabricating industries. Since 1983 we have pioneered hundreds of environmentally progressive and sustainable products in response to emerging regulatory demands and our customers' evolving cleaning and coating needs.  We are a company with heart.  At all our facilities across the globe, we work in a cheerful, inclusive, and collaborative environment where we respect, encourage, and support our customers, our suppliers and each other.  We like to laugh; have fun and we make an important impact.  If you are looking to bring your knowledge of chemistry and skills to a place that appreciates your contribution, MicroCare is your new home.  You will work collaboratively with the APAC regional team based in Singapore and as well as the parent company or subsidiaries in the USA and Europe.  You are required to implement territory-based sales & marketing strategies and sales initiatives to meet the company’s growth objectives in a team-based setting.  This role is key in managing different brands, channels, and industry sectors.  This is a solid challenge for the right candidate and an opportunity to take up higher-level responsibilities.  This role requires between 30-50% international travel.  Responsibilities: Hold business development responsibility for primary regions in Southeast Asia, and secondary regions in the rest of Asia and ANZ.   Drive sales and demand across multiple brands (2-3) and industry segments, aligning with company’s objectives and revenue budget. Develop and continue growing channel or/and distribution partner network as force multipliers. Be a technical resource and first point of contact to end-customers or partners.  Establish and lead direct sales calls with end customers or joint sales calls with partners, and conduct product demonstrations, when and where required. Engage customers or partners on usage forecasts and subsequently update/ coordinate with internal team members. Execute training programs for partner’s sales force or any end-users. Assist General Manager in planning sales forecasts, pipelines, and marketing events. Generate weekly sales reports to General Manager. Maintain constant networking with key industry players and regularly contributes business or competitors’ intel to the team members. Provide constructive product or customer feedback to internal co-workers. Work closely with General Manager and USA Product Managers to develop & execute strategic plans with relation to global-accounts, channel-growth, product,  pricing, quality, or marketing etc. Be a Brand Ambassador for the company. Assist marketing team and designers with both print and online or digital marketing materials/content for Asia Pacific territories. Support all marketing events or activities, trade -shows and conferences. Hold direct responsibility in coordinating regulatory requests and replies, between customers and Global Regulatory Colleague. Contribute and input data into company’s ERP/CRM system. Participate and contribute during online calls and meetings.  Additional duties or responsibilities may be assigned from time to time.  Minimum Qualifications: Minimum 5-10 years of sales & marketing experience In depth knowledge in consumable-products selling Proven knowledge in business-to-business distribution-based sales, and seeking sales opportunities with end-users when required Degree or equivalent experience in telecommunication, engineering, chemical engineering, or business related Preferred experience or some experience in handling customers from manufacturing, electronics, telecommunication, and/or fiber-optics related field(s) Possess both "hunter" and "farmer" skill sets (50-50) Strategic thinking and able to influence mid-to-top-level decision making Good presentation skills, with the ability to articulate value proposition to customers Effective, proactive communication skills and strong interpersonal skills Highly approachable and able to work with people from all walks of life Team player, able to work cross functionally between business units, functional departments, or different time zones Independent, a self-starter, good listener, and a problem solver Able to converse and read/write in English and Mandarin  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability or protected veteran status. Role Purpose:   Account Executives are key drivers of Jumio’s growth through leading new customer acquisition. You will be responsible for identifying and progressing opportunities, managing the sales cycle, and negotiating successful contracts in order to commence long term partnerships with new enterprise customers. Helping them to eliminate identity fraud and making the digital world a safer place.   Role Value:   Growing Jumio’s pipeline, revenue and market share in a rapidly expanding domain is fundamental to Jumio’s continued success. Account Executives are at the heart of the company’s global expansion and directly impact revenue, profitability and EBITDA. New customers and new revenue streams increase the value of the business and the impact we make on improving the world of online identity verification.     Responsibilities:  Delivering against agreed new business sales targets, revenue and new logo customer acquisition  Selling into companies across a number of industries including Sharing Economy, Gaming, Fintech, Banking and more.  Identification and development of opportunities with successful pipeline and process management through to deal completion Market mapping and researching prospects and their business needs and drivers - building relationships across target customers  Networking and event attendance and management Compelling articulation of Jumio’s offerings and competitive products, pricing and proposal models Closing deals resulting in the taking of market share from competitors Developing contacts through calls, emails, meetings and conferences Asking great questions to obtain detailed information to deliver effective solution presentations to prospects Maintaining accurate records of all sales activities for purposes of maintaining and further developing the Jumio’s sales pipeline Developing lasting, positive and productive relationships with Jumio’s clients - securing referrals and testimonials that lead to new business opportunities Working collaboratively with colleagues in pre-sales, marketing and account management to provide outstanding customer experience   Experience and Qualifications:  A track record of building relationships across Enterprise Accounts at the C-Level - achieving sales quotas of $1-2M+ per year  5+ years experience selling value-add software solutions to new customers  Excellent ability to identify and articulate value to customers through written and verbal communication  Prospecting skills and experience of prioritizing potential clients Proven negotiation and closing skills, Forecasting and financial planning and strategy skills Proficiency in CRM - SFDC preferable  Great to have Experience and Qualifications:   Established network of contacts in regional enterprise customers Existing knowledge of the ID verification, AML or KYC market Competitor product awareness and insight  Degree educated is preferred, not essential Proven experience managing deal sizes ranging from $30,000 to $3M+ Comfortable with sales cycles of between 3-9 months  Experience with reseller / system integration channels in Asia in cyber security solutions / identity management solutions is advantageous Fluency in English is crucial, additional knowledge of Mandarin or Bahasa Melayu would be beneficial   Key Characteristics and Attitudes:  Ambitious and driven Adaptable and flexible  Articulate and persuasive High IQ and EQ Curious and coachable  Commercially aware Resilient and tenacious Big picture and the detail   Example Objectives:  Jumio offers a richly rewarding sales career opportunity to strong sales performers. Sales employees have the opportunity to offer Jumio’s platform services in eKYC / AML to enterprises across the APAC market, to attain annual revenue objectives.   @Work:  Jumio Singapore office is located at Centennial Tower. It is the APAC headquarters comprising a small team of energetic, motivated staff members across sales, consulting, marketing functions. It is a friendly, social culture where everyone comes together to celebrate each other’s success and provide support in resolving challenges.  Company:  Jumio is the future for online and mobile ID verification. We are the largest and fastest growing company in the ID verification space. With a global footprint, we’re expanding the team to meet strong client demand across a range of industries including Financial Services, Travel, Sharing Economy, Fintech, Gaming, and others.   Equal Opportunities: Jumio is a collaboration of people with different ideas, strengths, interests and cultures. We welcome applications and colleagues from a wide range of backgrounds and statuses.

description: Description  AWS is seeking a world-class Sales professional to manage the "down-stream" global customer relationships with a globally significant FSIs that have operations in APAC and are head-quartered in the US or EMEA.  The Sales Leader will be responsible for providing global business leadership and management of global customer relationship and core account team. The Sales Leader will execute the CXO relationship strategy, including engaging with AWS senior leadership team for executive sponsorship, coordinating executive business reviews, and maintaining customer satisfaction.  Responsibilities The Sales Leader is responsible for teaming with the customer’s board, IT, digital and cloud leaders to build strategic relationships globally. Articulating a clear vision and generating enthusiasm, while impacting all business groups. Responsible for working at the most strategic level within the customer and implementing a broad strategy for earning customer adoption, acceptance and service implementation. This includes line management responsibility. Development of formal case studies and other forms of references highlighting activity and workloads running on AWS is core to the role. Preferred Qualifications  Experience as the Sales Leader for a global federated enterprise working with multiple business units and influencing governance and policy is a plus. description: Business Analyst Office Location: Central  Client is a global consumer goods company. They are rapidly expanding their presence in Singapore and setting up their regional headquarters here. To support this strategic initiative, they are looking for a Business Analyst to join their regional team in Singapore.  As a Business Analyst, you will have a crucial role in translating the business requirements into reporting deliverables, and you will assist the Brand & Country teams with dashboards and a variety of reports. You will also be supporting the team in identifying and analysing the business needs and proposing workable / constructive action points.  Reporting to the brand head, you will help to find answers to emerging business questions and solutions to operational challenges. You will be supporting Brand teams / countries in identifying and analysing the channel needs and proposing workable / constructive action points in favour of the growth of the channel.  The ideal candidate will: Assist with designing KPIs, reports and dashboards to improve business performance and operational efficiency Analyse and report sales performance, pricing, gross margins progress (Weekly / Monthly sales) Prepare ad-hoc analysis and execute data mining requests to support the team's new initiatives and projects Prepare P&L analysis Assist in the monthly & quarterly forecasting, and the yearly business plan preparations based on past, present and planned operations. Liaise, coordinate and support the relevant commercial and operational teams Constantly develop methods to ensure the data quality and improve analysis to better support business decisions. Actively engage and propose action points based on analysis done that could help achieve growth & performance plans of the channel. Analyse channel performance on assortment and sub-channel level and recommend actions centrally (regional mgmt. & product teams) and locally (country teams) to improve sales & profitability Carefully analyse & interpret data through logical thinking Work with IT on system-implementation of specific actions points  Requirements Possess a degree in Marketing, Statistics or Economics At least 5 years of relevant experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in the FMCG / Premium Retail sectors Experience in the following: Statistics, data, analytics Big data management / data warehousing Tableau / Dashboard set up CRM Data Management  Ability to synthesize large amounts of data, translate findings into clear insights and communicate these convincingly Experience with Analytics and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI Intermediate to advance knowledge with MS Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Good to have: (i) Statistical knowledge and experience with using statistical software tools (e.g. SPSS, SAS); (ii) Experienced in BI concepts, database management, data modelling, SQL & ETL tools  Personal Traits: A quick & eager learner; curious. Able to ask the right questions Able to see the big picture and create holistic view of the channel’s performance A self-starter with a strong ‘can-do’ attitude and not afraid of voicing ideas Cool and calm in a high-demanding environment in transition, can handle multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities Can work independently, resourcefully and creatively to research and implement new solutions Be an enthusiastic team member and act as an ambassador of the brand Think out of the box and challenge status quo. Be pro-active and show problem-solving mind-set. Have a strong sensing of Customer’s needs and behaviours. Ability to perform well under pressure in a deadline-driven environment.   (EA Licence No. 14C7000) (EA Personnel Registration No.: R1325063)

description: Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam has evolved into one of the world's leading premium spirits companies... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with a legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and entrepreneurial spirit. Our new company, Beam Suntory Inc. has now become the World’s #3 premium spirits company with unparalleled expertise in whisky has recently been formed and is now the 3rd Spirits business globally.  We are looking for a seasoned "Brand Manager" to develop and drive the branding strategies for our "Ready to Drink (RTD)" portfolio  Position Mission:  Supports the Senior Marketing Manager in developing strategic brand direction of RTD portfolio, delivering against key value, brand health and volume/sales/profit growth objectives. Responsible for the brand investment and P&L results of RTD.  This role partners with internal stakeholders, agencies, and external distributors to develop strategies to accelerate net sales and profit growth to deliver sustainable over-budget performance. Responsibilities:  •Formulate, deploy and monitor the marketing strategy of the company for advertising and promotion of defined brands maintaining compliance with applicable regulations & company policy. •Create & deploy channel specific visibility & promotional programs, define merchandising norms, etc., to enhance the brand experience of customers across all touch points the brand makes with the customer. •Assist the global brand teams in conceptualization and designing of required communication protocols, creative content/ promotional material for all branding/ advertising initiatives for the market. •Continuously monitor the market and competitive landscape to evaluate the existing and upcoming opportunities/ challenges, help the marketing team to devise counter measures to competitor moves, alter strategy to help company brands gain and strengthen market position. •Contribute to NPD strategies for future growth of the brands. Especially with reference to developing commercially valid RTD and FS outcomes. •New product development cross functional team member or leader •Market opportunity identification & capitalization – in consultation with the innovation & insights team •Assist the marketing manager in establishing a robust data analytical and MIS function aimed at monitoring and tracking the sales performance of company’s brands through primary and secondary market data analysis. •Support markets with deployment of assets, identifying agencies and maintaining pricing in market per global brand guidelines. •Maintain & grow online/social/e-comm presence & SOV per brand requirement. •Liaison with PR/media agencies, art designers, copywriters, etc., to formulate promotional/ campaign strategy and material. •Key lead for full portfolio off-trade promotional plans across key markets  Qualifications & Experience  •Degree in Business Admin, Marketing or its equivalent •6-8 years relevant experience. •Experience in managing RTD/Cider/Beer is added advantage  Key Relationships  •External agencies •Cross Functional Business Team which includes Commercial, NPD, SCM •Distributors’ teams •Beam Suntory NPD teams •Beam Suntory Insights manager  Job Specific Competencies  •Developing Brand Strategy •Briefing & judging creative development •Effective analysis, interpretation & recommendation based on key brand data (e.g. brand profitability, market information, consumer insights) •Ability to influence and partner with all external stakeholders (agencies, sales agent) •Effective collaboration cross functionally •Excellent project manager with a proven record and an understanding of efficient cost control. •Preparing and delivering effective presentations •Service orientated individual, resilient with a positive outlook •Professional, constructive and mature team leadership •Balanced judgment and commercial mindset, leveraging fact and intuition in a timely manner •Demonstrated strong planning and organizational skills to deliver excellence in execution •Ability to make decisions and apply judgment •Strong communication skills (both oral and written) •Creativity to identify alternative approaches and solutions •A confident manner and the ability to influence and persuade constructively •Enthusiasm to roll the sleeves up and make things happen  Beam Suntory Behavioral Competencies  •Entrepreneurial Approach •Creating Innovative Solutions •Beating the Competition…. description: Job Overview: The Enterprise Solutions team serves global organizations, including leading companies, governments, and nonprofits, who seek to upskill or retrain their workforce with the world’s best education. This team is made up of three sub-teams: Sales, Customer Success, and Revenue Strategy & Operations. The teams operate globally and have members based out of our offices in Mountain View, New York, London, Gurgaon, and Abu Dhabi.   We are looking for an Business Development Manager who can help us empower Universities & Higher-ed Institutions in Asia to offer the world’s best education to their employees and students respectively. Our ideal candidate is a passionate, entrepreneurial sales manager who can prospect, develop, and close large enterprise deals in Asia. You should have extensive experience of sales to large enterprises /universities / higher education institutions. Your knowledge of edtech, enterprise learning / training combined with superior communication skills and analytical abilities will shape Coursera’s enterprise business. description: As part of robust business expansion and growth, the RGE group is seeking high potential talents to join us as Senior Manager, Sales & Marketing.  The role may be based in Singapore, China or Indonesia.  When you are successfully hired, you will begin your career with the group in one of our key businesses or product lines. Afterwards, you may be assigned to other businesses or functions, subject to your career goals and capabilities. Eventually, the aim is to develop you to take on senior management roles with P&L and/or key functional responsibilities within the group.             You can visit http://www.rgei.com for more info about our group and businesses.  Responsibilities Contribute to the development and execution of the group’s sales & marketing strategy in globally identified markets to fulfil growth and annual profitability targets. Drive and coordinate sales & marketing strategies. description: About us Fairmart is an early-stage community commerce company with a mission to help local stores thrive in the digital age. It is our belief that local stores should have access to the same capabilities that larger businesses have, but built for their scale. To achieve this, we take a multidisciplinary approach to building solutions that are simple to use, yet powerful in their impact. We're based in the JTC Launchpad - a heart of Singapore's startup community. We are a diverse team of technologists and builders who love to see the direct impact of our work on the lives of our customers. Those who are successful at Fairmart are intensely curious and bring a fierce passion to their work. You should be results-oriented, but also be people-oriented and understand the broader context of each problem you solve. Our culture is our competitive advantage, and you will have a unique opportunity to nurture its evolution and growth. Our founders bring a combined 25 years of experience from industry giants such as Shopback, Redmart, and DJI. The company is supported by prominent VCs such as Entrepreneur First, HAX, and SOSV.  What You'll Be Doing Spearhead Fairmart's sales and partner development program to unlock digital commerce for physical stores Develop and execute sales and partner acquisition strategies in response to company objectives Passionately represent Fairmart to customers, partners, and industry stakeholders Lead a team of 2-3 BDAs, including their training and career development Collaborate with product, marketing, and customer success teams to ensure our users realize the full potential of Fairmart's technology Skills & Experience You’ll Need Ambitious, goal-oriented mind set with a strong passion for growth Strong track-record in owning and delivering against a sales pipeline Passion for supporting small businesses to realize the benefits of technology Experience in training, organizing, and managing a sales, business development, or partnerships team Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve company objectives Perks and Benefits Performance based incentive scheme. Open, respectful and creative company culture. Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution. Work with people who love what they do every day. Qualifications Diploma in Business, communication, or related field. At least 3 - 5 years' of relevant work experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Mandarin. Ability to work independently, multi-task, organize and prioritize work.

description: Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world’s leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing startups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation.  At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in Singapore. Learn more about a career opportunity as an Enterprise Account Manager in the Singapore Team at AWS.  As an Enterprise Account Manager, you will be responsible for driving customer digital transformation through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, and developers. You will be a brand custodian working to support our customers, partners and end-users as they work with AWS, and utilise our cloud technology to innovate and improve their business outcomes.  About This Role  In this role, you will ‘Learn and Be Curious’ (see Amazon Leadership Principles) about the entire portfolio of AWS products and services across strategic accounts in the Singapore Market. As a trusted advisor, you will listen to our customers and help solve complex business transformation and growth challenges so they can focus on delivering optimal business results. Your role will include customer engagement and creating a pipeline of strategic accounts while managing existing customers. As builders, we are here to build long-term relationships with our customers. With a strong ‘Bias for Action’, you will improve user experiences while engaging with external and internal stakeholders demonstrating ‘’Customer Obsession’.  Want to know more about what it’s like to be part of our ASEAN Team at AWS? Hear from our builders: ASEAN Builders  #AWSSINGAPORE   Basic Qualifications 12+ Years of experience in technology field sales, or business development 12+ years of experience with identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing projects with Enterprise accounts Demonstrated experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners. Preferred Qualifications Experience in selling cloud solutions Cross functional engagement experience (Architect, Sales Engineer, Professional Services, Partner or ISV) Strong presentation and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences in business proficient English Extensive experience with Singapore Enterprise accounts Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore  Job ID: A1751826

description: Company Description  For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose-built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,900 companies and have detected 100 Million threats/day.  We work in a fast-paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrives on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.  Traditional security companies are becoming less relevant as cloud adoption and digital transformation become the norm in every market industry and in every market segmentation. Zscaler has been a leader in Gartner’s MQ for 10 consecutive years and has helped shape the emerging SASE category (a true category creator). We are well positioned to dominate this massively growing cloud security market.  Job Description  Position: Regional Sales Director, ASEAN  Location: Singapore  The Regional Sales Director, ASEAN will report to Regional Vice President for Large Enterprises in ASEAN & GCR Region and will be responsible for building, directing and managing all field sales within the ASEAN region. You will have the opportunity to direct and drive new business, build customer loyalty, ensure high product renewal rates and support and promote corporate strategies and initiatives. Critical to success is the ability to build and manage high-performance teams, develop and execute area business plans, allocate appropriate resources, and develop internal and external relationships.  The Zscaler sales team is comprised of smart and tenacious people who are passionate about our vision of a secure, cloud-enabled digital future. By using their talent to share that vision, Zscaler sales teams are bringing the power and agility of cloud transformation to organizations around the world. Be a part of it!  Responsibilities/What You’ll Do Lead a team of Regional Sales Managers (Field Sales Reps) to overachieve sales goals Recruit, hire and develop world class sales talent Partner with marketing and channel to create a rolling 5x pipeline Develop and execute a regional strategy that ensures quarterly sales quota achievement Ensure sales processes and programs are part of the sales culture to ensure visibility, predictability, and consistency Create and maintain an operations plan with goals and objectives for the region, based on opportunity, customer needs, and strategic direction Qualifications  Qualifications/Your Background: Bachelor's degree or global equivalent in a related field 10+ years of Enterprise Sales Leadership experience in software/SaaS Proven track record of building and leading successful sales teams Strong sales process and methodology around territory planning, assessment, and resource allocation. Extensive business travel within the region - approximately 75 percent. Strong leadership, planning, execution, people-management, and coaching skills. Strong communication skills and demonstrated ability to establish credibility and trust with customers and to build influential relationships with partners in the business, including Finance, Legal, HR, Inside Sales, Channel Partners and R&D. Understand both business and people, including their drivers and success factors. Understand and communicate the business value and/or ROI of installed and proposed products and solutions. Additional Information  Why Zscaler?  People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.  Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.  Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description: Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Amazon is looking for a talented team leader for the Amazon Global Selling business in Singapore capable of leading a team focused on general account management related to selling on Amazon global marketplaces, identification and generation of Singapore based seller leads, and targeted campaign creation with the intent of marketing to prospective Sellers in Singapore to expand their product reach with Amazon globally. The ideal candidate brings rich industry experience, strong people leadership, a relentless focus on the customer, and a big vision. In this role you will be responsible for building and leading a team in Singapore, focused on networking with Singapore Sellers to better educate them on the benefits of selling their products on Amazon’s global marketplaces.  Background on Amazon Global Selling: The Marketplace or “Selling on Amazon” business exists in 13 countries and exceeds 50% of total Amazon unit sales and growing. Each year, tens of thousands of businesses join the marketplace adding millions of new products. Our vision is to offer customers Earth’s largest selection. The Thailand team leader will deliver on this vision by identifying potential Thai seller leads and successfully marketing to these leads to bring their product selection to Amazon’s global marketplaces.  Background on this role: Amazon’s vision is to offer the earth’s largest product selection and lowest prices for our customers. One way we deliver on this vision is by recruiting and launching Sellers onto the platform and maximizing the quantity of items that they list while ensuring the highest quality of product images and information. We need a leader who understands and can communicate to Singapore Sellers the unique benefits of Amazon’s global marketplaces, can utilize innovation to craft methods of reaching prospective SG Sellers and informing them of the benefits of selling globally with Amazon, and who can construct local marketing programs and tools to drive improvements in global participation by sellers in Singapore with the ultimate goal of making all Sellers global Sellers.  Key job responsibilities  The Key Strategic Objectives For This Role Include Analyze opportunities and develop and implement account management strategies and business plans to grow selection from SG based Sellers Train and coach sales team to identify, qualify, and engage with prospective sellers for the Amazon Business Marketplace while creating a clear value proposition of selling to business customers on Amazon, along with the features and functionality Build a strong team of Sales, Account Management and Integration talent Partner with Marketing, Product, Legal, Tax, Seller Performance, and Seller Support on gating, product quality, reporting, and compliance Drive Seller success as measured by lead generation, adoption, performance, year-over-year growth and profitability Build strong communication channels at all levels of the Seller’s organization, set proper expectations, provide clear status communications, and manage towards a growth plan Implement and track metrics for recording the success and quality of the sellers in Singapore. Use these metrics to guide your work and uncover hidden areas of opportunity Participate in periodic business reviews with Amazon Executive Leadership  Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering or computer science or equivalent experience 10+ years of experience with a blend of Sales, technical, business and product and/or program management roles Experience in people management (min. 5 years of team management experience) MBA or relevant work experience Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to interact at C-level with medium to large and multinational companies Preferred Qualifications Experience leading large diverse organizations and functions to deliver consistent results Strong analytical skills. Demonstrated ability to identify and solve ambiguous problems. In particular, identifying customer (buying and selling) needs and inventing new ways to meet those needs Demonstrated ability to operate both strategically and tactically in a fast-moving and changing environment High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing priorities Successful experience in hiring, people development, and managing large multi-level teams Excellent communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills that will enable you to earn trust at all levels Strong attention to detail and desire to roll up your sleeves Experience delivering software or online products to market  Company - Amazon Asia-Pacific Holdings  Job ID: A1760958

Being a client-focused role, excellent communication, networking and presentation ability is a must to uphold BCT’s reputation in front of new prospective clients and OEM vendors Must develop good relationship with OEM vendors such as TIBCO, Coupa, IBM Good proposal development and presentation skills. As it is a lean team in Singapore, the candidate must be a hunter capable of finalizing deals independently. Though the role is based in SG, the candidate is expected to cover ASEAN market (SG, Malaysia, Philippines, Brunei)   B.    Location : Singapore
