description: Job Description  About Gnowbe  Gnowbe is building the world’s next generation “Performance Enablement Platform” for frontline business teams. With an engaging learning platform, streamlined authoring tools, and a curated content library, we help teams learn quickly and perform more effectively in the field.  Designed based on decades of cognitive science research, Gnowbe helps make on-the-job learning an engaging experience rather than a chore. Our customers use us for everything from sales enablement to compliance training.  The recipient of industry awards and global recognition, Gnowbe is growing quickly around the world. We are looking for people who share our vision, challenge the status quo, and are ready to build the future.  Senior Business Development Manager As a Senior Business Development Manager, you will be a key player in our commercial team, helping to develop and execute Gnowbe’s strategy for expanding in the Asia-Pacific market. We’re looking for someone who aspires to leadership in sales - and beyond. You get energized by both winning business yourself and helping your colleagues do so as well. You naturally spend time thinking about which organizations we should be serving, how we should be serving them, and how to best win them over. You’re used to rolling up your sleeves and getting stuff done, particularly when you’re facing ambiguous challenges. At the same time, you’re interested in developing your strategic chops as well. Above all, you like helping people thrive - especially at work. Gnowbe is taking a data-driven approach to building and scaling a commercial engine. The best candidates will be keen to work end-to-end from idea to execution. If this is you - we hope to hear from you soon! How You Will Have An Impact Source, structure, and close deals with new and existing customers Manage a self-contained team, including sales development and customer success Partner with the global leadership team in developing go-to-market strategy for the APAC market and beyond Work with cross-functional teams on the Marketing and Product roadmaps Continually challenge the status quo with the ultimate goal of building the business Requirements Need to have 6+ years of customer-facing work experience, which must include sales in some form Proven track record of driving revenue independently Ability to think end-to-end at both the client and market levels Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong interest in technology and the future of work Sense of how to effectively build trust with people Mindset to thrive while managing both yourself and a team in fast-paced, changing environments Nice to have Experience in B2B technology and software Proficiency with CRM and sales engagement tools like Salesforce Proficiency in multiple languages MBA or related degree Benefits Unlimited PTO Rewarding commission structure Opportunity to work with a global team Major opportunities for progression and promotion

description: Upon completion of training, the Renewal Sales primary objective for success is calling an existing customer base and transacting a renewal based on the rules of engagement of a specific account. Even in these selling situations, securing a renewal is the priority. Job Responsibilities Achieve your quota by selling product/service renewals for some of the most recognized technology companies, may offer to upsell opportunities when applicable. Applicants should have sufficient internet access in their homes to attend and host video calls, as well as perform essential functions of the role which include downloading and uploading of large files to shared network drives.  If this sounds like an interesting opportunity, hit (easy) apply!  All shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

description: About The Company  Pixalate is a cross-platform digital advertising fraud intelligence company, offering the only system of coordinated invalid traffic (“IVT”) detection solutions across desktop, mobile web, mobile in-app, and OTT/CTV for better detection, diagnosis, and elimination of ad fraud.  We are under midst one of the biggest shifts in ad tech right now with overwhelming industry demand for greater transparency and protection against ad fraud. Concurrently, media spends are steadily shifting more towards newer channels like OTT/CTV which are poised to explode, yet present difficult challenges around measurement and fraud protection. Pixalate is uniquely positioned to capitalize on these industry trends by being the first fraud protection provider to offer MRC accredited omni-channel fraud protection solutions that are focused on actually reducing fraud, not just measuring it, and our explosive growth over the last quarters reflect that!  Position Overview  If you are looking to bring your ad tech career to the next level while honing your SaaS sales skill sets selling a dynamic solution for the biggest problem in the industry, then this Director/ Sr. Sales role will not disappoint. We are looking for energetic and intellectually curious self-starters who will fearlessly break into new segments for us and can build their own book of business. In return, we will provide the necessary tactical and strategic training for you to be successful here, including weekly support from sales leadership, opportunities to work cross-functionally in pursuit of large strategic partnerships, and frequent collaboration with the executive team on strategy and execution. Here are just some of the things that this role will do: Build and manage full sales cycle to exceed quarterly goals for new business Become experts in ad tech, industry guidelines & compliance, fraud protection, and most importantly our clients’ businesses. Be a trusted advisor by communicating the Pixalate story effectively and explaining our technologies with conviction. Sell solutions, not features! You know how to position a technical product effectively and how to identify the best partnership opportunities with win-win deal structures. Exercise creativity in positioning our solutions to bring in bigger deals, faster. Help further enhance our go to market strategy and share crucial feedback from the field. Collaborate closely with our Customer Success, Data Science, Ad Ops, Engineering, Legal, and Marketing teams to provide an exceptional end product to our clients. Have fun! If you enjoy building new long-lasting partnerships, evangelizing solutions that solve big problems, expanding your personal network within the space, and achieving wins together with a super supportive team, you will have a blast here :)  What we are looking for: 2-5 years of quota carrying sales experience in ad tech, mobile apps, user acquisition, marketing analytics, or marketing related SaaS. You are familiar with the ad tech industry and the ecosystem. Extra plus if you have sold on a SaaS model before. Huge plus if you have sold a technical product before and have also sold to technical and product decision makers in the past. Proven track record of sales success and comfortable selling 5-7 figure deals. Extra plus if you have built your own book of business before from scratch. Entrepreneurial and willingness to take ownership of the business. Understand the necessity of being seen as a trustworthy consultant by clients and balance that effectively to transcend the typical “vendor” relationship. Highly collaborative and able to build strong relationships internally with the team Motivated by the idea of being directly in control of your own career and financial success!  Why Pixalate? Uncapped commissions with accelerators for performance Career advancement opportunities at an exciting time of new company growth: we love promoting from within and would love that next person to be you You are joining at the best time when we are still a lean team, but poised for huge growth, winning marquee clients, several moats in product advantages – and much sales opportunities available for the right talent. Flexible work hours – work from home or go into the office. But never sit in traffic anymore! Daily GrubHub lunch allowance Travel within our offices Palo Alto, Los Angeles, Dubai, London, etc. We also travel to meet with our awesome clients and to the best industry events. Experienced and accessible leadership team to learn from Full benefits including healthcare, dental, and unlimited PTO. Powered by JazzHR  Lfb6uObjaH

description: Concentrix Tigerspike is an AWS Partner Network Advanced Tier Consulting Partner and one of the most recognised specialist enterprise mobility companies in the world. We work on exciting projects and we’re looking for a Client Services Manager with 2-3 years of experience in managing relationships within the digital space.  You’ll work with talented and passionate people, who love what they do, in an informal, yet high-energy office. So, if you love technology, have a passion for innovation, and thrive in a team-based environment then read on…  Tell me more!  We take our client's visions from concept to release in as little as a few months and often work together to evolve products for years. You’ll gain experience with industries that range from NGOs to Transport and have the opportunity to nurture products and see them through to completion and into maintenance.  Concentrix Tigerspike in Singapore is located just a 5-minute walk from the Tanjong Pagar MRT station, right in the heart of the CBD area. With projects ranging from aviation, telecommunications, finance, and the government sector, our energetic team is always ready to take up any challenge with enthusiasm, enjoyment and healthy competitiveness to deliver the best products for our customers. We are a vibrant young office that boasts approximately 14 different nationalities. We enjoy weekly activities ranging from Badminton, Basketball to Futsal but what the team thrives and enjoys most is our Friday Quiz which usually ends up in friendly banter on the amount of Googling the team has done to win!  You will Be responsible for the day-to-day management of key client relationships, opportunities, as well as the overall success of our client execution and contributing to the Sales Team KPIs. CSMs are expected to develop rapport and trust with clients, work to understand and influence the client strategy by providing or sourcing subject matter expertise, and aligning our own strategy and objectives to that of clients. This strategy is to be clearly documented and articulated to both the customer and the internal teams to create a ‘one team’ culture between Concentrix Tigerspike and the client-focused on delivering mutually beneficial outcomes. Be responsible for delivering sales and successful interlock to revenue, while continually improving client relationships. You will be responsible for the overarching customer satisfaction of the client and work with our delivery leads to navigate any project or delivery challenges. You will be a thought leader within the account and a trusted advisor to the client, providing value not only through our services but your own engagement and the ability to integrate other members of the team into positions of influence with the client. Be an advocate from our existing client base, which is a key part of this job description. It is the CSM’s responsibility to work with clients to develop case studies, secure joint speaking opportunities in the market, enter projects for award submissions in an effort to secure public recognition of our work. As a CSM you will facilitate existing customers by providing references for BDMs to leverage for new business pursuits. You Have 2+ years of experience in managing relationships within the digital space The ability to meet personal sales target and have contributed to team targets Experience attending and facilitating client meetings Experience giving customer presentations Coordinated pre-sales efforts; including resourcing requests and tasks management relating to contributions to pre-sales activities Experience booking pre-sales meetings with appropriate Delivery team members. Experience managing invitations, agendas, attendees, taking notes, and follow-up actions for all pre-sales meetings The ability to become a subject matter expert and gain knowledge of the latest technology trends and emerging technology, and can introduce new concepts to clients Experience developing knowledge of and utilising global Case studies in client interactions Experience supporting the Lead Client Services and Strategy Manager at events, networking, and conferences Been creating/Inputting into written thought leadership pieces for use in social media channels and sharing in the appropriate channels An active presence on social media promoting our culture and the work we undertake with clients Been managing and frequently updating sales cycle reporting tools such as Salesforce to provide accurate pipeline visibility Our Benefits Flexible work hours and remote work policy Annual performance bonus Health Insurance provided under AXA Smartcare Optimum Monthly mobile bill expenses up to SGD120 per month A generous annual allowance for training and development An annual allowance to spend on your personal growth such as learning a new language, cooking classes or pottery 20 days annual leave, increasing to 25 days annual leave per annum after 2 years of service, and 30 days after 5 years 10 days of carers leave The chance to collaborate with our other offices in Australia, UK, Europe, America, India and Latin America Weekly Bootcamp/fitness activities (on hold) Weekly Friday team lunches (on hold)  About Concentrix Tigerspike  We’re a global digital services company, offering end-to-end expertise in strategic consulting, service and experience design, multi-platform engineering, and systems integration.  We’re excited to announce that we’re now operating under the new name of Concentrix Tigerspike.  We’ve been a part of Concentrix since 2017, helping our clients around the world create great customer and employee experiences. We’ve made this change to our name to more clearly show the evolution of our services and how they complement and strengthen the overall strategic offering of Concentrix.  Our ownership and structure hasn’t changed: we’re still the same, great team spanning 10 global offices - and our design-led approach and deep engineering capability continue to remain core to how we work.  Our people are our culture and a huge part of what makes us unique. We recruit the best people and create small project teams, resulting in great chemistry between our teams and our customers that can solve even the toughest business problems. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.*  So what happens next?  Once we've received your application, we'll give it as much attention as it deserves and you'll hear from us either way. If we think you could be a good addition to our team, we will give you a call and from there you'll cruise through our recruitment process.  www.tigerspike.com  Powered by JazzHR  r66CAvLbTE

description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  The challenge  We are looking for an energetic individual with a consistent track record of success, selling in the Web Content Management space to join us as an Account Executive in our Commercial Digital Experience team. The ideal candidate has experience in selling Web Content Management and / or Personalisation and Opimisation solutions to enterprise customers. However, this could also be an awesome opportunity for an experienced software seller to move into the digital marketing space.  What You'll Do Run a portfolio of named accounts Develop target named account strategies and tactical penetration plans Develop and maintain relationships at the “C” and “VP” levels of the defined target named accounts Develop compelling value propositions based on return on investment cost/benefit analysis Execute against the major steps of the sales process including finding new business opportunities, qualifying new opportunities, and closing new business Sell against annual revenue targets for software licenses and services Coordinate with pre-sales and professional services teams Input ideas and participates in marketing events Provide accurate and timely sales forecasts Maintain third party relationships  What You'll Need Evidence of experience in digital software sales, ideally web content management or similar technology Understanding of both competitive and complimentary solutions in the Web Content Management, Personalisation and Optimisation space Ability to clearly articulate value propositions Ability to orchestrate a cross functional team and collaboratively bring in the right resources to bear at the right stage in the selling process Experience and success in selling high value enterprise solutions software ($100K and above) Proven new business development skills and sales quota attainment track record Mentality of a creative self-starter; ability to work independently and find a way into the prospect; in charge of his/her destiny with minimal support until the prospect is qualified Must have strong skills in the following: communication, presentation skills, negotiation, interpersonal skills and attention to detail High comfort level and presence with senior executives An accomplished record of selling multi-level to business, technical, IT people, and C-level executives Bachelor’s degree or related area is required Regional travel is required for this role (approximately 50%) by land and/or air  When you join Adobe, you can look forward to collaborating with the most genuine people in the industry, working on projects with real purpose, and having immense pride in the products we create and the customers we support. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, cultural background or religious beliefs. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here.  Come create experiences that matter at a company that is recognized around the world and hear what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog.

You lead with influence and build strong, productive relationships with various working styles and characteristics. Business acumen: You deeply understand business fundamentals, potential growth and cost drivers, and can translate complex information into actionable operational plans in the context of driving business performance. Sales experience within big data, Cloud, or SaaS sales Prior customer relationships with CIOs and important decision-makers Simply articulate intricate cloud technologies and big data Experience exceeding sales quotas Success closing new accounts while up-selling existing accounts Bachelors Degree and 7+ years of experience selling SaaS solutions to Enterprise Customers in Thailand is essential Native/Fluent proficiency in Thai is required  Benefits Private medical, dental and optical Life, accident, disability and critical illness coverage Central Provident Fund for local nationals Equity awards Paid parental leave Gym reimbursement Annual personal development fund Work headphones reimbursement Business travel accident insurance  About Databricks  Databricks is the data and AI company. Thousands of organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Nationwide and H&M — rely on Databricks' open and unified platform for data engineering, machine learning and analytics. Databricks is venture-backed and headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world's toughest problems. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

description: About Aspire: We are the #1 B2B all-in-one banking platform in South-East Asia. We are proud to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners.  Founded in 2018 by Lazada founders, Aspire has raised USD 200+M equity + debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions, we partner with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise. We were awarded 2020 Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and 2020 Startup Award by TechNode. We currently have ~150 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, and Thailand.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don’t take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  ABOUT THE ROLE The candidate will be part of the Operations Onboarding team and give our onboarding customers a stellar experience.  As a part of the application process, candidates need to submit this Application form: https://forms.gle/LT2jaXz4AemGQRih6  Own lead conversion Report on onboarding metrics Explain & pitch to leads how Aspire works and how it fit their needs Help customers who face any problems during registration Turn the onboarding process into an amazing customer experience, and brainstorm and implement new ideas on improvement Be responsible for customer experience metrics along the early stage of the customer journey  We would love to get to know you if you have the following:  Passionate about customers & sales 2-8 years work experience in customer success, inside sales, account management, or similar role; preferably in a startup, financial or tech company A Bachelor / Master degree from a top university Knowledgeable of best practices in onboarding & sales Strong communication, writing, and presentation skills Positive & get-it-done attitude 100% hands-on

description: Job Description  Pavilion - Senior Sales Executive   Minimum Qualifications Minimum of 10 years of related experience working in industry and in direct sales of software solutions with proven track record of success. Experience driving complex value based sales campaigns. Bachelor of Science Engineering, other related technical field or equivalent experience. Preferred  Consensus builder  Understands sales process  Strategic thinking  Proven influence Skills  Broad industry knowledge  Relationship building  Understanding of competitors and general product offering  Experience in successfully selling similar advanced process control solutions with track record of success that can be demonstrated  Desired Qualifications Position Summary The Model Predictive Control & Optimization Sales Executive is responsible for direct sales of Rockwell Automation’s Pavilion8 Software solutions, as well as Rockwell Automation's other portfolio products & solutions within his/her assigned Vertical Industry and district. The Model Based Control & Optimization Sales Executive is responsible for the development and execution of sales strategy and activities associated with targeted Software sales campaigns. Daily activities will include collaboration with the District sales management team as well as utilizing the District resources (technical experts, sales engineers etc) to execute both the District and Rockwell Automation solution sales plans.  Principle Duties And Responsibilities  Achieve Solution Sales Quota Targets. It is understood that a given time is required to build up the pipeline  Produce MPC revenue for Software, Services, and Maintenance. Conducts tasks in accordance with the applicable health, safety, quality and environmental regulations (state/federal laws) as well as Rockwell Automation policies and (state/federal laws) as well as Rockwell Automation policies and procedures.

description: About Jobkred  A Singapore-based start-up, JobKred uses Big Data and AI to scan online labour market information to decode the relationships between jobs and skills and understand the latest developments in the world of work. With this information, JobKred provides both local and global businesses and enterprises with a workforce transformation platform. Using the digital platform, business leaders can identify future-ready skills and create dynamic competency frameworks to guide their employees’ personal development. They can also get a real-time pulse on the skills inventory of the organisation’s talent pool and empower their employees with AI recommendations to personalise their learning and receive career recommendations.  Reporting directly to the Chief Customer Officer, you will be responsible for driving new business growth in Singapore and new markets.  Job Description Achieve monthly, quarterly and annual revenue targets according to company goals Source, qualify, build and manage new prospects in existing or new industries Maintain a high volume of activity including outbound calls, emails and social selling with a focus on generating new prospects Develop and maintain solid, trusting relationships and connections with local mid-market or enterprise companies, business leaders, their key stakeholders, and key integrators; to ensure long-term partnership and satisfaction. Negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximise revenue Ensure the successful delivery and best possible experience to customers’ needs and objectives. Manage the sales forecast and CRM to ensure accurate data is provided to the executive team, company, and board Requirements Must be based in SIngapore. Singaporean/ PR. 3+ years of enterprise software sales experience Experienced taking a company or territory through a revenue ramp, ideally from early traction to consistent ARR and beyond Experience building sales infrastructure and operations in a high-growth environment (systems rollout; lead generation programs; pipeline management; sales analytics; contract development) B2B tech sales background. SaaS experience preferred History of overachieving targets in a SaaS, market leading technology Experience working with a CRM systems Experienced in mid-market and large enterprise transaction negotiations Knowledge of HR technology ecosystem is highly desired Ability to embrace and understand uncertainty, chaos and a fast pace start-up culture
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Management Consulting

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager - SEA / ANZ / Taiwan - LPG & Gas Applications
description: Our client is a European manufacturer of high-pressure LPG & Gas equipment and a world leader in the field. For their established office in Singapore, they’re looking to recruit a Regional Sales Manager SEA – ANZ to further develop the LPG applications division. Analyzing the region for commercial opportunities, optimising business development strategies & product development together with the regional team and HQ in Europe. Strengthening relationships with existing clients, introducing additional solutions from the product portfolio. Managing daily sales operations, providing solution-oriented responses to technical enquiries. Educating clients & technical teams on the application possibilities & added value. Ensuring customer satisfaction, product quality, on time delivery & after sales service.  Requirements:  Possessing a technical (Engineering) background, strong commercial track record & negotiation skills with industrial applications. Pro-active mindset, ability to work independently within an international organization. Understanding the different business dynamics & commercial approach between countries in SEA – ANZ – Taiwan. Implementing a structured & strategical approach to business development and sales. Existing experience & network within the LPG industry is an added value. Proven experience in sales role or similar in wholesale trade of packaged food products and food commodities such as rice, sugar, cashews, soy beans, etc. Sourcing and selling experience in African and Asean markets prefered Communication and negotiation skills Proficiency in English Excellent knowledge of enquire to shipment process of the trade Self-motivated with a results-driven approach Other Requirements Responsible for achieving sales targets and growth Excellent track records in consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets Strong industry expertise Leadership, coaching and people management skills. Attending trade exhibitions, conferences and meetings. Extensive travelling Any other ad-hoc duties

description: Our client, Global leader in Customer Experience, Management, is looking for their Regional Strategic Partner Director F/M (E-Commerce & BPO) based in Singapore.  Reporting to the CCO, the Strategic Partner Director has direct responsibility for fostering a strong relationship with their assigned client to deliver regional and global farming opportunities and growth in market share through all its solutions that are offered. Will serve as a trusted advisor to the client and bring an incessant desire to add value. A “Passion for People" is key. In addition, the SPD is accountable for the financial performance of their portfolio. As a leader, you will collaborate with other members of the Executive, Global and Site level leadership teams to develop the overarching client relationship and vision and offer targeted solutions to help improve their overall business.  Main Responsibilities  We are looking for a Strategic Partner Director that has deep vertical knowledge in e-commerce and BPO. Provide strategic direction and executive leadership oversight for client/ relationships regionally and/or globally. Develop and implement strategic plans to drive revenue opportunities that align to clients’ strategy. Ideates and solutions to ID new LOBs. Cultivates client relationships at VP/SVP/CXO level and with all relevant client stakeholder to maximize the reputation and growth of its business with each client account. Ability to understand the full scope of its capabilities and ability to research the client landscape to uncover targeted areas of opportunity. Ensures retention of the client’s business, developing broad and deep relationships across the client accounts Attend internal weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews, building a cohesive client relationship. Act as escalation point for client issues that have not been resolved by normal channels Strong understanding or willingness to learn Transformation in BPO landscape and beyond. Provide strategic, transformative solutions to add value back into the client’s business. Assume accountability for the delivery of transformative, value-added client solutions services in support of multiple account managers, contact center agents, technology professionals, and project managers. Demonstrate an awareness of the range of services provided and match them the overall client strategy for program level enhancement. Lead process-improvement initiatives that deliver financial targets. Ensure account management teams are monitoring and calibrating customer service quality, and recommending product and process improvement ideas to clients. Create an environment, which delivers excellent service to clients; ensure account managers are driving operations to consistently meet or exceed all financial and non-financial KPIs. Oversee and support where needed all aspects of implementation of new clients as needed, ensuring management, compliance and reporting for all contact center operations including call volume forecasting and staffing, client service commitments, budget, forecasted hours versus actual hours, payroll, etc. Facilitate client visits, audits and tours while demonstrating knowledge and awareness of its business and the ability to present this to suit client needs These tasks are not limitative.  Qualifications  Minimum Education Requirement College or University graduate, or proven, direct extensive experience Minimum Relevant Work Experience - Exp in BPO & Ecommerce is a must Minimum 3 years’ experience in an account or vendor management role in a call center or consulting environment o Experience in a Call Center Operations Environment or Project Management Team Experience in budget forecasting and management including P&L responsibility Experience with strategic initiative development and implementation, specifically with operating policies and procedures, and work process improvements Experience in driving transformative strategies and bringing in SMEs to showcase capabilities which augment core offerings Proven success with client facing interactions as it relates to planning, business reviews and business development. Industry Vertical experience preferred in management of operational functions and large account management while interfacing with complex client organizations. Without industry experience, ability to upskill and learn will be essential and required. Extensive expertise in building and managing long-term relationships with business partners and clients. Consultative sales background critical, hunting and/or farming with proven track record to meet sales targets. Extensive background in project management and project implementation. Strong leadership ability in orchestrate directing a team consisting of multiple disciplines, multiple organizations/support functions, and/or upper management team members. Proven ability to manage global client relationships. Demonstrated strong track record in driving continuous improvement. Strong financial management skills, (i.e., P&L, pricing negotiation) Demonstrated ability to negotiate win-win agreements. Client facing and executive presentation skills. Excellent, proven interpersonal and communication skills.

description: Job Description  The Ads Operations Manager is responsible for building strategies focused on winning new advertiser segments and growing existing advertiser segments for the long term. You will also identify key opportunities to innovate based on market needs and influence product or acquisition strategy. Your day to day activities will change constantly as our business grows and you can expect to work on launching new advertising products, work with a wide range of advertisers, propose to create and establish programs that impact thousands of advertisers and build business cases to drive feature development. If you thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment with an entrepreneurial spirit, endless drive, and a passion for growing a business, then this role may be a fit for you.  Lazada Sponsored Solutions allows all brands and marketplace sellers to engage with Lazada customers via innovative online advertising experiences. Our advertising products leverage Lazada’s insights to find, attract, and engage intended audiences throughout their daily journeys. With a range of flexible pricing and buying models, including self-service, managed service - these products help sellers and brands to build brand awareness, increase product sales, and more. We would like You to join our journey to create value for our users, sellers, and advertising partners across Southeast Asia.  The regional team is based in Singapore, and the role will require you to work hand in hand with regional product management and country teams across Lazada’s six markets, focusing on the areas that matter most to our sellers.  Responsibilities : • Identify and ensure execution of business development opportunities in the region while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. product, engineering, seller engagement, legal, finance, etc). • Formulate strategy and identify how to drive impact towards advertisers’ acquisition, incubation and retention for ads products. Develop innovative ways to engage advertisers by designing incentive schemes or business programs. • Work on data-driven, actionable insights and recommendations through data mining and segment performance monitoring. Identify and execute on actionable initiatives to enhance advertisers’ engagement on ads products. • Work closely with product management and engineering teams to create product features that aims to solve advertiser pain points, lower barrier of adoption, improve user experience and increase advertisers’ engagement. • Evaluate market conditions and competitor data to identify emerging trends and to recommend learnings and influence change in business development activities. • Actively track and monitor the ads performance of key accounts portfolio / high-potential advertiser’ accounts. Prepare business reviews and develop cross-selling initiatives to grow the key account portfolio.  Requirements: 5+ years’ experience in Business Development / Seller Operations / E-commerce roles required. Sales experience is a plus. • Experience in advertising or traffic monetization strategy is strongly preferred. • Strong project management, problem solving and prioritization skills. • Excellent written and verbal communications skills, with ability to engage and influence senior management. • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams in a large organization. • Relevant work experience in a highly quantitative, analytical, and results-driven environment • Proven ability to think strategically and execute methodically. • Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. • Fluent in English. • SQL Proficiency would be a plus.

jobTitle: Business Development Manager - Binance Smart Chain
description: Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.  Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?  Responsibilities  BSC (Binance Smart Chain) is a EVM compatible blockchain, and launched mainnet starting from Sep 1st, 2020. Since inception, more than 600 DeFi and dapps have been deployed in BSC and attracted more than 1MM daily active users (addresses). We are now looking for a strong Business Development Professional for our tech-driven Binance Chain/Binance Smart Chain (BSC) Ecosystem. The successful candidate will join this innovative and fast changing field to build a new era of blockchain. The daily work content includes but is not limited to: Proactively engage the Dev community and VCs to promote BC/BSC and inspire new DeFi, DApps or blockchain ideas built on BC/BSC Proactively engage (potential) big players in blockchain and identify new business opportunities in/for BC/BSC Define target market segments, locate and reach target markets of early adopters and interested early users to work out solutions to establish deals and valuable business relationships Develop marketing strategies and models to grow user bases and target markets; collect market reaction, feedback and synthesise new trends to influence our product offering and help shape the business Develop and drive implementation of innovative and strategic use cases on BC/BSC Requirements Background in business development or marketing within information technology, internet, or technology community management Deep relationships with the technology and innovation community, especially within information technology and internet At least 3 years of experience in defining and locating target markets, strategic thinking, and expanding market to >100K DAU scale Strong communication, presentation and negotiation skills, especially in ice-breaking sales and marketing Passionate, Owner-mentality, Self-starter, Results-oriented, and a good Team player Blockchain knowledge with Finance background is preferred Business level English is required to interface with internal and external stakeholders Conditions Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems International work environment and flat organisation Great career development opportunities in a growing company Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career Competitive salary Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

description: Background: Pixi was created in 1999 and launched in our Flagship Boutique in Soho, London. Pixi has a loyal worldwide following thanks to its pure, awakening & skin-loving products that create a naturally radiant ‘’just had a good night sleep’’ look. Passionate about skincare, Petra creates innovative formulations that are infused with botanicals and beneficial ingredients. Petra has a real-world experience as a busy working mother of four; therefore, Pixi is truly about multi-tasking, flaw fixing youth – enhancing products for people on the go. Pixi’s mission is the same now as it was on the first day the Pixi boutique opened; to simply bring out the best in everyone - to make everyone look like themselves, only better! Flawless in few fuss-free minutes – that is what Pixi is about!  Role Overview: We are searching for a talented and proven Operations Manager to join our Singapore office. This individual will work to execute operational and supply chain activities in line with company goals and objectives. Additionally, this individual must be a leader, proactive and have strong problem-solving skills and a positive “can do” attitude.  Responsibilities: Managing the fulfillment of Purchase Orders ensuring all product is dispatched on time to meet delivery dates. Managing, preparing, and routing customer shipping requirements from the Warehouses. Managing inbound POs into the APAC warehouse, ensuring pricing, quantity and all other commercial terms are accurate and match our internal system. Managing stock reconciliation for all inventory sites weekly, ensuring the Pixi system aligns with external inventory site systems and any discrepancies are captured and corrected. Analysing data to implement best practice and operational excellence. Establishing and managing processes and policies around operational functions. Manage Item receipts of all inbound shipments into warehouses, ensuring any discrepancies are communicated to relevant parties and corrected in a timely manner. Acting as the main point of contact and liaison with US HQ regarding all operational matters. Managing warehouse KPIs, SLA and contract obligations. Supporting all product registration and regulatory matters in each of the markets in the APAC region. Maintaining the rolling forecast plan, including monthly statistics on sales, inbound receiving, and months of holding inventory and reporting details to management on a regular basis, working towards the prevention of Out of Stocks and meeting the fulfillment and delivery needs of our customers. Consolidating the forecast needs for all APAC retailing partners, including China.  Requirements: Minimum 2 years’ experience in FMCG Operations management Advanced Excel skills Accuracy and attention to detail Excellent analysis abilities Thrives under pressure and welcomes challenges Excellent communication and influencing skills Resilient and self-motivated Previous experience in the Beauty industry preferred
industries: Cosmetics

jobTitle: Customer Account Manager, Aftermarket, Aerospace APAC
description: If you desire to be part of something special, to be part of a winning team, to be part of a fun team - winning is fun. We are looking forward to Customer Account Manager, Aftermarket – APAC in Eaton’s Aerospace business, based in Singapore.  In Eaton, making our work exciting, engaging, meaningful; ensuring safety, health, wellness; and being a model of inclusion & diversity are already embedded in who we are - it’s in our values, part of our vision, and our clearly defined aspirational goals.  This exciting role is part of a fast paced, and sales orientated team in a large multi-national company. The role which offers a broad variety of responsibilities including international liaising and great learning opportunities.  The role will support and grow the commercial & military aerospace business in the APAC region for assigned territory and customer list. Be accountable for bookings and sales for assigned territory and customers, and improving overall customer satisfaction. Develop a deep working knowledge of Eaton’s products, technologies, operations, applications systems and value propositions to grow Eaton’s business year-on-year and to provide a complete service to the airlines, MRO’s, agents and distributors within the region. The incumbent will be required to promote SFE for new aircraft and provide full life-cycle support for the aftermarket as well as drive military campaigns for Eaton OEM business; be able to troubleshoot customer problems, identify and analyze issues and assist the customer with activities leading to a robust corrective action and customer satisfaction.  Your essential responsibilities: Meets aftermarket intake goals, activities and strategies for assigned territory in line with corporate intake goals and strategic plan Active role in identifying RMU opportunities in the market, working with internal colleagues and achieving bookings/sales from the customers in a timely manner. Increase ‘baseline’ business by increasing market share for repair business and sales of spare parts. Increase predictive sales and identify ahead of customer need potential sales opportunities with effective use of market & sales data Performs competitive analysis, develop competitive positioning papers and matrices, formulates responses to competitive threats and develop new initiatives to grow aftermarket intake and sales Technical support to airlines, MRO’s, agents and distributors within the region to promote the capabilities of Eaton’s products and systems with a deep understanding of competitors’ products and key differences in performance, reliability and total value Prepare and present comprehensive business reviews of assigned customers, identifying performance against goal/budget on regular basis, detailed forecast for the rest of the year with deep dive analysis Develop key customer relationships and continuously improve Eaton’s reputation within the market Support Eaton’s functional areas such as reliability and product performance teams with up-to-date customer data, and discuss findings including identification of sales opportunities. Support credit control functions with aged debt Providing timely forecasts and reports for assigned territory Alongside working with external customers, distributors and agents, this role requires strong internal collaboration with various internal stakeholders (e.g. Sales, Site PSM’s, RMU Teams, Customer Service Teams and Eaton sites) Role requires 50% travel Bachelor’s Degree; at least 5 years aerospace sales/customer support experience Knowledge of the aerospace market and specifically the aftermarket business Knowledge of the APAC Airline market and customer base Effective in a matrix management environment Strong Business Acumen – must understand market and customer trends, customer needs and impact on future product development programs, new business case financials. Be capable of developing and managing relationships with appropriate personnel. Strong customer interface skills. Ability to uncover customer needs and translate into winning capture strategies and value propositions. Strong presentation and written communication skills; Technical knowledge of electrical/mechanical aerospace components Broad understanding of the Aerospace product portfolio (OEM and AM for Commercial Aerospace) Experience with airline maintenance or service functions is preferred  Yes! Because you are the one we are looking for, we hope to hear from you now! No  Does this position offer relocation?  No  Travel  Yes, 50 % of the Time  Requisition ID :105109

description: We believe that when passionate people are able to spend less time struggling with technology, they can spend more time on what matters - like teaching children, running businesses, keeping airports safe, and connecting disaster victims with relief. That’s the real power of simplicity. Cisco Meraki is the leader in cloud-managed IT, thanks to our creative, inclusive, fearless team that is driven to simplify technology so the world can simply work!  Cisco Meraki has grown to become an industry leader in the IT space, with over 350,000 customers and almost 2 million active networks and counting around the world. We have a comprehensive set of solutions which allows customers to seize new business opportunities and reduce operational costs. Meraki is known for simplifying powerful technology through our products and services - and for the people behind them. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.  What You Will Do  As an Inside Sales Manager, you will lead a team of Inside Sales Representatives across your region to achieve our sales and talent development goals within the market. You will be responsible for setting the direction and empowering your Inside Sales team responsible for: new customer acquisition, existing account management, and working with our channel partners to accelerate growth. Hire, mentor, and develop a motivated and hardworking team of Sales Reps to deliver against your sales goals Invest in recruiting and growing the best talent, set employees up for a great onboarding experience, and provide candid feedback for continuous development. Drive strong internal and external relationships in service of an outstanding customer experience and continued rapid growth. Set the tone for your team: Champion a culture of strong achievement, inclusiveness, collaboration, creativity, and accountability while being a champion for your team’s career development Build and drive territory strategy and priorities and communicate them clearly with your team. Continuously optimize our sales methodology and share ideas to improve efficiency and focus, enable greater scale, and yield better results. Partner with cross-functional teams to maximize results (channel, field sales, systems engineering, marketing, Cisco sales leaders, etc.). Collaborate with Sales Enablement and People Operations to develop and execute individual and group training opportunities, identify development needs, and implement process improvement initiatives. Use metrics and data to continually assess both sales performance and talent performance/retention to fully understand underlying drivers.  Minimum Qualifications: 4+ years of successful sales/relationship management experience Executive presence and ability to collaborate cross-departmentally Examples of working collaboratively with peers to solve complex problems for the betterment of the team Organizational and project management capabilities with the ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines Proven relationship building skills, tenacity, resilience and interpersonal skills Track record of quota achievement and YoY growth As an Inside Sales Manager, you will be working across the region including key partners in India and thus, proficiency in both English and Hindi is crucial Current and continued right to work in Singapore required  Preferred Qualifications: 2+ years of experience leading a team in B2B sales, operations, or a similar environment with a consistent track record of overachieving goals  At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
industries: Computer Networking

description: Available for the following locations: Singapore, Singapore  Hello, We're TechnologyAdvice.  At TechnologyAdvice, we are dedicated to educating, advising, and connecting buyers and sellers of business technology. As a trusted resource across hundreds of technology verticals, our unbiased research and crowd-sourced product reviews help buyers find the right software to grow their business.  TechnologyAdvice has been named as one of the Inc. 5000 list of America’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies four times, as well as inclusion in the Inc Best Workplaces list for 2021. In 2019, TechnologyAdvice received a Nashville Business Journal Small Business Award and was named the Market Mover in the Nashville Chamber’s NEXT Awards. We are also a five-time recipient of the annual Tennessee Top Workplaces awards.  TechnologyAdvice is based in Nashville, Tenn, with a diverse workforce and client base located across the globe. We’re growing and always interested in expanding our team with top talent...make sure to check out our perks and benefits listed below!  The Opportunity…  We are looking for a motivated and customer-focused Client Success Coordinator to join our rapidly growing APAC Sales team. You will be someone who is hard wired with a ‘’get things done’’ attitude and has the ability to manage multiple tasks and problem solve effectively. You will be the go-to person for client questions around lead generation solutions, digital advertising and custom content solutions, and will use your expertise to help give customers the best experience working with us.  If you have a background in marketing or media and are a team player, who thrives on providing customers with an excellent experience, then this is the role for you!  How You'll Contribute… Operational management of client accounts in support of APAC sales team Internal briefing, delivery and coordination of all post-sale deliverables from end to end Create internal orders and insertion orders and adhere to defined business processes Monitor campaigns and ensure campaign delivery manage campaign performance and make optimisation recommendations Define campaign requirements, specs and communicate to relevant parties Effectively communicate with internal teams Delivery of results and assist providing client with end of program wrap-up Understand our clients goals, target markets, opportunities and challenges - with an ability to align our solutions to best effect Interactive with Finance team in regard to client credit and billing requirements Provide sales administrative and account related support  What You Bring…  Our ideal candidate has customer success experience and takes initiative. We’re looking for someone who’s hungry to learn and can do so quickly, while also bringing new ideas and creativity to the team. Bonus points if you’re technical enough to already know your way around Salesforce! Some other things we’re looking for are: Excellent communication skills through a variety of digital communication, including slack, email and over the phone/Zoom Excellent time management skills and the ability to multitask while upholding a high level of accuracy High level of customer and colleague empathy Self-motivated with a results-driven approach Confidence and a determined outlook Min 2 years experience (agency preferred) Organised and detail-orientated The ability to learn and to be challenged.  Physical and Location requirements… Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must meet minimum remote work environment requirements  Why You Want Us... MacBook Pro or PC laptop, your choice Ongoing Career Development Meetings Subscription to the Headspace App Monthly Team Outings and Quarterly Volunteer Opportunities Professional development opportunities and incentives Milestone celebrations for birthdays, weddings, work achievements, and more Long Service Award, a thank you to our employees for their service  To see all job openings and learn more, visit our .  Interviews will take place after resumes have been screened for minimum requirements. Please note that this position is not restricted solely to the responsibilities listed above and that the job scope and responsibilities are subject to change.  We believe that our differences make us stronger and foster a diverse and inclusive culture where people feel safe being themselves. TechnologyAdvice is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.  Pre-employment screening required.  COVID-19 RESPONSE:  TechnologyAdvice is committed to the safety and wellness of each of our employees. In response to the COVID-19 Pandemic, we follow all CDC and local protocol.  Powered by JazzHR  Q8iTGLBvMr

description: SAI Global, a global leader in Risk Management software, is looking to recruit an IRM (Integrated Risk Management).  The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and closing business opportunities, this will suit a candidate with a proven track record within complex enterprise software sales. You will be expected to generate business leads and opportunities alongside demonstrating software capabilities to key client stakeholders as part of the sales process.  Key Responsibilities  Due to the nature of the role, you must be able to work in a fast paced environment whilst maintaining responsibility for several simultaneous sales campaigns. The ability to present and demonstrate SAI’s Risk and Compliance value propositions to clients is critical to success. Additionally, you will be expected to manage the transition of the closed accounts to colleagues in professional services and support. An overview of the main duties have been provided below: Identify target accounts in key verticals Attain assigned sales and pipeline quota Develop deep knowledge of SAI’s Risk and Compliance Software offerings Qualify target accounts using "Solution Selling" methodology Present Risk and Compliance solutions with Pre-Sales support Manage sales campaigns to closure Manage and coordinate the smooth transition from pre-sales to post-sales activities Report to senior management on all activities Experience And Skillset Required A proven record of achievement in Enterprise Business software sales and new business development with 6-12 month sales cycles Specific experience in Risk and Compliance solutions would be advantageous C onsultative sales background Experience in selling “SAAS on-demand” solutions Experience and success in managing high-value and complex relationships with senior management in large corporations A good understanding of Risk and Compliance issues affecting international businesses Fluent, both written and spoken, in English A degree level qualification or equivalent Interpersonal Skills Strong commercial acumen, with a flair for high-value sales Confident and effective communicator, both written and oral, and presenter Excellent consultative selling and contract negotiating skills with an ability to close a deal Ability to deal with customers at senior management and board level Strong networking skills Self-motivation with the ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a broader team Attention to detail and accuracy Good IT literacy and skills, including proficiency in MS Office applications including Word, Excel and PowerPoint SAI360 is the leading provider of Risk, Learning, EHS, and Sustainability software. Our cloud-first SAI360 platform contains flexible, scalable, and configurable modules for a better vantage point on risk management. Our unified approach to risk management is what sets us apart, helping organizations across the globe manage risk, create trust, and achieve business resilience for over 25 years.  SAI360 is headquartered in Chicago, U.S., and operates across Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, Asia, and the Pacific. Discover more at sai360.com.

description: The opportunity  Unity Technologies is seeking a Business Development Manager, Games to help drive success with our most strategic gaming customers as well as our prospective customers in the ASEAN Region. This role will help drive Unity to the next level with the most influential gaming companies in the region!  Reporting to the Head of GG&E Sales, you will work in the SAPAC organization at Unity, working autonomously and collaborating closely with key internal and external contributors to help deliver and execute sales strategies!  What You'll Be Doing  Complete the full sales process from identifying, through to closing, new customer and existing customer opportunities Creatively thinking and executing our sales strategy around the Games industry Establish business relationships with commercial customers Collaborating across Unity’s divisions (including Sales Development, Marketing, and Field Engineering) around key initiatives and deals What We're Looking For  Field-based direct sales/business development experience Experience in consistently meeting or exceeding individual quarterly ACV/Revenue targets Proven track record to structure, develop and execute strategic agreements Comfortable representing a technology company and working with CTOs, engineers, or other technical staff to build solutions You might also have Direct sales experience with technology licensing or middleware Expertise in strategic selling structures, contract negotiation, deal closing, pipeline management, forecasting, and account planning Experience working with a major Sales Methodology Life at Unity  Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.  Unity is at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.  Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, disability, gender, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.  #SEN

description: About Meltwater  Our culture is based on a fundamental belief in people and the potential they possess. Our employees embody the ‘work hard, play hard’ spirit, and we are lucky to have some of the best and most talented people out there. We pride ourselves on taking great people and helping them do extraordinary things in a dynamic, global environment that fosters positivity, entrepreneurship, and teamwork.  With 20 years of experience in the field of online media monitoring, Meltwater is a global leader in media intelligence and social analytics SaaS solutions - helping to bridge the gap between Public Relations, Communications, and Marketing departments with an all-in-one solution powered by AI-driven insights. Through Meltwater's platforms, our clients are well equipped to stay on top of billions of online conversations and extract relevant insights - allowing them to strategically manage their brands and stay ahead of their competition. With 55 offices and 2,000 employees worldwide, Meltwater is a truly global partner to over 30,000 of the world’s most respected brands which rely on Meltwater to help inform their MarCom strategies and decision making.  Role: Key Account Manager, Client Success  As part of the Client Success team, the Key Account Manager is responsible for managing, retaining, and growing a portfolio of Meltwater’s top tier clients across Southeast Asia. You will be expected to demonstrate a thorough understanding of Meltwater’s products, and are responsible for driving engagement and adoption through all stages of the client life cycle and renewal process.  What You’ll Do Manage the top percentile of Meltwater clients with largest wallet share and growth potential Actively foster and manage the success of a portfolio of Meltwater clients assigned to you Establish a trusted relationship with each client and drive continuous value of our products Improve client engagement and product adoption, and foster enthusiastic, passionate clients Be responsible for customer satisfaction, retention, and expansion of existing accounts to grow revenue Work with the sales teams to onboard and train new clients Conduct client business reviews to track the health of your accounts, while listening to customer feedback and proactively discovering areas of improvement Collaborate with the sales teams to identify upsell and cross sell opportunities to grow overall portfolio size Negotiate and close renewal business with C-Level Executives and decision makers, enabling you to meet or exceed your quota Take ownership of monthly churn / retention and growth targets for your specific client accounts Proactively identify issues that may impact a renewal, and engage all available resources to resolve any knots Track client’s usage of and activity level on our platforms to monitor the health / risk status of your accounts Who You Are Attained Bachelor’s degree (in any specialization) 4 - 7 years of work experience in client servicing / client facing roles, ideally in account management, sales or business development roles Familiar with account management responsibilities such as retention of clients, upselling and cross-selling across your client pool Proven track record of fulfilling and exceeding sales targets Derive great enjoyment being in client servicing roles with a naturally strong customer focus Passionate about building relationships along with excellent interpersonal skills Dealt with complex or escalated customer situations, and able to navigate large organizations and gain executive level buy-in Strong empathy for customers, plus a passion for influencing customer revenue and growth Ability to think outside the box and adopt a solution-oriented approach to solve problems for clients What We Offer Competitive remuneration package, with uncapped monthly commissions and quarterly bonuses! Fast career progression and empowerment in your role Flat hierarchy with diverse, high-performance & collaborative teams Global presence and a uniquely Meltwater culture like no other Both flexible work arrangement & vibrant office spaces with well-stocked pantries Generous vacation leave & work-life balance Meltwater Careers Page: https://careers.meltwater.com/  ()

description: JOB DESCRIPTION  The ilLido Group is a collection of unique and critically-acclaimed restaurants and bars founded by renowned Italian chef-restaurateur Beppe De Vito in 2006. With the ultimate mission to elevate the Italian dining scene in Singapore, the Group is led by a team of passionate and dedicated hospitality professionals who work towards the principle of delivering the highest quality of dining experiences true to the company’s Italian identity. From casual to fine, classic to contemporary, its impressive variety of successful dining concepts include one-Michelin-star Art and Gemma at National Gallery Singapore, Amò, one-Michelin-star Braci, Southbridge.  Job Description Oversee marketing department Evaluate, develop and execute marketing communications strategy and marketing plan Plan, direct, and coordinate turnkey marketing campaigns and promotions  Research demand of the brands’ products and services Develop sales and pricing strategies to maximize profits and market share while balancing customer satisfaction Identify and engage potential customers  Build brand awareness and positioning Support sales and lead generation efforts Oversee social media marketing strategy and content marketing  Requirements  Experience in marketing and running a marketing team Proven marketing campaign experience Effective time management skills and the ability to multitask Strong copywriting skills Attention to detail Professional and proactive work ethic High competence in project and stakeholder management Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills Experience with digital marketing forms such as social media marketing and content marketing Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook  >> Kindly send your resumes to lyla@loop-pr.sg

If you’re a customer of the largest digital bank in the EU, then you’ve probably interacted with our platform and didn't even know it! We are Mambu - SaaS FinTech Unicorn on a mission to revolutionise financial services globally. Your reward if you will join us? A mark on a product used by millions of people !  Meet your team  The Inside Sales Team is responsible for driving pipeline build activities within their designated region. As an Inside Sales Manager, the role will be focused on; aligning GTM stakeholders, drive pipeline generation activities and ensure success with the team.  Your role at Mambu You'll be focusing on the Operational execution of GTMs & target campaigns with your team You'll be in-charge in the execution of lead and opportunity handoff points by the team and the execution of account penetration, cadence programmes & lead management You'll be driving regional pipeline generation activities and success with the team You'll get the opportunity to design regional territories with appropriate resourcing to deliver on pipeline generation targets You'll identify key skills required to be successful as an Inside Sales Representative and execute on hiring plans to address resource needs in territories You'll work alongside the Global Head of IS to develop coaching framework which measures a number of key competencies You'll have to create an analysis such as forecasting pipeline generation targets and conversion metrics and present insight reporting on performance confidently to senior management What You’re Bringing To The Table You have solid previous experience working as an Inside Sales Manager within FinTech / SaaS / Technology industry. You have an In-depth understanding of the sales process. You are an excellent communicator, interpersonal and team management skills You display strong leadership skills with the ability to coach and motivate a team You possessed strong analytical and organizational skills You’re More Than Your Job Description You have a strong, self-starter mentality and the capability to build relevant connections with other internal & external stakeholders and departments You have a team player mindset and a positive attitude towards colleagues and clients - even in challenging project phases You have detail orientation and a strong eye for organization & processes. You have the ability to work across geographic and cultural boundaries Your future at Mambu  We are a diverse group of Mambuvians, and we are growing fast across 30 countries and 6 continents (not enough banks on Antarctica!). Our eyes are on the future, and we believe we can achieve our mission together by working agile, harnessing the latest technology and having a positive impact for future generations by improving the environment we are in.  Mambuvians own their career growth, but we like to celebrate our successes together. We’ve got your back on your health, body and mind. Whether it’s our flexible hours or locations, or our 4-day work week over a 3 month period. You work 4 days a week, but get paid for 5!  As a member of the Singapore team, you will have access to: 25 days of annual leave Comprehensive Private health insurance for employees & their dependants In the office: coffee, tea, fresh juices, softdrinks, fruit, snacks Free access to bike parking and shower facilities by the office Training & development personal budget As part of the recruitment (or HR onboarding) process, you will be required to obtain authorized criminal background and credit screening results, as well as be queried against a sanctions/anti-money-laundering/counter terrorism financing/politically exposed persons screening service and your employment is conditional upon approval of these results  More About Us  To stay on top of the latest Fin-Tech trends and our success stories, please follow us on LinkedIn  For more details regarding our global career opportunities, please visit Career Site
