description: Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employeesDocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The teamOur Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This positionThe Sales Manager is responsible for managing a team of AEs developing and closing new business (logos) and expanding the current DocuSign footprint (use cases) in customer accounts within DocuSign’s business. The Sales Manager is accountable for coaching individual contributors, exceeding quarterly & annual quota, proactive deal management, forecast accuracy, and helping their team drive adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem. This role will manage a team of individual contributors who support our Majors & Enterprise accounts across Singapore.  This position is a people manager role reporting to the RVP of Sales, Singapore and is designated flex.  Responsibilities Daily management of sales teams – Includes pipeline/deal review, coaching & customer facing within sales cycles Grow DocuSign revenue within the Majors/Enterprise segment by selling into prospect & install base accounts Assess sales activities & forecasts, determine sales progress & required improvements Coach team to develop their sales skills including vertical market management, forecasting, prospecting within account base, negotiations, & other necessary skills; while maintaining individual accountability to goals Provide value in complex negotiations & the closing of new business Ensure the team effectively leverages sales tools & systems consistently & in alignment with Rules of Engagement Communicate & prioritize product & business needs from the field to appropriate corporate departments Provide the sales team an effective sales executive to leverage in the sales cycle Develop & execute upgrade/renewal process & strategies and ensure compliance to internal data management & reporting including use of internal CRM tools Maintain/protect DocuSign core values by hiring culturally aligned team members & leading by example Identify & support opportunities for the training & professional development of department personnel Operate well in a fast paced, dynamic environment without requiring significant supervision. Basic Qualifications 5+ years of people management experience within SaaS software sales (Enterprise level accounts), leading teams that close net-new business 8+ years of experience selling software and/or services Quota-attainment record of meeting and/or exceeding targets by managing process for identifying, qualifying, & closing new business as well as and not limited to growing an existing install base Preferred Qualifications Prior experience developing and maintaining business, sales, & vertical market plans as well as negotiating & closing complex deal Track record of building, coaching and enabling a rapidly growing team Prior experience selling an eSignature or Agreement or Document solution also helpful Experience selling into a variety of industries and territories as well as experience cultivating larger, strategic relationships key Capacity to work on cross-functional projects and teams as needed as well as leverage internal resources to problem-solve Strong verbal and written communication skills – includes excellent reporting and forecasting skills. Attention to detail is critical Willingness to travel 25% or more as needed IT industry and multinational environment background BA/BS in a business or a technical related field of study from an accredited college or university About Us  DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, over a million customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. And we help save the world’s forests and embrace environmental sustainability.  It’s important to us that we build a talented team that is as diverse as our customers and where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging and thrive. We encourage great talent who bring a range of perspectives to apply for our open positions. DocuSign makes hiring decisions based on experience, skill, aptitude and a can-do approach. We will not discriminate with regards to any legally protected characteristics.  AccommodationsDocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.

description: We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...  Kantar Insights Division  Business Development Manager Marketplace Singapore  Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with sophisticated technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help clients understand people and inspire growth.  Kantar Marketplace is an automated market research platform crafted for insights professionals, marketers and agencies who want to test, learn and move faster. It is the only platform with solutions that have been independently validated to predict sales and brand growth. We are committed to helping our clients unlock powerful insights through our verified audiences, intuitive self-serve dashboards and professional consulting - in over 60 countries.  The platform powers both a core storefront and portfolio of self-serve and serviced agile solutions (Kantar Marketplace), plus client-specific versions of the platform and portfolio (Kantar Marketplace Enterprise). These Enterprise platforms sit on a spectrum from simple rebranding and adaptations of our core solutions to a bespoke configuration of the full platform with a mix of Kantar assets and solutions, plus client-specific solutions developed by Kantar.  Our ‘results-oriented goal’ is that by 2022 Kantar Marketplace will be the top tier automated research & insights platform, generating incremental revenues for Kantar in excess of $100M at industry leading profit margins.  Role overview An exciting and entrepreneurial role to drive client penetration, revenue and profit growth for Kantar Marketplace in Singapore.  Key responsibilities will include: Driving sales for the KMP platform, across all solutions available. Significantly grow Kantar Marketplace business in Singapore, building long-term strategic relationships with new customers. Collaborative seller, working closely with the Client Service teams, Domain Leads, Client Leads, and the Marketplace team. Build and execute against the business plan, targeting Singapore based clients (can be regional or local work) that would benefit from Kantar Marketplace’s unique platform. Actively scope out new business opportunities through our established network, analysis of data, and existing knowledge of the market research landscape. Pitch the broader vision and narrative articulating compelling value propositions around our offer. Lead client conversations and platform demonstrations on the ground-breaking potential of Kantar Marketplace Platform focusing on unique selling propositions with a keen eye toward competitors. Handle in-depth knowledge of products and technologies, competitors, and market conditions. Identify lead generation products that can support the revenue growth Provide weekly updates to the Marketplace lead in Singapore and support to drive the overall vision in the market. Work in close relationship with the domain teams on resourcing required to execute projects, on-boarding new clients, delivering results and following up with the client after the first presentation to meet expectations.  Key outcomes Deliver increment growth for the Marketplace platform. Identify increased sales of serviced and self-serve opportunities. Strong pipeline of prospects for new and established clients for driving year over year growth. Build professional intimacy with clients to enable deep professional trusted advisor relationships, i.e. to the extent client partner is first port of call for strategic opinions and advice.  Experience & capabilities Possess a commercial mind set / business orientation along with gravitas, and relationship-building skills needed to build rapport and influence senior internal and external partners. Ability to establish strong cross-functional relationships; influence and encourage others; critical thinking; effective presentation skills and organizational agility. Capacity to collaborate effectively with dispersed and multi-party teams & working within a matrix structure to harness capabilities of the team and craft a winning proposal/solution. Proven track record to identify, build and secure strategic and profitable business relationships. Ability to interact directly with clients with ability to command a presence with clients and team members. Proficiency selling technology, market research solutions or marketing technology across various client verticals and within one or more of our domain areas of expertise. Ability to work at a fast pace, true self-starter mentality and strong desire to win Strategic-thinker who systematically solves problems and hypothesizes possible customer challenges, expectations and implicit needs. Able to tailor communication to the customers need with authority; optimally delivers presentations and has strong verbal and written communications skills. Current client networking relationships/rolodex of contacts. Identify the right customer partners and builds rapport/establishes credibility to build consensus for deals.  Join us At Kantar, we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market driven and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.  We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to encourage new thinking and craft the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us  At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity, therefore we encourage applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.  PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (“Kantar”). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is vital for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

description: Position Overview A self-motivated individual who can demonstrate extensive knowledge and insight into prospective client’s current operations and network design. You are a strong collaborator who can work with sales, professional services, product management, compliance, logistics and support resources to ensure proposed deals include technical solutions that accurately address customer needs and are appropriately supported by key customer decision-makers.  Key Responsibilities ● Provide deal execution support and influence (from discovery to signed contract) through subject matter expertise in Supply Chain, Logistics solutions. ● Identify & understand stakeholder pain points and determine how to effectively influence their decision and address their needs through our solutions. ● Build and perform prospective client presentations and solution demonstrations, delivered in-person and remotely ● Stay current on the e commerce/Supply Chain/Retail/CPG industry, technical & global logistics trends, and developments. ● Run discovery sessions with prospect to understand key objectives, issues, requirements, value propositions, and decision processes ● Develop solution proposals designing a profitable plan to deliver value, meet requirements, define future processes, and data integration to deliver customer requirements ● Support other pre-sales activities including technical RFI/RFP response includes systems architecture, data integration, demand and supply mathematical models, inventory optimization models, and network optimization design ● Configure and deliver customer demos ● Perform testing and analysis to ensure the solutions perform as designed ● Perform training sessions for clients and partners and support through go-live process, and play a key role in promoting solutions adoption ● Work with Project Leaders to understand assigned project responsibilities and keep the projects on schedule  Experience & Knowledge ● A minimum 5 years’ client-facing experience in Supply Chain Consulting / Pre-Sales Consulting/Solutions Consulting / Sales Engineering for complex enterprise solutions. ● Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or other appropriate field. Masters degree is a plus. ● Business process analysis and redesign experience: business analysis skills; process mapping; business process redesign and implementation. ● General consulting skills, including: team facilitation and business case development ● Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support ● Understanding of Web-based applications and SaaS technologies. ● The ability to communicate at various levels, including C Suite, and across functional areas (technology, finance, logistics, ecommerce, etc.) All the way down to product level. ● Demonstrated ability to articulate complex solutions to non-technical audiences.

description: At Automation Anywhere, we are passionate in our belief that Software Bots can free people to create, think, discover, and ultimately build great companies. With our Digital Workforce platform, we are contributing to build a Digital Workforce more than three million digital workers by 2022. Our platform includes Robotic Process Automation, Cognitive technologies and Analytics and is adopted by over 5000 companies globally.  We have dedicated the last decade to driving the adoption of Robotic Process Automation technology in leading Financial Services, BPO, Healthcare, Technology, and Insurance companies to name a few, across more than 90 countries. We are taking the lead to define the category and create the blueprint to make it successful. This clearly is a once in a lifetime opportunity to make a difference and change the world.     Enterprise Sales Account Executive (ASEAN)  Responsibilities: Take ownership of revenue generation, develop new opportunities, manage pipeline, create and execute account strategies and close enterprise-level deals for new, expansion and renewal bookings  Conduct on-site and remote customer meetings to include initial pitch presentations and demos with marketing qualified leads.  Attend tradeshows and other events to develop leads.  Conduct standard and custom product demos and answer technical Q&A  Interface with client technical teams to present our product architecture, engage in solutioning discussions customized to the client and overcoming technical objections, if any   Collaborate with our sales engineers to manage and execute Proof of Concept exercises where the sales engineer will go onsite to build a Bot (i.e., process automation) live in front of the client automating one of the client’s processes using their systems in a test environment.   Lead RFX responses coordinating with our RFX team, sales engineers, products team and services team as required   Coordinate closely with technical support, engineering and service resources to align solution design with client’s business requirements.  Work closely with key management team to ensure product success and define future roadmap.  Required Experience: Strong account management experience for large strategic accounts. Experience in full sales cycle helping to create and execute a vision with companies leadership teams around the value of a Digital Workforce and the strategy to onboard etc. Thorough knowledge of consultative selling including prospecting, qualifying, objection handling and closing Knowledge of enterprise software architecture and Cloud / SaaS technologies Knowledge of business process management and the ability to sell to lob business owners. High energy with the ability to excel in an entrepreneurial, fast changing environment Experience and knowledge of working with channel partners Technical depth with the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders Computer knowledge including proficiency with software applications including Salesforce Degree qualified preferred Experience with RPA and/or in related fields of automation a bonus.  Why Automation Anywhere? At our company each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. As the leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), we provide a very compelling product where our teams are breaking new ground every day and given an environment to grow their skills and have fun along the way.  Our technology is the game changer, and our people give us the edge to better our world and go be great!   Great learning environment, collaborating with experienced industry leaders.  Competitive salary Stock options  Flexible Work culture Best Medical Coverage plan  Automation Anywhere is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.  **All unsolicited resumes submitted to any @automationanywhere.com email address without HR/Recruiting approval, whether submitted by an individual or by an agency, will not be eligible for an agency fee.
industries: Computer Software, Management Consulting, and Information Technology and Services

description: Regional Sales Manager  Orissa International is a leading consultancy in the area of market entry and expansion. Established in 1997, the company is headquartered in Singapore with offices throughout Southeast Asia. We are now looking to hire a Regional Sales Manager in Singapore to assist our client in the cable and wire sector to expand into the APAC market.  Client background  Our client, Cimteq Ltd (www.cimteq.com) is the leader in innovative software and service solutions to the multi-billion cable and wire manufacturing industry worldwide. It is a truly global company with over 95% of its customer base located outside of the UK.  Its solutions reduce costs and significantly streamline customer operations. It counts the largest global cable manufacturers as key customers who make significant productivity gains through the use of its software. It has recently released its latest product CableMES with global potential to drive significant revenue for the business.  It is likely that the electricity or the network cable you use is designed with Cimteq’s software, along with specialty cables for power transmission and communication, over the ground, under the sea, through the air, and even in space.  Who is this job for?  We’re recruiting for an ambitious Regional Sales Manager based in Singapore to drive sales for Cimteq across the APAC region. This is a new business role and you will be responsible for sales management, lead generation, and securing new business supported by marketing and pre-sales technical support, either directly or through distribution or both.  Ideally, you will have a minimum of 3+ years of experience in manufacturing software sales with a consultative led sales approach to customers. Experience in the Cable Manufacturing sector would be a distinct advantage, as will experience in Product Data Management, MES, or ERP in a manufacturing environment.  You should have:  Demonstrable success in new business sales with deals ranging from £50k - £500k Tenacity is a key requirement of this role due to the complex nature of the customers’ requirements and long sales cycles. A proven track record of delivering growth and the gravitas and flexibility to engage a broad contact base from end-users to C-level contacts during the sales process. You will need strong commercial and business acumen and a new business mindset to maximize any opportunity in order to achieve targets.  Why is Cimteq recruiting?  Cimteq is at an exciting stage in its development and has recently received a £2.5million investment from the Foresight Group, a leading independent infrastructure and private equity investment manager who has been investing in technology companies for over 30 years. This investment will enable the company to take the next step in its development and aggressive expansion plans over the next few years and the Regional Sales Manager role is key to that success.  What skills do you need?  Key Activities:  Proactively sourcing leads and prospects Extensive client engagement (phone, WebEx & face to face) Accurate forecasting and pipeline management to ensure achievement of target Accountable for the completion of all quotations, tenders, and other prospective business proposals, contractual negotiations, and closing sales Working directly with the marketing team to promote the company brand and help develop territory-specific marketing material and events Managing the sales process and engaging internal specialists to maximize a successful outcome for each prospect Travel to customer sites as well as marketing activity such as exhibitions and conferences etc. Working closely with distributors in the APAC region and growing the distribution base throughout APAC  The Person:  A proactive self-starter who will maximize every opportunity to sell Cimteq and its software portfolio with exceptional interpersonal and networking skills Highly developed communication, organizational, and presentation skills A proven ability to develop and maintain strong client relationships over a sustained period of time (years) Reporting directly to the Sales Director in London, presenting weekly, monthly, and quarterly activity and performance reports Disciplined approach to updating customer information and reporting on CRM System Acts in a professional manner reflecting the aims and values of the company Proven track record in a solution sales environment Received some training in sales Ambitious and experienced enough to grow the territory to whatever they want it to become Used to working to deadlines, target and activity driven Positive, enthusiastic, energetic with good listening skills A polished presenter Good with Word, Excel, and PowerPoint English speaking Knowledge of the wire and cable industry and contacts in this area a distinct advantage Ability to think out of the box Tenacious, persistent Able to present a sales plan then deliver it  If you are interested in applying for this post, please send your updated CV and a cover letter explaining your interest in the position. Deadline to apply: 18 October 2021.  Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Senior Sales Manager to join a rapidly growing company headquartered in Singapore - a global internet technology company, mainly dedicated to mobile internet application development.  The position is based in Israel, Dubai or Singapore (with an option to relocate).  Responsibilities Grow company’s client base in Israel by generating client leads and driving the sales process through various channels including email, phone, social media, or face to face meetings Identify and build relationships with key clients in Israel across both gaming and non-gaming verticals Act as the day-to-day client lead and manage relationships with IL clients Campaign management - including results measurement, analysis and post-campaign reporting Support local and global sales teams in client outreach, creation of sales materials and client servicing Identify new areas of growth and upsell opportunities between client needs and the company’s product offerings Become an evangelist for the company in Israel. Engage with and inform advertisers and partners on the company's products and developments Deliver against quarterly KPIs Work with internal teams in planning campaigns for all IL clients Preferred Qualifications BA/BS degree 4+ years in sales, digital advertising, ad-tech and/or equivalent TMT roles Strong network and familiarity of the gaming industry - Must Experience working for MMP or SDK network - Advantage Excellent written and verbal communication skills; a proven track record in winning sales pitches Strong understanding of the Israeli at-tech eco-system. Proven track record of reaching and exceeding revenue goals Strategic, creative, and out of the box thinking Ability to perform well in a dynamic, rapidly changing environment. Proficiency in Hebrew - Must

description: Job Description  Rolls-Royce Solutions Asia (Formerly MTU Asia) is now hiring for a Sales Engineering Manager to join our team to support the Sales team for all technical application engineering related support for diesel and gas genset projects across APAC.  At Rolls-Royce, we pioneer the power that matters to our customers, to society and to the planet.  Our Power Systems business is a world-leader in large reciprocating engines, propulsion and distributed energy systems. We’re headquartered in Friedrichshafen in Southern Germany and employ around 11,000 people. Our product portfolio includes; MTU brand high-speed engines and propulsion systems; MTU Onsite Energy; Bergen Engines and L’Orange.  Key Accountabilities Provides the design, drawing and documents for the customer’s technical requirements including the calculation, verification of relevant equipment/suppliers and providing the technical specifications and defines the scope of supply for the equipment. Provides technical specs and scope of supply for suppliers/contractors to quote. Subsequently coordinating with factory and local suppliers for scope of supply and provides total product and project cost calculation. Provides/coordinates replies to the technical inquiries with Sales Manager. Raises the necessary purchase requisitions for the scope of supply and manages the order with internal departments, suppliers and contractors till all contractual requirements are fulfilled. Coordinate with all the stakeholders for the technical assistance/clarification of the order, sales engineering, and drawings/documents which may require business travels overseas as and when required. Uses the computerized engineering tools/database and technical library information and factory standards for the sales engineering work and provides and maintains the product and sales engineering information. Prepares and carries out technical presentations and training. Updates oneself with the technical developments of the market and internal products with particular focus on keeping updated and informed on the applicable international and in country technical standards. Qualifications Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree qualification in Mechanical or Electrical engineering with established experience in the diesel/gas engine/generator industry. Hands on experience on international engineering projects, site installation, site supervision and commissioning of diesel genset with knowledge of genset control system and electrical power systems. Knowledge of engineering calculation for genset and electrical systems with knowledge of switchgear and electrical power protection being an added advantage. Understanding of Asian cultures and business practices across Asia Pacific region. Good communicator and a team player with a proactive and positive attitude. Willingness to travel. Proficient in English language. We offer excellent opportunities to develop, along with a competitive salary and exceptional benefits. These include bonus, employee support assistance and employee discounts.  Pioneer beyond tomorrow. Join us and you’ll develop your skills and expertise to the very highest levels, working in an international environment for a company known the world over for brilliance and innovation.  Beyond tomorrow  We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realize their full potential.  You can learn more about our global Diversity and Inclusion strategy here .  So that you can be your best at work and home, we’ll consider flexible working arrangements for everyone, in any role.  Rolls-Royce follows a merit-based employee recruitment process and does not charge/accept any payment/security deposit from candidates during the recruitment process. Candidates seeking employment with Rolls-Royce should be cautious of potentially fraudulent communications and offers from individuals and agencies purporting to be from, or acting on behalf of, Rolls-Royce.  Please refer to the Career section on the Rolls-Royce website to verify employment offers or vacancies. Rolls-Royce shall not be liable for any loss, damage or consequences that may arise from any communication or offer of employment not directly made by Rolls-Royce.  Rolls-Royce reserves the right to take legal action against any individuals or agencies acting on behalf of Rolls-Royce without authorisation.  Job CategorySalesPosting Date16 Aug 2021; 00:08

description: Endeavor Streaming is the leading provider of over-the-top video digital entertainment technologies for Sports Federations, Broadcasters/MSOs and Content Owners. Our end-to-end digital platform delivers, distributes and monetizes live and on-demand content across all Internet-connected devices and powers the world’s biggest sports and entertainment brands including WWE, NBA, NFL, UEFA, EFL, Univision, BT, Eleven Sports, and more.  We are proven to provide the world’s most dynamic and interactive digital experiences that are shaping the future of OTT video distribution.  We are on a mission to continue to change the future of TV and this is your chance to be a part of a game-changing, rapidly growing company!   We are searching for an exceptional person to join our global Commercial Team at Endeavor Streaming. We are looking for someone who is passionate about digital technology and has a proven track record in digital media and specifically the delivery of end-to-end OTT premium video services. The candidate must be highly motivated, extremely organized, team-oriented, creative and with an eye for technical and product details and possess outstanding communication skills.   Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities Develop deep knowledge of Endeavor Streaming’s core platforms and services to enable detailed presentation of our OTT solutions and associated products as well as help define the optimum implementation approach for each prospective client. Serve as the primary technical and product lead supporting the Commercial Teams across a wide range of sales engagements across Sports Federations, Broadcasters/MSOs and Content Owners. Take ownership of all aspects related to the technical, platform and product presentation and associated documentation needs such as proposal documents, RFPs, RFIs and general presentation materials. Support the Commercial team to deliver compelling presentations to prospective clients including real-time demonstrations of Endeavor Streaming’s customers’ services as we as our comprehensive OTT platform toolsets. Manage multiple workstreams and track progress through Salesforce. Support the Commercial Team at industry conferences and trade events.   Key Result Areas To continue Endeavor Streaming’s success and growth. To build client’s trust in Endeavor Streaming’s technical and product capability throughout the sales process. To be the link between the client's technical and product leadership and Endeavor Streaming’s product and operations teams. To ultimately help win and onboard new clients to Endeavor Streaming’s growing client roster.  Knowledge & Experience BA/BS or equivalent required (software or business focused desired) Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong technical writing skills Experience in a customer facing environment, specifically in digital product and technology sales processes Knowledge of OTT video platform products as well as the underlying platform technology and architecture Enthusiastic, passionate self-starter motivated by helping win new business Ability to work on multiple projects at once  Previous experience of working for a business-to-business OTT platform provider, or with large Broadcasters or Sports Federations an advantage
industries: Broadcast Media, Entertainment, and Sports

description: About the compan: Gloat is a revolutionary startup based in New York and Tel Aviv. Our pioneering Internal Talent Marketplace has disrupted the HR Tech industry and is now powering some of the world’s largest, and most innovative companies in their journey of becoming future-ready workforces. If HR tech, career development, and the future of work are issues you care about - you’re in for a crazy ride. Life at Gloat: We are a fast-growing and dynamic startup with 140+  team members between our offices in Tel Aviv New York City and also sites in the UK and Melbourne. We value collaboration and innovative thinking. We’re looking for bright, driven, and passionate people to grow with us  Who we’re looking for: Smart and ambitious people Great communicators  Outgoing with a “can do” attitude is critical Eager to learn new things daily  You love being part of a team and want to make an impact Desire to work in a fast-changing environment Critical thinkers  You consider yourself a driven person About the Roll Our office is located in New York City but you can work remotely from within the US. We are a fast-growing HR Tech start-up looking to hire an Enterprise Account Executive with a hunter mentality to join our team. You will work in a fast-paced environment while playing a key role in developing new customer relationships. You will manage all aspects of the sales cycle selling to Fortune 500 companies, from prospecting to closing new business. We are looking for candidates who are self-starters, have high integrity, thrive in dynamic environments and have experience carrying a quota in enterprise SaaS or software sales Responsibilities: You will drive and close new sales opportunities selling to Fortune 500 companies You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle, including prospecting, qualifying opportunities, developing contacts, facilitating presentations, pricing proposals, negotiations and closing deals You will focus on consistently achieving targets while executing sales strategies for assigned region and generating accurate sales forecasts You will proactively build new customer and prospect relationships with C-level contacts, decision makers, and other key stakeholders You will utilize a customer centric approach in maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction working together with the Customer Success team to ensure positive outcomes You will build and manage pipeline by cultivating inbound sales leads and generate new business opportunities via outbound activities You will develop and maintain a deep understanding of both the customers and competitive landscape You will operate within software start-up environment collaborating closely with your colleagues across the company Requirements: 5+ years minimum enterprise software or SaaS sales experience hunting large opportunities at Fortune 500 companies Proven success in managing all aspects of consultative sales from prospecting through closing of $1M+ contracts to large enterprises Consistent track record of top performance in achieving and exceeding sales quotas Exceptional prospecting, opportunity development and relationship building skills with ability to proactively build pipeline Customer centric mindset passionate about ensuring customer satisfaction Previous experience selling SaaS/Cloud based HR software to C-levels within large enterprise accounts is preferred Strong verbal and written communication skills, with ability to deliver compelling product demonstrations, use cases and sales pitches Highly motivated, independent self-starter with a high level of integrity and professionalism who is a team player and can thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment Willingness to travel Bachelor degree preferred

description: Romer Labs, a global player in food safety, is a leading provider of diagnostic solutions for the agricultural, food and feed industry. Our broad range of innovative tests and services play a pivotal role in integrated food safety solutions. We develop, produce and market test kits and services for detecting food allergens, food pathogens, genetically modified ingredients, mycotoxins and veterinary drug residues using state of the art technology. Romer Labs is part of ERBER Group.  Our sales Team in Singapore is facing rapid growth: existing markets still have potential and new markets await us! Do you want to grow too – professionally and personally? Then join our team at your earliest convenience as Regional Senior Sales Manager The Regional Senior Sales Manager is responsible for managing business development activities with a primary focus on prospecting new opportunities in Food Safety products with a specific focus on Mycotoxin, Allergen, Food Pathogen, GMO and Hygiene products. Defining and driving strategies and ensuring the achievement of sales, lead generation and pipeline growth is a key objective, Regional Sales manager will be responsible for revenue target for SEA region and will have a strong role in contributing to Asia Pacific region overall success.  As a real performer you are in charge of the following: Provide new sales opportunities in Regulatory Departments, Global Key Accounts and Regional Key Accounts across SEA region will be primary objective of this position and will involve working closely with cross functional teams within Romer Labs Strategic Business Unit Partners with Business Managers and Application Teams on customer visits to provide strong commercial support, and assist in the promotion of Mycotoxin, Allergen, Food Pathogen, GMO and Hygiene products at all marketing events and activities Work closely with Distributors, Channel Partners and Business Managers will also be part of a daily routine Responsible for salesforce.com processes such as provide quotation to distributors for special cases or projects and closing orders Manage Global Key Account at regional level and responsible for achieving the Global Key Account sales and targets attainment in S.E.A region Responsible for forecasting and sales tracking, and to achieve the revenue and profitability targets for ROMER Labs products Conduct product demonstrations, global training program, organize workshops and seminars regionally Responsible to support customers on-site validations and execute experimental protocols to gain qualifications and order success Assist and collaborate with regional marketing team in the development of sales support materials and marketing campaigns Drives brand awareness of products, conduct training and seminars for clients, channel partners and sales team Maintains contacts with local business and technical associations and network with industry key opinion leaders to expand sales opportunities Responsible for daily salesforce.com engagement to support opportunities tracking For result-driven Sales Managers with passion for food safety, we are the best place to be. Are you ready? Minimum Bachelor of Science in Food Technology, Biomedical Science or equivalent 8 years of relevant experience in sales and business development Strong leadership capabilities and established track record in effective leadership talents which includes people development in channel partners Proven track record of achievement in a prior sales position Demonstrate strong closing skills. Prior training in Customer Focus Selling skills course will be an advantage Preferably working knowledge of food safety diagnostic kits Possess excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills Highly dedicated and sales driven with a high degree of personal motivation Demonstrate strong passion to understand and network with Food Safety industry Frequent travel is expected in accordance with business needs Our culture: Pioneers, Partners and Performers – this means for you: 100% of trust in you and your skills in advance Structured on-boarding program for a good start into your new job Portfolio of scientifically sound and proven products and services Participation in the most important national and international trade fairs and events in our industry Training on the job with experienced colleagues as well as a comprehensive internal and external training offer You are part of a successful company with successful employees, that makes you successful too! Have a look at our What else do you need to know? Reference Number: 676 You will be based in Singapore (E-Center@Redhill) (Singapore) Your type of employment: 40 hours/week, full-time, permanent contract Attractive compensation and benefits available Are you ready to leave real 'foodprints‘ with us? We are looking forward to your online application.  Interested candidates are invited to submit your resume to jobasia@romerlabs.com or apply online via APPLY NOW button below.  Or visit our website: www.romerlabs.com

Set and meet activity targets- outbound calls and conversions. Maintain industry networks and relationships to stay informed of competitor activities. Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation process.  Requirements: 3+ years of experience with a Bachelor’s degree is preferred. An understanding of outbound B2B tech sales development / inside sales role. Selling experience in international markets would be an advantage. Strong analytical skills and proven ability to solve problems creatively. Capable of working independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Communicate effectively with C-Suite executives. A positive and energetic phone presence, combined with excellent oral and written communication skills is a must.  About Hire Digital  Hire Digital is a freelance network of top talents in digital marketing, web development, and design. Our clients work with high-performing teams as well as individual talents who have gone through a rigorous screening process. Clients such as Shopify, Expedia, and Stripe have access to high-performing talents on-demand, with guaranteed performance.  Powered by JazzHR  KxBsBtaEZI

About GrowthOps  GrowthOps is a fully integrated consultancy that makes growth simple for our enterprise clients. We provide end-to-end digital marketing, diagnostic audits, customer-eccentric and product-led growth strategy, marketing execution and platform development to help clients grow.  GrowthOps's full-funnel and multi=disciplinary marketing capabilities help CMOs and the C-suite to align both their marketing and product strategy to deliver relevant, memorable and loyalty-inducing customer experiences.  Our core services include: customer research, experience design, data and analytics, creative advertising, brand strategy, software development, cloud services, artificial Intelligence development, organizational design and change leadership.  Our team covers all major industry sectors from local bases in Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Hong Kong, Manila, Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra and Auckland.  Job Description We are looking for a Growth Manager with experience in the digital marketing, advertising and management consulting space to grow the business at GrowthOps.   This candidate will work with the Chief Growth Officer to develop end to end sales strategy and to build out a solid pipeline across small to enterprise-level sales for GrowthOps strategy, creative and growth marketing practices.   This will be a target based role with a competitive commission package.  Responsibilities of the Growth Manager Work in partnership with the Chief Growth Officer to develop plans and strategies for developing business and achieving the company’s sales goals. Take the lead in developing the deal from inception to proposal and support the account until it is handed over to the GrowthOps Client Servicing teams. Assist in the development of the sales plan.  Hunt and farm for new opportunities by tapping on personal network, GrowthOps’ network and through the company’s own PR & digital marketing efforts. Prepares forecasts and KPI reporting for upper management, for use in organizational planning, financial forecasting, budget setting and strategic planning. Build processes and workflow for manual top-down reachout, onboarding, activation, and expansion. Evangelise the GrowthOps services and personally help close significant deals. Leverage on partnerships with marketing technology platforms to synergize sales opportunities Work collaboratively across internal teams in different countries/ practices to drive successful closure to all deals. Provide full visibility into the sales pipeline at every stage of development. Establish and foster partnerships and relationships with key customers both externally and internally.  Requirements This ideal candidate should be excited by the business consulting and digital marketing industry as well as by the challenge of selling into new markets, strategizing pitch proposals, negotiating complex deals and closing the deals with clients independently. The ideal candidate should bring strong relationships with enterprise clients as well as work experience in the digital/creative/advertising/management consultancy space.  Strong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions. Strength in problem solving, issue-resolution, ability to work in a deadline-driven work environment, attention to detail, and ability to multitask must be evident. Demonstrated strong relationship-building and communication skills, with a strong presence in boardroom environments.   Skills and Qualifications 7-10+ years of relevant sales experience Demonstrated track record of successful sales experience, bringing deals in the range of SGD 300K to SGD 5m deals. Both 80% hunter and 20% farmer characteristics. Proven ability to influence external clients, partners and internal teams & departments. Experience in Salesforce and the full Google Suite such as drive, Slides, Doc, Sheet and Gmail are critical.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Management Consulting, and Information Technology and Services

description: GOARC, the worldwide leader in Connected Worker technology space, is currently searching for an enthusiastic Senior Sales Executive with a sales hunter mentality to join our fast-growing sales team. Our elite sales professionals take a consultative solution selling approach towards understanding the customer’s needs and guiding the customer to the appropriate GOARC solution.  Do you have an entrepreneurial spirt? Are you consistently meeting and exceeding expectations in your current role? Are you looking for your next challenge? Do you thrive in a competitive environment where your peers inspire you to perform? Are you interested in working in a fast-paced environment with an all-star team growing professionally and financially? If so, we want to meet you!  The Senior Sales Executive will maximize profitable company sales revenue by identifying, qualifying, negotiating, and closing new connected worker, operational risk management, environment, health and safety business with new and existing clients. This position is primarily selling GOARCa’s SaaS solutions. This role will be the personification of GOARC in all matters within and outside the company with an unflagging commitment to customer satisfaction, delight, trust, and loyalty.  Requirements  The ideal candidate will own sales for identified target accounts in APAC and industry vertical and will possess the following: A minimum of 5+ years of successful experience in selling Enterprise Software and Technology solutions to the Global 2000 in either Energy, Resources, or Chemical industries Demonstrated success in closing large and complex sales; encourages and contributes to creative deal making; actively leverages role to close sales through appropriate sales channels and partners Strong hunter skills Experience should include negotiations, successful partnerships and / or joint ventures. Has implemented successful sales strategies in changing markets. Understands the product sales cycle and challenges, including the strategies of competitors, and leverages this knowledge to hone sales strategies. Appropriately adapts and leverages products, services and operations to effectively compete in competitive markets Assigns the highest priority to customer satisfaction. Listens to customers Has personally closed major deals and is well known and respected, maintaining effective interpersonal relationships with the key decision-makers in customer organizations. Enjoys interaction with customers and prospects and is a person that our sales people would welcome to participate in the sales process. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment and ability to navigate and excel in a complex, heavily matrixed organizations Demonstrated relationship management skills are essential, including the ability to relate successfully to a variety of people externally and internally, and to form strong relationships with key decision makers Proficiency with MS applications and CRM tools required (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, salesforce.com) Will demonstrate a desire to function as an entrepreneur within GOARC, and will not rely on large staffs to support their efforts Consistently met or surpassed yearly quota TRAVEL: 50% of the time  Responsibilities  Senior Sales Executive (Sales Director) within GOARC’s team will sell to Enterprise accounts, with a focus on hunting new accounts. Executing against quarterly and yearly sales goals Qualifying and disqualifying new business opportunities while identifying customer pain Delivering executive GOARC point of view dialogue Hunting activities (includes cold calling, conferences, trade shows etc.) Cross functional collaboration with Customer Success Managers Maintaining accurate forecasts Accountability for driving revenue growth across GOARC's assigned business lines to include identification of revenue drivers and metrics - creating visibility with all market owners on revenue trends and actions to drive revenues to plan Deliver solution presentations to key customers Develop enterprise software license proposals Negotiate enterprise software contracts Learning customer decision process Creating closing plans for forecasted business Close business in a timely manner Fully comprehend the GOARC unique value proposition.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Insider is a B2B SaaS company with a unique approach to multichannel experience orchestration. Recently, Insider announced its $32 Million Series C funding round by Sequoia. Insider was named the #1 leader on G2’s Mobile Marketing Software and Personalization Grids, with a 4.6/5 rating based 100% on user reviews, 19 quarters in a row. Insider was also named as the #1 Leader in the Forrester Wave for Cross-Channel Campaign Management (CCCM) with the highest overall score among all vendors, with a 5/5 rating in numerous criteria. CrunchBase recently ranked Insider’s co-founder and CEO Hande Cilingir as one of the top women CEOs outside the US.  Many of the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies and top brands in retail, automotive, and travel use Insider to deliver AI-backed personalized experiences that exceed customer expectations. Insider is trusted by over 800 global businesses, including UNIQLO, Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Toyota, New Balance, IKEA, Samsung, Newsweek, MediaMarkt, Nissan, AVIS, Marks & Spencer, Allianz, BBVA, Dominos, Avon, and CNN.  As an Expansion Manager, you will be responsible for delivering consistent, predictable revenue growth from our existing clients. You will be working with our Client Success organization to identify client needs and map Insider Solutions to create more partner value.  Good salespeople need two things. World-class innovative products and convenient commercials to cater to their prospects. Well, we offer world-leading products and a flexible commercial. These give us a starting point, but for most of us, that is just not enough. We like betting on ourselves to score the highest possible in this game, to climb the highest mountain, and to be the best there is. We are not only disrupting the tech ecosystem and democratizing the market but we are also disrupting the entire Saas sales community as well. All because we have a different style of sales. That's why we were able to expand so rapidly and we will never stop. If you want to know more about how not only to disrupt product & development but also disrupt B2B Saas sales, join us!  What to Expect in this Role? Take full ownership of accounts’ growth/expansion, while creating cross-sell and up-sell opportunities Connect and build relationships with existing clients and act as a trusted advisor with an eye for up-sell opportunities Identify opportunities to expand revenue from current customers through understanding long-term strategic business goals work with Client Success organization to identify client needs and map Insider Solutions to create more partner value, Helps us drive our hyper-growth and make a positive impact on client retention. We want you to join us while we are taking a step into the future if you; have minimum 5 years of sales experience, ideally within existing portfolio have previous experience with eCommerce, retail and banking industries are a plus! have ability to manage multiple opportunities simultaneously at various stages of the buying process have ability to develop senior-level relationships quickly and effectively have the ability to succeed working cross-functionally with sales and partner success teams. experience presenting to senior managers and the C-level executives have a university degree in Business, Marketing, or related fields. While we are conquering the world, we are offering you: a chance to work in an international, diverse, and inclusive environment, access and opportunity to gain a limitless network all over the globe, a chance to become a Shareowner with the "Shareowner System" that we offer to all Insiders who meet certain criteria, to be part of an industry that’s shaping the future of customer experiences competitive compensation packages, access to many hard and soft skills pieces of training to help you improve and challenge yourself, weekly trainings on our Sales University where we host industry leaders, access to Udemy’s business plan, where you can choose over 10,000 courses to satisfy your hunger for knowledge, space to share your skills, and even deliver pieces of training and workshops if you wish. Sharing is caring! the infamous team activities that are bursting with fun, no Dress Code! We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.  Please follow Insider on LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtube, Stack Overflow, and Medium!
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Retail

description: Summary: A great opportunity to be part of a well-known distributor and as the company is expanding in the local market, you will gain great insights into how the company envisions the brand’s growth and establish yourself as the driving force behind the brand. We are looking for someone with a mature and disciplined mindset, possess a self-starter attitude.  Job Description: · Spearhead the sales team in visioning of sales and marketing strategy · Responsible for brand activities and sales revenue generation through the local wholesalers · Work closely with the local wholesaler to sell, promote the product portfolio · Establish and maintain close relationships with all existing and new clients to explore new sales and cross selling opportunities · Seize business opportunities to increase market share and strengthen brand market presence through negotiations · Report directly to GM, responsible for development and performance of sales activities for on-trade and off-trade segment · Develop promotional campaigns, formulate sales plans and strategies to increase overall on-trade sales revenue and strengthen market shares · Ensure timely report of sales call and feedback other key competitors’ activities  Requirements: · Diploma in any field · Minimum 5 years of sales experience in FMCG industry, candidate with wines/spirits sales experience preferred · Good interpersonal and communication skills · Efficient problem solving and analytical skills, result oriented · Good negotiation and presentation skills · Both a leader and a good team player
industries: Import and Export

description: >  ABOUT US XP Power is a global leader in providing essential power solutions to the Industrial Technology, Healthcare and Semiconductor Manufacturing Equipment sectors. We design and manufacture power controllers, the essential hardware component in every piece of electrical equipment that converts power from the electricity grid into the right form for equipment to function. Listed as a FTSE 250 company on the London Stock Exchange we are a fast-growing business, serving our global blue-chip customer base from 29 locations across Europe, North America, and Asia. We are extremely proud and committed to our culture that values Customer Focus, Flexibility, Knowledge, Speed, and Integrity. Joining our team means you’ll work in a high performing global organisation where employees collaborate, and strive to make XP Power the first-choice power solutions provider delivering the ultimate experience for our customers and our people.  >  THE OPPORTUNITY We are looking for self-motivated professionals who thrive in fast paced dynamic environments to join our team. We are proud of and committed to our culture that values Customer Focus, Flexibility, Knowledge, Speed, and Integrity. Joining our team means you will work in a high performing global company where employees collaborate and strive for excellence and can make a difference.  >  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Business Development              Good knowhow in Power supplies application to facilitate customer’s requirements and needs generation. Perform market research on power supplies application for opportunities Cold call, prospect and identify new customers and opportunities within Asia Work with Product development and marketing team to understand product trends and requirement. Provide necessary support if needed Update and maintain Salesforce Database Follow up and update on Project status.  Leads Generation Contact potential customer to understand and create needs. Work with FAE team to review solutions with customers Work with outside sales to close the link with customer to follow through the project. Maintain focus on the total customer experience in all interactions with customers and partners.  System and Process Improve effectiveness and efficiency on existing systems and work procedures. To work closely with the inside sales, quality engineers, application engineers with other supporting staffs  Sales Support Work closely with outside sales to support customers/opportunities identified and seamlessly transfer customer/opportunities to outside sales to manage Visit to exhibitions and customers to understand the technology and market demand. To create more opportunities interest.  > Key Qualifications and Skills Good interpersonal and presentation skills Independent, Proactive and highly motivated Must be a team player with positive attitude, self-driven and multitasking Able to work independently under pressure in a dynamic environment. Process good business acumen Good written and verbal communication skills Good negotiation and persuasive skills and is action oriented and customer focus  > WHY WORK FOR US? XP Power provides a safe and healthy working environment that is stimulating and collaborative, where employees are empowered to make a real difference. We place our people at the heart of everything we do. We understand that if we provide our people with the ultimate experience, they will provide the ultimate experience to our customers. We also offer a comprehensive benefits package including: Company healthcare Term-life insurance coverage Friendly work environment.   > OUR PEOPLE – OUR POWER XP Power is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating an environment where people are valued, supported and nurtured to deliver their best. Operating globally, we celebrate the cultural differences that exist in the countries in which we do business. Being a truly diverse and inclusive community helps us grow our business through innovation; attracting and retaining talent to engage the people who buy our power solutions. We know that by cultivating the ultimate experience for all our people, they will deliver the same to our customers.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Industrial Automation, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: We're looking for a collaborative team player who is also unafraid to articulate his or her points-of-view. You will be responsible for delivering growth in market share and revenue for one of our business units - Quick Retailing and her brands through the implementation of sales and marketing strategies.  What will you do Establish and develop Key Business Partner relationships in target areas as agreed with upper management. Lead and manage business development strategy for Singapore and non-presence SEA countries. Sales pipeline management Lead marketing strategy and execution, deliver measurable, high quality, multi-channel programs and activities that are designed to drive awareness and increase engagement among clients and prospects to drive growth. Oversee regional content strategy as well as customer advocacy program to drive engagement with the community. Develop the affiliate marketing strategy with the aim of recruiting new affiliate partners and delivering sales volume Proactively acquire, onboard, and manage new and existing partners, influencers and KOLs to grow affiliate and marketing programs. Effective sales and supply chain interface that will ensure proper and accurate volume forecast Partner with Product Management and Marketing to consistently deliver effective product launches and the right messaging and positioning to prospects and customers. Be responsible for the measurement and success of all programmes; reporting, analysis and interpretation of trends. Continuously learn and evolve to build on positive impact and innovate to improve customer experience. Assist in the planning, execution and coordination of activities related to Quick Retailing participation in industry events and/or trade conferences. Design and execute programs that include events, emails, tactical PR, regular comms/newsletters, content, landing pages, webinars and product updates among other activities. Deliver seminars/ talks/ workshops both locally and (i.e. China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Vietnam, Europe etc.) for the purpose of lead generations and strategic marketing
