description: A global company with a distinctively French identity, Motul remains true to its roots while looking towards the future. Today, Motul continues to power forward its automotive and industrial competences in the lubricant space. Motul employs the same ideology everywhere: passion for ingenuity. This passion, which unites lovers of engineering to their machinery is the same passion that unites Motul’s People. Continuously crafting new solutions, ingenuity is at the heart of Motul’s culture.  Job Summary  Working in a matrix organization this role will have the following primary areas of responsibility in APAC: Manage Motul brand guidelines, messaging and ATL execution Marketing Lead for Motul local ATL & Trade Marketing activities  This role will require agility to partner key stakeholders across Global and APAC Business Units on the deployment of Branding & ATL activities, as well as work closely with commercial leaders on local trade marketing activities to ensure all marketing objectives from the strategic house is achieved.  Responsibilities  Regional Branding & Communications (APAC): Working in collaboration with Global, Regional GMs, local marketing teams & Category Managers  Custodian for all Motul brand messaging. Develop and implement brand guidelines and brand management policies, including brand licensing/merchandising partnership projects. Work closely with brand agency to ensure brand playbook, brand campaigns & product launch assets are according to brand tonality consistently and ensuring these are cascaded to all Asia Pacific markets.  Lead across all ATL channels. Review and manage media strategy, buy, formats & creative channels are in line with set company direction. Lead in marketing maximization of all current and future sponsorship contracts. Strong in identifying new opportunities that will provide gains to the brand, be it commercially or from the brand perspective. To be the main marketing contact leading the strategy and deployment of contractual commitments. Building credible industry level Key Opinion leaders/ communities relevant to the Motul brand (ie Workshop owners, Petrol heads, Racing enthusiasts etc) Lead and manage ATL media buying agency and media data Lead the regional marketing planning activities/campaigns related to new product launches Be at the forefront of effective marketing strategy and ensuring close monitoring of industry trends to position Motul as an active adopter of new technologies, best practices and new interactive solutions. Public Relations: Lead in PR to ensure key brand media communications are communicated “real time” with the media across Asia establishing always a “winning top of mind” position for the brand among media, customers and business partners. Be an active member of the Motul APAC Crisis Cell, supporting external communication strategy where necessary.  BTL: Regional trade marketing & Events Lead: Working in collaboration with Regional Sales Directors Lead in competitive ideating, formulation and logistic coordination on regional trade marketing. Formulation of regional trade marketing launches and promotions. Capitalize on contract partners (listed above), lead discussions and formulate “win win” partnerships and cascade unified promotions & events directions across markets to achieve one Brand Voice and achieve greater efficient especially contract ROI. Always be on the lookout for the best trade mechanics to maintain brand strength and achieve better demand for the product. Together with Business Unit heads, develop and implement regional trade marketing strategy that support local objectives, this includes formulating E2E winning promotion that will excite buy in from trade. Lead the ideation, planning and overall execution of key regional events eg: Annual Distributors’ Meeting, racing events, incentive trips for distributors or customers Work closely with Business Units in formulating key marketing especially trade marketing and events performance indicators and constantly ensuring improvements & KPIS are met  People & Processes Active participation in budgeting, reforecasts, yearly, multi-year budgets. Fully accountable for ATL & regional trade marketing budget, ensuring investment efficiency. Constantly review and improve reporting for both corporate & country expenses Measure and report performance for all ATL, regional & country level trade marketing campaigns Mentor, develop and grow the capabilities of direct reports to achieve Team Line up. Be the main interlocutor of HR for identification of people’s needs: recruitment, training, motivation, career path, appraisals, succession plans and competencies assessment  Requirements  Qualification: University degree or diploma in Marketing, Business Management or equivalent Past work experience: Preferred 10-15 years of experience in managing distributors, suppliers, media and business partners, and in managing a marketing department in both, corporate and trade activities. Innovative, adaptable, pro-active and skilled in problem solving. Effective communicator across all levels of management and staff level. Industry preference: Past lubricants industry is preferred Tool requirement: Well-versed in MS Office, especially MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
industries: Oil & Energy

description: What’s up? We’re VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH Our amazing client partnership team is looking forward to collaborating with a “people first” Account Director to lead multiple exciting accounts in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Client Partnerships APAC.  Here’s your first brief -- Big thinker yet hands-on in execution. Exemplary track record of experience in the Singapore market. Natural entrepreneurial spirit and love for social media. Overall leader who runs the day to day, keeping the wheels moving and your client and team motivated. Tech-focused and geek everything technology; Gaming, e-sports, new technologies. Gatekeeper of the brand equity and quality control of work prior to it leaving the building. Manages overall client’s business, ensuring that we are delivering for the client’s business everyday. Navigate a portfolio of brands within a larger conglomerate or business group, and be deeply informed on the client’s business, including all campaign performance, any competitive, as well as product cycle Deep and more proactive understanding of the client’s business outside of our campaigns or the marketing context. Proactively identify needs of the client and business to sell-through incremental campaign opportunities to clients, that help them achieve the most efficient returns & results on their overall marketing dollars, while delivering best in class work that help grow client business Strong foundational and working knowledge of creative and media across major digital and social channels. Well versed in common marketing and media principles with a strong understanding of the social media platforms and their ecosystems.  Your Experience 6+ years of relevant work experience in the media or advertising field, including an account management experience in the APAC advertising landscape. Competencies: Business strategy, digital asset management, digital media planning and buying. Proficiency in written, verbal and presentation skills. Strategic sales planning, pipeline management, relationship building, digital market knowledge, negotiation skills, presentation skills, analytical skills. People management Worked with teams in complex, multi-geography, multi-cultural environments.   What you should know about VaynerMedia Think “lab” and not “agency”. We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We’re willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It’s fun! Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Media Production

description: We are looking for a passionate Sales Specialist (Digital Applications) to join us in Singapore. In this role, you will promote technology domain-focused solutions within a practice area or service area to drive expansion within focused accounts for Digital Application Services  Job Description  •       Generate demand by assisting clients to identify and qualify current needs •       Effectively articulate how NTT Ltd can add value through its services solutions offerings. •       Work closely with paired strategic client managers. •       Conduct business conversations with the client that are solution usage and results orientated, focusing on why the offering is needed and how it can be used to meet the client’s needs. •       Prospect for new opportunities within an account and engage in business development activities that lead to new business opportunities for NTT Ltd. •       Lead the negotiation of deals with clients and lead the internal account management team to enable conclusion of the deal. •       Deepen relationships with domain-specific client key stakeholders and vendors, building new relationships and deepening solution knowledge. •       Contribute to the knowledge base of NTT Ltd’s solutions and services within a practice area or service area by sharing best practices with clients •       Use understanding of the client’s business and depth of knowledge on the technology-specific solution to personalise the recommended solution in line with the client’s need •       Achieve sales targets and assigned strategic account objectives. •       Follow pre-sales by working with Solutions Architects to create the best solution design for the client. •       Manage vendors partners to understand their strategies for solutions and services, can articulate the roadmap, and associated impacts for clients. •       Formulate, evaluate, and consider opportunities as a potential buy and decides when to withdraw from the sales engagement and when to pursue it. •       Oversees the generation of new business, within existing accounts.    Key Responsibilities  Ø Knowledge, Skills and Attributes: •       Sales business acumen – the skills supporting successful selling through organizational and business outcome mindset. Success will require focusing on planning, leveraging tools and data, and concentrating on NTT Ltd business requirements. Developing the skills to understand your client’s business (including commercial and financial aspects) in order to bring value to them from NTT’s portfolio of services. •       Sales client engagement & management – the skills used to effectively manage and analyse the client throughout the client lifecycle, with the goal of improving client relationships and driving sales growth. Success will require detailed understanding of client needs, effective sales planning, and building trust, all while managing to client expectations. Developing the skills required to know your client, building effective & lasting relationships with them and to be seen as a trusted advisor. •       Sales solution skills – the knowledge of NTT Ltd’s offerings, client applications, use cases and market trends and the skill to apply them to individual client and prospect situations that positions the sales team member as an expert client advisor. Success will require the ability to link NTT Ltd offerings, including high-value services to specific client and prospect needs and outcomes •       Sales resources optimisation – building internal relationships, working with pursuit teams and leveraging vendors as resources throughout the sales cycle. •       Sales pursuit – the skills and knowledge that enable a sales team member to create success by identifying and advancing opportunities at assigned prospects and clients. Success will require both individual ownership as well as accountability for coordinating internal and external resources in order to close sales opportunities. •       Sales strategy execution – the skills to ensure that the sales strategy is aligned to the business strategy. •       Sales business management – the skills to ensure that target setting, and associated processes is aligned to meeting the target. •         Technology expertise As an Applications Sales Specialist, you will have hands on experience in selling any of the below Application Development services Application Products and Services App Modernization & Migration Middleware Platforms Data Analytics solutions Cloud Based – SaaS/PaaS solutions Application Managed Services Engage Clients and share the value proposition of NTT’s application services and participate in deep commercials discussions via presentation slides to ensure solutions are designed to client needs. Research and maintain an understanding of trends within the market and understand the role of new technologies disrupting the market. Demonstrate domain expertise to produce solutions which are vendor agnostic. Understand business relevance and the value of the IT solutions offered to clients. Create roadmap Sales Specialist will build a holistic view of the client’s organization strategy, processes, information, and information technology assets. He/she conducts strategic engagements and work with architecture team to develop an enterprise–wide architecture. They will recommend assessments to gain insights into the client’s current and future states. The Sales Specialist will assist clients in assessing their “as-is” IT service, application and technology estate in defining the target (to-be) state IT service, application and technology landscape (architecture), and producing the business case and roadmap to optimize their IT.   Requirements: Education, Training and Experience Education ·      Candidate must possess at least a bachelor’s degree, Post Graduate Diploma or Professional Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent Work Experience ·      At least 5 years’ Solid experience in a consulting and IT role within a large scale (preferably multi- national) technology services environment as Sales Specialist position with a focus on Applications domain ·      Experience, Knowledge or Exposure to wide variety of Application Services and Cloud Services ·      Direct experience in deals pursuit in large scale and complex IT projects involving multiple technologies. ·      Relevant industry certifications and accreditations in sales credentials    You can share your resume with me at aparna.nair@global.ntt  Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today. Diversity We are an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.
industries: Information Technology and Services

Build strong relationships through your market intelligence and strong client delivery to grow your events Have a deep understanding of your clients' business objectives to make your event an integral part of the development strategy Creative unique package development to suit your clients objectives through conferences and an online platform Create in depth proposals that meet all the clients objectives Requirements A diploma or degree in any field Strong sales experience Good interpersonal and communication skills Organized and meticulous Keen learner Ability to identify client needs and customize solutions

description: Summary Drives large and/or complex business solutions and strategy for targeted/assigned customers. Provides in-depth industry and market expertise as well as technical acumen in developing and executing sale of high-level technical operating strategies, solutions and benefits to meet client's needs and requirements.  Responsibilities As industry expert, develops and drives large and/or complex business solutions for targeted/assigned customers. Provides in-depth solutions architecture capability based on specific customer's business needs. Oversees holistic solutions from both business and technical perspective, taking into account all realities and constraints such as costs, contract terms, business conditions and the technical environment of the client. Understands customer business by actively researching customer to determine business issues. Establishes technical credibility with existing and prospective clients providing the ability to cultivate relationships and envision creative sales and solution strategies that generate additional revenue. Cultivates key trusted-advisor relationships with senior level IT executives demonstrating an understanding of key business challenges within customer markets and how Company technology-enabled business solutions can address those needs. Provides leadership and strategic guidance with pursuit teams during the solution development process to ensure alignment with overall Company sales and client business strategy. Develops high-level technical operating strategies and solutions, and benefits. Analyzes stakeholders, identifies and recognizes prospect traits and determines how to effectively influence their decision. Delivers and sells the technical solution strategy and vision to senior client executives ensuring the solution embodies Company win themes and key differentiators while meeting client expectations and requirements thereby providing Company the best chance to compete and win. Researches existing industry, market and IT (information technology) services best practices and trends as well as alliances to evaluate and ensure Company solutions and services are meeting the needs of clients. Leverages partner solutions to continuously find ways to solve customer needs. Provides recommendations to offering organization on new offerings, upgrades/augmentation to enhance corporate competency in meeting the needs of customers. Acts as technical resource and mentor for less experienced Sales Solutions personnel.  Qualifications Government clearance required to facilitate working on government opportunities Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, information technology or related field preferred Six or more years of business solutions, technical consulting, or sales solutions experience Experience working with the technology industry, specifically handling significantly sized accounts Experience working with solution/product portfolios Experience developing winning sales solutions and proposals Experience working with technology products, services, competencies, solutions and offerings Experience working with business environment, business industry and competitor products and services Strong verbal and written communication skills to persuade others through presentations, demonstration and written communication Strong communication skills to listen to client and articulate back for solutioning Strong selling and negotiation skills Strong interpersonal and presentation skills for interacting with team member and prospective clients up to the Board level Ability to work and lead in a team environment Ability to create and maintain formal and informal networks Ability to publicly represent company with internal and external clients Ability to use own judgment and initiative in problem resolution Ability to present ideas, goals, problems, outcomes and processes to be understood by a diverse audience Ability to articulate and present the business value of Company solutions with a firm understanding of Company strategies and products relative to Company's major competitors
industries: Information Technology and Services

Must be a good team player, pleasant, service oriented and self motivated. Strong team building, interpersonal and communication skills. Hands on computer knowledge of MS Office.

jobTitle: Senior Dir, APAC Consulting Services Sales
description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  The Opportunity  Adobe Digital Experience is making a significant investment in Customer Solutions and is seeking an experienced leader to continue our success. The Senior Director of APAC Services Sales will lead the GTM strategy, Solution Architecture (SA) and Professional services sales (PS Sales) organization. This role will lead an organization of 30+ Services Sales, Presales and Strategy professionals to work with customers to meet their Digital Experience Services requirements and driving a business of 65 to 70M USD.  The leader will partner with the APAC License Sales team and Consulting Delivery Team to bring forth winning strategies and value propositions to Adobe customers. The PS Sales and SA team is responsible for scoping customer requirements and preparing proposals and documentation to meet customer’s business and technical requirements. The leader will also bring an increased focus on strategic offerings that drive repeat and profitable business and one that focusses on business impact.  What you’ll do Strategy : Lead the strategy for the Go to Market organization for APAC Professional Services business. Build pipeline, engage strategically with customers and partners and drive ROI and customer value. Establish deep credibility with CIO/CTOs through expertise and engagement. Business : Drive a net new PS business of $65M – 70M for FY22. Lead Adobe PS Sales and Solution Architecture organization to a higher level of strategic engagement and sales maturity; including collaborating and partnering with adjacent organizations (License Sales Consulting Delivery, Partner leadership, Product Marketing, Inside Sales, Training, etc.) to create a world class GTM. People: Build, coach and develop a world class team, capable of exceeding targets and creating strategic partnerships with customers. Build a strong first line management organization capable of scaling the organization. Establish rigorous sales discipline across all aspects of sales engagement, pipeline development/management and forecasting. Execution: Build a high-performance organization by refining/establishing key functions that drives sales / presales efficiencies and delivers a seamless experience to customers. Establish rigorous sales discipline across all aspects of sales engagement, pipeline development/management and forecasting. description: Headquartered in Singapore, Novade is a fast-growing software company. Our mission is to help companies in the building and construction industry drive their digital transformation with an integrated field management platform. Beside helping our client improve productivity, quality and safety, Novade powerful analytics can quickly transform their data into actionable insights. Our solutions are used daily by thousands of professionals globally.   We are expanding our product portfolio as well as our presence across Asia and Europe and are looking for a Sales Manager to manage the Government Sector in Singapore.   What you will be doing   The Government Sector Sales Manager is responsible for driving sales of Novade products within a specified set of Government related accounts. The role will also be required to develop and work with the channel partners in Singapore, in exceeding sales objectives. This role manages all aspects of the sales process including prospecting, lead management, qualification, product demonstrations, evaluation, close and account care. This is a quota‐carrying sales position that plays an integral role in the success of the overall sales team.  What You’ll Be Doing …  Define and Governmental related sales plans and then meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities within Singapore region. You will be responsible for the development and sales performance of the Singapore Government sector market working closely with our Singapore based Channel Partner. Develop and manage sales pipeline – prospect and assess new sales potential while moving a large number of transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline Provide initial product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers Nurture and expand the company’s relationship within customer accounts within Singapore region Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products Persuasively communicate the value of our solutions in terms of value and impact on customer business goals. You will also work closely with our marketing teams to market our solutions and gather feedback on customer and market needs. Directly interact with our professional services team to ensure successful implementation and customer satisfaction.  Who You Are…  Outstanding verbal and writing, communications and interpersonal skills in English is essential At least 2 years plus experience in software sales, within the Governmental and related sectors  Confidence and ability to interface professionally with a wide spectrum of customers for both existing and new accounts. Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful A Hunter with a Proven track record of selling on value and engagement with C-Suite management.  Be comfortable with technology, mobile apps and cloud services.   We will consider priority candidates with the following attributes   A get it done attitude Demonstrated sales abilities & a track record of successful selling software and account management Previous experience in selling IT into the Singapore Government and related entities.  Proficiency in Solution Selling or Customer Centric selling systems.  Possess high EQ with strong interpersonal skills.   If you are looking for a place where your achievements will be recognized, rewarded and celebrated a place where you won’t be lost in the crowd and a place where fun is a cultural value, then we are that place for you. We are Novade and we are looking for you.

description: Company Description  Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye Security offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, and nation-state grade threat intelligence. With this approach, FireEye Security eliminates the complexity and burden of cybersecurity for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyberattacks. Our security portfolio protects customers across endpoints, infrastructure, applications, and in the cloud. For more information, please visit www.fireeye.com.  Job Description  FireEye’s Sales Engineering Team is seeking experienced, exceptional individuals for our sales organization in the region. Ours is not a typical software sales organization. Everybody is a closer, from inside sales through executive management. Everybody. The Sales Engineer (SE) is a customer-focused technical sales professional who provides high level pre sales support and guidance to customers and collaborates with Territory Managers and partners to recommend and develop appropriate customer solution offerings. The SE acts in a consultative fashion and is looked to as an expert in his/her field by the account team, channel partners and customers.  What You Will Do: You will be part of a sales team responsible for meeting quarterly and annual revenue goals in support of FireEye’s product strategy You will work with key decision-makers in information security across a variety of industries You will be expected to define requirements, articulate key value propositions, architect technical solutions and demonstrate capabilities both in sales meeting and proof of concept environments for products which touch upon multiple security disciplines You should also have experience developing opportunities from initial lead to successful closure, or relevant experience in a professional services, consulting or related role  Qualifications Strong leadership skills with the ability to prioritize and execute in a methodical and disciplined manner. Set and manage expectations with senior stake-holders and team members Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to present to a variety of external audiences, including being able to interact with senior executives Hands-on technical understanding of incident response, computer forensics, network and/or application security 5 years or equivalent experience in consulting or sales engineering - particularly in the areas of security incident response or system and network administration; or, other relevant experience managing technical customer relationships History of creating rapport with customers, from line technicians to C-level executives Ability to explain and demonstrate - live and in color - a complex product  Additional Information Previous technical enablement or training experience Hands-on experience with Intrusion Detection Systems, Security Information Event Management solutions, packet analysis tools and operating system analysis Excellent knowledge of security solutions and technologies, including: Linux, Network architecture/implementation/configuration experience and knowledge of packet flow/TCP/UDP traffic Firewall technologies, proxy technologies, anti-virus, spam and spyware solutions (Gateway and SaaS), Malware/security experience Understand and be conversant about FireEye competitors, their solutions, strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats Good understanding and experience with Cloud Security will have an added advantage
industries: Computer Networking, Computer & Network Security, and Computer Software

MBA degree is a plus • Minimum 7-12 years of sales and business development experience with a successful track record in customer acquisition and relationship management in the financial services industry, both in Singapore and the region • Strong problem solving, decision making and stakeholder management, with the ability to influence key internal and external stakeholders • Strong knowledge of the payments industry and related technologies, with specific industry expertise in at least one of the following areas: banking / financial platforms (including trade, e-commerce, distributed ledger technology), cross border payment, real-time payment, or QR • A passion for understanding market and client needs, and having a relentless desire to solve pain-points using macro and micro level thinking and analysis • Self-starter, good team player, fast learner, curious, resilient, adaptable and entrepreneurial • Strong presentation skills and ability to articulate priorities to cross-functional audiences • Proficient in Customer Relations and stakeholder management

description: Everyone communicates. It’s the essence of the human experience. How we communicate is evolving. Technology is reshaping the way we live, learn and thrive. The epicenter of this transformation is the network—our passion. Our experts are rethinking the purpose, role and usage of networks to help our customers increase bandwidth, expand capacity, enhance efficiency, speed deployment and simplify migration. From remote cell sites to massive sports arenas, from busy airports to state-of-the-art data centers— we provide the essential expertise and vital infrastructure your business needs to succeed. The world’s most advanced networks rely on CommScope connectivity.  Are you first and foremost a developer of people – a coach who is passionate about developing talent and launching careers? We have the role for you!  CommScope is currently recruiting for a Manager of Inside Sales to join our team in ANZ / ASEAN.  How You'll Help Us Connect The World.  You will need to help develop and hone a department lifecycle that recruits well, on-boards fast, optimally develops top talent, and then proactively sends your best out to other departments. Rinse, repeat and refine.  Build and run a strong inside sales team that intentionally develops personnel with the intent of moving our best and most experienced reps into field or corporate roles while maintaining a very high revenue generation and performance expectation.  This is a hands-on role with significant emphasis on physical presence and active mentoring. You will focus on the process but be open to modifying and improving the process based on verifiable evidence. You must be a strong mentor capable of adjusting your techniques to ensure the best results!  Required Qualifications For Consideration A completed Bachelor's Degree with significant and validated experience in building and maintaining outstanding inside sales or other high-performance teams - you are probably a coach or mentor in your free time. Proven success in using CRM’s to drive sales and efficiency. B2B outward bound sales environment experience. Demonstrable track record of sourcing, hiring, and onboarding new talent with shown success in not only achieving results but exceeding them. Strong background in building relationships with account management and other sales teams. Strong written and verbal communication skills with a consistent track record to interpret and present sophisticated concepts. Proven track record in the use of Microsoft office, to deliver professional-client communications including Word, PowerPoint and Excel, and internet/phone presentations. A human approach with a strong ability to relate to people and communicate effectively at all levels. You Will Excite Us If You Have 2 plus years of experience leading teams. Sales experience in a global organization that has experienced exceptional growth. An understanding of IT infrastructure. Why CommScope?  CommScope is pushing the boundaries of communications technology. For more than 40 years, we’ve been leaders in innovating 5G, private networks, and Gigabit speeds everywhere – we're always anticipating what’s next. Developments such as the Internet of Things, seamless connectivity, Cloud, and 5G introduce new requirements and demand creative thinking. With our unmatched expertise in copper, fiber, and wireless infrastructure, our global clients rely on us to outperform today and be ready for the needs of tomorrow.  CommScope is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including people with disabilities and veterans. To learn more visit careers.commscope.com/eeo.  It is the policy of CommScope to provide Equal Employment Opportunities to all individuals based on merit, qualifications and abilities. CommScope does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy), national origin, age or any other characteristics as protected by law. Furthermore, this contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals on the basis of disability, and require affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals with disabilities.  ;;  6086660866

jobTitle: Business Development Manager - Drug Development Services
description: Company Description  SGS is a leading CRO that provides laboratory testing and clinical research services to the pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical industry. We are part of the world's leading inspection, verification, testing and certification company and recognised as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. With more than 89,000 employees, we operate a network of more than 2,600 offices and laboratories around the world.  Job Description  Working as a core member of our Global Health Sciences team, the Business Development Manager will prospect and sell our portfolio of preclinical and clinical testing and analytical services to clients in the Pharma and Biopharma industries. Partnering with our global lab network, you will ensure that clients in your assigned territory receive a best-in-class molecule to market testing service. Your territory will be the APAC region.  More Specifically, You Will Generate business opportunities for SGS Health Sciences across the APAC region; Develop a business network of clients in the Pharma and Biopharma research and development sector; Provide Market Analysis and competitive intelligence to support corporate development activities; Ensure that SGS Health Sciences has the laboratory capacity to provide contracted services and solutions; Develop a regional sales strategy to achieve defined sales targets and prioritize a list of target accounts for specific service sales; Develop regional promotional marketing plan for region with Marketing function to support selling activity; Work with commercial operations and service delivery teams within SGS to develop accurate and timely quotations and proposals to clients; Actively follow up on all proposals and conduct client presentations whenever required; Ensure proposals, quotations and contracts are renewed or amended as necessary; Ensure appropriate project handover to client delivery teams as required. Qualifications Educated to degree level in Biology, Chemistry, Biochemistry or a similar subject; Proven experience in selling Life Sciences services and solutions to global clients; Experience of working within a Contract Research Organization (CRO) beneficial; Knowledge of the drug development process (from preclinical to clinical testing) advantageous; Proven experience of working with a matrix organization, preferably on an international scale; Fluency in English and the language of allocated territory. Multiple language proficiency would be an advantage. Additional Information  This position will be based remotely in Singapore.

description: About Capgemini  Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 290,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms. The Group reported in 2020 global revenues of €16 billion.  Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com  Marketing Manager (Financial Service Strategic Business Unit)  We’re looking for a dynamic, go-getter to join our marketing team to manage Capgemini’s Financial Services Asia marketing strategy and communications based out of Singapore.  This role will support our Financial Services Strategic Business Unit (FS SBU) as the Enterprise Architect in pre-sales/RFP processes involving complex sales opportunities, especially in the banking and/or insurance domain. You will collaborate with business development and client engagement teams to assist in pre-sales opportunities like RFP responses, proposal delivery, architecture assessments and technical qualifications  Job Description  Reporting to the Vice President of Financial Services Asia, the marketing manager will be responsible for all marketing campaigns, brand advocacy and communications of Financial Services Asia with matrix reporting duties into Marketing Director of APAC Strategic Business Unit.    Chart the overall Marketing strategy & budget for Financial Services, Asia with clear outline of GTM plans including campaign launch, demand generation activities, partner marketing and account-based marketing.   Strategize and execute lead generation activities and own the ABM specific programs for focused markets and key accounts. Create engaging content marketing, key success stories and case studies that leverages on thought leadership reports - CRI reports, world reports     Identify/ collaborate with internal stakeholders to target top market, branding opportunities and develop communications and content strategy to meet stakeholders’ objectives. Plan and execute digital, marketing database, email and social media campaigns. Drive brand and mindshare awareness in the region, working closely with agency partner on media, digital advertising, public relations, and GTM campaigns Manage pre- and post-event marketing for sponsorships, tradeshows, seminars. Liaise with Capgemini’s global and regional marketing teams to cascade key campaigns to Asia-Pacific.   Skills and Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or Mass Communications is required.  Minimum Five years B2B technology marketing experience in the banking and financial services or Insurance industry. Solid expertise in marketing strategies and campaigns, experience in collaborating with partners on partner marketing initiatives Extensive knowledge marketing campaign processes and strong project management skills Possess current knowledge of digital communications techniques and social media engagement is preferred.   Excellent oral and written communication skills in English. Technology-savvy, with keen interest in emerging technologies and ‘all things digital’. Experience in creating content and communication strategy. Energetic, able to work independently with minimal supervision. Understanding of enterprise tech platforms and its business functions is a plus.

description: Cloud Kinetics (also known as CK) is a leading Cloud Transformation Solutions and Managed Services Provider headquartered in Singapore, offering a plethora of services across all major Public Cloud Operators. Cloud Kinetics is a Portfolio Company of I Squared Capital. I Squared Capital (ISQ) is a private equity firm focusing on global infrastructure investments. We are looking for a highly motivated individual reporting to the Singapore Sales Director to take on this exciting opportunity of driving sales growth and executing sales and go-to-market strategy in Singapore.  As an Enterprise Account Manager, you will primarily be responsible for expanding Cloud Kinetics (CK) enterprise territory through growth development of assigned account footprint and new account acquisitions. You will partner closely with CK cross-functional teams, vendors, and SI partners to provide customers a first-class sales service experience like no other, serving as the trusted anchor for customers throughout the entire sales cycle to post-closure. The Enterprise Account Manager will act as the single point of contact for assigned accounts to Cloud Kinetics and shall represent the brand.  As the Enterprise Account Manager, you will be tasked to develop and maintain a consistent and healthy pipeline, driving deal closures and company sales growth. This role is based in Singapore with high career progression opportunity. Serving Singapore markets, with overseas travelling opportunity.  Responsibilities ·       Maintain warm relationships with assigned accounts and new account acquisition. ·       Proper qualification of leads and able to provide accurate report on opportunities. ·       Conduct market research into accounts, identify key players and generate interest. ·       Strong phone presence and confidence/experienced in making cold calls. ·       Able to sell and upsell Cloud Kinetics’s Cloud and Data Center Solutions and value proposition to both new and existing customers. ·       Acquired understanding of market segmentation, develop, and execute Go-To-Market strategy for assigned accounts. ·       Collaborate between different functional teams and serve as the point of contact for customers and vendors. ·       Always maintain good customer and partner relationships. ·       Meet and exceed quarterly sales goals by managing individual sales activity. ·       Accurately track and generate timely sales report for presentation to management. Requirements ·       Possess excellent interpersonal skills with strong presentation abilities. ·       Proficient in MS Office Suite, Salesforce.com and/or other CRM, web presentation tools. ·       Comfortable with making cold calls to prospects. ·       Able to work in a team environment and independently. ·       Self-motivated and driven to achieve goals. ·       Possess strong understanding of Enterprise IT industry ecosystem. ·       Strong verbal and written communications skills are essential. ·       Willingness to learn and develop new skills is essential. ·       Ability to thrive in a fast-pace and competitive environment. Education & Experience ·       Min. description: Job Purpose:  The Product Sales Manager - SGO is accountable for: Ensuring the delivery of the global SGO NSE targets by managing a portfolio of products, projects and central responsibilities through the development of short and medium term plans with the Product Sales Directors, Global Director - Recruitment Managers (RMs) and Area Directors. Providing the interface between the Global Sales organisation and the OD and university partners, ensuring alignment on key product features/benefits, entry requirements and regulatory compliance matters. Project manage new SGO development opportunities and sales strategy to deliver on new product This role will focus on recruitment via all recruitment channels including agent, digital, university/school partnerships  Key Responsibilities: In conjunction with Product Sales Directors, Area Directors, Direct Sales Director and Global Director RMs, develop and deliver intake strategies and plans to ensure the delivery of SGO NSE targets and effective pipeline management activity across source markets. Manage relationship with UK Operating Division in relation to achievement of program NSE budget and profitability targets. Identify short-term tactical actions to drive NSE volumes Deliver efficient and effective training and launches for recruitment channels with strong collaboration with relevant marketing teams Develop in conjunction with marketing pricing/competitor insights and product scoping Develop specific market product requirements Work with in market global recruitment teams across all channels to identify needs and work with marketing to make available localised product materials for all key markets and ensure effective distribution and training Represent in exhibitions, recruitment events, partnership meetings and ensure NSE budgets are met by product Own the go to market plans for the SGO products, working closely with University Partners and colleagues in Product and Customer Marketing to develop and execute campaign plans and strategies to deliver on NSE’s, diversity targets etc. Collaborate with the Area Directors, Direct Sales Director and Global Director RMs to ensure the go to market plans are executed in accordance with the plan.  Organisational Compliance: Comply with Study Group policies and applicable laws including those in relation, but not limited, to: Workplace Health and Safety; Anti-Discrimination and Harassment, Anti-Bribery and Anti-Corruption and those specifically relevant to the position and authority of the job holder.  Qualifications     •            Tertiary education  Experience Required      •            Track record of delivering and exceeding sales targets. •            Experience of selling digital product •            Experience in product sales and marketing •            Experience in successfully executing conversion and sales strategies •            Experience identifying customer’s business drivers and influencing their buying behaviours in line with a customer value proposition •            Experience of working in an international corporate/matrix environment •            Experience of working with a CRM and using data/reporting to drive decision making  Personal Attributes        •            Strong business and commercial acumen, analytical and quantitative ability. •            A strong collaborator who develops effective relationships across all parts of Study Group and with key external stakeholders. •            Agile in approach – can move seamlessly between short-term tactical and long-term strategic plans and activities. •            Comfortable working in ambiguity and is able to develop multiple creative solutions to ensure the delivery of planned outcomes. •            Demonstrates a growth-mindset. •            Persuasive and impactful negotiator - influences effectively by adopting a range of approaches, maintaining relationships with all parties at all times. •            Highly organised and self-motivated; able to prioritise work and work to tight deadlines. •            Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills  Competencies •            Being accountable •            Collaborating together to succeed •            Embracing Study Group’s vision and mission •            Valuing a learning mindset •            Planning and delivering •            Achieving high quality outcomes •            Striving for operational excellence •            Embracing change •            Persuading and influencing •            Growing the business •            Leading and developing talent  About Study Group We are a global pathway provider in International Education, working collaboratively with a number of Top Tier Universities. Voted as the 2017, 2018 and 2020 Global Pathway Provider of the year, our people are united with the shared ambition of providing a world-class UK education to talented students from across the globe.   Organisational Compliance Study Group is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of its students, and expects all staff and volunteers to share the same dedication. Applicants will be required to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the role, including checks with past employers, an Enhanced Check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) and overseas criminal records if appropriate. Study Group processes your information in line with data protection regulations. Please see our Privacy Policy

description: What’s up? We’re VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH Our amazing client partnership team is looking forward to collaborating with a “people first” Associate Account Director to lead multiple exciting accounts in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Client Partnerships APAC.  Here’s your first brief -- Big thinker yet hands-on in execution. Exemplary track record of experience in the Singapore market. Natural entrepreneurial spirit and love for social media. Overall leader who runs the day to day, keeping the wheels moving and your client and team motivated. Tech-focused and geek everything technology; Gaming, e-sports, new technologies. Gatekeeper of the brand equity and quality control of work prior to it leaving the building. Manages overall client’s business, ensuring that we are delivering for the client’s business everyday. Navigate a portfolio of brands within a larger conglomerate or business group, and be deeply informed on the client’s business, including all campaign performance, any competitive, as well as product cycle Deep and more proactive understanding of the client’s business outside of our campaigns or the marketing context. Proactively identify needs of the client and business to sell-through incremental campaign opportunities to clients, that help them achieve the most efficient returns & results on their overall marketing dollars, while delivering best in class work that help grow client business Strong foundational and working knowledge of creative and media across major digital and social channels. Well versed in common marketing and media principles with a strong understanding of the social media platforms and their ecosystems.  Your Experience 4+ years of relevant work experience in the media or advertising field, including an account management experience in the APAC advertising landscape. Competencies: Business strategy, digital asset management, digital media planning and buying. Proficiency in written, verbal and presentation skills. Strategic sales planning, pipeline management, relationship building, digital market knowledge, negotiation skills, presentation skills, analytical skills. People management Worked with teams in complex, multi-geography, multi-cultural environments.  What you should know about VaynerMedia Think “lab” and not “agency”. We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We’re willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It’s fun! Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Media Production

description: We are a fast-growing HR Tech start-up looking to hire a Solutions Engineer with an all-round player mentality to join our team..  Gloat’s SEs have a simple mission; To Help Win more Deals, Faster. Our role is to demonstrate and describe our solution’s architecture and technical design to our prospects, and in doing so, position Gloat as the optimal solution to meet their needs. Solutions Engineers are the ambassadors or Gloat’s unique solution; going beyond the technical explanations, and into the challenges, motivations, and balancing-acts that Gloat’s technologists went through to create a one-of-a-kind talent marketplace. The SE is responsible for understanding our customers’ technical challenges and  requirements, mapping those to our offerings, and delivering technical demonstrations and presentations that illustrate our unique value.  SEs partner with our solutions consultants and sales to drive a comprehensive and effective pre-sales cycle, providing deep technical, product and HR industry knowledge to ensure the successful execution of our sales strategy.   Responsibilities: You will be working with Gloat’s Solutions Consultants and Account Executives on winning more deals, faster! You will own the technical presentations and demonstrations for all qualified prospects, and existing clients.  You will be responsible for all technical, architectural and operational aspects of our solution as part of the sales cycle, including technical demos & workshops, addressing security and privacy aspects, fostering relationships with relevant stakeholders, responding to RFPs and more.  You will become a source of knowledge and thought leadership of our solution’s current and future capabilities and functionalities, supporting Gloat’s employees and clients alike. You will act as the bridge between Gloat’s sales team and our product management and development teams; identifying, analyzing and eventually selling new features and functionalities. You will develop and maintain a deep understanding of both customers and the competitive landscape, and be immersed in the HR software industry and ecosystem through continuous learning. You will operate within software start-up environment collaborating closely with your colleagues across the company  Requirements: 5+ years of experience working with Enterprise customers in a client-facing commercial role, where you provide creative, outside-the-box solutions to business challenges. Experience scoping, managing, and executing customer pilots and Proof of Concepts. You have good interpersonal, communication, persuasion, and presentation skills. You have a passion for telling engaging stories that both demonstrate our products value and bring our solution to life. You are agile, with a love of thinking on your feet and a knack of steering conversations involving a variety of different stakeholders, from end-users to the C-Suite. Previous experience working on complex AI solutions for business functions.  Previous experience in System architecture, Software Sales, Technical Account Management is a plus You are highly motivated, and independent self-starter with a high level of integrity and professionalism, who is a team player and can thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment Willingness to travel up to 25%

description: Would you enjoy creating solutions and making an impact? Do you love collaborating with teams to solve complex challenges?  Join our Sales Enablement Team Sales Enablement is a critical part of the revenue acceleration engine at Akamai. This team empowers our Global Sales organization to achieve optimal sales outcomes by providing them with the content, training and coaching they need throughout the buyer’s journey.  Partner with the best As a Manager of Sales Enablement, you will partner with Sales & Presales teams across Asia Pacific Japan. We are looking for a natural relationship-builder, who can leverage field input to equip stakeholders with the knowledge, resources, tools, assets & strategies needed to sell more effectively.  As a Sales Enablement Manager, you will: Serve as the main point of contact for Sales Enablement across the APJ region Integrate with Sales and Presales leaders and sellers to gain a full understanding of the needs of the business in the context of our Sales Enablement Framework Collaborate globally with the Sales Enablement team to develop and deliver new programs and materials, including but not limited to: Playbooks, eLearning Courses, & Workshops Identify KPIs and efficacy measurements that track and measure success of sales enablement Lead the in-region execution of key events, such as our New Hire Onboarding and Sales Kickoff Provide leadership and direct oversight to junior Sales Enablement team member(s) in APJ  Do what you love To be successful in this role you will: Bachelor's degree or its equivalent in work experience 5 years relevant Sales Enablement experience, including a deep understanding of B2B sales cycles and functions and direct experience in B2B sales 2 years of experience leading people with an ability to provide direction to coach and mentor others Extraordinary interpersonal skills, with demonstrated ability to influence and motivate Deep knowledge of Sales Enablement best practices, tools, frameworks, and processes Applied experience with learning & development tools (Cornerstone, Rise 360, iMovie) Familiarity with Sales Tools (Salesforce, Sales Navigator, Quip) and Methodologies (MEDDICC) Bilingual language skills in Chinese Mandarin or Japanese are desirable  Work in a way that works for you We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. We are happy to discuss flexible working options in this role, please discuss your requirements with the recruiter when you apply.  Working with us At Akamai, we’re curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you’ll thrive here.  Working for you At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life: Your health Your finances Your family Your time at work Your time pursuing other endeavors  Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.  About us Innovating on a global scale, we deliver our customers a fast, smart and secure intelligent edge platform. Working against a backdrop of digital collaboration, our highly skilled teams build progressive solutions that have the scope to transform entertainment, business, and life in ways that we have yet to imagine.  Join us Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status.  #LI-DNI

description: The Company Our client is a popular football media platform for the new generation of football fans. It is the only app with a fully personalised home stream for non-stop news of your favourite club and the only company to offer single live football matches in-app on a free and pay-per-view basis. The app is available in 12 languages and is the best rated sports app in the world, based on millions of App Store and Google Play reviews. Managing and developing relationships with existing and potential clients. Manage the sales pipeline effectively including qualifying in, progressing, and closing opportunities. Play an active role in product and capability development by articulating long-term trends and product gaps to the investment teams. Traveling when necessary to meet clients and/or prospect new relationships. Qualifications & Requirements At least 3 years of relevant experience in the financial industry in a similar position. Recognized degree holder. Additional certifications (CFA, MBA, etc) are preferred. Proven ability to build relationships with institutional clients, existing networks are strongly preferred. Proven sales ability, working to KPIs, and hitting sales targets Excellent communication and presentation skills. Good understanding of financial markets and knowledge of different wealth management products. Independent and responsible. Strong analytical abilities. Motivated with a hunger for success.
industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management

description: PubMatic is looking for a highly motivated and experienced Manager to join our Sales Operations team. As a Manager, Sales Operations, you will be a critical part of ensuring our go-to-market (GTM) processes support the successful execution of business and sales objectives.  The ideal candidate should be highly analytical, able to provide business insights by analyzing and distilling large amounts of data and have a good understanding of business processes.  This position requires an agile detail-oriented individual who can quickly shift priorities and focus. He/she will work on a variety of projects, including bonus calculation and analysis for the GTM team, evaluate sales KPIs and other metrics.  The candidate should have excellent communication skills as he/she will serve as the liaison between the sales organization and other departments distributed across the world, such as HR, legal, and product management.  Key Responsibilities  Lead weekly production of regional Sales KPIs for the GTM organization Support Country Managers with quarterly target setting process Work across systems to ensure customer information is synchronized and accurate Serve as a trusted partner to the APAC Sales organization by defining, tracking, and implementing business objectives, strategy, tactics, and processes that scale Drive improvement of sales processes, policies, and procedures Support special projects. Structure business problems, evaluate options, implement actionable recommendations, and track success  Qualifications  BA/BS degree. 3+ years experience in consulting, finance, sales operations, advertising industry, or operational environments. Analytical, attention to detail Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and Salesforce Excellent communicating skills – Written and Oral Ability to build relationships across the organization  Additional Information  Coronavirus notice: PubMatic is actively working to ensure candidate and employee safety. Currently, all hiring and onboarding processes at PubMatic will be carried out remotely through virtual meetings until further notice.  Benefits: Our benefits package includes the best of what leading organizations provide, such as stock options, paternity/maternity leave, healthcare, dental and vison insurance plus many extra perks including Perkspot  unlimited PTO (that we actually require you to use!). As well, when we’re back in the office, we all benefit from a kitchen loaded with healthy snacks and drinks and catered lunches twice a week, and much more!   Diversity and Inclusion: PubMatic is proud to be an equal opportunity employer; we don’t just value diversity, we promote and celebrate it.  We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 1,400+ team members and values that guide a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute .  As a Sales Development Manager at GitLab, your job is to lead a team of SDRs to create qualified opportunities for the sales team. You'll train other members of the SDR team, and take on operational and administrative tasks to help the team perform and exceed expectations. You will be a source of knowledge and best practices amongst the SDRs, and will help to train, onboard, and mentor new SDRs with the help of the SDR Enablement team.  What You'll Do In This Role Train other members of the SDR Team to identify, contact, and create qualified opportunities. Ensure SDR Team members improve performance and abilities over time by providing coaching and feedback in recurring 1:1s Plan for hiring and onboarding new SDRs. Work closely with the Events and Digital teams on Field events and targeted ad and nurture campaigns. Work closely with Sales and other members of the SDR Leadership team to improve opportunity management and qualification processes Work closely with Sales, Senior SDR Manager, as well as the Regional Sales Director's to identify key company accounts to develop. Work in collaboration with Content, Marketing Program Managers, and Product Marketing to develop effective messaging for outbound communications to your team’s assigned accounts. We're looking for Excellent spoken and written English Experience in sales, marketing, or customer service for a technical product - leadership experience is highly preferred. Experience with CRM software (Salesforce preferred) Experience in sales operations and/or marketing automation software preferred Understanding of B2B software, Open Source software, and the developer product space is preferred You are obsessed with making customers happy. You know that the slightest trouble in getting started with a product can ruin customer happiness. Passionate about technology and learning more about GitLab Be ready to learn how to use GitLab and Git You share our values , and work in accordance with those values. Leadership at GitLab Also, we know it’s tough, but please try to avoid the confidence gap . You don’t have to match all the listed requirements exactly to be considered for this role.  Hiring Process  To view the full job description and hiring process, please view our handbook . Additional details about our process can also be found on our hiring page .  Compensation  To view the full job description and its compensation calculator, view our handbook. The compensation calculator can be found towards the bottom of the page.  Additional details about our process can be found on our hiring page.  As a Sales Development Manager at GitLab, your job is to lead a team of SDRs to create qualified opportunities for the sales team. You'll train other members of the SDR team, and take on operational and administrative tasks to help the team perform and exceed expectations. You will be a source of knowledge and best practices amongst the SDRs, and will help to train, onboard, and mentor new SDRs with the help of the SDR Enablement team. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. industries: Information Technology and Services and Computer Software

description: Responsibilities： 1. Agreeing the annual plans with customers, and monitoring monthly and quarterly performance;                                                                                                                     2. Negotiating customer pricing and contract terms; 3. Negotiating credit terms and ensuring payments are received on time from customers; 4. Providing demand, pricing and payment forecasts on a monthly basis with weekly updates; 5. Developing new customers in line with the channel and marketing strategy; 6. Monitoring competitor prices, activities and strategies; 7. Previous experience in key account management, including developing channel management strategies, account planning and negotiation of pricing, cash & credit terms; 8. The ideal candidate would have experience in managing key accounts in dynamic industries where rapid changes in market conditions are common, preferably with experience in the Photovoltaic sector; 9. Experience in building and supporting long term relationships; 10. Other tasks assigned by superiors  Requirements: 1. Master or Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical, Power or related field; 2. Minimum 3 years field sales experience in PV industry. Having good knowledge of PV market industry dynamics and landscape is required; 3. Good technical background knowledge of PV on grid/ off grid systems and BOS system; 4. Experience in tender project management preparation and coordination; 5. Excellent knowledge of PV industry value chain downstream influencers and sensitive in competition environment; 6. Willingness to do business travel overseas in short notice; 7. Good proficient of English is a MUST and any other local languages are added advantage; 8. Strong negotiating and communication skills; 9. Self-motivated, independent, diligent and detail-oriented personality; 10. Proactive in solving problems, open to customers.
industries: Renewables & Environment

description: The Company... An international AdTech company that focuses in rich-media ad formats. With offices across 7 major cities globally, this high-performing team is currently working with over 1,000 blue chip brand clients and delivering campaigns to more than 2,000 premium websites worldwide.   The Role As a Digital Ad Sales Manager, you will be reporting to the Head of Sales based in Singapore who is an industry expert with a strong commitment in growing the team reach their maximum potential. You will be expected to generate ad sales revenue, develop and maintain client relationships and accurately brief design team. Other responsibilities also include:    Negotiation, development and maintenance of trading deals Creating strong relationships with key client stakeholders at both senior and mid-management levels with media agencies, DSPs & 3rd party partners Maintaining sales volume, product mix and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators and competitors Working with internal teams on behalf of clients to ensure the highest level of customer service  & You...    At least 4 years of digital advertising sales experience Positive, target- driven, versatile and determined An independent self-starter who has an interest in the advertising industry and is keen to develop skills in marketing and research Creative problem solving   *** *** 33 Talent 33 Talent is your integrated HR partner providing bespoke recruitment, HR consultancy and coaching services into digital, data and communications across APAC and the rest of the world.  When you put people first, amazing things happen. We’re empowering people to thrive by helping employers hire, engage and unleash the best fits for their business. Please get in touch or feel free to make referrals to hello@33talent.com - we'd love to hear from you!  33 Talent Singapore Private Limited CEI Number: Diane Dizon - R1325376 EA License Number: 13C6298

description: Increase same-store sales at Fairprice, Coldstorage and other retailers Support the team with optimizing store presence of our healthy snacks Willing to travel around Singapore and work closely and respectfully with people Work and communicate with buyers, suppliers, stores, and distributors Ensure that stores, shelves or websites are stocked with the right types and quantities of products

Work closely with the Events and Digital teams on Field events and targeted ad and nurture campaigns. description: Description  Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers more than a million businesses in 190 countries around the world.  To meet the growing demand for AWS Services across the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you have excellent organizational and communication skills, a passion for working in a fast paced, dynamic environment and a desire to deliver exceptional customer experiences, we’d like to speak with you! Here's your chance to join us as our Business Development Manager (BDM) in our AWS Public Sector Singapore team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of AWS within the Public Sector market segments.  Other Responsibilities Include  The successful candidate will be a self-motivated individual with a proven track record in software/technology sales, business development or consulting, have business acumen and be effective in communicating the value of technology in fulfilling digital transformation missions. The BDM will be an exceptionally strategic and strong analytical thinker who likely has IT business experience with a major vendor in the IT market and embraces all aspects of solution selling. Build and execute the strategic business development plan to support government initiatives in Singapore Assist government ministry/agency in identifying use cases for priority adoption of Amazon Web Services as well as best practices implementations and ensure they are successfully using our web services with the technical resources required Develop Lighthouse Customers and build core Partners for the program Nurture opportunities and fill pipeline by active engagement with prospects, partners and key customers Facilitate strong relationships with key executives in the public sector verticals, policy makers, advisors and key partners Understand the technical requirements of our customers and work closely with the internal development team to guide the direction of our product offerings for developers.  Basic Qualifications  The Business Development Manager is someone with a strong Public Sector background and a deep understanding of technology, with a strong network within the Public Sector community and/or an ability to foster strong relationships with Public Sector stakeholders. This person should have good business development skills and experiences working with strategic alliances. Someone with strong customer facing skills and a demonstrated ability to think strategically about new business models. The candidate should also have a proven track record of influencing technology adoption through the partner ecosystem with program successes. Other requirements are: At least 10 years of experience in a world class consulting and/or technology companies developing new markets or selling software, hardware or consulting services Rich and diverse background of Public Sector, Health, Education and/or Research At least 5 years’ of experience in public sector (e.g., government and/or education) market direct business, with good understanding of the Singapore Government procurement process and contract vehicles Natural business-technical person with an ability to influence a broad virtual team Positive, proactive and self-motivated with sense of urgency and follow through Excellent communication and writing skills  Preferred Qualifications  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore  Job ID: A1430426

description: GitLab's DevOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently.
