description: About Us  At WeWork, we provide inspiring and flexible workplace solutions to help businesses - small, medium or large - thrive in more than 150 cities globally. The future of work is happening right now, and we are leading this moment. United by a common purpose, here we will empower tomorrow’s world at work. Join us on our journey as we give our members the freedom and support to push boundaries in their industries, and work to redefine our own.  About The Opportunity  The Pre-Sales Project Manager is a member of the Development team and operates as the primary facilitator between our clients, our Sales team and our Delivery team by providing technical support on customizations of our built product in both the sales and delivery process. This individual is accountable to communicate to the project teams all sales requirements to ensure projects will be resourced accordingly. In addition this individual must collate all deliverables and report back to the internal sales team accordingly.  The PSPM is responsible for ensuring that the physical workplace requirements of the customer are not lost throughout the sales, project scoping, and deal structuring (and if applicable, space delivery, move-in and ongoing operation of the space). The PSPM will be an excellent communicator and will have the ability to collaborate with other internal disciplines (ie. Design, Construction, Comm Mgmt, Logistics, Community, Facilities, IT, Security, Account Management, Accounting, etc).  The ideal candidate will be experienced in the architecture, workplace strategy, project management, construction, and real estate industries; have direct client engagement experience, a keen understanding of the enterprise real estate sales process, and a proven ability to effectively juggle competing priorities. Candidates must thrive at interfacing with internal and external stakeholders in a complex matrixed organization to develop creative, cost effective solutions that meet customer requirements.  Responsibilities  Manage multiple projects at a time and prioritize workload to ensure that project timelines are met. Substantial involvement during the sales process to convert customer’s requirements into a quantifiable scope of work. The PSPM will work alongside Sales and Delivery Teams to understand lease terms, develop estimates and budgets, preliminary schedules, and secure necessary approvals. Provide detailed reports required for the sales cycle, including workplace strategy analysis. Generate and continuously maintain reporting data for respective projects during the delivery phase, reporting to upper management as necessary. Collaborate with the legal team to ensure that all construction commercial terms and agreements are inclusive of complete scope of work, as well as help guide the process of contract negotiations as necessary Responsible for engagement with, and management of resources during pre-sales, including cross-functional teams such as Design, ICT, Security, Project Management, Cost Management, and Arts & Graphics. Responsible for ensuring project financials are approved prior to deal signing, including member-specific capex and budgets. Assist and close complex, multi-million dollar transactions, including cross-negotiating with our customers and our contractor-partners. Where applicable, the PSPM will also have the opportunity to run projects after the sales cycle, including the fill fit-out and delivery of spaces for various members within the WeWork portfolio.  About You  Does the below sound like you? If so, we’d love to hear from you!  5+ years of experience of all phases of the design process from schematic design through the bid process and construction management Experience generating cost and schedule estimates to be used for sales related activities Bachelors Degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction, Real Estate Development or similar. Experience in workplace strategy and key trends in the industry. Be familiar with the construction industry best practices, building & ADA codes. Be a self-starter, with the ability to work independently in a fast paced environment Experience in retail and commercial construction/development is preferable with contract values $2M+ Passionate about development (real estate, design, workplace strategy, numbers, schedules). Passionate about collaborating and leading all stakeholders to a suitable design solution. Extremely organized and great at managing productivity.  We will be prioritising applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and who do not require VISA sponsorship from WeWork.  Life At WeWork  Being a WeWorker is more than just a job. We believe the magic of work is sparked by the passion you bring, the places you go, the people you meet and the purpose you follow. And it starts here. Here you will brush shoulders with those who dare to dream and do. Here you will be welcomed by a diverse community that embraces and inspires you—because together we can achieve more. Here we challenge ideas, and explore new ways of getting things done. Whether you are part of our Employee Community Groups, or part of a global project, we ask you to bring your open-minded attitude and collaborative spirit. In return, you will be part of a team where your unique perspectives are celebrated.  WeWork is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil status, pregnancy (or pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression, transgender status or gender reassignment, race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including genetic testing and characteristics), military or veteran status, or any other grounds or characteristic that is protected under the law.

description: Job Overview The Business Manager (Commercial & International) is responsible for developing, managing, and expanding relationships with strategic Global Customers and Manufacturers.  It is the responsibility of our Business Manager to market our expertise in EMS/OEM/ODM/CM to provide a One-Stop Center for Business and Product Development as well as to solicit production sales orders from Global Customers to meet annual KPIs and sales targets.  Business Manager is responsible to solicit production sales orders from Global Customers to meet annual KPI and sales target, to promote and market our expertise in EMS/OEM/ODM/CM to provide a One-Stop Center for the design & development, prototyping, build-to-print production, integration and maintenance of electronic modules and systems for Global Customers.  Responsibilities and Duties Responsible for global sales and business development of the electronics manufacturing business Create and formulate a business development plan that involves capturing larger wallet shares through business expansion Establishing relationships with existing and potential customers and partners to enhance performance and future growth opportunities as outlined in the business plan Coordinates the involvement of company personnel and external stakeholders, if necessary, in order to meet account performance objectives and customer expectations Engage in the active search for new overseas partners and customers Coordinates and plans engagement programs and visits with key customers for senior management Lead related marketing activities, including organizing and coordinating with internal and external stakeholders in order to showcase our manufacturing capabilities at international trade shows Conduct research and gather information about trending vertical market areas to formulate project proposals and potential business opportunities  Accountabilities and Performance Measures Secure sales order targets as agreed on business roadmap Develop and communicate business strategies to higher management Fulfill planned international engagement events and exhibition Ensure excellence customer satisfaction ratings that meet company standards  Qualifications and Requirements Proven international/regional experience in sales/business development/marketing in the electronics manufacturing domain is cardinal. Prior experience in the technology sector (aerospace/space/EV automotive/satellite/Navigation/Autonomous & Robotics vertical market) will be an advantage Degree in an Engineering field, Business Administrative, Marketing preferred Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills Independent, self-motivated and able to work collaboratively within the global diverse team Ability to travel internationally. Singaporean only
industries: Telecommunications

description: Job Description:  Life at Grab:  At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.  Get to know our team:  GrabAds allows Advertisers, Agencies, and Merchants to engage the Grab Audience via innovative online and offline advertising experiences. Through our unique ecosystem and transacting user base, our clients can reach their desired audiences at scale, while driving measurable business outcomes.  We would like You to join our journey to create value for our users, drivers, merchants, and advertising partners, while continuing to make everyday lives better across Southeast Asia.  If you are interested in joining a highly volatile, fast paced start-up team and contributing to building a best in class ad operations team, we would like to chat with you.  Get to know the role:  Reporting to the Head of Ad Operations, your mission is to drive operational excellence, exceptional service for our sales team, advertisers and agencies, and be a trusted partner for our internal and external stakeholders. You will be leading a team of Campaign Strategists responsible for the success of advertising campaigns from a delivery and performance standpoint. This team provides valuable insights to our sales team to enable client retention, work on regional operational programs, test new ad products and functionalities, and ensure the smooth operationalization of new products and changes.  An ideal candidate has a strong track record of successfully collaborating with sales teams and clients, leading Ad Ops teams, running successful campaigns for Singapore and Southeast Asia advertisers, and delivering results for the business. You must love enabling people, solving problems, and have strong working knowledge of setting up, optimising and delivering successful campaigns on platforms like Google, Facebook, The Trade Desk, MediaMath, and DV360.  The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that the team achieves business, productivity and customer service metrics and goals, and communicating across multiple stakeholders to resolve any potential issues that impact customer experience or business continuity.  The day-to-day activities: Ensure the smooth running of team operations from pre-campaign launch queries, to optimization, to end of campaign and billing. Enable the team to consistently meet or beat SLA delivery and service satisfaction score in terms of work quality, service and SLA. Identify and anticipate team and Sales challenges with Ad Ops and develop an effective plan to address them. Hiring, training and developing team. Create and maintain a robust training program and documentations for the team. Inspire excellence, teamwork and maintain high individual and team performance. Develop performance metrics to drive team performance and business results. Be an effective point of contact for escalations and communication within the team and cross-functionally. Not be afraid to challenge the status quo and proactively surface challenges and solutions, and drive regional standardizations and excellence. Lead programs and support the Ad Ops Program Management team. The must-haves: 7+ years of Digital Advertising Operations experience, including 2+ years as Programmatic Trader using The Trade Desk, MediaMath, or DV360. 1-2+ years of experience directly managing Ad Ops or Programmatic Trading teams. Strong knowledge and experience working with Singapore and Southeast Asia clients. Bachelor’s degree. Excellent oral and written English communication skills. Outstanding attention to details, organizational and prioritization skills. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Passionate about operational and service excellence. Optimistic, positive and resilient in the face of adversity, high work volume and constant changes. Fast-paced, strong sense of urgency and commitment to work. Team Player. Strong working knowledge of conversion pixel tracking, third party, and ad verification tools and tracking. e.g. Integral Ad Science, DoubleVerify and Moat. Proficient in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets and PowerPoint / Google Slides. Proven ability to work productively and efficiently in an independent setting. We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.  About Grab  Grab is the leading superapp platform in Southeast Asia, providing everyday services that matter to consumers. Today, the Grab app has been downloaded onto millions of mobile devices, giving users access to over 9 million drivers, merchants, and agents. Grab offers a wide range of on-demand services in the region, including mobility, food, package and grocery delivery services, mobile payments, and financial services across 428 cities in eight countries.  Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: We are looking for a talented and competitive Rainmaker that thrives in a quick sales cycle environment.  You will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives.  P/S: The company is clean and has no abnormalities. Boss is handsome admin is pretty. Please contact me if you are keen.  Roles and Responsibilities: Meet and exceed sales quotas through prospecting, targeted research and networking to generate effective leads Meet quarterly and annual revenue targets. Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales and move multiple transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline. Coordinate pre-sales resources throughout the sales cycle. Manage and track customer interaction and transactional information in a CRM system Maintain active sales pipeline and provide regular pipeline and forecast updates Provide presentations, product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers. Execute a land-and-expand sales strategy with well thought out enterprise sales strategies. Provide regular reporting of prospecting, pipeline and forecast through the CRM system. Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products. Practice effective, excellent communication with management, customers and support staff. Requirements Minimum 3 years of proven experience selling SaaS solutions into enterprise accounts. Proven track record of consistently achieving sales goals. You know how to “drive a deal”. You have expertise at enterprise level to develop and lead prospects by applying analytics to specific business issues. Highly driven individual with an execution focus and a strong sense of urgency and a belief in Micepad. You can go beyond relationship management. You are a Team Player. You understand early-stage. You understand the need to work as a team for everyone to be successful. You are an Excellent Communicator. You know what to say and more importantly, how and when to say it. Strong oral and written communication skills are a must.

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The Future Is What We Make It  Senior Channel Marketing Specialist – HBT  Malaysia OR Singapore  Honeywell offers employees the opportunity to work on the world’s most exciting projects, transforming the cities we live in, the buildings where we work, and the vehicles that move us.  We are currently seeking a Senior Channel Marketing Specialist who will act as the domain knowledge expert for the BMS product portfolio supporting global new product development and the commercialization efforts of sales teams. This role will lead the GNP product development and own the end-to-end product portfolio in ASEAN, managing and directing all product marketing activities, and will be accountable for sales growth and profitability. This role will work cross-functionally with all levels of the organization to maximize product line growth through organizational alignment, product development and market penetration to insure maximum return on investment. This role will also utilize voice of the customer inputs and quantitative research to develop a differentiated strategic product roadmap with outstanding financial outcomes. This role will develop sales tools and lead internal and external product training to increase the market acceptance of Honeywell solutions. This role will also be the focal for Customer Marketing and Strategic Marketing in BMS for ASEAN.  Portfolio management of existing portfolio of BMS Systems  Providing guidance and application support to the sales and marketing teams about the local market conditions and requirements  Driving the adoption of recently released new products to achieve AOP targets  Developing strategies to drive the profitability of the BMS System across ASEAN  Supporting product/services life cycles, profitability, IOS, SKU reduction, SIOP/demand planning.  Providing positioning and pricing support along with competitor data to support sales and marketing activities  Manage the relationships with the internal and external suppliers to our Fire Systems and EL portfolio and provide appropriate updates to the sales and marketing teams.  Supporting data analysis to feed into regular senior management category/portfolio reviews  Requirements  The successful candidate will be an experienced and energetic marketer looking to learn, contribute and drive growth in the BMS Systems. Must have the ability to be the brand champion within the business, capturing attention of sales and driving business alignment to common goals. Must be able to work with the global teams regarding the GNP strategy. Shall have deep experience defining product requirements based on voice of the customer input. Will be deadline oriented and able to support the portfolio in all geographic markets. Should possess excellent planning, execution and project-management skills.  This person will be accountable for on-time delivery, world-class execution and maximum ROI on Marketing led programs and projects. Shall have the ability to make timely decisions balancing systematic data and analysis. Shall possess the ability to forge solid internal and external relationships and manage across a broad and geographically dispersed organizational context. Shall effectively demonstrate the ability to deliver on complex situations or problems without guidance or supervision.  Experience & Educational Requirements  Bachelor’s degree (MBA or post graduate qualification in Marketing desirable)  Minimum of 5 years track record of successfully delivering results in a Senior Marketing role  BMS Systems or relevant experience a plus  Experience of New Product Development for industrial B2B companies  Experience of working in matrix, multi-national organization  At ease with technology and engineering environments  Evidence of understanding and solving customer problems  Fluent in English (Other languages desirable)  About Us  The world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.  Discover More  We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/  If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.  The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. If a disability prevents you from applying for a job through our website, request assistance here. No other requests will be acknowledged. description: <<< Experience with digital user engagement is an absolute pre-requisite >>>  << Singapore Citizen & PR>>  Canopy is a "make sense of your data" financial technology startup with traction in the market. We provide aggregation, visualization, analytics, and reporting services to financial institutions, wealth managers, and high-net-worth individuals. Our company is only successful when Canopy is actively used by our clients and that's why we are looking for a client success manager.  You will lead the activities to improve our client experience and user engagement.  Business strategy and analytics: Analyze client usage & behavior to better understand how our clients use our platform Define and monitor our client segments to determine profitability and product suitability Develop, implement, and refine target user engagement models to ensure our company is focused on client success  Client Relations: Manage day-to-day client communication and address ad hoc client queries and requests Manage Canopy community, the exclusive, by invite only social platform for HNWI Buildup and maintain relevant post-sales marketing materials, leaflets, and websites  Cross-functions: Provide input into the product development cycle and feature prioritization Conduct User Acceptance Testing ("UAT") for new product releases to ensure they are ready for our clients Assist the Sales & Marketing Team with client segmentation and marketing messageiHK  Requirements +5 years of financial industry experience in: customer experience / user engagement / wealth management Advanced degrees and/or professional qualifications (MBA, CFA, CPA, FRM etc) are an advantage Strong understanding of financial instruments & capital markets (& FinTech industry!) Experience building, implementing, and refining user engagement models Demonstrable team management skills and experience Impeccable communication skills Strong career ambitions Willingness to learn new things and get your hands dirty! Ability to speak in Mandarin or Cantonese will be an added advantage  Benefits Fun start-up culture Chance to make a real impact - and be rewarded for it! Opportunities to accelerate your career and drive your passion Flat management structure  We regret that only successful applicants will be contacted.

description: Renewals Manager Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest, most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position The Renewal Manager (RM) is a high impact position combining equal parts relationship management, contract negotiation and client satisfaction. The RM will work with existing DocuSign customers, increasing usage, adoption and overall satisfaction to ensure renewal of their next contract. The Renewal Manager is accountable for customer retention through the annual renewal process, proactive client management, forecast accuracy, and driving growth with customers in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem. This position is an Individual Contributor and reports to the Manager of Renewal Managers, APAC. This role is designated Flex.  Responsibilities Retain and grow customer accounts, including increased commitment. Develop and leverage customer relationships to improve customer retention. Manage the renewal process and negotiate multi-variable contracts. Develop a strategy to ensure assigned accounts are renewed in a timely basis. Provide accurate and timely forecasts on a weekly basis. Monitor outstanding renewals and develop a robust follow up system. Liaise with internal teams to ensure smooth processing of quotes and renewals for customers. Identify areas for growth within the account upon renewal. Communicate risk to management and lead resolution strategies. Align with the Adoption Manager to ensure campaigns run effectively. Deliver business reviews for low adopting customers who require a 1:1 engagement. Be the principal point of contact for key customers and leverage the internal organisation to meet the needs of your customers. Act as the customer champion, by constantly looking for improvement areas and ways to retain our customers through better product and customer service  Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. 5 + years experience in B2B sales or account management focused on customer renewals within the technology or software industry.  Preferred Qualifications Proven track record of success in managing a high-volume portfolio of accounts. Track record of success and over-achievement of quota in past positions. Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Exceptional time management, organization, and multi-tasking skills are a must. Strong verbal and written communication skills, specifically at the executive level.  About Us DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, colour, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  #LI-CH1

description: Expanding geographical scope Medical Devices industry  About Our Client  Our client is a publicly listed Multinational in the Medtech industry. They have transformed and grown rapidly globally in the last few years and there is now a strong focus on their Asia business. Their products are well engineered and renowned for high quality, with impeccable customer service. In APAC, they sell through a combination of exclusive and multiple channel partners. They also have strong partnerships with major hospitals and vendors. They're looking to strengthen their direct presence by hiring a leadership role to lead and manage their commercial sales and business development.  Job Description  The General Manager, Sales - Asia is responsible for leading and growing their regional business through existing partnerships and identifying new business potentials. Leading a sizable team with good tenure, this new addition to the leadership team will be responsible for: Develop new partnerships, both in distributor network and directly, in line with the global growth strategy. Drive sales and implement strategic plans for the respective markets Increase Business in line with the corporate growth strategy à through regional expansion and market share gains Grow the marketing branding in new markets Lead and drive sales pitches and presentations Work collaboratively with senior management on strategic plans and develop actionable plans for the respective markets Identify opportunities for repeat business via campaigns, services, and distribution channels  The Successful Applicant  Degree holder in a relevant discipline, MBA is a plus Have an established network with distributors across Asia (across several countries) Proven track record in developing new market penetration strategies and plans Experience in brand building, development and retention within Asia At least 10 years in a commercial sales leadership with a good track record in developing high performing teams Able to work in a culturally diverse environment  What's On Offer  Our client is a well-established brand name in the ophthalmology industry. The organization has a competitive remuneration scheme and good employee retention benefits. The role requires travel for training, customer visits and partner management so we are looking for candidates who can travel once restrictions are lifted.  Contact: Eugenia NG (Lic No: R1108105)  Quote job ref: 4178658

description: To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring ground-breaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, manufacturer and artist in the world. Formlabs is one of the key players in digital dentistry. We are looking for a standout salesperson with the entrepreneurial mindset to build dental sales partnerships and programs. If you have a deep understanding of the dental and broader medical industry as well as experience bringing ground-breaking technology to market, join us as our Dental Channel Sales Manager!  We are open to having this person based remotely in Australia, or at our offices in Singapore.  The Job: Make Formlabs printers the de facto choice for 3D printing in dentistry across the Asia Pacific region Build sales partnerships with the best distributors and VARs in the dental industry across APAC Own the dental top line growth and target for APAC.  You: Thrive as a sole contributing entrepreneur while also fitting seamlessly into a team Have deep understanding of the dental and medical industries and the related advanced technologies Are an experienced salesperson who consistently outperforms targets and peers Can easily start, build, and deftly manage relationships over time Work strategically to make sales channel partnerships productive and valuable, including navigating margin structure, enablement, and conflict management Are an expert communicator who can talk to the engineer and layperson alike A smooth diplomat, as well as a tough negotiator Enjoy travelling frequently to speak with enterprise customers and partners  Bonus Skills: Passion for 3D printing and emerging technologies Experience in rapidly-growing startup environments  We Offer: Shares in the company (we're a Unicorn company) Development opportunities both in-house and off-site Fun team events  Perks are subject to adjustments and may vary from team to team.  We build amazing things. Come join us!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing.

description: At Chainstack we are building the ultimate blockchain control panel for businesses. We believe companies should spend their precious time leveraging the massive potential of decentralized solutions. Instead, we find many teams struggling through the complex blockchain maze. We are a fast-growing startup with strong roots in enterprise IT and cybersecurity. This means you can make an impact from day one contributing to our vision of making blockchain adoption as simple as modern web services.  We are currently looking for a versatile and enthusiastic Technical Sales Lead, who can work on prospect and customer development, as well as actively contribute to product and marketing initiatives.  Prospects: Be a technical evangelist of Chainstack Frequent direct dialogue with all prospects to help them assess needs and requirements Drive most prospect presentations, product demos, and tech assessment  Customers: Frequent direct dialogue with all high-value customers to help them assess needs and requirements across all channels Understand the new requirements and help the clients in choosing better plans and propose customized solutions Explore new areas of opportunities and value adds/propositions/scaling   Product: Document suggestions and ideas and share them with the product management team Proper understanding of the requirements and creating user stories  Marketing: Stay updated and actively engage in all meaningful blockchain developer communities Be an active member of various blockchain ecosystems Work with the core team to identify prospective blockchain protocols and frameworks Create high-quality product marketing content

description: The Company: Preqin is an award-winning, independent, research company providing data and intelligence to the financial industry. Investment professionals use Preqin’s online products to obtain key information for business-critical decision-making. Preqin’s clients include fund managers, legal firms, institutional investors, financial advisors and placement agents.  Primarily a data company; Preqin is also a fast-moving fintech with a strong growth record and a world-wide staff base. Owned by our founder, directors and employee shareholders, we care passionately about our customers, brand and the employees that make it all happen.  Role Overview: We are looking for a talented manager to join and head up our Client Services team and help us to continue providing a market-leading support experience for our clients within the APAC region. You will be responsible for managing a team of passionate, like-minded service and administrative individuals. You will work closely with other regional managers to maintain, plan and implement strategies that will have a positive impact on our large and diverse client base. You will have the opportunity to pursue and cultivate a rewarding career with an industry leader during Preqin’ s important stage of growth.  As a Client Services Manager, you will have the ability to make an immediate impact in building a high-performing team within the business. Based on your strong management, lead-by-example approach, and organizational skills you will have the opportunity to develop a successful career at Preqin.  Roles and Responsibilities: Manage a team of client facing service (and administrative) individuals, providing guidance and coaching to maintain and enhance individual and team behaviours/performance Effective monitoring and decision-making skills with experience of implementing processes, KPI’s and performance metrics Maintain and find ways to improve existing workflows and client satisfaction Work closely with the APAC Sales team to implement strategies for client support and retention, with the primary goal of achieving revenue targets Meet with other regional heads to assess current initiatives and their impacts Collaborate with key stakeholders across departments within in the region (and globally) to arrange feedback and enhancements to products and services Be a Preqin champion - Lead by example in interacting with clients and internally  Key Requirements for this Role: Proven experience in managing a successful team (bonus if regional experience) Good relationship-builder internally and externally, transparent and team-orientated Positive personality, able to inspire and drive results in equal measure High energy to work across time zones Communicates honestly and openly; promotes effective communication Commercial mindset and consultative approach to clients A good knowledge of the alternatives market and key players in the industry  Company Benefits: Competitive starting salary in addition to a quarterly incentive bonus and discretionary annual bonus Company equity/ options Medical and dental benefits 21 days holiday We also sponsor employees to undertake professional training or to gain qualifications relevant to their career  Training and Development Preqin offers comprehensive Sales Training to all new members of the Sales and CS Teams. Our training is provided in the first few weeks of joining us and utilises powerful, up-to-date techniques along-side industry knowledge to create a truly bespoke training experience unique to Preqin. Individuals that complete our programmes are able to conduct more efficient prospecting, uncover more value within our prospects and clients, resist and overcome objections and achieve success in a shorter period. Once completed and an assessment passed, all Sales & CS reps will be fully certified in Preqin Sales Fundamentals and experience a reduced ramping period and earn more money, faster.  Our Shared Culture Preqin is a fast-growing company, but we are passionate about keeping an entrepreneurial spirit at the heart of everything we do. Our aim is to deliver for our customers, but as one united, progressive, and successful team. Today, our more than 700 people globally share six core values. We strive for quality and put our customers first. We are objective, and we innovate, collaborate, and invest in our personal development. We also have fun together. We hold social events, play sports, and celebrate our shared successes.   Covid-19 note During the COVID-19 pandemic, Preqin has closed its offices and moved staff to work from home. Our primary goals are to ensure the safety of our employees, and to keep providing our clients with the best-in-class support they have come to expect from us. However, we have not slowed our recruitment activity due to the outbreak, and have adopted a remote interviewing, onboarding and training process. Our growth plans have not stopped, and we anticipate onboarding a significant number of staff in the coming months.

description: LIXIL – WHO WE ARE Every person on the planet dreams of a better home. LIXIL makes that possible with pioneering water and housing products. Our purpose is to make better homes a reality for everyone, everywhere. LIXIL was created in 2011 through the consolidation of five of Japan’s most successful housing and building companies. Since then we’ve acquired some of the most trusted global brands in our industry.  WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR The Leader, Brand Marketing (GROHE), LWT APAC is responsible for conceptualization, execution, and evaluation of a strategic brand communications plan to attain top of mind recall among its target audience, in support of the sales and marketing objectives of the GROHE brand. The role and its responsibilities will evolve and grow over time to meet business and market demands. The selected individual is expected to embrace such changes and rise to the challenge of developing himself or herself along with opportunities within the company.    YOU WILL 1. Market Research Gather market/industry information and provide marketing expertise for reaching and being relevant to target audiences. 2. Brand Identity Guidelines Work collaboratively with Global Brand Identity and other Regional Brand Leads to provide regional context on Brand Identity Develop APAC Brand Identity Guidelines and specific applications, based on the Global Brand Identity Guidelines Conduct annual training on Brand Identity Guidelines and Applications Provide guidance to markets and other regional functions to ensure applications are compliant to the brand identity guidelines 3. Communications Plan Development Work collaboratively with global/regional/local product marketing, channel marketing, and commercial teams and other functional teams to understand product and channel objectives and strategies Create an integrated marketing communication plan based on brand, product, and channel objectives: identifying target audience, issues and opportunities, determining communication objectives, designing the communication strategy (message and creative strategies), selecting communication channels, formulating communication media plan, budget and timeline Develop marketing communication assets for new collections/products and specific campaigns Provide writing and editing support for all communication  4. Communication Plan Execution Source, hire and manage external resources (creative and media agencies, and other outsourced services) Coordinate projects with agencies and suppliers for the creative strategy development and production of communication materials Produce marketing communications materials on brand/technology/category/collections or model/products/others (e.g. advertisements, press releases, EDMs, etc) Provide support, as needed, for the day-to-day implementation of the marketing communications plan. Work with regional marketing functions such as Product, Channel, Digital, Training, Commercial and other related functions for the execution Work collaboratively with PA team to develop and manage media relations to promote brand and secure coverage of new products, campaigns, events, etc. Manage brand advocacy/CSR programs, if any Maintain marketing communication resources in internal resource databases (PIM, SHAREPOINT, BOX) 5. Communication Plan Control and Evaluation Prepare marketing budget and monitors spending Prepare project timeline and ensure project is progressing as scheduled, addressing issues along the way Monitor program implementation and provide program objective measurements, working collaboratively with related functions. 6. Reporting Prepare and present regular reports (monthly brand report, monthly marketing budget report, and other reports as required) 7. Standards and Processes Comply with marketing standards Assist with the development/improvement of marketing standards and processes over time  8. Miscellaneous Duties Ad hoc duties, as required  Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, and participating in professional organizations Enhance department’s overall competence by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests. Explore opportunities to always add value to job accomplishments   WILL BE GREAT IF YOU HAVE General Qualifications: University Degree in Business or Marketing Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent organizational and time/project management skills; ability to multi-task and react to shifting priorities while adhering to deadlines. Attention to detail is essential. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written – with a strong need to convey statuses clearly and succinctly to a wide range of cross-functional audiences. Resourceful and self-motivated approach to work, with an interest in learning and growing professionally. Approachable team player who is results-oriented and can build relationships to achieve team goals. Experience: 8-12 years’ experience in brand or marketing communications for brand in high mass to luxury market segments Related experience in building materials industry preferred, but not required.

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager, Clinical Diagnostics Asia
description: Company Description  Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, which provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. The Group believes it is the world leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and for supporting clinical studies. In addition, Eurofins is one of the leading global emerging players in specialty clinical diagnostic testing.  In 2018, Eurofins generated 4.2 billion Euro proforma turnover in 800 laboratories across 47 countries, employing about 45.000 staff.  Job Description  SUMMARY OF POSITION AND OBJECTIVES:  Eurofins Technologies is an international business line (IBL) within the Eurofins Group which is developing, manufacturing and marketing technologies and other supplies in the field of bioanalytical testing. The position will focus on building a multi-million EUR business, with a focus on distribution in Asia of Eurofins Technologies clinical diagnostics test kit portfolio (incl. SARS-CoV-2 test kits and other infectious diseases, etc) to government institutions and B2B customers in Asia (research institutes, government laboratories, routine laboratories, hospitals, clinics, medical centers, etc)  Position & Objectives Support test kit registrations in key markets through own network with government institutes and via distributors Build a growth strategy for clinical diagnostics test kits in Asia. Based on market development, competitive moves and innovative thinking, identify, map and prioritise potential customers and sales opportunities in Asia. This will include the development of a SARS-CoV-2 test kit market for Eurofins Technologies. Develop a portfolio of prospects; Convert high priority clients into sales; Initiate, develop and grow relationship with key accounts and government key opinion leaders in Asia Actively seek participation in tenders and hospital laboratory outsourcing opportunities As the business grows, build a team; Hire sales executives and support team when required. Build Eurofins Technologies Clinical Diagnostics brand in Asia; Deliver high quality presentations and maintain ongoing customer communication regarding our capabilities; develop strategic marketing plans and marketing materials; Organise and/or participate in conferences for Key Opinion Leaders, Doctors and other medical staff; Organise test kit logistics between Eurofins Technologies production locations and client premises and strive to reduce lead time as much as you can to exceed customer’s expectations Disseminate and report information regarding developments in the marketplace and competitive information; Monitor competitor activity and competitors' products; Once possible again, maintain effective communication with the trade through regular field travel, convention attendance, customer visits and third party influence contacts. Keep abreast of trade developments. Manage your sales budget and cost of your department; develop and deliver an ambition plan Perform other duties as assigned. Evolution  In a fast growing group, successful leaders are frequently being offered increased areas of responsibility (subject to geographic mobility).  Qualifications  PREFERRED PROFILE: Strong understanding of the Asian clinical testing market (e.g. through an experience in the routine/specialty pathology market, or as an IVD sales manager, or as a distributor); 5 to 10 years experience in a regional sales related role in the Clinical Diagnostics test kit business Good contacts within the clinical diagnostics laboratory sector (private and government), hospitals, clinics, medical centers and specialty physicians; Good network within research institutes as collaboration partners for clinical test kit studies Set up and/or significant growth of a distribution business in the healthcare sector Managed a multi-country distribution business in Asia Technical understanding of PCR, ELISA and LFD test kit technology Entrepreneur; Ability to work independently locally, and as part of a team globally, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude; Ambitious Responsive, problem solving and action oriented mindset; Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail; excellent interpersonal, presentation, and organizational skills; Additional Information  What we offer: As an employer, we’re keen to look after our people with as much dedication as they look after our patients. That’s why we offer competitive salaries, excellent training and exceptional career prospects. We’re a growing and ambitious company, so there is huge potential here to develop with us and enjoy fantastic rewards in your career.  Your Data  As part of any recruitment process, the company collects and processes personal data relating to job applicants. The company is committed to being transparent about how it collects and uses that data and to meeting its data protection obligations.  Eurofins Technologies is an Equal Opportunities Company.
industries: Medical Devices, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Description  Job ID: 22-148  Come Join Our Passionate Team! At Barracuda, we make the world a safer place. We believe every business deserves access to cloud-enabled, enterprise-grade security solutions that are easy to buy, deploy, and use. We protect email, networks, data and applications with innovative solutions that grow and adapt with our customers’ journey. More than 220,000 organizations worldwide trust Barracuda to protect them — in ways they may not even know they are at risk — so they can focus on taking their business to the next level.  We know a diverse workforce adds to our collective value and strength as an organization. Barracuda Networks is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to equal employment opportunity and equitable compensation regardless of race, gender, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability.  Envision yourself at Barracuda  The Barracuda Networks Team is expanding and adding an additional field-based Account Manager covering Singapore. We are seeking talented, motivated sales performers responsible for achieving the territory new business target. You will be responsible for planning and executing the territory strategy in alignment with the overall regional plan. Through developing and enabling our partner channel and strong end-user touch, the Account Manager will leverage channel relationship to find and develop opportunities.  What You’ll Be Working On Build & execute on your business commercial plan to over-achieve on your numbers. This plan should include: How you will recruit and enable the channel community to generate a run-rate which should form 70% of your numbers Identify and sell into top enterprise account targets by building and executing on the account plans. Proactively execute on recruitment & enablement plans to generate interest in working with Barracuda. Conduct constant lead generation activities with partners to generate pipeline. Keeping up-to-date knowledge of Barracuda’s market position, the competitive landscape and communicate customers’ needs and issues to product management. What You Bring To The Role You are a serial over-achiever. You have a strong network of partners and good reputation with existing enterprise customers. An excellent and discipled self-starter who is also a great team player of a team with good communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills An enthusiastic, highly motivated individual with a serious work ethic Ability to work in a fast paced and sometimes hectic environment where you will draw on your problem-solving and multi-tasking skills. Experience in managing, motivating, and creating loyalty in your partners.

description: We are currently partnering with a well-known MNC in the FMCG industries. The ideal candidate is a team player who will be responsible for M&A activities.  Responsibilities Evaluate and execute of M&A and other investment opportunities, including: Performing valuation and returns analyses, including trading comparable, discounted cash flow and leveraged buyout analyses Oversight of transaction due diligence, including planning due diligence workstreams and management of transaction advisors Preparation of investment memos for transaction approval from board Negotiation of transaction documentation including sales and purchase agreements and other legal items Deal structuring and other transaction related matters  Development and execution of corporate and business unit level strategy, including: Co-ordinating and executing post-acquisition integration plans with investee companies Developing and overseeing value creation initiatives of existing portfolio companies including identifying financial and operational efficiencies and improvements, scope for development of operational capabilities and other investment areas  Support other corporate development activity, including: Analysis of industry trends, competitive threats, expansion opportunities and internal performance to support C-level decision making Supporting management on other business development opportunities   Qualifications 2-5 years of experience with at least 1 year in a strategy/investment banking/corporate finance/private equity firm; Prior experience in the consumer goods and FMCG industries is not necessary but would be advantageous; Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively; Excellent analytical skills and effective presentation skills; Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and react to changing priorities; Strong analytical, problem solving skills and resourceful.

description: With over 80 years as an industrial technology leader, Kennametal Inc. delivers productivity to customers through materials science, tooling and wear-resistant solutions. Customers across aerospace, earthworks, energy, general engineering and transportation turn to Kennametal to help them manufacture with precision and efficiency. Every day approximately 10,000 employees are helping customers in more than 60 countries stay competitive. Kennametal generated nearly $2.4 billion in revenues in fiscal 2019. Learn more at www.kennametal.com Follow @Kennametal: Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn and YouTube. Job Title: Senior Analyst, Sales Operations – Asia Location: Singapore  Job Summary   Kennametal Singapore is currently looking for a dynamic Senior Analyst, Sales Operations – Asia who will work closely with the commercial team in the region.  Key Job Responsibilities Helps drive sales growth by identifying areas for expansion and improvement. Analyzing key metrics; coordinating with sales, accounting, and marketing teams to develop and implement solutions. Coordinating with regional sales teams to ensure sales goals are met in a timely fashion and in compliance with best practices and relevant regulations. Integrate, compile, analyze, and evaluate data on sales performance metrics, including trends for products. Create reports based on their analysis of sales data and present that data to others in their organization, including management. Working with Asia Sales Leaders regarding sales forecasting and planning. Assist sales teams with operational tasks, such as data analysis, policy execution, and negotiation with managers. Provide ad hoc analyses to understand quotas, distributor, and/or sales rep performance and competitor impact. Manage end to end projects and lifecycle and take on leadership responsibilities over Sales Operations counterparts Liaise with other teams, channeling information to the appropriate parties. Providing Training to internal stakeholders regarding the Sales tools and process  Education, Work Experience, Skills, Certificates  Bachelor's degree in any field. Diploma holder comes with strong work experience will also be considered 5 years & above experience in a high-intensity environment Experience or knowledge in SAP, CRM, Tableau, Power BI is a must Experience / interest in end-to-end project management and implementations; PMP certification will be an added advantage Proficient with basic computer software and Microsoft Office tools (Excel & PowerPoint) Experience in engineering/manufacturing industries will be an advantage Attention to detail and meet deadlines are needed Able to multitask and solve problems quickly; process-driven Great interpersonal skills and able to work with ambiguity Eligible to work in Singapore Able to speak multilingual is an added advantage  Kennametal is an Equal Opportunity Employer

description: About US: H3C is an industry leader in the provision of Digital Solutions and is committed to becoming the most trusted partner of its customers in their quest for business innovation and digital transformation. Supported by a deep foundation with more than 30 years of operation, we provide scenario-based and customized solutions to our customers in nearly 100 countries and regions, enabling digital transformation in various industries that include, but not limited to carrier, government, finance, healthcare, education, transportation, manufacturing, utilities, energy, and Internet.  Key Responsibilities: Engages with the customer to identify opportunities. Translates customers' business challenges and goals into ICT opportunities. Accountable for pipeline building; Develops and maintains a professional relationship network within the customer to maximize efficiency and effectiveness for H3C. Defines an engagement model with the customer's key influencers and decision makers; Constantly develops information technology industry knowledge to position H3C’s portfolio in the account; Plans for accounts to deliver results through the financial year and beyond. Accountable for and supportive in deal closing and orchestrating the deal team; Responsible for in branding promotion and marketing development in market.  Qualification: University or Bachelor's Degree; Typically, 4-8+ years sales experience; Account management experience desired. Experience in ICT industry preferred. Experience in vertical industry preferred. Fluent in English, listening, speaking, reading, and writing.

description: As a global technology leader, Epson creates and delivers technology solutions for businesses and consumers, from inkjet printers and digital printing systems to 3LCD projectors, smart glasses, sensing systems and industrial robots. Epson has a comprehensive infrastructure of service outlets, solution centres and manufacturing facilities supporting customers in the region. Today, the company continues to exceed customer expectations with its wide range of high precision, energy-efficient products in the region.   Job Summary Effective product life cycle management e.g. from introduction to end-of-life (EOL) Responsible for equipping the sales team with the necessary expertise to enable them to sell products effectively. Act as the initial reference for all product related enquiries and work collaboratively with relevant colleagues to address any issues that may arise Preparing product forecasts, and constantly monitoring inventory levels, including liaison with relevant departments to ensure stock availability & supply timelines Anticipate challenges to product lines and proactively work on strategies to counter them Aggressively champion and drive business and opportunities for the product group Develop strategic product marketing plans for the product line through market research, competitive analysis, pricing, customer engagement and business planning To plan all activities with effective ROIs. Assist with the development of the annual marketing plan including advertising, promotion, activities and sales kit by working closely with the local marketing team Actively monitor competitors’ models, sales, programs, activities & market share Joint visitation with sales colleagues & potential partners to grow new business streams Focus on achieving sell in, sell out & sell through Set sales goals and develop channel marketing programs to achieve these goals Develop positive working relationship with channel partners to generate revenue Assist partners in the execution of channel marketing programs to increase product sales within customer base Timely creation of forms for special price support Creation of price list / memo for distribution to internal and external stakeholders Creation of program cost sheets to support channel related activities, including liaison with Legal team where necessary Timely stock forecast submission Interface with SCM on all stock related issues Participation and preparation for key meetings  Key Accountabilities Achieve business plan Oversee end-to-end product lifecycle management Develop a thorough understanding of the product and be the expertise in the assign product group Collaborate with key team members from across the business i.e. sales, marketing, customer service etc. to drive the business  Key Job Requirements: Min. 3 years of working experience in product management role Min. Diploma / Degree in business Prior experience in channel sales will be an advantage Experience in office automation and copier industry preferred

description: Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  The Coinbase Customer Experience (CX) organization plays an imperative role in achieving our mission. Our team is dedicated to eliminating customer challenges, empowering our global user base via self-service and automation, and optimizing customer support interactions to build an effortless experience. More specifically, the CX Operations team is dedicated to providing premier support and account management across our entire suite of products.  As the Manager of the APAC Account Management team, you’ll lead a high caliber team of passionate support professionals whose performance is critical to Coinbase achieving its mission. You will serve as the primary point of contact internally and externally for your Institutional client base and be the subject matter expert for Coinbase’s institutional suite of products (Prime Broker and Custody). You will be responsible for providing premier service and support to our most valued institutional clients such as hedge funds, investment managers, market makers, and private wealth managers. Being diligent, empathetic, a great people manager, and have a bias towards action, you will play a crucial role in the success of the Account Management organization as we help build the crypto economy.  What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties) Lead a team of high performing Account Managers and engage with senior management to drive the overall teams strategy. Serve as the Account Manager for a group of Coinbase’s highest priority and value institutional clients, co-owning the relationship with our Institutional Coverage sales teams. Act as the primary point of contact internally and externally for your client base. Conduct forensic mapping of each account to effectively build strong, trusted and fruitful relationships across all areas of the client organization, including the C-suite. Be the primary escalation point for your team and their clients. Provide a best in class experience for our clients through effective partner management, conclusive prioritization, and efficient execution across institutional teams Understand complex, multi-product client workflows and strategies to ensure that our institutional clients are integrated appropriately and using our product suite efficiently Effectively triage, manage and prioritize incoming client requests. Handle requests through to resolution, including delegating across teams of subject matter specialists Facilitate prospect and client demo calls, serving as subject matter specialist on product features, answering technical cryptocurrency related questions, and demonstrating how Coinbase can fit into their overall strategy Coordinate closely with Sales and Trading to design and jointly deliver use cases and solutions that drive portfolio allocation strategies into digital assets for institutions. Develop consistent flow of customer referrals from accounts to feed Sales and Trading pipeline Distill client feedback to internal teams including Advocacy, Engineering and Product when surfacing bugs, incidents, and product feedback What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) A proven leader with a minimum of 4 years experience leading Account Management teams, who is willing to assume the responsibilities of running a senior team Motivated by Coinbase’s mission and creating a seamless, white-glove support experience for our highest value individual and institutional clients Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in an institutional client partner / services / advisory role in financial services or technology industry Comfortable being the escalation point both internally and externally for your team and their clients. Experience with relationship or account management for institutional clients, liaising with executive leadership, management, and/or senior operations contacts In depth knowledge of global financial markets, prime brokerage, margin, lending, derivatives, trading platforms, custody, and/or crypto Fantastic interpersonal skills in order to represent your team across multiple departments, partners, and clients Flexible and adaptable to meet the evolving needs of a high-growth and fast paced organization Travel requirements up to 20% to Coinbase offices and client locations (depending on business need) Nice To Haves High level of proficiency in cryptocurrency and Coinbase products Advanced degree in business, finance, project management or client experience ID: R22906  Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@ coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Please contact accommodations@ coinbase.com for additional information or to request accommodations.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants  Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here: Ireland/EU, United Kingdom, and California. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Senior Manager, Business Development (for Razer Gold Japan)
description: At Razer, you will be at the forefront of the most exciting industry in the world—video games, undertaking the greatest mission of all: bringing gamers closer to the games they love. With fifteen offices and three R&D labs worldwide, you will be part of a global team that transcends time zones and geographical boundaries. You get to enjoy working in an environment that values transparency and collaborative effort. Most importantly, both work and play are equally important to us.  We are looking for a results-driven and hands-on Senior Business Development Manager to lead Razer Gold business development activities for the Japan market. You must have the ability to understand the sales development process and technology stack and ensure its adoption. We need a self-starter motivated to constantly improve and optimize the process to drive performance.  Responsibilities: Work closely with our strategic partner in Japan to run and expand Razer Gold Japan wallet Develop long-term partnerships with the assigned merchants/contents for the benefit of both companies Responsible for the opening of channels to drive distribution for Razer Gold as well as the onboarding of new game/entertainment contents together with our strategic partner in the Japan region Formulate and implement an account penetration, management and growth strategy and plan that maximizes sales and profits Drive and develop performance targets for key merchants/contents Identify business opportunities and work with team to capture the business opportunities Able to work independently to manage Razer Gold Japan wallet Coordinate local marketing activity with our strategy partner in Japan Analyze and report on your weekly activities to identify potential optimizations  Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field with minimally 5 years of sales/business development experience in the gaming/payment service industry Track record of successful channel acquisition and business development, especially for the Japan market Strong understanding of the gaming and digital content landscape and partners across PC, Mobile and Console Strong network of contacts in the payment service and/or games industry Proficiency in English language required, Japanese language skills will be an added advantage Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with partners as well as management and peers Self-motivated, with high energy and a passion for PC and Mobile games  Be part of a phenomenal team today!
industries: Consumer Electronics

jobTitle: Senior / Business Development Manager (Health & Beauty Category)
description: Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.  foodpanda is the leading, on-demand food delivery company in Singapore, bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a startup culture.  We are looking for an ambitious and energetic Business Development Manager (Health & Beauty Category) for our team in Singapore. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on exposure and have a direct impact, then this may be the place for you! The ideal candidate will have a track record as a significant individual contributor – comfortable working independently, whilst working closely with the management team.  About The Role  This role will be based in Singapore and will report to the Sales Team Lead. The successful incumbent will b e the front of the company and have the dedication to create and apply an effective sales strategy with strong desire to innovate and grow the business.  Responsibilities Experience in B2B sales. Knowledge in the Health & Beauty and/or FMCG industries is a plus Strong desire to innovate and find new ways to grow the business Exceeds volume & quality targets while working independently Ability to conduct cold calls and walk-ins, schedule in person meetings and sell to prospects in Singapore Manage a portfolio of prospects accounts, and meet or exceed goals for account signing & activation Be the local market expert: gather clients’ feedback, monitor competitor activity and provide recommendations for improvements to management Requirements Social character with positive attitude towards new challenges Outgoing and confident in their appearance Self-motivated with the ability to work remotely and under pressure Flexibility, FMCG clients do not always operate on 9-to-5 schedules Problem-solving and analytical skills to interpret sales performance and market trend information. Experience in sales force is a plus Fluency in English is a must What We Offer Challenging and fulfilling steep learning curve Vibrant, dynamic & international workplace Periodic fun & engaging company events & team activities Tasty Thursdays Birthday Leave Work Anniversar(ies) Leave Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor to this fast-growing global company
