description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  The Challenge  This is a unique opportunity for an experienced account executive to take on the responsibility of driving new sales revenue for Adobe Commerce portfolio, within select markets in Asia region. We are looking for a high energy individual who wants to make a difference and be part of a success story.  What You'll Do Drive Adobe Commerce portfolio revenue Prospect, develop and close new logo customers within a defined territory segment consisting of accounts between $100M- $1bn in business revenue Building executive level relationships as well as establishing meetings with a broad array of business and technology executives - proactively selling into multiple levels of an organization. Collaboration with the different Adobe business functions ( Partner Sales, Solution Consulting, Professional Services, Marketing etc.) to develop new value propositions, build awareness and new sales opportunities Manage and deliver accurate forecasts for reporting What You Need To Succeed Proven track record of achieving/exceeding sales quota and market share goals Experience in Enterprise Software sales, ideally Commerce / related Marketing Technology solutions. Proven success in selling to Senior Mgt and C- levels Consistent over-achievement of quota in past positions Experience in highly competitive markets Proficiency in direct and channel-based sales cycles Self-motivated and disciplined Thrive on challenges and able to work effectively in a fast-paced collaborative environment Outstanding presentation and negotiation skills.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Senior Manager, Business Development, Singapore Location: Singapore* * Note: This role requires physical presence in Singapore, so those that lack residence permits in Singapore need not apply. ** Note: This role requires near native English and Chinese language skills. Applicants lacking both language skills will not be considered.  At Ecoplexus (www.ecoplexus.com), we are seeking individuals who have a passion to be part of the renewable energy industry and the change it is bringing, are self starters, creative thinkers, possess the drive to achieve, and have the capacity to assume increasing responsibility in a dynamic growth environment. We are looking for talented self-starters with imagination, creativity and vision. We are a rapidly-growing developer of large solar, wind and energy storage projects serving corporate and utility energy purchasers. We design, build, finance, own and operate projects across the US, Mexico and Asia. Headquartered in San Francisco, Ecoplexus has grown at an annual rate of over 50% per year since its founding in 2009.  Duties and Responsibilities:  Ecoplexus seeks a Business Development Senior Manager to support our project development activities in Maritime Southeast Asia. This role is a critical component of Ecoplexus's business. Liaise with government, electric utility, and industry stakeholders (including the EMA, Singapore Power, Ministry of Trade and Industry, and others) to obtain transmission grid information, determine suitable transmission routes and grid connection points, coordinate potential cross-border initiatives, and manage all related documentation and correspondence. Source and secure project revenues through long-term agreements for sales of energy (PPA) and renewable energy attributes with commercial and industrial off-takers. Manage responses to local requests for proposal and tenders for renewable energy from corporate off takers, prepare and structure offers, in close collaboration with our global Origination and Legal teams, as well as local Project Development teams. Monitor and analyze government policy, corporate buyer procurement mechanisms, and electricity market data to recommend forward-looking strategies for profitable project development and contribute to defining project offerings. Originate utility-scale renewable energy and energy storage project opportunities that meet the company's investment criteria. Source, evaluate, analyze, and secure land for utility-scale renewable energy and energy storage projects in collaboration with management, internal staff, and external consultants. Specific duties include prospecting, site identification and assessment, information gathering with local government, viability analysis, outreach and property owner relationship building and relationship management. Develop the company profile in the marketplace through regular partner and stakeholder contact, participation in professional organizations, and attendance and presentations at industry events. Collaborate with technical, legal, and financial resources to support the business development process. Manage and maintain data rooms, project summary and tracking tools, and project files Compile and maintain update reports as required by management. Other development and support activities as may be required by the Company. Experience: 5+ years business development or project transactional experience in the energy or real estate development industry in Singapore Strong track record of working cooperatively with government Strong background working with internal and external stakeholders Multinational company experience a plus Qualifications: Knowledge of the Singaporean and Malaysian renewable energy markets advantageous Electrical engineering experience a plus Project management skills Ability to work independently and creatively solve problems High level of professionalism with attention to detail Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills Superior time management and interpersonal skills Expert in MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint Full professional proficiency in English required Professional proficiency in Chinese or Bahasa Malaysia strongly preferred Legal residents of Singapore only. Education: Minimum BA/BS degree required Completed courses in renewable energy will be considered positively Travel: frequent (primarily domestic)  Ecoplexus offers a competitive salary, strong bonus structures, the potential for employee stock options in a growing company, and a benefits program.  Ecoplexus Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.  Check us out at: http://www.ecoplexus.com/about-us/
industries: Renewables & Environment

description: On behalf of our client - Cloud ICT provider, we are looking to speak with Sales/BD professionals with product knowledge in cloud computing, capable to own/take charge of P&L and cloud product lines.  Responsibilities & Requirements for Product Manager/BD Manager (Cloud)  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in Cloud Computing • Maintain & create strategic alliances with the CSPs and Channel partners to increase market share • Research and identify new business opportunities, develop/Implement Go-To Market (GTM) strategy and work with all departments to achieve sales & marketing objectives • Provide strategic direction and support to sales team to drive sales and achieve cloud product targets and plan the certification training roadmap for sales and cloud professionals • Identifies new strategic opportunities for the development of cloud business & services • Improve company’s Cloud branding through various marketing campaigns and webinars • Discuss promotional strategy and activities with the marketing department; organizing and managing events/roadshows • Singaporeans are welcome to apply  Consultant: Jethro Ong Reg No.: R1874206 HRnet One Pte Ltd (EA Licence: 16S8408)

The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media-buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers — and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency.  So if you’re talented, driven, creative, and hungry to bring something entirely new and wildly ambitious into the world (and have some fun doing it), then we want to talk.  What We Do  The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media-buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers — and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency.  So if you’re talented, driven, creative, and hungry to bring something entirely new and wildly ambitious into the world (and have some fun doing it), then we want to talk.  What You’ll Do  Manage and grow a roster of key agency accounts Work closely with the Trading team to rapidly onboard new customers Work closely with Sales to identify ways to grow current accounts Become an expert on the use and best practices on The Trade Desk platform, and offer insights to clients on how to improve campaigns Provide continual training to clients as new features are added to The Trade Desk Work with Product Management to help define features and drive enhancements to The Trade Desk platform Help build the Client Services practice, by creating training materials, best practices, sales materials and customer facing guides  WHO YOU ARE:  Bachelor’s Degree with at least 3 years of online advertising experience and at least 2 years of client-facing experience Expertise in working with RTB, DSPs, ad exchanges, aggregators, ad servers, and other optimization platforms is a plus Experience managing CPA, CPC, and CPM marketing campaigns Solid experience in Excel and MS Office, including pivot tables, chart-making, and manipulation of large data sets Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a fast-paced start-up environment Proven track record of growing accounts by forging a strong relationship with clients, understanding their objectives and recommending best strategies Effective time management skills – ability to prioritize and meet deadlines  The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. description: Do you want to contribute to the future of healthcare? As Siemens Healthineers values those who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause, our company’s name is dedicated to our employees. It’s their pioneering spirit, blended with our long history of engineering in the ever evolving healthcare industry that truly makes us unique as an employer.  We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to stretch beyond your comfort zone in order to grow both personally and professionally. Sound interesting?  Then come in and join our global team as an Account Manager, Healthcare Digitalization you will plan and executes sales targets and activities in Singapore. You will be focusing on the prospecting and business development, closing and managing project implementation for the healthcare digitalization solutions to healthcare service providers. This is a complex solution-based Business Development role which requires the incumbent to be able to create, manage and convert relationships into enterprise digitalization solutions to be delivered.  Your mission and responsibilities:  You will be responsible for management of assigned accounts You will be responsible for the delivery of revenue targets of assign accounts You will be responsible to handle Tender/ Procurement and to Work with commercial/ legal teams on T&C You will work along with project managers to manage customer’s expectation You will coordinate with Customer Service support and keep abreast with service support issues, status along with maintaining customer satisfaction You will ensure there is no overdue account receivable You will ensure effective, quality and accurate opportunity pipeline You will coordinate, report and feedback the market situation to sales managers You will maintain up-to-date customer/ market intelligence and capture win/ loss data You will be responsible for accurate forecast in monthly, quarterly and annual basis You will provide in-house residence expert for assigned products and business unit You will develop and execute strategy for assigned product lines and accounts You will be Involve & responsible for MTA/MBR business planning & Strategy planning. You will guide & coach the junior sales executive/support team.  To find out more about the specific business, have a look at https://www.healthcare.siemens.com/  Your qualifications and experiences:  You are an expert in exposure to customers and account management best practices You are good in creating strategic business plan, communication and presentation skills You are good in developing and creating key business opportunities together as part of a wider matrix structured digitalization team including pre-sales, consulting, customer success, and IT Professional servicing team Orchestrate and support consulting and transformation engagements as required. Develop sustainable account plans which are aligned to the changing customer environment. Build key relationships with and educate customers to help drive success in the digital transformation journey. Structure Enterprise Solution and business insight Create bespoke end-to-end digitalization solution and value proposition on a customer that meet and exceed business requirements. Work to identify and develop new solution for “land to expansion”, sometimes by working with external organisations. You have at least 3-5 years of sales experience preferably in Healthcare products and solutions in Singapore You have experience in managing customer accounts preferably in Healthcare industry. Understanding of diagnostic imaging market with sales knowledge of Singapore Healthcare market  Your personality and skills:  You are an expert in exposure to customers and account management best practices You are good in creating strategic business plan, communication and presentation skills You can build sound working relationships internally and with Customers to ensure success in this role You possess excellent communication, influencing and relationship building skills  Being part of our team:  Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. More than 53,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services.  Your cultural fit:  Our unique team spirit arises from embracing different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge conventions. Change is a constant aspect of our work. We aspire to lead the change in our industry rather than just react to it. That’s why we want you to seek, implement and celebrate your best ideas.  To all recruitment agencies: Siemens Healthineers does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, employees or any other company location. Siemens Healthineers is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes  Siemens Healthineers Singapore was awarded Gold in "Excellence in Total Rewards Strategy" & "Excellence in Retention Strategy" at the HR Excellence Awards 2020. description: Intuition is looking for a high-performing Business Development Manager to play a pivotal role in driving revenue growth and increasing market share for Intuition’s Technology business in Asia Pacific. Based in Singapore and reporting to the Global Chief Commercial Officer, Technology the Business Development Manager will be responsible for identifying new technology sales opportunities within the region, growing strategic relationships, and utilizing commercial acumen to define and maximize opportunities. This role will cover the full range of deliverables including market research, consulting with clients, solution selling, and working with both internal and external partners to ensure success.  The successful candidate will have strong sales credentials with a proven track record of success in dynamic sales environments. They will be a highly-driven self-starter with an aptitude for innovation and the ability to operate in a fast-paced environment. Excellent client-facing and communication skills are essential.  Main Duties Include Prospecting and identifying new technology sales opportunities in the Asia Pacific market. Generating new business and managing existing business. Using existing contacts within the industry to concentrate on business development and raising the profile of the Intuition technology business within the region. Solution selling, pricing and closing deals for our technology products & services including cybersecurity. Evaluating competition, analyzing the market, and thinking laterally to target opportunities for growth. Building relationships with senior managers in some of the world’s largest corporate institutions. Working to understand and solve real-world business problems for our clients by following a consultative and solution-based sales process. Working closely with the sales support and account management teams. Liaising with the Chief Commercial Officer, Technology to define opportunities and optimise solutions. Achieving personal sales targets. Overseeing the continuing development, performance and profitability of accounts. The Successful Candidate Will Be fluent in English. Be a hunter, door opener, cold caller and networker. Have proven experience in sales, ideally in solution selling within the Technology or eLearning sector. Possess exceptional personal drive and an interest in developing and pushing boundaries to introduce products and services to our clients to build revenue. Be able to work independently to meet and exceed targets. Possess excellent communication skills (written and oral), organizational skills, and attention to detail. Be able to manage and work on multiple projects simultaneously, at a fast pace and to tight deadlines. Possess an exemplary client service ethic. Have exceptional analytical skills, including the ability to produce and analyze reports to draw conclusions and make strong recommendations. Be a committed team player. A good remuneration package is on offer for the successful candidate, including a competitive commission scheme and paid holidays.  Intuition is an Equal Opportunities Employer
industries: Information Technology and Services, Management Consulting, and Financial Services

description: The Opportunity  Sitetracker is expanding into APAC following the success and continued growth of the business across North America and EMEA. We are looking for a successful Enterprise Account Executive to join our VP of APAC in this exciting, ground level opportunity to be a visible part of our expansion into the vast Asia Pacific region. Based in Singapore and responsible for the ASEAN region, you will be instrumental in building and creating something special as part of a dynamic and growing team in APAC.  The Skill Set Drive an effective sales process: source to close to attain/exceed your sales budgets Effectively articulate the benefits of Sitetracker’s software to prospective customers Evangelize and articulate the benefits of Sitetracker to prospective customers Actively prospect to supplement the lead flow provided by a dedicated team of Business Development Representatives Design and execute account plans and strategies for all target accounts Craft tailored content, including presentations, proposals and custom ROI analyses Record and document all prospect information in Salesforce CRM Within 60 Days, You'll Working with the Sales and sales leadership team, you'll gain deep knowledge of and become Sitetracker certified Develop your own presentation of the Sitetracker value proposition Work with cross functional teams to gain deeper understanding of Sitetracker's various focal industries You'll familiarize yourself with Sitetracker systems and processes Within 180 Days, You'll Be consistently building a mature pipeline Be fully ramped and conveying the Sitetracker story across your territory Be actively working and closing mid size customers Within 365 Days, You'll Be an expert in the Sitetracker solution and Sitetracker focal industries Have closed your first enterprise customer Add to the sales team's best practices in the region About Sitetracker  Sitetracker was founded seven years ago with the singular focus of solving a problem that was first recognized within the telecommunications industry; how to effectively manage the volume, variety, and velocity of critical infrastructure projects needed to meet the demand of expanding wireless and cellular service. That problem has become even more pronounced due to the eventual explosion of 5G. Being able to effectively deploy infrastructure is going to be the differentiator between leading telecommunication providers.  However, over the years, we realized that this challenge isn’t localized to telecommunications – it’s pervasive nearly everywhere and has reached an inflection point. Utilities (such as gas and electric services), smart cities, and alternative energy all face similar challenges. Sitetracker is the only full-lifecycle project management platform suited to support these companies and address these challenges.  We are exceptionally proud of the company we’ve built (we were recently recognized as the #2 place to work in San Francisco , as well as one of the top places to work in the entire United States). Our people are extraordinary and we’re continuing to invest in our people-first culture.
industries: Computer Software and Information Technology and Services

description: To manage the customer in Asia and ensure that Stepan is getting the full value out of the customer relationship through continuous growth and development as partners. This happens through challenging the status quo and selling win/win solutions. Actively communicate, safeguard and promote clients’ and team’s interest within the key account’s management team and leadership team in Asia. Covering the sales of Consumer and Functional Products. Single contributor role.  Sales Performance Sales Performance Sell Stepan products to established customers and new prospects within territory to meet KPI Develop and implement a sales strategy for identified target customers and distributors. Negotiate new contracts and/or supply agreements. Opportunity management – from identification of opportunity to commercialization. Establish a robust projects & opportunities pipeline to ensure sustainable growth for the territory  Customer Relations Make sales calls in professional manner to maintain company image and maximize sales performance. Use man-day plan as guide for time management. Establish good working relationships with key contacts with customer.  Identify and establish an in-depth relationship with key decision makers; develop a good understanding of their needs, key issues, and concerns. Visit all key customer locations as needed with the appropriate regional personnel to provide continuity across regions and to ensure a consistent message from Stepan. Coordinate all Stepan interactions with customer including management visits, R&D programs, technical service support, etc.  Market Knowledge Develop a sound understanding of the target industries including key technologies. Industry trends, market shares, etc; become recognized as an industry and territory expert. Develop a good understanding of customers business, products, manufacturing capabilities and needs, market position, culture, methods of doing business, etc. Identify and communicate customer requirements and new opportunities for our products. Develop a good understanding of our competitors and their products, strengths and weaknesses, strategic intent, etc. Become an active member and participant in key trade organizations and shows  Product Knowledge Develop an excellent understanding of Stepan’s product lines including product specifications and physical characteristics, applications, benefits, formulation requirements, etc. Develop a good understanding of end-use applications and surfactant requirements. Develop a good understanding of the competitive landscape – products, technologies, production capabilities & capacities, R&D, prices – in each market area and communicate to key internal Stepan contacts in leadership, business, R&D, etc. Develop a good understanding and utilize internal resources as appropriate. Conduct all sales activities to meet company standards for professionalism, ethics and safety. Further develop sales, marketing, and personal skills through internal development programs and external training programs.  Internal Admin Process Maintain knowledge of and follow company procedures and policies regarding pricing, deliveries, sales terms, forecasts, records, reports, use of company car, etc. Specific duties include: regular communication with sales manager, customer sales reports in CRM, monthly reports, expense reports, monthly forecast in SAP. Maintain account information and input new opportunities into Salesforce.com Review open sales orders regularly Meet sales commitments, yearly budget preparations, and provide strategic plan inputs. Work with customer service and help resolve customer service issues. Facilitate resolution of supply, quality, and pricing issues when necessary  Educational Degree Qualified, Chemistry or relevant degree preferred, Marketing Qualification advantageous At least 3 years of solid relevant working experience Experience within a sales and commercial environment. Significant experience in chemicals industry, surfactants and knowledge of the markets Requires strong interpersonal skills and teamwork Proven record of negotiation skills, and decision making
industries: Chemicals

jobTitle: Industry Strategy and Marketing Manager, Asia Pacific
description: Job Description  Rockwell Automation is hiring!  We are looking for an Industry Strategy and Marketing Manager, AP to be based in our Singapore office.  He / She is responsible to lead the Industry strategy and marketing team in development and execution of Industry Strategies (BSRs) and marketing plans for Asia Pacific focus industries in alignment with Asia Pacific and global stakeholders.  Responsibilities Oversee the development and execution of Regional Industry Strategies (BSR’s) and marketing plan in strong partnership and alignment with Asia Pacific Sales, Marketing, Industry, BU Leadership team. The BSRs and marketing plans should support the AP and subregion strategic growth priorities driving solid focus on ROI, strengthening Rockwell Automation brand and accelerating customer decision making/buying process. Ensure the execution of BSRs across AP and oversee the implementation of marketing plans in alignment with global marketing. In partnership with the Industry teams provide insight to BU's on Solution and technology gaps for Asia Pacific focus industries. Support the development and execution of AP Marketing plans in partnership with AP Marketing leadership team. Monitor and drive implementation of the Industry marketing plan, ensure adherence to budget, perform ROI analysis on all programs and launches with support from the Demand Center & Analytics team. Collaborate with global industry strategy and marketing team in global BSR and marketing programs planning and development to support AP business objectives and market opportunities; get alignment on results and lead program execution in AP. Maintain regular engagement with global, AP Industry stakeholders for BSR development and execution, marketing plan alignment and buy-in. Drive alignment and consistency of industry messaging through all programs, channels and media. Work with PR team to strengthen thought leadership and brand awareness. Monitor key regional market trends, competitive landscape and mentor team to create actionable insights and industry strategies in alignment with AP and global stakeholders that capitalize on market opportunities and drive profitable growth (short and long term). Oversee and ensure goal alignment and collaboration between Industry, Field Marketing and sales leaders on execution of industry marketing activities. Partner with wider AP marketing team to ensure alignment of initiatives which will drive meaningful business impact for the region. Coach and develop team members in development of strategies and implementation. Part of Asia Pacific Marketing leadership and be involved in key initiatives for Asia Pacific marketing team as defined. About You Bachelor’s Degree in marketing / Business Management / Engineering or equivalent. MBA Preferred 10+ years of experience working in or with a broad range of industries and associated ecosystems preferably Semiconductor, F&B, Heavy Industries, Life Sciences. Track record of developing and executing winning strategies in a B2B and multi-national environment. Well versed in key regional industry market trends and competitive landscape to identify market opportunities and areas of growth. Proven experience in leading teams to deliver new strategies or capabilities while developing, mentoring and inspiring team members in a remote and matrix organization environment. Solid business, financial and program management acumen
industries: Industrial Automation and Computer Software

This role has an interesting combined function of “hunting” and “farming” to maximum revenue. Manage and monitor the commercial performances of assigned accounts. Set up the commercial and pricing policy in agreement with the lines, business development plan, and strategies in compliance with the Group policy. Prepare visit reports/market studies and perform other tasks as required by Management. Communicate the commercial directions to the network and ensure correct application Focus on customer relationship development, establishment, and improvement Job Requirements Minimum 5 years of working experience in a commercial role in Marine/Shipping. The JD is mentioned below  Responsibilities : Manage the sales activities for our LMS platforms / L & D solutions in given geographies, including partner development, business development and implementation, and ensure the company’s annual sales targets for the Country to met Lead customer acquisition by generating leads through demand generation teams, providing online / in-person demonstrations to those leads and organizing pilots Use existing relationships to grow business to new clients and current accounts Write commercial proposals and lead commercial negotiation with clients Achieve sales goals and be able to work independently Collaborate with internal resources to drive larger sales and opportunities Undertake other promotional activities that are likely to culminate in a purchase agreement Ensure prompt collection of receivables from our customers Lead our participation in promotion events like roadshows, conferences and media showcase events Help in authoring sales and marketing collateral, including websites, promotional material, concept and case study videos, etc., Maintain strong customer relationships throughout the customer life cycle Build the DISPRZ brand  An ideal Candidate Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Sales or business management from a top B school The candidate needs to be Singaporean Citizen and have language proficiency in both English and Mandarin(speaking and writing).  5 to 7 years’ experience in B2B enterprise experience in selling SaaS Products / L & D consulting At least 2 years proven sales record in a reasonably sized market in Singapore Experience in corporate learning and development is a plus

companyName: Bray Leino Splash (formerly Splash Interactive Group)
description: A little about us…  Bray Leino Splash is a full-service digital marketing agency dedicated to combining strategy, user experience, visual design, technology and integrated work to drive tangible business results for our clients.  We’ve been in business for 19-years; headquartered in Singapore, with offices in Malaysia, Hong Kong, Shanghai and Vietnam. We work with clients throughout the Asia Pacific. From good intuitive design to innovative applications, complex backends and platforms, we combine strategy, user experience, visual design and code to ensure our Clients both navigate and thrive in an increasingly digital world.  Bray Leino Splash Interactive is also part of UK-based The Mission Marketing Group, host to 16 entrepreneurial, founder led Agencies with 25 offices that include integrated, multi-discipline, multi-sector Agencies, specialists in specific marketing/communications activities and specialists in particular market sectors.  What will I be doing? We are looking for an enthusiastic problem solver who works with clients and internal colleagues to guide, recommend and translate technical challenges into opportunities. They are the conduit between Development teams and Project/Client teams. This person is able to articulate a strong vision of technology as a means to customer value. Lastly and most importantly this person is an Excellent Communicator.  Primary Responsibilities: Provide high-level perspectives on potential business opportunities and engage with clients on how our technology offering can advance their business Work with business development / client service in Singapore, Malaysia and China to define and analyse clients’ business requirements and challenges Liaise with technical leads based in Vietnam to support Client Service in developing high quality technology solutions for proposals. Support client service in converting leads into business in a very highly competitive environment in shorter sales cycles Consult to project managers in Singapore, Malaysia and China during project implementation.  Skills Required: Fluent English and Mandarin Chinese Familiarity with web technologies/CMS Expert knowledge of MS Powerpoint Familiarity with full SDLC  Qualifications & Certifications: BS Computer Science or equivalent exp. MBA or IT Masters will be an advantage. CMS certifications will be an advantage (Sitecore, Kentico, Acquia)  Experience: Must have at least 4 years of programmer/developer experience Must have at least 4 years of technology sales support Consulting experience will be an advantage  Other Requirements: Must have Very Good verbal, written communication & presentation skills Two (2) professional references from last two assignments / projects / employments will be required if you are short listed.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

Perform transaction trades volume timely within the agreed SLA. Initiate account opening / closures / update instruction checklists and interface with client to ensure completion of documentation requirements Follow up on outstanding documentation and clients’ outstanding fee payments To provice quality and timeliness service to enchance effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams Enforce banking policies and procedures to ensure operational integrity while maintaining high client satisfaction. description: Company Introduction: Matrixport is Asia’ fastest growing one-stop digital asset financial services platform. With $10 billion in assets under management and custody, it provides one-stop crypto financial services with over $5 billion in average monthly trading volumes. The offerings include Cactus Custody™, spot OTC, fixed income, structured products, lending as well as asset management. Headquartered in Singapore, Matrixport’s mission is to make crypto easy for everyone and its motto is “Get More From Your Crypto”. The company has over 220 employees serving both institutions and retail customers in Asia and Europe.  Why Join us: At Matrixport, we believe that teamwork allows us to tackle complex challenges together. Every team player is valued, has a voice that can be heard and a contribution that can be made. You can expect to make a difference and have direct impact towards the success of the company. We seek the passionate and the courageous who can imbue their expertise into the crypto community and build a better product for the next one billion users.  Responsibilities Serve as a sales support for institutional custodian solution, highly perform technical pre-sales for digital asset custody functionality; Be engaged in client meeting, which will involve diving into the specifics of new assets, protocols & functions and determine feasibility and scope of integration difficulty before escalate the demand to development team; Have complementary technical skillset to support development and lead the product design direction; Identify market new trend, maximize pre-sales impact and influence product priorities; Coordinate and orchestrate blockchain integrations for Custody with development team; Kick off initial discussions around integration timeline and custom product needs, as well as help set expectations on scope and pricing; Identify areas for improvement and communicate these issues and possible solutions with product teams and upper management.  Qualifications Has technical related degree and previous experience as a technical consultant (3-4 years); Has experience in facing clients, sales engineering, solutions architect or implementation consulting role in technology field, or technical implementation role; Demonstrate ability to grow market shares, identify priorities, and winning patterns to maximize pre-sales impact; Ability to develop an in-depth knowledge of our technical products and services and to relate this knowledge in a way that is understandable to non-technical customers; Highly personable and good listener who can create concise recommendations after listening and assessing potential clients needs; Sensitive to the rapid change of blockchain & cryptocurrency market & knowledge of blockchain technology is a bonus; Fluency in English and Mandarin is required.
industries: Financial Services

description: As the world’s leading provider of cloud-based software and technology solutions delivered by managed service providers (MSPs), Datto believes there is no limit to what small and medium businesses can achieve with the right technology.  Collaboration, teamwork, open communication, and transparency are vital to our success. Datto motivates and empowers our employees to grow through professional development, training opportunities, and internal promotions.  As n SDR Manager At Datto, You Will  Help us create a prospecting playbook and outbound framework for our expanding APAC region. Coach and mentor an engaged team of SDRs and collaborate with global leaders to build out the future of APAC business development. This is a high visibility role with immense opportunity to make an impact, inspire and innovate.  Our Singapore office is based at Battery Road, WeWork  A Look Inside The Job Build and coach a small team of high-performing SDRs in Singapore and Australia, to prep them as our future Account Executives and Channel Managers Own and drive execution of Datto’s new business pipeline goals for APAC Make an impact as you work with global leaders to refine a robust prospecting framework to support Datto’s expansion across APAC Analyse top of the funnel metrics, pipeline quality, and revenue influenced across partner and end user segments Shape deep partnerships with global Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, Enablement, and Product Marketing teams to successfully collaborate on new campaigns, events and activities Identify opportunities to refine lead generation processes for direct and "through-partner" prospecting Lead through inspiration, service leadership, Datto values with a “We are one team” and “Always do the right thing’ approach About You Coaching and/or direct leadership experience with a track record of excellence in outbound prospecting and pipeline generation activity in a fast moving global business Ability to inspire emerging sales talent through one-to-one, and team training, coaching and development conversations Appetite to execute on a day-to-day basis and influence positive performance and productivity Have a reputation with cross-functional teams as being collaborative, innovative, accountable, and reliable Data-driven, highly analytical with the ability to lead through influence Experience leading virtually across different time zones Big picture thinker with the foresight to understand predictable revenue models and value selling philosophies Excited by attracting, recruiting, developing and retaining world-class talent early in their careers Bonus Points An understanding of typical MSP services, business models, and market Experience developing prospecting frameworks, playbooks and incentive programs Datto - A little more!  Datto offers Unified Continuity, Networking, and Business Management solutions and has created a one-of-a-kind ecosystem of MSP partners. Datto supports our partners 24/7/365. This commitment is a value at the core of every role in every office, always doing the right thing, and putting our customers first.  Benefits  At Datto, we’re committed to cultivating a healthy, positive and growth enabling environment. We are proud of our wide ranging benefits package which is available to all full-time employees, including: “Datto University” virtual on-boarding program EAP (Employee Assistance Program) LinkedIn Learning Headspace App Employee Resource Groups (Datto Culture, Datto Familia, Datto Pride, Women in Tech) Charity match program Education reimbursement Datto is an equal opportunity employer.  By submitting an application, you acknowledge we will process your data in order to consider you for the position you apply for and for other open positions within our company for which you may be suited. We collect and store your data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Practices.  Note: Only candidates who are Singapore Citizens or hold perm residency will be considered.
industries: Computer Networking, Computer Software, and Information Technology and Services

description: ADVANCE.AI is a leading AI and big data company in Asia, helping to solve digital transformation, fraud prevention and process automation for enterprise clients. Launched in 2016 and headquartered in Singapore, We combine deep local market knowledge with superior Al technology. We are experts in natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision and help our clients with chatbots, anti-fraud, facial recognition, e-KYC, and optical character recognition (OCR). Currently, we partner over 1,000 enterprise clients across Southeast Asia, South Asia and Mexico in sectors such as banking, financial services, fintech, payment, retail and e-commerce. ADVANCE.AI was ranked No. 5 on LinkedIn’s 2020 Top Startups List in Singapore. As part of the Advance Intelligence Group, an Al-driven technology company with over 1500+ employees in 12 markets worldwide, we are united by a shared vision and purpose: to Advance with Intelligence for a Better Life--for our customers, colleagues and communities. Our culture is built on values that are core to who we are and what we stand for: We foster an INNOVATION mindset We achieve results with EFFICIENCY and excellence We take pride in the QUALITY of our work We uphold INTEGRITY in all we do We embrace COLLABORATION to work across business lines and borders  We’re looking for a Channels Partnership Manager to join our high performing team in Singapore.  Job Responsibilities Identify and acquire new partners (SIs and Reseller), and maintain a strict cadence to drive revenue with and through partner relationships. Establish and maintain exceptional partner relationships with the necessary partner stakeholders for the purpose of designing and executing initiatives to develop, manage and drive revenue growth. Identify target opportunities with the partners to complement and expand the reach and attractiveness of the company’s platform solution. Drive partner adoption by engaging with high-level executives and strategic thinkers across an organization. Understand partners’ end markets, and use competitive insights to create actionable partner plans and leverage/extend product nuances into strategic recommendations to deliver success within vertical markets. Assist in the development and delivery of sales, technical, and solutions training to ensure partner stakeholders are well equipped to effectively market, position and sell it as an integrated solution. Collaborate closely with sales and business development team and internal stakeholders across the organization to assist in the successful execution of key initiatives with our partnerships, frequently leading or assisting sales teams in customer/prospect discussions with our strategic partners. Build & execute business plans for establishing key partnerships to support revenue growth objectives; negotiating corporate-wide agreements with these strategic partners.  Job Requirements Minimum 10 years of enterprise software/IT sales, partnerships and channels/alliances experience (enterprise software required) with regional exposure in South East Asia countries. Proven track record of sales quota overachievement. Demonstrated people management experience of a partnership/sales team. Proven track record of developing complex repeatable technology solutions with large enterprise accounts. Proven ability to manage complex sales cycles. Demonstrated ability to recognize, analyze, and execute on small and large-scale enterprise-wide business opportunities. Strong leadership and teamwork skills. Ability to differentiate and successfully position new, disruptive solutions. Ability to participate effectively in cross-functional teams and work well in a matrixed management environment, including; Sales, Business Development, Pre-Sales Engineer, and Post-Sales Consulting.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Company Description  GrowthDesk is a Marketing Automation platform built for Small to Medium-sized businesses. Through its 2 flagship brands, DREA for Real Estate and SKALE for Retail, we empower our small to medium-sized businesses with a powerful and easy to use platform that allows them to easily and effectively automate their marketing.  Job Description  We are looking for an experienced growth-oriented marketer who has well-rounded experience across different marketing verticals, with deep knowledge in customer acquisition and growth marketing.  You will work closely with the CEO to grow SKALE as a SAAS business. The ideal candidate will be a hands-on and passionate marketer who is ready to join a fast-paced high-growth startup.  Your Responsibilities Will Also Include Lead a team of 2-4 to drive customer acquisition, activation and new monetisation opportunities Conceptualize, plan and implement plans for user acquisition in individual markets through inbound, outbound, partner channels Collaborate closely with Customer Success, Dev Team, Creatives , Digital Marketing and other stakeholders to design and execute growth initiatives Utilise data-driven insights to optimise the sales process, drive customer acquisition and customer retention; and identify upsell opportunities Plan and implement initiatives to get customer feedback using surveys, questionnaires, etc Qualifications  Key Requirements: Broad knowledge in 360 marketing A deep understanding of various customer acquisition channels, e.g., search engine results, paid ads, email referrals, organic traffic, social media referrals, etc. Fluent in data analysis and data processing tools like analytics tools, data visualization tools, A/B testing tools, Excel, etc. Analytical and data-driven, and enjoying working iteratively and experimenting Experience with ad management tools like Facebook Ads Manager, Google Adwords, etc. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Resourceful, proactive, and have growth mindset At least 5 years and above of relevant professional experience Additional Information  The Offer Work with a team that believes in cultivating growth mindset in each and every team member A role that offers a breadth of learning opportunities and a highly collaborative environment A flat hierarchy and with a high level of autonomy We believe in a happy work environment and culture!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: iObeya is an adventure that has been scaling for 10 years. Our secret : a startup mindset, 110 passionate individuals offering their best in an intensely collaborative and fulfilling environment that stimulates innovation.  In 10 years, iObeya's Digital Visual Management solutions have already won over more than 400 large companies in all industries, and 500,000 daily users in more than 30 countries. Based on Lean and Agile practices, iObeya revolutionizes performance management by providing executives, managers and operators a real-time visual cockpit for all departments of an organization. Today, our goal is to become the international leader in Enterprise Visual Management.  We are opening a new office in Singapore, and we are looking for a Sales Manager to participate in our adventure !   Key responsibilities : Reporting to the General Manager, you will : Create and drive revenue for the territory of Singapore and neighboring countries (Taiwan, China, Korea, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia…) Manage the entire sales cycle with the support of a local Presales Consultant and a remote corporate team : qualification, product demonstration (remotely or face-to-face with the prospect), proposal, negotiation, contracts and deal closure Be a trusted advisor to customer sponsors and executives, with a consultative sales approach that focuses on understanding, analyzing and solving customer challenges and delivering value Define and implement a clear vision and business plan for your territory and accounts, communicate status regularly to management to replicate success, and identify challenges and resource requirements Actively work with the corporate Marketing team to build lead generation campaigns Rigorously manage sales administration and forecasting, including regular use of CRM (Salesforce) Represent iObeya at trade shows and conferences Depending on the results, the position will evolve into a role of Sales Director, with the recruitment and management of a sales team and the expansion of the territory    Required skills include : Minimum of 10 years B2B sales experience in the software or IT sector Fluency in English Strong oral and written communications skills using phone, email and web conferencing Entrepreneurial attitude, self-driven personality, flexible, hard working, creative with high quality standards Willing to operate in a non-traditional sales compensation structure that emphasizes team achievements over individual performance  Additional valued skills : Knowledge of Lean and/or Agile Management and Visual Management Fluency in French and Chinese  iObeya is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing a safe and equitable working environment. Any offer of employment will be contingent on the successful completion of a background check. We value honesty, transparency, teamwork, and a philosophy that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. We focus on people, collaboration, and enthusiasm: all team members share in the success of the company regardless of their position or title. Join us now ! ------------------------------ Position to be filled immediately in Singapore. Send your application (Motivational letter and CV) to jobs.sales.singapore@iobeya.com

description: MAIN PURPOSE  Reporting to the Brand Director based in Singapore, the Brand Manager is responsible for leading and managing Japanese brands IPSA, The Ginza and BAUM in the Travel Retail (TR), working with two key TR regions at present i.e. Shiseido Travel Retail Asia and Japan. Other TR regions (EMEA, Americas) will depend on the brands’ future expansion plans. The role requires the experience to:  Accelerate IPSA, one of the fastest growing skincare brands in the Shiseido TR - Leverage its unique brand proposition of minimalism and customisation of a skincare recipe best suited for the individual, to target the post-90’s consumer.  Develop The Ginza, the uber-lux brand within Shiseido TR - Build brand equity and the distribution of this high-performing minimalist tailor-made skincare brand targeting the discerning and affluent consumer.  Launch BAUM, a new brand which focuses on “the power of trees”. Based on the concept of “coexistence with nature”, valued by Japanese people for centuries, the brand aims to realize a sustainable society that fully embraces the blessings of trees and preserves them for the future.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Brand Holder Key Reference You are responsible for acting as a key point with the Brand Holders and other internal and external stakeholders on the subsequent steps: Adapting and implementing the brand strategy as defined with Brand Director Liaising with Brand Holders for TR-related developments (TREX,360 activation campaigns and expansion plans)  Brand Marketing Strategy You are responsible for developing, implementing and executing 360 marketing initiatives and activities for the brands: Defining short- and long-term brand strategy (in collaboration with the regions) based on consumer and market insights, commercial analysis and distribution opportunities Building realistic, yet innovative 360 plans taking into account competition, sales performance, trends and cost aspects, & regional specificities Developing TR exclusive concepts and implementation plans in collaboration with internal stakeholders as well as external agencies  Brand Foundation Set up the foundation of the different brands when it comes to launches and expansion in TR, including defining processes, guidelines and best practices.  Business Analysis Beyond being responsible for the marketing strategies by brand, you are also in charge of managing and monitoring the brand P&L, monthly sales and market share performance, ROI measurements for marketing and digital activities, and identifies short- and long-term market growth opportunities by: Working with regional marketing, sales, demand planning, finance teams and Brand Holders to develop brand KPIs and measure results Delivering results for the brand level P&L focusing on retail sales, net sales and brand contribution  REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degree in marketing or equivalent At least 6 years of relevant experience and prior experience in cosmetics/ beauty/ retail industry will have an advantage Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written Ability to steer and drive the collaboration amongst the various stakeholders to achieve the brands’ objectives Commercially sound with experiences in launching new brands/ development brands with a good understanding of profit and loss accounting, sell-in/ sell out analysis, ROI calculation and the influence of operating factors e.g., volume vs price Creative and able to think big and act in detail Excellent organisation skill, able to prioritise Solution orientated, decisive by nature and resourceful in the approach A collaborative team player – concerned with the team success as well as individual performance Strong interpersonal skill - good listener, will challenge constructively and respond well to feedback Self-starter - high energy levels with positive and a collaborative can do mentality
industries: Cosmetics

description: An exciting opportunity exists in the newly merged OneFootball and Dugout organizations to develop and grow the SEA sales revenues. Reporting directly into the APAC. General Manager, you will be expected to utilize existing business relationships, as well as develop new ones across the media and sports industry to educate them about the OneFootball proposition and to provide appropriate solutions to clients’ challenges. Your day-to-day responsibilities will have you working closely with agencies (Media/Sports Marketing).  Tasks Develop appropriate solutions for our brands and advertisers utilizing audiences across the OneFootball App, the OneFootball Video Network and our social platforms to help brands and advertisers achieve their goals. Utilize existing relationships and develop new ones at relevant media agencies, sports marketing agencies, and clients to unlock revenue opportunities. Establish client’s objectives, create appropriate sales responses, pitch, effectively manage your day-to-day business relationships and ensure salesforce is kept up to date. Meet and exceed quarterly/annual regional revenue targets. Work with the GM, APAC to structure and execute appropriate trade agreements with agencies and strategically important clients. Forge strong internal relationships with our clubs, publishers, editorial, social, legal and marketing teams to maximize sales opportunities. Requirements Successful and proven track record in media sales. An established network of industry contacts with local and regional media agency planning teams, media agency trade desks, sports sponsorship agencies and clients direct. A proven ability of successfully interpreting a client’s objectives, creating an aligned response and presenting. A strong understanding of the digital media industry and trends within both the football and the sports industry. Experience of selling to local and regional agency teams across the SEA territory. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Competent PowerPoint/KeyNote skills. An ambitious, entrepreneurial and proactive mindset. A team player. Excellent written and verbal skills in English; a second language is beneficial. Experience of selling sport/football is preferable. Experience of using Salesforce is preferable. Love of football or sport in general is a bonus. OneFootball strives for a healthy and safe workplace and is committed to building diverse teams.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: About Temenos  We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.  We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.  Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!  THE ROLE  The purpose of this role is to maximize lead generation and progression of leads through the sales funnel, ultimately increasing revenue potential from marketing programs. This role will require close collaboration with the broader marketing team (regional & global) and also sales colleagues in the field to support developing qualified opportunities and meeting monthly and quarterly targets.  A potential career progression & growth for successful Inside Sales Executives would be a transition into Account Management/ Territorial Sales roles hence it is imperative for this individual to have natural passion and flair to connect with people and enjoy the intricacy of influencing and overturn sales objections.  Key Responsibilities  Pro-actively building & sustaining connection and network via virtual & digital tools (Mobile, VC, Social Media, EDM etc.) with existing and new customers to remotely influence customers at senior level with focus to develop opportunities and to cross-sell Market research and using tools like sales navigator to identify potential client targets. Active follow-up on targeted marketing campaigns to deliver incremental high quality sales leads. Manage & influence the sales leads through to conversion to qualified status. Develop and test demand generation scripts based on briefings for specific sales and marketing campaigns, appropriately capturing value proposition and delivering required results. Maintain strong and effective working relationships with regional sales, pre-sales and the broader marketing team. Adhered to sales and marketing processes & updates to ensure Clients’ contact database are well maintained, robust lead generation and efficient operational measurement and reporting. Work with regional marketing management to ensure integrity, validity and appropriateness of marketing database. Develop and maintain strong knowledge of leading industry trends by reading the financial and country specific press and appropriate industry websites. Maintain a consistently high call rate aimed at exceeding monthly and quarterly ‘meeting’ and ‘opportunity’ targets of both customer accounts and new business focused on developing opportunities and cross-selling the client base.  Skills & Experience  Degree holder in Computer Science, Business Studies, Marketing or related preferred. 2 years’ experience in a similar role preferably in software company or in any B2B internal sales roles Highly motivated and results oriented with a can-do entrepreneurial spirit. High energy and determination to achieve/exceed monthly targets. Proven influencing skills using written, and verbal communication including telephone. Strong presentation, communication, organization, multitasking, and time management skills. Solid problem solving and consultative skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced team sales environment with minimum supervision. Experience with MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and One other Asian language would be a plus for regional work purpose coverage (Eg: Mandarin/ Malay/ / Indonesian/ Tagalog/ Vietnamese)  WHY TEMENOS  You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day. You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best. You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises. You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity. You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients. You will experience what we call – Temenosity!  We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.  Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe.  Position Summary  The Technical Account Manager (TAM) works as liaison between STERIS Life Sciences, our local channel partner (distributor) and our end Customers in Singapore and South East Asia (SEA) in order to promote the sale, application, and support of our contamination control product offering. Working both independently as well as closely with the local distributor, the TAM will meet directly with Customers to promote the full range of Life Sciences consumable product offering in the pharmaceutical, biotech and cosmetic industries. Utilizing their strong business acumen, selling skills, and technical knowledge, the TAM will act as a bridge from the Customer to STERIS and ensure that the end Customer receives excellent service throughout the entire sales cycle. This role is critical in increasing our Customers’ trust, confidence, and reliance on STERIS throughout Singapore and SEA.  Duties  Sales (60%) Achieve assigned monthly, quarterly, and yearly sales quota for assigned sales territory. Identifies and proactively seeks out valid sales opportunities with new and existing Customers but not limited to, Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Medical Device, and Research accounts to focus activities. Develops strong long-term business relationships with Customer base and STERIS’s Singaporen and SEA distributor. Provides high level of service to Customers, including timely and accurate responses to inquiries, and to maintain/build STERIS reputation in the marketplace. Develop and maintain sound business relations with customers as well as internal cross-functional teams such as Customer Service, Marketing, Technical, and Field Sales. Communicates leads to appropriate Account Managers/Sales Managers in other territories. Evaluates non-routine complaints from Customers and takes appropriate action to bring to resolution. Represents STERIS in a professional and ethical manner according to the STERIS Code of Business Conduct. Duties - cont'd  Technical (30%) Presents STERIS Life Sciences consumable to pharmaceutical and biotech manufacturers. Consults with Customers and evaluates needs in order to recommend, sell and support innovative solutions and ensure Customer satisfaction. Understand and articulate product features and how they apply to given customer requirements and needs. Utilize product knowledge to provide customer solution. Maintains current knowledge of industry and market trends as well as technical knowledge and understanding of products and services. Attends educational workshops, reviewing professional publications and participating in professional societies. Educates Customers in the area of cleaning and contamination control. Business/Administrative (10%) Communicates regularly with STERIS management, Customers, and local distributor in order to support their needs. Must be able to identify needs, articulate those to management, and justify potential solutions with a business case. Provides competitor “intelligence” to marketing and operations functions and other duties as assigned. Provides timely reporting of activities in order to measure progress against goals. Education Degree Bachelor's Degree in Biological Science or Science Required Experience Minimum 3-5 years working for a pharmaceutical manufacturer in a technical role with degree; Specific experience in cleaning validation, disinfectant validation, contamination control, product quality, technical services or manufacturing experience preferred. Experience selling technical products/services in Singapore and S.E.A region preferred. Experience in the production of oral solid dosage forms and biopharmaceuticals preferred. Demonstrated track record of achieving or exceeding sales goals. Skills Technical and business communication, both written and verbal in English; technical vocabulary required. Excellent interpersonal, written, verbal, analytical and formal presentation skills, with ability to interact effectively across all levels of the organization, as well as with Customers. Willingness to travel 30% approximately international travel for business purpose. Strong understanding of Customer and market dynamics and requirements in Singapore and S.E.A, with demonstrated ability to expand existing Customer relationships as well as develop new ones. Ability to work in a self-directed capacity, adapt to change, and set priorities and balance sales and administrative duties. Strong business acumen, with ability to understand and monitor trends, maintain and develop knowledge and apply that knowledge to effectively influence sales. Excellent computer skills, including strong experience with Microsoft Outlook and Office Suite. STERIS is a leading provider of products and services that meet the needs of growth areas within Healthcare: procedures, devices, vaccines and biologics. We exist to fulfill our MISSION TO HELP OUR CUSTOMERS CREATE A HEALTHIER AND SAFER WORLD. STERIS is a $3B, publicly traded (NYSE: STE) company with approximately 16,000 associates and Customers in more than 100 countries.  STERIS strives to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
industries: Medical Devices and Hospital & Health Care

description: Ready to Surge?  Surge Advertising is looking to hire talented individuals for a wide range of roles as we continue to expand. We are seeking highly motivated, confident and creative individuals with experience and a passion for growth. We are looking for team players with the ability to maintain a high degree of professionalism. Positions are currently remote but may have the potential to transition to in-office if desired.  Company Description  Surge Advertising is a digital marketing agency that specializes in lead generation. Our team of experts knows the industry's ins and outs, developing effective strategies for both local and international clientele. With over $90 million in trackable sales since 2019, we have a proven track record for generating leads for our clients.  We generate leads for our clients by leveraging digital marketing techniques, including SEO, SEM, content marketing, social media advertising, email campaigns, mobile advertising and more.  Our approach to lead generation is different from most agencies. We take a data-driven approach to our campaigns and work with all of the top tools available at any given time to ensure we are constantly working on the newest and best marketing techniques.  Programme Outline:  You will begin a 1-week programme with training and activities led by our training I/C. You will familiarise yourself with our company's SOP. You will identify your personal goals and discover how your journey with us can help you achieve them. Following your induction, you will be part of a 3-6 months job rotation into 2 of our core departments: Market Acquisition and Advertising. Not only will you become highly competent in acquiring customers locally and internationally, but you will also become a high-performance marketer being proficient in helping customers achieve higher profit margins with your strategies. At the end of your 3-6 months rotation, you can decide to specialize in either of these departments. You will also be assigned to take on new responsibilities or projects as you continue your career with us.  Requirements  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Entrepreneurial spirit Leadership and teamwork skills Project management skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Good interpersonal and social skills Problem-solving and analytical skills Focused and goal-oriented Written and oral fluency in English and Mandarin Work from home   P.S We're also here to help you with your biggest ideas. We'll groom and teach you the skills and provide resources needed for entrepreneurship -and you'll always be part owner in any business or project we incubate under our holdings group too.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: ·       Direct sales to global/regional/local enterprise customers in accordance with the Colt business plan. To be involved in all sales steps from development of sales opportunities, proposal submission, negotiation to order acquisition (delivery) for domestic, regional and global opportunities. This covers data services such as, but not limited to Metro Ethernet, Leased Line, Internet, Global connectivity, Cloud access, SDWAN and other services. ·        Responsible for developing sales opportunities, submitting proposals and negotiating terms and conditions to order acquisition (delivery) of enterprise customers. ·        Conduct solution sales to address customers’ business issues. ·        Prepare and propose customized sales models to meet individual customers’ requirements in cooperation with solution partners (IT vendors, etc) as required. ·        Based on Colt business plan, prepare and update account development plans, take sales actions and make reports. ·        Build and maintain good working relationships with such internal teams as Solutions, Financial, System & Technology, Operations & delivery, and take necessary actions. ·        Build relationships with customers’ C level management.   QUALIFICATION:  ·        University Graduate or above ·        Experience in hunter-type selling with rich experience in developing new customer base ·        +5-8 years of experience at a telecom carrier with excellent sales experience developed through direct sales to enterprise customers ·        Professional Pipeline and Forecast-management ·        Strong Qualification skills ·        Independent, good at self-management and time management   INTERPERSONAL:  ·        Energetic and take initiatives proactively ·        Communication skills, detailed oriented ·        Adaptability ·        Independent ·        Self-Driven ·        Results Oriented

description: X0PA AI is an Artificial Intelligence Software as a Service (SaaS) start-up that aims to digitally transform the hiring process. We aim to save companies significant time and cost in hiring while achieving the highest level of objectivity, ultimately enhancing retention, loyalty and person to job and organization fit. Through our AI and Machine Learning capabilities, we are able to source, score and rank talent to identify the best talent for each organisation. X0PA AI has recently launched X0PA ROOM, an AI enabled video interview platform with AI capabilities.  Brief Overview Of The Role  As an Inside Sales Manager, you will be responsible for the global sales of X0PA’s solutions, managing all aspects of the customer lifecycle. You will be responsible for driving the sales and revenue for X0PA's solutions globally. You will be responsible for targeting new organisations to increase the awareness and usage adoption of X0PA's solutions. You may also be responsible for handling renewals of existing clients as well as up-selling new opportunities.  This is a fantastic opportunity to work hands on with a high performing team in an AI based, innovative, fast-moving, funded start-up.  We are looking for candidates with the right attitude, drive & curiosity and we value that over any educational qualifications. If you are highly driven, looking to grow with a high performing start-up environment, WE WANT YOU!  Key Responsibilities Generate sales leads with new clients Identify key influencers and decision makers at target companies and convince them on the benefits of our solutions Comfortable with selling B2B solutions and SaaS solutions Conduct product demonstrations Drive product subscriptions and sales Manage end to end sales processes, including negotiating and closing clients Take ownership of creating your sales plan and achieving your sales targets Create presentation and marketing materials independently as required Perform cost-benefit analysis Ongoing reporting on sales metrics and forecasts Recommend improvements and features based on customer feedback 5-7 years of sales experience with a proven sales track record in driving subscriptions Experience in selling B2B/SaaS or Technololgy solutions Knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and HR tech solutions will be an added advantage Comfortable with interacting with VP and C-level executives Excellent negotiation and communication skills Oral and written fluency in English Experience and/or comfortable with cold calling Highly result oriented, go-getter and a team player Highly self-motivated with a strong ambition to excel and achieve results Great interpersonal skills to liaise with key stakeholders including VP/C level executives Adaptable working style and comfortable with ambiguity Comfortable with technology systems and internet applications What we offer?  We are a bunch of fun loving, self-motivated professionals. We offer an inclusive, diverse and motivated work environment with huge learning opportunities.

Responsibilities Define and prioritise market segments with the brand and sales teams to deliver optimal placement of brands and pack types according to sub-trade channel potential, size and consumer profile Develop trade and sales kits to ensure Picture of Success execution at the Point-of-Purchase. Conduct market visits and working closely with Off-Trade sales teams Co-formulate trade marketing strategies and objectives, working closely with brand and sales teams to ensure timely execution of activities Plan to achieve positive marketing ROI, initiate execution with the sales teams to remain on-course to meet key corporate objectives of Market Share, Net Sales Revenue and EBIT Work closely with 3rd party advertising, events and point-of-sale agencies to achieve optimal value for our brands Prepare joint trade promotional plan of key account customers Track competitor activities and recommend action steps Coordinate communication of price, pack and product changes Manage Nielsen database via Answers Platform and provide evaluation and recommendation Monitor and provide updates of volume performance by channel  Requirements Minimum Diploma / Degree (Marketing or Business) Minimum 6 years of relevant Modern Trade Experience in either Sales or Trade Marketing Required to travel within Singapore to conduct night market visits and work during weekends of peak periods Proficient in MS Office applications (i.e. Words, Excel, Power Point & Outlook)  Analyse market data (Sg Customs, AC Nielsen, Internal Sales Data) Excellent communication and presentation skills in English  Job Details Workplace Zhongshan Park, Singapore  Job type Permanent  Part time / Full time Full Time  Working Time Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm  We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
