description: Apply Here For Expedited Consideration If You Are Being Directed to a Third Party Site: https://matterport.com/careers/  Matterport is leading the digital transformation of the built world. Our groundbreaking spatial computing platform turns buildings into data making every space more valuable and accessible. Millions of buildings in more than 150 countries have been transformed into immersive Matterport digital twins to improve every part of the building lifecycle from planning, construction, and operations to documentation, appraisal, and marketing.  We’re excited to announce that Matterport is now publicly listed on NASDAQ as MTTR. It’s an exciting time to join us!  Visit our Matterport Comparably Profile to learn more about working at Matterport and the awards we have won for being a Great Place to Work!  Matterport is looking to hire a Partner Manager - Business Development to play a critical role in developing and executing on a platform partnership strategy focused on driving Matterport adoption and usage within key vertical markets The Business Development team drives partnerships and strategic initiatives that play an outsized role in differentiating and scaling Matterport’s platform and business. We work closely with external partners and across functions to identify, execute, and manage technology partnerships and product integrations, fostering a thriving ecosystem that delivers new innovation and lasting customer value. As a member of this entrepreneurial and results-oriented team, you will have an opportunity to influence and scale Matterport’s game-changing partnerships and the critical programs and systems that enable and support them.  As a Partner Manager, you will manage all aspects of our platform partner relationships as well as help to develop new ones. You will carefully cultivate and maintain relationships with our partners as their main point of contact to develop launch strategies, advocate on their behalf to help drive business, analyze trends and work with internal departments to create long-lasting partnerships.  What You Will Do Proactively manage our Technology and Platform Partners, ensuring their success with us and checking in with them regularly. Be a trusted advisor with our commercial partners by deeply understanding their business and aligning their needs and Matterport’s. Find compelling ways for our customers to utilize and leverage Matterport platform partner solutions and work with our internal sales team to realize these opportunities. Reliably forecast partner business and sales expectations Deliver the best partner experience by working internally with cross-departmental teams, such as Customer Success, Marketing, and Support. Seize joint marketing opportunities with partners and work closely with Marketing to realize them. Be the voice of our partners: streamline the communication between our partners and our internal teams to hit goals and win together. Represent partners internally and Matterport externally with partners’ management teams and at industry events Work closely with the Business Development team to explore and create new partnerships/channels for our growth Own and champion our ecosystem terms (partnership tiers, commercial terms, etc.). Who You Are BS/BA degree in a technically related field or equivalent MBA or a JD is a plus BS/BA degree. 2+ years of experience in relationship management, business development, or equivalent role, with experience working directly with external partners and internal cross-functional teams. 4+ years of business development experience at enterprise SaaS companies, with experience working directly with senior leaders internally and external partners. Proven ability to operate in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment, providing thought leadership and market context to drive consensus and reach key decisions. Strong analytical skills with the ability to build strategy, frameworks around, and optimize partnerships using a metrics-driven approach. Demonstrated experience in drafting term sheets and negotiating complex, multi-faceted, and sometimes first-in-kind partnerships. Ability to financially model and project returns on new initiatives and efforts. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including strong presentation skills. Strong personal initiative with proven ability to execute with little supervision and adapt to a fast-paced, constantly changing environment. Conversant in Japanese and/or experience working in Japan ad added advantage. We want to hear from you! We are looking to build the best team of people who will be empowered to do their best work. If you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily meet every bullet in the job description we encourage you to apply.  Matterport is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.  For more information regarding how Matterport collects and uses personal information, please review our Privacy Policies. https://matterport.com/privacy-policy
industries: Computer Software, Computer Hardware, and Internet

description: Key responsibilities of the role: We are looking for an experienced Regional Sales Director in Singapore to develop and grow our portfolio in Singapore as we continue to rapidly grow across global markets and expand our enterprise presence in the APAC region. The role will require the individual to build and grow corporate accounts across Japan. The person must have a strong understanding of the leadership & talent development landscape in the region. They should have experience delivering over $1-2m/year in sales and must be well networked across HR and L&D professionals.   Key Skills and Experience: Over 7 years of corporate sales (B2B sales), with a background in Executive Education or HR/L&D Consulting or practice with minimum US$1-2m/year in sales contributed as an individual. Strong understanding of how to approach, position talent & leadership development conversations with CHROs, L&D & HR professionals as well as Business/C-suite. Well networked and connected across the L&D/CLO and HR/CHRO fraternity. Tenured relationships across leading companies local, MNCs and Public / Government sector. Strong communication and presentation skills – adept at developing, pitching and closing large deals. Gravitas to pitch to CXOs, CHROs, CLOs/L&D Heads. Ability to develop and position winning proposals to corporate clients. Experience and working knowledge of CRM tools like HubSpot, Salesforce. Strong knowledge of marketing & positioning across the region to help build and deliver a robust pipeline for growth. Experience working for a global company also a plus.

description: Role Summary  * This position is responsible for participating in the establishment of the sales organization. * This position is responsible for setting local sales targets and monitoring the progress of those targets through active collaboration with different functions.  Job Description * Define the detail sales process for establishing a sales organization and support the establishment of relevant system infrastructure * Establish the organization's work guidelines through the detailed sales process * Set up the procedures for Finance, Insurance, COE Auction, Vehicle Registration and Delivery, and review collaboration of 3rd party partners * Support sales IT system development (define requirements, find local collaborative partners, etc.) * Develop and plan short-and-long term domestic sales targets (monthly, quarterly, annual and more) * Assess the local sales trends, market developments, and implement informed sales objectives * Continuously monitor and analyze Singaporean automotive market trend and competitors to derive our response strategies and to form a collaborative process with related units * Monitor, track and manage domestic sales objectives by working closely with Sales personnel * Act as department spokesperson and present company's sales planning when required at regional and national sales meetings * Assist sales consultants by planning COE package and operation strategy (using big data COE prediction model/system) * Work closely with Product & Marketing division and Channel Strategy team to align overall sales strategy * Coordinate with Product & Marketing Division to ensure that marketing campaigns align with the description: Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn’t about conforming to somebody else’s ideal. It’s about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.  We are looking for Commercial Retail Excellence Analyst is newly created role based in Singapore, to support the strategic revenue management priorities in Asia Pacific.  This role is a trusted business partner to the South East Asia Affiliate & Distributor markets to manage the retail and commercial business in all its present channels from the key parameters pricing strategy, performance analysis and monitoring by channel and door and other key performance indicators relative to the market and expectation.  To ensure alignment to the regional strategic revenue management priorities, the role will also have a matrix reporting line into the regional business intelligence & commercial excellence team to project and manage the pricing strategy in Asia Pacific.  The role requires a strong commercial and collaborative profile, who can operate independently and influence stakeholders to drive business change and make an impact.  Key Responsibilities  South East Asia & Distribution Markets – Business Partner (75%) Supported by VP Sales, South East Asia & Distributor Markets Portfolio controlling Pricing manager for South East Asia & Distributor Markets Business analyst to review monthly business performance & quarterly market performance  Asia Pacific Strategic Revenue Management – Pricing Manager (25%) Supported by Sr Director Business Intelligence & Commercial Excellence, Asia Pacific Annual pricing review with close collaboration with global and local markets Pricing strategy across brands, markets and go to market channels Pricing strategy of innovations   You should have the following experiences Commercial (or professional / consulting) experience is preferred in the beauty or Luxury/Retail industry Excellent communicator (both verbally and in writing), action oriented, can-do personality Strong organizational and project management skills, familiar with managing process flow and global reporting Systems experience in ERP (SAP) and Business Intelligence Tools (Power BI) Agility in managing relationships with senior management High levels of collaboration and with a strong teamwork ethic Enthusiasm, passion, and knowledge of the beauty industry
industries: Cosmetics, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Sales Manager, Singapore - Performance  Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions until further notice. We will adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.  Who are we and What do we do? InMobi Group’s mission is to power intelligent, mobile-first experiences for enterprises and consumers. Its businesses across advertising, marketing, data and content platforms are shaping consumer experience in a world of connected devices. InMobi Group has been recognized on both the 2018 and 2019 CNBC Disruptor 50 list and as one of Fast Company’s 2018 World’s Most Innovative Companies.  What’s the InMobi family like?   Consistently featured among the “Great Places to Work” since 2017, our culture is our true north, enabling us to think big, solve complex challenges and grow with new opportunities. InMobians are passionate and driven, creative and fun-loving, take ownership and are results focused. We invite you to free yourself, dream big and chase your passion.  What do we promise? We offer an opportunity to have an immediate impact on the company and our products. The work that you shall do, will be critical for optimizing tech operations alongside working with highly capable and ambitious peer groups.  The Challenge: Your mission will be to manage and develop a solid revenue stream from leading regional performance & digital first clients. Digital first defined as travel, ecommerce, gaming, banking and finance, insurance or any other category which has an outcome-based media approach.  Take responsibility for growing Inmobi Performance business from large regional performance advertisers Build and maintain an ongoing relationship with digital marketing / growth marketing teams across digital first clients based in the region Work towards attainable quarterly sales targets and meet/ exceed these goals. Work in partnership with dedicated performance account managers to successfully deliver results on client campaign objectives Build, track and manage an active sales pipeline to achieve quarterly sales targets and build a broad base of repeat advertisers. Provide market intelligence on market dynamics and competitive landscape to sustain regional business growth. Represent Inmobi in Indonesia across clients, events & Marketing ecosystem.  What we need from you: Digital media sales experience 5 + years, including at least 2 years selling outcome-based campaigns A network of strong relationships and an excellent reputation with large digital first clients in the region Senior client relationships -including, Digital Lead, Head of Growth is an added advantage An understanding of the programmatic advertising, working with DSP platforms is an added advantage Ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines Demonstrated experience generating leads and closing new business Experience achieving group goals; and not fazed by targets or metrics Experience generating revenue against personal targets (and love smashing them!)  Disclaimer: The duties and responsibilities described above is not a comprehensive list and additional tasks may be assigned to the employee from time to time. The scope of the job may change as necessitated by business requirements.   Why Join Us? You will contribute to creating disruptive and innovative consumer experiences using technology. We value autonomy, collaboration, technical innovation, and results-oriented thinking. InMobi’s culture is all about rewarding excellence so there are fantastic opportunities for the right candidates!
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: About AVEVA AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software, driving digital transformation and sustainability. By connecting the power of information and artificial intelligence with human insight, AVEVA enables teams to use their data to unlock new value. We call this Performance Intelligence. AVEVA’s comprehensive portfolio enables more than 20,000 industrial enterprises to engineer smarter, operate better and drive sustainable efficiency. AVEVA supports customers through a trusted ecosystem that includes 5,500 partners and 5,700 certified developers around the world. The company is headquartered in Cambridge, UK, with over 6,500 employees and 90 offices in over 40 countries. Learn more at www.aveva.com.  We take pride in our core values and the diversity of our people, valuing the unique experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.  At AVEVA, we’re all about Limitless possibilities. Are you?  What do we stand for? When you work for AVEVA you work for a company focused on its people. We are proud to promote diversity, inclusion and work-life integration – we’re a great place to work but we are continually striving to be the best place to work!   ABOUT THE ROLE Drive sales operations for Southern Asia sales functions, establishing measurements, methods, and tools to enhance sales productivity from strategic planning to tactical execution by function and market.  Sales operations is a high-performing, business critical and increasingly strategic function that supports the sales organization to create an environment for sales success. The function directs the sales organization and drives investment in sales force effectiveness, managing the functions essential to deliver sales force productivity and performance.   Responsibilities: • Partner with the VP of sales, their leadership team and regional sales operations leads to effectively align & embed the rhythm of the business, managing sales leadership team’s cadence of review and planning activities throughout the fiscal year. • Ensure planning, forecasting and budgeting efforts are appropriately integrated with other planning processes employed across the organisation. • Provide leadership to the sales organization and counsel to sales leaders to implement sales objectives that appropriately reflect the Corporate goals of the organisation. • Ensure the accurate calculation and deployment of budgets, delivering revenue and order coverage planning and assignment of sales force quotas, ensuring the function’s financial objectives are optimally allocated to all sales channels and resources through the sales incentive program. • Identify opportunities for sales process improvement. Facilitate successful implementation of new programs through the sales organisation by ensuring a well-defined, efficient sales process is in place for launch. Fosters an organisation of continuous process improvement. • Drive global consistency in tools, processes and measurement to enhance both revenue growth and productivity. • Implement and manage globally standardised sales forecasting, opportunity management and planning & budgeting processes, establishing the highest levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency. • Support the prioritization of investments in enabling technologies in support of sales organisation productivity. Work closely with the sales leadership and IT to align the sales and technology roadmap and strategy, recommending changes and enhancements to sales tools and process. • Partner with HR & Finance BPs as well as regional sales leadership to help shape to the Global Incentive Compensation program from design and governance to implementation and administration ensuring that the plan drives sales behavior & reinforces the sales strategy.  Essential Competencies, Knowledge, Skills: • Ability to handle multiple, simultaneous projects in a fast-paced environment while paying excellent attention to detail • Extensive experience with Salesforce/CRM systems • Cross-functional, matrix / stakeholder and leadership skills and the ability to influence across all levels of the organization • Ability to build vision, understand and define requirements, design practical solutions, develop supporting business cases and implement solutions • Deep knowledge of sales and account management practices as applied within a Technology/SaaS, B2B environments • Experience in driving structured processes and leveraging analytics from large datasets to drive growth programs • Experience using data to develop go-to market approaches and inform the business. • Ability to think strategically and synthesize insights and business implications from data in a meaningful way • Focus on self-learning and improvement to strive to be better and serve others better in the pursuit of business growth and personal development  Experience: • Minimum of 7 years of experience managing sales operations within a technology company. • Significant experience in Technology/SaaS sales space, with strong preference experience in growth companies. • Significant experience in developing & engaging highly functioning sales teams. • Demonstrable experience in change management within sales organisations.   AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplar employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.  Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.  Concerning agencies: AVEVA does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.
industries: Computer Software

description: Manager- Enterprise Sales  Experience: 5+ years in B2B SAAS Sales We bring the best of AI+human-led conversational automation for enterprises of great repute like Schlumberger, Domino’s, Dr. Reddy’s Lab, PepsiCo, Bajaj Group, Indigo, Cipla, Siemens, MG Motors, and more. We have offices in 6 countries and have clients across 27 countries. We’re a team of 500+ makers, who’ve shipped over 750+ Intelligent Virtual Assistants. Our Virtual Assistants converse in over 120 languages, and our platform handles more than a billion conversations every month - over 50+ channels in text and voice! We’re also named Leading conversational AI Platform, Distinguished CX Vendor, and Advanced Virtual Assistant Provider by Gartner. They’re really critical and meet 1000+ Conversational AI Platforms. We’re thrilled to be recognized by them! We’re one of the fastest growing SaaS leaders emerging from Asia and are backed on this journey with more than $100M in funding so far by partners like Lightspeed, Sapphire Ventures, WestBridge Capital and Salesforce Ventures. We also got honoured recently, being one of the top 10 companies to work at by ‘#LinkedinTopStartups’ and a ‘Great Place to Work at’ certification. We’re looking for a Manager- Enterprise Sales . We are looking for a Sales Manager who will embark on an exciting journey with us to grow the A.I. enterprise solution business. This role demands excellent communication skills and sales techniques with a customer-oriented mindset. You will take the lead in developing new business leads, managing relationships with our current corporate clients and close target business accounts. The role will require you to work with our clients closely, understand their needs and drive sales growth. Responsibilities: Meet and exceed sales targets by directly closing target business accounts Develop a strong direct touch sales pipeline, focused on the different vertical Understand client needs and requirements. Drive business meetings in the field. Accurate account and pipeline management with professional-level of forecasting. Expertly demonstrate value proposition and benefits. Manage the entire sales process from prospecting to close working with the team Looking for candidates who have: 6+ Years of experience in enterprise product (SaaS) sales Strong experience developing high impact sales teams in a similar technical environment Demonstrable track record achieving sales growth Excellent in communication skills and corporate sales techniques Curious about latest technologies and are motivated by real-world application of chatbots

Swapcard digitalizes events while preserving the magic of real-life interaction. Behind this dream, stands a passionate, curious, and down-to-earth team. We believe an environment of trust, autonomy, and support is integral to our success. As a result of putting people first, career evolution and rapid growth have become regular commodities. We've even managed to revolutionize our industry through true teamwork, sharing our ideas, and listening to each other!  With 34 nationalities amongst a team of more than 154, we enjoy an open-minded environment where opinions and ideas are encouraged and exchanged freely to create a product and company we can all be proud of. We’ve also learned that the more moments we share, the more comfortable, communicative, and confident we are when working together. That’s when the real magic occurs. We’ve made some incredible memories around the globe together so far & it's only the beginning!  Your focus in this role:  Qualify and recruit reseller and referral partners within a dedicated territory. Manage the lead flow and qualify/progress high-value leads to regional Partner Managers. Manage & close SMB agency leads. Develop and nurture relationships with partners to secure partner-led sales. Proactively recruit the right partners based on industry or geographical segments not covered by Swapcard direct sales team. Provide local language and regional service support to supplement Swapcard services where needed. Provide complimentary service offerings to cover the holistic services nature of events (i.e., Production/Registration/Creative & Design) Provide enablement programs to educate partner teams on pricing structures, platform capabilities, and developments, as well as positioning and market fit. Grow commercial relationships by extending revenue throughout to Swapcard by reselling or referral selling.  What you will be doing:  Strong sales administration within internal systems and the coordination of service efforts/deployment of resources to deliver to client expectations. Create strong relationships with agency partners to understand their business model and deliver mutually beneficial financial relationships. Results both financial and leverage are critical to the success of this role. Reliable forecasting and deal transparency, as well as reference case development and roadmap inputs, will form part of the measures of success for performance assessment.  Your profile:  2 or more years of sales experience. 1 or more years of experience in the events industry, ideally within an agency environment. Strong relationship development and management skills. Exceptional comfort while speaking on the phone/video conference and presenting while selling with and enabling Partners. Exceptional communication, listening, and presentation skills Persistent, optimistic, and charismatic. Experience qualifying leads and managing deals from negotiation through closure. Fluent in English - Regional languages would be appreciated!  Reasons to join us  * International Team with 39 nationalities (more on the way!) 🌍 * Paris HQ with offices in the USA, UAE, CA, UK, & IN 🇫🇷 🇺🇸 🇦🇪 🇨🇦 🇬🇧 🇮🇳 🇸🇬 * Fast-growing startup with many opportunities for growth 🌱 * Open-minded culture that appreciates differences 👽 * Feedback driven, supportive & curious team with DIY mindset 🤔 🛠 * Family Leave & remote work to ensure you have time for what matters most ❤️ 🏡 * Team that seizes every opportunity to celebrate success 🍾 🕺🏼💃 * Learning support & sponsorship 📚 * WFH Budget to help you feel comfortable 😊 * Generous Paid Time Off program to ensure your happiness 🎁 * Team Vacations to celebrate our achievements ✈️

description: Retykle.com is Asia’s first and largest online consignment store for buying and selling designer baby, children's & maternity fashion, gear and toys. Our mission is to make buying and selling high quality pre-loved items as good, if not better than buying new. We sell over 2000 of the world’s best children’s and maternity brands at a fraction of traditional prices - up to 90% off. For sellers, we take the hassle out of resale. We allow parents to turn their kids closets into cash without lifting a finger whilst also benefiting the environment. The platform started in Hong Kong but we are growing rapidly and it is now time to launch our fully circular offering in Singapore. We are looking for talented people who are hungry to learn and contribute to our team. Our ideal candidates are passionate about social media, creative content, executing innovative marketing ideas as well as someone who loves meeting new people and developing meaningful relationships. Key Responsibilities: Local social media strategy & content Local press and influencer/affiliate/ambassador liaison Event management Handling of creative assets for website, printed marketing materials, ads, email marketing Assist with photography shoots Developing partnerships with local brands, corporates, charities & schools Reporting and data analysis Candidate: Prior experience with creative content generation and a solid grasp of design concepts Strong understanding of social media Comfortable working in software such as Illustrator, InDesign, Canva or Photoshop Enthusiasm for the design process Enjoy building new relationships and prior experience in sales a plus You need to enjoy working in an entrepreneurial and start-up culture Strong attention to detail and organisation skills Interest in technology, fashion, e-commerce, sustainability & design a plus Fluent english Available to work in Singapore with a working visa Kindly note that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

description: The Qualtrics XM PlatformTM is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can't imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  A Day in the Life Experience in multi-threaded engagement, selling to EVPs, CXOs and end-users (in the same sales cycle) in both individual and team sales environments Build your market - Acquiring clients, negotiating, and selling the Qualtrics Experience Management platform to marketing, customer experience, research and/or HR executives of Fortune 500 companies, governments NPOs and/or academic institutions Define and execute territory sales plans within the assigned territory Storytelling - Leading potential clients to an understanding of the options or solutions that are applicable to their situation, demonstrating how features and benefits match their needs Daily Prospecting/assess new sales potential Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or higher 7+ years of direct sales experience, with proven track records in achieving quotas in ASEAN region Demonstrated success in driving new business sales, and ability to develop and manage a sales execution plan at an account and/or territory level. Goal-Getter. Strive to achieve sales KPIs daily, weekly, monthly, etc. You are willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful Effective Communicator. You have the ability to ‘story-tell' and illustrate strong communication skills cross functionally. Highly Competitive Proven success in selling SaaS or disruptive technology Preferred Qualifications Experience using Salesforce.com About the Team  Part of the growing Qualtrics South-east Asia team, the team is a group of highly driven individuals that are intelligent, organized, and dedicated. We work together as a team to accomplish and surpass quarterly and annual objectives. We are a visionary team that works hard and enjoys the incredible trajectory that Qualtrics provides. Our overarching objective is to drive company revenue growth through client success.  What Differentiates Us From Other Companies Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings (COVID rules apply), and happy hours. Based in Downtown Singapore, we take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space. On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office. We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees. Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer  Qualtrics provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or veteran status.

description: About Temenos  We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.  We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.  Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!  THE ROLE  The Business Development Manager is responsible for driving the sales cycle from initial contact to signing of the deal, and then maintaining a good client relationship, as well as take part in market analysis and relationship building with senior management and key opinion leaders in the banking and financial services sectors.  Key Responsibilities  Achieve sales targets established by the Territory Sales Manager. Prepare and execute a territory sales plan in accordance with Temenos strategy and maintain a rolling pipeline of at least 3x annual target. Start and manage the full sales cycle, coordinating pre-sales and other specialist resources as needed. Work with the lead pre-sales resource to ensure professional engagement with the prospect to fully understand their requirements, deliver quality proposals that emphasize Temenos strengths. Manage the sales cycle in accordance with the TAS methodology and ensure T-Force and TAS Dealmaker are up to date at all stages. Negotiate, or assist in the negotiations (depending on the deal size), on terms and conditions of the sales and service agreements. * Assist in market research and build perspective client profiles with respect to their current systems, potential future software investments and strategies, and key decision makers. Perform competition analysis with respect to strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities and threats. Identify new market and growth opportunities to build a strong sales pipeline, establish, and continue relationships with primary alliance partners.  Skills & Experience  Proven track record of sales and achievement of sales targets in the banking and financial services sectors, and substantial relevant experience within the same domain (7 years or more). Able to deal with people at all levels within an organization, and show and demonstrate negotiating skills with key decision makers. Demonstrate good communication, presentation and interpersonal skills to establish interest, trust and credibility. Good understanding of banking operations and relevant processes (front, middle, back office), thorough understanding of IT processes and implementations from both functional and technical perspectives. Previous experience in Global Accounting/ Global Investor segment will be considered as an asset. Preferably, a university education in relevant business disciplines, preferably with a post-graduate degree. Self-motivated, ambitious, independent, organized, focused and be able to multi-task.  WHY TEMENOS  You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day. You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best. You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises. You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity. You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients. You will experience what we call – Temenosity!  We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.  Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy

description: Regional Sales Manager, UK & Germany  About Us  BioMind is an award-winning deep technology company focusing on healthcare  solutions.  We build state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies to help hospitals  diagnose medical conditions and manage healthcare-related problems. We have a  strong team of deep learning scientists, software engineers, medical experts and  distinguished advisors from prestigious hospitals and universities.  Job Description  We are looking for a high-performing Sales Manager to help us meet our customer  acquisition and revenue growth targets by keeping our company competitive and  innovative. Work beside passionate and driven experts in the fields of healthcare and  data science to change the face of the healthcare industry.  Responsibilities Identify and pre-select suitable and qualified sales channels distribution in the Radiologist market Define and prioritise strategic areas/market segments for market penetration and work closely with our local partner to identify our initial reference centre  and key opinion leader (KOL) Travel extensively in the region to support our sole distributors, join customers visits, medical congress/exhibitions and assist in closing key sales Prepare business plan for each country, analysis of our competitors and market potential. Increase market penetration with our new product lines Monitor and improve customer’s and distributor’s support level to ensure they are motivated to buy and sell our product by providing product updates,  training and marketing information Evaluate, organise and update regional relevant congress, seminars and product demos in the region to maximise our marketing efforts Provide timely updates to CSO with the market situation, follow up on agreed action plans and provide solutions or corrective action  Requirements Preferably in MR Radiographer background Work in Radiology market segment and have strong customers relationship Good understanding of Radiology department and Neuro department Good in Spoken and Written English

description: Role Purpose:  This is a newly created role. As the Customer Success Manager, you will report to the Digital Insights Business Lead. You will pro-actively work with affiliates to pursue & secure opportunities across the full digital solutions product portfolio. This includes building a deep understanding of the customers’ needs, buying cycle and key stakeholders & their wins, and design customised solutions, both Roche and non-Roche products, and innovative value-based pricing models to achieve desired outcomes at the opportunity level. Where necessary, you will need to partner team members, VS, and Global teams to bring in vendors/3rd party products to deliver the holistic solutions. You will work together with our Roche colleagues in each country to provide a seamless customer experience – This involves building relationships with a wide range of stakeholders within the laboratory or hospital, both technical and commercial. As a trusted adviser and coach to the customer, you continuously articulate value and support your customers with achieving their desired outcomes.  In this role, you will:  Be the champion to accelerate the sales of  digital solutions portfolio across multiple customer areas across the affiliates in Asia Pacific; Create a regional overview of the sales opportunity funnel across the full digital solutions portfolio in APAC. This includes designing & monitoring success metrics and conducting regular business reviews with Roche affiliates and customers to discuss strategic initiatives and align with each customer’s success criteria; Build relationships and partner with our Roche counterparts in each country and region to align with their customer account management approach; Partner affiliates to advance the digital solutions opportunities, from providing expertise in digital sales process, designing & architecting customised solutions, defining the pricing models, to finally submitting & negotiating for the tenders; Serve as an advocate for your customers in driving the improvement and evolution of our products and services by bringing thoughtful feedback back to the RIS team and identifying new areas of growth to harvest more value from the customers; Identify risks within customer accounts and drive internal action plans to eliminate those risks - Be a trusted advisor for your customers, based on strong product and industry knowledge; Establish and build strong customer relationships over time that allow for continuity and ongoing partnership to drive growth and retention of accounts through deep understanding of your customers’ use cases; Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional internal teams including sales, service delivery, marketing, support and product management; International travel of up to 50% is expected for this role.  Who you are:  Minimum qualifications: You should possess a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Biomedical Sciences, Business, Finance, or Healthcare, advanced degree (Masters, Medical Degree or Ph.D) is preferred. 5-8 years of experiences in either the IVD, pharmaceutical industry, preferably in sales and/or marketing; Experience with driving successful sales, adoption & cross-selling of Software as a Service (SaaS) products in APAC from early customer engagement/ pilots to meaningful revenues is a plus. Demonstrate the ability to prioritize in an ambiguous environment in accordance to a clear understanding of the business, target markets and trends. Ability to work in a highly matrixed environment, with excellent oral and verbal communication skills Demonstrated ability to be pro-active in supporting local sales & marketing teams to drive opportunities forward e.g. participating in tender submissions, building deal level P&L  Qualification and Experience  Preferred qualifications: Outstanding communication (written and oral), listening and negotiation skills and proven commercial acumen demonstrated by previous successes. Able to foster positive partnerships through effective influencing, negotiation and conflict management skills  Location:  Preferred location will be Singapore, however other locations within Asia Pacific may also be considered.  APAC:  This is a diverse region culturally and with respect to business maturity. APAC Spirit is an embodiment of the organisation we in the APAC region aspire to be. As a member in this region, you will strive to deeply understand, live and encourage those around you to embrace the APAC Spirit principles.  As this position is a regional role, international business travel will be required depending upon the business location of the successful candidate and ongoing business project activities.  Roche is strongly committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strive to build teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Embracing diversity enables us to create a great place to work and to innovate for patients

jobTitle: Senior Office Business Strategy & Planning Executive
description: FUJIFILM Business Innovation Asia Pacific (FBAP) is the best companion for our customers on their Digital Transformation journey. In order to achieve, we need to gather insights on customers’ needs, build better solution and customer experience which meet their requirements, as well as explore new opportunities for our customers.  Job PURPOSE: Responsible for marketing strategy and business planning of office products & solutions for selected countries Responsible for Asia Pacific (AP) region plan achievement for sales and market share within AP Lead regional initiatives through close collaboration with our Subsidiary Companies Support office products business expansion across direct and indirect business.  RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS: Business Development Support in driving office product Business strategy and identify opportunities to grow within managed Subsidiary Companies Support in driving Regional Initiatives involving Senior Management and PIC in our Subsidiary Companies Drive upskilling of Subsidiary Companies’ product marketing and sales of our products & solutions Drive competitiveness through Competitive analysis, strategy and benchmarking across Subsidiary Companies  Initiative Promotion Identify and analyze common challenges in AP region and support the implementation of countermeasures Support in the development of regional sales strategy and implement action plans Monitor, drive and support Subsidiary Companies in the strategy and align plans to achieve budget target  Office Product Promotion Investigate product positioning including predecessor models, competitors, market share/price, and sales channels by country to ensure that the new products meet market requirements Support in the development of product strategy through close collaboration with Product Marketing team Support Subsidiary Companies in sales promotion and activities  Qualifications - External 4 - 6 years in Regional Business Development role, preferably possess printer/office printings sales/marketing experience Diploma / Bachelor's degree in Marketing or related discipline Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) Proficiency in Excel Pivot Table/Macros an added advantage Channel Marketing experience  Proven competency in managing, implementing and formulation of Marketing & Pricing strategy Product Marketing skills Data and Competitive Analysis skills Strong Communication and negotiation skills Positive attitude / Sense of ownership Team player; works well with cross functional teams Knowledge of printer product and industry preferred Experience in Asia Pacific regional preferred Occasional travel required.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  The Challenge  Adobe Digital Experience (DX) Growth Marketing is seeking a Field Marketing Manager for South East Asia who will be a creative and critical problem solver, an adept communicator, and have the organizational skills to handle a variety of concurrently running projects and programs that will drive the business through thought leadership, sales opportunity generation, and overall sales and marketing!  What the successful candidate will do  Develop and lead programs to drive opportunity generation and pipeline acceleration including joint field marketing events, digital events/activities, sales collateral, and outbound prospecting campaigns. Work cross-functionally with the corporate marketing organization to align the Adobe DX Growth go-to-market strategy and messaging. Develop strategic outbound campaigns and sales collateral to support coordinated global demand generation campaigns. Analyze performance field marketing activities and establish a regular reporting & communications cadence on field marketing efforts. Serve as a marketing business partner to the sales organization by capturing sentiments and feedback from the field to communicate back to corporate marketing. Travel included  What is needed to succeed  10+ years’ experience in field marketing and/or marketing management in the region. Shown success in developing and executing regional/country programs and events that drive deal acceleration and bookings. Experience with account-based marketing, including working with sales to develop target account lists and account segmentation. Knowledgeable and experienced in demand generation best practices, including the methods and tactics to support post-MQL outreach. Ability to analyze & interpret metrics around field marketing performance and adjust strategy accordingly. Proficient using Microsoft Office applications, specifically Excel and knowledge of the ecommerce and marketing automation systems, specifically Marketo and SFDC technology.
industries: Computer Software, Marketing and Advertising, and Information Technology and Services

description: Job Purpose: Responsible for the achievement of sales and service targets making existing agreements more profitable and developing an effective relationship with current or new accounts in line with objectives assigned to South East Asia markets.   Duties and Responsibilities: Achieve and ensure strong and profitable sales growth Implement good quality of marketing plan according to company strategies. Develop the plan to achieve the forecasted revenues ensuring the correct split among the business partners by month and by SKUs Analyze and evaluate new markets/ new channels/POS/Corporate clients as potential business environment for Bulgari products Maintain and improve relationship with the business partners, interacting with all the necessary people in their organization, ensuring regular clients visit as well as key point of sales. Manage with Business Partner negotiation of margins, pricing, payment terms, new opportunities space (new spaces & relocation), stock management, (BTL/ATL )activities. Monitor the compliancy and consistency of POS visual merchandising and store layout, providing appropriate indications and establishing 'ad hoc' actions; support events at point of sale; support campaigns of new products launches Analyze sell-in, sell-out and stock data of each door/partner. Proactively monitor order process, making sure that the business partner is placing regular order and making sure that monthly forecast and sell-out are achieved. Interact with other department in case of issues related to products, shipments, pricing, etc. Cooperate with the administrative department/s in the credit control, status of payments etc. ensuring the implementation of corporate client management policies & guidelines and fast issue management and communication to clients. Focus on retail conversion from sell-in Provide reports on sales to ensure an efficient resource usage to increase profitability   Qualifications: At least 6 to 8 years of working experience in sales management Bachelor degree holder in business administration or marketing major is preferred Knowledge of luxury beauty industry processes, guidelines and procedures Knowledge of the relevant market (competitors, luxury business etc.) Knowledgeable in negotiation techniques

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The Future Is What We Make It  Offering Manager – HBT  Malaysia OR Singapore  Honeywell offers employees the opportunity to work on the world’s most exciting projects, transforming the cities we live in, the buildings where we work, and the vehicles that move us.  We are currently seeking an Offering Manager who will act as the domain knowledge expert for the Fire System portfolio supporting global new product development and the commercialization efforts of sales teams. This role will lead the GNP product development and own the end-to-end product portfolio in ASEAN, managing and directing all product marketing activities, and will be accountable for sales growth and profitability. This role will work cross-functionally with all levels of the organization to maximize product line growth through organizational alignment, product development and market penetration to insure maximum return on investment. This role will also utilize voice of the customer inputs and quantitative research to develop a differentiated strategic product roadmap with outstanding financial outcomes. This role will develop sales tools and lead internal and external product training to increase the market acceptance of Honeywell solutions. This role will also be the focal for Customer Marketing and Strategic Marketing in Fire ASEAN.  Portfolio management of existing portfolio of Fire Systems and Emergency Lighting in ASEAN  Providing guidance and application support to the sales and marketing teams about the local market conditions and requirements  Driving the adoption of recently released new products to achieve AOP targets  Developing strategies to drive the profitability of the Fire System and EL portfolio across Fire ASEAN  Supporting product/services life cycles, profitability, IOS, SKU reduction, SIOP/demand planning.  Providing positioning and pricing support along with competitor data to support sales and marketing activities  Manage the relationships with the internal and external suppliers to our Fire Systems and EL portfolio and provide appropriate updates to the sales and marketing teams.  Supporting data analysis to feed into regular senior management category/portfolio reviews  Requirements  The successful candidate will be an experienced and energetic marketer looking to learn, contribute and drive growth in the Fire Systems and EL portfolio. Must have the ability to be the brand champion within the business, capturing attention of sales and driving business alignment to common goals. Must be able to work with the global teams regarding the GNP strategy. Shall have deep experience defining product requirements based on voice of the customer input. Will be deadline oriented and able to support the portfolio in all geographic markets. Should possess excellent planning, execution and project-management skills.  This person will be accountable for on-time delivery, world-class execution and maximum ROI on Marketing led programs and projects. Shall have the ability to make timely decisions balancing systematic data and analysis. Shall possess the ability to forge solid internal and external relationships and manage across a broad and geographically dispersed organizational context. Shall effectively demonstrate the ability to deliver on complex situations or problems without guidance or supervision.  Experience & Educational Requirements  Bachelor’s degree (MBA or post graduate qualification in Marketing desirable)  Minimum of 5 years track record of successfully delivering results in a Senior Marketing role  Fire Systems/EL or relevant experience a plus  Experience of New Product Development for light industrial B2B companies  Experience of working in matrix, multi-national organization  At ease with technology and engineering environments  Evidence of understanding and solving customer problems  Fluent in English (Other languages desirable)  About Us  The world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.  Discover More  We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/  If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.  The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.  For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, refer to the EEO is the Law poster.  Please refer to the EEO is the Law Supplement Poster & the Pay Transparency Policy .  For more information on how we process your information in the job application process, please refer to Recruitment Privacy Notice.  If a disability prevents you from applying for a job through our website, request assistance here. No other requests will be acknowledged.  Copyright © 2020 Honeywell International Inc  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD126123 Category: Business Management Location: UOA Corporate Tower, Avenue 10, The Vertical,,Bangsar South City, No. 8, Jalan Kerinchi,Kuala Lumpur,WILAYAH PERSEKUTUAN,59200,Malaysia Exempt Engineering (GLOBAL)

description: Description and Responsibilities: Canvasing of new business based on direct marketing and referrals; Build and manage good relationships with new and existing clienteles; Provide mentorship and training to own sales team members; Working with the sales team to develop targeted sales strategies; Handling client project inquiries on specifications and lead-time; Conduct site-recce, sales, and tendering presentation; Prepare quotation and Delivery Order; Research, expand supplier/vendor listing on project-related; Research, expand supplier/vendor listing on project related; Creating and presenting sales performance reports.  Requirement: Min. 3 years of sales experience in a similar trade (Large Format Printing, Events and Exhibition Builder); Sales track records in corporate account servicing for our industry; Strong analytical, organizational, and creative thinking skills; Excellent communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills; Knowledge of modern marketing techniques; High-level communication and networking skills; Understanding of commercial trends and marketing strategies; Good project management skills that include working collaboratively with designer, production, external contractor and suppliers to complete each project; Have not attended any salary support programme such as PCP, PnT, etc.
