description: Secretlab is an international gaming chair brand seating over a million users worldwide, with our key markets in the United States, Europe and Singapore, where we are headquartered.  Secretlab’s Brand Experience department focuses on the multiple touch points that Secretlab’s customers, visitors, partners and fans experience with the brand. Whether for our main product and service offerings, physical stores and showrooms, vendor relationships, special events or internal organizational use, this department is responsible for creating and maintaining a cohesive Secretlab brand experience, both tangible and intangible.   As a Senior Retail & Offline Marketing Specialist, you are accountable for ensuring a world-class customer experience in the Secretlab showroom and all offline activations. Your primary responsibilities are to support the development and execution of all product launches and offline campaigns in the showroom. In addition to that, you will be expected to find creative and innovative ways to increase brand awareness, brand loyalty and sales conversions, while fostering long-term customer satisfaction. We are open to candidates with a background in strategic marketing, branding or events.   What you’ll be doing: Overview Provide strategic thinking—grounded by audience insights, goals and objectives. Monitor the retail and offline industry for best practices. Draft project briefs with clear requirements that aligns with Secretlab’s branding and campaign objectives. This process includes analysing and deconstructing briefs provided by stakeholders, conducting research, defining objectives and KPIs. Develop both print and digital communication materials for offline activations and showroom sales promotion in collaboration with the wider marketing team. Collaborate with the Performance Marketing team to manage showroom promotions and achieve sales targets. Ensure brand consistency and messaging across all Secretlab offline campaigns. Measure, evaluate, and report the effectiveness of marketing communication plans and VM implemented in the showroom and offline activations.  Retail Marketing Ensure the presentation of the Secretlab showroom and customer touch points are aligned with brand standards and guidelines. Build, overlook, maintain and constantly improve Secretlab’s VM guidelines. Forecast and propose VM direction for new product launches, offline marketing campaigns and seasonal themes. Offer strategy and on-brand sales training to the Retail Operations team. Constantly iterate and refine (from feedback and trend research) to deliver the best customer experience in the showroom. Program activities to increase customer traffic.  Offline Marketing Elevating the brand by strategizing and executing creative and innovative offline activations, creating transcendent experiences for our customers. Develop experiential marketing activations that are aligned with Secretlab’s branding and goals by leveraging vendor/partner/sponsor relationships.  Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in VM, Arts Management, Interior Design or equivalent. 3-4 years of experience in either VM, retail, sales, events or fashion/high end luxury industries. Good spatial awareness, being able to envision/imagine set-ups in three-dimensional spaces. Effective communication and liaison skills. Strong organizational skills. Demonstrate ability to make sound decisions and delivering successful outcomes.  Works in a fluid and collaborative environment, and able to work autonomously.  Creative, resourceful, able to work under pressure within tight deadlines. Comprehensive knowledge leveraging digital channels [i.e. landing pages, videos (web and social), organic social media marketing, EDMs, etc.] and the specifications involved in executing an integrated marketing campaign. Able to convey ideas through sketches. Able to use Google suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides) programs.  Bonuses: Passion for, and interest in, the gaming/ esports industry. Familiar with spatial 2D/3D software. i.e. Sketchup.   For more details on this position and other opportunities, please refer to our careers page.
industries: Consumer Goods

description: Position Summary/Purpose Do want to work with a great lead generation and sales development technology stack? Do you want to join an organisation where there is a recognised SDR career framework? Do you live and breathe outbound sales development and lead generation?  We are looking for motivated and professional Sales Development Specialist to join our innovative and respected sales development team. Based in Jakarta or Singapore and reporting to the Regional Sales Development Manager, you will work as the most senior and experienced team member in the Indonesian Bahasa region to identify, research and approach customers in target industries.  Utilising your expert outbound sales skills and leveraging our established digital marketing organisation, our goal is to identify, research, contact and qualify prospects in across various industries in Indonesia with the primary goal of booking a meeting for our Field Sales Team. Target industries include Energy Generation, Oil & Gas, Transport, Construction and Engineering.  This position is a unique opportunity for an experienced Lead Generation and Sales Development Representative (SDR) from the computer software sector (i.e. SaaS, Subscription Sales, Perpetual Sales), with exceptional Bahasa language skills, new business prospecting and outbound sales skills.  With a competitive base salary, company benefits and a structured commission scheme, we believe we present an attractive option to current Sales Development Representatives, Specialists and Consultants to step up into the elite segment of enterprise level global engineering software solutions.  With sales development peers in Singapore, Australia, Indonesia, the Americas and Europe, this is a unique opportunity to join a global team open up markets and territories for the Hexagon PPM group.  Responsibilities: Outbound lead generation across Indonesian market to fuel Hexagon PPM Pipeline and Growth. Collaborate with and leverage teammates to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities. Utilize industry knowledge to research & develop accounts, identify key players, generate interest, and identify compelling events. Predominately outbound prospecting (with limited inbound) to companies via cold calling, email, marketing campaigns, social selling. High-level discovery and educational conversations using BANT Methodology Book meetings for Field Sales and prepare for handover Manage, track, and report on all activities   This position is based in our Singapore Science Park or Jakarta offices.  To find out more please apply or reach out for any questions to Kevin Murphy kevin.murphy@hexagon.com or +61 409 185 814
industries: Computer Software and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: Company Overview  H2O.ai is the company behind H2O and Driverless AI. H2O is a distributed machine learning platform designed for big data with APIs are available in R, Python, Scala, Java and REST/JSON, while Driverless AI employs the techniques of expert data scientists in an easy to use application that helps scale your data science efforts. With H2O, data scientists can take sophisticated models all the way to production using the same user-friendly platform that they use for modeling. Our customers have built mission critical applications across all industries including healthcare, insurance, finance, telecommunications and retail. The H2O.ai team is a mix of software, machine learning, and data science experts working together with the open source community to build H2O and Driverless AI.  Founded in 2011, H2O.ai was one of the first companies to create an enterprise machine learning platform and continues to lead in this space.  Job Summary  We are looking for a Sales Engineer who will be an effective and pivotal part of the H2O.ai Solution Engineering team, supporting the delivery of revenue to the business. You would be working across a wide range of APAC accounts and industrial sectors providing machine learning, supporting technology and domain advice. You will also be working within a dedicated and fun loving team to successfully design and sell value based solutions that will allow our customers solve their business challenges.  Responsibilities And Duties  As a member of the Solutions Engineering team, you will work closely with Sales Directors to: Be the trusted data science advisor for our prospective clients and partners. Own account-related technical items and relationships throughout the sales cycle - account planning, opportunity identification and solution design. Communicate effectively with a diverse audience of internal and external stakeholders consisting of: Engineers, business people, partners, executives. Interactions will be both in-person and online. Translate business cases and requirements into value based technical solutions through the architecture of machine learning workflows and systems from data ingestion to model deployment. Demonstrate machine learning solutions with engaging storytelling and technical accuracy. Create, design, and deliver compelling presentation on complex and technical concepts. Present at meetups and webinars in the Data Science community, and be an integral part of the Maker culture of creating the best products and solutions. Have an active presence in social media. Gather customer feedback so that you can work with the H2O.ai Engineering team to further enhance our products. Explore a wide range of locations within your resident and neighbouring countries. Travel can be up to 50% of the role but with a flexible balance between your work and home life. Qualifications And Skills A detailed technical understanding of machine learning algorithms and their practical applications. Experience in at least one of the following programming language: Python, R, Java, Scala, Spark, SAS. Possession of the skills needed to help sell software and solutions through articulation of values rather than just features/functions. Ability to explain a complicated subject in a clear and articulate fashion. Comfortable with travel within the EMEA region.  Benefits And Perks Flexible work hours and time off. Competitive salary with uncapped commission and accelerators above quota Medical, dental, vision.  Work location: This position is located in APAC region  H2O.ai is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.  Powered by JazzHR  OUxq3n4AZq
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: See yourself being part of a large, transformational change? This could be the role for you!  Iress is continuing to hire for roles during Covid-19 with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually. Everyone new to the team, along with our current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.  Who We Are  At Iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day. Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across Australia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Canada, New Zealand and Asia.  The Role  We're seeking a Singapore based Senior Business Development Manager who gets a genuine buzz from driving new business while working with existing clients delivering solutions to their problems.  You will be expected to manage client engagement across Iress Financial Markets and Wealth Management solutions including overall coordination from pre-sales demo to initial high level scope discovery to statement of work as part of our proposal.  This is a a varied role that will see you contribute to our marketing strategy and be a key player in new business tenders.  What You Will Be Doing Manage client engagement across Iress Financial Markets and Wealth Management solutions including overall coordination from pre-sales demo to initial high level scope discovery to statement of work as part of our proposal. Collaborate closely with Iress account managers, client solutions teams to articulate what success looks like and define strategic business outcomes for our clients and Iress. Lead the proposal presentation, interact closely with senior stakeholders and teams both internally and externally. What You Will Need A financial services background with a solid understanding of trading/wealth management and knowledge of solution sales Experience managing a portfolio of clients Strong communication and presentation skills Drive and adaptability to tailor solutions for our clients. Why work with us? Competitive base salary Global opportunities State-of-the-art offices Casual dress, flexible work policy Access to various learning and development programs 3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives Global 36-hour hackathon Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work. Employment Type Employee Time Type Full time
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Hiring on behalf of our subsidiary, Sunlight Electrical Work Location: Chin Bee Road  Marketing drives profit, promote products and services through coordinated marketing campaigns and upstream specification.  As a marketing talent, you'll contribute to and develop integrated marketing campaigns to promote a product, service, or innovation. This a varied role, which includes: Planning Advertising Public relations Event organisation Upstream customer influencing  Responsibilities As a marketing talent, you'll need to: create awareness of and develop the brand we're marketing communicate with target audiences and build and develop customer relationships help with marketing plans, advertising, direct marketing, and campaigns support the marketing plan in delivering agreed activities source advertising opportunities and place adverts in the press or on the social media work closely with in-house or external creative agencies to design marketing materials such as brochures and adverts write and proof-read marketing copy for both online and print campaigns produce creative content, including videos and social media posts run social media channels (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Wechat, etc …) to enhance audience engagement organise and attend events such as conferences, seminars, receptions, and exhibitions source and secure sponsorship liaise with designers and printers and organise photoshoots arrange the effective distribution of marketing materials maintain and update customer databases conduct market research, for example, using customer questionnaires and focus groups develop relationships with key stakeholders, both internal and external.  With experience, you'll need to: develop and implement a marketing strategy (often as part of a wider sales and marketing programme) evaluate and review marketing campaigns, advertising, and SEO to make sure the correct mediums are being used and campaigns are effective track marketing performance and return on investment and prepare weekly or monthly reports for management monitor and report on competitor activity lead external agencies, when appropriate, to effectively manage events, press relationships, editorial requests, presentations, promotional materials, and online activities oversee and manage the marketing budget. accountable for scooping and identifying projects opportunities in Singapore and the region.  Requirements: Bachelor Degree, Electrical Engineering or Marketing related disciplines Above 6 years Marcomm, Sales or Marketing experience in dynamic multinational organizations, plus at least 3 years in a marketing management role in Low Voltage electrical segment. Strong sense and depth knowledge in marketing planning, customer-centric, brand value proposition, innovative, energetic, analytical, result-oriented, can-do attitude with exceptional interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving ability, including metrics-driven thinking to collaborate with other functions – especially with the sales function. Strong networking, language fluency, communication, and listening skills coupled with the ability to influence and motivate are considered core skills for this position.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

description: Want to be at the forefront of the Computer Networking industry?!  Who We Are  At Cisco Meraki, we know that technology can connect us, empower us, and drive us. By simplifying powerful technology, we can free ambitious people to focus on their mission. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products, and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.  What You Will Do  As an Inside Sales Manager, you will lead a team of Inside Sales Representatives across your region to achieve our sales and talent development goals within the market. You will be responsible for setting the direction and empowering your Inside Sales team responsible for: new customer acquisition, existing account management, and working with our channel partners to accelerate growth. Hire, coach, and develop a motivated and hardworking team of Sales Reps to deliver against your sales goals Invest in recruiting and growing the best talent, set employees up for a great onboarding experience, and provide candid feedback for continuous development. Drive strong internal and external relationships in service of an outstanding customer experience and continued rapid growth. Set the tone for your team: Champion a culture of strong achievement, inclusiveness, collaboration, creativity, and accountability while being a champion for your team’s career development Build and drive territory strategy and priorities and communicate them clearly with your team. Continuously optimize our sales methodology and share ideas to improve efficiency and focus, enable greater scale, and yield better results. Partner with cross-functional teams to maximize results (channel, field sales, systems engineering, marketing, Cisco sales leaders, etc.). Collaborate with Sales Enablement and People Operations to develop and execute individual and group training opportunities, identify development needs, and implement process improvement initiatives. Use metrics and data to continually assess both sales performance and talent performance/retention to fully understand underlying drivers. Minimum Qualifications 4+ years of successful sales/relationship management experience Previous OR current Meraki Team Lead/Management experience Executive presence and ability to collaborate cross-departmentally Examples of demonstrating the Meraki Leadership Principles: > Being Candid > The ability to Disagree – Decide – Commit > Career Champion > Driving Results >Transparency/Trust Examples of working collaboratively with peers to solve complex problems for the betterment of the team Organizational and project management capabilities with the ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines Proven relationship building skills, tenacity, resilience and interpersonal skills Track record of quota achievement and YoY growth Preferred Qualifications Strategic selling experience 2+ years of experience managing a team in B2B sales, operations, or a similar environment with a proven track record of overachieving goals Experience building relationships/interfacing with Senior Cisco leaders/Channel leaders Understanding of greater Cisco portfolio 1+ years in current role at Meraki/Cisco As an Inside Sales Manager for India, you will be working across the region including key partners in India and thus, proficiency in both English and Hindi is crucial Current and continued right to work in Singapore required Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Key Responsabilities  Mission : Improve efficiency and Autonomy of Sales & Marketing Teams and operations  Business Analysis, Dashboard & Reporting Building dashboard & views to enable sales teams to monitor their business Provide ad'hoc reports Contribute to weekly reporting of the CU Analyze sales KPIs to suggest areas for improvements Contribute to Budget definition with Financial Controlling Teams Lead Generation for Acquisition Contributing to setting-up sales campaigns and tracking progress and efficiency Contributing to the definition of new lead sources options together with other departments Implement and work toward automation of new lead sources processes. Analyze lead sources performances and suggest areas for improvement Contribution to process design and roll-out/support to clusters Contributing to the design & implementation of sales processes with common guidelines (ex: how to ask for a refund, how to react to churn risk, how to manage a delivery issue, ……) in collaboration with other departments Maintaining the knowledge base of processes & best practices Ensuring streamline communication between the CU / cluster and other departments Being accountable for the efficiency of the process (ex: delivery, ordering priorities, digital farming) Sales enablement & CRM Ensuring that sales teams are trained on relevant topics including on tools and processes Acting as first point of contact for all CRM usage questions and improvement suggestions. Centralizing requests, assessing their relevance and discussing implementation with the CRM team. Continuous improvement Propose and contribute to business specifications for new tools & processes to provide more autonomy and empowerment to the sales teams Key Skills Excellent interpersonal, communication skills Be tech-savvy with cloud knowledge, and with marketing & customer minded Be highly creative, proactive, pedagogue Have the ability to coordinate multi-stakeholder projects Time management skills and ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines 3+ year experience in Business Analysis / Sales & Marketing Operations / Data Analysis Knowledge about CRM & Marketing automation tools Data Management Skills and experience highly appreciated

Swapcard digitalizes events while preserving the magic of real-life interaction. Behind this dream, stands a passionate, curious, and down-to-earth team. We believe an environment of trust, autonomy, and support is integral to our success. As a result of putting people first, career evolution and rapid growth have become regular commodities. We've even managed to revolutionize our industry through true teamwork, sharing our ideas and listening to each other!  With 39 nationalities amongst a team of more than 168, we enjoy an open-minded environment where opinions and ideas are encouraged and exchanged freely in order to create a product and company we can all be proud of. We’ve also learned that the more moments we share, the more comfortable, communicative, and confident we are when working together. That’s when the real magic occurs. We’ve made some incredible memories around the globe together so far & it's only the beginning!  We've opened offices in Paris, Montreal, Dubai, Seattle, London, and New Delhi. Where's next for us? Singapore!  Your Focus On This Role  Prior to the pandemic, our team supported remote-work. This has helped us transition smoothly to a full-remote company this year. We'll be keeping our HQ in Paris as home base while staying flexible to see what the future holds for our growing team. Currently, we're spread out throughout the world. We're looking for ambitious and curious teammates to take part in this adventure of growing from a start-up to a scale-up. Qualify and recruit reseller and referral partners within a dedicated territory. Manage the lead flow and qualify/progress high-value leads to regional Partner Managers. Manage & close SMB agency leads. Develop and nurture relationships with partners to secure partner-led sales. Proactively recruit the right partners based on industry or geographical segments not covered by Swapcard direct sales team. Provide local language and regional service support to supplement Swapcard services where needed. Provide complimentary service offerings to cover the holistic services nature of events (i.e., Production/Registration/Creative & Design) Provide enablement programs to educate partner teams on pricing structures, platform capabilities, and developments, as well as positioning and market fit. Grow commercial relationships by extending revenue throughout to Swapcard by reselling or referral selling. What you'll be doing: Strong sales administration within internal systems and the coordination of service efforts/deployment of resources to deliver to client expectations. Create strong relationships with agency partners to understand their business model and deliver mutually beneficial financial relationships. Results both financial and leverage are critical to the success of this role. Reliable forecasting and deal transparency, as well as reference case development and roadmap inputs, will form part of the measures of success for performance assessment.  Your Profile 2 or more years of sales experience. 1 or more years of experience in the events industry, ideally within an agency environment. Strong relationship development and management skills. Exceptional comfort while speaking on the phone/video conference and presenting while selling with and enabling Partners. Exceptional communication, listening, and presentation skills Persistent, optimistic, and charismatic. Experience qualifying leads and managing deals from negotiation through closure. Fluent in English - Regional languages would be appreciated! description: As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Sales Manager with a wealth of experience selling SaaS solutions to government entities? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? If yes then we want to hear from you!  The Impact You Will Have  You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new customer relationships across the APAC region. As a Government Sales Manager you will become an expert in Elliptic’s value proposition, helping build our revenues with government bodies (central banks, law enforcement and regulators) to develop their understanding and help them to navigate the impacts of increased adoption of digital assets.  You will manage the full sales cycle including prospecting, qualifying leads, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing business to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and exceed your targets.  This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!  What You’ll Do Develop net new business and cross sell opportunities Build out strategic market penetration plan, prospect, and manage full sales cycle Prospect and generate high quality leads Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements Conduct presentations and product demos Negotiate terms and close the business As applicable, work alongside our Customer Engagement team to develop deeper relationships and upsell to set and hit aggressive revenue goals Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota Requirements  You will be a great fit here if you: You have experience of selling into central banks, law enforcement and regulators. Have the ability to analyse data to identify market trends and opportunities for cryptocurrency and compliance. Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals Have a collaborative mindset Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities Our Ideal Candidate Has 5+ years full sales cycle experience selling SaaS solutions to public sector entities Strong outbound prospecting skills, with track record of generating net new business Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur’s mindset. You’re comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy Bonus Points For Can understand how compliance of digital assets fit into public sector plans Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Experience selling SaaS solutions to government/public sector. Borderline obsession with emerging technology Benefits Share Options Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays + additional day for your birthday Health insurance Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Home office allowance Full access to Spill Mental Health Support We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

description: About the business  IDEMIA, the global leader in Augmented Identity, provides a trusted environment enabling citizens and consumers alike to perform their daily critical activities (such as pay, connect and travel), in the physical as well as digital space. Present in the Financial services, Telecommunications, IoT, Public Security and Citizen Identity markets, IDEMIA offers end-to-end solutions for us to interact, pay, connect, travel and vote in a connected environment. This is because securing our identity has become mission critical in today's world.  Job Title: APAC Business Operations Lead Reports to : APAC Regional Program Director  Location / Site: IDEMIA Singapore  As per project requirements, only Singapore citizens or SPRs will be considered   Purpose of the job This key role is to manage the entire APAC PSI Business Operations, including APAC PSI Business P&L and business analysis IDEMIA PSI markets in APAC region. APAC PSI region consists of North Asia, South Asia, South East Asia and ANZ.  The role provides the linkage between the business/delivery/operations team and finance for all reporting & financial co-ordination across all PSI programs in APAC region. This is an internally focused position that works closely with the business interacting with sales, presales, programs, delivery teams, APAC/Global/Country finance controlling, global operations and purchasing. The main purpose of this role is to ensure there is a consistent, aligned view on business financial input coming from the APAC region into controlling with analysis around any deviations.  This role is part of APAC Programs team and will report to APAC Regional Program Director.  Main responsibilities Annual business and operations budget planning – sales order intake (OI), revenue, margin Contribute/participate/present in monthly business performance review with global leaders Consolidate the monthly business performance APAC Revenue and Gross Margin (GM) Forecast Regular engagement with the internal stakeholders, such as Sales, Pre-Sales, Program Managers, Local and Global Finance Controlling, Global Operations team, etc., to gather information needed for business analysis and forecasting. Consolidate and highlight the project risks and opportunities which may have material impact on the forecasted revenue / GM Provide financial analysis, such as cash flow, invoicing and revenue forecasting, on the existing programs or up-coming pipelines, if required. Support Sales team during Bids/Tenders process Support Region Value Creation Plan, OI accuracy and OI forecast reporting Collaborate with Program Managers to generate and maintain the program dashboards for the monthly program review Demand planning and forecast for APAC projects and upcoming opportunities Uncover insightful information and work with the regional team to drive sales and operational productivity and efficiency. Drive business and operation tasks and activities Participate and support programs monthly reviews  Experience & background Financially literate in terms of business finance and operations Experience in strategic planning and execution Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions Strong spreadsheet skills are desirable (Excel and Word) Sound experience in a commercial environment Experience in presentation to senior leadership  Main interlocutors APAC President, APAC Program Director, Sub-region Sales Directors, APAC Program Managers, APAC Delivery teams, APAC Finance Controller, APAC and Global Finance team.  Geographical scope of the job APAC – North Asia, South Asia, South-East Asia, ANZ regions  Competencies / soft skills With strong written and verbally communication and interpersonal skills, he/she will be able to manage difficult situation, cope with the pressure and potential delay in obtaining the needed information from the required parties.  Listening skill is crucial to the success of this role. The ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions  Organized, rigorous, and transparent, he/she is curious and interested in driving and improving the business operations efficiency and sensitive to other cultures.  Business financial analytical skills to manage business P&L and performances.  Recognized by his/her peers and teams around the engagement he/she is capable of supporting the business in terms of business analysis and dashboard reporting decisions.

description: Description  Amazon Global Selling has been helping individuals and businesses increase sales and reach new customers around the globe. Amazon Global Selling Marketing Team spread the awareness of selling globally with Amazon through digital reach, offline events, media outreach and success story sharing. We also engage potential sellers through social media channels and website to promote the sell on Amazon program to them. Our mission is to educate sellers how they can become sellers on Amazon marketplace, helps them understand the potential benefits to their business so that the seller can reach the world of customers through selling on Amazon.  We would like to seek a highly motivated, customer focused, creative thinking, data driven and deadline oriented professional to join our marketing team to drive the awareness of Amazon global selling through various online/offline engagements and strategic partnerships with government agencies and key partners, with a focus on Thai sellers.  The marketing manager will work closely with our strategic partners as well as with sales, PR, legal and public policy teams to build, execute and report on a series of events to generate awareness and leads for follow-ups. He/she would engage with potential sellers through various channels including online, offline and partnership to build motivation, generate demand and drive conversions. Working with the sales team, he/she would also develop a regular cadence of strategic gatherings and meetups to identify potential sellers, as well as to create positive experiences that will connect sellers.  Role And Responsibilities Identify and develop online marketing opportunities to drive nationwide seller awareness and engagement Work with partners and internal stakeholders to define seller awareness and engagement goals for online activities Keep track of updated content creation guidelines and resources, develop communication materials, review and seek approval ahead of deadlines Own content metrics and content development processes Manage online/offline event calendar, budgets and sponsorships Build reports to provide visibility on event results, effectiveness and conversions Build and develop close relationships with seller communities Proactively identify and work with candidates to build interesting Amazon Global Selling seller stories Find new and exciting ways to engage sellers via social media, website and CRM channels Monitor social media channels at the real time, on a daily basis, to provide prompt and active support to sellers Actively seek solutions through researching and liaising with relevant internal teams and identify trends and ideas for improvement Maintain a strong up-to-date knowledge of seller ecosystem, resources and internal processes  Basic Qualifications Bachelor degree required 6+ years of experience Strong oral and written communication skills in both English and Thai Organized and detailed oriented Proven track record of developing and managing multiple marketing programs simultaneously Strong prioritization and time management skills, with a high degree of flexibility Experience managing multi-channel marketing strategy and execution Experience in corporate communications, pitch deck and case study development Deep understanding of major social media platforms including analytics and business management tools Familiarity with the B2B sales cycle and how to employ marketing communications strategies to nurture leads, drive adoption and accelerate growth Deep understanding of and passion for e-commerce A team player with the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders and partners Preferred Qualifications 3+ years of experience in B2B offline/event marketing 3+ years of experience in social media marketing and community building 3+ years of content and writing experience 3+ years of strategic partnership management Understanding of how to use content marketing to generate awareness and qualified leads Familiarity with local events and Making Money Online (MMO) scenes in Thailand Experience building, launching and reporting on campaigns using Salesforce or similar CRM tools Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role  Company - Amazon Asia-Pacific Holdings  Job ID: A1550297

description: About Meltwater  Our culture is based on a fundamental belief in people and the potential they possess. Our employees embody the ‘work hard, play hard’ spirit, and we are lucky to have some of the best and most talented people out there. We pride ourselves on taking great people and helping them do extraordinary things in a dynamic, global environment that fosters positivity, entrepreneurship, and teamwork.  With 20 years of experience in the field of online media monitoring, Meltwater is a global leader in media intelligence and social analytics SaaS solutions - helping to bridge the gap between Public Relations, Communications, and Marketing departments with an all-in-one solution powered by AI-driven insights. Through Meltwater's platforms, our clients are well equipped to stay on top of billions of online conversations and extract relevant insights - allowing them to strategically manage their brands and stay ahead of their competition. With 55 offices and 2,000 employees worldwide, Meltwater is a truly global partner to over 30,000 of the world’s most respected brands which rely on Meltwater to help inform their MarCom strategies and decision making.  Role: Account Manager, Client Success  As part of the Client Success team, the Account Manager is responsible for managing, retaining, and growing a portfolio of Meltwater’s clients across Southeast Asia. You will be expected to demonstrate a thorough understanding of Meltwater’s products, and are responsible for driving engagement and adoption through all stages of the client life cycle and renewal process.  What You'll Do Actively foster and manage the success of a portfolio of Meltwater clients assigned to you Establish a trusted relationship with each client and drive continuous value of our products Improve client engagement & adoption and foster enthusiastic, passionate clients Be responsible for customer satisfaction, retention, and expansion of existing accounts to grow revenue Work with the sales teams to onboard and train new clients Conduct client business reviews to track the health of your accounts, while listening to customer feedback and proactively discovering areas of improvement Collaborate with the sales teams to identify upsell and cross sell opportunities to grow overall portfolio size Negotiate and close renewal business with C-Level Executives and decision makers, enabling you to meet or exceed your quota Take ownership of monthly churn / retention and growth targets for your specific client accounts Proactively identify issues that may impact a renewal, and engage all available resources to resolve any knots Track client’s usage of and activity level on our platforms to monitor the health / risk status of your accounts Who You Are Attained Bachelor’s degree (in any specialization) 2 - 5 years of work experience in client servicing / client facing roles, ideally in account management, sales or business development roles Familiar with account management responsibilities such as retention of clients, upselling and cross-selling across your client pool Proven track record of fulfilling and exceeding sales targets Derive great enjoyment being in client servicing roles with a naturally strong customer focus Passionate about building relationships along with excellent interpersonal skills Dealt with complex or escalated customer situations, and able to navigate large organizations and gain executive level buy-in Strong empathy for customers, plus a passion for influencing customer revenue and growth Ability to think outside the box and adopt a solution-oriented approach to solve problems for clients What We Offer Competitive compensation package, with uncapped monthly commissions and quarterly bonuses! Fast career progression and empowerment in your role Flat hierarchy with diverse, high-performance & collaborative teams Global presence and a uniquely Meltwater culture like no other Both flexible work arrangement & vibrant office space with a well-stocked pantry Generous vacation leave Meltwater Careers Page: https://careers.meltwater.com/  ()

description: Our client is a 30 year old an Australian founded owned Multi-National Company that develops, distributes, and supports state-of-the-art cash processing solutions to the Retail, Hospitality, Banking, Gaming, CIT and Transport sectors. The company is expanding it's presence in Singapore which is being establised as a hub to grow in in Asia.  The Role Reporting to the General Manager Singapore, this role is responsible for the development of new business and the management of some named existing accounts across all market sectors.  The focus for this role will be identifying and developing NEW business opportunities for both the existing and new product ranges, whilst ensuring our clients receive the highest possible level of support and customer service.  Our Ideal Candidate The ideal candidate will have a strong background as a successful Sales Specialist, developing new business, with a proven track record of delivering results and significant revenue growth. To be successful, you will have well-developed interpersonal skills, a disciplined and structured sales process with a knack for finding and building relationships and developing new business opportunities. (Those with 1-2 years experience in the right industries can be considered too) Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, information technology, or related field. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Superb interpersonal skills and ability to quickly build rapport with both customers, suppliers, and internal stakeholders.  Key responsibilities and accountabilities: Selling direct to customers and on occasion, via our reseller partners. Establish relationships with new customers and secure contracts with new customers. Develop and maintain territory plans which outline how sales targets will be met on an ongoing basis. Achieve assigned sales quotas and targets. What can you expect? Excellent remuneration with a competitive base salary ($6,000 to $10,000) and an excellent sales incentive for achieving sales targets. Generous bonuses for over achievement of targets. PRIMARY FUNCTION Reporting to the Brand Director based in Singapore, you will be part of Shiseido Travel Retail – Global team to support translating the Anessa and Elixir brand strategy into a Travel Retail Specific roadmap. The key market is Asia Pacific at present with the possibility of expanding into EMEA and the Americas in future.  You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders daily. Interfacing with Brand holders based in Tokyo and with the regions to localize marketing strategies, develop insight driven 360 marketing initiatives and activities that are meaningful for the channel while ensuring brands consistency across Travel Retail markets worldwide.  These strategies will enhance brand equity and sales to improve market share, ensuring brand objectives and financial targets associated to the brand are realized.  You will also be responsible for the management and monitoring of the Brand P&L, budget management, working with stakeholders to develop and measure brand KPIs as well as pricing implementation.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Brand Holder Developing & implementing the brand strategy as defined with Brand Director Liaise with brand holders for TR-related developments (TREX,360 activation campaigns and expansion drive) Consolidated reporting from regional subsidiaries and act as an intermediary with Brand holders Share any feedback on market and competitor trends, 360 activations, opening & renovating counters and full marketing mix  Marketing strategy Monitor market trends, research consumer markets and competitors’ activities to identify opportunities and key issues. Defining short/long term brand strategy based on consumer and market insights, commercial analysis and trending opportunities for the Travel Retail channel Building realistic, yet innovative 360 plans considering competition, sales performance, trends, costs aspects, & regional specificities Work with internal and external agencies to ensure the creative and innovative deliverables (campaign, events, tool kit) to be implemented by the regional marketing teams  Consumer Experience Collaborate with Store Design/Visual Merchandising team in the creation and development of collaterals, outpost concepts and Point of Sales Materials to drive disruption and distortion in-stores for the brands Influence and collaborate with the Digital teams to develop and deliver insights driven integrated consumer experiences. Leverage on travelers insights to co-develop big and groundbreaking ideas and flesh them out across channels/mediums Identify together the right KPIs for marketing campaigns based on key objectives and drive towards these metrics Collaborate and support regional and local teams in developing and executing social media strategy, consumer engagement initiatives and retailers online presence   REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degree in marketing or equivalent At least 6 years of relevant experience and prior experience in cosmetics/ beauty/ retail industry will have an advantage Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written Ability to steer and drive the collaboration amongst the various stakeholders to achieve the brands’ objectives Commercially sound with experiences in launching new brands/ development brands with a good understanding of profit and loss accounting, sell-in/ sell out analysis, ROI calculation and the influence of operating factors e.g., volume vs price Creative and able to think big and act in detail Excellent organisation skill, able to prioritise Solution orientated, decisive by nature and resourceful in the approach A collaborative team player – concerned with the team success as well as individual performance Strong interpersonal skill - good listener, will challenge constructively and respond well to feedback Self-starter - high energy levels with positive and a collaborative can do mentality

jobTitle: Agency Sales Manager, Google Customer Solutions - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: Agency Sales Manager, Google Customer Solutions - Singapore  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Additional Role Description  As an Agency Sales Manager in Google Customer Solutions (GCS), you will lead a Sales team working to grow the business of key advertisers across a set of high-growth markets in Southeast/South Asia (including Malaysia, Philippines, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka). In this particular segment of our business, our advertisers primarily work with Traditional Media Agencies, and in this role, you will build relationships with our partners and influence at this level as well.  In addition, part of your remit will be to grow Google’s business in these markets and influence resourcing/internal investment decisions. As such, you will contribute to driving market-level plans, and be a key contributing member of the GCS Leadership team in Southeast Asia.  Responsibilities Recruit, retain, motivate, and develop a sales team by providing coaching on senior-level engagement, effective questioning, objection handling, and competitive selling Analyze data, trends, and customer performance with your team to develop strategic plans for customers Lead and strengthen executive-level relationships through key C-level meetings and business reviews Influence internal regional and global decision makers to advocate for resourcing/investment to accelerate growth in these markets Represent the GCS business for Malaysia, Philippines, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka to internal, cross-functional stakeholders on topics such as market business reviews, annual planning, etc. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 11 years of experience in technology, advertising, or management consulting People management experience Preferred Qualifications Experience working with the following markets: Philippines, Malaysia, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, and/or Bangladesh Experience in online media, brand and performance advertising Experience building relationships with C-level executives Ability to lead and grow a sales team with track record of success in sales and/or partner management Ability to drive business growth, meet business objectives, and act as a key spokesperson Ability to speak in one or more of the following languages: Tagalog, Malay, Urdu, Bengali, to interact with external stakeholders in these local markets
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Aspire: Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.   In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn’s Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don’t take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  Objective of the role: The goal for this position is to drive exponential growth by boosting the lead generation of startups across APAC. You will have full ownership of the outreach strategy in your vertical to become the number one financial operating system for digital businesses in Singapore. The core responsibilities will be to hire/train/manage a Business Development team, develop a robust lead strategy and work closely with the commercial management team to launch new products that fit customers requirements.  Note: Aspire is looking to hire 2 different positions: Head of Business Development (Cards), and Head of Business Development (FX).  As the Head of BD for our card OR FX vertical, you will be reporting and working closely with the Head of Sales. Your mission will be to make Aspire the #1 Financial OS for startups in APAC.  Your responsibilities: Growing our card OR FX vertical as a standalone business unit with well-defined performance targets in terms of growth  Build, manage and train a business development team of overachievers focused on B2B card spenders (Cards) OR cross border payers (FX). Keeping a tab on latest developments in the industry and identify growth opportunities for the company Establish, build and nurture relationships with payment gateways/e-commerce associations/travel agencies/marketing agencies in Singapore  Identify new sales and marketing opportunities for new products, features and customer acquisition channels  Work along with sales teams to ensure that we deliver on the performance targets committed to our investors Track, measure, and report progress and performance to the head of sales  We would love to get to know you if you have the following:  7-10 years of experience spanning business development, sales, for a card provider (Amex/Visa/Mastercard) or payment gateway (PayPal/Braintree,Shopofy, etc.) Successful track record of hitting ambitious targets and posses wide network of digital companies across Singapore  Experience in hunting B2B companies in South East Asia and digital companies in particular would be an advantage  Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can coach / mentor their sales team while establishing a healthy working culture based on the Aspire principle Exceptional communication and collaboration capabilities Ability to coach and guide teams on successful strategies to employ for success. High-energy, results-oriented, creative leadership approach.   For Head of Business Development (Cards), kindly click on the Apply button in this Linkedin post. For Head of Business Development (FX), kindly apply via this link: https://boards.greenhouse.io/aspire/jobs/4145430004
industries: Financial Services

description: The Enterprise Account Manager will be responsible for developing and closing business with new and existing Enterprise customers. The focus will be in the largest and most strategic named accounts in the assigned territory.  To meet or exceed individual and team revenue targets in Enterprise market segment Achieve and exceed individual and team revenue targets Grow pipeline by teaming up with Inside Sales, System Engineers and Channel & Alliance partner sales teams Perform direct customer-facing enterprise sales activities in the field together with Channel and Alliance Partners Propose, coordinate and participate in marketing activities to enterprise named accounts Enter reliable forecasting and account/opportunity details in Veeam’s CRM (SalesForce) on a timely basis; Be an aggressive self-starter with the ability to build executive relationships, articulate Veeam’s solution and business value, create demand and close deals. Develop a pipeline of activity that focuses on short, medium, and long-term revenue opportunities within the assigned accounts that result in quarterly measured revenue generation Set the sales strategy that drives demand and revenue generation and is responsible for developing and executing the business plan that includes a team of resources Must be able to effectively find, assess, and prioritize existing and future opportunities in conjunction with the customer, Veeam teammates, and the Channel Partner ecosystem Engage with strategic alliance partners to drive mutually beneficial revenue opportunities Propose, coordinate and participate in marketing activities to enterprise named accounts Effectively executes territory plan, account plans and opportunity plans to maximize revenue Performs other relevant duties as assigned  Qualifications  Proven track record in acquisition of Large Enterprise customer is preferred. Being comfortable in building relationship at executive/C-Level customers Experienced in selling and working with relevant technology segment; Infrastructure, Software, Virtualization platforms, Cloud, Storage and Data Protection. Minimum of 8 or more years of direct enterprise sales experience Proven track record of accomplished value selling in the Enterprise. Must have an in-depth understanding of technology trends and issues and their impact in the Enterprise space Proven ability to develop new sales with prospecting, relationship building and executions skills Must have knowledge of solution selling and value-based selling techniques Be a high-energy and motivated salesperson who is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where roles and responsibilities change quickly Excellent verbal and written communication skill Ability to work independently with limited direction in a fast-paced environment Must be a Team Player ability to lead and leverage on extended team for successful sales campaigns.

description: LIXIL – WHO WE ARE Every person on the planet dreams of a better home. LIXIL makes that possible with pioneering water and housing products. Our purpose is to make better homes a reality for everyone, everywhere. LIXIL was created in 2011 through the consolidation of five of Japan’s most successful housing and building companies. Since then we’ve acquired some of the most trusted global brands in our industry.  WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR The Leader, Brand Marketing (INAX), LWT APAC is responsible for conceptualization, execution, and evaluation of a strategic brand communications plan to attain top of mind recall among its target audience, in support of the sales and marketing objectives of the INAX brand. The role and its responsibilities will evolve and grow over time to meet business and market demands. The selected individual is expected to embrace such changes and rise to the challenge of developing himself or herself along with opportunities within the company.   YOU WILL 1. Market Research Gather market/industry information and provide marketing expertise for reaching and being relevant to target audiences. 2. Brand Identity Guidelines Work collaboratively with Global Brand Identity and other Regional Brand Leads to provide regional context on Brand Identity Develop APAC Brand Identity Guidelines and specific applications, based on the Global Brand Identity Guidelines Conduct annual training on Brand Identity Guidelines and Applications Provide guidance to markets and other regional functions to ensure applications are compliant to the brand identity guidelines 3. Communications Plan Development Work collaboratively with global/regional/local product marketing, channel marketing, and commercial teams and other functional teams to understand product and channel objectives and strategies Create an integrated marketing communication plan based on brand, product, and channel objectives: identifying target audience, issues and opportunities, determining communication objectives, designing the communication strategy (message and creative strategies), selecting communication channels, formulating communication media plan, budget and timeline Develop marketing communication assets for new collections/products and specific campaigns Provide writing and editing support for all communication  4. Communication Plan Execution Source, hire and manage external resources (creative and media agencies, and other outsourced services) Coordinate projects with agencies and suppliers for the creative strategy development and production of communication materials Produce marketing communications materials on brand/technology/category/collections or model/products/others (e.g. advertisements, press releases, EDMs, etc) Provide support, as needed, for the day-to-day implementation of the marketing communications plan. Work with regional marketing functions such as Product, Channel, Digital, Training, Commercial and other related functions for the execution Work collaboratively with PA team to develop and manage media relations to promote brand and secure coverage of new products, campaigns, events, etc. Manage brand advocacy/CSR programs, if any Maintain marketing communication resources in internal resource databases (PIM, SHAREPOINT, BOX) 5. Communication Plan Control and Evaluation Prepare marketing budget and monitors spending Prepare project timeline and ensure project is progressing as scheduled, addressing issues along the way Monitor program implementation and provide program objective measurements, working collaboratively with related functions. 6. Reporting Prepare and present regular reports (monthly brand report, monthly marketing budget report, and other reports as required) 7. Standards and Processes Comply with marketing standards Assist with the development/improvement of marketing standards and processes over time  8. Miscellaneous Duties Ad hoc duties, as required  Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, and participating in professional organizations Enhance department’s overall competence by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests. Explore opportunities to always add value to job accomplishments   WILL BE GREAT IF YOU HAVE General Qualifications: University Degree in Business or Marketing Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent organizational and time/project management skills; ability to multi-task and react to shifting priorities while adhering to deadlines. Attention to detail is essential. Resourceful and self-motivated approach to work, with an interest in learning and growing professionally. Approachable team player who is results-oriented and can build relationships to achieve team goals. Experience: Minimum 8 years’ experience in brand or marketing communications for high-mass to luxury brands Related experience in building materials industry preferred, but not required.
industries: Consumer Goods and Building Materials

description: Inventors of Brand Power - the most powerful, iconic TV ad platform driving brand sales Creators of Home Tester Club - the world’s largest digital community of shoppers delivering social proof content Customized training program delivered by some of the industry's best The Role  We're on the hunt for seasoned sales guns to join our team in Singapore servicing our markets to get our amazing advertising solutions in front of the world’s biggest packaged goods brands.  This is a genuine sales role for people who are serious about selling – you are competitive, curious and an outstanding communicator.  If successful, you will join a group of like-minded new starters to be developed together with a specially designed training program simulcast from our global headquarters in Toronto.  When you join us you will work directly with the world’s top packaged goods companies, have the opportunity to travel the region meeting some of North America’s greatest marketing minds, and hone career-making sales, management and production skills across television, digital and social.  You'll also learn all you need to know about our company, our unique products and the secrets to selling as part of an extensive training program delivered by some of the industry's best.  Buchanan Group  Buchanan Group (a WPP company) is the world’s leading provider of endorsement advertising platforms across television, digital and social, i ncluding Brand Power, Medifacts and Home Tester Club. We’re big fans of authentic. Not just in the solutions we provide clients globally, but in the people we welcome to our team. Genuine team players up for collaborating, creating and celebrating awesome results for our clients.  We know passion beats pretense and that it’s the down-to-earth who best step up to any challenge. We champion diversity. We collaborate across sixteen offices worldwide. We’re expanding into new markets. We’re committed to solutions that drive measurable results for our clients. And we play as hard as we work.  With more than 100,000 staff based in 110 different countries, WPP is the world's largest creative transformation company and is home to some of the biggest communications, advertising and media agencies, including Ogilvy, GroupM, Grey and Wavemaker. A career with Buchanan Group opens up endless opportunities to learn and grow within a powerful network of WPP brands.  Things you're gonna like doing: Use some of your existing contacts in the market to generate meetings with prospective clients around Singapore Networking at a high level, getting to know our current clients while finding potential new ones Setting up meetings with top-tier CPG, FMCG and OTC companies across Singapore to educate about our platforms and how it can serve their business, using various tactics such as e-mail, telephone, LinkedIn etc. Use our pretty cool online CRM tools (salesforce.com) to maintain detailed information on contacts, accounts, meetings, and opportunities Work effectively with multiple internal departments to sell, execute, and manage campaigns (i.e. creative and production teams) Research and manage potential leads and prospects through LinkedIn and industry database subscriptions to understand market dynamics and key players Use your industry knowledge to establish areas of opportunity with potential clients Become an expert in product categories and advertising best practices in order to persuade marketers to consider Buchanan's tools Use the skills you develop to close business with new clients Build strong relationships with existing clients to grow book of business Prepare quotes for qualified prospects and opportunities Prioritize and organize the sales pipeline for maximum efficiency on a daily basis Qualifications and Experience you will have: University Degree (Business or Marketing preferred) or relevant experience 3+ years of relevant work experience (CPG exposure highly desirable) High levels of initiative, self-motivation and time management Competitive and ambitious nature, demonstrating a strong aptitude for sales Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills Experience leading a team highly desirable Ideal candidates will be mobile and open to an opportunity to live and work in a different country if desired at some stage in the future Features tell...but our Benefits SELL! Competitive base salary and lucrative commission scheme Excellent international career opportunities in a high growth company Training, training and more training – delivered by some of the industry’s best Relaxed (and pretty cool...if we don't say so ourselves) advertising agency environment with a commitment to professional development and progression We’re big fans of authentic.  Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to who we are, and what has always made us tick. We recruit and reward people based on capability and performance. We don’t discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. You may think we care about your purple hair or love of cats, but we don’t. We believe treating everyone with authenticity and respect simply gives us the best chance of delivering success.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: Interpersonal skills to work with a wide variety of people each day, build business, relationships and network by identifying and selling prospects. Identifies business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry; researching and analyzing sales options. Sells Solution by establishing contact and developing relationships with prospects; recommending solutions. Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance; researching and recommending new opportunities; recommending profit and service improvements. Identifies product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitors. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Giving demonstrations and presentations to help clients discover and understand products/services Negotiating contracts, terms and conditions Preparing tenders, proposals and quotations Reviewing cost and sales performance Ensuring that sales targets are met  Qualifications / Skills: Confidence and strong self-assuredness to succeed in cold-calling customers and making a sale Communication skills, especially persuasion, to clearly convey the benefits of a product/application to potential customers Strong presentation and negotiation skills Motivation for Sales Avaya contact center solution knowledge API and DevOps knowledge Cloud and AI knowledge Developer/Architect background preferred  Education and Experience requirements: Bachelor’s or master’s degree with a concentration in Technical/streams/Computer science, IT sales, or business administration preferred At least five (5) years of industry sales/pre-sales experience. Cloud certifications (Azure/AWS/Google). Knowledge of DevOps and advance technologies like AI/ML. Cloud services sales experience preferred.
