description: Help Flexport fix the user experience in global trade!  At Flexport, we know global trade can move the human race forward. That’s why it’s our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. Flexport today connects more than 10,000 clients, both consignees and shippers, across 109 countries. Our role is to help businesses of all sizes find the global trade solutions that will empower their success.  Now, more than ever, customers need our support to survive and win in 2021. Their success is our success. We work back from what’s best for them to find a solution. That’s why we are building the Platform for Global trade - a strategic model combining customer centricity, supply chain expertise, advanced technology and data analytics.  Our goal for this role is for you to be a proactive business partner to our clients and suppliers, designing and implementing the unique supply chain solutions that will propel our clients’ businesses forward. As a member of the Global Client Solutions Team, your mission will be to proactively grow our client relationships by building and implementing solutions to their critical supply chain challenges.  Adaptive Performance  In every role at Flexport we balance high levels of tactical performance (convergence and scalability) with high levels of adaptive performance (divergence and problem solving) – it means we are constantly learning and finding ways to improve. In this role, adaptive performance is essential to helping our clients understand and realize Flexport’s value proposition.  Client Solutions  The Client Solutions Manager will own the long-term client relationship, improving and growing the client’s business by identifying and implementing new and enduring global trade solutions to drive the client’s business forward. You will use your advanced knowledge of the client’s business goals, the industry, and Flexport’s services and solutions to proactively close and deliver new solutions that empower the client and deepen the client relationship. You will serve as the client’s trusted advisor, advocating for their needs with internal stakeholders and finding win-win solutions for the client and for Flexport. You will use regular client touchpoints and business reviews to help clients understand the value they are realizing and to capitalize on new opportunities to deepen the relationship. You will work cross-functionally – across Supply Chain Operations, Procurement, Account Solutions, Implementation, Industry SMEs, and Trade and Financial Services teams – to develop and execute on the client strategy in a deliberate way that maximizes the client’s outcomes. You will stay up-to-date on the latest industry and supply chain developments, so that you can proactively educate and support your clients through change. You will proactively monitor the client’s health to identify opportunities to improve client outcomes and ensure that Flexport meets its business objectives. With the support of Client Solutions Associates, you will help the client improve operational processes and streamline its supply chain. You will ensure high product adoption by mastering teaching the Flexport platform to help your clients get the most out of their Flexport experience. You will have constant opportunities to learn by attending and participating in account management meetings, training seminars, and workshops. Local Sales Building  The Client Solutions Manager will have the unique opportunity to build our local sales book out at Flexport and nurture a small team towards growing our portfolio of Singapore business. You will be accountable for identifying and growing local sales leads. You will programmatically grow interest in Flexport and show the power of our technology to existing clients in Sinagapore. You ideally have an existing network within Singapore that could be interested in our service and solutions. You are entrepreneurial and in addition to selling you are passionate about owning the end to end operations and implementation with the clients. Tactical performance  Here Are Some Of The Tactical Responsibilities For This Role  Our clients depend on us to manage their experience with high degrees of professionalism and attention to detail. After the initial client onboarding and solution adoption, you will own the client strategy. You will decide, document, and implement the long-term plan for Flexport to deliver for the client. You will understand and develop pricing strategies to drive profitability and growth. You will monitor the client’s performance and profitability over time, and work with the client to ensure a win-win relationship. You will serve as a critical operational expert during the client’s onboarding experience, ensuring that the client’s success criteria are accurately translated into standard operating procedures for the Supply Chain Operations team. You will identify and create new revenue opportunities by selling new Flexport solutions and services that empower our clients. You will demo Flexport’s value and service offerings for new stakeholders to ensure that the client realizes the full Flexport value. You will perform core account management activities to ensure excellent client outcomes, such as defining and refining the customer’s success criteria, responding to customer escalations, maintaining an accurate client forecast, and reporting on customer financial health. You will ensure that the client meets their financial agreements, managing credit and collections. You will respond to complex client escalations. You will need to acquire new clients through different channels including but not limited to MDR inbounds, network referrals, and facilitate their continuous growth by presenting Flexport’s product and service, and selling the value of technology in the logistics industry through remote and in-person meetings as the account and/or opportunity owners. You will manage a book of business where you and your team will own the long-term client relationship, improving and growing the client’s business by identifying and implementing new and enduring global trade solutions to drive the client’s business forward. You will also use regular client touch points and business reviews to help clients understand the value they are realizing and to capitalize on new opportunities to deepen the relationship. Experience  What you will need 5-8 years of experience in sales or account management roles, or equivalent relevant internal experience Working knowledge and experience of the local Singapore market - specifically a working knowledge and network for selling freight in Singapore. A background in logistics, freight forwarding, or supply chain (strongly preferred) You have existing experience in selling and a well developed network of regional HQ and local decision makers in Singapore Entrepreneurial mindset. You love building and scaling and the process of growing things from the ground up.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Logistics and Supply Chain, and Internet

jobTitle: Regional Vertical Market Manager, Healthcare, APAC
description: OBJECTIVE & PURPOSE  The Regional Vertical Market Manager (VMM), Healthcare, APAC is part of the APAC Regional Sales and Marketing team. He/she leads the Healthcare vertical in APAC and drives the Company strategy and game plan for this vertical. The incumbent is expected to share best practices across all the APAC sales teams and provide strategic direction, innovative solution development and compelling commercial offers for all key healthcare customers and strategic prospects in APAC. He/she positions GEODIS APAC as the preferred supply chain provider for the Healthcare sector, thereby supporting our growth towards doubling our revenue by 2023.   ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES  Vertical Market (VM) Leadership Define & drive the Healthcare strategy in APAC Create APAC Healthcare roadmap and be the project champion to execute the deliverables   Align and lead internal stakeholders to develop required core capabilities and value propositions Collaborate with strategic marketing team to design and deliver go-to-market value propositions Represent GEODIS APAC in all regional Healthcare forums and establish GEODIS as a recognized subject matter expert and thought leader in APAC Align APAC actions with the Corporate Healthcare VM Vice-Presidents (VPs) and leverage corporate to assist with APAC growth Lead the development of VM country champions and deliver relevant workshops & training in all countries Support and coach all key APAC countries to establish their own healthcare roadmaps Provide required reporting, vertical related information, monthly reports, newsletters for regional and/or global stakeholders  Business Development (BD) Leadership BD development strategy on Strategic Accounts/identified accounts in APAC Work closely with country, regional and global stakeholders to explore and hunt for new business as well as developmental opportunities Update relevant countries with target accounts and market knowledge information Ensure the development and maintenance of customer relationships and enhance overall client portfolio, safeguard sales revenue and ensure customer satisfaction Deploy a strong consultative selling approach to identify supply chain challenges and develop value creating solutions that drive increased scope of engagement and share of wallet for GEODIS. Support internal parties to develop best possible solutions for the customers Ensure development of cross selling in Asia and within the GEODIS network Ensure quality and volume of pipeline is consistent with our sales objectives Monitor and enforce CRM compliance Support and drive country KAMs to set-up country level Strategic Account Plans for their critical healthcare clients  Team Management Build up a team including regional KAMs and provide support for their key healthcare customers Matrix management of key country healthcare country KAMs, Field Sales Managers  Regional sales strategy contribution Support and drive our internal transformation program - CARE Go-To-Market (GTM) initiatives Contribute to the Regional Sales and Corporate Sales channels success by leading initiatives, projects and innovations  REQUIREMENTS Bachelor Degree in related disciplines Excellent sales, presentation and negotiation skills Strong consultative selling skills and a good understanding of customer psychology and purchasing patterns Strong confidence and competencies in building executive level relationships     Fluent in English and knowledge of any other APAC language is a plus 7 – 10 years working experience in the Healthcare industry or in a sales role managing healthcare customers Strong Sales or Business Development experience in Logistics, Freight Forwarding or Warehousing Tender processes management experience  Our Candidate promise  Recruiting passionate people  At GEODIS, we believe that each and every person matters when it comes to achieving long-lasting success and demonstrating our know-how. Our commitment to our customers leads us to recruit passionate and demanding men and women who are ready to fulfill the ambitions of our rapidly changing sector with all their energy.  Join a leader in constant evolution  With more than 100 years of experience in the field of transport and logistics, GEODIS knows how to respond to the major challenges. Throughout its history, GEODIS showed ability to adapt to the needs of its clients, industry-specific constraints and new national boundaries. With its talent pool, GEODIS opens you doors to the world full of dynamism where everyone finds their place in expertise, contributes to their development and succeeds. Being the key player of the supply chain, we are working on the logistics projects of our customers today and preparing those of tomorrow.  Creating daily opportunities  It is true that we are committed to offering autonomy and the opportunity to take initiative to each of our new hires. Therefore, it is necessary that they benefit from personalized and operational support that will allow them to understand the challenges of GEODIS and emphasize their strengths. We encourage openness. “Discuss. Decide. Align.”- this is a genuine moto to guarantee the success of our actions.  And if you were part of this adventure?  Being GEODIS employee means living every day professional and personal adventure. It is about incorporating your personality, your knowledge and your know-how in the culture and the team spirit of GEODIS. Involvement and collaboration make it easier for everyone to take responsibility. We encourage you to go and meet different expertise and our complementary ecosystems whose activities give meaning to the group.
jobFunction: Supply Chain, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: Job Summary  The Healthcare Marketing Manager creates and executes marketing plans and sales campaigns to grow volume, revenue, and profit within targeted segments. He/She collaborates with other groups to ensure the right messages get to the consumer through all communications channels. This position identifies targeted markets, researches buying behaviors, and translates buying behaviors into value propositions for customers. The Marketing Manager supervises others in the department.  Manages Projects Manages project lifecycles, including project scope, resources, schedule, initiation, start-up/design, building, and deployment to see projects from beginning-to-end. Forwards project documents to stakeholders to obtain sign-off, agreement on project cost, and needed resources. Develops project plans (i.e., detailed plan, milestones, and work breakdown structures) and assigns tasks to resources to ensure that the project will be completed on time and according to specifications. Ensures affected functions or groups are identified and works with them to negotiate process changes, ownership of processes, and to manage project impact. Designs and implements communication plans to ensure those affected by projects are informed and updated. Follows up with assigned resources formally (e.g., status meetings, etc.) and informally to continuously manage the productivity of the team, project timelines, and deliverables. Balances multiple projects and deployment schedules to meet stakeholder goals and expectations.  Develops Market Strategies Analyses marketing research information to develop a value proposition that clearly articulates UPS's positioning against the competition. Builds and presents marketing tools and information to internal stakeholders to gain approval of marketing plans. Provides subject matter expertise to ensure marketing plans are on target, to clarify product positioning issues and make changes to the plans when necessary. Conducts meetings with internal groups (e.g., Customer Service Centers, Customer Technology Marketing, etc.) to explain benefits for new offerings and how to position new programs and offerings in the marketplace. Develops business case documentation to establish baseline for opportunities and challenges to gaining market share. Works with corporate teams to develop comprehensive marketing materials and collateral. Implements measurement plans to ensure effective tracking of direct marketing activities and program or product deployment (e.g., enrollment, activations, etc.).  Identifies Customer Needs and Industry Segment Trends Maintains regular communication with marketing sources (e.g., sales force, segment managers, pricing region and field marketing managers, Business Information Analysis, Pricing, Customer Service Center, etc.) to gain insight into the needs of customers. Reviews industry sources (e.g., periodicals, financial reports, field reviews, etc.) to stay current on trends and issues that impact customers. Visits customers, talks to association contacts, and challenges team members, peers, and leaders to expand customer knowledge and stay apprised of current customer needs and issues. Conducts market research to understand the needs of customers and to define the scope of new offerings. Conducts brainstorming sessions with internal and external groups within areas of UPS’s strategic focus to identify new concepts or enhancements to UPS products and/or programs. Conducts primary research to understand customer needs and identify opportunities to enhance the value proposition of UPS. Identifies and analyzes segment trends that will significantly impact UPS and/or customers to develop projections of customer needs and potential solutions.  Identifies Target Markets Analyzes and synthesizes market research to identify target markets based on size, opportunity, profit, and ability to win business. Uses financial analyses of projected growth in targeted segments, products, or program groups to determine future target markets. Conducts projected growth analyses of target markets to forecast financial success of initiatives and marketing efforts. Develops business case models of targeted markets to support development of new offerings within defined markets.  Analyzes and Reports Performance of Segments or Products Reviews annual situation assessment (i.e., SWOT [strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats] analysis) to understand past performance of products and services. Researches internal and external customer data to understand factors driving product performance and results. Identifies strategic implementation opportunities of key customer issues to develop alternatives in incentive plans, product repositioning and new approaches to the marketplace. Analyzes product and revenue performance (e.g., monthly, bi-monthly, quarterly, annually, etc.) to report any variances to plan. Presents findings on key issues to stakeholders to gain departmental approvals for new products and services. Monitors and reports performance of marketing initiatives to senior management to explain any variance to plan and outline key learnings or issue. Supports annual business planning process to ensure planned growth is aligned with market & initiatives.  Conducts Competitive Analysis Works with competitive analysis groups to gather information related to targeted markets. Analyzes product share position by volume and revenue to determine the competitive position of UPS offerings in the marketplace. Analyzes competitors’ messages (e.g., advertising, trade show sponsorships, marketing campaigns, etc.) to understand their market position and make strategic recommendations for UPS offerings. Collaborates with customers and sales force to gain insight on competitive advantages and disadvantages to develop business cases for marketing to strategic industry subsegments and customer segments.  Identifies Customers’ Objectives and Business needs Work with UPS Sales and segment marketing to identify needs of customers (eg technology capabilities, increasing efficiency, specific services) in HGA accounts to determine long-term goals and strategies to provide value-added solutions to ensure business growth, customer retention and strengthen relationships Conducts research to determine the compatibility of UPS offering with customers’ needs and gain an understanding of the business model, market conditions and competitors.  Develops and Maintains Subject Matter Expertise Participates in professional associations to further knowledge and gain insights into current industry trends. Reviews industry-related publications to enhance knowledge and understanding of the industry and the market.  Manages And Develops Others Manages resources and people processes (e.g., Performance Management, Career Development, Training, Staffing, etc.) to ensure the day to day administration of processes and formal procedures. Identifies individual and team skill gaps and developmental opportunities (e.g., training, special assignments, conferences, projects, etc.) to facilitate individual and team development. Ensures that direct and indirect reports have documented career goals and detailed plans for achieving these goals to develop them personally and professionally. Conducts frequent performance evaluations in a consistent, fair, and objective manner to facilitate open communication and encourage continuous performance improvement. Holds others accountable to established performance levels to achieve individual and group goals. Resolves individual and group performance issues in accordance with UPS’s policies and procedures in a timely manner to motivate and foster teamwork. Coaches others and provides on-going feedback and support to improve performance. Identifies opportunities to involve others in new and challenging work assignments and/or rotations that advance the skills and capabilities of individuals and the organization.  Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Business or healthcare related field 5 years of working experience in Supply Chain or healthcare industry, experience in Contract Logistics would be an advantage Analytical skills – quantitative and qualitative Experience in Digital Marketing Experience in a regional role within the APAC region Excellent time management skills in a fast-paced environment with the ability to work efficiently while meeting tight deadlines Demonstrated ability to work cross functionally, with clients, and with various levels of UPS management Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented environment Ability to articulate ideas clearly in both oral and written communication
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain, Public Relations and Communications, and International Trade and Development

Develops business case documentation to establish baseline for opportunities and challenges to gaining market share. Works with corporate teams to develop comprehensive marketing materials and collateral. Implements measurement plans to ensure effective tracking of direct marketing activities and program or product deployment (e.g., enrollment, activations, etc.).  Identifies Customer Needs and Segment Trends Maintains regular communication with marketing sources (e.g., sales force, segment managers, pricing region and field marketing managers, Business Information Analysis, Pricing, Customer Service Center, etc.) to gain insight into the needs of customers. Reviews segment sources (e.g., periodicals, financial reports, field reviews, etc.) to stay current on trends and issues that impact customers. Visits customers, talks to association contacts, and challenges team members, peers, and leaders to expand customer knowledge and stay apprised of current customer needs and issues. Conducts market research to understand the needs of customers and to define the scope of new offerings. Conducts brainstorming sessions with internal and external groups within areas of UPS’s strategic focus to identify new concepts or enhancements to UPS products and/or programs. Conducts primary research to understand customer needs and identify opportunities to enhance the value proposition of UPS. Identifies and analyzes segment trends that will significantly impact UPS and/or customers to develop projections of customer needs and potential solutions.  Identifies Target Markets Analyzes and synthesizes market research to identify target markets based on size, opportunity, profit, and ability to win business. Uses financial analyses of projected growth in targeted segments, products, or program groups to determine future target markets. Conducts projected growth analyses of target markets to forecast financial success of initiatives and marketing efforts. Develops business case models of targeted markets to support development of new offerings within defined markets.  Analyzes and Reports Performance of Segments Reviews annual situation assessment (i.e., SWOT [strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats] analysis) to understand past performance of products and services. Researches internal and external customer data to understand factors driving product performance and results. Identifies strategic implementation opportunities of key customer issues to develop alternatives in incentive plans, product repositioning and new approaches to the marketplace. Analyzes product volume and revenue performance (e.g., monthly, bi-monthly, quarterly, annually, etc.) to report any variances to plan. Presents findings on key issues to stakeholders to gain departmental approvals for new products and services. Monitors and reports performance of marketing initiatives to senior management to explain any variance to plan and outline key learnings or issue.  Conducts Competitive Analysis Works with competitive analysis groups to gather information related to targeted markets. Analyzes product share position by volume and revenue to determine the competitive position of UPS offerings in the marketplace. Analyzes competitors’ messages (e.g., advertising, trade show sponsorships, marketing campaigns, etc.) to understand their market position and make strategic recommendations for UPS offerings. Collaborates with customers and sales force to gain insight on competitive advantages and disadvantages to develop business cases for marketing to strategic industries and customer segments.  Identifies Customers’ Objectives and Business needs Work with UPS Sales and segment marketing to identify needs of customers (eg technology capabilities, increasing efficiency, specific services) in HGA accounts to determine long-term goals and strategies to provide value-added solutions to ensure business growth, customer retention and strengthen relationships Conducts research to determine the compatibility of UPS offering with customers’ needs and gain an understanding of the business model, market conditions and competitors.  Directs Field Marketing Collaborates with Sales, and other UPS (internal) stakeholders to align efforts in delivering the solutions needed Formulate and lead implementation of relevant marketing campaigns in identified target markets Facilitates and participates in strategy sessions with the Sales team to communicate customer needs and provide recommendations and coordinate needed support from other UPS stakeholders  Manages And Develops Others Manages resources and people processes (e.g., Performance Management, Career Development, Training, Staffing, etc.) to ensure the day to day administration of processes and formal procedures. Identifies individual and team skill gaps and developmental opportunities (e.g., training, special assignments, conferences, projects, etc.) to facilitate individual and team development. Ensures that direct and indirect reports have documented career goals and detailed plans for achieving these goals to develop them personally and professionally. Conducts frequent performance evaluations in a consistent, fair, and objective manner to facilitate open communication and encourage continuous performance improvement. Holds others accountable to established performance levels to achieve individual and group goals. Resolves individual and group performance issues in accordance with UPS’s policies and procedures in a timely manner to motivate and foster teamwork. Coaches others and provides on-going feedback and support to improve performance. Identifies opportunities to involve others in new and challenging work assignments and/or rotations that advance the skills and capabilities of individuals and the organization. Makes salary recommendations to reward employee performance.  Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Business or healthcare related field 5 years of working experience in Supply Chain or healthcare industry Analytical skills – quantitative and qualitative Experience in a regional role within the APAC region Excellent time management skills in a fast-paced environment with the ability to work efficiently while meeting tight deadlines Demonstrated ability to work cross functionally, with clients, and with various levels of UPS management Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented environment Ability to articulate ideas clearly in both oral and written communication
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain, Public Relations and Communications, and International Trade and Development

description: The Regional Account Manager is responsible for regional client engagement, driving local relationships and moving the engagement forward as part of the Workspace strategy. This role will be based in Singapore.  Key Focus Areas • Strategic Thinking • Relationship and Trust Building • Communication at Senior Level • Continuous Improvement • Leadership • Commercial Acumen  Key Tasks and Responsibilities Strategic Thinking • Adapts global strategy in line with regional differences. • Delivers regional initiatives. • Recognizes regional challenges and adapts in line with global strategy. • Supports development of innovative solutions. • Keeps informed of developments within clients’ organisation and industry. • Delivers revenue growth in line with regional opportunities and internal targets.  Relationship and Trust Building • Develops and manages both regional & local relationships with key accounts. • Delivers excellent client survey results through strong leadership.  Communication at Senior Level • Aware of impact and adjust communication style accordingly. • Ability to influence without authority to ensure the needs of the client are fulfilled. • Collaborates with regional stakeholders to deliver client objectives.  Continuous Improvement • Responsible for ensuring excellent customer service and exceeding the client KPIs • Makes recommendations for change  Leadership • Demonstrates and promotes the company vision and values • Leads a diverse global team to the same objectives • Articulates the vision of the client engagement and executes the strategy. • Demonstrates Leadership to internal and client stakeholders.  Commercial Acumen • Awareness of regional financial performance. • Ability to respond / manage regional RFP’s.  Aptitude, Knowledge and Qualifications  Aptitude • Ability to respond resourcefully and constructively to new demands, priorities, and challenges. • Ability to develop compelling sales presentations. • Ability to create new business opportunities. • Plan, implement and deliver business goals. • Set priorities, manage your time and workload and dependably meet strict deadlines. • Work efficiently in a high-pressured environment.  Professional Knowledge and Skills • Ability to read, analyse, and interpret contracts. • Demonstrated ability to influence decision makers and close new business propositions. • Must have ability to effectively present information to C-Level and senior management, prospects, and/or public groups. • Highly customer service oriented/driven interpersonal skills. • Ability to multi-task and organize work streams to meet client deadlines. • Cultural Awareness • Assignment Management knowledge • Project Management Skills • Negotiation Skills • Willingness to travel • Strong excel skills • Strong CRM experience & skillset.  Qualifications • College degree or equivalent. • 5+ Years of Account Management experience at a regional level or above. • International experience. • Experience in construction or commercial real estate industry is a plus. jobTitle: E-commerce Sales & Category Specialist, SG MSU
description: The E-commerce Sales & Category Specialist, SG MSU shall develop our coffee business across E-commerce channels in the Singapore market, and is responsible to deliver a certain level of business performance of these channels (NOS, EBIT, OWC and E-commerce KPI’s).  The E-commerce Sales & Category Specialist, SG MSU reports into the Country Manager, SG MSU.  Goal & Key responsibilities  In your role as eCommerce Sales and Category Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in JDE eCommerce within the SEA region. You will be an active member of the SEA eCommerce Centre of Expertise Team (CoE), and will actively participate into the new dynamic of our fast growing coffee business on the on-line channel. You will be reporting to the Country Manager for Singapore.  Responsibilities/Key Activities  ·       Manage the day to day commercial operations across our on-line channels in Singapore and extensively in South East Asia markets where needed  o    Execution of the assortment & pricing strategy  o    Execution of the perfect basic and rich content  o    Input into volume forecasting process collaborating closely with supply chain  o    Define a Visibility and Promotional planning to Win the big Events such as 11:11 or BlackFriday or Prime Day.  o    Win the Search for the Coffee category  ·       Manage the day to day relationship with 3rd Party Marketplace (MP) partners, to ensure a perfect execution of our eCommerce Fundamentals and Win the big Events  o    Build a winning way of working with the selected 3rd Party MP partner  o    Be the single point of contact between the 3rd Party MP partner and internal stakeholders such as eCommerce CoE Team, Category Managers, Performance Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance Team and Business Intelligence  o    Define what’s to be done to Win the big Events such as 11:11, Black Friday or Prime Day.  o    Define analysis tools and dashboards to test and learn fast and nurture the JDE eCommerce strategy in the region.  ·       Identify any new or additional business opportunities for Marketplaces ranging from product development to operational improvements  ·       Lead the perfect execution of the JDE eCommerce Fundamentals in SEA region by building a collaborative and winning relationship with local JDE eCommerce contact in the markets.  ·       Deliver business KPIs: Nos, GP, Market Shares, Share of Search, Eventing    Qualifications  University Graduate    Additional Information  Must have:  o    4+ years of experience in eCommerce Sales Development, including Account Management, Content execution, Marketplace relationship and 3rd Party partner relationship  o    Experience with Beverage, Food or FMCG within a digital environment, and/or Digital Marketplace (Lazada, LazMall, Ali, Amazon…) is strong plus  o    A good knowledge of how to win at eCommerce channels: Grocery on- line, Marketplaces and PurePlayers will be an advantage  o    A good knowledge of Microsoft Office is required  o    You are accountable for the targets and results and capable of communicating with impact on a transparent way (in time, open, honest and with respect) & across different levels in the JDE organization and with external partners  o    You act in an entrepreneur mindset, influence internal stakeholders to follow your recommendations, and you are capable of making the difference in digital transformation in a fast-moving organization  o    Your skills in English language are excellent  o    You are full of energy, active team member, open, curious and fast learner  o    Flexible, attentive to details and you are able to prioritize the workflow independently

description: We're looking for a Marketing Executive to join 90 Seconds and support our team on our marketing initiatives, provide data and storytelling expertise as we drive the growth, retention, engagement on the 90 Seconds platform.  You’ll be given the opportunity to have a large impact on the overall business, working closely with a cross-functional team, improving processes, tracking, analytical insights, and turning the data into an insightful story.  WHAT YOU'LL LOVE DOING Analyze data, present trends, and insights for content creation and audience engagements. Create high-quality reports and documentation for external audiences in an attempt to further enhance CRM efforts. Analyze campaign data across different channels, interpret data to identify key insights, and create compelling stories and reports backed by data. Develop a deep understanding of our target audience and the customer journey in order to optimize the funnel by leveraging growth marketing initiatives, leverage data and analytics to find new growth & optimization opportunities. Working closely with the Growth team to nurture and generate leads, create insights blog articles, and creating sales decks. Translate analytics and insights into the actionable, measure and communicate the effectiveness of overall growth initiatives, and channels performance  WHO YOU ARE You have a genuine interest in analyzing data. You have profound knowledge of key digital analytics (lifetime value, retention or life-cycle segmentation, attribution) and experience with analytical and CRM tools (i.e. Google Analytics). You possess a passion for improving processes, tracking, and analytical insights. Experience in campaign reporting and analysis, creating high-quality reports and documentation for external audiences in an attempt to further enhance CRM efforts Speed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter attitude. A love of data & storytelling - you just go get the data you need and turn it into an insightful story. You thrive in and contribute to a positive, collaborative, work environment and are self-motivated, resourceful, and detail-oriented - you get stuff done!

jobTitle: Sales Enablement Business Partner - Asia Pacific Japan
description: Sales Enablement Business Partner Asia Pacific Japan  There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Snowflake, the company that delivers the Data Cloud to Mobilize the World’s Data, is actively seeking a Sales Enablement Business Partner based in Singapore to support the Asia Pacific Japan (APJ) segment.  In this role, which reports to the Director of Sales Best Practices and Enablement, you will be a key contributor to the vision and realization of our overall sales enablement strategy.  In This Role You Will Get To Serve as the voice of Global Sales Enablement in the APJ segment, leading communication and execution of the global enablement plan in the segment. Establish yourself with sales leadership and cross functional partners in marketing and sales operations as an extended member of their leadership teams. Connect with a broad range of stakeholders to identify enablement needs in the sales organization. Manage the intake process and prioritize segment specific enablement requests based on expected business impact. Lead and manage projects that produce segment specific selling and enablement assets. Where applicable, manage the process and resources (internal or external) to localize these assets to the needs of the sales team. Build strong partnerships and align with internal and cross functional SMEs on enablement content creation and delivery. Coordinate and schedule activities and people in support of new hire onboarding, Sales Kickoff and ongoing enablement. Keep the field informed on all things enablement - offerings, process, systems, due dates, progress reports, etc. - through active communication and awareness campaigns. Collaborate with your Global Sales Enablement peers to shape and continuously refine the onboarding program, quarterly enablement plan and on-demand enablement offerings based on the needs of the segment. Collaborate with your Sales Enablement Business Partner peers from around the world on common needs, and share content and other enablement assets to speed time to impact in your segment. On Day One We Will Expect You To Have A minimum of 8 years of related experience with a focus in enterprise software, sales and enablement. Strong project management skills. Highly organized with excellent communication skills. Ability to manage competing priorities across multiple projects, while meeting deadlines and producing quality deliverables. Business, technical and sales acumen. Understanding of complex sales cycles, processes and methodologies. Ability to lead through influence. Experience working in a fast-changing environment that requires strategic thinking, resourcefulness, agility, results-oriented decision making and commitment to excellence. Bachelor’s degree Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?  To Apply For The Role Use This Link  https://careers.snowflake.com/us/en/job/5534421002/Sales-Enablement-Business-Partner-APJ

description: Company Description  For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose-built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,900 companies and have detected 100 Million threats/day.  We work in a fast-paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrives on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.  Traditional security companies are becoming less relevant as cloud adoption and digital transformation become the norm in every market industry and in every market segmentation. Zscaler has been a leader in Gartner’s MQ for 10 consecutive years and has helped shape the emerging SASE category (a true category creator). We are well positioned to dominate this massively growing cloud security market.  Job Description  Position: Regional Sales Director, ASEAN  Location: Singapore  The Regional Sales Director, ASEAN for Enterprise will report to Regional Director, APJ for Enterprise in APAC Region and will be responsible for building, directing and managing all field sales within the ASEAN region. You will have the opportunity to direct and drive new business, build customer loyalty, ensure high product renewal rates and support and promote corporate strategies and initiatives. Critical to success is the ability to build and manage high-performance teams, develop and execute area business plans, allocate appropriate resources, and develop internal and external relationships.  The Zscaler sales team is comprised of smart and tenacious people who are passionate about our vision of a secure, cloud-enabled digital future. By using their talent to share that vision, Zscaler sales teams are bringing the power and agility of cloud transformation to organizations around the world. Be a part of it!  Responsibilities/What You’ll Do Lead a team of Regional Sales Manager (Field Sales Reps) to overachieve sales goals Recruit, hire and develop world class sales talent Partner with marketing and channel to create a rolling 5x pipeline Develop and execute a regional strategy that ensures quarterly sales quota achievement Ensure sales processes and programs are part of the sales culture to ensure visibility, predictability, and consistency Create and maintain an operations plan with goals and objectives for the region, based on opportunity, customer needs, and strategic direction Qualifications  Qualifications/Your Background: Bachelor's degree or global equivalent in a related field 7+ years of Enterprise Sales Leadership experience in software/SaaS Proven track record of building and leading successful sales teams Strong sales process and methodology around territory planning, assessment, and resource allocation. Extensive business travel within the region - approximately 75 percent. Strong leadership, planning, execution, people-management, and coaching skills. Strong communication skills and demonstrated ability to establish credibility and trust with customers and to build influential relationships with partners in the business, including Finance, Legal, HR, Inside Sales, Channel Partners and R&D. Understand both business and people, including their drivers and success factors. Understand and communicate the business value and/or ROI of installed and proposed products and solutions. Additional Information  Why Zscaler?  People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.  Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.  Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  Adobe Sign  Adobe's solutions meet the needs of a diverse customer base that spans from consumer to enterprise. Adobe Document Cloud is a complete portfolio of secure digital document solutions that speeds business transactions through 100% digital workflows. It includes Acrobat DC and Adobe Sign services, plus web and mobile apps that integrate into your existing document processes, productivity apps, and systems. With Adobe Sign, users can edit, sign, send and track documents wherever they are — across desktops, mobile and web. Businesses embarking on digital transformation strategies can leverage Adobe Sign to drive better customer experiences, and organisational agility. The adoption of eSignatures as a solution is set to grow exponentially, and Adobe Sign offers the best in class offering, from the market leader in secure document communications and founder of the PDF standard.  The challenge  The Adobe Sign Enterprise Sales Account Executive will accelerate the growth of Adobe Sign to net new customers in South East Asia across all Enterprise verticals – this is very much a “Hunter” role. This person will be a seasoned sales professional preferably working in new businesses who can identify strategic business opportunities and work independently or in partnership with Adobe Sales teams to achieve the revenue targets. This role is instrumental in contributing to a high performing sales culture and requires a highly passionate, confident and influential person who can develop strong business relationships internally and externally!  What The Role Includes Identify greenfield opportunities for Adobe Sign across Enterprise verticals, and develop a list of target accounts. Develop measurable, strategic sales plans for your target accounts and identify required resources. Evangelise Adobe Sign with prospects and customers and work with internal pre-sales resources and/or partner to develop the right solution for the customer. Utilise Salesforce.com for end to end pipeline management by building strong working relationships with the various sales teams and field marketing teams.  What's Needed To Succeed 10-15 years Direct Enterprise Sales experience in software and/or SaaS solutions. Selling to FSI, Telcos, Aviation, eCommerce, manufacturing or professional services verticals highly regarded. Ability to understand complex business environments and uncover customer issues, process problems, and translate need into business opportunities. Comfortable talking internal/external customers and building relationships, and monetising them. Strong ability to demonstrate value propositions & ROI in sophisticated environments to a wide variety of individuals; technical and/or executive audiences. Build, run and lead accurate pipeline and forecasts. Ability to work in a fast paced, changing environment while still providing quality opportunities and driving revenue. Exceed sales targets while aiding the entire organisation to do the same. Strong results-oriented personality, self-motivated and self-managing. Highly ethical; will always do what is right by the organisation and customer over personal gain. Executive presentation and communication skills. Strong team orientation and ability to build cross-functional relationships.

description: About Clearwater Analytics® Clearwater Analytics® is a global SaaS solution for automated investment data aggregation, reconciliation, accounting, and reporting. Clearwater helps thousands of organizations make the most of investment portfolio data with cloud-native software and client-centric servicing. Every day, investment professionals worldwide trust Clearwater to deliver timely, validated investment data and in-depth reporting. Clearwater aggregates, reconciles, and reports on more than $5.5 trillion in assets across thousands of accounts daily for our Fortune 500 clients.  Description We are looking for a Presales Consultant to join our APAC sales team. As a Presales Consultant, you will assist and facilitate key deliverables utilized within the sales process with a focus on writing and creating formal documentation for Clearwater, including adherence and support of guidelines for the Sales Team. You will contribute to and develop sales resources as needed, looking for ways to proactively add value to the Clearwater sales offering.  The ideal candidate is adept at solving problems and seeks to continually develop new skills. We are looking for a creative, self-starter who has the ability to work well with, and gain the respect of, both internal colleagues and external stakeholders.  Responsibilities Develop a deep understanding of Clearwater’s product Understand the prospect needs and can create a storyline working with the Sales Director Create collaterals and deliverables, including templates for client presentations, training materials, stakeholder presentations, and tailoring presentations to meet the needs of the specific client/prospect. Assist in the successful completion, organization and delegation for prospect RFPs Understand prospective clients’ current infrastructure, business requirements and subsequent challenges Master and effectively communicate Clearwater’s value proposition Provide relevant product and market feedback to Clearwater’s product management, development, global delivery and client services teams Collaboratively organize resources across Clearwater to support sales efforts Capable of solving complex and abstract problems Assist with critical research and preparation for sales visits  Requirements Bachelor’s degree in related field Asset Management, Insurance or FinTech industry experience Accounting and/or reporting experience Superb written communication skills along with experience working with PowerPoint for client and internal stakeholder meetings Analytical skills Persuasive, clear and concise communication Ability to develop a strong understanding of the Clearwater system and communicate this in both internal meetings and with clients and prospects Motivation to continually learn and solve problems for our clients

jobTitle: Channel Sales Manager (ASEAN & India) - Remote, Singapore
description: Channel Sales Manager (ASEAN & India) - remote role, Singapore  The Channel Sales Manager is responsible for sales enablement of their assigned channel, and managing their channel to achieve stated sales targets.  The Channel Sales Manager is a grade 8. Responsibilities Responsible for the day-to-day relationship management of channel partners Act as a liaison between the GitLab and assigned channel partners. Build, maintain, and manage relationships with current and prospective channel partners. Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned partner accounts. Coordinate the involvement of GitLab personnel, including support, service, and management resources, in order to meet partner performance objectives and partners’ expectations. Sell through partner organizations to end users in coordination with partner sales resources. Meet assigned targets for profitable sales volume and strategic objectives in assigned partner accounts. Manage direct/channel conflict by fostering excellent communication between the channel and direct teams Ensures partner compliance with Channel Partner programs and agreements Participate in a partner planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones associated with a productive partner relationship. Identifies partner GTM &/or services offerings; working with partner sales resources, serives, marketing, etc. develop & launch offerings to point of incremental join revenue achievement Builds relationships with technology vendors to identify mutual greenfield opportunities with shared partners  Requirements Previous experience of driving channel sales ideally within the same product category and channel. Must have experience working with partners extensively in SE Asia and India Experience selling in the Software Development Tools and/or Application Lifecycle Management space via channel partnerships Experience managing partner relationships that are based in developing and delivering service offerings tied to vendor product Experience selling Open Source Solutions 5+ years of experience with B2B sales 10 years selling high technology products in assigned territory in a channel model Interest in GitLab, and open source software Effective communicator with excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to build strong relationships with partners and GitLab teams. Strong personal network within the industry. Driven, highly motivated and results driven. You share our values, and work in accordance with those values. Leadership at GitLab Ability to use GitLab   Top 10 reasons to work for GitLab: Work with helpful, kind, motivated, and talented people. Work remote so you have no commute and are free to travel and move. Have flexible work hours so you are there for other people and free to plan the day how you like. Everyone works remote, but you don't feel remote. We don't have a head office, so you're not in a satellite office. Work on open source software so you can interact with a large community and can show your work. Work on a product you use every day: we drink our own wine. Work on a product used by lots of people that care about what you do. As a company we contribute more than we take, most of our work is released as the open source GitLab CE. Focused on results, not on long hours, so that you can have a life and don't burn out. Open internal processes: know what you're getting in to and be assured we're thoughtful and effective.  Work remotely from anywhere in the world. See our culture page for more!

description: We are searching for an experienced Partner Manager at our Singapore facility. Are you an experienced shipping expert with commercial or operational background? Do you enjoy bringing the outside-in view to an organisation and focus on building solid external relationships? As our new Partner Manager, we invite you to join us on a journey where you can play a central part in building and developing our pool partner experience and the products and services we deliver to them. Reporting to the Global Head of Partner Sales & Services, you will play a significant role in developing existing partner relations across our pools and supporting the continuous development of our offerings. As part of the position, you will own the day-to-day relationship with named partners, ensuring we optimise both the partner’s and our own returns. The position is based in Singapore, focusing on developing key partnerships assigned to you.  We offer Maersk Tankers is pursuing an aspirational strategy focused on optimising partner returns. A key element in that strategy is taking an external view when propelling, improving and developing our business. We have a diverse base of partners, from various types of shipowners to privately owned companies and institutional investors. We have set out with the goal of tying together commercial management activities, ensuring end-to-end responsibility for generating industry leading returns for our partners. The role is based out of our Singapore office, as proximity to business operations and partners is key. Some travel should be expected as part of the role.  Maersk Tankers offers an attractive career with the possibility of continuous professional and personal development. We focus on diversity and equal opportunities, we work in an informal and flexible space, striving to provide an optimal work-life balance.  Key Responsibilities Today, Maersk Tankers manages around 220 partner vessels from 40+ different partners. You will play a central role in optimising the partner TCE, keeping an overview of all commercial management activities of your assigned pool partners, advising and guiding them internally and handling exceptions where need be.  You will be responsible for commercial management product and related services together with the rest of the Partner Services team, including making sure our product suite keeps developing, meeting the needs of our partners. You will represent Maersk Tankers and its services externally, being the link between internal functions and field of delivery. Internally, you will work closely with our chartering, operations, finance, analytics and legal teams to ensure synergy in commercial development. You will develop and contribute with new ideas on specific engagement plans, as well as work on continuously refining the value proposition we offer to our customers and partners. A proven track record with Sales Targets being attained and exceeded and an ability to grow the business through establishing and maintaining local networks will be a key factor of the role - pls note only short listed applicants will be contacted"

description: Overview of Role:  Fenergo's Client Solutions Consulting Team is at the forefront of our company's success and growth strategy as it works collaboratively with prospect clients to identify current opportunities and challenges, develop knowledge and understanding of our solution and determine how to leverage Fenergo it for their business. Essentially, we build on our extensive industry experience to identify a client’s strategic and tactical goals and align them to where Fenergo can solve their challenges and realise their ambitions. We then take this analysis a step further by demonstrating how Fenergo can add real quantifiable value for their organisation.  The Client Solutions team work closely with our Global Sales Teams who identify potential opportunities and we then provide the detailed business and technical support throughout the sales cycle. Similarly, we work closely with our product team identifying gaps and opportunities directly contributing to the product roadmap and our future success.  This is a client-facing role so you will have to build relationships and act as the first point of contact with the client’s stakeholders and subject matter experts. The role requires absolute professionalism in advising clients and guiding them through the multi-faceted change process to deliver early and continuous value to their organisations.  Core Responsibilities:  For each prospect engagement you will work alongside the sales team and other internal stakeholders including the regulatory team, professional services, and a technical team to guide the client through the following key tasks: Ensure that the Fenergo application is presented in the best light with new and existing customers Deliver product demos to demonstrate how Fenergo can help them deliver meaningful and rapid improvements in their organisation this includes demo preparation, delivery and follow up outstanding questions Understand client challenges and develop appropriate solutions necessary to win new business Lead and conduct onsite engagements to understand customer processes, requirements and facilitate architecture / solution discussions. Work with prospect clients to align their tactical and strategic challenges through implementing the Fenergo product across their organisation Proactively scope the functional and technical requirements to address customer requirements, assesses customers met and unmet needs, and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and the Fenergo. Maintain and expand working knowledge of the Fenergo product. Provide feedback to the product organization on enhancements. In conjunction with Sales Ops Support complete RFx documents on behalf of the company Use knowledge of competitive solutions to help the sales organization to propose the most optimal solution for the customer Ensures that sales, product and professional services organizations are properly aligned to achieve client and sales objectives. Build strong relationships within the project team, client teams and internal Product Management team Keep abreast of product, regulatory and industry changes  Requirements  About you: Excellent Client Facing Skills with the ability to Own the Room. Soft Skills include Communication, Co-ordination, and Negotiation Bilingual skills and experience working within Asia Natural leader looking to ensure a positive outcome for the organization Understands business goals and market perceptions and how the Client Solutions team impacts both. Seeker of information (internal and external) to help drive the right approach to lead to the right outcomes Knowledge on organization offerings with a strong focus on attention to detail. It is an advantage to have worked in the Financial Services industry or a software company in a different industry, but neither are mandatory. We are looking to hire people who are passionate about using our technology to solve customer problems. If you are self-motivated, detail-oriented and have the confidence to communicate your ideas both verbally and in writing then you should talk to us. It could be that a new exciting chapter in your career awaits. Previous experience in the consulting industry would be highly favourable.  Benefits  Benefits of working for Fenergo Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale Extensive training programmes, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University’ Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress Active sports and social club.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

As the Sales and Marketing Manager of the organization, you are effectively required to:  Develop and execute sales strategies for region and territories.  Forecast revenue by analysing trends and results.  Understand supply and demand, economic indicators and competitors.  Building relationships with healthcare specialist and hospital medical teams.  Work closely and manage distribution channels.  About The Manager/team  Reporting to the General Manager, you will be working closely with the sales teams.  Skills & Experience Required  To be successful in this role, you possess at least 3 years of working sales experience in within the medical device business. description: About Stripe  Stripe’s infrastructure and suite of APIs powers hundreds of thousands of businesses—from startups to Fortune 500s—in almost every country around the world. From developers and product managers to founders and CFOs, a broad audience interacts with Stripe’s products and uses them to start, run, and scale their companies. Removing the barriers to online commerce helps more new businesses get started, expedites growth for existing companies, and increases economic output and trade globally. We operate at a significant scale, but we’re still tiny relative to the opportunity ahead, so there is still much to do. Join us and help put the global economy within everyone’s reach. At Stripe, we’re looking for people with passion, grit, and integrity. You’re encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn’t precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. At Stripe, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who think rigorously and aren’t afraid to challenge assumptions. Join us.  Background We’re looking for an experienced, creative, results-oriented marketer to lead our Platform Partner Marketing efforts in APAC. The Partner Marketing team’s mission is to create an outstanding Stripe experience for partners, supporting them with the right engagement, resources, and incentives as they scale their business with us. The APAC Platform Partner marketing manager for SaaS will own marketing with and through our technology (e.g. software, cloud providers that develop solutions that run on or integrate with Stripe products) and connector (e.g. plugins, integrations, extensions that enable users to more easily connect and deploy Stripe to third-party platforms) partners. This role involves defining our partner marketing investment model and strategy for APAC , building joint marketing plans with strategic partners, executing co-marketing campaigns to drive customer acquisition, and ultimately helping partners grow their business with Stripe. We’re looking for a candidate that can not only develop and own regional strategy, but also roll up their sleeves and execute. As an early member of the Partner Marketing team, this role will have the opportunity to shape our partner marketing function regionally and influence global partner marketing priorities. We’re Looking For Someone With 8-10+ years of relevant B2B marketing experience, ideally with 3+ years focused on partner marketing Experience partnering closely with technology platforms to build joint marketing plans and execute marketing programs and campaigns that drive new customer acquisition and pipeline generation outcomes Experience working with a global function based in a different region Proven ability to influence and guide the partner’s marketing leadership team to align on objectives and deliver against joint marketing priorities and plans Experience shaping joint messaging with partners Demonstrated experience in measuring and improving the ROI of marketing investments through an indirect business model leveraging partners Deep understanding of the user journey through a partner distribution channel and the requirements on the partner marketing organisation to drive revenue You Will Work closely with the Sales and Partnerships team to jointly increase Stripe adoption via partners Collaborate closely with the Global Partner Marketing function based in North America as well as APAC marketers to develop and execute on the regional partner marketing plan Define priorities, investment model, and success metrics for our partner marketing efforts Define annual joint marketing strategies, objectives, and measures of success with top partners Build joint messaging and execute co-marketing plans with the top partners to drive scaled acquisition of new users and incremental pipeline Define scaling mechanisms to provide marketing resources and enablement to a growing ecosystem of platform and plugin partners Administer and optimise market development funds with each partner You Likely Will Have A startup mentality with a bias to action and the ability to flex in a fast-paced environment Superb organisation and project management skills and the capacity to manage multiple complex projects at once Proven leadership capability and effectiveness working collaboratively and cross functionally Excellent analytical skills and the ability to craft actionable insights from complex data
industries: Computer Software, Financial Services, and Internet

description: Description  Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing awareness and adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) in the Singapore Public Sector market? Do you have the Public Sector experience and sales background necessary to help establish Amazon as a key technology platform provider? Are you passionate about the Public Sector?  AWS Worldwide Public Sector (WWPS) is seeking a Sales Manager to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of AWS within the government market segment in Singapore.  Your responsibilities will include leading a team of specialized Account Managers engaged with government customers to drive revenue attainment objectives. The candidate should have political savviness, thought leadership and executive communications skills. Partnering with internal teams to ensure eligibility for bulk tenders and government panel opportunities, this leader will independently manage complex contract negotiations and work with senior executives both inside and outside of Amazon and be the voice of our business at the most senior levels of government.  Roles & Responsibilities Review individual territory plans for the Singapore Government business and ensure alignment with the overall Public Sector business strategy. Work with the wider Singapore Public Sector management to create a prioritized, tactical action plan to exceed revenue and strategic goals. Develop specific targeted accounts with clear value proposition for using AWS. Independently execute the strategic business development plan while collaborating with key internal stakeholders (e.g. Partners, Solution Architects, Bids & Proposal teams, Legal etc.) Nurture opportunities and fill pipeline through active engagement with prospects, partners and key customers Prepare and give business reviews to the Singapore Public Sector management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing new customers. Develop the Singapore government sales team and bring out the positivity and strengths of each team member.  Basic Qualifications  The Singapore Sales Manager will have a keen sense of ownership and enthusiasm for the Public Sector segment in the software and technology industry. Prior experience in people management role and a track record of achieving revenue targets At least 20 years of sales and business development experience covering public sector customers in technology industry is advantageous Good understanding of the Singapore Government procurement process and contract vehicles Being right a lot and displays good business acumen Nurturing in personality and highly motivated to develop the best in each team member Positive, proactive and self-motivated with sense of urgency and follow through Excellent communication and writing skills  Preferred Qualifications  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore Job ID: A1560808
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: 1.      Company ENGIE is a world leader in low-carbon electricity production, centralized and decentralized energy networks, and associated energy efficiency services. The Group relies on its 4 key businesses - Renewables, Energy Solutions, Networks, Thermal & Supply, to help its customers meet their decarbonization goals Our purpose is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral economy, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally friendly solutions. The purpose brings together the company, its employees, its customers and its shareholders, and reconciles economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. ENGIE’s actions are assessed in their entirety and over time. In Singapore ENGIE is a leading Energy Solution Provider, and a trusted partner by well-established players such as ComfortDelgro, JTC Punggol Innovation District, SIT, SingHealth, NUHS and LOGOS to name a few.  2.      Job Description The Real Estate Business Sales Manager is part of the local Business Development team and is responsible for building a portfolio of opportunities with customers in the real estate sector in the city state.  Together with the local and regional Business development and technical teams, you will manage the creation of proposals aligned with ENGIE’s value propositions (delivering integrated energy and broader sustainability solutions to our clients), while ensuring compliance with client requirements. As a sales manager, you will ensure successful project handover and be engaged with the client throughout the execution phase. You like to take the lead and dare to give your opinions and advice. You are open to feedback, taking a flexible approach.  3.      Job Responsibilities Own a network of real estate developers who you can contact to offer multi-utility, sustainable solutions (both green and brownfield) with low impact on the environment. Find a set of customers operating wider portfolio of buildings in Singapore. Prepare customized energy solutions (with a focus on Cooling, Solar, Digital and Green Mobility) for building owners to optimise their energy offtake and negotiate proposals from start to end. Track environmental policies and build commercial service offerings that can answer the existing and emerging trends. Serve as single contact for preparation of commercial offers in collaboration with all services required (technical, financial and contractual). Draw on ENGIE’s expertise, skills and resources to develop winning strategies for preparing offers. Master technical, financial and commercial project presentation to the client with the support of the relevant teams. Be a trusted advisor to clients on our key accounts Identify and maintain strong relationships and an appropriate governance structure with key client stakeholders. Deliver and oversee accurate and timely critical reporting, including internal and corporate reporting Demonstrate innovative thinking and proactive management in bringing new ideas and solutions to the client, and ensuring they are rolled out effectively. Provide strategic direction and guidance on ways to enhance and expand services offering to the client. Able to collaborate and contribute on other tasks set forth by your manager.  4.      Job Skills / Knowledge Requirements You have a good understanding of the real estate sector and/or experienced / possess a good understanding of chiller systems. You maintain an active network with REITS and Real Estate Developers Have a keen interest and enthusiasm for sustainability You have a strong background of project finance, capital structuring and financial modelling You a good communicator able to work with multiple stakeholders Ability to provide efficient, timely and is seen as a reliable partner to customers. Strong presentation and communication skills, and able to present a convincing argument Adaptable, with a methodical and problem-solving mind Strong business acumen and commercial intelligence Be proactive and motivated personality to self-improve Good time management and multi-tasking skills  5.      Qualification Minimum Diploma / Degree in relevant Engineering / Facilities Management / Real Estate Management / Sustainability studies. MBA qualifications will be advantageous At least 5 years’ related sales experience, with understanding of energy solutions and sustainability
industries: Renewables & Environment and Facilities Services
