description: We are currently looking for a Manager, Marketing to drive lead and demand generation efforts across our Gartner Technology Sales (GTS) business line in Southeast Asia and Korea and ANZ. The Marketing Manager reports to the VP of Marketing of APJ, and is responsible for co-developing and implementing marketing strategies targeting Senior IT Executives to drive lead generation, customer acquisition and cross-selling. He/she will develop a deep understanding of the GTS product offerings, and will utilize this understanding to create innovative and engaging marketing initiatives to support the global campaign engine in the region. He/she will work closely with sales, product and marketing leadership to drive marketing initiatives according to business priority while maintaining a valuable customer experience. Marketing impact is measured on revenue sourced from marketing leads and overall effectiveness in coordinating with other relevant functions and teams. The preference is for the position to be based in our Singapore office. The successful individual will join a dynamic and growing organization, supporting personal and professional development.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Marketing management: Help develop marketing planning activities including the demand and lead generation strategy, prioritization of resources, liaison with key stakeholders with Southeast Asia and Korea, especially Singapore as the core-focus market Interact with business unit leaders, present execution plans to them and influence their thinking on marketing projects/campaigns. Serve as marketing “expert” for the GTS business. Create and execute integrated marketing campaigns for existing and new products. Explore and Develop co-branding partnerships for the GTS space. Work with the Marketing Centers of Excellence (particularly Corporate Communications, Experiential Marketing and Digital Marketing Teams) to leverage corporate wide marketing capabilities and skills and ensure compliance to corporate marketing standards. Develop KPIs and metrics for campaigns to set clear goals and assess campaign success at the campaign, activity, and channel levels to inform future campaign tactics. Track and measure marketing effectiveness across channels and optimize plans to ensure ROI on all activities. In additional to regional responsibilities, each regional lead will manage marketing plans for assigned global program and/or role and close alignment with R&A to support growth from key marketing segments  Regional Product team interface: Co-ordinate integrated, multi-tactical product and marketing programs intended to deliver client value, drive and build new business.  Support the adoption and activation of collateral and messaging use by the commercial and product teams – serving as centralized and consolidated voice of business tools and revenue-generating initiatives. Manage one direct report and dotted line to dedicated support from our marketing center of excellence in India  Process management: Help create and maintain collateral development and marketing process consistency.  Maintain regional collateral hub/portal for intuitive use by commercial teams.  Create and manage structure for revenue team training/scripting/role-play sessions and lead sessions in partnership with individual program “product specialists.” Work across business lines to identify, leverage and integrate marketing ideas and activities. ·       Independently manage projects from identifying the problem to be solved and potential solutions with periodic guidance from line manager. ·       Ensure all leads are followed up by sales in a timely manner.  A successful candidate will possess: BS/BA degree, MBA preferred. 8+ years of relevant B2B marketing experience a B2B environment ideally with experience in a services or solutions oriented businesses. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from a wide range of stakeholders. Ability to assess complex market landscape and create focused, integrated Marketing plans. Ability to influence and partner with internal business partners on strategic objectives and challenges; Energy and positive attitude to work with varying stakeholders and get them through to the “final mile” of action and outcomes. Self-starter with the ability to work independently. Excellent program, project and time management and execution skills, with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines. Excellent written communications skills; Excellent oral communication skills; Ability to present self professionally and intelligently to internal clients/colleagues. Demonstrated initiative and resourcefulness; Ability to build relationships and work well across multiple functions
industries: Information Services, Computer & Network Security, and Information Technology and Services

description: Job description At AsiaOne, we are proud to offer our readers a fresh perspective on what’s happening packaged in a relatable way that matters. We are looking for an energetic Sales Manager who has strong existing network with contacts across media agencies and advertisers to help us promote and evangelize our media products and services.  AsiaOne’s Commercial team is dedicated to driving measurable outcomes for brand advertisers, agencies, and small businesses. Our range of ad solutions help attract and engage intended audiences through the AsiaOne brand of “off centre, on trend” content to build brand awareness, increase product sales, and much more.  You will be responsible for selling our advertising solutions and driving sales to advertisers and their agencies at all hierarchical levels. You will work with both existing and prospecting clients and be responsible for their long term growth.  Our ideal candidate will have a good breadth of sales experience, preferably within the digital media space. A consultative selling style is desired, coupled with the structure and organizational skills needed to build trust in a new business environment. If you are ready to advocate for and deliver strategic advertising solutions to your clients – apply now!  Responsibilities: ·      Drive digital advertising growth with Agencies and Clients ·      Sell integrated digital solution across content, video, display and social ·      Own and hit/exceed personal sales targets within assigned industries/sectors ·      Work with campaign manager to monitor campaign performance to ensure success metrics are met ·      Enthusiastic team player, able to collaborate with colleagues across different functions and business units  Requirements: ·      Highly organised with strong analytical ability and adaptable to changes ·      Operates as a dynamic "hunter" and demand generator ·      Excellent written and verbal communication skills. ·      Resourceful, self-motivated with excellent presentation and interpersonal skills ·      A proven track record of driving new business growth ·      Independent worker and ability to work under tight deadlines ·      Preferred experience in digital media, media advertising, content marketing  Eligibility Criteria: ·      Singapore Citizens/Permanent Residents ·      2-3 years in digital media sales role  ·      Interested applicants, please include links to your portfolio in your CV and email to careers@asiaone.com

jobTitle: Startup Program Manager, Asia Pacific & Japan Startup Business Development
description: Description  In this role, you will be responsible for owning and executing global Startup BD programs across Asia Pacific &. Japan (APJ). This will require working closely with the central Program Management team in the US to help evolve and operationalize existing and new Startup programs. You will also be required to identify, develop and execute regional startup programs for APJ, in collaboration with the Startup BD and Marketing team. You must be able to directly understand and relate to the startup experience, have an innate understanding for entrepreneurs, company founders and technical decision makers at early stage companies, and be passionate about helping build new ideas for that community. Ideally, you are someone that has had experience designing and developing new products or programs targeted at the startup community. You should be familiar and interested in driving innovation in customer facing products, and have a track record of owning successful, metrics driven development plans. You must be able to work with and influence different teams across organizations to work toward a common development goal.The ideal candidate will have a strong program management background with experience leading medium to large projects. The candidate will also have a business development background with strong ability to earn trust with startup founders, as well as work cross-functionally across the Amazon organization. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must.  Roles & Responsibilities Work closely with customers, Startup Business Development, Startup Marketing, Startup Sales, Startup Solution Architects, and specialist teams across the organization to understand the needs of entrepreneurs and how to help them meet those needs to achieve growth. Research and ideate potential solutions to process gaps and hurdles in the startup experience. Liaise with the global Startup Program Management team to front-end the execution and regionalization of startup focused programs at the APJ level. Develop and execute on new Startup Programs at the regional level. Implement customer usage metrics & reporting, with a strong focus on improving customer experience. Manage the entire lifecycle of the initiatives you are responsible for, including showing operational success and further iterations.  Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or related field 15+ years of experience 10+ years of program/product management or business development experience. Demonstrated understanding of the startup ecosystem, including investors (such as venture capital, angel investors). Proven ability to launch successful, external experiences that are used and loved by customers Operational rigor, ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously, keeping focus on execution and delivering results consistently. Proven ability to work cooperatively with various teams, including business development, operations, and sales Demonstrated ability to interact with startup executives to both understand their requirements, and to discuss proposed programs and engagements. Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as leadership skills. Strong analytical skills, with problem-solving abilities in ambiguous situations. Vision to own and drive programs with development horizons of months or years.  Preferred Qualifications  You would have worked in a startup in a business operations or strategy role, founded a startup, or have invested in startups. You are deeply entwined in the startup ecosystem and know executives in startups and investing communities across Asia Pacific and Japan.  You have an MBA or equivalent relevant business experience.  You are passionate about technology and have some exposure to the AWS platform.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore Job ID: A1554746
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: About Currencycloud Currencycloud is somewhere where innovative thinking and the power of technology know no limits. We know that the success of the business depends on the people who keep it moving, which is why we are looking for exceptional talent to join our international payments revolution.   We are an open & collaborative Fintech unicorn that lives and breathes our company values: Be Human, Better Together and Own it.  About the role... This role will be the key link between marketing and sales to support top of the funnel sales for a given region, working closely with the sales and marketing counterparts on a demand generation strategy that drives both inbound and outbound leads.  The details... Demand Generation Delivery (approx.. % of role breakdown – 50%) Delivery of holistic demand generation activity, outbound/inbound lead generation Managing prospect lists, managing data, building campaigns within lead gen tools (eg. Salesloft) and the execution of those campaigns Qualifying inbound leads and creating opportunities that are fit to be passed to Sales Consultants Demand Generation Strategy (approx. % of role breakdown – 25%)  Working with segment-focused marketing managers and sales consultants, support the creation of a demand gen strategy that meets regional targets Researching prospects, target personas, and segment landscape to assist with lead scoring and more account based marketing Building prospect target lists using business development tools. Build strategies using clear and defined KPIs and ROI. Specific campaigns that are built and delivered as part of the strategy should have trackable metrics and align with your overall strategic objectives Own data management for prospecting Localisation (approx. % of role breakdown – 25%) Localise key marketing materials already in existence to support campaigns as needed, including white papers, blog posts, emails, social media campaigns and sales collateral Other key areas of focus Develop, manage and maintain excellent relationships with stakeholders Data-driven approach – base strategy on facts rather than opinions Demonstrate ROI on all activities  Skills Knowledge & Expertise Have at least 2 years of experience in the payments space Enjoys working in a fast paced environment & thrive within it Delivered demand generation activities, meeting individual and team targets. Delivered a segment strategy resulting in improvement in key team OKRs & KPIs Adhere to team processes and practices Understands different demand generation and sales development techniques Used Salesforce Have a positive winning mindset  Why Currencycloud? We are a remote-first company; whichever location you’re contracted to, we leave it up to you and your manager to agree on how often you come into the office. To make things easier we offer an allowance so you can create your own working space at home because we REALLY mean it when we say remote first.  Your health and well-being are of paramount importance to us, and so our jampacked employee benefits reflect this!  We offer a competitive salary, an individual learning and development budget, a pension or 401K contribution, mental health days and comprehensive health care that includes annual optical and dental allowances, access to mental health support and a monthly allowance that you can spend on anything health or wellness related!  At the moment we are unable to consider applicants living outside of our entities and we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.  We aren’t currently looking for additional Recruiter support on this role and won’t be accepting any unsolicited CVs
industries: Financial Services

description: Job Description:  About Us  Grab was founded on the belief that a technology company in Southeast Asia could both run profitably and create sustainable social impact. We hold ourselves responsible to the environment and socio-economic development of this region, not just for today, but also for the future.  At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles, which we call the 4Hs. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.  WORKING WITH GRAB POSITIVE & COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENT. Grabbers thrive in a corporate culture that values every team member's contribution towards our goal of improving lives. ROCKET FUEL FOR CAREERS. Grabbers experience hyper professional growth and all the challenges that entails. Grow your skills while working to solve real issues across the region. FUN & DEDICATED FAMILY. Grabbers work hard and play hard. Our teams grow as one as they overcome challenges and have fun along the way. Our Team:  As a member of Grab, not only will you bring your skill sets to drive your team forward, but you will also develop your untapped potential and be inspired by some of the most amazing minds in the industry. Our team consists of both young and experienced individuals who are tenacious, motivated and energized by the fact that we exist to make a change - have a societal impact in Southeast Asia.  Grab for Business is the B2B SaaS team within Grab that helps to simplify business transportation, corporate food & package deliveries as well as related services for companies across Southeast Asia. We actively engage with thousands of corporate clients across the region and it is imperative that we drive the further expansion of a high growth product line such as Grab for Business. To this end, we are looking for a hands-on and operationally resilient Regional Manager to anchor a portfolio of growing Strategy & Product Operations responsibilities .  To perform this role well, a candidate needs to have strong communication skills, attention to detail, a background in product operations, consulting or project management and a track record of exceeding expectations.  This role is based in Singapore.  To perform this role well, the candidate should: Be highly organized and process-driven, with a keen eye for analytics. Be a self-starter with a strong passion for Product Strategy & Operations, backed by data insights. Have strong communication skills (written, spoken, presentation), with keen attention to detail. Experience in Product Marketing is an added advantage, but not mandatory. The Role: You will report to the Regional Head - Go To Market, Grab for Business Be part of the regional Grab for Business team, with ownership in building up the high growth B2B SaaS product solutions such as the Grab for Business Portal, GrabFood for Business etc. Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: Develop, test, own and operationalise the Grab for Business new product development strategy and roadmap alongside the Product Management teams. Drive creative solutions to contribute towards product strategy and impactful product operations, and exhibit operational autonomy in new initiatives & projects. This would include core contributions to the Grab for Business suite of B2B solutions at the ideation, market research, iteration and product scoping stages all the way to a successful product launch and the scaling of product support workstreams. Be a Grab for Business product subject matter expert, and be closely aligned with the sales, key account management, channel partner and Sales Ops teams, drive, implement and track product operations SOPs that are in line with overall product & business objectives. Provide strategic support to the Grab for Business Product Management team (product documentation and checklists, market research and client interviews, new product introduction preparation, feature prioritisation based on business team objectives, alignment with support teams etc.) on the top priority projects. Ensure timely and regular cadence of communication across all aspects of the Grab for Business Portal product life cycle for all teams (Product Managers, Designers, Business teams, Client Support, Marketing etc.) Conduct regular trainings with Grab Customer Experience (CE) teams to ensure they are proficient and updated on all Grab for Business support processes and new product features. Special Projects: GrabFood for Business Regional responsibility for scaling product operations for GrabFood for Business Roll out of all new and existing product features (Grab for Business Portal, App & Web Booking) for corporate use cases. Align commercial operations on all GrabFood for Business requirements including promotions, partner-funded discounts, billing & invoicing and client support Work closely with GrabFood country operations teams to build, launch and own the operational roadmap for corporate catering merchant-partner acquisition, retention, promotion, commercial terms and partner management in each Grab market. Provide process mapping and guidelines for corporate catering Merchant-partner account verification, onboarding, activation, menu & cuisine management as well as pricing recommendations. Collect, organize, and analyze product and business data on GrabFood for Business to help product managers make more informed decisions on issues faced by the sales and account management teams that then enable us to leverage client, industry and data-backed insights to exceed expectations & achieve commercial excellence. The Qualifications: Experience: Minimum of 6-8 years of operational and direct work experience in a Product Strategy, Product Operations, Product Consulting or Project Management role in the B2B, SaaS, Telecom, Consulting, Technology, Foodtech or F&B industry. Education: Bachelor’s Degree (required). [Optional] Proficiency in project management tools and workflow solutions (E.g. Jira@Atlassian) Should be comfortable with advanced usage of Microsoft Office and G Suite (Docs / Sheets / Slides) Communication: Strong and effective communicator with good presentation and speaking skills who can verbally and visually articulate their point of view clearly and succinctly. Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can work well in a startup VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous) environment. Must demonstrate integrity and respect in the performance of their duties.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Our client is a leading MNC operating within the Building Materials sector.  Job Description:  Effectively utilize consultative solution selling processes to increase revenue topline and generate deals. Possess In-depth knowledge of full Waterproofing products (including membrane, liquid and powder) for basement, roof, water retaining structure and other type of application. Acquire knowledge and ability to use AutoCAD is an advantage (will be added advantage) Eye for detail and able to work independently Strong understanding of the Waterproofing market, especially for South East Asia. Possess good working relationship and good track record with waterproofing applicators/contractors in the field (Pre & Post sale support).  Traits we are looking for:  Ability to know your customers and market needs. Are you consistently obsessed with understanding and shaping customer and market behavior? High persuasive skills. Pursuing goals with energy, drive and a need to finish. Always looking for the possibilities to skillfully overcome obstacles. Leveraging experts and other key individuals as important sources of information. Being a team player. Uncovering relevant information to make accurate judgments and sound decisions. Open minded to suggestions.
industries: Building Materials and Chemicals

description: About Temenos  We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.  We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.  Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!  THE ROLE  A key position in the Regional APAC sales team and has primary responsibility for achievement sales targets through the implementation of sales strategies driven from a territory sales and go to market plan. This role is a Business Development Role, focused on New Business.  Key Responsibilities  Achieve New Business sales wins to exceed target supported by local cross functional support teams and the Sales Director Provide insight and plan effective sales campaigns together with a skilled Pre-Sales team to operate successfully in competitive bid scenarios Proactively address the market to expand the brand reach and achieve a high rate of meetings, demonstrations, workshops, quotes and proposals Maintain four times your Annual quota in Pipeline with New Business opportunities by working closely with Marketing, Inside Sales our In-country Partners by and Sales support teams by establishing relationships with primary alliance partners and identify new market and growth opportunities to build a strong sales pipeline Skillfully negotiate profitable contract agreements for license, consulting and support services Provide leadership in client relations to set the company head and shoulders above the competition Leverage existing business relationships with decision makers, executives and key players in the banking and financial services sectors Establish relationships with primary alliance partners and identify new market and growth opportunities to build a strong sales pipeline Provide leadership in client relationship management, address clients’ business needs and constraints. Build long-term relationships and referrals with senior managers and key opinion leaders in the banking and financial services sectors.  Skills & Experience  Exceptional verbal and written communication skills in English. Eloquent in one other local language i.e.Thai, Lao, Khmer, Malay, Vietnamese, Bahasa etc is an additional advantage A high-caliber individual with the right breadth and depth of experience, strong credential, influence within the financial arena with the focus and acumen to cultivate profitable and lasting customer relationships Proven track record of leading and achieving “big ticket” sales to exceed targets in the banking and financial services software industry with substantial relevant experience within the same domain Minimum 7-10 years Sales and New Business Development experience in a banking software company or related companies (e.g. local Software Industry) and has deep understanding about Solution Selling Confident in operating at “C level” and can demonstrate strong sales and negotiating skills with key decision makers Must have the presence together with strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills to establish interest, trust and credibility Has mastered technical and business skills required to accomplish the job Good general understanding of banking operations and relevant processes (front, middle, back office) with a reasonable understanding of IT infrastructures and implementation approaches from both functional and technical perspectives Self-motivated, ambitious, independent, organized, focused and able to multi-task Can work independently and in a collaborative nature, excellent interpersonal skills, great team player Willing to travel on frequent basis  WHY TEMENOS  You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day. You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best. You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises. You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity. You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients. You will experience what we call – Temenosity!  We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.  Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Description  Harmonic is the worldwide leader in video delivery solutions. We enable media companies and service providers to deliver ultra-high-quality streaming and broadcast services to consumers globally through innovative SaaS platforms and software-based appliances. We are changing the way media companies and service providers monetize live and on-demand content on every screen. More information is available at www.harmonicinc.com  Role Description  The Regional Sales Manager is responsible for selling Harmonic’s Video and Cable Access solutions in the assigned territory through new business acquisition and/or growing existing accounts. This involves developing and maintaining relationships with senior level business, finance and technical executives and demonstrating how our solutions will allow them to efficiently run critical video services for their business. In the growing and developing South East Asia market, the business development component of this role is crucial. Though the territory assigned to the candidate will include a large number of existing Harmonic accounts, the candidate must also demonstrate a great capability to identify, qualify and secure projects with new prospects, in particular in the Video Streaming segment.  This role reports to our Sales Director, SEA and the candidate must be based SEA.  What You Will Be Doing Develop new opportunities and generating growth, penetrating strategic key accounts Grow business with existing accounts in the assigned territory Develop and implement account and opportunity plans in support of company goals and quota objectives Plan and organize the support for any sales activities with Indirect Sales partners (Channels) Establish a strong relationship with strategic and technology partners to cooperate on business opportunities and jointly offer a comprehensive ecosystem Align and prioritize efforts based on company’s initiatives to maximize revenue and customer satisfaction Report key information in a timely manner and bring visibility to the Company with accurate forecasting Effectively and appropriately engage sales resources – technical pre-sales, product management, program management, partners, legal, finance and executive team – and coordinate internal and external participation in tactical initiatives Respond to RFI/RFPs, creating proposals and closing sales, developing ROI and TCO analysis What You Should Have Representing and embodying the sales organizations values of: Individual Leadershipwith accountability, commitment to goals and ability to mobilize for success; Customer Advocacy with the ability to listen to the customer to gain insight and then orchestrate solutions; Team Collaboration with the ability to lead, collaborate and then accelerate the team to support customer success 5-10 years sales or experience in regional sales and/or business development role Knowledge of strategic value proposition required to offer solutions and support geared toward substantive customer satisfaction levels. Video Streaming and in particular OVP (Online Video Platform) background is a plus Demonstrate experience of success in proposing and selling SaaS solutions within the Broadcast, Telecom and/or SaaS market sectors. Hunting sales approach to acquire new customers Business Analytics: pipeline/forecast management Business Acumen: strong ability to present complex business cases and handle advanced negotiations with CxO level Consultative Sales: must exhibit ability to effectively comprehend, analyse, and address sales situations within the construct of developed strategic accounts Creativity: Develop creative tactical sales positioning and solution selling methods to suit demanding sales situations Influence and Negotiation Demonstrate effective communication and interpersonal skills Language: English (Spoken and Written), any other South East Asia region language is a plus Travel (if applicable) As required At Harmonic, we believe that building and nurturing a global team with diverse backgrounds and voices is critical to our success. Together, we achieve excellence through creativity and innovation, build relationships based on integrity and mutual respect, and deliver the highest quality in every aspect of our business for the benefit of our employees, business partners and shareholders.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: Job Description The Product Manager/Product Executive is responsible for both product selling, marketing and management of the go-to-market strategy. The role is to manage the product throughout the product lifecycle, gathering and prioritizing customer’s product requirements, defining product vision, and working closely with the sales engineer (direct report to Product Manager), to deliver winning solutions to customers.   The Product Manager is expected to: Responsible for managing the products within a specific set or group/type of products Be the product evangelist within a specific set or group/type of products Define and execute the product strategy and roadmap Meet the quota expectations of the Product Vendors that he/she is assigned to manage. Need to work closely with the assigned product vendor Conduct Quarterly Business Review with the Vendor/s Deliver Marketing goals Work with pre-sales and sales for product sales opportunities Work with the security sales engineer to craft product demo scripts and requirements to potential customers Determines customer’s requirements and position product solution accordingly by working closely with the sales engineer Meet revenue and profitability goals Deliver a periodic revenue and profitability forecast Develop sales tools and collaterals Prepare Business Plan and execute the plan on timely manner Propose an overall budget to ensure success Meet quarterly sales targets for both Gross Profit and Revenue Brief and train the sales force at weekly and monthly training meetings (Timeshared with other Product Managers) Assesses market competition by comparing assigned products to competitors’ products. Weekly sales forecast submission to both management team and also assigned product vendors.   Act as the main contact point with the assigned product vendors. Sales Enablement to the internal sales channel team. Organize regular product workshop for both partner’s sales & technical team. Planning and Executing Lead Generation activity which contribute to the consistent pipeline of the assigned products.   Requirements: Have the RIGHT ATTITUDE & APTITUDE Possess marketing mind for IT Security Products Good to have prior success in selling IT Security products Beneficial to have experience in the IT Security Industry Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English) Technical Sales background and interest Excellent teamwork skills Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority Must be able to travel 20% of the time Fresh Graduates / Candidates with lesser experience will be considered for the executive role “Diploma or Degree in Information Security Courses Preferred but not essential”  Remunerations: Basic Salary with Commission Attractive Commission based on Tiered Targets Car Allowance if driving Petrol and Parking Claims Mobile Phone Claims All other company expenses would be based on claims  *This position is available for both Singapore and Malaysia (KL).
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: Maritime Performance Services (MPS) is a new service line within LR, created to help achieve our ambition to become a trusted advisor that improves the safety, sustainability and efficiency of our customer’s assets and businesses. We will do that by helping a wider set of stakeholders across the maritime value chain maximise revenue earning potential from their assets, manage complex risks and optimise across their entire operations.  We are looking for our new Business Development Manager, Shipping Markets to join our Sales team within Maritime Performance Services. This is a new role that will establish LR as the trusted advisor and technical partner for commercial shipping stakeholders, including charterers, financers, and more within Singapore and the SAMEA region in support of our ambitious growth plans. This is an opportunity for you to build a new business from the ground up; and to work collaboratively with key stakeholders, new and existing clients to drive the decarbonisation, and digitalisation of the shipping sector.  You will Develop a clear vision for Lloyd’s Register’s commercial shipping engagement in the Singapore and SAMEA Area – the Why, Who, What & When. Execute this vision, developing mutually beneficial relationship with target stakeholders including (but not limited to) charterers, financers, traders, brokers, insurers, etc Leverage LR’s technical and regulatory expertise to help clients optimise the performance of their shipping portoflio; quantify and manage risk; and to understand the impact of technology; regulatory developments; decarbonisation and digitalisation on their business. Identify suitable opportunities for collaborative projects (JDPs, R&D, etc...) with charterers, bringing in owners, shipyards, technology providers etc where relevant. Be the voice of the customer internally within LR for the commercial shipping sector in SAMEA: provide feedback to LR M&O and MPS on evolving trends; new opportunities and risks; identify opportunities to develop new LR products and services. Be a thought leader and respected voice on decarbonisation/technology/regulations within the Singapore commercial shipping community Work together seamlessly with LR Singapore M&O & MPS commercial and technical teams; and with subject matter specialists globally. Be guided and supported by the Global Lead, Shipping Markets You will need To be a self-starter; a seller-doer. To take the initiative and responsibility of building a new line of business and new relationships. A track record in identifying, developing, and delivering customised solutions to solve client challenges. Demonstrable team working skills to collaborate both externally, and internally with subject matter experts Consultative selling and Key Account Management skills, are a necessity to be successful in this role, with proven experience in sales and marketing and managing relationships with key clients; outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities at all levels Strong knowledge and understanding of the technical aspects of ship design, construction and/or operations. Specific experience in ship performance optimisation is an advantage. Experience and in-depth understanding of the maritime regulatory environment. Experience of commercial ship operations and chartering is an advantage. Able to influence multiple stakeholders, at all levels, both internally and externally and function within a matrixed organisation.
industries: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Oil & Energy

description: You will be responsible for managing all aspects of the assigned product line to achieve profitability and growth in market share within the Southeast Asia region.  Responsibilities  Develop marketing plans and strategies for assigned product line based on analysis of market growth potential and competition to achieve Sales & Marketing objectives as established.  Effectively increase product awareness by driving tactical promotional efforts and engagement activities with internal and external sales team, which includes but not limited to product launches, develop publication articles and white papers to promote products scope and focus; and develop promotional demonstration tools for focused products. Develop and deliver product & industry training (including applications, competitive products & technologies, and features & benefits training) for internal and channel personnel. Deliver presentations and hands-on demonstrations of assigned products, applications, and technology to customers for the purpose of product sales and awareness. Responsible for managing product line(s) budget. Work closely with Sales Team within Southeast Asia to provide solutions to customers. Demonstrate a positive and flexible approach to changing business priorities. Communicate strategic businesses and price negotiations with Headquarter Business Unit(s) and consistently provide feedback regarding competition, product and/or market needs. Coordinate promotional efforts with MARCOM. Maintain a sound technical/application knowledge base on assigned product line(s).  Requirements:  Diploma or Degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering. Additional qualifications in Marketing will be an added advantage. Three years of experience in industrial electrical component/solutions. (Candidate with higher experience will be considered for Manager Role) Field experience in PLC programming and troubleshooting is a plus Prior experience in the field of Automation Systems and familiarity with DCS systems will have an advantage. Ability to understand and explain Wireless solutions and All Electric Society is preferred.  Excellent MS Office skills, especially in POWERPOINT Willing to travel extensively and within short notice
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Industrial Automation

description: Location: Japan/Singapore Type: Full-time   ROLE DESCRIPTION  Homage is looking for an Expansion Lead strongly aligned with its mission to transform the way people access and get personal care. You will drive our international expansion plans with the goal of  successfully launching Homage in multiple new markets, and very importantly set them up for scale. This role reports to the Head of Expansion. You will be responsible for recruiting, motivating & coaching Expansion Associates in HQ, and the initial launch team in each new market.   RESPONSIBILITIES Launch Homage in multiple new markets and set them up for scale. Define GTM strategy: Research and develop a deep understanding of the differentiated value proposition of Homage’s services in the context of potential markets, including addressable size, readiness and competitiveness landscape. Manage operations: Drive day-to-day execution to successfully launch and grow in new markets. This involves being hands-on with end-to-end care delivery, including recruitment of Care Professionals, qualifying assignments, and upholding perfect fulfilment rates and care quality. Business alignment: Independently articulate and champion the state of play of the markets we expand into. Define market-level OKRs and seek support and alignment from leadership and operational teams.  Cross-functional coordination: Coordinate across Operations, Product and Marketing among various other teams to scope, prioritize, and roll out playbooks for every phase of a market’s growth Build and set local teams up for success: Attract and motivate local team members across Operations, Sales & Marketing to execute against key business and tactical goals. Ensure that teams have the direction, tools and knowledge they require to be successful, and has a shared understanding across our offices Flawless execution towards market growth: Responsible for growth targets aligned with HQ. Intrinsically understand the growth and cost drivers and execute against them. Be the local pacemaker and maintain regular cadence of reporting. Make impact-driven decisions to optimise towards growth targets and operational efficiency Inspire with the Homage mission: Represent the brand and mission of Homage internally with local team members, and externally with PR and events Hiring of country leadership: Assess maturity of markets and drive recruitment of country leadership at the right stage of time, in close collaboration with business leadership.   SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Minimum of 2-5 years relevant work experience in strategy, operations and/or growth with 1-2 years of managerial experience. Excellent written and verbal skills in English, strong proficiency in Japanese, particularly comfortable communicating in Japanese in a business and professional context Proven track record of excelling in a rapidly growing global organization. Entrepreneurial: Proven ability to build from scratch. Ability and desire to operate resourcefully, independently and with urgency.  Impact-driven and persistent: Motivated by moving the needle meaningfully, especially during times when it requires persistence and courage. Analytical: Ability to closely examine and identify relevant information, and earn the respect of both leaders and operational teams by translating insights into clear, sizable operational plans. Operational excellence: You have a keen eye for detail and an exceptionally high bar for accuracy and quality. Similarly you hold your team to that level of standards. Strong opinions, loosely held: Ability to articulate POV with clarity, humility, and a willingness to question one’s own assumptions / desire to constantly improve.  People leadership: Ability to lead with influence and build strong, productive relationships with various working styles and characteristics. Integrity and trustworthiness A passion for caregiving while leading with empathy is a plus Experience and understanding of the healthcare industry is a major plus  About Homage Homage is a care platform that combines qualified and trained caregivers, nurses, doctors and health care organisations and funders with technology, enabling care, wellness and recovery wherever you are. The work that we do and technology we build transforms lives every hour, every day. We’re looking for people who are talented, driven and motivated by our social mission.
industries: Hospital & Health Care

description: Overview We are seeking an Account Manager based in Singapore who will cover existing Healthcare accounts in the Southeast Asia region. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with established customers with the objective of meeting or exceeding assigned sales revenue quota. Check our more information below and apply today!  What you will be doing Develop a sales plan to meet or exceed established quota for assigned moderate risk, moderate impact existing customers Understand the customers business and technical needs; pursue opportunities for company expansion and integration Proactively initiate contact with customers on a regular basis; maintain and expand business relationships across divisions, departments and at all levels (CxO and below) Respond to non-technical customer inquiries, such as module information, pricing, maintenance and billing questions Work in partnership with other team members on accounts that are designated as strategic by sales management Record all customer account information in the CRM, including opportunities, commitments, meaningful conversations, customer visits or sales calls Develop and communicate accurate sales forecasting on a real-time basis Ensure customers are reference-able and participating in company marketing efforts, to the best of their ability Attend and contribute to company sales meetings, training sessions and trade shows Take proactive measures to streamline and constantly improve account management and the sales process Share extensive experience and best practice knowledge; contribute to the overall growth and quality of the sales team Continue to grow knowledge of solutions and company's best practice sales and account management methodologies Comply with all corporate and departmental privacy and data security policies and practices, including but not limited to, Hyland’s Information Systems Security Policy  What will make you successful Experience in sales, particularly selling into Government and large Corporate Healthcare accounts Demonstrated engagement experience with Government and Government Managed Services providers in Singapore and beyond Experience working across South East Asia and ANZ – highly desirable Exceptional communication and cultural understanding across the APAC region Demonstrated knowledge of sales in relevant technology solution in Healthcare Demonstrated ability to establish rapport and gain the trust of others Strong oral and written communications skills that demonstrate a professional demeanor and the ability to interact with others with discretion and tact Can successfully multi-task Self-motivated with the ability to manage work to completion with minimal oversight Strong collaboration skills, applied successfully within team as well as with other areas Up to 50% travel time required (as permitted) Associate's Degree or equivalent experience Or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the principal duties of the job Microsoft Windows and Office proficient and CRM packages Knowledge of Enterprise Content Management services and/or Enterprise Medical Imaging desirable  What you can expect next: Hyland Recruiters thoroughly review every application and will contact you within 1 to 2 weeks regarding next steps. Be sure to add Hyland to your contacts list and check your spam folder so you never miss a message from us! Do you have any follow up questions? Email your Recruiter directly at Careers@Hyland.com.  Employee Perks and Programs Flexible Schedule. Paid Time Off. Volunteer Time Off. Wellbeing Initiatives. Career Development and Training. Sabbatical Program. Reach out to your Hyland Recruiter for more information. description: Job Summary  Promote, and sell JBT GSE products and services in the South East Asia markets. This includes new products and spare parts as well as repair and refurbishment services. Expected to grow new equipment and aftermarket sales and grow JBT’s presence in the South East Asia market in a profitable and sustainable manner  Job Responsibilities To prospect for business opportunities in both existing and new customers, and grow the GSE business in South East Asia, through direct selling as well as managing some of the business through agents/distributors. Engage customers at a higher level, working with the sales managers, to ensure contact with key customers and new customers at various levels, developing customer relationships for a sustainable business. Such business involves new equipment sales, spares and spares supply contracts, and refurbishment and overhaul works of existing equipment and continual product training to grow the revenue stream. Organise product and/or themed seminars and directed presentation to existing and new customers, to educate and share with customers on the differentiated features and designs of JBT GSE products. Work with customer purchasing, legal and technical personnel to ensure JBT equipment compliance with tender specifications. Development of Product Services sales opportunities with customers. Representative to explore customer requirements to promote parts kits, training, repairs, unit inspections, and equipment refurbishment. In addition, representatives should seek out, identify, and effectively communicate information regarding competitive products and services. Prepare and produce proposal and tender documents. Work with sales team and contract manager to prepare and produce proposal and tender documents, including proposal review and pre-bidding discussions with Regional Director and business planning team in Orlando. Provide liaison support with other JBT departments, including communication with engineering, vendors, shipping and/or other field service representatives to resolve customer issues in a timely manner. Effectively interact with JBT Senior Management. Identify opportunities for executive sales and escort management on customer calls Participate and contribute to successful Ad Hoc project management, training program development, instructional development and generic problem analysis on an as-required basis. Effectively work with customers to develop win-win solutions with the as part of problem resolution including technical, financial and logistics issues Secure payment on past due customer accounts. Job Requirements Completion of University degree (in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering/Business). Over 5 years of sales experience in marketing capital equipment in industrial sectors, preferably with a minimal 3 years in the aviation/airport segment. Those candidates who may not have capital equipment selling experience, but do have experience in winning business through working with customers to draft tender specifications based on product specifications, can also be considered. Experience in engaging customers both through direct selling and through managing agents/distributors, to grow the business Familiar with contracts, tender documents and the local related bid processes. Thorough understanding of contractual and supply terms, import requirements and CAAC certification of products. Must possess strategic-thinking thought process and has demonstrated the ability to grow the business in a profitable and sustainable manner. Strategize, lead and execute the business plan for meeting annual targets, and define and maintain the growth map of the GSE business, working closely with the Regional Director – Asia Pacific.

description: The Role (Position Objective/ Summary): Works closely and collaboratively with the global team members to identify and develop sales opportunities, provide product solutions, ensure customer satisfaction, and maintains positive ongoing relationships within the assigned Vertical accounts to maximize sales for the company. description: Who are we?  Here at ADDX, we believe in a future where everybody can access financial ecosystems easily, fairly, and safely. That is why we’ve built the world’s first fully regulated platform for digital securities, licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.  In 2021, we raised USD 50 million in Series A funding led by Japan Investment Corporation and Development Bank of Japan. Among other esteemed investors, we are backed by Singapore Exchange and Heliconia, a subsidiary of Temasek.  We have gone through a total re-brand and promise this to be an exciting time. An integral part of a fast-growing team enabling investments in unicorns, pre-IPO companies, and hedge funds, your role is to innovate and discover new solutions.  If you believe in a future of fair financial markets, just like we do, we’ve been waiting for you at ADDX.  Who are we looking for?  We are looking for a highly motivated Client Relationship Manager to join our Business Development team. Your mission will be to generate and close inbound/outbound leads and ensure the growth of our investor base.  You will be responsible for building a healthy pipeline of new investors and creating a robust investor acquisition process. Success in this role will lead to expanding the scope and managing a team of Client Relationship representatives in the future.  What we offer you? Full time role based in Singapore with opportunities abroad Attractive remuneration and career path (Base Salary + Commission for every opened account + Annual bonus) Work in the exciting fintech space, powered by blockchain, transforming the future of finance and wealth management Work with a team of industry veterans from UBS, GIC, Morgan Stanley, Credit Suisse and BCG Responsibilities Drive client acquisition strategies in a fast-growing private markets platform Organize data capture, data management, and insights to create scalable, tech driven sales strategy and tactics Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation and sales playbook Manage and maintain a pipeline of quality prospects and engage for next steps Perform prospecting and pursue clients and accredited investors from all angles including cold calling, lead nurturing and networking Handle client relationships from the first chat until the day of the successful account opening Keep all records in SalesForce (or equivalent CRM) with high levels of detail orientation Use creative strategies to overcome client objections and maximize sales activity Work closely with the marketing team to develop scalable client acquisition strategy Own your targets and work independently to overperform every quarter Advocate the brand and platform when meeting prospects via events and meetings Be proactive to constantly seek out trends and opportunities in the region Requirements 3-6 years of experience in sales and/or client facing relationship management (wealth management, fintech, private markets) Sales is in your blood, hearing “no” is not an answer Exceptional EQ and ability to instantly connect with most people you meet Strategic thinker with hunger to create impact from day 1 Strong data management and creative thinker who can drive actionable insights from data Ability to work SalesForce.com (Or equivalent CRM platform) with strong process discipline Highly self-driven, well-structured yet ﬂexible, able to think strategically Excellent writing and verbal communication skills Leadership ability and desire to manage a high-performing Client Relationship team in future Due to our limited capacity, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Financial Services

description: Emarsys is seeking a driven, motivated, and unconventional Business Development Manager to bring in New Business for Singapore and South East Asia Market. You will be passionate, someone who wants to change the marketing landscape through technology, and love and consultative selling to Marketing Professionals. You enjoy working in competitive environments who will consistently overachieve and surpass expectations. You will possess a can-do attitude and embrace new challenges.  YOUR AREA OF RESPONSIBILITIES Develop a sustained pipeline in SEA by actively prospecting via cold-calls, warm leads, marketing lead follow-up, local partners, professional relationships to independently close contracts at a close frequency and value to meet or exceed productivity and quota expectations Effectively and independently deliver Emarsys value proposition, including technical value proposition, demonstrating an in depth understanding of Emarsys product platforms, email technologies, Internet technologies, etc Negotiate contracts with clients, working closely with the sales management and the Finance and Contracts department Personal responsibility and careful processing of RFP´s (Develop, write, and deliver value-based sales proposals and respond to client RFP’s.) Use Emarsys products to demonstrate our product capabilities to potential clients in person or via web access Appropriately engage management and staff in the sales cycle and provide on-going feedback to other areas of the organization Follow the established sales process Consistently and regularly use salesforce.com to provide timely and accurate forecasting and reporting of activity  YOUR PROFILE Experience selling software products and solutions to C and VP level marketing and sales professionals preferred. Demonstrated sales track record in meeting or exceeding assigned individual quota in a software or SaaS company, including a proven track record of new business sales. SEA coverage including Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, and other emerging markets experiences are advantageous. Strong pitching and networking skills, you should also be comfortable calling directly into an organization and seeking out decision-makers for our products and services. Relevant sales experience in the last two years in email (preferred), marketing automation, business, CRM or related software. Enjoys working in a structured, targeted environment to challenging KPIs. Flexible and adaptable to meet the needs of the changing market, our customers and the business. Demonstrated ability to deal with change, think strategically, and make complex decisions. Confidence presenting to large groups of people. Strong technology skills. You should be able to do complete product demonstrations and credibly discuss technical topics such as data integration, XML APIs, etc. Working knowledge of Salesforce. Strong communication skills in English and another Asian Language would be an advantage.  WHAT WE OFFER Growing office with young, talented, and like-minded individuals. Great employee health, medical, and dental benefits Young and dynamic work environment with open office plan. Fun and collaborative team members who are willing to lend a helping hand..  DIRECT FROM OUR STAFF “The office is in a fantastic location: waterfront view, close to two MRT stations and surrounded by restaurants and bars.” “Everyone in the office is always willing to help out and work as together to make sure goals are met and that people get the support they need.” “The team spirit is easy to see, with regular office events and weekly Friday breakfasts."  At Emarsys, we are committed to building diverse teams with a rich variety of perspectives and experiences. If your job profile closely aligns with our essential requirements and business need, we encourage you to apply. We are dedicated to assessing your competencies, learning agility and passion and not your age, disability, familial status, sexual orientation, gender, race, ethnicity, religion or nationality.

description: Cyberdyne Tech Exchange (CTX) is a digital green exchange licensed and regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore and powered by Nasdaq’s advanced trading and surveillance technologies. Founded in 2018, it provides qualified asset owners and institutional investors with a full-service infrastructure including primary issuance, secondary trading, settlement, and custody of asset-backed tokens. Singapore-based CTX aims to be a global hub for green financing and will be the first exchange to incorporate carbon disclosures for both issuers and investors. Our ideal candidate should have the ability to handle sensitive information confidentially. Desired personal traits include ability to navigate through the emerging space, be a team player, able to work effectively and collaborate with colleagues across the firm. Roles and Responsibilities: Actively approach and pitch existing and potential clients with emerging digital products that meet their investment requirements. Work closely with clients, to enhance working relationships and ensure the client’s needs are met. Work to broaden relationships with institutional investors in Singapore and elsewhere. Work closely with other departments on client related matters and assist in any ad-hoc projects as required. Serve as the primary day to day contact for all relationship activities, including daily ad hoc enquiries and in-depth search of information regarding portfolios and operational related requests. Responding to any enquiries by clients and ensuring the quality and accuracy of both regular and ad hoc reports to be delivered to clients. Liaise and establish strong relationship with other departments for the on-boarding process of clients and ensure client reporting needs are met. Provide proactive support and communication to clients with respect to product performance, attributes and developments. Arrange and coordinate client portfolio meetings to review investment guidelines, objectives and process. Ensure client documentation is updated accordingly and internal monitoring is feasible. Requirements: A university degree or higher with 3 - 5 years of relevant experience. Proven track record in business development and sales within the Financial Institution industry. Bilingual, excellent oral and written communication skills. MAS representative license Possess solid experience in buy & sell side environment. Ability to build the trust and confidence of clients, ability to strengthen client relationships through ongoing dialog and interactions, ability to work well with others to accomplish client objectives. Self-starter, resourceful, able to work independently and in a small team environment. Demonstrated history of being results-oriented, able to work under pressure, and organized.

description: About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Vietnam, Indonesia, Seoul, and Tokyo. Visit www.tiktok.com  About the Team: We’re looking for an APAC Productivity & Efficiency Manager who can define and execute against strategic priorities to unlock revenue and better enable our sales teams across the APAC region. Our Sales Operations and Planning team is essential to enabling TikTok's sales teams to drive revenue at scale efficiently and strategically. This team is responsible for revenue planning and pricing, operational effectiveness in our tooling and sales processes, and ensuring productive and fruitful partnership cross-functionally across internal teams  Responsibilities: - Document data flows, standard campaign operating procedures, and project-related requirements, issues analysis to determine areas of improvement and identify bottlenecks in the sales process - Work with other Sales Operation members to resolve sales support issues in a timely manner - Optimize overall sales processes, promote cross-functional partnership and buy-in, and ensure smooth cross-team communication, all while reducing friction and identifying any potential conflicts of interest across the in-market teams - Work with cross-functional teams and provide input on sales operations processes and CRM based on sales feedback and real practice - Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to identify training and development needs and deliver training as needed to support the initiatives - Foster and maintain strong working relationships with critical business partners (e.g. Revenue Recognition, Legal, Finance, etc.) expedite the review/approval process  Preferred qualifications: - BA/BS in Marketing, Business Administration, Analytics or related field - 3+ years of experience in a fast-paced technology company with knowledge of the digital advertising landscape and/or KPIs for mobile ads is preferred - Has technical proficiency in these systems is preferred - SalesForce, Insightly, Tableau, and other MS Office Suite programs - Ability to multitask and switch focus quickly - Is a self-starter and has the ability to work independently - High attention to detail and strong organisational skills - Comfortable in working in a high-pressure environment along with ruthless prioritization skills - English fluency - Have a passion for TikTok  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

description: What's the role?  As the Sr Partner Sales Manager, you own partner ecosystem for HERE in Southeast Asia, executing the Partner Playbook to craft breakthrough opportunities for the company and its partners. You will lead the SEA Partner Team, own the team’s quota and be individually responsible for partnerships with certain key strategic partners in the region.  HERE is growing our reach within targeted segments and your expertise within Transport & Logistics, Retail, Tech, Media and Telco will see you solving real business problems using innovative location technology.  HERE prides itself on five core values, Be True, Be Bold, Win Together, Learn Fast, Give Back, and your role is to represent HERE in the Partner ecosystem as we drive towards our vision to enable an autonomous world for everyone.  Your Main Responsibilities Include Establishing and cultivating executive relationships and securing executive buy-in at key SEA Partners. Understanding the organization, structure, and business model of Partners and develop relationships with decision makers, and technical/sales operatives to ensure efficient communication and productivity. Leading and managing partner initiatives, architectural wins and identifying new strategies & incentives for field engagement and business success Creating and running a governance structure for projects and initiatives owned Acting as a strategic advisor to Strategic Partners and HERE Business Units Working closely with key stakeholders to execute on the next generation Open Location Platform (give/get model). Leading the relationships and owning the partner sales quota for the assigned Strategic Partners and your SEA Partner Sales Team. Contributing to a Strategic Partner business plan for alliance solutions and initiatives Executing program & project plans for the assigned Strategic Partners Organizing monthly progress meetings and quarterly business reviews for the assigned Strategic Partners Providing input into the Strategic Partner portfolio strategy and monthly operations reviews. Who are you?  You are a problem-solver and influential collaborator who can conceptualize winning strategies, formulate strategic initiatives, and execute under tight timelines.  You also possess the followings skills, competencies and work experience: A bachelor’s degree in business or related fields 17+ years of work experience managing partners in an information technology or IT Platform company Strong understanding of strategic alliances/partners frameworks. Understanding of SEA business and partner landscape Ability to collaborate and work closely with the Sales organization Strong commercial and contracting skills Negotiation and business development skills Experience in quota carrying role People management skills and an ability to inspire a high level of performance in your team members. HERE is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  Due to Covid related border control measures, we will be prioritising candidates who are based in Singapore.  Who are we?  HERE Technologies is a location data and technology platform company. We empower our customers to achieve better outcomes – from helping a city manage its infrastructure or a business optimize its assets to guiding drivers to their destination safely.  At HERE we take it upon ourselves to be the change we wish to see. We create solutions that fuel innovation, provide opportunity and foster inclusion to improve people’s lives. If you are inspired by an open world and driven to create positive change, join us. Learn more about us. Watch Video

description: Are you looking for a role which allows you to showcase your technical capabilities, problems solving and stakeholder management skills? Look no further, this role will provide your opportunity and challenges in both technical and customer-facing domains.  Besides, you will be working with talented and passionate colleagues around the world, on interesting projects across APAC. Don’t miss this golden opportunity, apply with us today!  Your responsibilities Together with the Sales Manager you will make an important contribution to sales success in the pre-contract phase of a project. Your tasks include identifying customer needs, developing and evaluating the right logistics solutions, preparing sales proposals and presenting these to customers. You will build and maintain together with the Sales Manager and the rest of the Sales Engineering team a constructive working relation with the customer and define the appropriate sales tactics.  During the tender process you will work on complex technical and business issues and develop solutions using automation equipment from Vanderlande and preferred suppliers. For the internal organisation you are the contact person on technical and concept specifications in relation to the project, and you will play an important role in the transfer from the sales team to the project execution team.  The Sales Engineer is fully in control of quality and progress with respect to the sales proposal and calculates the price of the proposal. You translate the needs (within RFPs) into solutions while evaluating technical conformances, non-conformances, functionality, business needs, cost, and risks.  Your qualifications and skills Master’s (preferred) or Bachelor’s degree in relevant study (Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Automation, Electro-mechanical Engineering, Logistics, or similar discipline) 5 years relevant working experience Strong customer focus Team player Creative Ability to multi-task and work on several projects simultaneously Ability to work effectively in an entrepreneurial international organization, often working across organizational, geographic, and cultural boundaries Strong analytical ability to structure and solve logistics problems Good communication skills (internal and external) Willing to travel internationally (up to 20% of your time)  Company profile Established in 1949, Vanderlande is the global market leader for future-proof logistic process automation at airports. The company is also a leading supplier of process automation solutions for warehouses and in the parcel market.  Vanderlande has more than 7,500 employees, all committed to moving its customers’ businesses forward at diverse locations on every continent. With a consistently increasing turnover of 1.8 billion euros, it has established a global reputation over the past seven decades as a highly reliable partner for future-proof logistic process automation.  Vanderlande was acquired in 2017 by Toyota Industries Corporation, which will help it to continue its sustainable profitable growth. The two companies have a strong strategic match, and the synergies include cross-selling, product innovations, and research and development. The Singapore office is part of Customer Centre Airports Parcel Solutions Asia Pacific (CC APS APAC) and is active in Asia Pacific region.  The Sales organization is active in the market segments Airports (Baggage Handling Systems) and Parcel sortation facilities. To support the further growth of CC APS APAC we are recruiting for a Sales Engineer.  If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Please submit your detailed resume with information on current salary, expected salary and date of availability. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  By sending us your personal data and curriculum vitae (CV), you are deemed to consent to Vanderlande Industries and its overseas subsidiaries and affiliates collecting, using and disclosing your personal data for purposes of evaluating suitability for employment, conducting reference checks, administering employment related services and such other purposes stated in our privacy policy.  Please visit www.vanderlande.com/privacy-statement for a copy of our Privacy Policy.

description: The position: The essence of this role is to generate revenue by maximising relationships and generating client opportunities. The position requires someone with significant digital ad sales experience who is target driven and proactive with a versatile, positive and determined nature. Solid market knowledge and technical understanding are essential. This person must be a confident presenter, strong relationship builder and persuasive negotiator. This person will be a strategic thinker who enjoys creating and delivering large scale innovative, brand campaigns.  Responsibilities: Define and execute appropriate sales strategies; business development, marketing, technical, ad operations and sales support programs to maximize sales and profitability. Meet quarterly revenue targets Negotiation, development and maintenance of trading deals Create strong relationships with key client stakeholders at both senior and mid-management levels with media agencies, DSPs & 3rd party partners Maintain sales volume, product mix and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators and competitors Work with internal teams to ensure the highest level of customer service Ensure new businesses is a priority to grow all possible revenue streams Work closely with colleagues on cross-territory opportunities and internal teams across various projects Brief design team Ensure pipeline is up to date with live and proposed campaign information and agency contact details Analysing data, building reporting and making strategic recommendations based on data and trends  You must have: 4+ years of digital advertising sales experience Positive attitude with clients and co-workers An independent self-starter who has an interest in the advertising industry and is keen to develop skills in marketing and research Creative problem solving A high level of initiative Ability to give and receive effective feedback with respect Proven ability to consistently deliver and exceed sales targets Experience identifying additional revenue streams and acquiring new business Possess the confidence to deliver high quality and engaging sales presentations Excellent written and verbal communication skills Collaborative individual who thrives in a team environment Bachelor’s degree   My client offers a competitive salary and incentives plan, based on experience and increase with performance.
