description: About Temenos  We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.  We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.  Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!  THE ROLE  Are you passionate about coaching sales associates and helping people achieve their goals?  Are you an experienced inside sales professional looking to build a management career?  In this team lead role, you will have direct visibility to our regional leadership team, helping Temenos to achieve our aggressive APAC pipeline and growth goals. Additionally, you will manage the day-to-day operations with direct line management responsibility for Inside Sales Associates. You'll recruit, support, advise, and inspire them to achieve career growth and success.  Key Responsibilities  Hire, train, and onboard new Inside Sales associates Manage, motivate and develop a team of Inside Sales associates Help them improve their performance and generate leads to achieve sales outcomes (both new business and cross-sell) for both inbound and proactive outbound activity. Coach individual team members on how to improve their business acumen and commercial skills, overcome performance gaps and deliver ongoing informal/formal feedback to help the team build careers and conduct end of year performance reviews, and address any performance management gaps as appropriate Conduct monthly performance scorecard reviews with the team Accomplish targeted sales goals and achieve relevant KPI's Evaluate and improve new and existing operational processes (including but not limited to commission processes, SLAs on marketing/sales engagements) Report on team metrics to both the team and relevant stakeholders on weekly/monthly cadence calls Ensure correct usage and adoption of Salesforce and other tools Drive team to individual and team goals, driving team utilization and territory allocation Collaborate with marketing and sales on upcoming go-to-market campaigns and planned marketing events to ensure Inside Sales support Communicate performance of the team weekly, celebrating success and highlighting gaps to target as appropriate.  Skills & Experience  Leader: You inspire and receive buy-in from both your team and cross-functional stakeholders Coach and people developer: You want to not only lead but also develop and coach a team of Inside Sales Associates Strategic/Analytical: Ability to improve processes and execute initiatives while working closely with stakeholders to ensure operational efficiency of the team Pipeline management: Ensure proper pipeline development to meet short-term and long-term targets from lead generation Communicator: You're just as effective at addressing issues as you are at celebrating success Creative thinker: You look outside of the box to find solutions to generate new business to meet growing sales targets Visionary: You are able to look ahead, forecast, and an ability to consider future opportunities and potential problems You have experience in the following: prospecting, cold outreach, pipeline management, inbound sales, and taking the lead through the sales cycle Adaptable: You're able to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt quickly  WHY TEMENOS  You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day. You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best. You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises. You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity. You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients. You will experience what we call – Temenosity!  We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.  Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy

description: Alliance Manager, APAC  Can you ensure that our market-leading audio solutions target just the right audience by leading the end-to-end global system integrators processes? In this newly established role, your interpersonal and stakeholder management skills will be key.  Jabra is a leader in engineering communications and sound solutions – innovating to empower both consumers and businesses. Proudly part of the GN Group, we are committed to letting people hear more, do more, and be more than they ever thought possible.  Through sound and video, we help transform lives. Jabra engineering excellence leads the way, building on 150 years of pioneering work. This allows us to create integrated headsets and communications tools that help professionals work more productively; wireless headphones and earbuds that let consumers better enjoy calls, music, and media; and pioneering video conferencing solutions, enabling seamless collaboration between distributed teams.  Jabra employs approx. 1,800 people worldwide, and reported annual revenue of DKK 6,2bn in 2019. The GN Group, founded in 1869, operates in 100 countries and delivers innovation, reliability, and ease of use. Today, GN employs 6,500 people, and is Nasdaq Copenhagen listed. GN makes life sound better. www.jabra.com     Take the lead on end-to-end alliance processes  Jabra is searching for a Alliance Manager to develop and define alliances for APAC business units. Working with our global team and local sales and marketing, you will need to maintain broad and deep partner relations with our strategic alliances.  To be successful, the position will need to collaborate with local marketing, sales and the global team along with a clear understanding of alliance priorities and scope in all aspects of the alliance business.  The position will require travel, and the need for a deep relationship with the alliance. You will help to drive the alliance engagement for the APAC business units. Participate at alliance and industry events, provide presentations and have knowledge of our product portfolio.  Review and implement global alliance strategies for APAC, and build potential go to market scenarios with our alliance partners  Reporting directly to the Head of Product & Alliances APAC. Will also have to work across a matrix organization with direct engagement with corporate teams.   You will get your hand on the following exciting tasks:  Develop APAC alliances for our business units Manage the alliance proactively and map out the alliances capabilities and understanding for our market Create go to market opportunities with the alliances Have a deep knowledge and understanding of the alliances Work with local and regional marketing on alliance campaigns and plans Educate the alliance on our value propositions Help to drive joint engagement with customers working with our sales teams Report back on alliance engagements on a monthly basis Drive quarterly reviews with the alliances Deep understanding of Telecommunications, Information Technology, Audio Video, Contact Centers, and Unified Communications solutions in APAC region Undertanding of software development and API/SDK is beneficial Versitile with a strong sense of purpose Maturity to talk with all levels of the partner organisation Will come across as professional and knowledgable Needs to present in customer situations and deliver our messaging to the partner Ability to build, lead and execute strategy in a cross-functional environment Self-motivated, innovative, collaborative, multi-tasker, creative and analytical. Strong project management skills  Ability to manage work and meet specific deadlines, delivering high quality results Ability to share and communicate knowledge with team/others High integrity honours commitments: consistent and predictable follow-up Commitment to cultural sensitivity and respectful of diversity Strong organizational and analytical skills, a structured thinker, excellent written and verbal communication skills, an experienced company spokesperson Willing to travel across APAC Excellent oral and written communication skills, and a proven ability to communicate effectively in a multi-cultural matrix environment and at all levels from marketing to country sales managers.  We imagine the following sound like you:  Bachelor’s Degree required in relevant field 4 – 7 working experience in alliance partner experience Capable of working remotely, ability to stay on task, and multitask, in a remote work environment Excellent communication and problem-solving skills  Would you like to know more? To apply, use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 30th October 2021. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

In this role you will... Develop and execute sales strategy and territory plan for your assigned territory Prospect target customers and qualify opportunities Propose solutions that align to prospects’ and/or clients’ needs, goals and objectives Work with partners when necessary by teaming with re-sellers or bringing partner solutions to the opportunity as required Continue to expand relationships and penetration within existing clients within your portfolio Be capable of delivering targeted and differentiating product demonstrations yourself when necessary Work closely with Field Marketing to establish the Cornerstone brand and presence in your market and to deliver targeted marketing interventions to clients and prospects Assist with localization of marketing messaging and positioning in your local market Manage sales process for individual opportunities to ensure successful outcomes Proactively and accurately manage opportunity/pipeline data in CRM application (currently Salesforce.com) Forecast accurately Building strong internal and external relationships Consistently meet/exceed established quotas Establish trusted partnership with new and existing clients and collaborate with other functions to ensure that clients are successful and reference-able Partner with the Service Delivery teams to ensure a smooth and successful hand-off of new wins into the subsequent phases of the Client Lifecycle (e.g., implementation, adoption and optimization) Consideration of security and privacy obligations You’ve Got What It Takes If You Have... Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or equivalent 8+ years of relevant software sales experience with a history of consistent goal attainment Fluency in English and Chinese/Bahasa Experience in working with Alliances / Channel Sales Team The ability to manage both at the strategic and operational levels Excellent command of written and spoken English language. Strong communications skills Strong organizational skills; highly motivated self-starter with an ability to work without constant supervision An expansive network that includes potential target customers and (channel implementation) partners Outstanding consultative/solution selling skills and consistently not only achieve, but exceed targets Effective customer follow-up, from implementation through to on-going account management Excellent interpersonal skills and success in building relationships internally and externally Strong command of Microsoft Office and virtual meeting technologies such as Cisco WebEx Ability to travel internationally as required Citizen of and/or permanent resident in the country the candidate applies for Extra dose of awesome if you have... Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) sales experience Experience selling talent management and/or HR-related software or services highly valued Our Culture  Our mission is to empower people, businesses and communities. A culture created less by what we do and more by who we are. When people ask what our team is about, we point to our core values: champion customer success, bring our best, achieve together, get stuff done, and innovate every day. We're always on the lookout for new, curious and capable people who can help us achieve our goal and we are seeking diversity in the people who join our team. We want to make sure that our company reflects the demographic of our customers, clients, and the communities in which we operate. So if you want to work for a friendly, global, inclusive and innovative company, we'd love to meet you!  What We Do  Cornerstone is a premier people development company. We believe people can achieve anything when they have the right development and growth opportunities. We offer organizations the technology, content, expertise and specialized focus to help them realize the potential of their people. Featuring comprehensive recruiting, personalized learning, modern training content, development-driven performance management and holistic employee data management and insights, Cornerstone’s people development solutions are successfully used by more than 75 million people in 180+ countries and in nearly 50 languages.  Cornerstone takes special care to ensure the security and privacy of the data of its users.  Check us out on Linkedin , Comparably , Glassdoor , and Facebook !  Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental commitment at Cornerstone OnDemand. description: JOB PURPOSE:  The Product Marketing Manager is responsible for the overall performance of a business unit with regards to sales, margin, inventory, quoting strategies, suppliers, and the ongoing development of the employees.  PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:  Set & achieve sales and margin budgets & objectives Perform all necessary research and analysis to establish achievable but yet aggressive sales and profit margin goals by class and by supplier.  Business unit quarterly business review Review entire business KPI (Key performance indicators) with business unit. Determine actions required to meet objectives. This is an all-encompassing review: sales, inventory, profit margin, in addition to performance to SLA (Service Level Agreement); supplier performance, customer performance, staff development, etc.  Supplier relationship management Build and maintain relationships with all suppliers at the appropriate levels. Supplier Champions are assigned for each supplier.  DPP pricing negotiation In conjunction with the Global Commodity Manager, negotiate preferential pricing for Future on stocking devices. For focus suppliers, the Director is responsible.  Product knowledge Understand the basic technologies for which you are responsible. Top end applications, basic electronic function the product does in a circuit. Understand the market trends of the end application as fluctuations can influence supply and demand.  Market knowledge Understand and communicate competitive landscape, product availability, pricing trends. Maintain close scrutiny on market conditions (lead-time and lead-time trends) to establish when inventory needs to be increased in anticipation of future market developments.   JOB CONTENT:                                       Perform all necessary research and analysis to establish achievable but yet aggressive sales and profit margin goals by class and by supplier. Review entire business KPI (Key performance indicators) with business unit. Determine actions required to meet objectives. This is an all-encompassing review: sales, inventory, profit margin, in addition to performance to SLA (Service Level Agreement); supplier performance, customer performance, staff development, etc. Build and maintain relationships with all suppliers at the appropriate levels. Supplier Champions are assigned for each supplier. In conjunction with the Global Commodity Manager, negotiate preferential pricing for Future on stocking devices. For focus suppliers, the Director is responsible. Understand the basic technologies for which you are responsible. Top end applications, basic electronic function the product does in a circuit. Understand the market trends of the end application as fluctuations can influence supply and demand. Understand and communicate competitive landscape, product availability, pricing trends. Maintain close scrutiny on market conditions (lead-time and lead-time trends) to establish when inventory needs to be increased in anticipation of future market developments. Based on business unit strategy, review all CBO for assigned branches to identify potential issues and sales and profit margin opportunities. Prepare and execute quarterly reviews and ensure that we deliver on our commitments to suppliers by creating realistic objectives and follow through on action items. Plan and prepare meeting agenda for communication meetings. Present & discuss relevant information in a timely and effective manner. It should include topics such as Service Level Agreement, sales, profit margin, quoting, training, market conditions. Negotiate special returns with suppliers where we require additional flexibility outside of contractual rotation/scrap allowance. In addition, special returns need to be actioned by any individual who is able to use their relationship, developed with the supplier, to gain a favor. Identify and maintain parts in inventory where sales and marketing needs to be alerted to tightened availability for appropriate business reasons (market conditions, manufacturing issues, etc). Approval of quotes based on a dollar threshold set by business unit. As appropriate, visit selected customers in the field, and participate in customer visits at corporate headquarters. Prepare and present appropriate information. Expedite existing supplier purchase back orders for stocking and/or specific customer requirements. For those situations where greater effort and relationship is required to achieve satisfactory results. Target and sign new franchises. Determine initial inventory investment, execute on supplier development plan. Perform range reviews to determine top non line items to create and purchase. Assign quotes by branch and balance workload across quoting positions in a business unit. Update cost books, lead-time, factory stock, cross reference files for dashboard and business unit shared drive. Adjust CBO pricing upwards in appropriate business conditions (supplier cost increase, restricted availability, etc).  Prepare and present product related material to increase knowledge base of marketers and / or sales. Includes arrangement of suppliers / reps to conduct training sessions.  QUALIFICATIONS   A minimum Degree or equivalent  JOB REQUIREMENT(S) Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience in an electronics distribution industry, component manufacturers and/or EMS companies. Proficient in using MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook) Strong Communication Skills – verbal and written Results oriented Ability to work in a competitive, fast paced and multitasking environment Strong ability to negotiate and communicate ideas effectively Immediate starters/short notice will be advantageous Candidate with more years of work experience may be considered for 'Senior' role.

description: We invite you to bring your expertise into play as you work in collaboration with senior management in Ramboll Water in Singapore and globally. You will take on the lead responsibilities for water infrastructure and climate adaptation related projects in the Market/Geography and subject matter expertise within climate resilience projects. To succeed in this role, you must have significant professional experience with our key clients in the IFI-segment, such as ADB and WB, project management expertise and domain knowledge to act as a subject matter expert in managing and delivering complex projects. Are you our new Market and Business Development Manager? Click the apply-button to send your application.  Inviting bright minds  Do you want to push the boundaries of your profession and develop your excellence in an open, collaborative and empowering culture? We work to create a sustainable future and our inspiring projects and innovative solutions aim to set the standard among our peers. You will join a global company that has been growing successfully since its founding in 1945. Together, we lead and leave a positive impact on societies, companies and people around the world.  You will join our Global Water Infrastructure and Climate Adaptation Division.  As our new Market and Business Development Manager you will be part of the Singapore Water team, sitting in the intersection of the Geography and Market dimensions for the Global Water Infrastructure and Climate Adaptation Division. Your will serve as the day-to-day manager of business development activities for select client segments and programs in Singapore and the APAC Region, and take on the lead responsibilities for Water related projects in the Market/Geography. You will work together with the local water team-leadership and senior experts and project managers in the business units for Water, Environment & Health, Architecture and Landscape, Transport and Buildings.  Your key tasks and responsibilities will be Serve as senior expert and primary contact to clients on large projects and as Key Account Manager with selected key accounts Serve as Project Manager on Water Infrastructure and Climate Adaptation projects Serve as subject matter expert on climate resilience projects Grow the business by leading strategy development on key opportunities and tenders Maintaining and developing close relationships with major utilities in the Asia Pacific region and globally to determine major projects for pursuit. Provide high level close relationships with target clients to develop winning strategy for pursuit of future projects in Singapore and neighbouring countries. Provide existing strong relationships with leading Universities and expand relationships with other strategic thought leaders that give an advantage to winning work. Develop thought leadership on advanced water infrastructure and climate adaptation related technologies Contribute to collaboration across the geographies within Water business unit, and between Ramboll Business Units, taking advantage of synergies and competencies (resources, skills, clients) Support strategic decision making and management of own unit performance Support to maximize profitable growth of the Department and Water in Singapore, in close collaboration with Global Division Directors. Supports the development of the Business Plan for the Department, Markets and Geography. Act as Strategic Advisor in expertise and business development, project implementation and client management Strategic Selling - Understands Ramboll's strategy, vision and distinctiveness and effectively selects, drives and leads strategic sales to high profile clients in support of Ramboll's strategic direction. Keeps pipeline growing and is effective in selling new projects. Has extensive knowledge of the strategic direction of Ramboll and drives strategic selling into current and new areas and where clients value what Ramboll offers. Drives selling approach and the tender process in accordance with Ramboll code of conduct and in compliance with Project Excellence Life Cycle. Strategic Planning - Creating the capacity for business value and developing business plans for the department, Business Unit and/or PBU. Being knowledgeable in aspects that may affect Ramboll as a business as well as in understanding the competitive landscape. Maximizes the identification of profitable business opportunities and is able to translate into an actionable business plan. Understands how to prioritize efforts in the market, in client relations and in own organization. Cooperates with Market Developers on creating Go to Market Plans. Leadership - With the leadership team establishes a compelling vision based on lead expertise in subject matter which others are motivated and inspired to follow. Contributes to the development of people and talent and manages obstacles and risks which may interfere with the needs of the client and the achievement of Ramboll's operational and strategic objectives. Drives the achievement of business plans and results by establishing clear direction, by laying out work in an organized manner and by managing day-to-day work. Addresses risks, problems or challenging situations and deals with those professionally and promptly. Recognizes and develops people to allow talents to flourish, ensures high employee engagement and encourages strong collaborative communities. Entrepreneurship - Generating business value by innovatively influencing the markets in which Ramboll operates and in positioning Ramboll, its portfolio and its capabilities positively within them. Maximizes and prioritizes the identification of profitable market-based opportunities and efforts required to deliver them. Fully considers geographic, industry, client and domain specific actions required to deliver the Go to Market Plan. Develops entrepreneurial approaches in exerting influence over the client's buying and decision-making preferences. Understands international market conditions including relevant regulations, country and contract laws. Your starting point for constant growth  From the moment you join Ramboll, we will support your personal and professional development so that you grow with the company. For this role, we believe your starting point is Master Degree within environmental or civil engineering field, or related water infrastructure and climate adaptation specialization. Strong technical/ functional acumen. Thought leader in process design of advanced water infrastructure and climate adaptation Significant professional experience and domain knowledge, where a significant component should be from the lead role on subject matter and/or management of teams preferable in international context Experience working with Asian Development Bank (ADB) Extensive knowledge of Asia Pacific market and work experience in this region Extensive knowledge of international project procurement cycle Proven ability to manage, in terms of identify and develop talent, set direction for diverse and multi-disciplinary teams and manage performance Strong relations to the academic world & relevant Universities Strong commercial and business acumen and ability to drive execution on deliverables. Strong English language skills (written and oral), along with strong communication and negotiating skills Personal qualities that will help you succeed in this role include Strong commercial and business acumen  Welcome to our Water division  At Ramboll, a global team of specialised water consultants support the development of sustainable societies. We assist our clients with their most challenging water management issues, delivering solutions that enable people and nature to flourish. Our main service areas cover Climate Adaptation & Landscape Architecture, Water & Wastewater Treatment, Water Resource Management, and Water & Wastewater Networks.  Ramboll in Middle East and Asia Pacific  Ramboll has more than 1,500 experts working across 15 offices in the Middle East and Asia Pacific. We are present in Saudi Arabia, Qatar, the United Arab Emirates, China, India, Malaysia, Hong Kong SAR, Singapore, Australia and New Zealand. Our experts are applying their passion to deliver innovative solutions in markets as diverse as Buildings, Transport, Planning & Urban Design, Water, Environment & Health and Energy. Founded in Denmark, Ramboll is a people company. We invite you to contribute to a sustainable future working in an open, collaborative and empowering culture.  How To Apply  Apply online. Attach your CV, cover letter and relevant documents showcasing why you are the right fit for the role, and when you are available to start. We look forward to receiving your application.

description: Reports to: Managing Director  About the role We are looking for an organised Business Operation Manager to operate the B2C and B2B business with achieving sales target. Your responsibilities include making emotional connection between the brand and the customer with executing the clear brand concept, visual merchandising and excellent customer experience in stores in collaboration with sales team, maintaining passionate sales team and good relationship with retailers. You will represent our company's brand and drives strategies to increase brand awareness by observing the market, competitors, and industry trends.  To be a successful Business Operation Manager, you should have strong interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills. Basically, everyone - if not most people, should be fond of you. You should also possess an in-depth knowledge and understanding of sales, customer service and visual merchandising.  Responsibilities Understand monthly, annual sales target and ensuring that the sales team meets their quotas and goals. Understand brand concept and communicate it to the customer with inspirational visual merchandising and excellent customer service. Research and develop the appropriate Customer Relationship Management (CRM) program to retain regular customers. Research and suggest the attractive sales promotion. Recruit, train, schedule, coach, and manage sales teams to meet sales and human resource objectives. Every member of the team should be as good as you are. Promote a strong sense of teamwork by working together safely, effectively, respectfully and efficiently with all associates. Communicate customer feedback to sales team concerning policies and/or product requests, problems and suggestions. Maintain relationships with important retailers and B2B customers by making regular visits, understanding their needs, and anticipating new marketing opportunities. Manage accurate sales input which tallies with department stores’ record. Manage accurate and optimal inventory per location ( stores and warehouse ) Gather, investigate, and summarise market data and trends to draft reports with meaningful insights.  Requirements Compulsory Requirements Minimum 2 years' experience in retail operation or sales manager in consumer goods retail industry. Minimum 2 years' experience in POS, CRM, Inventory management system. Minimum 2 years' experience in MS office. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills. You have a knack for making most people like you. The ability to understand and follow company policies and procedures. The ability to work under pressure - and not crack while you're at it. Kind English speaking and writing.  Preferred Requirements Mandarin speaking B2B business operation

description: Description The Business Development Manager is responsible for business development, managing large key accounts, marketing, sales of both broad-based and niche logistics services including performing market research, prospecting, developing relationships with potential customers and meeting sales targets. He/She is also responsible for managing business resources, including manpower and internal assets. Resourceful and analytical, he/she is required to manage resources and obtain buy-in from internal and external stakeholders. He/She is also expected to lead teams and make business decisions independently. To support the Business Development Director in developing market entry strategies and business plans in Singapore that align with the Group’s business direction. To assist the Business Development Director in the development and implementation of business development plans to achieve short term and long-term business development goals and objectives. To manage the relationship with existing and potential clients to develop new opportunities and advance an organization’s business interests. To provide support to the Business Development Director to drive strategic initiatives related to business development opportunities and strategic alliances, JV’s, mergers/acquisitions/divestitures, etc. To identify and evaluate business opportunities within the Group’s vision, mission. Make a decision for the organization within his/her designated authority by assessing ROI, risk, and cost/benefit. To undertake market research (in a house or outsource) to keep the management abreast of the latest market and industry trends To evaluate the findings of market research; assess the viability of alternative market segments for growth and make recommendations. Obtaining new orders for an employment agency, etc related project and negotiating terms and securing a favorable contract. Arranging workers for deployment to the sites and technical personnel to ensure the quality of work done. Monitor progress of work regularly and get feedback from field staff and take corrective action at the right time. Follow up on payment matters including bank related issues. Furthering the employment agency business of the organization by looking for more employers and job seekers to avail of our services. Review the reports and make necessary adjustments according to the local markets/clients specifics Attend and present sales decks during conference, seminars and networking sessions; represent the Company at the main industry events Generate monthly reports on clients and prospect feedbacks and sales reports If necessary, search and engage employees for project-based and permanent work, stating the KPIs and providing training To render effective and satisfactory services to our clients-employers & candidates. Requirements Must be able to travel independently outside Singapore for company work purposes. Must be having good command on local Chinese language and local China market also able to understand international multiple languages at the same time. Must able to work in split shift willing to travel multiple times out of Singapore frequently in non-official hours and even public holiday & weekends also. Collaborate with key account managers to identify new business and grow relationships that assist in revenue generation within assigned verticals. Develop co-created solutions with customers to enhance offerings and competitiveness. Develop intervention strategies to mitigate gaps in the delivery of logistics services. Develop sales performance metrics based on organization service prices and cost structure approach. Develop vertical business plans to grow the markets of vertical sectors. Drive customer attraction and retention strategies to improve customer loyalty. Engage in targeted conversations that steer customers to solutions that address their needs. Manage teams in the workplace. Optimum use of allocated resources within business activities. Review customer needs to enhance offerings and competitiveness. Review sales performance metrics to enhance sales outcomes. Review sales proposals/ tender documents. Shape sales outcome effectiveness. Self-Motivated and organized Excellent negotiation and communication skills Excellent presenation skills

description: Description  Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a dynamic results oriented candidate to join as the Startup Partner Success Manager within our ASEAN Partner team.  As the Startup Partner Success Manager within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon’s utility computing web services (including Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, Amazon CloudFront, Amazon RDS) within the portfolio of partners and solution providers.  Your broad responsibilities will include helping to define and execute against the partner program for ASEAN, establishing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with Startups in order to build long-term business and marketing opportunities. The ideal candidate will possess both a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CXO/VP level, as well as a technical background that enables them to easily interact with software developers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.  Other Responsibilities Include Serve as a key member of the ASEAN Startup team in helping to drive the overall AWS Startup Partner Strategy Have a broad based understanding of cloud technologies Develop a group of committed partners including a plan to recruit, on-board, educate and measure them across ASEAN Countries Develop and execute the strategic business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales, marketing, legal, support, etc.). Work with specific prospects/partners to develop the business value proposition for using our services and solutions for the specific prospects/partners; educate and enable them for using AWS solutions Establish the business development pipeline by engaging with prospects and key customers Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress against budgeted plan and any potential roadblocks to closing new customers Manage complex contract negotiations and serve as a liaison to the legal group Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of the market strategy Handle ad-hoc incoming inquiries and qualify them as potential AWS BD targets.  Basic Qualifications  The right person will have a balance of technical and analytical background; possess extensive sales, Channels and/or business development experience. Other requirements include: Degree/MBA in relevant disciplines with at least ten years of working knowledge of software development tech companies. Extensive channel and alliance experience is an essential requirement to be successful in this role. Strong verbal and written communications skills as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Preferred Qualifications Experience working with Startups in ASEAN is highly desired Exposure to and experience is developing channel programs to deliver sustainable revenue. Culturally aware and have good interpersonal skills; able to collaborate across different functional teams and internal stakeholders. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore  Job ID: A1659925

description: Circles.Life will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require sponsorship of a visa.  About This Role  Account Management Executive is involved across all stages of the execution of successful partnerships with top-tier companies- from identifying the right partners, proposing exciting partnership angles, negotiating mutually beneficial terms and executing with a strong focus on analytics and user experience.  This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to develop their skills in sales and business development.  Successful candidate can expect to be a key resource in developing partnerships between Circles.Life and top companies in Singapore.  About Circles.life  Circles.Life is Asia’s first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in Singapore in 2016, and have since expanded to Australia, Taiwan, Indonesia and Japan. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth.  Circles.Life was founded by Rameez Ansar (ex-Temasek, BCG), Abhishek Gupta (ex-McKinsey, Bain Capital, StanChart PE) & Adeel Najam (ex- Nokia, Huawei, Starhub), who are supported by an all-star leadership team including C-suite executives from Tata Docomo, Paypal, Vodafone, Bharti Airtel, Hooq/ Singtel, and Flipkart (to name a few)  It now employs 400+ people over 5 APAC offices. It is the portfolio company of Warburg Pincus and Sequoia  Notable accolades from past years include: Top 5 most loved Singapore brands (2nd year running)- YouGov Customer's Choice; Top Telco for Customer Service- Seedly; and Top Employer- Influential Brands (2019)  WHY THIS ROLE IS UNIQUE  Account Management Executive is involved across all stages of the execution of successful partnerships with top-tier companies- from identifying the right partners, proposing exciting partnership angles, negotiating mutually beneficial terms and executing with a strong focus on analytics and user experience.  This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to develop their skills in sales and business development. Successful candidate can expect to be a key resource in developing partnerships between Circles.Life and top companies in Singapore.  What You'll Do  Business development: Identify new opportunity of growth with partners and end-to-end customer journey. Ability to convince partners to join certain  Account management: Ensuring a smooth on-boarding experience for partners with a focus on addressing and predicting their concerns. Taking ownership for timely resolution of partners’ queries and needs is a critical component for this role. Drive upsells and reduce churn.  Reporting and following up: Presenting analysis and ideas in a clear, concise manner and executing follow ups like a hawk.  Analytics: Must be able to align and agree with partners on campaign analytics. Must be able to extract meaningful insights by analyzing campaign data; specifically optimizing for choice of channels, target segment, and user journey. Analyze CIS customer base data, and develop suitable sales strategies in conjunction with Consumer to drive sales and GTM in various services and products for CIS segment.  Who You'll Work With  Head of Partnerships - Primary  Marketing team - Secondary  Product team - Primary  Functional Leads across departments in Singapore  What We Are Looking For  At least 1-2 years of Business development, account management, sales or similar roles  Have a track record of successful sales/account management in a fast moving environment  Excellent communication skills (in person, over the phone, over email and face to face presentations).  Passion about technology, start-up and disruptive business model.  Entrepreneurial mind-set to be able to work in a hyper-growth start-up environment  Benefits  One of Circles.Life's key missions is to build the best place to work and grow. In order to do that, we offer:  Exponential career growth & ownership - Completely own your own career and determine how fast and in which direction you grow. Being in a hyper-growth environment means having the opportunity for 10x the learning at 10x the speed; watch your role expand as the company expands.  Impact from Day 1 - Translate idea to action and help us to blaze the trial for innovative products and shake up the telco world, and beyond.  Talent Mobility - Circles.Lifers are given the opportunity to change roles internally, across functions and/or offices, through multiple structured programs (i.e. internal transfers, job shadowing or job rotation). We've witnessed many successful examples -e.g., from HR lead to Business Development Senior Manager.  Talent Development - We stand for a culture of continuous learning and growing. Besides structured career development paths and quarterly performance reviews, we offer monthly learning brown bag sessions, manager training and L&D budget to support development of professional interests and efforts.  Attractive Total Rewards (Salary + Equity) - We offer highly competitive salary and bonus inline with top tier technology companies, and equity for ALL employees (up to 6 months of annual salary worth for top performers). That means, unlimited upside based on company's performance.  Benefits - Mobile bill reimbursement for all Circles.Lifers and their dependents and medical insurance. Bonus: Well-stocked pantry and monthly fun activities.  Circles.Life is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, disability or age.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: APAC Market Development Lead – Payments and Fraud
description: SalesTribe is exclusively partnered with Riskified a revolutionary AI platform.  Using cutting-edge technology, machine-learning algorithms, Riskified is designed to help Merchants take away the worry of fraud-related chargebacks allowing them to boost sales and expand confidently into new markets.  Established 8 years ago in Tel Aviv, Riskified has passed $100M in revenue across large global enterprises such as Macy’s, booking.com, and Prada. Recently raising $229M in investment with a valuation of over $1 billion, Riskified is now ready to expand into the APAC region adding to an already 600+ team globally.  Now Riskified are looking to build out APAC and hire their first boots on the ground in Singapore. You’ll be joining a fintech with a huge runway ahead of them.  What will you do? Identify and nurture partnership opportunities for Riskified in Asia. Generate inbound interest through strategic prospecting, networking and brand awareness building. Establish Riskified presence and brand across APAC. Represent Riskified at industry events, both in Singapore and the wider APAC region. Build high quality pipeline of opportunities. Working closely with Account Executives and the wider Riskified team to close business. Work hand in hand with the Riskified central marketing team to create lead generation campaign.  What do you have? A strong background in tech sales, ideally fintech and payments. An ability to form, nurture and grow relationships. A can-do, high-energy attitude, driven to exceed goals An ability to communicate effectively and consistently with people at all levels in an organisation Self-motivation and desire to work within a start-up environment Experience in payments and/ or eCommerce is a great advantage  Riskified is a serious company solving complex problems. Listed as one of the most promising start-ups with Series E funding and nominated in Top25 Best workplaces by Fortune Magazine the future for Riskified is bright.

We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek -- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.  "What's it like to work at Agilent in Sales? Watch the video"  The Regional Sales Manager (CSD) will be responsible for developing and executing a regional sales plan for the assigned territory to achieve sales quota performance. Team sales performance meeting to Chemistries and Supplies Division objectives.  Developing tailored solutions for the customer will often require working across various groups within Agilent including the service delivery, instrument sales and consumables teams. Continue to develop a culture of innovation and excellence within the Agilent Chemistries and Supplies sales organization Develop and execute immediate and long term plans to achieve sales targets and strategies. Grow and Develop sales across all channels including direct and indirect sales teams. Advanced business degree with emphasis on marketing/market management, MBA a plus or equivalent combination of education and experience in analytical scientific, Lifesciences and/or FMCG market. 7+ years relevant sales & channel management experience with a proven track record in exceeding sales targets and goals Direct people management and/or channel sales management experience Experience in channel structure and design with direct management of channel resellers, and successes associated with the channel design Proven track record of process and workflow improvements across organizations and sales channels Domestic and international/cross-cultural exposure and experience, from a business and personal perspective. Experience in building and leading a multi-functional team. Excellent written, analytical, verbal communication and presentation skills are required. Demonstrated leadership in a cross-functional environment with the ability to lead, influence and shape opinion among a peer group of senior managers. Passion for talent development with the ability to select and grow high potential managers who will contribute to the growth of Agilent organizations in the region. Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws. jobTitle: Asia Pacific - Regional Marketing Manager, Shiseido
description: MAIN PURPOSE  The Regional Marketing Manager, SHISEIDO, is responsible for building long-term brand equity and delivering annual brand & business targets. She/he will play a key role in driving brand’s direction and supporting its growth strategy in Asia Pacific working closely with global brand holder, local country teams, and all key multi-functional stakeholders. Together with the Regional Brand Director, she/he will serve as the voice of the markets to ensure relevancy & sufficiency of marketing strategies & plans to support brand growth in the region.  Key Responsibilities  Marketing leadership & strategy role: Define strategy, develop and align 360 marketing plans partnering with local market teams & global brand holder to ensure successful marketing activations and launches Lead business performance, consumer, and campaign analysis for the brand across the region, identify business opportunities, key learnings, & insights, and define clear action plans Optimize ROI for marketing initiatives through insights from digital and social media analytics Develop Digital strategy & plans that support overall brand objectives and to improve brand/campaign performance throughout Customer Decision Journey Drive and oversee regional eCommerce marketing and promotion plans Develop CRM strategy & plans that support overall brand objectives and to improve brand/campaign performance throughout Customer Decision Journey Drive and oversee regional CRM plans and execution Lead price setting and alignment process across the region to ensure compliance with global pricing guidelines and define pricing opportunities where possible Develop VMD & assortment plans and coordinate with global and regional in-store design teams to ensure alignment and best-in-class executions Provide guidance to local market teams to set and achieve clear marketing goals & KPIs Inspire local brand teams by encouraging global & regional best practices sharing Marketing Operations And Execution Role Align, evaluate and validate the launch and marketing plans of all markets Track sales performance, A&P investment, and ROI Lead marketing initiatives and launches forecasting process by defining regional forecast, consolidating bottoms-up forecast from all markets, analyzing, and benchmarking to maximize launch revenue and to ensure forecast description: Company Description  Informa is a leading international events, intelligence and scholarly research group.  We’re the specialist’s specialist. Through hundreds of powerful brands, we work with businesses and professionals in specialist markets, providing the connections, intelligence and opportunities that help customers grow, do business, make breakthroughs and take better informed decisions.  Informa is listed on London Stock Exchange and a member of FTSE 100, with over 11,000 colleagues working in more than 30 countries.  Job Description  This role is accountable for meeting and exceeding the monthly, quarterly and annual orders and sales targets of the Maritime & Law such that it achieves sustainable, profitable growth. The Maritime & Law Vertical produces revenue from four strategic revenue streams. These are Subscriptions, Consulting, Marketing Services and One Time Sales.  The successful Corporate Account Manager will execute against sales goals with respect to forecasting and revenue attainment. This generally includes managing a renewable account base, seeking new business opportunities, learning customer decision/making process, creating and maintaining accurate forecasts, negotiating contracts, offering client presentations, closing business in a timely manner, and fully comprehending our Maritime Intelligence and Law unique value proposition.  Role And Responsibilities Accountability for driving revenue growth across the vertical to meet or exceed expectations, including identification of revenue drivers and metrics to focus on increasing account volume, profit and penetration Monitoring performance-to-plan throughout the financial year and adjusting direction, focus and sales initiatives as needed to deliver volume commitments Provide accurate forecasting to create visibility with all market owners on revenue trends and actions to drive revenues to plan Understanding the solution sales cycle and challenges, including the strategies of competitors, and leveraging this knowledge to hone sales strategies Working with Product Management and Marketing to use customer feedback and analytical insights in the formation of new products/solutions Maintain Account plans for all major accounts and report on progress as required Giving the highest priority to customer satisfaction by maintaining effective interpersonal relationships with and listening to customers Responding to Customer survey results to ensure customer satisfaction Contribute effectively to a highly driven, yet collaborative and cohesive team dynamic Qualifications A minimum of 5 years sales experience with demonstrable ability to extend and add to existing revenue streams within a defined account base within the Maritime sector Additional experience within either Financial Services, Trade Finance, Trade Compliance, Shipping or Governmental sectors would be ideal Must be flexible with the ability to work effectively and collaboratively with all colleagues Candidate will need to be self-starter, with the ability to develop a business plan Strong relationship building skills Highly self-motivated, competitive and results driven Passionate, positive and enthusiastic Advanced level of spoken and written English. Additional Information  We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't fit all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have most of the skills or experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need! We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Informa is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics under local law. This role may also be available on a flexible working or part time basis – please ask the Talent Acquisition team for more information.

description: Do you love to work on exciting marketing campaigns with brands like Disney, Unilever, and Grab?  Are you passionate about leading a team of young account managers and executives?  Is talking to clients and influencers second nature to you?  Then this might be the job for you! We are looking for a stellar Client Director APAC, who can strengthen our Influencer & Client Relations (ICR) department.  The ICR department is the link between content creators and clients and helps brands and agencies across APAC deliver spectacular influencer marketing campaigns all over the world!  In this position you will be tasked with leading the ICR department in APAC and run campaigns from start to end, thereby communicating with the brands and agencies.  You will support senior BD members who will take in briefs from clients and conceptualise influencer marketing campaigns by running feasibility checks and giving creative ideas where possible.  Your main responsibilities will be: Manage our largest client accounts in the region. Be the main point of contact for clients and operational teams to ensure smooth campaign execution. Create and standardise protocols for each client based on their internal procedures and business needs. Manage internal and external software to come up with the most efficient solutions for project management of campaigns. Full ownership and responsibility to ensure that campaign targets are met. Prepare creative and detailed onboarding documents for effective influencer marketing campaigns. Champion influencer marketing, digital, content marketing and benefits of social media and native content within these companies. Staying up-to-date with social media and digital technology trends and using these insights for sales strategy in order to secure revenue including but not limited to enterprise software development, and NFTs. Apply now if you: Have great people and relationship building skills Are a process-oriented and goal-driven individual Have a keen eye for detail and highly skilled in project management Have good market and industry knowledge and an interest in digital marketing, especially influencer marketing. Are a self-driven multitasker, who can perform under pressure Have excellent analytical skills Have the ability to balance multiple tasks Have excellent verbal and written communication skills Are great at using both analytical (e.g. Google Sheets, R, Tableau, etc.) and communication/project management tools (Google Slides, Jira, Atlassian Confluence, Asana, etc.) What we offer: A dynamic and friendly start up working environment, where your voice counts Growth opportunities, whereby you learn on the job A market competitive salary An international and multicultural environment with colleagues from all over the world About indaHash:  indaHash is the fastest growing technology platform that connects influencers from all over the world. Currently, indaHash operates in over 113 markets and has offices in Germany, USA, UK, United Arab Emirates, Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Japan, South Africa and Poland. We cooperate with over 1,000,000 influencers and work with the biggest Fortune 500 brands.  Since 2016 indaHash conducted more than 10,000 campaigns for the world’s largest brands (Coca-cola, McDonald`s, L’Oreal, Electrolux and many more). indaHash cooperates parallelly with media houses and advertising agencies across the major groups such as WPP, IPG, OMG, Havas, Hakuhodo, Dentsu, and many more from around the world in order to carry out effective global campaigns on Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Youtube, and many more. description: About Workato  Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.  Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.  We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.  Why join us?  Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.  But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.  If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!  Also, feel free to check out why: Business Insider named us an "enterprise startup to bet your career on" Forbes' Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America Quartz ranked us the #1 large company for remote workers  All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups Flexible and personalised medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalisation and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...) Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave  Responsibilities  We are looking for an exceptional Senior Manager/Manager, Sales Operations to join our growing team. In this role, you will be involved in supporting global sales teams, are sought out for advice from sales leaders, are a wizard when it comes to digging into data and making meaning of it, and are always looking for ways to make things better, faster, and more automated. This is a role for someone who loves building, loves solving problems, and is passionate about working closely with sales teams and GTM leaders. You will also be responsible to: Serve as a trusted business partner to our sales and GTM leaders - proactively bringing our leaders the highest impact insights, ideas, and solutions that improves our GTM productivity Evaluate, improve, and manage key sales ops processes including: weekly forecasting, capacity planning, pipeline modeling, account scoring, TAM modeling, and territory planning. Streamline and improve the internal sales process and AE experience to enter, update, progress, and book a deal in our systems, including the quoting and deal desk processes. Improve and enforce our sales rules of engagement for our teams to work effectively together Define, build, maintain, and improve our data, analytics, and reporting foundation and provide visibility and performance tracking to the business Assist with all executive analyses, strategies, and deliverables (e.g., board materials, QBRs) Set quotas and build comp plans that are compelling yet easy to understand and execute Research and invest in tools that help us scale and drives the highest quantity of the highest quality activities Learn how to use the Workato product to drive operational efficiency by automating and improving processes, tools, and analysis that scales  Requirements  Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills You have 3+ years prior experience in sales strategy and operations for a high growth company, or operational experience in investment banking, management consulting, private equity, venture capital, or business insights / analytics roles You demonstrate the ability to scale and equip the business in a strategic manner, communicate big picture opportunities and make data-driven decisions You have advanced spreadsheet and Salesforce skills and are quick to learn and adopt new sales technology  Soft Skills / Personal Characteristics You're someone who sales teams want to work with - positive, energetic, responsive, and helpful. But, at the same time, you're direct, concise, and pragmatic. You have great instincts when it comes to what will work for sellers - you strive to simplify and reduce non-selling tasks whenever possible You know how to prioritize - you know your list will never get done at the end of the day, so you're excellent at identifying and working on the few things that move the needle the most Your gif game is top notch. Can't emphasize this one enough. You have an enthusiastic "roll up your sleeves" mentality and do well under pressure

description: Our Singapore Sales team is searching for a Senior Account Director to join our high-achieving SEA sales team. Are you looking for the next step in your career? excited to work for a global leader in Market Research? A people and thought leader? This may be the perfect role for you!  Position Summary The Sr. Account Director is someone with team responsibilities and is also responsible for the development and implementation of sales strategies and practices for SEA market by delivering sales targets and meeting KPI’s through the management of a mixed portfolio of clients whilst implementing strategic account management and key account planning programs.  As an Account Director, you will have strong customer focus; interpreting customer inquiries or requests and take appropriate actions to produce high levels of customer satisfaction. You will be expected to manage a team of Account Managers who will assist on the client request handling while also owning a few key clients. This is a team quota bearing role.  The customer channel this role will focus on is Market Research Agencies.  To be successful in this role, you will have experience and be motivated to proactively drive revenue from previously unknown or under-leveraged sources and identify and develop opportunities through research and networking. Additionally, you will offer insightful and strategic solutions to business objectives while developing knowledge of client sectors, business, industry issues and products and solutions.  Responsibilities These include the following. Other duties may be assigned at the discretion of management in the context of the role:  Deliver sales targets and meet KPI's through the management of a mixed portfolio of new business and existing clients. Forecast pipeline and work towards converting opportunities and leads into revenue Proactively drive revenue from previously unknown or under leveraged sources. Actively source  leads & opportunities through multiple avenues including research and networking. Implement strategic account management and key account planning programs. Prepare a wide range of written proposals including full costing quotations.   Offer insightful and strategic solutions to business objectives. Support the implementation of marketing programs, new product rollouts and other initiatives. Develop knowledge of client sectors, business, industry issues and products and solutions.  Requirements  A successful track record in Sales including business development, ideally within a consultative environment Sales leader ideally with supervisory experience Strong academic background & 6+ years of professional work experience within Market Research Industry Understanding and experience in online market research and/or panels would be a plus Excellent communication skills Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage your time effectively prioritising tasks to meet a range of tight deadlines. Excellent attention to detail The ability to communicate effectively to both internal and external stakeholders Be a proactive and motivated 'go getter' who thrives in a sales environment  Our Company Values Focus on Solutions, not problems Work hard, play hard Be the best Let integrity be your guide Stay one step ahead  What we can offer:  Exposure and training to policies and procedures for 8 countries within APAC Flexible working arrangements to suit your lifestyle Supportive and collaborative team  Fast-paced environment with opportunities to grow with the business Hybrid working model  At Dynata, we are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of ethnicity, gender, identity, disability and age. We actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds to join our innovate and high-performing team where individual differences are respected and celebrated.

description: Job Description  An exciting opportunity for a Commercial Manager has arisen in the General Counsel (Civil Aerospace) team in the areas of Account Management, Sales & Contracting and Services. Our mission is simple, to drive Civil Aerospace to commercial success whilst protecting our company’s reputation.  We are looking to recruit experienced commercial/contracting talent as well as develop new talent from outside of our business.  Are you interested in working in a fast paced, international team? Do you have excellent interpersonal skills? Would you like the opportunity to be able to influence decisions at all levels in the company and deliver business solutions to complex business issues? Would you love to build strong relationships with customers/partners/suppliers, understand their key business objectives and how these fit with Rolls-Royce’s business?  Within the Customer team, there is opportunity to develop your skills and business acumen working in different geographical regions with our airline customers (think British Airways, Lufthansa, Cathay Pacific, Emirates etc.) whether on complex and high-profile account issues or as part of an integrated campaign team, supporting new sales opportunities and taking the lead on contract negotiations.  Within the Services team, there is opportunity to provide leadership and support to the Derby based commercial team, particularly in the areas of Strategy, Repair and Availability Services. This will involve developing and implementing improvements (ensuring that the wider team can work with greater autonomy), supporting negotiations and creating new business solutions.  At Rolls-Royce, we pioneer the power that matters to our customers, to society and to the planet.  We deliver the best jet engines in the world. Through intelligent innovation and active collaboration, we’re putting our customers at the forefront of the aviation industry – and we keep them there. Our product portfolio powers more than 35 types of commercial aircraft, and with over 13,000 engines in-service around the world; we’re keeping the world flying.  Key Accountabilities Contract Negotiation/Sales Activity – Work as part of an Integrated campaign team (ICT) to provide commercial input to the development of the sales strategy, identifying value though commercial structures, service levels and guarantees. (Sales & Contracting team specific) Contract Management – Responsible for negotiating, drafting, administering, interpreting, and amending a range of contracts as well as generic and bespoke offer letters and settlement agreements. Claim Management – Lead the commercial resolution of customer issues, claims, and disputes by drafting and negotiating relevant commercial settlements and/or contractual amendments. Risk Management - Identify and assess potential risks and liabilities and propose and negotiate amendments to manage, minimise or mitigate such risks in discussion with other stakeholders Account Management & Administration – Accountable for the timely delivery of contracted commercial commitments, including the issuance of invoices and credit notes and the completion of escalation, reconciliation, and forecasting processes. Financial Management - Manage profit, cash and debt relating to our business by supporting the meeting of financial targets, the realisation of cash opportunities, and mitigation of financial threats. Counsel & Compliance - Interface with a wide variety of specialist teams, both within and external to the company, to obtain advice and guidance. To evaluate such advice and develop pragmatic risk-based solutions to complex, multi-dimensional issues to meet customer/supplier and business requirements. Continuous Improvement - Deliver and lead continuous improvement initiatives, both as part of the General Counsel function and as part of our business teams. Leadership – Support, coach, develop and provide technical supervision to junior embers of the team, as required. Qualifications Degree or equivalent qualification. Well-developed interpersonal, diplomacy, communication, influencing and negotiations skills. Ability to solve complex problems while maintaining customer focus. Highly motivated and capable of working under own initiative or in a team environment. Sound business acumen. Ability to prioritise workloads to meet demanding deadlines. Experience of influencing at all levels across an organisation. We offer excellent opportunities to develop, along with a competitive salary and exceptional benefits. These include bonus, employee support assistance and employee discounts.  Pioneer the performance of the future. Join us and you’ll develop your skills and expertise to the very highest levels, working in an international environment for a company known the world over for brilliance and innovation.  Beyond tomorrow  We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realize their full potential.  You can learn more about our global Diversity and Inclusion strategy here .  So that you can be your best at work and home, we’ll consider flexible working arrangements for everyone, in any role.  Rolls-Royce follows a merit-based employee recruitment process and does not charge/accept any payment/security deposit from candidates during the recruitment process. Candidates seeking employment with Rolls-Royce should be cautious of potentially fraudulent communications and offers from individuals and agencies purporting to be from, or acting on behalf of, Rolls-Royce.  Please refer to the Career section on the Rolls-Royce website to verify employment offers or vacancies. Rolls-Royce shall not be liable for any loss, damage or consequences that may arise from any communication or offer of employment not directly made by Rolls-Royce.  Rolls-Royce reserves the right to take legal action against any individuals or agencies acting on behalf of Rolls-Royce without authorisation.  Job CategoryCommercialPosting Date07 Oct 2021; 00:10

description: Rakuten is a global Internet and e-commerce company, with over 1.3 billion registered users worldwide. Our e-commerce platform is the largest of its kind in Japan and among the world's largest by sales. Rakuten has many subsidiaries, including Rakuten VIKI, Rakuten TV, Rakuten Kobo and Rakuten Viber.  As a Business Manager of Marketing AI at Rakuten's AI Business, you will be responsible for directing a comprehensive product strategy from product conception and definition through its end of life. You are to function as a central resource for design, manufacturing, quality, testing, marketing and distribution as the product(s) move through their lifecycles. You will also be responsible for directing those involved in the design, modification and evaluation of all phases of a specific product or group of products.  In addition to the abovementioned scope, you will take charge of formulating and executing long-term plans for cost/profit control, and promote new technologies and industry-leading trends for the company.  Responsibilities:  Define and expand overall product and go-to market strategy for Rakuten Marketing AI solutions, including customer targeting and optimization, marketing automation, geolocation solutions. This includes setting and executing overall direction, strategic planning, market and competitive research, and customer insights understanding. Manage marketing AI-related products/ services management roadmap Establish and report progress on OKRs, strategy, and KPIs for executive reporting Be responsible for the product’s budgetary and financial control Analyze activities, costs and operations to determine progress toward established goals Review operations and plans for meeting revenue goals, ascertaining requirements for developing new products and markets Partner effectively across the company to execute the product plan and deliver the most significant impact Work closely with backend engineering, UX designers, application engineers, and more to successfully scale the growth of the products Selecting, recruiting, hiring, develop of members  Qualifications:  More than 7-year experience in strategic planning or product marketing or entrepreneurial success in Adtech or Marketing Tech AI domain Ability to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, including senior executives Proficient in both English and Japanese as you will be required to work closely with stakeholders from overseas Hands-on experience in strategy development, customer and market research, and financial modelling/ planning Strong passion for Data Science/AI adoption and being customer and data-driven High-level understanding of big data systems and data analytics  Rakuten is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age.
