description: Sophos Overview – Cybersecurity Evolved Sophos is a worldwide leader in next-generation cybersecurity, protecting more than 500,000 organizations and millions of consumers in more than 150 countries from today’s most advanced cyberthreats. Powered by threat intelligence, AI and machine learning from SophosLabs and SophosAI, Sophos delivers a broad portfolio of advanced products and services to secure users, networks and endpoints against ransomware, malware, exploits, phishing and the wide range of other cyberattacks. Sophos provides a single integrated cloud-based management console, Sophos Central – the centerpiece of an adaptive cybersecurity ecosystem that features a centralized data lake that leverages a rich set of open APIs available to customers, partners, developers, and other cybersecurity vendors. Sophos sells its products and services through reseller partners and managed service providers (MSPs) worldwide. Sophos is headquartered in Oxford, U.K. More information is available at www.sophos.com.  Job Purpose  A heavily proactive role working within a Channel team that needs to grow its business by recruiting, qualifying, and onboarding new partners to drive net-new and cross-sell revenue. This incumbent will be reporting to the Senior Manager, Enterprise Sales.  Main Duties  Develop and maintain detailed knowledge of Sophos products, services, and also that of Sophos competitors to a high standard. Maintain and develop executive relationships with named partners via email, phone, and face to face, where appropriate Keep business plans and conduct regular Partner business reviews with named partners Accelerate customer retention, growth of cross-selling, and new customer acquisition through partner activity Provide information, arrange training, and coach Partners to ensure that they are trained to use Sophos systems and tools (Partner Portal, etc) and can articulate the Sophos GTM Adherence to CRM (Salesforce, Clari, etc.), business systems, and activity management standards, ensuring all activity is logged and accurately updated. Eg. Partner/Customer contacts, opportunity forecasting Facilitate technical enablement, certification of named partners to ensure alignment to local sales and product strategy Spend 30% of the time developing and executing prospecting activities through named partners. For example, account mapping, MDF activity, call blitz, offers/promotions Achieve customer territory target Conduct a min of 10 customer meetings per week to ensure customer retention and migration to the latest NextGen Sophos products or services Facilitate technical security assessments and product demo’s to ensure customer awareness and satisfaction  Skills & Experience  Essential: Working towards a sales target Building mutually beneficial business relationships Working with a high volume of customers or partners Proactive outbound calling in previous roles Strong communication and presentation skills – verbal and written Influencing and problem-solving Handling multiple priorities effectively Teamwork Conflict handling and negotiation Travel to the partner site and customers required Restricted holiday in March and month-end  Equal Opportunities Sophos is committed to equality opportunity in all areas of its work. All qualified applicants will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. If you choose to explore this opportunity, and subsequently share your CV or other personal details with Sophos, these details will be held by Sophos for 12 months in accordance with our Privacy Policy and used by our recruitment team to contact you regarding this or other relevant opportunities at Sophos. If you would like Sophos to delete or update your details at any time, please follow the steps set out in the Privacy Policy describing your individual rights. If you have any questions about Sophos’ data protection practices, please contact dataprotection@sophos.com.

The objectives are accomplished by meeting target accounts directly and working with Channel Partners, ensuring that they have the focus and commitment necessary to succeed. Each sales entity (channel partners in this case) develops a business plan containing capacity, marketing activities, and investments to develop and grow key accounts. This role is also responsible for informing ANSYS management of region-specific requirements and any issues / obstacles that may affect short / long term performance.  Key Duties And Responsibilities Responsible for selling ANSYS products in specified territory - Vietnam through channel partners while exhibiting ANSYS Sales Channel principles. Will own full responsibility over sales targets, sales attainment and forecast for the territory - Vietnam. Establish productive relationships with key partner personnel and ensure ANSYS and Channel Partner priorities are aligned Lead annual joint business planning and implementation, as well as quarterly business reviews for performance tracking and determining corrective actions Drive awareness and adoption of channel programs, tools and resources – deal registration, certification, demand generation, incentives, 8Q New Business Rule, 4Q Inactive Accounts Rule Provide / coordinate the support, training and coaching required to increase partner skills, competency and commitment in sales, technical, marketing and order management sub functions Assist / support partners with pipeline development effort essential to driving sustainable and profitable growth Assist channel partners reps in closing larger or more complex deals (over $50K), including on-site engagement. Provide hands-on leadership and support for larger opportunities, and for other significant regional opportunities. Gain access and manage relationships with senior level customer executives Provide accurate and timely forecast, including forward 3 quarter pipelines for all channel partners. Review forecast and pipeline with channel partners on a regular basis Take ownership and ensure proper and timely resolution to partner issues and requests - customer pricing, discounting & special offers, channel conflicts, sales splits, customer concerns such as software performance issues, and assist in development of tactical solution strategies. Interface directly with customers to ensure satisfaction with ANSYS solutions Develop relationships with new and existing ANSYS Solution Partners for co-marketing for generating demand: hardware (HPE, nVidia, etc), software (Microsoft, etc), services, and academic partners. Develop positive ANSYS image at all levels and serve as the ANSYS face to all parties Assist ANSYS management in analyzing regional business trends, industries, competitors and market data to set market coverage strategy. If needed, also aid with Go-To-Market model definition, number and types of partnered needed to cover the market, channel recruitment, onboarding and development Ensure partners’ compliance with channel programs and agreements And other job-related duties may be assigned by management from time to time Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or business discipline required A minimum of 10 years successful sales, key accounts, and indirect channel account management experience in software industry Experience in negotiating sales contracts with key accounts Must be able to quickly identify issues, communicate to management, and recommend solutions Proven track record in managing indirect sales channels Strong analytical, planning, coaching and communication skills Travel 50%+ required Preferred Qualifications And Skills Work experience and knowledge of Vietnam territory is must MBA preferred Strong sales and business acumen Demonstrated awareness and understanding of engineering design processes, and of how PLM / simulation tools are deployed in manufacturing and process industries CULTURE AND VALUES  Our Values Are Crucial For Fostering a Culture Of Winning For Our Company  Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Customer focus Results and Accountability Innovation Transparency and Integrity Mastery Inclusiveness Sense of urgency Collaboration and Teamwork WORKING AT ANSYS  At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it’s about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished”. It’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.  At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.  Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.  Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.  For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com  Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.  Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

description: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  Our clients are faced with external pressures on an unprecedented scale. The ability to translate strategy into reality is key to their enhanced business performance. As a consulting professional, you will be focused on helping them achieve this goal.  You’ll work in high performing teams that deliver exceptional client service, enabling organizations to grow, innovate, protect and optimize their business performance – playing your part in building a better working world.  We believe that you should own and shape your career. But we’ll provide the support and opportunities to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to succeed. The strength of our global network, combined with a local empowerment and a relentless focus on winning in specific markets, means you’ll interact and team with individuals from various geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.  About The Opportunity Manage the pursuit process (EY Asean Consulting Deal Governance process) for opportunities, working closely with key partners. Provide pursuit management support for key accounts, focusing on opportunities with high-revenue potential. Embed pursuit excellence in the business by sharing best practices in pursuit management and intellectual assets. Manage the CRM process which includes working with accounts teams on strategic opportunities through the sales cycle. Manage the CRM process to push the team to move opportunities through the pipeline, driving action, accountability and accuracy around pipeline. Execute win/loss debriefs. Review, analyse and provide periodic reporting to monitor Asean Consulting Accounts Revenue (GTER), Sales and Pipeline, in particular highlight gaps to support Consulting Markets Leaders develop and implement actions required to achieve targets. Liaise and work with Consulting Account Leaders and account teams on periodic account reviews and pipeline discussions. Be the knowledge steward of the Asean markets’ Consulting Key Accounts and provide all relevant performance reporting to the region on a regular basis. Support the annual revenue planning process with the Market segment leadership team and relevant Client Services Partners (CSPs). Support the Consulting Markets Leader and BDs with the development and implementation of an account-centric, action-oriented account plans.  Skills And Attributes For Success Financial literacy and the ability to interpret results and provide advice on performance. In addition, ability to forecast and project areas that the leaders need to focus on. Relationship building skills and the ability to work with multiple stakeholders at all levels across Asean Consulting. Understanding of firm wide systems and processes.  To qualify for the role, you must have: A Bachelor’s Degree 5 years of relevant experience in business operations, and/or sales process  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

description: Job Description  So you’re looking for a team lead role? It is right here with F5!  F5 technologies are at the heart of modern applications that are enabling digital transformation across the globe. We give the world’s largest businesses, service providers, governments, and consumer brands the ability to securely deliver every app, anywhere-with confidence. We do this by working collaboratively in an innovative environment, helping each other thrive and succeed. We take pride in being trusted advisers to our customers, offering the best solutions for their interests.  This role will lead the Theatre Sales Operations Specialist team. The Sales Operations Specialist (SOS) team is involved in all stages of the sales process ensuring that sales activities are best supported and conducted in accordance with F5’s policies. This role provides a high-level support to both internal and external sales teams to facilitate positive relationships and generate revenue for F5. This is a fast-paced team, ideal for someone who is highly organized, loves details and wants to go above and beyond. Sales Operations Specialist Supervisor’s responsibilities will include team leadership and management, project management, order processing, troubleshooting and problem solving, tracking and reporting, sales support, training, and other assigned activities.  Primary Responsibilities Conduct regular team meetings - encouraging team contribution and teamwork towards the development and improvement of Sales Support processes and procedures. Developing a summary of open projects, tasks, events for the regional team. Team building and recognition - Conduct team building events and build team rapport through execution and recognition. Management and Performance Review - Responsible for conducting annual performance reviews, PTO requests, etc. Metrics - The SOS Supervisor will work with their regional team develop a dashboard and collect/report on meaningful metrics. Local Point of Contact for critical issues within the team and from Sales and F5 Management. Attend monthly team lead/supervisor calls with other team leads to discuss ways to improve processes and facilitate standardization across theaters. Support other theater team leads in projects related to the goal of WW standardization. Order processing of Purchase Orders. Act as liaison between Field Sales, Inside Sales, Channel Sales, Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, Finance and Accounting. Supervise and maintain assigned program(s). Provide communication and education on current processes and best practices. Answer pre and post sales questions from partners and F5 sales teams. Research inquiries and assist internal and external customers. Coordinating expedite requests. Ensure the integrity of SalesForce data. Responsible for upholding F5’s Business Code of Ethics and for promptly reporting violations of the Code or other company policies. The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.  Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Must be detailed oriented with a tried ability to multi-task. Sophisticated communication skills, both in written and verbal form, to interact with cross functional teams and departments. Self-motivated and able to work with little direct supervision. Strong ability to work under time constraints and meet tight deadlines. Passion for customer experience and exceeding expectations. Sophisticated understanding or knowledge of sales processes, order administration processes, etc. Expert Project Management. Strong interest in identifying process improvement opportunities that support the key business operations. Expert ability to draw concise, well supported recommendations based on issues presented. Strong experience with SFDC and Oracle. Independent and works well in a dynamic environment. Preferably previously working experience in a high-tech environment. Good experience in Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel. Qualifications Bachelors degree 5 years or more of sales support experience If this sounds like you, we want to meet you!  The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing Alert  Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).  Equal Employment Opportunity  It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

description: Who we are looking for? GCA is on a growth footing and looking to hire a good channel developer who can onboard and nurture channel partners. Channels are a key growth strategy that GCA is looking to develop. As such, we are looking for a unique individual who possesses the following qualities: Is entrepreneurial and is driven to create or provide value for customers Has good knowledge in marketing, with direct experience in managing channels in a B2B business setting Has demonstrated success in applying channel development strategies Is personable with a keen mind to learn and grow Has an independent and performance-driven mindset; always looking to do better Owns his / her performance targets and drives to achieve and exceed them Possesses a creative mind in developing solutions for partners and clients Has a keen interest and experience in social media marketing to join us as Senior Channel Partner Developer  Job ScopeThere is a primary focus on channel development, and a secondary focus on business development to give the role more room for diversity. Channel Development Identification and selection of appropriate channel partners Design / Create marketing material to support channel partners Specifying the guidelines for partners and detail the role of each party Organise and conduct onboarding training for channel partners (online / offline) Design and implement outreach strategies for new channel partners Plan and seek approval for market expansion via channels Create / Implement surveys for partners to voice their issues and provide solutions Participate in product development with Management to build deeper and wider channels Managing and improving after-sales support, post-sale upgrades and other long-term profit generation methods Ensure proper customer communication and support to partners, clients and all stakeholders Business Development Identifying, qualifying, and securing business opportunities; coordinating business generation activities; developing customized targeted sales strategies Building business relationships with current and potential clients Creating informative presentations; presenting and delivering information to potential clients at client meetings, industry exhibits, trade shows, and conferences Creating and maintaining a list/database of prospect clients; maintaining a database (CRM, Excel, etc.) of prospective client information Warm calling; making PDPA-aligned calls to potential clients; closing sales and working with the client through the closing process Collaborating with management on business goals, planning, and forecasting; maintaining short- and long-term business development plans Make appropriate business decisions to meet service expectations and agreements

description: Career Growth, Flexibility and Collaboration! Entrust is dedicated to securing a world in motion by enabling trusted identities, payments, and data protection around the globe. Headquartered in Minnesota, we offer our colleagues the ability to work globally, in a flexible and collaborative environment. Our team makes an impact!!  The Company: Entrust relies on curious, dedicated and innovative individuals whom anticipate the future and provide solutions for a more connected, mobile and secure world. Entrust’s technologies and expertise help government agencies, enterprises and financial institutions in more than 150 countries serve and safeguard citizens, employees and consumers.  We Believe: Securing identities is most effective when we value all identities. We are committed to ensuring that, through diversity and inclusion, the many voices that make up our communities are heard. From unconscious bias training for managers to global affinity groups that create connections both within and across our enterprise, Entrust expects and encourages all individuals to accept and respect one another. And, of course, to be themselves.  Position Purpose: The Technical Sales Consultant (TSC) support sales to develop and grow the business for solutions and services with both the distributors and the customers. As a subject matter expert, he needs to proactively visits and communicates with partners, customers and prospects to understand their changing business requirements and to promote Entrust solutions and assist the partners in utilizing the services and solutions within the Entrust portfolio.  We offer flexibility We offer a diverse work environment Futureproof your career with a job in information security  How You Will Make An Impact Position Entrust solutions unique selling points, and value propositions to partners and end customers. Be the trusted advisor and have the ability to holistically approach critical, analytical, technical and operational issues across multiple teams and drive customer adoptions. Provide solutions presentations, demonstrations, technical proposals, Proof of Concepts and etc, to our customers and end customers. Participate in the delivery of proposal/bids by ensuring that solution proposed to client is technically feasible and can be successfully delivered. Provide thorough competitive and landscape knowledge including compliance requirements, solutions, technology and product offerings. Voice of the region to provide technical and solution feedbacks to products, services teams in the region and in HQ. Assist RSM in the creation of case studies, references and competitive wins in conjunction. Perform other duties and/or projects as assigned. Frequent international traveling is required (50%).  Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business administration, engineering or computer science. Minimum of 5-7 years’ experience in information technology or software engineering related functions, with particular interest in banking and financial services. Presentation and public speaking skills would be a necessary skill. Pro-active, creative and energetic, taking lead and initiative to make things happen, able to work under pressure and with minimal supervision. Possess good work attitude, communications skills, and people skills, be willing to self-learn and self-improve continuously. Experience working as a technical lead in a pre-sales software environment  Preferred Qualifications Knowledge in the smart card industry, mailing industry, packaging industry, and/or printing industry would be a plus.  Why Should You Apply? Leader in the security industry Friendly, supportive & knowledgeable teams Opportunities for on-the-job training You’ll help secure identities!  For more information, visit www.entrust.com . Follow us on LinkedIn , Facebook , Instagram , and YouTube .  Recruiter Jean MichlewiczJean.Michlewicz@entrust.com

description: The Business Development Manager is responsible for generating new business and maintaining existing relationships in the corporate market. The BDM will focus on small and mid-size opportunities that are less complex in their workspace needs. The BDM will build market position by locating, developing, defining, negotiating, and closing business relationships. The BDM will establish and maintain a portfolio of prospects to build a pipeline of potential clients and drive sustainable growth. This successful individual will ensure all sales goals and objectives are achieved and within prescribed time frame.  This role is based in Singapore. Successful candidate will focus on sales efforts under the Crown Workspace brand which primarily focuses on assisting clients with workplace requirements inclusive of commercial relocations.  Key Focus Areas • Business/Pipeline Development • Strategic Thinking • Communication and Presentation • Business/Commercial Acumen  Key Tasks and Responsibilities Business Development • Work closely with Department Head to develop strategies and sales objectives to market Workspace Services to multinational or national organizations in his/her territory • New Leads Development – generate new leads through cold calling and networking techniques identifying key decision makers in potential client businesses • Develop proficiency in Crown Workspace services and Crown brands to facilitate multi-service, cross brand opportunities • Partner with management to develop consultative strategy to create client focused solutions. • Maintain absolute focus on Crown’s organizational objectives to establish growth through cross selling of services • Achieve annual individual sales goals and objectives within the prescribed time frame, collaborate with Department Head to prepare and deliver exceptional proposals, presentations, RFPs and other client facing presentations. • Meet and or exceed established goals, call targets, revenue targets, and new business acquisition initiatives, jointly with sales and management teams. • Utilize and maintain accurate records in CRM database • Utilize CRM to maintain a regular call cycle/follow up contact with potential and target corporate customers, as detailed within the Strategy Plan • Understand Market drivers and anticipate trends • Attend annual sales conferences / training seminars and networking functions. • Effectively partner with and support network members in developing corporate leads and sales activity. • Create plans in conjunction with management to ensure monthly and quarterly account development • Drive and manage local marketing programs in conjunction with marketing department • Establish a professional, working and consultative relationship with the client, by developing a core under-standing of the unique business needs of the client within their industry • Participate in sales projects or company initiatives to drive corporate vision and strategy • Demonstrate and promote the company vision, strategy and values  Aptitude, Knowledge and Qualifications  Aptitude • Excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills • Ability to respond resourcefully and constructively to new demands, priorities, and challenges • Ability to plan, implement and deliver business goals • Ability to set priorities, manage your time and workload and dependably meet strict deadlines. • Work efficiently in a high-pressured environment • Solution oriented approach to problem solving and decision-making  Professional Knowledge and Skills • Demonstrated Sales and Leadership skills • Excellent communication, influencing , negotiation and closing skills • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret prospective client relocation policies and contract documents • Effective presentation skills for C-Level, senior management, prospects, and/or public groups • Highly customer service oriented/driven interpersonal skills • Ability to multi-task and organize work streams to meet client deadlines and • Knowledgeable on Commercial Real Estate Trends • Ability to read, speak and write English • Fluency in local language {for international positions} • Demonstrated business acumen and strong judgement  Job Specific • Account Management • Communication • Sales Goals • Sales Skills • Territory Management  Education and/or Experience • College degree or equivalent work experience required. • Prefer to have a minimum of three to five (3-5) years of experience in a business-to-business sales environment within the commercial real estate / construction industry. • Proven track record of developing prospects and securing new clients. • Prior familiarity with assigned territory. • Experienced in the preparation of tenders/bids/proposals

jobTitle: APJ Specialized Sales GTM Strategy Lead - Public Sector
description: Description  For more than 15 years, Amazon Web Services (“AWS”) has been the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS offers over 200 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world—including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—to power their infrastructure.  As the Worldwide Specialized Organization (WWSO) Go-To-Market (GTM) Strategy Lead for Public Sector in APJ, this person will be a critical member responsible for one of the top WWSO priorities to drive Specialist GTM plans and an improved Field interlock experience. Working with the WWSO Specialized Service Leadership, Strategy & Operations Leadership team and the Public Sector sales and operations organizations, he/She will drive strategic programs, initiatives and processes that accelerate revenue growth and drive sales productivity. He/She will be engaging with senior stakeholders to meet or exceed joint business goals, and simplify and optimize the engagement between WWSO and the Field to ensure an excellent Field and customer experience.  The ideal candidate will have experience in leading business strategy, innovation and transformation at scale in complex environments. They will have high business acumen and strong analytical skills coupled with strong collaboration and influencing skills. This is a hands-on position - the candidate must be willing to “roll up the sleeves”, be a self-starter with a bias towards independent problem solving, and have a passion for identifying and eliminating bottlenecks, anticipate business needs, make tradeoffs, and balance business dynamics despite constraints. The lead will thrive in a fast-paced environment, will be able to manage through ambiguity and complexity, and constantly seek ways to invent and simplify across the business.  Key Responsibilities Work with Specialist Service, Segment and Vertical Leads to build and drive the short and long-term GTM strategy. Participate in Field and WWSO specialized sales strategy and planning discussions. Define key sales support mechanisms, processes, and programs to meet the rapid growth of the business and achieve revenue attainment and market development objectives. Constantly innovate and improve programs and program management mechanisms, suggesting new ideas, sharing best practices, and improving the business and customer engagement model. Proactively lead joint interlock mechanisms that identify mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones. Evaluate effectiveness of GTM programs from WWSO and provide feedback on how to improve and enhance, including sharing best practices across Specialized Services and Geo/Field organizations. Ensure alignment between WWSO and Field organization. Remove sales blockers and accelerate escalations to resolution  Basic Qualifications 15+ years of experience in sales, sales strategy, business development, and operations in SaaS business model. 5+ years in sales or business development specific roles. Bachelor's Degree Preferred Qualifications Ability to work with matrixed teams through influence across a broad set of functions and geographies, developing new ideas and creative solutions for difficult, ambiguous and complex issues. MBA or other relevant advanced degree. Persuasive verbal & written communication skills with senior leaders. Excellent collaboration and negotiations skills with internal and external stakeholders. Program management knowledge spanning planning, execution and project delivery. Ability to navigate a fast-paced environment with limited direction, balance competing priorities and multiple time-sensitive projects at once and make decisions and recommendations with quick turnarounds. Ability to provide meaningful insights of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, messages, and presentations. Demonstrated ability to define, refine and implement sales processes, procedures and policies. Highly organized, detail oriented, and efficient in ambiguous situations. Experience or familiarity with the AWS platform, products, solutions or capabilities. Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role Navigate ambiguous situations and drive to solutions independently Establish new or improve existing processes to drive scale across the organization What if I’m not an expert in all the above? That’s okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.  If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world’s leading cloud provider, apply now. We can’t wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.  CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY  At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that’s inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We’re committed to putting in the work for more equal representation  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.  Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. description: READY TO BRING PASSION INTO YOUR CAREER? Clarins Group is not only a fast-growing, leading Beauty Company, we’re also a committed, family-owned enterprise with a fiercely independent and pioneering spirit. As one of the top skin care companies worldwide, with a strong position in Europe and the Americas and growth accelerating in Asia, we’re looking for a CRM Manager, Asia Pacific based in Singapore.  THE ROLE:  In the APAC Digital, CRM, E-commerce team, the APAC CRM Manager is responsible is for leading CRM strategy in the region to master 360° customer knowledge, acquisition & loyalty, customer journey and lifecycle planning as well as some project management ensuring a successful roll-out of the CRM projects/tools for the region.  The key responsibility is to define CRM strategy for APAC and provide plans & support to RECRUIT & RETAIN customers in the various markets. Be responsible for supporting the APAC markets in driving the best-in-class customer engagement and loyalty strategy across key touchpoints. He/she will also manage with the team the lifecycle planning to deliver meaningful segmentations & recommendations on the different communication channels.  He/she will also CONDUCT key CRM analysis, with this, he/she will be a key business partner for markets to help them understand their customer & product analysis better to plan relevant marketing & sales actions accordingly to meet their CRM kpis.  He/she will finally IMPLEMENT some Data & CRM projects with Global, IT and countries teams to ensure APAC specificities are well taken into consideration into the specifications & developments. He/she will be a key partner for the successful installation / roll-out of the new & best in class relational marketing tools in the countries.  WHAT YOU'LL DO:  Lead APAC strategy to drive recruitment & retention Co-build with the market a strong CRM omnichannel strategy to drive repurchase and loyalty, and develop a year round CRM action plan aligning with our APAC priorities Work with markets to animate campaigns and support CRM activities and/or mechanics to target specific groups customers (Club Clarins, prospects, Make up vs Skincare…) Oversee and Manage the Loyalty strategy (Club Clarins Program) together with Global and countries, support countries in the evolution and animation of their Club Clarins Program (Tiers, brand identity, Member’s day) & tool Drive campaign guidelines for key product launches as well as regional CRM projects Drive cross-product segments/categories link-selling and penetration through best practice sharing focusing on key product campaigns and customer segments Propose operations & mechanisms to increase contactability (mobile and email opt-in in markets) and improve main KPIs : decrease churn rate & Increase N2P rate Monitor and collect local implementation, execution and feedback of CRM campaigns Oversee the setup and implementation of triggers campaigns, including recommending the target audiences for campaigns based on briefs submitted by markets Exploit Adobe Campaign’s full capabilities, thus creating competitive advantage to meet short and long-term goals and recommend various test frameworks to the markets  Lead CRM data analysis for APAC markets Consolidate and analyse customer data (both quantitative and qualitative) to derive customer insights, business indication and provide related action plan to deliver CRM objectives and goals Partner with marketing functions to develop integrated CRM plans and provide insights to understand customers’ behaviour and set up consistent action plans to improve our ability to engage the customer per franchise Analyze the purchasing patterns, migration of customers, and recruitment of new customers per channel and retention of existing customers to support APAC main CRM kpis Generate insightful reports, post-campaign analysis to optimize the strategy and its implementation Ensure high level of CRM operationality via monitoring process management and reporting  Lead the implementation of APAC CRM tools & projects Evangelize the CRM product roadmap vertically (GM) and horizontally (stakeholders including CRM leads) to bring the vision to fruition Collaborate with Local teams to translate their campaign/customer journeys into scalable levers for Global platforms Create a compelling CRM vision and roadmap that best facilitates the CRM engagement strategies with best-in-class solutions (database, loyalty, Clientelling tool…). This requires a deep understanding of the CRM strategy and business needs To be able to drive the change management hand in hand with the local teams & global teams allowing a smooth go live of the projects To liaise with the different parties involved (whether internal or external) to track and manage the project efficiently and report the status of the project to top management  Other responsibilities may be added to the above, which are consistent with the title CRM Manager, Asia Pacific.  YOU HAVE:  Business Degree, focus on CRM/Customer Experience/Business management/Marketing 10 years in CRM, data & Project management, both on and offline Previous relevant experience(s) in B-to-C CRM, preferably in an international retail environment Strong presentation skills with excellent written and verbal communication skills Customer-focused, results-oriented and passionate about customer engagement Strong interest in understanding consumer insights and behaviour, with an eye for detail and a broad sense of perspective Strong project management methodology, must have extensive CRM/ERP project management experience, which should include overseeing the CRM/ERP implementation life cycle from the early planning stage to post-implementation. Advanced understanding of data journeys (data modelling, data flows, data quality, deduplication…) Experience of CRM/lifecycle planning, including segment identification, trigger definition, journey planning and testing Experience in SQL, familiar with concepts like HTML and JavaScript is a plus Experience with Marketing Automation a must, Adobe Campaign Preferred Knowledge of data visualisation tools like Qlik Sense or Tableau Good with numbers, have strong analytical skills and problem-solving capabilities Digitally-minded with an awareness of online trends and innovations Strong collaborator with influencing skills to bring people together in solving problems, and resourceful in finding ways to get things done Open-minded, adaptive to change and flexible in an evolving fast-paced environment genuinely looking forward to new challenges, High sense of ownership  WE HAVE:  Standout brands: Clarins and My Blend Distinctive, high-quality products and services A longstanding commitment to social, economic and ecological initiatives   Growth opportunities Learning & Development An attractive compensation and benefits package  If you have a curious mind and are always questioning how things can be done better, the ability to take risks and accept new challenges, join us!

description: FoodXervices Inc is one of the top foodservice distributors in Singapore, servicing over 4,800 clients ranging from top hotels and restaurants, airlines, and cafes, fast food chains, and culinary institutions.   We are looking for a Channel Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate should possess leadership qualities and demonstrate good business acumen. You will report to the Sales and Business Development Director.   Duties and responsibilities include:  Tracking and monitoring sales channel performance and collaboratively working with channel heads to ensure the organization goals and objectives are achieved. (Sales KPI) Proactively developing new promotion plans and retail strategies to achieve management objectives. To forecast the monthly sales trend and to proactively identify opportunities that can help to grow & achieve the business targets. Managing channel receivables and ensuring timely payments from Business Partners and direct accounts. Responding to technical questions from prospective customers.  Presenting, promoting, and selling products and services to existing and prospective customers.  Performing cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers.  Establishing and maintaining relationships with customers.  Expediting the resolution of customer problems and complaints.  Analyzing market potential, tracking sales and status reports when necessary. Keeping up to date with best practices and promotional trends.  Assisting in sales and inventory forecasting.  Any other ad-hoc duties assigned.   As a Channel Manager, you need to:  Preferably possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Business or any relevant field. Have relevant experience in the F&B industry.  At least 5 year(s) of working experience in managing a team with proven track record. Have a strong commitment to achieve sales targets. Possess strong analytical skills. Have excellent interpersonal & organizational skills. Have excellent communication, negotiation, and selling skills.  Preferably be fluent in spoken and written Mandarin to cater to our customer demographics.  Be proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.   As an employee of FoodXervices Inc, you will enjoy the following benefits: Corporate credit card with monthly spending allowance Monthly company revenue incentives Access to company gym facilities Monthly company cafeteria dining allowance Staff discount rates for company listed products Free parking *Salary range would commensurate with experience

Expressions of Interest  We are seeking expressions of interest from qualified and talented Sales applicants as part of our Global Expansion.  If you are interested, please apply here and answer the set questions as part of the application process.  These direct contributor/hunter roles will be responsible for expanding direct sales to drive value, generate revenue and accelerate the adoption of our global fabric. Passionate about growth and innovation, you will be a solution focused self-starter.  About Megaport  Megaport has transformed the way IT gets connected. We're global leaders in Network as a Service (NaaS), changing the way businesses reach the cloud. We're also a leading partner to Amazon, Microsoft, Google, IBM, Oracle, NYSE, and many other leading technology companies. Megaport is a publicly traded company on the Australian Stock Exchange with a market cap exceeding $2 Billion. We’re a lean, high-achieving team made up of over 230 members globally. While the company is headquartered in Brisbane, Australia, employees are spread out across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. Staff enjoy an environment that is collaborative, supportive, and fun.  Our Team Culture  Join a team of globally-positioned industry experts that lead by example. We do not compromise our values for commercial gain; we are all custodians of our culture, and the customer is at the centre of everything we do. Our employees are motivated, adaptable, persistent, hard-working, and dynamic. Our culture permeates everything we do and this, in turn with a global vision, forms a commitment to each other, our customers, and shareholders alike.  What You’ll Be Doing  As an individual contributor, you'll be prospecting, creating, developing and securing new business through Direct Sales across the APAC region, with a key focus on revenue generating targets. Continuously building and managing sales pipeline, and reporting pipeline activities to senior management. Profile and architect cloud-based network solutions for Enterprises. Learn and develop in depth knowledge of Megaport products and solutions, as well as the products of our key cloud services partners (AWS, Azure, Google, Oracle, etc). Research current business drivers, business strategic objectives and key stakeholders for prospects to develop solution offerings on our network fabric. Gather information on target markets, potential clients and the most favourable business models, and partner with the sales management and client management teams to define the most effective strategies to penetrate markets. Directhunting as well as partnering with the indirect/channel sales team to engage in campaigns and programs that will be used to target the potential industry verticals and clients.  What We Are Looking For  Demonstrable success in enterprise Solution Sales positions, consistent achievement of or exceeding sales targets. Tenacious, technical, personable, self-starter and strong-willed HUNTER able to generate business through your own outreach efforts. Be able to articulate a high level of understanding of data networking, cloud computing and virtual private networking. Consultative selling skills with first class communication skills (verbal and written) that allows you to comfortably present with flair both internally and externally. The ability to create your own Go-to-Market Sales strategy. Strong prospecting, qualifying, closing and relationship skills. Comfortable working in a remote, globally distributed work environment with ability and willingness to travel up to 30% of the time, once travel is determined safe.  What We Offer  Flexible working environments Birthday Leave Generous study and training allowance + 5 days paid study leave Creative, fun, and contemporary workspaces Motivated team of industry experts and new talent Celebrated success with ‘Legend’ and ‘Kudos’ Awards Health and wellness program Opportunities for career growth and potential for global intra-company transfers for interested candidates  All applications will be treated in confidence.  Please see Part 2 of our Privacy Policy to see what information Megaport collects from job applicants, why, and how we store and use it. Note that you’re entitled to know what personal data of yours Megaport holds, to request updates, rectification, and in some circumstances restriction or deletion thereof if you object (you being entitled to withdraw your consent to our holding your information at any time). Please see Part 5 of our Privacy Policy for more details on this and how to contact Megaport's data protection officer if you have any further privacy-related questions.  Candidates who meet the selection criteria will be invited to attend an interview.

description: Primary Objectives: The Presales Technical Consultant is primarily responsible for: (1) Supporting the sales of KX software in designated territories. (2) Ensuring client demonstrations, PoCs, technical discussions are carried out in a professional, clear way which clearly extols the benefits of the KX technology stack. (3) Act as the Technical Lead in country for all KX consultants working collaboratively and helping to mentor and develop junior staff.  Background:  KX, the time-series database company, is looking for energetic, highly motivated self-starters with a successful sales track record in the enterprise software sector of over 10 years, experienced in prospecting, cultivating and closing enterprise software sales across the ASEAN and South Asia markets with proven access to senior client executive decision makers. This is a new business development role where experience and results matter and will be well rewarded. KX is looking for seasoned professionals who enjoy winning and who have access to C suite executive contacts. The role will work cross-functionally with technical sales, solution teams, consulting, professional services, project management, delivery, support, corporate marketing, to build and deliver revenue growth.  Responsibilities: The Presales Technical Consultant is responsible for: • The technical sales process and technical engagement with KX prospects and clients • Partaking in a multitude of client facing activities relating to technical engagement: o Client Presentations outlining the technical aspects of a KX solution o Technology landscape. Ability to describe to clients the current technology themes in the market and how KX satisfies these requirements today. o Act as the KX go to client contact for technical questions around interoperability and system integration requirements. • Take ownership of RFI and RFP technical sections of the documents. • Proof of Concepts. Own the technical KPI’s which KX must meet to ensure the successful completion of an RFI. • Bid Process. Be responsible with the delivery function to correctly estimate man day effort to deliver a client end to end system. • Ownership of handover to Customer Success. Provide seamless transition to the delivery organisation to ensure that contractual commitments are fulfilled on time and to budget. • Mentoring and Skills development. Take an active role in facilitating the growth of the local kdb+ consultants in the relevant country. • Provide the senior technical point of contact for the respective KX office which other KX consultants can refer to in the first instance.  Knowledge / Skills / Experience: • Experience in enterprise software technical sales, including full lifecycle of understanding customer requirements and crafting/ presenting technical solution proposals. • Experience as a database/ analytics-oriented solution architect. • Experience collaborating with customers on a solution as a trusted advisor (especially with DevOps, IT, analytics, data science and product teams). • Deep knowledge and experience working with complex enterprise data architectures with a view to quickly identify strengths, weaknesses and areas for ROI driven improvement for a client. • Experience in architecting cloud, on prem and edge solutions involving control, monitoring and/or reporting applications. • Knowledgeable in diverse technologies and integration approaches that are relevant to Industry 4.0 including but not limited to: o Diverse database technologies, messaging, protocols, infrastructure, programming languages / approaches o Understanding the advantages / disadvantages of different technologies for different use cases / solutions • Excellent communication, writing and presenting skills (English and ‘local language’ is a requisite) • 7+ years’ experience with minimum 10 projects involving diverse technologies and challenges. (The experience should ideally cover design study, needs assessment, architecting systems, developing demos, running POCs and pilots) • Ideally has knowledge of industrial systems and processes in manufacturing, utilities, automotive and/or oil and gas sectors (telco would be a bonus)   Working for FD: At FD, you will embark upon a career with life-long learning at its core, facilitating rapid professional and personal development and the opportunity to design your own path. We support a variety of external training courses and accreditations and are truly passionate about our Mentor Program, through which our senior colleagues generously set aside personal time to coach and support others in their career progression.  We are delighted to have several active internal networks, social committees, and charity initiatives, designed with the intention of meeting the holistic needs of our employees and giving back to our communities.  Our employees are rewarded with numerous benefits as part of their employment, including: Competitive Salary Extensive Health Care Package Pension plan Employee Assistance Programme Annual leave increasing with service Group Life Protection Benefit Training opportunities FD Internal Network and Sports & Social Calendar  Who are we? First Derivatives plc (FD) is a leading software and services company, with world-leading intellectual property in ultra-high-performance analytics (KX) across industries, and extensive domain expertise and capabilities in capital markets systems and technology (managed services and consulting).  KX KX technology is designed to capture and analyze data to make real-time decisions in a world where data volumes generated by markets and machines are increasing exponentially, and existing technologies fail due to technological or commercial limitations.  KX is widely adopted throughout the financial industry and is poised for accelerated growth across high-tech manufacturing, automotive, oil and gas, utilities, and telecommunications.  First Derivative First Derivative provides a range of managed services and consulting worldwide to its clients in the capital markets sector, including many of the world’s leading banks, focused on supporting mission-critical systems as well as helping them to achieve and maintain regulatory compliance.

Kohler Co.'s mission is to contribute to a higher level of gracious living for those who are touched by our products and services. We understand that it takes investment in our associates’ development to make that happen.So, we offer ongoing investment in each individual’s personal development and the opportunity to collaborate with others across functions and roles at Kohler. jobTitle: Senior Business Development/Sales Manager - Singapore and Malaysia
description: The key objective of this role and position is to perform by meeting and achieving the sales and business goals of GRAPHISOFT in Singapore and Malaysia. The Senior Manager, Business Development/Sales - Singapore and Malaysia must be highly motivated and experienced software sales professional, who represents GRAPHISOFT as a business and a brand. This “business-to-business” sales professional should be able to generate leads, prospect target accounts for new business, develop existing customers as well as establish and work with channel partners in countries in his territory of operation.  The Senior Manager, Business Development/Sales - Singapore and Malaysia must be comfortable with selling technical software solutions to all stakeholders in the AEC industry, from design, through construction to owners of the property development projects. This position is a “solutions-oriented” position that uses consultative sales techniques, training and tools to provide the Channel and Sales Manager with every opportunity to succeed. The incumbent is expected to carry out his tasks in alignment to the company’s direction and to demonstrate the value of GRAPHISOFT solutions and products to customers.  Main Duties & Responsibilities Coordinate with partners to create and execute business plans to meet sales goals. Manage sales pipeline, forecast monthly sales and sales activities of partners to generate revenue. Analyze market trends, develop sales plans and identify new business opportunities. Manage channel partner and key customer relationship through all phases of the sales cycle. Manage partner-related issues – sales, pricing and process improvement matters in a timely manner. Responsible for tracking channel partner and key customer information, forecasts and reports Develop and maintain prospect and customer list based on strategic marketing data and other sources for sales leads in our CRM system Identify, recruit and manage the on-boarding of new channel partners within assigned territory. Develop positive working relationship to build business and communicate up-to-date information about new products and enhancements to partners. Provide a consultative solutions sales process training and upskilling of channel partners’ personnel, including one-on-one and group sales presentations Deliver customer presentations and attend sales meetings and partner conferences. Assist in partner marketing activities such as tradeshows, campaigns and other promotional activities. Responsible for tracking channel partner and key customer information, forecasts and reports Develop and maintain prospect and customer list based on strategic marketing data and other sources for sales leads in our CRM system Develop and maintain knowledge of local industry systems, standards, practices and trends and competitor activities Liaise with the pre-sales function of GRAPHISOFT to provide technical support and trainings to channel partners and their key customers Keep abreast of the knowledge of the software products and the technology represented by the incumbent. Job Requirements Minimum Diploma (or equivalent work experience) in business, marketing and sales or related field of study. Able to demonstrate sales record (5-8 years) at a high level of achievement. Solutions-selling experience in any one or all of the following areas in the AEC industry of Singapore or in the Southeast Asia region: hardware, software, services or other technical product. Having strong Southeast Asia AEC contacts especially with architectural, interior design, project management consultancy and/or construction firms and companies (preferably at the main contractor level) would be an added advantage. A self-starter.with strong analytical, presentation skills and possess the professional ability to interact with any level within an organization. Ability to self-motivate, multi-task and work independently or within a team. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Ready to travel extensively in Singapore and Malaysia. (Note: In view of the COVID-19 situation, all business travels will be suspended till further developments.) Demonstrate GRAPHISOFT’s core competencies such as conflict management, loyalty and commitment, productivity and effectiveness, quality of internal and external communication, taking the initiative, independence, ownership, teamwork and interaction with others, thoroughness and accuracy, time management and self-organisation.

description: About Us  500 Global is a venture capital firm with more than $1.8 billion in assets under management that invests early in founders building fast-growing technology companies. We focus on markets where technology, innovation, and capital can unlock long-term value and drive economic growth. We invest far and wide, across sectors and geographies. Our portfolio includes 33 companies valued at $1B+ and 120 companies valued at more than $100 million.  500 Southeast Asia is an early investor in Grab, Bukalapak, Carousell, Carsome, Prenetics and Finaccel, with 15 more of our portfolio companies worth in excess of USD $100 million each. We have made investments in 250 companies, which have gone on to raise a total of USD $20 billion. This is just the beginning - we are aggressively growing our team to serve even more founders and be even more impactful to entrepreneurship and the region.  About The Role  We are looking for someone to join the Capital Formation Team at 500 Southeast Asia in Singapore.  We have sovereign wealth funds, financial institutions, pensions, multi-nationals, ultra high net worth individuals, family offices and more entrusting us with their capital. You are a magnet for that. You strategize, organize, and execute the increase in assets under management. This means you'll pick up that phone, take the meetings, wine, dine (over Zoom as well), and convey our fund proposition to the right people. You'll work directly with the General Partners.  Responsibilities Actively source, outreach, contact and build relationships with potential leads and future investors (funds, financial institutions, pensions, multi-nationals, ultra high net worth individuals, family offices and more) Producing and updating collaterals including decks, pitchbooks, investor updates and reports Manage the relationships with our fund investors, including through organising events, scheduling meetings, managing and updating our investors Drive projects related to lead generation, sales pipeline organising fundraising roadshows Track and monitor the investor lifecycle and ensure that all investor queries are addressed in a timely manner Work with potential investors through their diligence, subscription and onboarding process.  Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance or other related field Required 3+ years of prior fundraising experience in investment banking, private banking, private equity, or venture capital High attention to detail, thorough, organized and self-motivated Strong understanding of financial reporting and ability to analyze fund performance Proficient in G Suite tools as well as excel and powerpoint. Excellent deck design and data visualisation skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to multitask between projects and deliverables and maintain a high level of accountability Comfortable with working in an unstructured, cross-culture, global environment with high expectations Ambitious, curious, passionate about startup culture, venture capital and technology Flexibility with international travel at short notice Sales-driven personality  500 Global collects and processes personal data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you are a California Job Applicant see the privacy notice for further details.
industries: Venture Capital & Private Equity

description: About Daraz Daraz is South Asia's leading online shopping and selling platform present in Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Myanmar and Nepal. We currently operate an ecosystem of ~50,000 sellers serving 10 million consumers with more than 20 million listed products. In May 2018 Daraz was acquired by Alibaba Group, and we are proud to carry our part of the mission to 'make it easy to do business anywhere'. As part of the Alibaba ecosystem, we are leveraging Alibaba’s global leadership and experience in technology, online commerce, mobile payment and logistics to drive growth in our markets. Together with Alibaba, we are ready to empower entrepreneurs in the region and to fulfill our promise to offer our customers the best selection of products with a high level of convenience. We currently have approximately 3,000 employees in across countries and business units.  Responsibilities Strategize: Lead the development of strategic business priorities, based on internal & external analysis. This would be supported by a robust financial model, leading to specific operating plans and budgets; Analyze: develop routine performance management and ad hoc analysis for your projects to understand our strengths and weaknesses, competitive pressures and opportunity areas. Define corporate metrics that align with business drivers for performance management. Lead: drive and effectively manage the roll-out and day-to-day business by building project plans, chairing project meetings, organizing, delegating and controlling project activities and milestones on an ongoing basis to ensure timely completion across different departments; Advocate: build strong relationships with teams across all departments -both locally and functionally - to drive strategic initiatives and seize opportunities; Experiment: Use data-driven decision making and sound business judgment to identify improvement opportunities across departments, run tests, and innovate our business; Do: figure out how to get from A to B – and actually make it happen; Grow: help the business get better, every day, 1% at the time; Gather: act as the one point of contact for product and data teams, garnering requirements from all business and operational teams, and helping to prioritize based on the business need; Support: work with account management and acquisition teams to build robust processes and best practices to help them achieve their objectives.  Requirements: Basic qualifications Experience: 3+ years experience in consulting, or project and program management in eCommerce (or related function within a high growth startup environment); Education: bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or Engineering from a top tier university with outstanding results; Excel: advanced skills.  Preferred qualifications Experience with P&L ownership; SQL proficiency.  What we offer: International working environment in a start-up setting, and a unique opportunity to learn from the best in e-commerce (Alibaba Group) and business growth. A platform to learn from Alibaba’s world-leading ecosystem with regular visits to China and South East Asia. Rigorous training and exposure in team management, leadership, business analytics, and operations. An opportunity to train the next generation of business leaders in the ‘tech’ industry. Competitive salary and incentive package Health & life insurance Relocation support (if applicable)
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: About The Company Climate Impact X (CIX), a global Environmental Commodities Exchange, is looking for a Commercial Manager (Sales & Origination) to help build the future of carbon trading markets. We are developing a global carbon exchange and marketplace that aims to scale the voluntary carbon market, through a joint venture to be established by DBS, SGX, Standard Chartered and Temasek. CIX will connect an ecosystem of partners, leveraging satellite monitoring, machine learning and blockchain to enhance transparency, integrity, and quality of carbon credits. This will empower corporations to take effective action and complement carbon reduction efforts as part of a holistic climate mitigation strategy.  CIX will offer distinct platforms and products that will cater to the needs of different carbon credit buyers and sellers. The Exchange will facilitate the sale of large-scale high-quality carbon credits through standardised contracts – catering primarily to MNCs and institutional investors. The Project Marketplace will offer a curated selection of NCS projects that can meet corporate sustainability objectives. Each project on the Project Marketplace will be supported by transparent impact, risk and pricing data.  For more information, please visit www.climateimpactx.com  About The Role  The individual will be accountable for driving growth in revenue; negotiating and closing transactions with both buyers and sellers; and building an active sales pipeline. The Commercial Manager (Sales & Origination) will be primarily focussed on working with buyers and developing those relationships; and where necessary, selected supplier relationships as well. The role will either be based in Singapore or London as part of a global Commercial team reporting directly to the Head of Commercial.   Responsibilities: Establish, manage and grow relationships with existing and new buyers so as to drive delivery of CIX’s sales strategy for growth across our platforms and services Build up a portfolio of high-quality buyers; originate and close deals/partnerships with buyers and see through their purchases on the Exchange and/or Marketplace Develop a programmatic approach to develop and expand buyer partnerships with client communication and marketing activities to onboard new buyers into the CIX ecosystem Perform high-level sales planning to forecast demand and sale of carbon credits & contracts from various buyer groups, including a) Coalition members, b) Exchange and Project Marketplace members, c) Retail customers Origination, structuring and execution of long-term offtake agreements and commercial deals for origination and spot procurements for various classes of carbon credit commodities from various credit providers (including brokers, conservation bodies, developers & governments) Understanding of the main business driver of current and potential suppliers and buyers; with ability to define the value of potential solutions, demonstrating an understanding of the buyer/supplier needs and product development to capture the imagination and interest of the customer Stay current on market developments, identifying new regulation/legislation and industry trends, products, developments in the voluntary and compliance carbon market, and new trading/revenue opportunities and how they affect the network of buyers Work alongside a dynamic global team of commercial and product managers to attract new customers and drive revenue growth. Actively engaging with the Operation, Legal and Compliance departments to ensure thorough risk management, trade execution, post-trade discipline and the overall quality control is maintained.  Requirements  Education - Bachelor’s Degree: Business, Finance, Economics or equivalent Preferred - Higher degree or working experience in relevant subjects such as Sustainable Finance, Environmental Studies, Energy Economics Required Experience - 8+ years’ experience in business and partnership development, sales, broker role or B2B sales in the Commodity/Financial markets; with a strong track record of sales, origination and relationship management Preferred – Specific experience in buy and/or sell-side of carbon credit market, work in a Carbon Trading Desk, Brokerage, or Exchange; with a strong grasp of market dynamics in the carbon market (compliance and/or voluntary). Skills & Abilities - Entrepreneurial and commercial mindset; sense of responsibility with willingness to take initiative and work independently; A sales excellence mindset with pride in exceeding sales targets; Know-how of relevant sales software (CRM) and techniques; Strong organisational, communication and interpersonal skills;  Apply via https://climateimpactxpteltd.applytojob.com/apply/S1wtmjaZ8V/Commercial-Manager-Sales-Origination

description: Our Company: If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world then this is the place for you. If you have a desire to work in an organisation that is: Passionate about its people Focused on delivering the very best tech to our customers Offering the flexibility to work how and where you are most successful Obsessed with our customer’s success The leading SaaS platform to automate partnerships - affiliate, influencer, technology partners, and more! Entrepreneurial in spirit with a culture that rewards collaboration and curiosity Obsessed with making a difference in business and to the wider community    Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation, working with innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi’s, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage their online affiliate, influencer, brand to brand, and content partnerships. The Impact Partnership Cloud covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across Europe, the United States, Africa, and Asia so there is plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement.  Your Role at Impact: The Partner Development Manager (PDM) is responsible for scaling Impact’s acquisition and recruitment efforts to drive a steady stream of publishers (traditional affiliates, media houses, content partners, influencers,...) to Impact’s marketplace and its brand portfolio. You are a go-getter. You are energized by the thrill of the chase. You like to build systems around success and replicate it 100-fold. You’re good at selling ideas and helping others see the value that you see. The PDM is critical to the success of Impact’s Marketplace & Brand growth and will be responsible for recruiting, connecting, optimizing, and scaling Publishers on the Impact platform. The PDM will be a part of a growing global team with supporting lineages within the Product Growth team.  What You'll Do: Set a plan of attack to uncover new-to-marketplace Publishers and to re-engage the dormant ones. Supporting the Client Success Team to understand strategic partner verticals to recruit for. Recruit and manage a pipeline of new marketplace Publishers using various communication channels, tools and methods. Inform onboarding of recruited/ new Publishers through activation channels. Drive path to first success with newly acquired publishers. Establishing deep mutually beneficial partnerships with a key group of tier 1 partners. Providing world-class growth enablement and the ultimate partner experience that builds trust, retention, and loyalty. Partner enablement programs to unlock key growth opportunities with high potential partners. Gain a deep understanding of a Partner's business priorities, strategy, and challenges and provide solutions accordingly. Responsible for meeting productive partnership and partner account growth targets and ensuring partner CRM is up to date. Identifying sales and expansion opportunities amongst a partner base for our publisher solutions (Supply-side License, Trackonomics). Learn assigned product lines and industry & internal ecosystem.  What You Have: 2-5 years of Publisher experience for a global software company and or agency. Previous experience in the affiliate marketing industry is a key requirement. Strong account management and or business development experience with a focus on Publisher development and experience using performance marketing SAAS technology. Demonstrated successful collaboration with internal international teams from ‘HQ’ & company offices across global time zones. Empathetic: understand every aspect of the day-to-day life of the audience we are supporting. Self-Motivated, Attention to Detail, Passion for Learning, Team player. Experience in working independently as well as part of a team in an energetic environment.  Benefits/Perks: Unlimited PTO Take the time off that you need. We are truly committed to a positive work-life balance, recognising that it is important to be happy and fulfilled in both. Training & Development Learning the advanced partnership automation products. Stock Options 4-year vesting schedule pending Board approval. Private Health Insurance Flexible work hours Internet Allowance Casual work environment Our international presence and diverse team allows you exposure to global perspectives. Established company with a cool, high velocity work ethos, where each person can make a difference.  Impact is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, genetics, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or non-binary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
