Department: None Description  Description:  The Sales and Business Development Leader - MES will be responsible for developing and driving sales order growth for Level 3 MES business, helping LifeSciences Manufactures across AP to achieve Business agility. MES Business shall cover the products like Syncade, Fluxa and NextGen MES Solutions.  This includes working with the PSS Country Leaders and LifeSciences Sales team to develop annual business goals and to provide leadership, communication, support, training and collateral to successfully meet these business goals.  Job Responsibilities:  Sales & Opportunity Management: Sets the direction for strong growth and set stretch goals/targets which are in line with divisional objectives for MES products. Maintains accurate booking forecast data in conjunction with all stakeholders. Monthly report out of pursuits and actions. Maintains a summary of current status on key pursuits. Works with sales management to ensure bookings happen per the forecast.  Supports and drives development of sales platform tools for front line sales, account teams and develop sales champion community. Ensures Asia Pacific has the required support and messaging to deliver the full sales cycle from Qualification through to demonstration and Proposal. Supports Emerson Life Science Management to set pricing strategies by preparing and presenting competitor intelligence and market pricing intelligence. Where required, deliver full sales support to sales team including opportunity qualification with customers, definition of sales strategy, delivery of SME specific presentations, initiation and delivery of proposals in collaboration with the proposal team and close out of the opportunity.   Business Development: Works with the Global team and countries to understand the top industry trends and drivers and develop Growth Programs aligning to Top industry trends. Sets clear Objectives, Strategies, Initiatives and Tactics for AP Specific Growth Programs for key products like Syncade and Fluxa. Maintains and builds on relationships with the existing Syncade installed base in Asia. Leverage and collaborate with Global Syncade Sales and Marketing to fill the sales funnel with quality leads and to increase Syncade Sales. Collaborate with the existing Syncade installed base and explore growth opportunities in MES solutions for R&D. Captures and develops value creation descriptions or QBRs in conjunction with Sales, Operations, Field Services and Account Management.   Product Management and Marketing: Works with Product Marketing to provide feedback on required Syncade functionality and updates on the MES market requirements and expectations. Expedites and escalates key customer complaints and problems as is required to obtain satisfactory and timely resolution. Works closely with different product Groups to understand the product roadmaps and be the Voice of Customer for the AP LS End Users ensuring the customer demands are met in product definitions. Participates and representing Emerson at various trade shows / events / conferences in various life sciences forums across Asia Pacific to establish Emerson Thought Leadership in domain and new potential markets. Leads and develops Digital Media campaigns in Digital Marketing and rolling out various initiatives. Ensures compliance of workplace safety rules, including but not limited to the usage of a personal protective equipment, if provided to you, while working; not involve in any unsafe or negligent act that may endanger peers or oneself; reporting unsafe work conditions and providing suggestions to improve safety / health at work, as needed.    Job Requirements: Degree in Engineering and 7-10 years’ sales experience in the process control industry. Relevant experience in the MES Application is preferable. Strong analytical skills. Good business knowledge and excellent selling skills. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, especially influencing skills. Strong technical skills – Project knowledge and solution knowledge. Able to travel extensively at least 50% of the time.       WHY EMERSON?  Our Commitment to Our People  We invest in our employees to ensure they have the marketplace knowledge, skills and competencies to compete and lead in a global economy. Our training programs focus on end-to-end development from onboarding through senior leadership.  Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer you the right options to meet your individual/family needs  Our success is measured by the positive impact we make on people, our communities and the world in which we live.  Learn more about us! .  Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion  At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place.  Diversity and Inclusion at Emerson is about welcoming, respecting, and valuing the differences each employee possesses. Inclusion is creating a real sense of engagement, belonging and connection for all employees. Learn more about our  Culture & Values  and about  Diversity & Inclusion at Emerson .   If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, you can request help by sending an email to idisability.administrator@emerson.com . description: Vodien Internet Solutions is a subsidiary of Dreamscape Networks and is the leading domain name, hosting service and solutions provider through Asia Pacific that supports over 35,000 companies and 210,000 users. We are seeking for a highly motivated and talented Business Development Executive with the relevant experience and expansive network within Singapore and South East Asia to accelerate our growth opportunities within Singapore through our corporate/enterprise focused Vodien brand. The Business Development Executive is responsible for driving growth in sales and product engagement through new customer acquisition as well as upsell and cross sell of existing corporate customer accounts. You will also be responsible to assist the Business Development Manager in developing and implementing appropriate initiatives, plans, solutions and proposals working alongside a highly skilled and experience account management, marketing and support team. Plan and execute targeted initiatives in collaboration with other departments to drive customer acquisition through a variety of channels. Generate leads and cold calling prospective customers. Drive towards meeting challenging, but rewarding targets (uncapped commission), goals and objectives. Develop, grow and nurture relationships based on consistent proactive and reactive communication with key corporate customers with a focus on customer needs and requirements. Attend face-to-face meetings with prospective and existing customers. Prepare, deliver and present high quality, professional proposals, quotes and business plans crafted towards the customers’ needs and expectations applying negotiation skills as and when required. Plan, manage and execute the on boarding of new customers with applied strategy, process and organisation. Nurture a strong and structured strategy focused towards new and existing customers to tailor appropriate solutions and drive increased engagement in partnership between the organisation and customer. Maintain and grow an in-depth understanding of corporate customers and the general market. Work within a highly metricised environment across the Corporate Accounts team and Marketing Team to ensure adequate forecasting, planning and projections along with tracking and periodic reporting as required. Assist the Business Development Manager/Head of Business Development to implement and manage any applicable corporate customer strategies and initiatives. Process incoming, missed and any other required customer communication with respect to corporate sales. Receive, communicate and escalate any customer concerns and issues within the Corporate Accounts and Technical team. Keep the Business Development Manager/Head of Business Development updated on targets’ progress and timeline, providing them with accurate forecasting of anticipated sales. Reporting on successes and areas needing improvements.  Job Requirements 3 – 5 years of business development/sales experience, preferably in the Information Technology or Web Development space and proven sales track record in the job advertisement. Is commercially astute with extensive experience in business development roles preferably in the Information Technology or Web Developments space. Possess a command for information technology, particularly within the area of Servers, Infrastructure as a service and associated enterprise products and solutions. Excellent selling skills with a “hunter” mentality. Have an entrepreneurial approach with a strong focus on innovation and is passionate towards customer advocacy. Possesses strong account management and relationship building skills. Excellent problem-solving and negotiation skills. Superb analytical skills with efficient ability to evaluate data and implement applicable action items and initiatives. Ability to flourish with minimal guidance and can handle uncertainty. Able to think strategically - seeing the bigger picture and setting aims and objectives in order to develop and improve the business. Has a proactive approach, take initiative and the confidence to start things from scratch. Is a team player and have outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

description: AVEVA infuses industrial software with intelligence to empower people to shape a sustainable future. We work with our customers and harness the power of our ecosystem to deliver operational agility and empower human expertise. Our solutions advance engineering and operations with Performance Intelligence. From water and energy to food and infrastructure, we inspire insights that transform opportunity into sustainable business value. We combine unparalleled intelligence with collaborative innovation to enable people and industries to thrive.  There are 6,000 of our people at 90 locations in more than 40 countries who challenge themselves and each other to create and improve the transformative technology our customers need. With our help, industries across the world can make a positive difference to the lives of people everywhere.  We take pride in our core values and the diversity of our people, valuing the unique experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. At AVEVA, we’re all about Limitless possibilities. Are you?   ABOUT THE ROLE  Location: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia or Singapore Region: SEA  Senior Sales Manager will manage the team of Corporate Account Managers in the South East Asia region reporting to VP, Corporate Accounts for Southern Market.  Responsibilities: • Provide focused sales leadership in acquiring business against competition, managing a Direct Sales Team of Account Managers • To meet and exceed Orders & Revenue targets for named corporate majors across SEA. • Reviewing the business pipeline with the team and providing accurate forecast to the management. • Strategizing AVEVA’s footprint growth by identifying white space as well as competition install base. Plan for Demand Generation activities in collaboration with marketing and Product Specialist and inside sales teams. • Work with account managers and support function teams to identify and progress opportunities to drive growth in the corporate accounts. • Communicate status, plans and campaigns regarding all aspects of Sales and Business Development, and to support the monthly quarterly and reporting process. • Ensure sales team is passionate about learning to develop their selling skills, understanding of the nature of the customer’s problems and an ability to reframe these problems to the solutions AVEVA provides. • Develop long term relationships with C level Executives and key decision makers. Coaching team to become a trusted advisor to clients. • Comply with the Framework of ONE AVEVA for all policies and other written and verbal communication from the management.  Knowledge, Skills & Experience Required: • Well established Sales Manager with a proven track record Experience (~15 years in a direct sale, account management) ideally selling software solutions serving, O&G, Plant Owner Operators, EPC’s and /or Design consultants or B2B solutions with long sales cycles. You will have at least 5 years’ experience in a sales team management role. • Self-starter who sets aggressive goals and is driven to succeed both personally and professionally • Ability to lead and learn in a fast-paced environment and capture quick wins to drive early momentum • Assertive sales leadership with ability to lead & coach sales teams by outlining compelling winning sales strategies and tactics at C-Level and functional management level • Analytical approach to the market • Strong C-level customer acumen and gravitas • Strong ability to program management across the team, driving effective account planning, deal reviews and demand generation so that intelligence, methods & learnings are captured consistently, and culture of repeatable success is established. • Proven ability to work cross-culturally - Excellent written and oral communication • Ability to work with all levels of an organization and to coach team in this skill  Qualifications: • Degree Level in Engineering, Business, Information Technology Background in Process Industries, Manufacturing or Engineering Industry.  AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplar employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.  Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.  Concerning agencies: AVEVA does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

description: As our Manager, Partnerships ANZ, you will be responsible for recruiting and managing relationships with an ecosystem of pre-defined Scandit partners across the territory. The role will focus on initiating, building and maintaining relationships with our key ISV, SI and reseller partners in the region. These partners will span across all of our key industry verticals which are Retail, Transportation and Logistics, Manufacturing and Healthcare. The primary success metric for this position will be to use the regional partner ecosystem to generate new sales opportunities. In addition, the secondary success metric is to ensure that the pre-defined list of ecosystem partners are all signed, onboarded, enabled and ready to collaborate.  This role requires a person who is proficient in wearing multiple types of partnership-oriented hats versus being more vertically focused on a particular partnership or industry type. If you enjoy the complexity, challenges and opportunities that a diverse ecosystem of partners brings, then you will thrive in this position. ISVs reshape industries by identifying solution gaps and therefore, this role plays a central part on how ISVs and Scandit together can reshape solutions which in turn reshape the expectations of the players in the industry vertical.  In this role, you will work closely with our VP of Partnerships, our APAC partner director, peer partner managers, regional sales directors, regional marketing managers, and product management to coordinate activities to support existing partners and actively recruit new partners to support our rapid growth. The position will report to our APAC partner director.  What You Will Do  Achieve regional partner goals by becoming an evangelist within partner organizations with a deep understanding of market dynamics and Scandit’s solutions Leverage your existing network to broaden Scandit’s relationships with key partners and device manufacturers in the ANZ region. Actively prospect and recruit new regional partners, including system integrators, ISVs and resellers to Scandit’s partner program Become an expert on Scandit solutions with the ability to comfortably pitch and provide training to partners Support and collaborate with sales team on partner-driven opportunities, and leverage partners for custom development Work closely with Scandit’s marketing team to create relevant collateral and co-marketing materials for partners as well as coordinate joint customer-facing events Provide feedback to Scandit’s product team based on conversations with partners, and provide support for product-led technology partnerships Track all activities in Salesforce, providing feedback and reporting to the regional Partnerships Director  Who You Are  Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, business, or a related field 8+ years experience in partner management, preferably covering a wide partnership ecosystem with entities such as enterprise-focused ISVs, System Integrators and Resellers Experience working with B2B mobile or SaaS solutions required, with experience working directly with sales and marketing teams Experience working in Scandit’s primary target industries of Retail and Logistics, additional industry experience is a plus Strong understanding of industry trends, key players, terminology and overall economics of the partner marketplace Ability to publicly represent Scandit with internal and external stakeholders, and at industry events and seminars Reliable, structured self-starter with strong analytical skills Language requirements: fluent English speaker. Cantonese, Mandarin, Korean would be a plus. Eligible to work in the ANZ region Last, but not least: excited to join a rapidly growing company with the ability to apply your experience to make an immediate impact, and the opportunity to grow professionally as the company expands  Partnerships at Scandit  The ecosystem we have created ensures that verticalised software solutions developed by our partners, may they be in retail, transportation, healthcare or manufacturing, incorporate the best data capture engine available in the market today. Our partners chose to work with us because together, we deliver the highest value products into our target markets. We have built strong relationships with market leading ISVs, SIs, device manufacturers and resellers.  The team is a diverse group of individuals who are passionate about our products, our values and our ability to extend our impact through our partner network. We represent a variety of cultures, have fun learning and executing together and are looking forward to welcoming you to the team!  Who We Are  Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones, and robots.  Scandit’s mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation and logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit’s technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.  Many of the world’s most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit’s enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.  “Everybody is welcome here” - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.  At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.  All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.  We help you capture every opportunity. www.scandit.com

description: About Temenos  We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.  We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.  Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!  THE ROLE  As part of our continuous expansion, we are looking for a talented Sales Account Manager to help us drive the adoption and growth of our suit of solutions with our existing client base.  Key Responsibilities  Articulating and demonstrating Temenos solutions through strategic value-based selling, building strong business cases, developing a return on investment analysis, and using other references and industry data to build relationships at multiple levels and ultimately drive deals from inception to close. Working with customer stakeholders to understand their bank’s strategy, challenges, and opportunities and articulating how Temenos can help them achieve their objectives. Creating value by partnering with technical and non-technical executives to support their transformation journey by showcasing the commercial and technology value of our Transact offering. Building and maintaining a robust sales pipeline and accurately tracking quarterly forecasts/revenue. Balancing quarterly results while keeping a clear line of sight of strategic and long term revenue opportunities. Create and execute account plans which address tactical and strategic opportunities Collaborating with various distributed internal teams to ensure the seamless execution of end to end sales cycles and ensure the highest level of customer advocacy.  Skills & Experience  In-depth knowledge of the financial services industry; the trends, challenges, and innovations. Proven track record of success in selling complex software solutions (ideally core banking) to the financial services sector. A consultative sales approach which enables listening to and understanding customer needs. Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with an ability to translate business requirements into value propositions which engage a range of audiences. Data-driven and able to use data to tell stories, engage clients and create value and drive clients to action. Able to navigate change and deal with ambiguity. A passion for selling! Fluency in English and local native language. A business and technical background to be able to engage and ensure buy-in at C-level and with IT teams. University degree in a related field. International experience.  WHY TEMENOS  You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day. You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best. You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises. You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity. You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients. You will experience what we call – Temenosity!  We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.  Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy

description: Date Posted  2021-05-28-07:00  Country  Singapore  Location:  UE Square, 83 Clemenceau Ave, #11-05/08, Singapore 239920  Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.  Our Avionics team advances aviation electronics and information management solutions for commercial and military customers across the world. That means we’re helping passengers reach their destination safely. We’re connecting aircraft operators, airports, rail and critical infrastructure with intelligent data service solutions that keep passengers, flight crews and militaries connected and informed. And we’re providing industry-leading fire protection and safety systems that our customers can count on when it matters most. Are you ready to learn from the most knowledgeable experts in the industry, develop the technologies of tomorrow and reach new heights in your career? Join our Avionics team today.  Job Description  Reporting to the Head of Sales (Asia Pacific), we are looking to hire a Senior Manager, Sales Business Development to join our Information Management Services Asia Pacific Sales team, based in Singapore, with the following job scope: Senior customer-facing role focused on large pre-sales opportunities with existing or new customers. Builds customer relationships at the executive level of large strategic customers to understand customer business and technology needs, influence technology choices and ensures they are met by Collins Aerospace products and services. Drives the sales of products and services to the highly complex accounts and customers to achieve the sales targets. Works with account teams to develop large opportunities involving airlines, airports and ANSPs (Air Navigation Service Providers). Strategically positions product offerings to maximize revenue. Overall leader on large complex opportunities for most strategic customers in APAC; works in matrix org to develop the deal strategy and lead the bid team on large opportunities. Ensures collaboration with multi-functional teams to execute on sales plans. Negotiates with internal and external parties and communicates with executive leadership on matters relating to the best strategies for identifying, securing, and maintaining critical customers. Responds to proposal requests from customers and develops proposals, ensure the financials meet customer expectations and respect internal profit targets. Resolves wide-ranging issues to get proposals approved both by the customer and internally. It includes performs negotiations to close the sale. Guides marketing resources and the sales leadership team to define the overall sales strategy as well as develop products and solutions responsive to the customer’s business. Speaks at industry events, clearly articulating Collins Aerospace vision and the future of ICT systems in airlines/airports/ANSPs (Air Navigation Service Providers) as well as the business benefits of new and existing technology. Performs, forecasting for respective channel, customer group, or territory. Any other ad-hoc as assigned by the leader. Qualifications Engineering or equivalent technical degree and 15 years of relevant experience. Extensive experience in selling complex technical solutions in the Aviation Industry to airports, airlines, and ANSPs (Air Navigation Service Providers). Must have proven track closing major opportunities in Aviation/Airlines Technologies domain. Strong networks within Aviation / Airlines industry is prerequisite. Possess the gravitas to develop and maintain positive relationships with both internal and external stakeholders; including senior level management Acquire natural flair to communicate with people effectively, persuasively and respectfully Mastery level of presentation skills in an articulate and clear elegance. Proficiency in English is demonstrated in communication, influencing and negotiation skills Prior sales experience from a renowned global organization is preferred Ability to travel at least 70% of the time Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. jobTitle: Sales & Relationship Manager (SEA), Securities Services - VP
description: In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 17,000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.  Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 73 markets with more than 196,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region.  BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced, diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits, as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team. excluding partnerships https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/  Position Purpose To market our securities services solutions and franchise (Global custody, Fund administration etc) to asset owners like central banks, SWFs, pension funds as well as to asset managers. To protect and retain the existing client revenue streams To grow these revenues through the cross selling of additional solutions and the execution of strategic client relationship planning, while ensuring the highest standard of client experience. Key Responsibilities  Sales Responsible for building and managing a pipeline of key deals and new business opportunities. To contribute to achieving the Sales Budget under South East Asia. Responsible for ensuring maximum profitability is achieved as well as achieving pre-agreed new sales targets. Responsible for developing and sharing internally, market and competitive information Build and develop relationship with prospective clients Market BP2S Brand Relationship Management Accountable for KYC documentation and client due diligence compliance Negotiate custody agreements with clients in collaboration with BP2S Legal Collaborate with our colleagues across the BNP Paribas Group to ensure a ‘One Bank’ approach for our institutional clients. Develop detailed understanding of local clients' organisation, with specific purpose of understanding the clients' strategy Define and maintain local account plan, setting out clear objectives, actions and identify business development opportunities Understand and actively promote the full suite of BP2S' products and services to the client, to maximise cross selling opportunities Work with internal management and teams to ensure excellence in service delivery, in line with agreed service level commitments Ensure prompt resolution to client complaints and disputes, and efficient response to client requests and queries Strong Discipline in Client Vision inputs for pipelines Competencies (Technical / Behavioral) Experience in complex institutional relationship management Minimum 10 – 15 years of experience in managing client relationships Proven experience successfully closing sales and managing multi-billion relationships Proven track record of client retention and revenue expansion Effectively liaises with a number of individuals throughout the organisation; Self-motivated and disciplined. Excellent communication and client facing skills Good presentation skills, both written and oral with strong attention to detail Strong ethical and professional conduct Specific Qualifications Required Bachelor’s Degree / Masters Primary Location  SG-06-Singapore  Job Type  Standard / Permanent  Job  SALES DEVELOPMENT  Education Level  Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)  Experience Level  At least 12 years

description: Department: None Description   Description:  Lead the business development efforts and provide technical leadership for the Measurement Solution – Systems team in South East Asia. This role combines the sales ownership of businesses with our channel partners as well as ensuring the selection and consideration of the most optimal solutions in liquid and gas hydrocarbon flow metering systems to meet the business objectives of customers and Emerson.  Job Responsibilities:  Solution Architect Builds awareness, drive consideration, and achieve preference for Emerson’s engineered flow solutions. Provides technical leadership to proposal team & in-country sales teams on solution strategies that will help win engineered liquid and gas hydrocarbon flow metering opportunities. Engages early with customers, lead technology conversion discussions as appropriate in order to come up with the most optimum solution that meets/exceeds all the technical and commercial requirements. Works with proposal team, review customer’s technical requirements and lead discussions on proposal and execution strategy. Coaches in-country sales teams and other segments/business units of Emerson to upsell product opportunities. Ensures smooth handover of awarded opportunities to execution team and ensure a seamless customer experience.   Business Development Works with in-country sales teams and other segments/business units of Emerson to find new opportunities for engineered flow solutions. Leads the opportunity review process of identified projects with Emerson’s channel partners and leadership team. Uses solution selling approach to understand customer pain & customer organization and transfer customer pain to Flow System Vision and Value. Works with sales team and lead discussions on bidding and commercial strategy. Owns and reviews the project technical and commercial deck (DOA document) with AP leadership. Actively participates in contract negotiations with in-country sales team. Actively participates in monthly sales and orders forecast calls with countries. Monitors the system business competitive environment to identify threats and opportunities and assist in plans to address them.    Job Requirements: Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Instrumentation, Chemical) and 8-10 years’ experience in the Oil & Gas industry/ flow metering (with at least 2 years in a proposal and sales/business development capacity). Knowledge and working experience of flow meteorology systems is highly desired. Strong system product/solutions/applications knowledge and associated buyout products. Strong commercial, organizational, prioritization and planning skills. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to recognize and adapt to cultural differences in different countries in South-east Asia. Willingness to travel within the region up to 40% (post pandemic). This role will be located in Singapore.    Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore-West Coast  Other Locations  Malaysia-Selangor-Subang Jaya  Job Function  Sales  Date  Aug 10, 2021, 8:00:14 PM

description: Company Description Our client is Asia fastest growing one-stop digital asset financial services platform. With $10 billion in assets under management and custody, they provide one-stop crypto financial services with over $5 billion in average monthly trading volumes.  Role Overview We are looking to hire a passionate sales engineer who can imbue their expertise into the crypto community and build a better product for the next one billion users.  Responsibilities Serve as a sales support for institutional custodian solution, highly perform technical pre-sales for digital asset custody functionality. Be engaged in client meetings, which will involve diving into the specifics of new assets, protocols & functions and determine feasibility and scope of integration difficulty before escalating the demand to the development team. Have complementary technical skillset to support development and lead the product design direction. Identify market new trend, maximize pre-sales impact and influence product priorities; Coordinate and orchestrate blockchain integrations for Custody with development team; Kick off initial discussions around integration timeline and custom product needs, as well as help set expectations on scope and pricing. Identify areas for improvement and communicate these issues and possible solutions with product teams and upper management. Requirements 3 plus years’ experience in technical related degree and previous experience as a technical consultant. Has experience in facing clients, sales engineering, solutions architect or implementation consulting role in technology field, or technical implementation role. Demonstrate ability to grow market shares, identify priorities, and winning patterns to maximize pre sales impact. Sensitive to the rapid change of blockchain & cryptocurrency market & knowledge of blockchain technology is a bonus.

jobTitle: Domestic Appliances - Regional Paid Search Manager
description: In this role, you have the opportunity to drive Philips Domestic Appliances growth by translating business and marketing objective into winning consumer centric digital campaigns which lead users throughout the customer decision journey. You will be a part of Global Digital HUB operating in APAC region.  Key responsibilities: Designing and implementing an ambitious Paid Search strategy for champions preposition as well as e retailer platforms in APAC such as Lazada, Shopee, Tokopedia, Q10, JD and Amazon to contribute to the growth of our brand preference and market shares. Translating brief objectives into effective digital activation with customer centric approach   Driving online excellence for full funnel end to end campaign activation (media planning, e-commerce) Ensure the activation ecosystem and target are defined, appropriate, and in line with overall KPI's.  Recommend and implement measurement solutions or A/B test to help understand the impact your campaigns make on targeted audience, the business in general. Continuously check on effectiveness of media buying and creative strategy. Support to develop content in line with key digital platforms specifics and the best practices Driving the adaptation of key digital tools and capabilities that being rolled out across Business, Content and Media Drive analytics to support fact-based decision marketing processes, ongoing optimization, and ROI modeling.  Manage relationship with key vendors and partners Continuously search for innovation to drive digital excellence and leverage best practices across markets Develop activation capabilities, practice change management to effectively contribute to driving growth Acts as single point of contact for Group of Markets that are supported for specific activations Consulting and coaching to achieve global and local online excellence   To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: 5+ years of professional experience with the proven track of record in Digital Media Planning/Buying (Paid Social, Paid Search) on client or agency side Extensive hands-on experience in Paid Search campaign management with multiple languages across Google, Lazada & Shopee and broader knowledge of Google Ads, Google Marketing Platform (SA 360, DV360, GA ) and Lazada & Shopee MSP Experience in project management. Proven experience in working with large businesses in international environment. Experience of managing and supervising team of experts Experience in working with creative/communications teams to craft creative assets driving audiences through full consumer decision journey Confidence and skill in presentation, communication and knowledge-sharing, engaging and leading them through complicated subject matter Outstanding analytical skills Fluent English (spoken and written) and additional Asian language would be a plus   In return, we offer you  A meaningful career, with new challenges in our dynamic organization, working in an encouraging multinational and multicultural environment. We are happy to provide you with this opportunity to work with new technologies. You will be surrounded by passionate and committed, colleagues who share your ambition to create outstanding customer experiences. Your work will be ambitious and full of opportunities for growth. Variety and challenge will be part of your daily routines.   Why should you join Philips?  Philips’ Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion in sales in 2019 in kitchen appliances, coffee, garment care and home care appliances, with successful products such as the Airfryer, Perfect Care Steam Generators, Automatic Coffee Machines with LatteGo and SpeedPro Max Aqua vacuum cleaner, and many more that are used by millions of people every day across the world.   In January 2020, Philips announced that it would be considering new ownership options for Domestic Appliances, as it is not a strategic fit for the company’s future as a health technology leader, and committed to finding the right home for the business to ensure that it is set up for continued success serving customers, leveraging the Philips brand and driving growth across the markets that it serves.   In its 128-year history as a leading innovator, Philips has had to reinvent itself a number of times to remain competitive. This has involved several high-profile divestments, resulting in the company’s successful track record in managing complex change of this scale. Such transformations offer unique opportunities for employees to ‘make their mark’ and gain expertise in a specific and dynamic environment - those who can deliver results while navigating and contributing to changes will gain unique skills and perspective that will prove valuable for the rest of their careers.
industries: Consumer Electronics and Consumer Services

description: ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES  Vertical Market Management Develop and drive the national strategy based on the GEODIS Global Strategy in complete alignment with the Regional business strategy and market trends. Create an annual sales plan and budget for the country that meets or exceeds the budgeted growth in sales and profitability Drive strategy including but not limited to VM road map development & implementation; development of VM local champions; delivery of relevant workshops & training in whole country; internal and external VM marketing plan; Ensure communication and understanding of the strategic plan including objectives; Work closely with internal local, regional and global stakeholders to explore and hunt for new business opportunities; Structure and allocate Key account clients based on vertical market segmentation in complete alignment with the regional sales structure and strategy; Establish Customer Development Plan to grow the target accounts (i.e. strategies to leverage existing customers into more country opportunities and generate leads for other APAC countries). Steer, develop and motivate the country KAMs to sell, maintain and support the assigned clients; Deploy a strong consultative selling approach to identify supply chain challenges and develop value creating solutions that drive increased scope of engagement and share of wallet for GEODIS; Update country BD teams with target accounts and market knowledge information; Perform vertical related sales administration (CRM, monthly report, newsletter activities) for country, regional or global stakeholders; Support internal parties to develop best possible solutions for the customers.  Management Information Gather, consolidate, analyze and report on sales performance, to ensure realization of national sales plan and budget Ensure all stakeholders/ users are fully trained in CRM system and CRM reporting tools; Keep global CRM updated with correct information to allow ONLY system generated reports for Performance Management; Provide timely and accurate reporting of relevant details as required and requested.  Business Planning Drive behavior towards strategic engagement and value creation for [named VM] Corporate Accounts and strategic targets as well as drive pipeline size and quality;  Process Management Manage the standard process for each sales channel as outlined and communicated by the regional sales strategy; Implement and constantly enforce agreed company-wide health, safety and security systems that make provision for systematic identification and elimination of hazards.  Management Information Gather, consolidate, analyze and report on sales performance, to ensure realization of national sales plan and budget Ensure all stakeholders/ users are fully trained in CRM system and CRM reporting tools; Keep global CRM updated with correct information to allow ONLY system generated reports for Performance Management; Provide timely and accurate reporting of relevant details as required and requested.  Business Planning Drive behavior towards strategic engagement and value creation for Corporate Accounts and strategic targets as well as drive pipeline size and quality;  Process Management Manage the standard process for each sales channel as outlined and communicated by the regional sales strategy; Implement and constantly enforce agreed company-wide health, safety and security systems that make provision for systematic identification and elimination of hazards.  Organizational Culture Create a positive work culture to ensure the commitment of both the staff to the company and vice versa are realized, be the employer of choice; Insure that standards are deployed and used to foster a performance based culture with clearly defined expectations supported by tools, training and mentoring; Embrace the 5 values of Geodis be an ambassador by demonstrating these values in everything you say and do.  Leadership Steer, develop and motivate direct reports for individual and company objectives, to ensure the necessary quality and quantity of staffing for current and future needs Initiate and execute Performance Management process, including conducting performance appraisals and midyear reviews against measurable KPIs; Identify team and/or individual developmental needs/ opportunities and stimulate and ensure follow-up and execution; Demonstrate commitment to Geodis by keeping the team committed to deliver the Business Vision, Mission and Values; Coach, train and develop the sales resources within each sales channel to reach their productivity, pipeline and budget targets; Motivate, inspire, develop and engage all direct reports; Conduct people interactions timely, in a transparent, approachable and trustworthy manner; Communicate on strategy and business results on a regular basis with the team. Engage dialogue to keep the communication flowing; Ensure realization of training programs in co-operation with HR; Support the growth of identified talents with HR as part of the succession planning.  People Management Support and implement programmes and activities for efficient people management in line with the global HR policies Ensure the team has meaningful and achievable objectives aligned to company’s strategy; Ensure all employees are equipped, trained, qualified, motivated, developed and empowered to provide high levels of customer satisfaction as measured in regular surveys; Train, coach, encourage and develop management and all staff to continuously review our people strategies and management effectiveness to improve employees’ satisfaction; Encourage employees to offer suggestions for improvements, influence on team decisions, and act on these as appropriate with feedback/feedforward; Operate recognition schemes (E.g. RING THE BELL/ Sales League) that ensure praise is given to individuals and teams for outstanding performance in a fair and motivated manner; Enforce the Geodis policy relating to Equal Opportunities by ensuring that everyone is treated in a fair and equitable manner in terms of compensation strategies, development opportunities, dispute and grievances handling etc; Ensure organization is structured and roles are designed to create interesting work and collaborative ways of team environment; Communicate the appropriate Regional and Local future strategic objectives and updated information necessary for the jobs of all employees through proper and effective channels.  Relationship Management Cooperate with managers in other parts of the Group outside the country and always create value by acting in the best interests of Geodis when making decisions.  Compliance and Internal Policies Implement and comply with Geodis Group Policies including health and safety and security procedures; Operate in accordance with all legal requirements and external regulations; Work with Regional Legal to ensure minimize legal exposure upon critical decisions of the company.  REQUIREMENTS  Degree holder in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management or related disciplines. At least 5 years’ experience in developing and operating in various Markets Strong sales or business development background in Logistics, Freight Forwarding or Warehousing; Tender processes management experience; Excellent sales, presentation and negotiation skills, consultative selling, customer psychology and purchasing patterns; Strong confidence and competencies in building executive level relationships; Fluent in both verbal and written English. Basic sales techniques and negotiation skills Presentation techniques, comfortable with meeting and presenting to groups 2-3 people Knowledge of Geodis tools Knowledge of company goals and strategies Good interpersonal and communication skills Highly proficient in computer skills and common applications (Office, Excel, PowerPoint & Word)  Our Candidate promise  Recruiting passionate people  At GEODIS, we believe that each and every person matters when it comes to achieving long-lasting success and demonstrating our know-how. Our commitment to our customers leads us to recruit passionate and demanding men and women who are ready to fulfill the ambitions of our rapidly changing sector with all their energy.  Join a leader in constant evolution  With more than 100 years of experience in the field of transport and logistics, GEODIS knows how to respond to the major challenges. Throughout its history, GEODIS showed ability to adapt to the needs of its clients, industry-specific constraints and new national boundaries. With its talent pool, GEODIS opens you doors to the world full of dynamism where everyone finds their place in expertise, contributes to their development and succeeds. Being the key player of the supply chain, we are working on the logistics projects of our customers today and preparing those of tomorrow.  Creating daily opportunities  It is true that we are committed to offering autonomy and the opportunity to take initiative to each of our new hires. Therefore, it is necessary that they benefit from personalized and operational support that will allow them to understand the challenges of GEODIS and emphasize their strengths. We encourage openness. “Discuss. Decide. Align.”- this is a genuine moto to guarantee the success of our actions.  And if you were part of this adventure?  Being GEODIS employee means living every day professional and personal adventure. It is about incorporating your personality, your knowledge and your know-how in the culture and the team spirit of GEODIS. Involvement and collaboration make it easier for everyone to take responsibility. We encourage you to go and meet different expertise and our complementary ecosystems whose activities give meaning to the group.

description: All roles listed as ‘remote’ are available as remote within the same country.  APJ Strategy & Sales Operations Manager  We’re looking for an entrepreneurial and driven Strategy & Sales Operations Manager to join our Strategy & Operations team to support Snyk’s hyper-growth in APJ. APJ was launched a year ago and is growing at a phenomenal pace with teams located in ANZ, Singapore and Japan and ambitious expansion plans in 2022. The Strategy & Operations team’s mission is to support Synk’s Leadership team in driving hyper-growth by enabling good, efficient decision making, rapid, effective execution, and scale. The position will report directly to Snyk’s Sr. Director, GTM Strategy, Operations and Analytics.  You’ll Spend Your Time Supporting the APJ leader in defining APJ growth strategy and prioritizing investments Assisting Sales Management with Annual and Quarterly planning, including customer segmentation, territory design, and quota deployment Creating and delivering weekly operations reports and sales forecasts Tracking, analyzing, and reporting on sales and sales process KPIs Delivering actionable insights to leadership to inform decisions to increase GTM effectiveness and efficiency Supporting ad hoc sales analytics and developing new reporting tools stemming from multiple data sources Managing assigned projects to drive increased operational efficiency within sales and sales operations Training teams on how to use our sales tools (e.g., CRM) most effectively; subsequently collaborating with them on ideas and enhancements to our tools and our overall sales process You Should Apply If You Are agile and enjoy the speed of a fast-paced, highly engaged startup environment Have sharp analytical skills and an “insight-ready” mindset: you don’t just report the data, you generate insights & provide business recommendations Are ridiculously easy to work with, with an ability to build strong relationships with a broad set of stakeholders that have diverse interests Have program management skills and are comfortable multitasking and prioritizing in a fast paced environment Enjoy acquiring new knowledge and skills and can do so quickly We’d Especially Love To Hear From You If Have Bachelor’s degree within a critical thinking field (economics, finance, accounting, operations, etc) Are proficient in MS Excel Have consulting experience Have experience with BI tools (Looker) and/or SalesForce dashboarding Have at least 4 years of experience working with a SaaS or a technology company in an operational role Are a self-starter with ability to work independently with minimal supervision Are an exceptional problem solver, with a demonstrated ability to analyze complex problems and develop solutions We are distributed across four offices in London, Tel Aviv, Boston and Ottawa, with 10% of the company working fully-remote. We’ve made an organizational commitment to building a strong, effective, distributed company: we form teams across multiple offices wherever possible, and we invest in communication so that we can benefit from each others’ perspectives. As well as an always-on webcam so we can see what’s happening in each office, we make heavy use of video calls, Slack, and some inter-office travel.  About Snyk  Snyk is the leader in developer security. We empower the world's developers to build secure applications and equip security teams to meet the demands of the digital world. Our developer-first approach ensures organizations can secure all of the critical components of their applications from code to cloud, leading to increased developer productivity, revenue growth, customer satisfaction, cost savings and an overall improved security posture.  At Snyk, we envision an inclusive technology industry powering a more sustainable and secure world. Since our founding, Snykers have cared deeply for one another and the developer and security communities as well as the larger world around us. Learn more about our Snyk Impact social and environmental mission and take action with us here.  Snyk's Developer Security Platform automatically integrates with a developer's workflow and is purpose-built for security teams to collaborate with their development teams. Snyk is used by 1,200 customers worldwide today, including industry leaders such as Asurion, Google, Intuit, MongoDB, New Relic, Revolut and Salesforce.  Snyk is recognized on the Forbes Cloud 100 2021, the 2021 CNBC Disruptor 50 and was named a Visionary in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for AST.

description: COMPANY BACKGROUND  Thunes mission is to enable businesses and their customers to participate in the global economy by providing them fast and affordable cross-border payments. Interconnecting mobile wallet operators, platforms, merchants, money transfer operators, payment service providers and banks to facilitate seamless payments, we unlock opportunities for millions of people and businesses in emerging and developed markets.  Our Mission  To enable a world where emerging and developed markets have seamlessly interconnected cross-border payments.  Our Values  Our team is committed to thinking big, work hard and smart, and do the right thing. Above all, we love what we do and we have fun!  Our Solutions  We act as a trusted, neutral aggregator in a deeply fragmented industry. Without a trusted, neutral and interoperable aggregator, the partners of a payment transaction would waste time and costly resources developing their connections to multiple systems. Multiple connections would also mean that these actors must charge higher prices, which could prohibit financial inclusion and the spread of financial services. We offer key payment solutions to tackle the speed, cost-efficiency, and accessibility challenges for emerging markets:  Business Payments Mass payouts Remittance processing Virtual Accounts International Trade Invoice Payments  CONTEXT OF THE ROLE  Thunes is a global, fast-growing fintech scale-up that connects businesses to the global economy thanks to the world’s largest cross-border payment network it has established. Thunes has clients in over 100 countries including many in emerging markets across LATAM, Africa and Asia. Backed by top tier investors around the globe we have raised significant capital allowing us to focus on:  Continuing to expand its network to enable payments in more local markets Scaling and automating our platforms Launching innovative products that serve its customers and drive business growth  You will work with highly skilled colleagues from numerous nationalities and you will be a valuable contributor from the start. You will be a genuine ambassador of Thunes’ values and products.  You will get the opportunity to work on an international stage, alongside household names such as TikTok, PayPal, and Checkout.com, hold genuine responsibility, deliver meaningful projects, and make a real impact on the lives of people in developed and emerging markets alike.  Role Overview  The CRM  Specialist will report to the Global Sales Operation Manager and will serve as the company CRM subject matter expert (SME). They will drive and champion system usage, so that our data provides accurate insights into sales performance and trends, providing leadership with meaningful data that supports the ongoing growth of the business. An ideal candidate in this role will be highly dynamic, meticulous, bear exceptional communication skills and will know how to balance getting the right details while working in a fast environment. The individual will be a vital member of a growing Sales Operations team which is critical to the overall productivity and growth of the business.  Key Responsibilities  Being Thunes global ‘go-to’ expert for CRM queries and ideas for development, proactively identifying areas for improvement and suggesting & implementing changes Works with key stakeholders such as Sales, Finance, Marketing to advise on best use, assess and advise on workflows and manage and facilitate trend analysis Defines the process and manages the accuracy & integrity within CRM by working closely with sales & leadership team Aligns/ Implements seamless workflows between CRM and other Thunes systems Creates and reengineers reports and dashboards for management information (MI) Supports the Sales Forecasting process, ensuring a high degree of data quality and accuracy Assists with Annual and Quarterly Sales Planning process Identifies training needs, develops, and delivers training programs to Thunes CRM users Supports Global Sales Operations Manager to optimize processes and drive CRM utilization Provides insights into various aspects of the sales cycle including pipeline management, sales velocity metrics and opportunity management Creates documentations for existing processes and upcoming process changes Manages ad-hoc reporting and analysis requests  Professional Experiences/Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in a business discipline Strong understanding of CRM best practices and functionality Hands-on CRM implementation, administration, maintenance, and optimization experience e.g., Zoho/ Salesforce/ Hubspot or other Has held a sales analytics/ sales operations/ CRM specialist role in a commercial environment that has a globally dispersed sales organization High level of Microsoft Office Suite competency including at least intermediate Excel proficiency (Creating visual representations of data, creating & managing pivot tables, ability to organize data using SUMIF, COUNTIF, and VLookup.) Must be highly organized, independent, and able to prioritize tasks Ability to work under pressure in a rapidly evolving fast-paced environment Detail-oriented and a believer in the value of process Exceptional collaborator and influencer - driving change through ideas, relationships, and action Previous experience gained within Financial Services, or a Tech Company is desirable Ideally, applicants will have previously managed and/ or played a key role in the implementation of Salesforce within an organization  Sound like you? Apply now
industries: Financial Services, Information Technology and Services, and Banking

description: IN A NUTSHELL Spryker is soaring at high speed towards global expansion! With $130m raised in series C funding and Spryker valued at $500m, we want to join forces with a BIG thinking Senior Sales Manager who will target the enterprise sector as the main growth region and be a key player in Spryker’s e-commerce revolution! We seek a sales hunter with an entrepreneurial-driven commercial to be an Account Executive and build on our extensive list of enterprise accounts in the Asia Pacific region. You will be in the driver's seat, driving new accounts into our enterprise customer base and steering Spryker towards its global expansion targets whilst reporting into and collaborating closely with our VP of Sales EMEA Growth Markets, Alexey Pronin.  YOUR CHALLENGES Drive our growth in the enterprise sector, develop our business, and take responsibility for customer acquisition and business expansion in the APAC region. Experience in Singapore and/or Australia is a priority. Define and implement a collaborative planning process to develop sales forecast/plans and a go-to-market strategy Manage various prospecting channels to target and gain the interest of potential B2B & B2C targeted top tier accounts Take part in trade shows and conferences for lead generation and enterprise sales Implement acquisition processes from the first point of contact to planning and carrying out enterprise customer pitches, defining offers and contract negotiations Establish and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders like solution partners, enabling services, core development, sales, and marketing Be on top of it all and keep abreast of industry news, technologies, trends, and opportunities, piloting and implementing emerging technologies for e-commerce Regularly report your activities, progress, and successes  YOUR PROFILE You are a real hunter and have a minimum of 3 years experience (Account Executive) and a minimum of 6 years (Senior Account Executive) with B2B and/or B2C enterprise stakeholders and decision-makers of major competitors and various industries in the APAC region. Your professional ambitions match our growth ambitions of over 300% and a very agile and fast-paced environment  The proven success record of closing large enterprise clients within a SaaS and/or Ecommerce environment following a consultative selling approach Your exceptional communication and social skills are on point, even in front of large enterprise customers Strong analytical ability to analyze and interpret sales data and trends from a variety of sources You have a strong sales skill set, deep technical knowledge, and a proven track record in developing and executing successful sales plans and stakeholder mappings Your outstanding problem-solving skills and superior influencing skills paired with a high level of endurance within long sales cycles involving various different levels of hierarchy are only some of your strengths You have a well-developed ability to independently create and effectively deliver presentations, C-Level pitches onsite, develop forecasts and sales stories In all this, you are a real collaborative team player and agree with us that teamwork means working together towards a common vision professionally, with passion and fun You ideally have experience with project implementations (as a consultant, project manager, or product owner) and very complex bid processes You call yourself a networker, know that traveling and Sales go hand in hand, and enjoy being on stage or on fairs Fluency in one of the SEA languages is a plus  ABOUT US Spryker enables companies to become digital pioneers in B2B, Unified Commerce, B2C, and marketplaces. The innovative platform-as-a-service solution with over 50 API-based packaged business capabilities (PBC) is cloud-native, and its flexibility makes it attractive for companies and developers. The Spryker Cloud Commerce OS has empowered 150+ companies to manage transactions worldwide. It is trusted by brands such as Toyota, Hilti, Lekkerland, Hero, Rose Bikes, and Prym. Our modern offices are located in the digital metropolises of Berlin and Hamburg and other locations such as Amsterdam and New York. We are taking new markets by storm! The international Spryker team is constantly working with new, exciting customers, technologies, innovative approaches and is looking for talented people who want to revolutionize the digital commerce world with us. Learn more at Spryker.com.  OUR RESPONSIBILITY – 5 REASONS TO JOIN THE SPRYKER HERD We integrate work into our lives, not the other way around: To be your most productive, creative, and amazing self, make use of our work from anywhere policy, benefit from flexible and unlimited vacation days and flexible working hours from 6 am to 10 pm. We offer fresh fruits, healthy cereals, and cool drinks in our newly designed offices to support your health. Benefit from our remote budget and monthly internet subsidiary and set up your own personalized mobile office. We challenge and grow: Our mission is to provide each Sprykee with a framework for holistic and regular 360° feedback as well as for personal and professional development, enabling you to master daily challenges and continuously develop your own skills further via self-learning tools and training. To invest in your future, we offer a company pension scheme and free language classes.  We focus on our vision: Join an ambitious global journey, work and collaborate with masterminds and best-in-class colleagues while enjoying trust, flexibility, and full ownership to excel in an outcome-oriented environment. Go green with us, Spryker is a climate-neutral company, and together with our employees, we support climate action projects. Grasp our vision even better during our regular all-hands and executive Q&A sessions.  We celebrate our success: Knowledge sharing sessions, digital Yoga and work-out classes, thanksgiving dinners, “Glühwein” nights, regular “herd events” such as cocktail mixing workshops, BBQ, movie nights, and many more allow you to get in touch and exchange with colleagues living the Spryker spirit and never stop learning. We live and breathe innovation: Constant innovation is not only essential to our product but also the key to our DNA in all business areas. Choose between the newest hardware versions, e.g., Mac or Lenovo laptops, and work on the latest business models and technologies. We strive for excellence in everything we do, so help us by providing feedback and suggestions via regular internal pulse surveys.  HERD STATEMENT We are innovators, challengers, and active problem-solvers. We are empathic lateral thinkers and team players first. But above all, we are all different, and that is what makes our Spryker herd unique!  These various approaches, ideas, cultures, passions, and solutions make us strive to hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds globally. At Spryker, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, or disability status. Our Spryker herd welcomes all.  Spryker solely collaborates with selected agencies where terms and conditions are in place and does not accept unsolicited headhunter or agency sent resumes.  At Spryker, we are convinced that we are driven by true passion, and by embracing the team and supporting each other, our herd can manage any change in an adaptable manner. We love finding innovative solutions, take massive ownership, challenge each other and challenge the status quo.  Check out our Career Page (https://spryker.jobs.personio.de/) and our Website (https://spryker.com/en/career/) for more information.

description: Directs technical sales activities for customers or partners in assigned territory or accounts. When supporting the channel, aligns technical resources to support customer engagement with partners. Leads the technical team in the development of formal technical account plans and proposals. Applies consultative solution selling skills to conduct discovery activities, translate needs into complex technical solutions, articulate unique value and drive sales to technical closure for assigned opportunities. Delivers demos, trials, proofs-of-concepts and post-sales diagnostic support, or creates the appropriate infrastructure for demos, trials, and proofs-of-concepts to be delivered by partners. When supporting the channel, authors roadmap adoption and enablement plans based on partner business plan requirements. Serves as liaison to Avaya to ensure relevant customer/partner feedback on product and process improvements is considered. Typically requires a Bachelor degree (Engineering/Computer Science/Technology) and 8+ years related experience. Implementation and Operational background required.
