description: Description  What makes us Qlik  Qlik helps enterprises around the world move faster, work smarter, and lead the way forward with an end-to-end solution for getting value out of data. A Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader for 11 years in a row! Our platform is the only one on the market that allows for open-ended, curiosity-driven exploration, giving everyone – at any skill level – the ability to make real discoveries that lead to real outcomes and transformative changes.  We are a Values-Driven organization, operating over 100 countries with 45,000 customers around the world. If you think we are interesting, please read on – we may be looking for you!  The Partner Organisation  Qlik offers a fast paced, high-energy, innovative, global and team-oriented culture, with a flexible and exciting work environment, as well as plenty of opportunities for you to grow as a professional and as an individual. As the Inside Partner Sales Manager and team member of our rapidly growing international team, you will have significant impact on our company’s growth and success and you will be working with leading edge technology.  We focus on helping partners reach their full potential through strategic planning and execution to plan. Our mission is to inspire and empower our partners with simple tools that expedite the ability to gain the knowledge and skills needed to effectively position, demo, sell, implement and support Qlik solutions  Inside Partner Account Manager (iPAM)  The inside Partner Account Manager i(PAM) has overall responsibility for developing and expanding relationships with their assigned solution providers, to drive Qlik revenue, both resell and/or influence, across all market segments. The iPAM manages every aspect of the partner experience and relationship with Qlik across the customer lifecycle, spanning demand generation, land, adopt, expand and renew phases, referred to as QLAER. iPAM territories will comprise partners with differing levels of experience, capability and potential. This will drive tailored Qlik engagement approaches and strategies.  The iPAM co-ordinates where appropriate, the engagement between the partner and Qlik sales resources (e.g. NAMs, TAMs &B ISRs), to increase and drive sales opportunities. The iPAM leads an effective collaborative planning process with the partner, including formal business reviews to drive accountability and mutual performance.  A responsibility of the iPAM is to identify, recruit and on-board partners to ensure that there is sufficient coverage for business success. This happens in alignment with Partner Sales Leadership. The iPAM must drive the enablement of partners on Qlik products, processes and methodologies with the purpose of increasing the self-sufficiency of the partner. Working with Qlik Partner Marketing Managers (PMMs), the iPAM supports and motivates the partner to accelerate pipeline growth and consistently improve quality and conversion rates.  Key Responsibilities & Tasks Work closely with Partner Sales Management to drive and execute alliance strategy in country. Support 2nd tier focus partners to achieve quarterly and annual sales targets for Qlik solutions. Maintain and nurture reactive partners via regular partner communications, educate partner community on program/policy updates Drive collaboration between partner and Qlik sales teams. Build a sustainable pipeline with Partners with identified goals and actions; ensure visibility to partner pipeline. With Marketing – MDF planning and execution support for demand generation and pipeline build. Responsibility for partner recruitment, onboarding, activation and development to ensure sufficient and suitably qualified and focused partner coverage. Develop and execute partner education / enablement plan across sales, technology and marketing. Ensure partner attains and maintains necessary certification and competency levels. Initiate and conduct sales readiness and training events. Develop and execute collaborative Partner Business Plans (PBP) to achieve mutual goals. Conduct QBRs with 2nd tier focus partners to review performance and course correct as necessary. Identify, develop and drive solution offerings for key vertical and horizontal solutions. Ensure partners support end customers success and value realization to secure renewal and expansion. Protect the integrity of our customer experience by providing the highest level of customer service. Demonstrate a clear understanding of partner’s value drivers, economics and business models. Establish, maintain and orchestrate the Executive/Owner relationship with partner. Manage disruptions, escalate risks and coordinate resources in achievement of business goals, managing conflict where necessary. Own Qlik Partner Program alignment with partners. Understand and consistently communicate program structure and value proposition to drive program adoption. Competencies And Skills The iPAM needs to have a broad range of core skills and competences. These include: Planning, Negotiation, Influencing, Relationship Building, Resilience, Problem Solving, Cross Functional Collaboration, Presentation, Communication, Creativity, Project Management, Finance Must have an understanding of and the ability to position, alternative Partner business and deployment models including on perpetual & subscription & on premise & cloud based offerings. Thrives in fast paced and quickly changing environment Goal oriented and excellent work ethic Team player; adaptable & responsive. Experience & Qualifications 1 to 3 years in an equivalent position. Successful track record operating with partner or customer organizations. Proven experience in software (technology) solutions sales with, through and to Partners. Ability to influence functional groups to a shared vision. Will have worked successfully within a matrix management environment Will have worked within a high growth environment Ability to organize, prioritize, make decisions and work efficiently and effectively under a deadline Will have ideally worked within an environment of change therefore a flexible approach is key Fluency in English mandatory, an addition one or more regional ASEAN languages (most specifically Bahasa Indonesia) would be considered an advantage. Education  Bachelor’s Degree  Location/Mobility  Singapore – minimal travel will be required outside of geographic area of responsibility.  About Qlik Qlik Company Page – Who we are! Our Values at Qlik: Challenge, Take Responsibility, Move Fast, Teamwork for Results, Be Open and Straightforward Competitive Benefits package Flexible working environment Giving back is a part of our culture – we give you a day to change the world. In addition, we encourage our employees to participate in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs Learn about our Corporate Responsibility Program by visiting Qlik.org Check out our careers in R&D here. Check out our company page on Linkedin! Follow us on Instagram lifeatQlik and on Twitter @Qlik Check us out on Youtube! Qlik is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value the diversity of our workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected category or characteristic. If you need assistance due to a disability during the application and/or recruiting process, please contact us via the Accessibility Request Form  AGENCIES: Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: ABOUT KEF KEF is a 60-year-old UK-based company that has earned a reputation as the premier manufacturer of stunning, audiophile-quality audio solutions for modern home theatre, hi-fi, custom installation & personal use applications. KEF products are distributed around the world and have won awards and accoladed around the globe. KEF is part of the GP Industries Group with Headquarters in Hong Kong, PRC.  Marketing Manager – Regional Marketing & Business Development   Description The Marketing Manager) will develop regional marketing strategies (focusing on marketing communications and channel strategies) and collaborate with cluster managers and regional e-commerce team in the implementation of plans. In this senior capacity, the RMM will provide coaching and guidance for two Marketing Executives who are operating remotely. The position will also work closely with internal stakeholders such as corporate marketing, product management, sales and finance. This position requires strong communication, project management and planning skills. The ability to manage external agencies and collaborate with cross-cultural teams across the APMEA region.  Responsibilities: Engage with the global, regional marketing teams and digital, product team and sales team to ensure the support and execution of regional campaigns / sales enablement programs Foster relationships with partners and understand the business performance and potential in the respective markets to drive effective marketing strategies for business growth. Ensure understanding and consistency of global go-to-market messages and identity for both direct and indirect channels Leverage global marketing strategies, PR, media relations, social media and campaigns to drive market awareness in APMEA region Execute business development strategies for product lines through all-rounded support in sales management, merchandising, marketing, visual merchandising, retail interiors and event, etc.Coordinate with local teams on marketing material Assist in developing and implementing marketing strategies for branding, new product launches, campaigns and global events Deep understanding in Digital marketing such as SEO/SEM, customer journeys and email automation to drive and improve customer retention, sales and remarketing Act as a consultant and gatekeeper to work closely with assigned country sales offices on regional marketing planning, budgeting, implementation quality and product launches Work closely with internal stakeholders, as well as external agencies and suppliers Conduct regular analysis on sell through data, sales performance and assist in planning and managing the marketing budget to achieve optimal results Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications or relevant disciplines. Postgraduate degree is an advantage. At least 10-15 years of relevant marketing experience is essential. At least 3-5 years of digital marketing experience. Experience in consumer goods industry and regional roles are highly preferred Strong skills in project management, communication and presentation with sound understanding of marketing online and offline Proactive and independent professional with a positive mind-set with strong sense of commitment and ownership Good command of both spoken and written English and Chinese. Proficiency in any other Asian language is an advantage. Proficiency in Microsoft office apps, CRM and collaborative applications ie Salesforce and Asana.   Visit our website for more information: www.kef.com    We are an equal opportunities employer. Personal data collected will be treated as strictly confidential and used for recruitment purpose only.

description: Are you passionate about sustainability & fashion?  Style Theory is a Fashion-Technology company that is redefining Fashion Consumption. We believe that there is an inefficiency in the way we consume fashion in today's world and are on a mission to provide a smarter solution.  We are currently Southeast Asia's largest and fastest-growing Fashion startup. Our core businesses focus is on driving circular fashion, and includes Rental, Resale and Restoration across Apparel and Bags verticals. Today, we are focused on building more products to improve Fashion Consumption and driving these solutions across the region.  Responsibilities Of The Role Derive the seasonal OTB and inventory forecasts per rental and resale business targets. Closely monitor monthly inventory position against plan and be able to deliver insights into actionable messages Provide a clear overview of business while also leading deep analysis to investigate opportunities and challenges Work closely with the Merchandisers to manage product assortment strategies Deliver insights and recommendations to the Merchandisers to improve inventory health and performance Identify opportunities and lead projects that will achieve business targets and improve on current processes Develop, maintain and update weekly and monthly reporting tools Analyze weekly and monthly business performance to identify risks and opportunities Develop and manage KPI forecasts to achieve topline sales plans Partner with cross-functional teams (Growth, Content, Customer Experience, Research, etc.) to understand strategies to be factored into merchandise plans Closely manage product performance and proactively work with cross-functional partners to drive results Confidently identify growth opportunities and provide action plans Lead and initiate projects with the objectives of improving current processes and achieving company objectives Experience And Skills Needed Min 3 years of merchandise planning, demand forecasting, or relevant field, with strong OTB knowledge Singaporean or Permanent Resident is preferably Degree holder with exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills Strong team player, ready to collaborate and build with various stakeholders Structured communicator both verbally and written, able to package the results into digestible and actionable messages Excellent planning, organizational skills and strong attention to detail; deadline oriented Advanced forecasting and data modelling techniques Strategic thinker with an emphasis on operational and commercial excellence; customer-centric Flexible, approachable attitude with a comfort in working in a fast-paced environment and willingness to get to the core of an issue and go the extra mile An understanding of fashion and luxury is a bonus, especially from a multi-brand setting The ability to adapt quickly to a fast-paced start-up environment and to process new information on the go; ability to embrace ambiguity

description: PURPOSE OF JOB:   This competitive environment is rapidly changing and with that also its customer’s and consumer’s needs. Because of these developments, APBS is looking to recruit a Trade Marketing Manager, On trade. This person will be responsible for building our important brands in the key segments, creating a win-win situation for customers, consumers and APBS. The majority of the job focuses on creating value added propositions for our customers. Building partnerships through distribution, visibility and activation is what the job is all about. The incumbent shall create an integrated sales and marketing plan, driving positive results on sales, execution and category growth.  MAJOR ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:   As Trade Marketing Manager, Modern On trade, you will be part of the Trade Marketing team. This team works pre-dominantly close with Marketing and Sales. The incumbent is expected to initially build strategic & executional plans, with strong alignment amongst all stakeholders. Sales, marketing, trade marketing, customers, consumers, creative agencies, event partners, influencers, many different parties will be part of everyday business. You will report directly to the Senior Trade Marketing Manager.  Planning & Briefing 1.    Serve as a focal point for the creation of customer-focused channel marketing programs consistent with brand management’s overall strategies and approved trade budget 2.    Define, build and implement channel strategy, plans and programs with Brands and Sales based on consumers/shopper understanding, channel, brand and business priorities as well as category growth drivers. 3.    Identify brand opportunities by segment growth trends and consumption opportunities  Operations: Execution & Evaluation 4.    Manages all activities and brief the relevant teams to deliver desired results on time and within budget. 5.    Monitor the progress of the promotion and implementation on trade. 6.    Reviews the process and post evaluation of activities and creates new ways of working to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of future promotions. 7.    Measures and calculates ROI for the activity. 8.    Uses shopper insight and business strategy to deliver or develop the appropriate visibility strategy to consumer while meeting customer specifications. 9.    Drive successful internal and customer coordination and implementation of marketing materials, e.g. POS, merchandise, etc. across the Channels, through outstanding leverage execution and tracking of channel marketing activities.    EXPERIENCE:    Minimum 5 years of Trade Marketing or Sales management/marketing experience within the On Trade environment or consumer goods industry. Experience in analysis of business problems and developing solutions, and market segmentation and financial analysis required.   JOB RELATED KNOWLEDGE/ SPECIFIC SKILLS:  Trade Marketing or On Trade experience is an advantage. Strong knowledge of consumer and customer needs. Knows what’s hot and happening in current Singaporean Modern on-trade market. Experience in building long term commercial relations and able to create a win-win situation as well as demands for 50-50% partnership. Candidate should have (Trade) Marketing affinity: enjoys storytelling and is passionate for building brands and concepts.

Track record with selling at least $500,000 worth of digital services over your career. Very organized Extremely Meticulous Able to handle extremely challenging situations and the pressure of a high performance culture Have a previous track record with winning deals Have experience with growing business development in a service company Connections to SME networks a big bonus Experience with building and leading a high-performance sales team Attractive remuneration and bonuses will be tied to the performance of the company

companyName: Asia Pacific Breweries Singapore (Part of The HEINEKEN Company)
description: RM is a holistic approach to support Category Revenue Growth agenda in a competitive and profitable way. Holistic RM spreads across 5 pillars, Brand Strategic Pricing, Channel Pack Price Architecture, Mix Management, Promotional and Trade Terms Management.  Meanwhile, Data Driven Sales (DDS) is a new addition to the pillars and will be one of HEI top priorities for the coming years. This portion is critical in terms of quickly upscaling capabilities, putting data in the hands of key users and generating insights that are relevant and actionable.   To assist in conducting annual pricing review to identify potential RM benefits (based on RM analytics, market intelligence, etc) ·      Brand Portfolio Pricing & Pack-Price Architecture: Conduct annual brand pricing review based on market data analyses and/or conjoint consumer research to derive brand elasticity, review of actual price ladder vs brand equity, value chain margin development. Utilize AC Nielsen and individual retailers’ scanned sales data to assess promo depth of all SKUs, manage and provide recommendation to the sales team ·      Mix: Consolidate current mix performance, identify mix opportunities, and support prioritization of SKU mix based on profitability-potential analytics and track SKU mix allocation execution. Set SKU segmentation, PICOS standards and track execution ·      Promotions: Continuously track promo performance (uplift, ROI) using promo analytics. Help develop and maintain promo tool, evaluate promo effectiveness, highlight variance, and assist in the preparation of action plans ·      Discounts & Trade Terms: Build profit pool of outlets/retailers, quantify the trading terms spent and discounts claims by retailers. Identify profit pool opportunities & defensibility risks: translate into trade term guardrails. Provide recommendations to account teams on how to improve SMART conditionality of terms ·      Value Chain and Price Maintenance: Creation of price structures for new product innovations and review of base and trade margins for individual SKUs. Maintain master price file and inputs for price maintenance in collaboration with order-to-cash team  To assist in executing OpCo DDS agenda, with the aim of streamlining and improvement of data management: ·      Disciplined analytics (combining internal and external data, financial and non-financial) ·      Creation of relevant dashboards, linking of data sources, aggregation & consolidation, and utilize data analytics tools ie: PowerBI, Qlik etc to translate data into easily understandable charts ·      Utilize data to drive insights and create actionable insights that can be adopted by the relevant stakeholders on a weekly / monthly basis ·      Establish and form convincing arguments and story-telling to shape the revenue and growth agenda supported by data ·      Evaluating performance to ensure execution and continuous improvement through learnings. Improving and optimising data operations ·      Assist in the various workstreams and support other team members in the quest towards using data as the platform for decision making ·      Application of relevant revenue management techniques to help grow our revenue and assess campaign performance to optimize pricing strategy  REQUIREMENTS: 3-5 years of research & analytics experience, preferably in FMCG Technical expertise in statistics / operation research / economics. Working knowledge of programming tools ie: SQL good to have. Meanwhile, experience in developing and building PowerBI reports essential. Must have interest in this area Strong data analytical skills – ability to review complex, ambiguous/incomplete data, pulling out key insights, where they have been focussed on delivering outcomes with great attention to detail is essential. Intellectual curiosity and ability to search out facts without prior process/guidance and forming a structured thought process Passion for delivering result, take ownership and translating insights into concise practical plans for execution Strong interpersonal/communication skills to win support High level of cross functional cooperation: effectively partnering with communication, control, account & brand teams Logical thinker with ability to visually present analysis, key insights, facts & figures in a compelling way; tailor content to audience Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time and work under pressure, to deadlines and holds a passion to succeed Fast learner with the ability to think on your feet
industries: Food & Beverages

description: American Express is hiring an Assistant Marketing Manager for its Singapore Corporate Marketing team.  American Express Global Commercial Services (GCS) provides payment solutions to prospective customers through its suite of products with the guiding objective of bringing the right prospects, in the right way, at the right margins. The marketing team plays a critical role in this mission, helping create a pipeline of leads and opportunities via marketing campaigns run across channels.  This position is an excellent opportunity for a proactive and enthusiastic marketing professional to assist in driving acquisition growth for the Corporate Business. This is a very hands-on role, to be successful a candidate would need to possess knowledge of digital marketing along with strong project management and communication skills to ensure the timely launch of marketing campaigns working alongside the Marketing Manager.  Key Responsibilities Manage and lead campaign execution from start to finish to generate and nurture leads to develop a qualified sales pipeline. Support demand gen tactics, prospect list creation and report success metrics on salesforce.com. Manage and deliver on cross-sell campaigns end to end collaborating with different business units within American Express with an aim to drive acquisition. Manage marketing execution for digital close/application submission experience including paper & e-application. Build an integrated marketing mix including campaign development across digital marketing channels (email, PPC, social, display, nurturing and retargeting) to drive online traffic and leads. Design, develop, test, maintain, and support business reporting for marketing team. Exhibit business curiosity and can extract business insights supporting team in business reviews. Build and maintain marketing dashboards and reporting campaign performance effectively. Manage key agencies from initial briefing, creative concepting to execution. Oversee the creation of Marketing Assets and collaterals (Digital, OOH, Videos and Landing pages). Collaborate with internal stakeholders in the sales organization, virtual teams and other lines of businesses (legal, compliance, acquisition, account development, regional marketing). Forecast, manage and ensure maximum leverage of the marketing budget. Track invoices and reconcile marketing budget ensuring accuracy against the allocated budget. Establish and maintain an end-to-end project view, manage timelines and prioritise amongst competing projects to ultimately deliver programs that support the business needs. Qualifications University graduate in Business Management, Marketing or Communications. 5+ years of working experience in B2B marketing, with a mix of agency and client-side experience is preferred. Knowledge of digital marketing is a must. Strong project management and organisation skills, being meticulous, and having the ability to prioritise and manage multiple and competing demands in a timely and professional manner. Comfort with working with data, be able to analyze campaign performance working on diverse marketing platforms and manage budgets. Self-starter comfortable in a sales and partnership driven environment. Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.  American Express has been awarded Aon Hewitt Best Employer Singapore six times. Join us and you’ll soon see why.  As an employee, you can expect challenging work, with purpose. Be more than just your job. Be the voice of inspiration and transform the way the world does business for a living. By joining American Express, you are choosing to become a part of the dynamic team that is recognized as Singapore's "Best Employer 2018".  Why American Express?  There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.  American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.  We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.  Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.  The powerful backing of American Express.  Don’t make a difference without it.  Don’t live life without it.
industries: Financial Services

description: Company Description  For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose-built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,900 companies and have detected 100 Million threats/day.  We work in a fast-paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrives on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.  Job Description  We are looking for salespeople who are sharp, creative, and hardworking with an unwavering desire to be the best.  Traditional security companies are becoming less relevant as cloud adoption and digital transformation become the norm in every market industry and in every market segmentation. Zscaler has been a leader in Gartner’s MQ for 9 consecutive years and has helped shape the emerging SASE category (a true category creator). We are well-positioned to dominate this massively growing cloud security market.  The Zscaler Sales Culture  Winning Technology and Products -We offer the best technology and products for the cloud-first world. We pioneered cloud security and continue to grow our 20B + TAM by releasing new products every year.  Investing in People – A well-funded and world-class Sales Strategy and Enablement Team to help you succeed. The sales process, practical methods and training to help you ramp faster and close larger deals as companies accelerate their move to the cloud.  Supportive Leadership – An industry-leading leadership team with strong values, off the chart business acumen that will help you succeed quickly while providing mentorship and career growth.  Competitive; We Play to Win – We are playing in a Rapidly growing TAM and huge market mega-shifts that leads directly to Zscaler; tracking a growth path similar to Salesforce, Workday, & ServiceNow.  Regional Sales Manager, Large Enterprise - ASEAN  Reports to: Director, Regional Sales ASEAN/GCR  Location: Singapore  Your Path To Success You will take ownership of an assigned territory focused on a net new logo and upsell opportunities, while leveraging customer references such as the CIO of GE*, CTO of Siemens*, and EVP of Microsoft*. You will demonstrate expertise in building business cases that clearly show value and differentiation at all levels of your customer/prospect organizations. You will benefit from complementary and robust Sales Engineering, Solution Architecture, Value Consulting and Transformation Teams throughout your sales cycles. You will constantly generate pipeline using new techniques, tools, joint field marketing initiatives, trade shows, and top tier channel partners (VAR, SI & SP). You will win deals through world-class planning and preparation, as well as being consultative in your approach to solving real business problems. Customer References: GE:http://bit.ly/GEZenithLive  Siemens:http://bit.ly/SiemensZenithLive  Microsoft:http://bit.ly/MSZenithLive  Qualifications 5+ years of experience evangelizing enterprise technology, with a particular focus on SaaS and disruptive networking technologies. Security background a plus. Consistent track record of over-achievement; net new logo accomplishments; and keen understanding of how to leverage channel partnerships. Maniacal focus on excellence in Pipeline Generation & Opportunity Progression; including meticulous planning and preparation. Willingness to be coached and the discipline to work a proven sales process from beginning to end. Evidence of ‘team sales’ and the ability to use internal resources, partners, and team members to be successful. An ‘in the field’ mentality leading you to meet customers & prospects face to face wherever possible. Additionally, We Will Make Every Effort  In Return, we will invest in you; and in your customers. You will be supported by a world-class team made up of some of the most prominent names in security who turn our customers into advocates, and give you the skills you need to build a highly successful career. To provide you with the best support, learning, and access to expertise in the marketplace. To invest in your personal and professional growth and reward you accordingly with competitive pay, benefits, and equity. And, provide you with an environment that is defined by collaboration. Additional Information  Why Zscaler?  People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.  Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.  Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: Job Description  Rolls-Royce Solutions Asia (Formerly MTU Asia and an entity under the Rolls-Royce Power Systems business) is now hiring for an experience Service Sales Manager to join the team to manage sales of our service products to the Defence industry. This role will need someone with a strong focus on complex spare parts tenders / frame agreements, LTSA’s and Factory Rebuild as per the subapplication market demands.  At Rolls-Royce, we look beyond tomorrow. We continually pioneer integrated power and propulsion solutions to deliver cleaner, safer and more competitive power.  Our Power Systems business is a world-leader in large reciprocating engines, propulsion and distributed energy systems. We’re headquartered in Friedrichshafen in Southern Germany and employ around 11,000 people. Our product portfolio includes; MTU brand high-speed engines and propulsion systems; MTU Onsite Energy; Bergen Engines and L’Orange.  Key Accountabilities Regular frame contract work and negotiations (durations 1 to 5 years) with governmental customers (high complexity including topics e.g. such as Offset regulations, export regulations) Governmental tender participations mainly for spare parts (high complexity) Sales and Support for factory rebuild projects Definition and alignment of the sales strategy for the local markets Local ILS management and support Sales planning (forecasting and planning) for the Asian markets Qualifications University degree holder preferred (Engineering/Business/Logistics) Established working experience dealing with Governmental Defence business Experience in negotiating and review of contracts Excellent communication skills in customer facing role Keen to learn and excellent team player We offer excellent opportunities to develop, along with a competitive salary and exceptional benefits. These include bonus, employee support assistance and employee discounts.  Pioneer an ocean of power. Join us and you’ll develop your skills and expertise to the very highest levels, working in an international environment for a company known the world over for brilliance and innovation.  Beyond tomorrow  We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realize their full potential.  You can learn more about our global Diversity and Inclusion strategy here .  So that you can be your best at work and home, we’ll consider flexible working arrangements for everyone, in any role.  Rolls-Royce follows a merit-based employee recruitment process and does not charge/accept any payment/security deposit from candidates during the recruitment process. Candidates seeking employment with Rolls-Royce should be cautious of potentially fraudulent communications and offers from individuals and agencies purporting to be from, or acting on behalf of, Rolls-Royce.  Please refer to the Career section on the Rolls-Royce website to verify employment offers or vacancies. Rolls-Royce shall not be liable for any loss, damage or consequences that may arise from any communication or offer of employment not directly made by Rolls-Royce.  Rolls-Royce reserves the right to take legal action against any individuals or agencies acting on behalf of Rolls-Royce without authorisation.  Job CategorySalesPosting Date23 Sep 2021; 00:09

jobTitle: Senior Business Development Manager, Agency Business Development
description: Job Purpose  You will be responsible to achieve cluster business Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) by driving the sales force through effective management and prompt service support of cluster assigned.  The Job Achieve the cluster yearly KPIs and growth in new business premiums and manpower through the development and implementation of Company & Department business plans and initiatives Conduct regular meetings and communication sessions with cluster agency leaders and/ or potential producers with the intention to enhance their performance management, sales & recruitment results and business plans and ensure compliance of regulatory guidelines Raise productivity, motivate and influence top producers and planners in taking positive actions to achieve personal and agency objectives and goals Identify & develop future potential agency leaders and producers within the respective cluster Manage the operational requirements of the field force and ensure that they are given full and appropriate logistic support & problem solving assistance in running their agency business Ensure the agencies within the cluster comply with prevailing regulatory regulations and conduct their business in a professional and competent manner Develop and build a cordial and close working relationship with the various Profit Centers and Departments within the Company Maintain a conducive and productive cluster working environment Take accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and take appropriate steps to mitigate the risks Maintain awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company Highlight any potential concerns/ risks and proactively share best risk management practices Our Requirements Minimum Degree qualification from a recognized institution Project Management experience Proficiency in MS Office Applications (Excel, Word & PowerPoint) Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills Able to perform quantitative and qualitative evaluations Performance management driven Ability to carry oneself confidently Willing to learn and adaptable A team player High level of integrity, take accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork Take initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes About Great Eastern  Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner.  We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us.  We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions.  Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people’s lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management.  To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description: We’re looking for people who put their innovation work to advance our success – and their own. Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions.  In This Position, You Will Get To  What YOU WILL EXPERIENCE IN THIS POSITION: Develop the distribution channel for Enclosures across Singapore and Malaysia as a start, might involve more countries in the future and penetrate with existing channel so discipline deployment of nVent channel playbook. description: AI is poised to transform many industries in the world in the coming years. Sentient.io, with its AI & Data platform as well as its Solution Gallery of SaaS Solutions, wants to position itself as a key driver of business transformation.  We are at the start of an exciting growth journey. Sentient.io is a rapidly-growing, ambitious company that aims to democratize access to AI through an open platform that marries large, diverse and open data sets with deep, diverse AI algorithms that work out-of-the-box.  We are looking for team players in the Sales Team. We are hiring an Enterprise Sales Manager that is motivated and self-driven. We love people who are passionate and who like working in a fast-paced startup. Sentient.io operates out of Singapore and has business both in Singapore and Japan with multiple prominent clients in the market.  In order to support our fast-growing business development of our platform and services, we are looking to fill the position of an Enterprise Sales Manager  What you will be doing Develop Singapore as a sustainable market through business development, partnerships and enterprise sales Identifies customer pain points and astutely reads the triggers and underlying needs of each unique client. Furthermore, clarifies understanding by asking for examples and illustrations Helps customers in their buying process and clarifies the strategic benefits provided by Sentient.io solutions Works co-operatively, co-ordinate and leverage internal relationships and resources including but not limited to inside sales, technical presales, partner sales, executives and delivery teams. Demonstrates a deep understanding of the customers’ needs during conversations with the various stakeholders Directs the customer interfacing relationship and confidently speaks with Senior Management contacts, crafting the proposal, pricing and negotiating the deal to completion. What we are looking for 8+ years of overall industry experience with at least 5 years of strong and relevant enterprise sales selling experience in projects and SaaS solutions Knowledge and understanding in artificial intelligence solutions and its related industrial applications is preferred Ability to understand customer and industry business drivers and how that applies to the management of sales opportunities. Proven success in closing large enterprise software sales opportunities. Ruthless focus on results - pipeline generation & managing business pipeline and revenue forecasts. Good tertiary education in Business, Management, Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience. Experience to sell to both business and IT professionals Effervescent self-starter and team player, excellent communicator both written and verbally with the ability to present to and influence decision-makers at all levels For Senior Sales Manager, a solid 5 years and above enterprise solution sales experience with a strong ability in business development and market analysis to drive the business growth is required Advantageous if you have Experience working with international partners Experience working with a rapidly growing and changing company Experience working for a start-up where processes are still being built by the day

description: APAC Marketing Manager  The Marketing Manager (Asia Pacific) position is an operational and hands-on role and will support the overall APAC marketing strategy for Grabyo, based in our Singapore office.  This role will be suited to somebody who has generalist marketing experience across all areas of the marketing mix underpinned by an analytical and data-driven mindset.   Key activities for this role include: Work closely with the Global Head of Marketing, the global marketing team and the EVP for Asia Pacific; develop and execute multi-channel marketing campaigns to enable lead generation and scalable growth to support commercial priorities for the APAC region Adopt a data-driven approach to all campaigns and be responsible for reporting on regional marketing performance across the funnel including IMPs, CTRs CPL, website conversions, prospects, lead scoring and MQLs Support the pre-sales team with outbound activity and report on results  Seek new partnerships, events and sponsorships and develop long-term relationships with relevant industry publications, online trade media and event organisers to help Increase brand exposure Analyse the results and effectiveness of all sponsor, partner, event and digital campaigns to deliver actionable insights and recommendations Develop event and partner marketing campaigns (where required), inclusive of promotion and follow up Maintain effective segmentation and brand messaging for APAC sales campaigns, collateral and events. Ensure brand consistency across all channels. Collaborate with the global content team and digital marketing Manager (based in London) to create assets for lead generation and nurturing prospects through the lead lifecycle Review and optimise the design and content of all online assets including the company website and social media pages Ensure marketing efforts adhere to agreed timelines and managing expectations with various stakeholders Contribute to or assist the development of content, working closely with the Head of Content (based in London). This role is focused on APAC marketing management and, where required, supporting the global marketing team of which this person will be part of  Education & Experience  3-5 years experience in marketing with ideally a degree in Marketing Certified or expert I'd knowledge of automation and CRM platforms, ideally Salesforce and PardotExperience in using tools such as Google Analytics, AdWords Strong understanding of the digital video and/or broadcast markets Driven and hungry, ability to show creative thought and application to new technologies Structured, methodical and detail oriented Self-starter and ability to self-manage towards goals Results focussed with ability to deliver key projects both internally and for customers Ability to work autonomously as well as being a team player Strong communication skills (written and verbal) with exceptional design and presentation skills Committed, proactive, and resourceful. Can be counted on to get the job done on time  Fast learner, eager to deepen knowledge and understanding of Grabyo’s business operations  Due to Covid-19 challenges only candidates based in Singapore will be considered at this time. Thank you.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: ViSenze is a fast-growing, global Retail AI solution provider trusted by the world’s leading brands and 900+ retailers globally with almost a decade of experience in AI and Computer Vision.  To help us build upon our success, we seek a dynamic, driven, and results-orientated Field Marketing Manager (Global), to join our team. You will be responsible for driving demand and building the brand by implementing and executing the GTM (Go-To-Market) /marketing strategy and managing tactics focused on meeting the revenue targets across APJ, EMEA, and North & Latin America regions. The Field Marketing Manager will be part of the global marketing team and report to the Global Head of Marketing.  Responsibilities Increase revenue through demand generation and branding targeted at prospects and customers Develop a revenue centric marketing plan focused on the following segments Prospect marketing (campaigns, lead generation, opportunity management, etc.) Customer marketing (renewals, cross-sell and upsell tracking, case studies, etc.) Partner marketing (strategic and tactical support, co-marketing campaigns, MDF, etc.) Develop off/online content-based demand generation campaigns Manage the campaigns schedule (frequency and recency) Track metrics and adapt (closed-loop marketing) Efficient and effective budget management Working with the sales teams and channel partners  Requirements A skilled marketing professional with 6+ years of relevant experience Experience in Enterprise B2B software or services marketing Strong understanding of marketing planning, branding, and demand generation (including prospect marketing, customer marketing, channel marketing, etc.) Strong leadership potential and interpersonal skills (works well with others) Self-motivated, disciplined, proactive, independent, and likes to work in cross-cultural teams Strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to understand business and technology messaging Campaign management, budget, and scheduling experience Broad understanding and experience in various marketing and CRM tools like Hubspot, Salesforce, etc…  About Us: ViSenze is a fast-growing, global Retail AI platform provider. Our AI solutions redefine how Retailers, Brands, and Marketplaces improve their businesses, both on the digital shop floor and behind the scenes. We optimize product discoverability, provide deep catalog intelligence, and drive contextually relevant ads that are proven to shorten the conversion path for consumers both online and in-store.   Today, ViSenze is acknowledged by Interbrand, CBInsights, VentureBeat, Gartner, and Forrester. Also ranked as top 10 tech companies in 2019 by Glassdoor in Singapore and winner of The Best Tech Company to Work For in 2019. ViSenze offers the opportunity to join a thriving, fast-paced, multi-cultural environment and be part of a growth journey. To learn why the world’s top brands and retailers trust ViSenze, visit www.visenze.com

jobTitle: VP, Regional Business Development, Private Bank
description: About UOB  United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.  Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.  About The Department  The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.  Personal Financial Services  We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.  Job Responsibilities  We are seeking for a Regional Business Development Manager (BDM) to support Private Bank’s (PB) regional expansion and outreach efforts in target markets within Asia. The BDM is responsible to embed PB’s value proposition and be the regional acquisition lead to identify new business opportunities. The BDM will be involved in strategic and tactical planning and positioning of PB value proposition and is the ‘go-to’ person for all PB related matters for internal and external stakeholders.  Specific Responsibilities Responsible to drive new business development activities and to create business and sales marketing plan for countries of coverage to achieve business objectives. Perform market research and benchmarking, plan prospecting activities and establish referral SOPs. Manage key stakeholders in markets and deepen relationships with potential clients and internal stakeholders. Create and maintain acquisition pipelines and contact plan for each prospect. Perform acquisition forecast and analysis of leads pipelines in accordance to requirement. Plan regular engagement sessions to train / update in-country teams on PB updates and upskill them with required knowledge to facilitate flow of business to PB. Work with Group Marketing to raise PB brand awareness in markets of coverage by rolling out curated and targeted activities that are fit for purpose. Take charge of all BD activities rollout, eDMs and collaterals, tracking of post activities ROIs and feedback. Job Requirements  Who are we looking for? Resourceful self-starter with strong interpersonal and networking skills. An advocate for work efficiency to make things simpler, faster and better. Ability to work independently, prioritise workload and execute in accordance to plan. Strategic thinker and able to see the bigger picture in order to improve the business. Analytical mindset to structure business plans and tenacity to overcome challenges. Exceptional oral and written communication skills to articulate clearly. Willingness to travel (20% of time). Education / Experience Requirements A successful candidate must possess a Bachelor’s degree in finance, marketing, business management or any business-related fields. A least 5 years of business development experience within high net worth sales / acquisition space and experience in planning and execution of marketing plans. Experience working in a Private Banking environment preferred. Be a part of UOB Family  UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.  Apply now and make a difference.
industries: Banking and Financial Services

description: Company Profile DSTNCT is an insights-driven, integrated marketing agency with deep capabilities in youth. The agency has worked with both brands and governmental agencies alike, to create effective marketing and branding campaigns on both local and regional scale. #AgencyForTheNextGen DSTNCT hopes to establish itself as a homegrown brand, exporting products, services and culture – sparking positive disruption everywhere we go.  What we look for in our people Proactive attitude, driven, opinionated and resilience. These are the attributes that we look out for in our people. We want our people to have a proactive attitude, taking control and making things happen rather than just adjusting to a situation and waiting for things to happen. We want our people to be driven and to go above and beyond. To be self-motivated when things get tough. We want our people to be outspoken and have their own opinions when it comes to brainstorming or group discussions. We don’t want you to be a Yes man. We want our people to be resilient. To be able to bounce back from adversity and to be able to manage a stressful situation.  Purpose of the Role We are looking for an experienced Account Manager to lead and manage the Account Management team. He needs to have a strong understanding of the advertising/marketing landscape and be passionate about the job. While leading the Account Management team, he is also required to manage multiple clients and oversee the ongoing projects in the agency.  Responsibilities Client Relationships: You are required to be client facing, receiving new briefs and building a strong relationship with the client. You are also required to grow the account, securing bigger budgets and retain the account year on year. Effective management of client expectations is essential; support your teams to ensure the timely and accurate delivery of all aspects of campaign management, identifying improvements to ways of working where required. Team Management: You will have to manage the Account Management team, grooming and nurturing the team to be better leaders of their own which include the setting of personal objectives and performance reviews. A weekly work-in-progress check-in is required to be carried out in the team. Delegation of the appropriate amount of task to ensure acceptable workload. Identifying opportunities for your executives to take ownership of task or projects (under your supervision) to aid his development. Giving the executives adequate room for them to grow within their roles and eventually beyond. Project Management: You are to handle all aspect of client campaigns from planning to delivery. You are also required to be the quality control officer, ensuring that all content that goes out is vetted through and to meet the standards of the Agency. Integration of Teams: You will be in contact with the Management, Creative and Finance Team on a weekly basis. You are also required to respond to information request from the Management and the Account Directors. Work closely with the Managing Director and Business Director to deliver new business RFPs and pitches as required. Processes: You are to ensure that processes are tightly managed and that the Account Management team follows these processes. Financial Management: You are required to set and manage campaign budgets. To enforce on the Account Management team that they have to strictly follow the budgets that are set aside for every campaigns/projects that they are working on. To assist with financial reporting and smooth running of the finance function. Be responsible for the accurate recording and billing of client media spend and fees. Follow the defined processes and timelines to ensure you have a clear view of revenue performance. Ensuring your teams and the Finance department are completing billing and reconciliation of campaign spend / income in a timely and accurate manner so suppliers are paid on time, and clients are invoiced on time.  Requirements Minimum 3-4 years’ agency side experience in a digital strategy and/or execution role. Experience managing a team to deliver best in class client campaigns. Experience managing senior client relationships. Excellent organisational skills - Efficient and great project management skills. Pro-active attitude and determined - Willing to take on any challenge and task assigned to you. An eye for details. Strategic thinker. The ability to work under pressure and assimilate large quantities of information quickly, while maintaining attention to detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Articulate presenter, with the ability to present to senior clients and internal agency teams, comfortable with showing what data means and how we can take action based upon it. Commitment to delivering first-class work every time, and never leave a quality issue unchecked. Highly commercial - selling value, negotiation, client relationship management skills, how to be a trusted business advisor  The Company reserves the right to vary, modify, add or remove any item into the Job Description by giving written notice to you.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: The Enterprise Account Manager will be primarily responsible to sell the entire suite of Imperva solutions (Application and Data Security) by interacting with accounts in the assigned territory region that are prospects or leads generated from the ISR and Channel resources. You will leverage your key existing relationships and those of the greater Imperva organization, at the CIO level, to work collaboratively to solve specific use case situations within the customer’s organization. Additionally, you will work alongside our Channel Partners, including top System Integrators, to proactively grow Imperva’s reach within those existing accounts and to establish Imperva as the dominant provider of Security Solutions within prospect accounts.    Responsibilities:  Works in tandem with the Inside Sales Organization and Sales Engineers to inform the customer/prospect and demonstrate Imperva’s capabilities Drive opportunities at the strategic and tactical level in a Primarily Hunter Role Develops and maintains strong relationships with key CXO client decision-makers, including maintaining a sales strategy based on customer’s requirements. Directs customer service improvement activities Keeps informed on new products, services, and other general information of interest to customers, through successful completion of Imperva Sales Training and self-study Stays informed of customer business opportunities, current conditions, future prospects, active measurements, and competitive issues. Regularly briefs Imperva management on status, prospects, and current needs of top customers Responsible for securing new business, additional orders and professional services revenue Keeps records and generates reports on all phases of activities, including Account Plans, Win Plans, and forecasts Participates in varied sales activities requiring perseverance, preparation, ingenuity, and responsibility Display strong time management skills Understand and manage all phases of the sales cycle; ability to handle technical/product inquiries without a SE when needed Accurately forecasts all territory business utilizing Salesforce.com Extensive travel when required  Qualifications:   Demonstrated ongoing success as Strategic Account Director OR Regional Sales Director History of Success in Small and Large Environments and Building Markets Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, Management, Marketing (or related field) or equivalent experience Dynamic, high energy sales professional with a history of years of successful experience in direct sales, high-level, executive selling of long-cycle products. Experience selling Enterprise Level Solutions in the SaaS or Applications Markets Willingness to drive deals through leads coming from ISR and Channel by operating in a dynamic and ever-changing environment Demonstrated ability to exceed quarterly and yearly quota Strong computer, written and interpersonal communications skills Experience with Salesforce.com Our Company Imperva is the cybersecurity leader whose mission is to help organizations protect their data and all paths to it. Customers around the world trust Imperva to protect their applications, data and websites from cyber-attacks. With an integrated approach combining edge, application security and data security, Imperva protects companies through all stages of their digital journey. Imperva Research Labs and our global intelligence community enable Imperva to stay ahead of the threat landscape and seamlessly integrate the latest security, privacy and compliance expertise into our solutions. Learn more on the Imperva website or company blog, and follow Imperva on LinkedIn and Twitter     Rewards  Imperva offers a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, medical, flexible time off and more. It’s an exciting time to work in the security space. Check out our products and services at www.imperva.com and career opportunities at www.imperva.com/careers.  Imperva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, protected veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Summary: The primary objective of the Client Manager: Key Accounts is to manage and grow relationships to drive expansion and renewals across all solution areas within key accounts in segments 2 and 3. They are required to realize revenue and margin targets and maximize sales opportunities through connecting client needs with NTT(Ltd) offerings and solutions..  Ideally, Key Client Managers are vertically structured, and their portfolio of accounts are in one or adjacent verticals.  Responsible for selling the company’s products or services to and maintaining relationships with existing accounts.  Job Description: Primary Segment Focus Existing clients Sales Process Involvement Land, Adopt, Expand and Renew Client Load Existing: 5 – 15 Prospect: 0 Sales Time Allocation Pre-sales: 20% Engaged selling time: 30% Sales completion: 30% Sales Facilitation: 20% Solution Focus Primary: Partnership and Foundational All solution areas Sales Strategy with Buyers & Products Existing: Retention (current products) and Penetration (new/different products)  Key Roles and Responsibilities: Take ownership of a range of larger and more strategic clients by passionately advocating the client requirement, whilst keeping sight of the need to increase revenue and improve margins for NTT(Ltd). Realise revenue and margin targets and maximise sales opportunities through connecting client needs with NTT offerings and solutions Minimise churn and maximise retention as well as uncover sales opportunities in assigned accounts. Re-evaluate progress against revenue/profit goals monthly and develop best/worst case scenarios for input into a monthly financial plan. Responsible for driving client satisfaction throughout the entire lifecycle of the clients’ buying process, by taking ownership for the commercial agreement for each client. Approaches the management of his/her account in a systematic way by identifying the strategy they will use to develop and grow the account profitably. Generate demand by assisting clients to identify current needs and articulating how NTT (Ltd) can add value through its services and solutions. Build enduring relationships and display an understanding of the client industry, business environment and strategy to identify current and future opportunities for NTT (Ltd). Effectively articulate how NTT can add value through our services and solutions Influence and work closely with vendors to achieve required results. Use NTT (Ltd)’s sales tools and methodology to effectively manage territory, accounts, opportunities, pipelines and forecast. Develop open and effective channels of communication in with each client within the assigned account. Encourage revenue growth by inspiring clients to additional services. Become the reliable point of contact for clients that is required to establish a strong business relationship. Drive to achieve revenue and margin targets and exploit opportunities, whilst displaying notable client service orientation. Implement and/or align governance and compliance policies in own practice area to identify and manage risk exposure liability. Monitor and control financial governance and compliance to ensure the effective management of financial cost. Take ownership of key clients within the assigned segment.  Knowledge, Skills and Attributes: Sales business acumen - The skills supporting successful selling through organizational and business outcome mindset. Success will require focusing on planning, leveraging tools and data, and concentrating on NTT Ltd business requirements.  Developing the skills to understand your client’s business (including commercial and financial aspects) in order to bring value to them from NTT’s portfolio of services. Sales client engagement and management - The skills used to effectively manage and analyze the client throughout the client lifecycle, with the goal of improving client relationships and driving sales growth. Success will require detailed understanding of client needs, effective sales planning, and building trust, all while managing to client expectations. Developing the skills required to know your client, building effective & lasting relationships with them and to be seen as a trusted advisor. Sales solution skills - The knowledge of NTT Ltd’s offerings, client applications, use cases and market trends and the skill to apply them to individual client and prospect situations that positions the sales team member as an expert client advisor. Success will require the ability to link NTT Ltd offerings, including high-value services to specific client and prospect needs and outcomes. Sales pursuit - The skills and knowledge that enable a sales team member to create success by identifying and advancing opportunities at assigned prospects and clients. Success will require both individual ownership as well as accountability for coordinating internal and external resources in order to close sales opportunities.  Academic Qualifications and Certifications: Relevant Degree or Advanced Diploma Post-graduate qualification would be advantageous Relevant vendor certifications  Required Experience: Solid experience in a similar role in a similar environment Proven experience in a sales environment and/or customer service role Proven sales and client engagement experience coupled with a good understanding of business, sourcing and technology market Proven experience negotiating with clients and vendors Solid experience with business to business and business to consumer sales techniques Demonstrable experience working as part of a sales team in a fast-paced environment Good experience analysing commercial information

description: At Allpress, we truly value how important our people are; they make us great at what we do and make working at Allpress something quite special. We’re a team of dedicated people who care about each other and our customers and believe in what we do. Our dedication to adding value in our community beyond a great cup of coffee is why we get out of bed. It’s all about the people and the genuine connections we make.  Over a 30-year period, Allpress Espresso has developed global operations in New Zealand, Australia, UK, Singapore & Japan and became a globally trusted brand that has an uncompromising focus on people, flavour, and innovation.  The search is on for a natural and authentic leader to grow our growing business in Singapore. We’re looking for someone who aligns with our brand and values, can inspire and motivate, and who gets their kicks from seeing people do well.  Reporting directly to the General Manager in Australia, the Singapore Regional Manager is responsible for: Coaching and developing a team of four to achieve our operational and strategic goals. Leading and developing all operations in Singapore: production, customer service, sales, technical, training and the café. Leading all sales activity to achieve growth and build sustainable long-term customer relationships. Analysing regional market trends and creating sales plans in line with business objectives. Maintaining and growing the Allpress brand in Singapore. Planning and execution of strategic growth projects in conjunction with other regional managers in Australia and the GM. The Right Person For This Role Will Have senior management experience in a customer-focused business. Have experience as a regional sales manager, area manager or senior sales role, with the ability to measure and analyse KPIs and ROIs. Know how to build a brand and understand how important it is to us and our ongoing success. Have a strong track record of commercial delivery at an executive level, with full P&L accountability. Be a great people person who understands that building unique relationships with our customers, consumers, and team is vitally important. Have an inspiring leadership style with a commitment to building highly engaged teams. Demonstrate both strategic and operational capability to grow a business. Understand the importance of a positive culture. Be able to see the big picture whilst being across the finer details too. Be articulate and effective in written and verbal communication to people at all levels of the company. Have strong organisational skills with the ability to identify and address problems promptly. Have a full, clean driving license. Have a love for the coffee & food industry and a good eye for growing a successful hospitality business. A BSc degree in Sales, Business Administration or relevant field is favourable. If you think that this sounds like you, send your application to Bojana by following the steps in this link. Please make sure that you include a personalised cover letter explaining why you would like to lead our team.

description: Singapore Account Manager, GN Audio  Jabra is a leader in engineering communications, sound and video solutions – innovating to empower both consumers and businesses. Proudly part of the GN Group, we are committed to letting people hear more, do more, and be more than they ever thought possible.  Join us at GN – home of Jabra – where we make life sound better  Are you a game changer? Do you have what it takes to cultivate long term relationships in enterprise sales that lead to big deals?  Maybe you're looking for a new challenge where the relationships count as much as the technology, and you enjoy the thrill of the chase.  We're looking for a Singapore Account Manager to be based in Singapore to drive sales to specific named accounts and local customers  An ideal candidate would  • Have a demonstrated track record of at least 3 years' experience selling technology to MNCs and/or major accounts; • Have the business acumen to identify opportunities and differentiate himself from competitors. • Communicate effectively with senior level of different nationalities, at client and partner level. • Be a team player, contributing individually and also part of a close-knitted team. • Be comfortable to present and provide product demos to wide demographics of audiences.  The responsibilities of this role would be to  • Achieve revenue targets for the set of assigned accounts; • Widen and deepen existing senior level relationships and create new ones where none yet exist; • Work with the current existing channel or if needed identify new channel partners to work with; • Participate as a member of the Jabra Singapore sales team for the Enterprise accounts; • Support the wider team on regional and global projects; • Participate in the standard set of reporting and back office work that makes modern technology companies function.   Would you like to know more? To apply, use the ‘APPLY’ link. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.
