description: Location: Singapore, Indonesia or Vietnam  About Antler Antler (www.antler.co) is a global venture capital firm enabling and investing in the world's most exceptional people building the defining companies of tomorrow. Through our regional HQs across most major startup ecosystems (New York, London, Berlin, Bangalore, Singapore, Sydney and others), we are changing the way VC investments are made at scale globally. To date, we have helped build and invested in more than 350 companies across technologies and industries such as AI, robotics, drones, fintech, proptech and healthtech. Every year, we receive more than 55,000 applications from experienced entrepreneurs and teams that want to build their next company with Antler.   Over the next decade, we will build more than 3,000 new technology companies, contribute strongly to job growth, global GDP, and the UN SDGs, while working hard to deliver great returns. We believe anyone with the right talent, drive, and ambition can change the world, and we have supported founders from more than 70 nationalities and from all socioeconomic backgrounds. 40% of our portfolio companies have a female co-founder, and 80% of these companies have a female CEO.   The Antler team is very excited about working with you to build Antler into the preeminent platform for early-stage innovation in SEA and across the globe.  About the role A big part of Antler evolves around creating the best possible environment for talented entrepreneurs to scale their ideas. Collaboration with leading corporates and technology companies form strong opportunities for startups to scale faster and better. We also have the opportunity to help educate and inspire large corporates to get more involved with early-stage innovation.  Core responsibilities  In this role, you will work on engaging leading corporates and technology companies in Antler’s partnership offerings across Southeast Asia, utilizing our presence and expertise across markets such as Singapore, Indonesia and Vietnam. You will focus on originating value-adding relationships that are scalable across the region, through:   Building and maintaining long-term partnerships with corporations and governments across the broader Southeast Asian ecosystem Driving the development of different Partnership offerings and engagement models that are attractive for corporates and public entities and simultaneously adds value to the Antler platform Identifying key areas across the Antler platform that can be leveraged as a knowledge base and used to give insight and learnings back to our partners  Core attributes Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Experience with selling to technology companies and corporates, with strong results from previous roles Experience with creating partnerships between companies for mutual benefit Accomplished and structured problem-solver Independent, used to thinking outside the box  Comfortable with working with stakeholders across Southeast Asia and with being part of a result-driven culture A genuine passion for entrepreneurship and inspired by helping the world develop and support more change-makers and innovators  The Antler Proposition Create a legacy and have a large impact: be part of a platform that helps build and invests in hundreds of disruptive companies every year An opportunity to greatly impact the direction of Antler across geographies A competitive salary, with performance based upside incentives
industries: Venture Capital & Private Equity

description: Description  The Deals team is seeking a highly customer-centric and motivated individual to help manage the processes that position deals to Amazon customers. You will have the opportunity to manage the day-to-day programs that ensure Amazon is providing the best customer experience possible when it comes to how our customers interact with deals. Ideal candidates will have a passion for continuously raising the bar and challenging the status quo.  Main Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To  As the Deals and merchandising manager, you will own the end-to-end implementation process of the promotions that Sellers run in marketplaces worldwide. Work across multiple internal Deal and promotions teams, including our international partners, building relationships and gathering input to drive alignment. Collaborate with program owners, build effective and efficient application process to source high quality deals. Develop and track key performance metrics using Excel, SQL, and other internal Amazon systems. Identify opportunities to improve processes, including driving automation, and increasing overall team efficiencies Understand local Sellers’ business needs, develop clear Seller communication materials that help educate and clarify Amazon Promotions policies and rules. Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner to leadership both verbally and in writing. Create regular and timely program update, define and track performance metrics, and drive operational excellence. Excel in a working culture where accountability, transparency, and collaboration are the norm and where rapid deep dives into data and financial performance is a standard operating practice. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Basic Qualifications Master’s degree is preferred 5+ year experience working in sales excellence, operation, or business program management role Experience working with partners and managing cross-functional projects Highly organized, ability to complete a high volume of tasks and projects with little to no guidance and tight deadlines Experience analyzing data and metrics, delivering business insights, and proposing recommendations Fluent in English Preferred Qualifications Ability to independently own and manage a strategic program by defining and executing on key deliverables and outcomes Demonstrated skill at building relationships and an ability to influence others Demonstrated business judgment as well as ability to think creatively, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve, scope business requirements and prioritization. Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills 3+ years of progressive responsibility in program or project management High threshold for working in an ambiguous, fast paced environment  Company - Amazon Asia-Pacific Holdings  Job ID: A1724223

description: Want to build a dynamic Cartier commercial roadmap with an amazing team? Join us NOW!!!  HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?  Reporting to SG Sales Director, you will assist in the business development of wholesale network through daily commercial activities, cultivating effective business relationship, network performance analysis and markets intelligence. Overseeing all aspects of client policies, objectives and projects. Acts as interface with all connected departments to guarantee clients’ satisfaction.  COMMERCIAL PERFORMANCE  Formulates and define sales strategies, analyzing trends and performances Forecasting and setting monthly/ annual sell-in and sell-out Achieves sales and sell-out objectives Maximize sell-out, ensuring SOSI balance Develop high-end business through in-store and event opportunities  NETWORK MANAGEMENT  Commercial Strategy Implementation Share Maison vision and strategy with external sales team & ambassadors, and ensure its implementation across the whole network Participate actively and monitoring the progress of commercial action plans Develop & implement local commercial actions to improve performances of all partners (auto-replenishment/assortment, incentive schemes) Build sustainable and mutually engaging relationships with partners and POS, conducting regular effective sales visits Negotiation of commercial developments with partners (openings, closures, renovations and digital presence) Collaborate transversally with Operations team to ensure accurate allocation and implementation stock with timely deliveries Manage in a timely manner all product inquiries, customer firm orders, lead time etc..  PROJECTS  Execute and follow through international commercial projects/ actions Responsible for Network Planning updates and regular follow-up (partners, Store Planning team, and HQ). Work closely and leverage relevant expertise from related departments (CRM, Marcom, VM, Operations etc….)  REPORTING & ANALYTICS MANAGEMENT  In charge of all weekly, monthly, yearly internal reports & comments for HQ submissions Regular checks to ensure partners daily and monthly reports & sellout are timely declared Regularly prepare & update presentations for management market visits and/or business reviews You will also require to be stay updated with latest news, monitor and keeping track of competition activities.  HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?  You have a clear passion in providing service excellence with a strong background in related roles Team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills Result oriented, possessing project management skills, together with an agile mindset Self-starter with a proactive approach Strong analytical and organization skills Proficient in Microsoft suite  HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?  A great opportunity to contribute to the Commercial landscape of Cartier within an diversified environment  Career development opportunities within Cartier and the Richemont Group to help you develop and take your career to the next level  Your Journey With Us  After being shortlisted, you will meet the Talent Manager to get to know YOU  You will then meet with our HRBP, SG Sales Director, Commercial Director and Managing Director to assess your fit to this role and give you a preview as well an overview of the team dynamics and company culture  If you are the successful candidate, discover and immerse yourself in the world of the Maison

description: As the CRM Manager for Lifecycle Programmes, you will be in charge of building and managing marketing programs that cut across all aspects of the customer’s lifecycle journey - all the way from welcoming a new-to-platform user, to building them up to become loyal super-customer. You will work across creative and data-driven teams to plan, develop, and orchestrate campaigns across all customer communication channels (i.e. Email, Mobile Push Notifications, SMS).  In this role, you will also work with cutting-edge Marketing Technology platforms to push the boundaries of data-driven customer communications. A regular day-to-day will include building and testing different content ideas, customer segments, personalisation formats, and optimising campaigns to achieve a seamless customer experience for FairPrice customers and meet business objectives.  Key Responsibilities Adopt a customer-first mindset, chart out the different areas of the customer journey, and develop campaign flows to nudge users from one touchpoint to the next Conceptualise content ideas and work closely with creative and Martech teams to actualise them into automated customer journeys and campaigns on Salesforce Marketing Cloud Take ownership to plan, setup, and launch daily campaigns across all CRM touchpoints (E.g. Email, Mobile App Push Notifications, SMS channels) Understand commercial business objectives and work with data teams to conduct actionable analyses to uncover opportunities and gaps in the user lifecycle, and identify new areas to grow the Lifecycle campaign portfolio Track, measure, and report on the performance of these customer communications, design and conduct A/B tests for iterative optimisation and improvement (E.g. campaign triggers, subject lines, sales copy, send timing and frequency) Work closely with technical stakeholders to develop mastery of our CRM platforms in order to constantly experiment and push the boundaries of our customer communications  Key Competencies Strong willingness to learn and grow independently  Strong interest in being at the forefront of e-commerce, marketing, and technology  Excellent communication skills  Diligent in execution and able to think critically  Able to handle data and relate them to qualitative aspects of work  Proficiency in HTML, Excel, SQL is a plus Prior experience in ecommerce is a plus Prior experience in Marketing Cloud platforms (i.e. salesforce, oracle) is a plus  What we offer  Be a part of a high performance, highly professional & entrepreneurial team  Witness cutting edge E-commerce in a leading homegrown brand, and play a part in being the driving force behind our success  Work with experienced, motivated and talented colleagues from all over the world  Opportunity to see your inputs and initiatives take flight to drive real business impact   Other Information Working Location: NTUC FairPrice Hub, 1 Joo Koon Circle

description: At Razer, you will be at the forefront of the most exciting industry in the world—video games, undertaking the greatest mission of all: bringing gamers closer to the games they love. With fifteen offices and three R&D labs worldwide, you will be part of a global team that transcends time zones and geographical boundaries. You get to enjoy working in an environment that values transparency and collaborative effort. Most importantly, both work and play are equally important to us.  The Channel Performance & Marketing Manager is responsible for driving the global strategy and marketing programs to improve revenue growth through channel partners, including resellers, payment channels, and direct carrier billing partners. In this role, formulating channel partner strategic marketing plans which include value proposition, messaging, lead generation, along with channel partner sales enablement and management of the Market Development Fund (MDF) is a must.   This role will require you to be creative, strategic, and organized as you are expected to work across multiple cross functional teams including business development/sales, operations, product and engineering. This position reports to the Senior Manager, Global Sales & Ops, and will play a key role in establishing our Channel Partners and Reseller Program contributing to the overall success of Razer Gold.  Responsibilities Work closely with stakeholders across Razer Gold global departments and country teams to develop a robust Global Channel Marketing strategy, including segmentation, value proposition, and GTM plans Develop a roadmap and coordinate strategic channel marketing or promotion activities through country teams with their local retailers/distributors/payment channel partners  Drive co-marketing opportunities with new channels in new markets Define the SOP and deliver strategies to enable the business to leverage channels more efficiently to ensure strong adoption of Razer Gold globally Work with various partners in our ecosystem to establish strategic co-marketing programs by setting clear goals, tracking success against plan, driving awareness, and generating leads Own and drive Reseller Recruitment and Brand Awareness campaigns globally Track performance of sales promotional activities carried out with retailers/distributors/ payment channel partners across all regions on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis to improve efficiency and results Provide recommendations base on analysis of results Provide regional input into campaigns and materials, specifically for channel partners, for inclusion in the Partner Marketing Centre and Reseller Distribution Hub Work collaboratively with B2B Marketing department in devising the best communication approach to deliver our business margin Work with B2B marketing department and local teams to ensure marketing collaterals and materials provided to or developed by channel partners are up to date and compliant with Razer Gold’s branding guidelines.  Support B2B Marketing department on managing and tracking MDF and co-marketing budgets across all regions  Devise guidelines for best practice within channel partner management and reseller partner program Participate and present in Sales and marketing channel partner meetings, stand-ups and QBRs, including Executive Leadership Meetings  Requirements 5+ years of experience in strategic planning in a B2B reseller environment, preferably in Technology, Fintech, or software industries Proven record in working with channel partners and resellers to build campaigns and deliver on pipeline Excellent computer skills in Microsoft Office: Excel and PowerPoint. Proficiency in Photoshop would be a bonus. Strong verbal and written communication skills is a must Great initiative when it comes to getting things done and aren’t afraid to ask questions Ability to exhibit self-confidence when dealing with challenging situations Ability to think out-of-box and possess analytical thinking skills Ability to work under pressure and possess high self-discipline in getting work done to meet tight datelines Highly detail-oriented with strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects at one time Entrepreneurial attitude and the ability to wear multiple hats with a "roll-up-your-sleeves" mentality Experienced and willing to work with global teams across multiple time zones Experience and interest in gaming is desirable  Be part of a phenomenal team today!

Experience in managing a small team is an added advantage. description: About Railsbank Railsbank is the world’s leading global open banking platform that gives customers access to prototype, build, and scale financial products on 4 continents with one contract and one set of APIs. The company was founded by serial FinTech entrepreneurs who previously founded successful and award winning companies like Currency Cloud (recently sold to Visa for $1B) and Evolution. Railsbank is in growth mode with hundreds of clients globally, over 5.5 million end user accounts, VC funding from top firms like Clocktower Ventures and Visa and the most globally-enabled, digitally-native product in the FinTech platform space. We recently announced our US launch with our new Credit Card as a Service offering, aimed at allowing any company to build futuristic credit cards and lending products that live inside their user experiences.   Since starting in 2016 in London, Railsbank is now the only platform capable of issuing multiple financial products on 4 continents including USA, Europe, SE Asia, and Australia. Fresh off the back of a new $70M VC raise, we are looking for exceptional people who share the same core values to join team Railsbank in APAC.  The Role As an experienced Sales Executive, you will be responsible for working with Railsbank’s prospective customers as a trusted advisor to deeply understand their unique company challenges and goals. You will demonstrate the value of Railsbank and the impact the product will have on the prospect’s business. You will demonstrate the value of Railsbank and the impact Railsbank capabilities will have on leads and prospects’ businesses and the ability to drive results. You will have the opportunity to help influence the go to market strategy and further expansion of Railsbank in multiple countries working alongside Railsbank colleagues.  Key Measurements and Objectives include; Meeting ARR targets by closing deals Maintain the required value of deals pipeline to be able to meet ARR targets Bring in Net New Customer Revenue and establishing Railsbank brands in APAC  Maintain the Average Sales Cycle as per company standards  We are looking for you to; Work with startups, brands and established financial services providers to demonstrate Railsbank’s unique value This is first and foremost a closer role. You’ll be receiving qualified prospects and you will be responsible for the overall business development, client engagement, and sales lifecycle of Railsbank prospects across Europe Deeply understand the prospect's business, regulatory construct, flow of funds and challenges to ensure that Railsbank is the correct solution for the prospect Manage time effectively by qualifying and re-qualifying prospects throughout the sales cycle Build trust with the prospect by demonstrating that you understand the prospects’ business objectives and that our success can only result from their success Maintain and update an accurate log of activity in the CRM system Use phone and email to correspond with prospects Provide feedback across Railsbank related to information prospects share that could be helpful in advertising, marketing and product roadmap   What we look for in your professional skills 5-10+ years of experience selling SaaS, fintech/tech, financial services or B2B solutions Superb listening skills. You must understand objections and defeat them by turning sceptics into excited new customers High level of empathy. It’s important for our Business Development Managers to be a good person to peers and prospects Demonstrable history of carrying and exceeding quota Proven ability to make strong connections and overcome rejection to achieve results Demonstrated ability to conduct compelling on-site presentations up to senior executives. Tenacity and discipline to follow up with passion and respect A self-starter that thrives when given a clean sheet of paper and a target to hit A genuine interest in startups, fintech and/or financial services Excellent Communicator at all levels, internally and with customers A ‘get things done’ mentality Analytical, able to visualise key metrics for informed decision making Market aware: Knowledge of today’s major financial services, open banking and payments technologies, players and major up-and-coming trends   Role location and hours Unless agreed otherwise the role will be a full time role and you will be based in our Singapore offices, with flexible working, we would expect you to be available 2-3 days a week as a minimum in the office  What we look for in our team members and our values Being an integral part of the Railsbank team and sharing our values is important to us. The environment at Railsbank is fast-paced, exciting, and dynamic. It suits people that love to collaborate and support one-another. We are all driven by the same values and are looking to welcome new people to the team that share these values. Our values are: excellence, accountability, diversity, work/life balance, trust, fun, inclusivity, friendship, noble causes, and respect. If you are eager to join a thriving, fast-paced, Scale-up company and contribute to shaping its future, this is the role for you to make a difference.   Equal Opportunities Employer  Railsbank is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion or belief, colour, sex or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, marital status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.
industries: Computer Software, Banking, and Information Technology and Services

description: Shared micromobility is one of the fastest growing industries globally, and Beam is leading the way as Asia-Pacific's largest and fastest growing shared micromobility company, with rapidly growing operations in South Korea, Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia, Thailand and Taiwan.   Led by technology and innovation, we are on a mission to turn little drives into better rides and makes cities flow better for everyone.   We are looking for a Tender Manager who will lead the conception, coordination, implementation and submission of all tender and application-based activities. You will be the Project Manager and the focal point for bringing together all facets of the Beam team to contribute to winning bid.       WHAT YOU WILL DO :   Devising a successful strategy for winning a bid, including pinpointing the unique selling points (key differentiators), knowing the company's operating and profit margins and understanding the organisation's specific requirements Researching, writing and/or checking proposals Working with key members of the project team to obtain the information required to compile the bid Assessing and addressing the technical and commercial risks relating to the bid they are working on Managing budgets and tracking costs Researching current and future market trends Leading final reviews and be the responsible signoff for all finished products      WHO YOU ARE :   Broad business acumen with strong analytical, decision making and problem-solving skills Skilled in building and leveraging relationships Good communication and interpersonal skills Able to understand a variety of tender requirement systems across countries and cities Ability to adhere to and drive process excellence and governance Strong organisational / planning skills with the ability to multi-task and meet demanding deadlines effectively under pressure without supervision      The position is full time, permanent and onsite in Singapore. Due to travel and work pass restrictions as a result of Covid-19 safety measures, you must already be residing in Singapore.       WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU :   Opportunity to make an impact by being part of a movement that will revolutionize transportation in cities Be part of a hypergrowth organization with plenty of opportunity for personal development Flexible and inspiring workplace with a team of competent, motivated and fun colleagues Autonomy and ownership of the work you do Flexible hours and unlimited days off Comprehensive remuneration and benefits      The Beam Group of Companies is an equal employment opportunity employer, dedicated to providing an inclusive, open and diverse work environment. All are welcome regardless of race, language, religion, gender, nationality, age, disability or other divisive categorizations.       By submitting an application, you acknowledge that you have read the Privacy Policy and that you consent to Beam processing data in accordance with the Privacy Policy. Please let us know if you change your mind at any time in relation to Beam processing your personal data.

description: Leader, Sales Enablement - Singapore  Are you passionate about leading and developing strategic partnerships? Are you ambitious about driving Sales across the region? Join Western Union as a Leader, Sales Enablement in Singapore.  Motivated by our values: purpose-driven, globally-minded, and trustworthy & respectful  We're a FinTech that's using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We're a team of over 10,000 people spanning 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen.  Relentless pursuit of better  You’ll be in charge of regional sales enablement including sales planning, forecasting, and pipeline management processes. You’ll focus on driving material long-term company growth in collaboration with key central functions by setting a strategic framework and corresponding roadmap for the partnership lifecycle. You’ll be evaluating and designing product-market fit in a support of a potential long-term revenue target. We'll be looking to you to deliver training to Regional Sales teams on products, value propositions, and enterprise solution selling.  For this role, you will have experience dealing with enterprise/ sales solutions with a track record of securing deals and launching partnership solutions for large companies.  You will have a significant project, program, and change management experience or certification. You’ll have the ability to influence C-level executives internally and externally and have the competency in leading cross-functionally to drive large-scale change in a complex environment. Previous experience of lean and agile working methodologies is also desirable.  Join us, and let’s connect the world  Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. It’s an exciting time for our organization, as the largest cross-border money transfer operator, trusted by millions of consumers around the world. If you’re ready to unleash your potential to help drive change through bottom-up innovation, apply now.  We’re a company on the move, and we want our people to grow and develop. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as a great salary and benefits package.  We are passionate about our diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams, while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran (U.S.) status. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, in accordance with applicable laws.

description: Senior Specialist - Applied Genomics - Biotechnology - South East Asia - Singapore  My client are a well known and established global Biotechnology, with a fantastic name and reputation, as well as revolutionary technology, all in aid of transforming and improving human health.  Due to an internal promotion they are looking for a Senior Specialist to join the team in Singapore to cover South East Asia. This is for the non-human Genomics side of the business, focusing on Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, Environmental Genomics and Infectious Diseases Testing.  As Senior Specialist, you will be part of the Commercial Team, working closely with the Sales team and helping Customers by being the Subject Matter expert in this space.  You will report into the Senior Director for Applied Genomics for APAC and be part of a strong regional team. Additionally, you will have a very competitive package, not just remuneration but fully flexible working culture and whole company wide week off once a year.  Senior Specialist - Applied Genomics: Bachelor's degree and/or PhD in Molecular Biology, Genetics, Virology or similar field 5+ years' experience in highly technical support position in ONE of the following: Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, Environmental Genomics or Infectious Diseases Testing Experience in customer facing role - highly effective communicator of Technical information with strong Commercial Acumen Positive and self-motivated "get it done" attitude Able to travel once safe to do so  If this Senior Specialist role sounds like you please click apply now, share with your network too if this is not quite right for you, but could be good for someone you know!  *Due to COVID can only consider applicants currently residing in Singapore*  Suzannah Bangle EA Reg No: R1983937 l EA License No: 11C5813

description: Reference No: WD-0008780  What's the role?  We are looking for a customer-focused Business Developer, data centers to develop his/her career in a rewarding, high-performing, international company while working in a fast paced and very exciting segment of Data Centre construction.  The Business Developer (BD) role is a technical sales role where you will be focusing on a portfolio of Owners, consultants, Engineering Procurement Construction companies (EPC) and Contractors based in Singapore, designing and building data centers across the South East Asia region. You will create strategies and lead its execution to increase specifications and sales from the accounts based on technical and commercial discussions through the cooperation with global as well as regional BD community and the support from technical back office.  Who is Hilti?  If you’re new to our industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and first-rate service. With 30,000 people in more than 120 countries, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow and carve-out your career.  What does the role involve?  Day to day, you will be responsible to identify the key contacts for targeted projects of the focus accounts, develop standards and specifications with Hilti solutions, as well as to coordinate with the sales team on current and future data center projects being designed in Singapore.  The Key Responsibilities Include Contributes and accountable for sales development (direct or indirect), long term relationship build-up, and execution of account strategy working on tailored commercial and technical solutions, engineering specifications and standards Works with operational teams and management in target accounts including designers, engineers, project team members, purchase department, lead engineers, discipline managers, turnaround teams across multiple disciplines (Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation, Piping & Procurement) Examines economic and market trends and conditions that affect the company, and develop strategies to take full advantage of any changing circumstances Maintains effective communication systems throughout the team and company Our tools are chosen for some of the world’s most exciting projects, like London’s Crossrail and Japan’s bullet train, as well as everyday buildings that make people’s lives better and safer  What do we offer?  We’ll give you what you need to excel in your role, including ongoing training from the start. Your responsibilities will be great and, with them, we'll give you the freedom and autonomy to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results.  Show us what you’re made of and we’ll offer you opportunities to move around the business – to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets. It’s a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you’re after.  On top of these, we have a thorough people review process, unlike any we know of in any other business. We screen everyone in the company in a yearly career performance matching process. It means we can pair talent with opportunities - developing our people in their current roles or challenging them to work in new ways or in new places. It’s how we find the right fit and further our teams personally and professionally.  Why should you apply?  We have an excellent mix of people, which we believe makes for a more vibrant, more innovative, more productive team. So, if you’ve never worked in construction, that’s fine with us. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.  What You Need Is Degree in Engineering, Civil / Mechanical is preferred Experience in business development or sales for specified engineering products or sales of solutions, marketing management experience is a plus Experience working with Data Centre Segment and its stakeholders is a must Business sales negotiation skills Strong communication skills and proficiency in English Enthusiasm to learn and drive to succeed Acts independently and thinks strategically Work experience in multicultural environment Due to the nature of the role, a driving license is essential By submitting your resume, you confirm and agree that Hilti Far East Pte Ltd and its related companies worldwide (collectively, “Hilti Group”) may collect, use and disclose your data for their recruitment purposes. This may include selecting, evaluating and recruiting candidates for roles or positions that differ from the above job description, but for which we believe that you may be interested in or appropriate for.  We look forward to receiving your application and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  “How am I going to sell power tools? I’ve never drilled a hole in my life! That’s what I thought when I first joined Hilti, but it’s really not like that. It’s about nurturing your strengths and being rewarded for hard work.” James, Customer service representative (sales)
industries: Construction, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Civil Engineering

description: Build the Future  The work you do at McGraw Hill will be work that matters. We are collectively designing content that will build the future of education. Do you want to play your part and experience a sense of fulfilment that will inspire you to even greater heights?  With the fast-changing landscape in Higher Education and the rapid evolution to digital, our Higher Education division is seeking for an Enterprise Solutions Manager to join our dynamic team.  How can you make an impact?  As the Enterprise Sales Manager, you will be responsible for executing institutional sales in the assigned territory, particularly in capitalising on the portfolio of MHE digital products and services through digital subscription growth.  This role encompasses business development, digital enterprise sales and customer partnership development.  You will work collaboratively with the sales, implementation, marketing, and product teams, to drive division’s institutional selling strategy by leveraging on our digital platforms via integration with our customer’s learning management systems (LMS).  Successful Candidates Will Have The Following Experience Achieve or exceed all enterprise-level business financial measures through territory planning, execution and fulfilment strategies that deliver on customer need Collaborate with internal teams to design, deliver and implement institutional solutions based on profitable assessment of customer need requirements Exhibit solid understanding of McGraw Hill digital product solutions and integrative technologies Project Management: manage multiple projects (and various stages of negotiation/production) to effectively to maximise territory enterprise solutions sales revenue Demonstrate ability to recognise customer needs and the implications of technology solutions on learning objectives/outcomes Be a skilled negotiator and solutions seller, able to communicate effectively with faculty and institutional leaders Develop enterprise solution proposal documents and presentations Key Competencies Required For This Role Demonstrated passion for technology–enabled educational solutions Possess at least 5 years of sales or business development experience (ideally in an enterprise or software selling equivalent) with demonstrated sales success Highly proficient, or a proven capacity to rapidly acquire, deep technical expertise in McGraw Hill digital products and solutions, and in wider industry technologies (such as Learning Management Systems) Experience interfacing with executive management; ability to conduct high-level sales meetings with Deans, Vice Chancellors and similar Experience with SalesForce would be advantageous Excellent interpersonal skills; Fluency in English (Listening, Speaking, Reading & Writing) Here’s What We Offer  A competitive salary, bonus, and the opportunity to deliver work that matters, especially given the world we live in today. If you are curious, open to new ideas and ready to make a difference, we want to talk to you.  As an education innovation company, we're proud to play our part by inspiring learners around the world. If you bring your curiosity, we'll help you grow in a collaborative environment where everyone shares a passion for success.  Are you ready for a new challenge? Apply for a career at McGraw Hill and together, we'll impact the world.
industries: Education Management, E-Learning, and Publishing

description: We are currently looking for a Regional Sales Manager for Asia.  You are ambitious and tenacious in selling our solutions at the biggest airports in your region. You have knowledge of the technology and functionality of airports, but you also know who the key stakeholders are in the area.  Being a Regional Sales Manager at TKH Airport Solutions means far more than just selling our products to customers. It revolves around handling the customers who play a strategic role in our company’s growth.  Your tasks  As part of a highly motivated Sales team, we also expect you to Identify and grow opportunities within the area of responsibility Be a real solution seller. Independently plan and execute an effective relationship strategy and maintain effective long-term business relationships at senior level with key decision makers and influencers Support Sales operations, forecasting, analyzing, reporting and coordinating bids and reviews Participate and facilitate in business winning reviews Keep your knowledge up at a high level with the industry, developments and innovations Share your knowledge with the project and development team. Support marketing activities by participating in trade shows, seminars & conferences Travel frequently within your region About TKH Airport Solutions  TKH Airport Solutions is an innovator in airfield ground lighting (AGL). We provide a revolutionary AGL technology called CEDD®: contactless energy and data distribution. A smart and sustainable solution for airports that increases the efficiency, safety, and reliability of the airfield lighting infrastructure.  TKH Airport Solutions is one of the operating companies of the Dutch stock listed TKH Group NV, an internationally active group of companies specializing in the creation and delivery of innovative telecom, building and industrial solutions. Being part of the TKH Group, our company can build on a history of 90 years in smart connectivity, energy distribution and AGL.  Your Qualifications  – Degree from a recognized university in Engineering and/or Business  – Experience with the air business industry  – Existing network of contacts within the air industry  – Experience in international sales and solution selling  – Experience with (international) tenders  – Professional communication skills in English  How To Apply  Interested and looking for a challenging yet fulfilling job that will make you proud? If so, Please apply to this job position.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Security and Investigations

description: Our Company  If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world then this is the place for you.  If you have a desire to work in an organisation that is: Passionate about its people Focused on delivering the very best tech to our customers Offering the flexibility to work how and where you are most successful Obsessed with our customer’s success The leading SaaS platform to automate partnerships - affiliate, influencer, technology partners, and more! Entrepreneurial in spirit with a culture that rewards collaboration and curiosity Obsessed with making a difference in business and to the wider community Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation, working with innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi’s, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage their online affiliate, influencer, brand to brand, and content partnerships. The Impact Partnership Cloud covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across Europe, the United States, Africa, and Asia so there is plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement.  Your Role At Impact  The Partner Development Manager (PDM) is responsible for scaling Impact’s acquisition and recruitment efforts to drive a steady stream of publishers (traditional affiliates, media houses, content partners, influencers,...) to Impact’s marketplace and its brand portfolio.  You are a go-getter. You are energized by the thrill of the chase. You like to build systems around success and replicate it 100-fold. You’re good at selling ideas and helping others see the value that you see. The PDM is critical to the success of Impact’s Marketplace & Brand growth and will be responsible for recruiting, connecting, optimizing, and scaling Publishers on the Impact platform. The PDM will be a part of a growing global team with supporting lineages within the Product Growth team.  What You'll Do Set a plan of attack to uncover new-to-marketplace Publishers and to re-engage the dormant ones. Supporting the Client Success Team to understand strategic partner verticals to recruit for. Recruit and manage a pipeline of new marketplace Publishers using various communication channels, tools and methods. Inform onboarding of recruited/ new Publishers through activation channels. Drive path to first success with newly acquired publishers. Establishing deep mutually beneficial partnerships with a key group of tier 1 partners. Providing world-class growth enablement and the ultimate partner experience that builds trust, retention, and loyalty. Partner enablement programs to unlock key growth opportunities with high potential partners. Gain a deep understanding of a Partner's business priorities, strategy, and challenges and provide solutions accordingly. Responsible for meeting productive partnership and partner account growth targets and ensuring partner CRM is up to date. Identifying sales and expansion opportunities amongst a partner base for our publisher solutions (Supply-side License, Trackonomics). Learn assigned product lines and industry & internal ecosystem. What You Have 2-5 years of Publisher experience for a global software company and or agency. Previous experience in the affiliate marketing industry is a key requirement. Strong account management and or business development experience with a focus on Publisher development and experience using performance marketing SAAS technology. Demonstrated successful collaboration with internal international teams from ‘HQ’ & company offices across global time zones. Empathetic: understand every aspect of the day-to-day life of the audience we are supporting. Self-Motivated, Attention to Detail, Passion for Learning, Team player. Experience in working independently as well as part of a team in an energetic environment. Benefits/Perks Unlimited PTO Take the time off that you need. We are truly committed to a positive work-life balance, recognising that it is important to be happy and fulfilled in both. Training & Development Learning the advanced partnership automation products. Stock Options 4-year vesting schedule pending Board approval. Private Health Insurance Flexible work hours Internet Allowance Casual work environment Our international presence and diverse team allows you exposure to global perspectives. Established company with a cool, high velocity work ethos, where each person can make a difference. Impact is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, genetics, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or non-binary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

description: About Clearwater Analytics® Clearwater Analytics® is a global SaaS solution for automated investment data aggregation, reconciliation, accounting, and reporting. Clearwater helps thousands of organizations make the most of their investment portfolio data with a world-class product and client-centric servicing. Clearwater offers a full complement of middle- and back-office solutions like trade confirm/affirm, client billing, composite management, client statements, and more.  Each day, the Clearwater solution reports on more than $5.5 trillion in assets for clients. Since its founding in 2004, Clearwater has provided a cloud-native solution that helps investors make the most of their data. Investment professionals in more than 25 countries trust Clearwater to deliver timely, validated investment data and in-depth reporting.  Position Details In this role, you will work closely with the EMEA/APAC marketing team and others in sales to identify and execute on the marketing strategy including bringing Clearwater’s brand to life through events, email marketing, growing the social media presence, and other digital marketing tasks. This role requires critical thinking, flexibility, attention to detail, organization, consistent follow-up, and ability to prioritize in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. This role will require excellent communication and relationship-building skills and an enthusiasm for dynamic and innovative messaging, reporting on results and a willingness to learn and adjust with the changing environment.  Responsibilities Execute an appropriate mix of integrated campaign tactics, including events, round tables, email, webinars, social media, SEO SEM to deliver the regional campaign goals Identify and research industry events, sponsorships, and speaking opportunities that align with Clearwater’s brand, product, and target markets.  Execute strategic events, including tradeshows, hosted events, webinars, and user conferences as assigned.   Create a social content calendar, post and adjust post based on interaction Grow our digital presence including social, web, and paid ads Perform email marketing activities in Marketo Complete social and email analysis measuring success and cost per campaign Work with the entire marketing team to drive successful digital campaigns Track results and ensure high quality coverage in our digital spaces Assist with general project management and administration, as necessary  Desired Skills & Experience Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, or related field required Experience in any of the following areas: market research analytics, strategic planning, campaign development, events, email and nurturing, digital, social media, SEO SEM Strategic thinker with ability to adjust to changing dynamics An enthusiastic, high energy team member who is viewed as a “doer” on the team and across internal organizations Able to work autonomously, owning integrated marketing campaigns Experience with Marketo and/or Salesforce is a plus Experience in Software or SaaS industries is a plus

Knowledge of attrition modeling, website speed optimization, A/B testing, conversion management, sales journey optimization, traffic analysis, and reporting tools. description: About Club Med  As the pioneer in premium all-inclusive holiday concept, Club Med has been the world leader in offering happiness since its inception in 1950. Founded in France and has seen expanded to a unique upscale, friendly and multicultural brand, Club Med boasts over 70 resorts located in the most beautiful destinations around the world, a luxury cruise ship, as well as a selection of Luxury Villas & Chalets. Club Med has more than 20,000 Gentle Organizers (G.Os) and Gentle Employees (G.Es) working in its resorts, regional headquarters in Paris, Singapore, Shanghai, Rio de Janeiro and Miami, as well as commercial sales offices all over the world.  Purpose  Within the Development Department, in charge of managing the portfolio of resort under Club Med management in East South Asia and Pacific, the new hire will be required to actively contribute in projects in South East Asia by sourcing and helping the negotiation and coordination of new Club Med resort projects - either greenfield or brownfield, across South East Asia in the Pacific. The Development Manager will seek to expand the Club Med presence in the region in line with the company's development strategy and ambitious objectives.  Responsibilities Source New Projects: Prospection in new destinations Analysis of new development projects or takeover of existing assets Scoping of hotel investment sector players and deals to identify potential partners Manage the coordination of deals from sourcing to closing: Internally: Coordinate with relevant teams for the success of the project (Finance, Legal, Construction, Operations, Marketing...) Externally: Coordinate negotiations and proposals to potential investors and partners / assist in the negotiation of legal documents / ensure collaboration with other external stakeholders (banks, financial Asset Management: Assist in Asset Management projects for existing Club Med resorts: Lease extension, Capex Projects, Real Estate Transactions, Valuations, etc. Club Med development 'marketing' Lead regional marketing effort to showcase Club Med projects and extension to source potential financial partners and investors in the investment community. Requirements Minimum Degree in Business or equivalent At least 3-5 years’ of relevant working experience in Hospitality / Real Estate / Consulting / in South East Asia/ APAC Possess knowledge on Fundamentals of Project Finance and Hotel P&L modelling Excellent verbal and written communications skills, with the ability to negotiate legal contracts such as but not limited to Hotel Management Agreement or Lease Agreement Strong interpersonal skills to manage internal and external partners Self-starter, enthusiastic with strong entrepreneurial spirit Proficient in Microsoft office
industries: Financial Services, Accounting, and Hospitality

description: Sephora, a division of LVMH - Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton global luxury leader, is a global leader in beauty retailing. It successfully operates more than three thousand points of sale across Americas, Europe, Middle East, and Asia. Its aim is to animate the most loved beauty community in the world.  Sephora South East Asia is a high growth division of leading global beauty retailer, Sephora. Our teams run omnichannel retail businesses in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Australia, New Zealand, and Hong Kong; Franchise operations in India & Indonesia; and ecommerce-only business (the first in the world globally for Sephora!) in the Philippines. We have recently opened new markets in Hong Kong and New Zealand as well!  Our success is built on innovation, a unique product portfolio, market-leading digital capabilities, and our exceptional people! With ambitious growth plans, we are always looking for talented people who are passionate about building businesses and developing themselves and our customers' experience.  At Sephora, we stand together, and we stand for something more. Every day we reimagine beauty, discover new brands, and influence positive change. Data plays a big role in that. This Category Manager, Franchise Markets, will interface between our Regional team and Franchisee teams to facilitate and ensure qualitative execution of brand plans (Sephora/Exclusives) to deliver the set business objectives.  You will shine here if you enjoy working on…  •   New Brand Acquisition o   Planning the brands pipeline with the country leads basis what’s trendy & what customers want  o   Driving new brands acquisition for countries with commercial negotiations o   Approving the brands mix in each country  •   Brand/Assortment Management [Sephora & Exclusive Brands] o   Initiating Joint business plans with key brand partners to support growth  o   Aligning on assortment plans & communication plans with Sephora Regional, Exclusive Brands, Sephora brand team and get buy-ins from partners to mirror the international ranges o   Planning & executing new product launches, key focus categories, pricing, forecasting of new/one shot/animation products. o   Working with Regulatory teams & with brands to time the launch of products, in-market  o   Working closely with Supply Chain to ensure timely POs & replenishments  o   Planning brand visits with partner teams to optimise visit for trainings, PR opportunities, in-store activities o   Ensuring proper execution of planogram and seasonal fixture updates for Sephora private label and Exclusive brands. Provide feedback & approvals on all new store layouts, brand adjacencies   •   Marketing  o   Working closely with marketing team to secure brand animation slots as per the planned calendar for each market  o   Tracking & Analysing Brands and Campaign performance o   Working closely with franchise partners to facilitate Brands annual launch plans and negotiate with brands on instore mechanics/promotions or activities to drive sales o   Overseeing promotional activities that will meet desired sales/marketing objectives o   Assisting in registration of any marketing related products like free samples, GWPs  •   Reporting  o   Churning monthly Merchandising reports on the KPIs, business performance o   Monitoring and present regular updates on any emerging trends of the beauty market and the local competitive landscape o   Ensuring the correct maintenance of Master Data   We would love to hear from you if have…  •   6+ years Category/Brand Management experience, ideally from the beauty/fashion industry •   Cross functional work experience •   Strong interpersonal communication skills with the ability to influence •   Strong analytical skills  •   Results Oriented •   Independent and able to work in a fast paced environment •   Keen interest in the beauty industry with a flair for trends and style •   A Masters Degree in Business/Marketing •   Understanding of India, Indonesia markets would be an advantage  While at Sephora, you’ll enjoy… The people: You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, and kind leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work with.  The learning: We invest heavily in training for our leaders and store associates. Not just product knowledge, but building a personalized career plan with you so you continue to evolve and build your skills.  The culture: As a leading beauty retailer, backed by the LVMH luxury brand, our reach is broad and our impact is global. Yet there’s always room to explore. It’s in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty. You can unleash your creativity, because we’ve got disruptive spirit. You can learn and evolve, because we empower you to be your best. You can be yourself, because you are what sets us apart. This, is the future of beauty. Reimagine your future, at Sephora.
industries: Retail

description: At Razer, you will be at the forefront of the most exciting industry in the world—video games, undertaking the greatest mission of all: bringing gamers closer to the games they love. With fifteen offices and three R&D labs worldwide, you will be part of a global team that transcends time zones and geographical boundaries. You get to enjoy working in an environment that values transparency and collaborative effort. Most importantly, both work and play are equally important to us.  The Senior Product Evangelist/Product Marketing Manager will work closely with the business and product team of Razer Gold platform. The position has the responsibility of developing marketing strategy, promotions and activities to drive user acquisition, engagement and supporting the business team to maximize revenue opportunities.  Responsibilities: Marketing ownership of a B2C wallet, driving end user demand generation from user acquisition and revenue perspectives Launch new features with go-to-market planning and compelling creative ideas to grow adoption and usage. jobTitle: Regional Business Development Manager, Customer Service
description: The Swiss-based family owned company Bühler is a global, industrial solutions provider for processing foods and manufacturing advanced materials, contributing to food security and high-energy efficiency. Around 65% of the worldwide harvested grain is processed on Bühler mills, around 50% of all car taillamps or headlamps are getting metallized on Bühler machines. Every day, billions of people come into contact with Bühler technologies to cover their basic needs for foods, mobility, or communication.  Bühler Singapore has been operating in Singapore since 1977. We offer the entire range of products and services of Buhler Group, with our main activities being food production and processing for rice, pasta, flour, chocolate and breakfast cereals as well as solutions for die casting, wet grinding and coating technology, with a focus on applications in the automotive industry, optics, electronics, paints, packaging and glass technology. Bühler Singapore is the Regional Headquarter for South East Asia and Oceania and has gained in depth knowledge of our customers’ specific requirements in the region over the past decades.  We are searching for a sales-proactive, self-driven and dynamic candidate to fill the vacancy of Regional Business Development Manager, Customer Service (CS) to be based in Singapore Regional Office; the role will be responsible for South East Asia & Oceania regional portfolio. This role will report to Customer Service Director, South East Asia & Oceania.  Strategically Full overview of the key accounts, Customer Service (CS) needs and solutions for SEA customers, thereby developing successful market and business development strategies for Southeast Asia (SEA). To assess CS opportunities and to define successful business development strategies (incl. ignoring an opportunity). Provide and consolidate price strategy for Retrofits and CS products. Operationally Executing CS business unit (BU) business strategies and yearly objectives in SEA region as jointly defined by the Management. Review and leverage frame agreements in CS business e.g. for promotion. CS business development of existing and new customers. Formulate business development concepts specifically to BU to meet customer’s requirements. Understand the needs of our customers and find solutions accordingly. Support the local CS teams to emphasize the unique selling points of Buhler solutions to customer. Guide the CS Sales & Quotation team to establish accurate quotation e.g. in retrofits and recommended spare-parts for new plants.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Automotive, and Food Production

description: Something about us... App Annie is the industry’s most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. Our mission is to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. We created the mobile app data market and are committed to delivering the industry’s most complete mobile performance offering. We are headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide. More than 1,200 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business.  Along with a market defining product, we take great pride in our culture and values and strive to embody them daily! We set a high bar for our success and have made Excellence as our standard, hold each other Accountable, continuously push Innovation and Win with Style.  What can you tell your friends when they ask you what you do? As part of the Professional Services team, I delight and inform App Annie customers with insights to help them benchmark and set strategic goals aligned to their specific business needs. I help companies understand, plan, and track the performance of their mobile apps in the fast-moving and ever-evolving mobile market. I help drive customer satisfaction and retention by applying my analytical mindset to create innovative solutions.  You will be responsible for and take pride in…. As a Mobile Strategy Consultant, you will apply App Annie’s world-renowned mobile market data, combined with the latest mobile industry trends, to deliver clear findings, actionable insights, and recommendations to customers, prospects, and the press. Your work will enable customers to capitalize on data as they explore digital strategy changes, mobile product development, mobile marketing, and more.  You will partner with Sales to establish credibility, demonstrate value, and provide strategic guidance to help leading brands across industries leverage App Annie’s services to successfully execute their mobile transformation strategies. You will work with Marketing to continually improve how we communicate the value of the App Annie platform and strategic services to the market.  You will also work at the intersection of many internal teams to scope and deliver strategic services required to meet our Enterprise customer’s goals.  You will apply your unique combination of business acumen, technical expertise, and strong interpersonal skills to creatively use all the resources available to you to solve prospects’ problems and share these inventive solutions across the team.  You will also have the opportunity to shape the product and direction of App Annie. App Annie’s collaborative approach means you will be encouraged to explore areas that excite you and to be constantly learning.  In partnership with the Sales team, identify prospects’ and customers’ mobile transformation goals through discovery calls with relevant stakeholders Effectively communicate the value of App Annie’s product suite to prospects and customers demonstrating an understanding of their businesses and helping to elevate the sales conversation Deliver strategic insights and recommendations to prospects (pre-sales) and customers (post-sales) applying both qualitative and quantitative analysis Conduct research and analysis by combining App Annie’s data with that from external sources and deep knowledge of the mobile landscape Contribute to Go to Market strategies for target verticals, including both pre-sales objectives as well as post-sales measures of success Becoming better at what you do every day  You should recognize yourself in the following... 7+ years experience at mobile-first publishers and brands, top tier management consulting, investment banking, or a research firm Strong analytical, quantitative, and research skills, and proficient with Excel and Powerpoint Resourcefulness to find relevant and credible external information on your own with intellectual curiosity and deep interest in the app, mobile, and tech space The ability to translate quantitative analysis into actionable business strategies A demonstrated ability to communicate and present complex concepts, and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive levels Ability to think on your feet and handle challenging questions in a meeting environment Strong collaborator who works well cross-functionally across multiple teams and time zones A proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail  This is what we offer... We provide a $1,000 (Country equivalent) reimbursable WFH allowance to set you up for remote work success. Internet allowance for stable internet connection, so your video does not freeze on Zoom. Flexible working days. We love to meet, but if you need to get your kids to school-zoom, you need to leave early to get to your band rehearsal or gym classes, do your thing. Paid leave, so long as you promise to come back! Health and dental benefits. An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations. Wellbeing allowance for any activity that matters to your wellbeing; (online) gym classes, fitness equipment, mindfulness apps or even childcare support! Unlimited access to our online learning platform Udemy to help you develop your skills. Virtual initiatives and events to keep you connected with your colleagues.  Yes, I want this job!
industries: Internet, Marketing and Advertising, and Market Research

description: Sales Executive The  Opportunity a) You have a fire in your belly, and you can’t wait to go to the frontline every day. You know how to persuade people and are willing to go the extra mile to achieve goals. Grit.Resourcefulness. Drive. These are the traits that we are looking for in our Sales Executive role. If you’re looking to build valuable connections and to learn sales from an experienced company, this could be the perfect role for you! b) The idea of sitting at a desk from 9-5 bores you. You crave for an experience that allows you meet others and interact because you are built to connect. CyberforSEC Pte Ltd is looking for an exceptional negotiator with excellent persuasion skills. We’re looking for that fire in you; that desire to win and win big, that hunger to have more, that determination to never back down. Up for the challenge? c) CyberforSEC Pte Ltdis looking for their next Sales Executive to sell to cyber security solutions to SMEs. If you thrive in an uncertain and dynamic environment, and wish to get thrown into the battlefield for that holistic learning experience, this is the job for you! At CyberforSEC Pte Ltd, you are the superstar who brings food to the table for the company. You’ll main tasks involve lead generation and sales (big responsibilities). You are the vessel who ships our products/services to our clients. Without you, our product/service reaches no market. What You'll Learn Sharpen your business development skills ○ You'll learn how to identify business opportunities, structure proposals and close deals. ○ Be exposed to the art of maintaining fruitful relationships with clients ○ Learn to build and maintain a healthy sales funnel Build up & hone your negotiation and persuasion skills ○ You'll be meeting different people from all walks of life on a daily basis. Everyday will be a new opportunity for you to hone your negotiation and persuasion skills, and adapt them accordingly to the person you're communicating with. ○ From what you say, how you say it, and even your body language -- all of these things play a significant role in convincing clients why you and your team are right for the job. Learn about creative sales techniques from the best minds in the field ○ Work closely with the most resourceful people in the field and learn all about creative sales techniques. Find out what tools and practices they have managed to build for themselves so that they can manage a team and hit their targets. Job Description Lead Management & Client Pitching ○ Research & generate a clientele list ○ Build the client database and identify key contracts ○ Engage prospects through multiple channels to generate new sales leads ○ Regularly attend industry events, network and build industry relationships ○ Organise and make sales visits ○ Produce detailed proposals and presentation materials for client pitching ○ Pitch to clients about our company services and offerings Account Management ○ Sell company products and recommend solutions ○ To maintain client relationships by providing support and information. ○ To recommend new opportunities and improvements. ○ Assist Sales/Account Managers in sales activities such as preparing contracts and quotations ○ Collaborate with the Marketing team to structure service bundles ○ Always on top of industry trends, market activities, and competitors so as to identify new opportunities Administrative Duties ○ Ensure prompt response to enquiries/or resolution to customer complaints ○ Proactively maintain and enhance relationship with clients ○ Assist in meeting sales targets for the sales team ○ Maintain sales activity records and prepare sales reports Requirements Years of experience Minimum 3 years of experience in sales or client success Skills Required: ○ Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills ○ Strong management and communication skills ○ Computer savvy and proficient in powerpoint presentations ○ IT Knowledge required ○ Excellent salesmanship and networking skills ○ Competent in presentations and demonstrations ○ Proven ability to achieve sales targets What we’re looking for in you: ○ Strong customer orientation, dedication, and passion for delivering a great customer experience ○ Passionate about technology and strong desire to learn ○ Displays intellectual curiosity and the ability to handle ambiguity ○ Ability to convey information clearly and analyze customer requirements as needed to help customer make buying decisions ○ Highly energetic, positive attitude with the ability to take initiative ○ Tenacious and goal-oriented ○ Business acumen with a problem-solving attitude ○ Discipline to conduct and manage sales cycle process from initial contact through to initial qualification ○ Collaborative and team oriented
