description: READY TO BRING PASSION INTO YOUR CAREER?  Clarins Group is not only a fast-growing, leading Beauty Company, we’re also a committed, family-owned enterprise with a fiercely independent and pioneering spirit. As one of the top skin care companies worldwide, with a strong position in Europe and the Americas and growth accelerating in Asia, we’re looking for a Accounts Receivable Lead, Asia Pacific based in Singapore.   THE ROLE:  This role will be responsible for leading and managing the Accounts Receivables team, supported by 2 direct reports. The individual must be hands-on, have the audacity to drive improvements, build the team’s capability, and demonstrate strong communication skills to engage stakeholders.  WHAT YOU'LL DO:  Credit Management/ Accounts Receivable Lead, manage and oversee the Accounts Receivable team, to deliver timely and accurate quality work Responsible for the full scope of credit management and accounts receivable, of all the relevant markets, including Singapore Domestic, APAC Agents, and Worldwide Travel Retail, including the end-to-end Order-to-Cash accounting and reporting, billing, collections, reporting and month-end closing Credit limit review, analysis, and compliance to minimize credit risks. Familiarity with credit insurance and credit rating reports Payment Term expertise, and Trade Finance experience, such as Letter of Credit (LC), Documents against payment (DP), and various payment terms to minimize credit risks and improve collections Strong finance business partnership with the respective sales team, BU controllers, and Supply Chain, to drive business growth Process improvements, to drive efficiency and effectiveness Ensure compliance to internal controls, policies, and processes Support Audit in a timely manner, including statutory audit, and HQ initiated internal audits  Financial Reporting Timely and accurate financial reporting, such as net invoicing (sales), revenue recognition, working capital, ageing, DSO, provision for returns, doubtful debts, and cash reporting Responsible for GST payable compliance, reconciliation, and reporting  Cash Management Responsible for all cash and working capital reporting to Group Cash forecast and planning to ensure liquidity Review accounting entries relating to treasury activities Bank reconciliation review, and ensure internal controls are met System administrator of e-banking, and ensure compliance to bank mandates  People Management Lead, train, coach and develop teams/ direct report(s) Set clear directions, plan and lead Strong communicator with internal and external partners Provide strong support to the Corporate Finance Director in various initiatives and projects  Other responsibilities may be added to the above, which are consistent with the Accounts Receivable Lead, Asia Pacific role.  YOU HAVE:  Bachelor-degree holder or equivalent in Accountancy, Business or related discipline from a reputable university CA / CPA qualification preferred Minimum 8 years of relevant working experience, and at least 3 years of management or supervisory experience, preferably in established global FMCG with retail or supply chain exposure Prior experience in Travel Retail and Cash Management will be an added advantage Excellent system knowledge including MS Excel, JDE, Oracle, Workday, SAP and/or Hyperion Strong technical knowledge, with good analytical and problem-solving skills Strong process and project management capabilities will be a plus Agility to change, mature, independent, hands-on, able to work under stress, and has a strong sense of responsibility Good team player as well as team leader to provide coaching and guidance  WE HAVE:  Standout brands: Clarins and My Blend Distinctive, high-quality products and services A longstanding commitment to social, economic and ecological initiatives   Growth opportunities Learning & Development An attractive compensation and benefits package  If you have a curious mind and are always questioning how things can be done better, the ability to take risks and accept new challenges, join us!
industries: Cosmetics

description: About The Role  The Pre-Sales Project Manager is a member of the Development team and operates as the primary facilitator between our clients, our Sales team and our Delivery team by providing technical support on customizations of our built product in both the sales and delivery process. This individual is accountable to communicate to the project teams all sales requirements to ensure projects will be resourced accordingly. In addition this individual must collate all deliverables and report back to the internal sales team accordingly.  The PSPM is responsible for ensuring that the physical workplace requirements of the customer are not lost throughout the sales, project scoping, and deal structuring (and if applicable, space delivery, move-in and ongoing operation of the space). The PSPM will be an excellent communicator and will have the ability to collaborate with other internal disciplines (ie. Design, Construction, Comm Mgmt, Logistics, Community, Facilities, IT, Security, Account Management, Accounting, etc).  The ideal candidate will be experienced in the architecture, workplace strategy, project management, construction, and real estate industries; have direct client engagement experience, a keen understanding of the enterprise real estate sales process, and a proven ability to effectively juggle competing priorities. Candidates must thrive at interfacing with internal and external stakeholders in a complex matrixed organization to develop creative, cost effective solutions that meet customer requirements.  Responsibilities  Manage multiple projects at a time and prioritize workload to ensure that project timelines are met. Substantial involvement during the sales process to convert customer’s requirements into a quantifiable scope of work. The PSPM will work alongside Sales and Delivery Teams to understand lease terms, develop estimates and budgets, preliminary schedules, and secure necessary approvals. Provide detailed reports required for the sales cycle, including workplace strategy analysis. Generate and continuously maintain reporting data for respective projects during the delivery phase, reporting to upper management as necessary. Collaborate with the legal team to ensure that all construction commercial terms and agreements are inclusive of complete scope of work, as well as help guide the process of contract negotiations as necessary Responsible for engagement with, and management of resources during pre-sales, including cross-functional teams such as Design, ICT, Security, Project Management, Cost Management, and Arts & Graphics. Responsible for ensuring project financials are approved prior to deal signing, including member-specific capex and budgets. Assist and close complex, multi-million dollar transactions, including cross-negotiating with our customers and our contractor-partners. Where applicable, the PSPM will also have the opportunity to run projects after the sales cycle, including the fill fit-out and delivery of spaces for various members within the WeWork portfolio.  Qualifications  5+ years of experience of all phases of the design process from schematic design through the bid process and construction management Experience generating cost and schedule estimates to be used for sales related activities Bachelors Degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction, Real Estate Development or similar. Experience in workplace strategy and key trends in the industry. Be familiar with the construction industry best practices, building & ADA codes. Be a self-starter, with the ability to work independently in a fast paced environment Experience in retail and commercial construction/development is preferable with contract values $2M+ Passionate about development (real estate, design, workplace strategy, numbers, schedules). Passionate about collaborating and leading all stakeholders to a suitable design solution. Extremely organized and great at managing productivity.
jobFunction: Project Management, Supply Chain, and Engineering
industries: Construction, Civil Engineering, and Business Supplies and Equipment

description: About NTT Data Singapore  We are a top 6 global IT services company with operations in 50+ countries. We offer an advanced portfolio of application, business process, cloud, and infrastructure services to businesses and governments worldwide.  NTT DATA Singapore PTE Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NTT DATA Corp, a part of NTT Group, the world’s 65th Largest Company according to Fortune Magazine. The Singapore entity of NTT DATA is an S10 government-registered supplier and forms the core of NTT DATA’s APAC operations and is positioned as a gateway of our global capabilities in Singapore and the APAC region.  At NTT DATA SINGAPORE, we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunity employer that puts our people and clients first. We welcome different ideas, backgrounds and passionate individuals to join us in our inclusive environment to achieve stronger and better results through teamwork, foresight, and innovation. We pledge to create a harmonious and nurturing culture, where all individuals feel a sense of pride and belonging, regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity.  Responsibilities  The company is growing exponentially and is looking to hire a sales professional to sell ICT solutions to Government clients. Own a client portfolio and manage the sales process end to end. Develop an Enterprise Account Plan for each enterprise account, then drive the execution of that plan to success. Conducts account planning and proactively seeks to bring innovative ideas and approaches to the account strategy for quarterly review. Identifying and mapping business strengths and customer needs. Prospecting, building the pipeline and selling NTT Data solution to enterprise clients. Engage with C-level prospects to position NTTDATA enterprise value proposition and key player in deal to closure. Provide pro-active, trusted thought leadership to target accounts. Orchestrate internal teams to collaboratively build Joint Vision Roadmaps outlining the value that NTT DATA will deliver and the investments the client will need to make. Generate new sales opportunities, and work with the technical solutions experts to create innovative and compelling proposals. You will be responsible to qualify, participate and take lead in Government tenders. Work together with internal and external stakeholders to achieve the objectives of the company as a whole. Prospect, educate, qualify and develop opportunities in existing and new key accounts to identify profitable revenue streams. Handle objections by clarifying, emphasizing agreements and working through differences to a positive conclusion. Requirements University degree/business/engineering school or similar tertiary qualification 5+ years of experience in ICT solutions to public / government clients with key strengths on IT solutions. Comfortable in contract negotiation, deal forecasting and articulating organisation's capabilities to customers Strong business acumen and work independently Positive mind-set, result-oriented, high level of initiative and integrity Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Company Description  Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiant’s approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills confidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats.  Job Description  The Senior Manager Sales Enablement will drive the overall sales enablement & effectiveness program in APJ. This person will develop, maintain, and build the regional enablement function. They will drive sales enablement to meet the market specific needs of the regional sales organization. They will execute a variety of global programs technical, sales and channel effectiveness. Reporting to the Director of Sales Enablement, this position necessitates strong program, project management and communication skills, and consistent achievement of defined goals and objectives. The high-level, high-impact projects this individual will be responsible for will help ensure the success and efficiency of the organization, and the success of the candidate will directly affect the overall success of the organization.  Responsibilities: Responsible for partnering with the APJ sales leadership team and frontline country sales managers to fully understand key needs at a regional level and become a true advocate for the Field. Define the enablement strategy for APJ, including planning and delivery around product knowledge, solution messaging, sales methodologies, and sales processes. Manage the regional design and execution of our New Hire onboarding process by sales role. To include 30, 60, 90…360-day plans and new hire workshop. Develop a plan to coach front line leaders and sales to apply rigor around our global sales methodology and process. Define and analyze metrics, objectives, key results, and productivity gains that inform the success of the enablement programs and activities. Help to develop Sales and manager skills competency model.  Support the global Field Enablement team and assist with other projects as necessary (ex: Annual Sales Kickoff, Live Training Events, etc  Qualifications  Requirements: Experience coaching front line leaders and sales around sales process, sales methodology, successfully implemented sales methodology, deal inspection coaching to drive greater success within accounts (Experience with Force Management COM, or MEDDIC or other value selling methodology) Demonstrable experience in building enablement/effectiveness programs that have a measurable impact on revenue. Experience of establishing a new hire onboarding program to include 30, 60 90…360 Day requirements Facilitation of online, face to face sales product & solution enablement including content development. Track record of successfully managing multiple projects at once successfully. Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, excel in a complex fast paced, rapidly evolving business, team-oriented environment. Experience of value selling methodologies Experience in Cyber security, SAAS, Services Proven ability to link business strategies to business objectives and drive desired business outcomes. Experience in developing content & facilitating online and face to face sales product & solution enablement session Demonstrated ability to lead and partner with cross-functional, virtual teams and operate autonomously, making complex decisions in situations of ambiguity and time pressure. Possesses strong executive presence, engaging style in front of large audiences, strong written and oral communication skills with credible influence and impact at various levels. Strong writing/editing and verbal communication skills. Strong detail orientation skills. jobTitle: Head of Merchant Strategy and Execution
description: Job Description:  Get to know our Team:  The Singapore Operations team oversees, shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.  As part of the Singapore Operations team, the GrabFood team looks at connecting Singapore eaters and customers to the vast array of merchants (from the familiar favourites to the up and coming stars) within our sunny island-home of Singapore, through our many delivery-partners.  Get to know the Role:  In this role, you will strategize and execute engagement and monetization initiatives for Grab's Merchants across Food, Mart, and Payments in SG. Working closely with the Sales and Account Management teams, you will define the Merchant experience at Grab -- from how we segment merchants and what programs we offer to each of these segments, to how we design value-adding products to help merchants grow with Grab.  The role is a balance of strategic thinking, stakeholder management, and operational know-how. As the Merchant Strategy and Execution Lead, you will gain cross-functional exposure: you will report to the Head of Merchants in Singapore, but work across operations, strategy, marketing on a regular basis.  The day-to-day activities: Conduct strategic pieces of work for the Account Management and Sales Teams, ie. defining merchant segmentation or optimizing merchant acquisition strategy Design and execute programs that help Merchants to grow their business by leveraging Grab's capabilities (ie. wide customer reach, detailed customer insights) Create and operationalize programs and communications channels to better engage merchants on the platform, particularly long tail merchants who do not have an account manager Analyze success of these programs through data-driven analyses; Clearly present results and next steps to senior stakeholders Work closely with stakeholders across all parts of the GrabFood SG organization, particularly Marketing, Strategy and Operations, Merchant Operations to establish strong value propositions Liaise with and understand the needs of all of Grab's merchants through conducting focus groups and occasionally accompanying Sales and Account Management Executives to meet merchants Lead, coach, and manage a high performing team to scale Merchant Engagement initiatives in SG; Train and develop the Sales and AM teams with the intent to raise the bar (particularly in terms of analyses and structure), improve performance, cultivate creativity and increase team motivation. Keep abreast of new product developments and regional initiatives in order to tailor and localize them for SG Merchants The must haves: A minimum 5-7 years of relevant work experience in top tier management consulting or technology firms, preferably in strategy and operations, sales ops, or demand planning roles Experience in senior stakeholder management across multiple departments and functions Committed and highly collaborative leader who can coach and mentor the broader team while successfully establishing a healthy working culture based on Grab's principles Confident in processing, analyzing, and conveying complex data sets using Excel and PowerPoint, working knowledge of SQL and Tableau are also preferred but not essential Quantitative discipline with strong business sense and ability to articulate complex analyses to a wide range of audiences, and translating these to actionable business insights Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English Demonstrated ability to see big picture while not losing sight of details Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can work well in a startup. Able to work independently but also a good team player.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: GitLab's DevOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 1,400+ team members and values that guide a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute .  Channel Sales Manager (ASEAN & India) - Remote, Singapore  The Channel Sales Manager is responsible for sales enablement of their assigned channel, and managing their channel to achieve stated sales targets.  Job Grade  The Channel Sales Manager is a grade 8 .  Responsibilities Responsible for the day-to-day relationship management of channel partners Act as a liaison between the GitLab and assigned channel partners. Build, maintain, and manage relationships with current and prospective channel partners. Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned partner accounts. Coordinate the involvement of GitLab personnel, including support, service, and management resources, in order to meet partner performance objectives and partners’ expectations. Sell through partner organizations to end users in coordination with partner sales resources. Meet assigned targets for profitable sales volume and strategic objectives in assigned partner accounts. Manage direct/channel conflict by fostering excellent communication between the channel and direct teams Ensures partner compliance with Channel Partner programs and agreements Participate in a partner planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones associated with a productive partner relationship. Identifies partner GTM &/or services offerings; working with partner sales resources, serives, marketing, etc. develop & launch offerings to point of incremental join revenue achievement Builds relationships with technology vendors to identify mutual greenfield opportunities with shared partners Requirements Previous experience of driving channel sales ideally within the same product category and channel. Must have experience working with partners extensively in SE Asia and India Experience selling in the Software Development Tools and/or Application Lifecycle Management space via channel partnerships Experience managing partner relationships that are based in developing and delivering service offerings tied to vendor product Experience selling Open Source Solutions 5+ years of experience with B2B sales 10 years selling high technology products in assigned territory in a channel model Interest in GitLab, and open source software Effective communicator with excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to build strong relationships with partners and GitLab teams. Strong personal network within the industry. Driven, highly motivated and results driven. You share our values , and work in accordance with those values. Leadership at GitLab Ability to use GitLab Remote-Singapore  Country Hiring Guidelines  GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.  Your Privacy  For information about our privacy practices in the recruitment process, please visit our Recruitment Privacy Policy page.

description: The Team Lead (Business Development) - Digital Events, is accountable for the Digital Events SEA team's revenue and performance targets. The Team Lead drives the sales KPIs and leads the sales team to ensure each individual business development manager and the overall team achieves the prescribed sales quotas. EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS At least 8+ years of b2b sales experience and skilled at consultative solution-based selling. description: Description  Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers more than a million businesses in 190 countries around the world. Our business is growing at rapid rates and to support this growing demand for AWS services across the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you have a passion for working in a fast paced, dynamic environment and provide exceptional customer service, we’d like to hear from you!  The AWS Asia Pacific & Japan Sales Strategy team is a team that partners with the APJ Leadership, influencing GTM strategy, identifying strategic priorities, leading strategic programs and operationalizing strategy. We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Manager who can lead Strategic Programs across customer acquisition, diversification, workforce strategy, compensation design strategy etc., spanning across all geographic areas and all customer segments in the APJ Commercial Sales organization. They will work with a set of cross-functional stakeholders and business leaders, collaborating across Sales, Operations, Partner, Technical, HR etc. We are looking for a builder who will start by “rolling up their sleeves”, understand business needs, and then scale and develop a high-performing team that can deliver strategic programs in a consistent and impactful way. The candidate must be able to create simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems, have excellent project-management skills, and be able to communicate complex topics in a concise and easy-to-understand manner. They must be able to communicate effectively to business leaders, stakeholders and to the wider field teams as needed. The individual will have the opportunity to really make a difference in a high growth environment where their ability to lead and inspire a team of Program Managers to deliver a portfolio of highly complex programs and projects to successful, high quality, on-time launches will be key.  Your Responsibilities Will Include Leading a team of Program Managers to deliver highly complex, large scale, strategic programs from initiation through delivery, on time and with quality. Ensuring consistent and efficient execution of programs and projects, delivering high-quality, scalable solutions within aggressive timelines. Proactively identifying and mitigating program risks and obstacles by collaborating closely with business partners and key tech and non-tech stakeholders. This includes effectively communicating with, and influencing, senior stakeholders across multiple parts of the organization. Hiring, developing and managing a diverse team of bar-raising Program Managers to create a pipeline of future Amazon program leaders while building an inspiring, high-performance environment that attracts internal and external talent. Relentlessly focus on identifying and delivering innovative, ‘think-big’ improvement opportunities which step change Sales Strategy capabilities.  Basic Qualifications At least 10 years of program/project management experience in a mid/large size company with a proven record of successful project delivery working cross-functionally with teams spanning multiple geographies. Demonstrated ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, clear written summaries, and region-wide communications. Demonstrated ability to lead a team of program managers independently while dealing with high levels of ambiguity, organizational complexity and trade-off requirements. Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of presenting to senior management. Strong prioritization skills, including driving multiple initiatives at the same time. Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications MBA or other relevant advanced degree. Strong foundational knowledge of Sales Strategy in a fast growth Technology organization. Experience building GTM Strategy across multiple diverse markets Experience running programs, building strategy or partnering a B2B Sales team. Familiarity with cloud product and services, and sales cycles. Proven capability working with, presenting to and influencing senior executives. Relevant project management accreditation e.g. PMP. Ability to collaborate with a diverse set of business and technology stakeholders to identify improvement opportunities, manage risk and resolve conflict. description: Job Description  Danfoss is looking for an energy-efficiency minded Sales Manager to develop and manage our sales. This position is responsible for establishing and maintaining a profitable relationship with customers and channel partners on behalf of the company by taking full responsibility for Marine & Offshore customer accounts. As Sales Manager, you will be responsible for driving business growth in Singapore for the Marine & Offshore business under Danfoss Drives Segment. You will work with the local team supported by regional stakeholders to generate pipelines and deliver sales targets.  Job Responsibilities  Responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to, the following. Fully responsible for Singapore M&O sales targets and growth plan Independently develop the local M&O business strategy as the subject matter expert, and drive business growth through the successful implementation of that strategy Work with local and regional Danfoss stakeholders to develop targeted solutions to address customer needs Grow business with electrification projects with shipyards, system integrators and partners (distributors), leveraging the support of regional and global Danfoss networks Grow aftermarket business with shipowners and ship management companies for retrofits, service support and partner sales Grow partner business through development and implementation of business plans Mine new opportunities and develop win plans for pipelines Make adjustments to strategies to navigate surprise challenges and uncertainties Connect the dots with internal and external stakeholders in order to multiply efforts and develop win-win solutions Background & Skills  The ideal candidate possesses these skills. Minimum Diploma/Bachelor’s Degree in Business/Engineering or equivalent Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in a front end sales role, with good exposure to matrix management, cross-functional collaboration and distributor business Must be able to work efficiently as a sole contributor, as well as a team player Must be self-driven and have a hunter mindset with strong EQ and AQ Must be an master communicator Structured and process oriented Experience with CRM Highly motivated and finds building relationships rewarding Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow  At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways – driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.  Following our founder’s mindset ‘action speaks louder than words’, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.  Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.

jobTitle: Senior Partner Development Lead – Distributors, APAC
description: Description  Come and join Amazon Web Services (AWS) as we redefine the IT Industry. We are building a business that has the potential to be at least as big as the Amazon.com retail business and are seeking world class candidates to contribute to this effort. As a Distribution Partner Development Lead, you will help scale the delivery of industry leading, transformative partner programs that support the AWS distribution partner ecosystem in building and differentiating their high-value products, solutions and services that help accelerate AWS Distribution Partners in building a successful cloud practice.  This role will challenge both your creative and analytical skills. You will build relationships with business stakeholders within the global alliances team at AWS and AWS distribution partners, become a subject matter expert in the distribution channel segment, drive both new partners and new sales campaigns in support AWS Channel Partners. The Distribution Partner Development Manager will partner with current and future AWS distribution partners, Global alliance leaders, Partner Development Managers, Sales teams, and the Business Development organization to execute distribution program worldwide.  This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an incredibly fast growing business. The ideal candidate is experienced in building partner programs, and has a proven ability to learn new technologies fast. The Distribution Partner Development Manager can effectively influence both technical and non-technical audiences up to the senior executive level. A primary responsibility of this role will be to execute a strategy for acquiring and nurturing a large number of partners across multiple technology stacks. The ability to identify, prioritize and build relationships with the most strategic of these partners is essential. The right individual will need to focus on driving top line revenue growth and customer adoption through these partners. They will also work to ensure each partner chooses AWS as the preferred platform for their customers.  The ideal candidate will be eager to build and develop a team to influence decision makers at the executive level, as well as the proven ability to interact with many stakeholders. She/he should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and communicate clearly. Success criteria for this position will be heavily metrics driven, which will require contributing to the build out of a scalable process to manage a large volume of partners.  Roles & Responsibilities Support the execution of the technology services distribution programs in APJ Support the process for launching a new distribution channel partner in new geographic regions Develop structured processes around onboarding, enabling and supporting distribution partners for business and operations Work across regional sales and partner teams to build an ecosystem of strategic distribution partners that add significant value to AWS Channel Partners Serve as a key member of the AWS distribution team in helping to define and deliver the overall go-to-market strategy Own all reporting of distribution, participating in regular business reviews with leadership and stakeholders Utilize salesforce.com and other internal Amazon systems to track key performance metrics Willingness to travel 60% and travel globally  Basic Qualifications At least 10 years of partner/channel business development with distributors/value-added-resellers the technology industry 5+ years of Program Management cross functional supporting internal and external stakeholders 5+years of building teams and development of employees Preferred Qualifications Experience working within the enterprise software development industry Experience working with global technology distributors such as Carahsoft, Ingram Micro, Tech Data, DLT, etc Experience working with global teams is highly desired. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences. Solid technical acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/disruptive technologies like open source software, virtualization and Software as a Service delivery models Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. description: About Accenture  Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Corporate Functions – Marketing & Communications  As part of this team, you’ll play a key role in helping Accenture execute its strategy. You’ll work with a diverse team of innovative marketing experts who focus on the following areas: global brand management and advertising; global events and sponsorships; internal communications; marketing research; media and industry analyst relations; corporate and financial communications; internet marketing; recruitment marketing; client-centric marketing; and industry, service line and geographic marketing campaigns.  YOUR ROLE: Diamond Client Marketing Lead  Own and drive marketing and communications strategy and campaign development to help accelerate growth and to increase penetration for Accenture's business at one of Accenture's Diamond Client accounts. As part of the Strategic Accounts and Global Sales marketing team, this high-profile role is ideal for a strategic senior marketer with pursuit based marketing experience and integrated, multi-channel marketing skills. The Diamond Client Marketing Lead will be a member of the Client Account Leadership team and serve as the senior marketing & communications advisor and partner to the account. The individual will design, develop and lead execution of a hyper-personalized Account Based Marketing strategy. In addition, this role will be accountable for KPIs and bespoke marketing efforts specific to the account. Ultimately, the Diamond Client Marketing Lead will steward the client’s experience with Accenture.  Key Responsibilities:  Lead pursuit-based marketing within the account  Serve on the Client leadership team and partner with the Client Account Lead (CAL) on all marketing outreach programs  Develop a bespoke marketing and communications strategy and plan to support the growth of the account  Serve as the lead contact for and interface with all parts of Accenture as the front door for the client and have a deep understanding of the key buyers, their perception, and experience of the Accenture brand  Be accountable to deliver relevant marketing program elements (e.g., Brand positioning; Content development, Creative design, Social media marketing, events; Sales/BD focused marketing activations and the use of research and insights) across the global account  YOUR EXPERIENCE: Basic Qualifications  Bachelor's degree, or other 4-year university degree  Minimum of 10 years of marketing experience  Minimum of 5 years of experience in a client centric marketing role  Preferred Qualifications  Brand marketing  Account based marketing  Relevant Software & Platforms industry experience  Event strategy and development  Campaign planning  Pursuit-based marketing  Key message development  Professional Skills  Ability to work in a teaming environment with the business serving as the marketing expert and advisor  Planning and strategic skills  Executive presence is a must  Excellent written and oral communication skills- the ability to present and communicate ideas clearly and persuasively at all levels to influence both internal and external audiences  Demonstrated passion and aptitude for digital marketing  Demonstrated conflict management skills  Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian  Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian  OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU  Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement.  You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects.  Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments, and collaborating with experts across the company.  Access to leading-edge technology.  Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package including generous paid time off, an employee healthcare plan and a competitive 401K program. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits here.  You will also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

description: Company Overview  Our client is one of the leading asset management firm in Asia.  The firm offers distinct investment management services and investment advisory services for financial institutions, sovereign wealth funds, and pension funds across Japan and overseas.  Job Responsibilities Promote and sell firm’s funds and strategies to the clients which includes Japanese equity, J-REIT, Asian equity, Asian REIT, Fixed income etc. Proactively cultivate business prospects such as Accredit investors in Singapore, Institutional investors, and retail distributors in Thailand, Malaysia, Brunei, Indonesia, and Australia etc. Provide bespoke investment management services and advisory services to the clients. JOB REQUIREMENTS A team player who is self-driven and requires collaboration with products teams in Japan. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Comprehensive knowledge of financial concepts and investment products. Degree from reputable university. At least 6 years of experience in investment management firm, with proven track record of structuring, marketing, or managing complex investment products to institutional or high-net worth clients. Client coverage over Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia and Brunei will be strong advantage. jobTitle: Regional Trade Sales Manager – Singapore & Bangkok
description: Regional Trade Sales Manager – Singapore/Bangkok Location – Singapore  A job with Merlin isn’t like a job anywhere else. With attractions around the world, from rollercoasters to wax figures, we don’t trade in suits, handshakes or briefcases. We trade in fun. In smiles, shrieks, and spine-tingles. In memories. In magic. But there are no tricks behind our magic. Instead, there are people like you. Passionate, dedicated people who are committed to making sure our attraction and guests’ experiences are the best they can be.  We are looking for a Regional Trade Sales Manager to join our fast-paced, busy, and dynamic team and support business development of our Midway attractions within Asia, focusing on the below attractions: Madame Tussauds Singapore, Bangkok & Hong Kong Sealife Bangkok (Siam Paragon) Reporting to the Regional Director of Trade Sales (APAC) and a dotted line into the Head of Marketing (Rest of Asia) while working closely with local & regional marketing teams, this role is responsible for developing and driving international trade strategies and plans for the attractions primarily from Intra-Asia regions and key markets such as India, Indonesia, Malaysia and Philippines to deliver volume, revenue and yield budgets.  Main Responsibilities: Driving international recovery post Covid-19 Create a trade strategy anchored to global strategy and based on market, region or attraction knowledge, experience and required deliverables. Develop sales strategies for key accounts/OTAs delivering mutual sales and marketing benefits. Establish and execute a robust recovery trade plan to deliver Inbound Trade volume, revenue, and yield targets for Midway Asia attractions. Identify the most effective delivery for Inbound trade through existing partners as well as developing new partnerships. Work with local sales & marketing teams with a pull/push sales strategy to secure trade contracts, marketing exposure while leveraging partner spend. Review pricing impact of trade monthly and adjust to align to consumer pricing changes in respective markets. Work with regional team to review and approve contracts and commission terms for all partners. Support local sales & marketing teams to drive digitization of ticketing, to ensure all Partners are 100% voucher-less and booking journey is seamless.  We are looking for the following skills and experience… Minimum of 5 years sales & marketing experience in international leisure and travel trade in both B2B and B2Cs. Must have experience working in international markets, specifically with Inbound trade in Singapore and Bangkok. Be based in Singapore (relocation is not offered for this role) Previous experience at a management level, with significant project management skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional peers. Previous experience in budgeting and financial planning. Track record of exceeding commercial targets and objectives. Proven ability in B2B sales environment. Excellent interpersonal and influencing skills, with ability to build strong relationships at all levels, both internally and externally. Ability to manage and influence a large number of stakeholders. Proficient use of Excel to create and update reports and work with large data sets to draw insight from. Strong interpersonal skills and being able to adapt style to different environments. Passionate and driven individual, who can demonstrate their enthusiasm for sales acquisition. A proactive and creative approach to problem solving. Flexibility in adapting to fast-changing priorities and fast paced work environment. Strong organisation skills, with the ability to multi-task and hit the ground running within a hands-on role. You thrive on ownership and accountability – and have a proven track record of acting on your own initiative to deliver sales.  Education: Degree or equivalent qualification in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or other related fields preferred.  Business/Working Environment This role supports a number of regions; flexibility in working hours to meet relevant time zones is a key requirement. Time management is therefore an essential skill to ensure deliverables are met and working hours remain tenable. Generally operational days will be Monday to Friday with ad hoc requirements outside of this to meet business needs. There will be critically relevant travel requirements within this role, but these should be managed to a business essential only level to ensure costs are controlled effectively.  The Benefits… We’re growing fast and alongside a fun and friendly environment, we offer a fabulous package and amazing prospects – ideal if you’re already fantastic and can quickly become even better (our magic can help here). The local benefits include: Medical & Dental Insurance Sentosa Island Partner membership Merlin Magic Passes that grant free entry for you & your guests to any of our attractions around the world Development opportunities Flexible working arrangements And many more!  Here at Merlin Entertainments we are proud to have a diverse workforce, and we’re all about providing equal opportunities to the whole team. Because of this we are committed to an active All Together programme which starts with our recruitment and selection process.
